reviews.review: I didn't see one goth person walking around here!. You can safely walk and view the gothic quarter. It's in the S.E. section of old Barcelona (gothic=old - get it?) Practical tip: when you are walking around, keep yourself in reference to the old cathedral. In that way, it is less likely that you will get lost. Many of the avenues have names that can be difficult to ascertain or which change names after you cross an intersection. Any of the locals will be happy to assist you as they generally have good knowledge of the street names.

Managable walk that is close to the Ramblas, too.. A nice walk into the past. Book ahead if you wish to visit Picasso Museum. The cathedral is free in the morning and is certainly worth a visit. Narrow winding streets in the Old Jewish Quarter house many interesting stores. Don't miss the small synagogue, which was just recently excavated.
Best food is hiding here . Best little area to eat, drink or just walk around. We were in Barcelona for a week and kept going back to El Barrio gótico.

a great place to wander. The Gothic Quarter has some nice sights and is a pleasant and atmospheric place to stroll around and enjoy a coffee or meal. The Cathedral is worth a visit and is free upto 1pm. Visit the Temple of Augustus pillars which are in the most unusual setting but worth a brief trip.
Excellent but need a giude. Great place to stay and walk about but area comes to life with a guide to explain about what is significant, what to look for. Guide makes experience 10 times richer
A fun walk, eating and shopping experience. Go to El pinxto. Food and servers are amazing! Very worth the cost for DELICIOUS tapas and drinks. It's a bit hidden but keep looking till you find it!

wonderful atmospheric area. Loved this part of barcelona, with it's quaint winding streets, interesting bars and restaurants and the inevitable tourist shops. Picasso Museum is here (book first, queues are long)

Amazing!. Love love LOVE this place! Beautiful architecture and interesting to explore. I wish I lived here! Steer clear of commercial areas though and look for small tapas bars off the beaten track run by SPANIARDS!

Not for claustrophobics. If you don't like narrow and crowded alleys lined with tiny shops of all kinds that are packed with tourists shoulder to shoulder, don't bother. But for everyone else who likes the idea of getting lost in a maze of little streets, this is your mecca. We loved it so you know which group we belong to.
Such character. Great area (old town) narrow quaint streets, lovely cathedral. Great for a wander, loads of tiny shops and eateries.
Nice walk full of attractions. You can visit the Cathedral, have some tapas and shop souvenirs. It's nice to spend a time just walking around.

A nice place to stroll around. Not unlike the Latin quarter in Paris, or the oldest part of Rome, or any number of similar places, this neighborhood is chock full of tricky-tacky souvenir shops and mediocre food, but that said, it's architecture is authentic and it is worth a stroll around.
Wonderful. Get lost in the lane's. Don't use a map just wonder. Full of lovely shops and café bars. Ice cream cafes are aplenty.
Creat place to stroll . Fantastic architecture and good shopping. Head over shop - lots of place to eat and have a drink - head over to the basilica of Santa Maria deal mar.

magnificant. This quarter is a must see place in Barcelona . You walk in history bind the walls and high building with unique architecture . in narrow streets you will find many cosy shops and coffee shops . Don;t forget to drink a cup of tea or coffee with a piece of delicious sweet .
My favourite area of Barcelona . This district is great to wander the lanes, lots of independent shops, great bars and Restaurant's. Highly recommend *****
Great shops. Great shops and nice people watching. Love the architecture and variety of stores. Would definitely recommend spending a full day here.

Like stepping back in time. Great shopping, interesting museums and great food. This is a Barcelona must do. I enjoy just strolling around the winding streets. You must visit some of the museums here.

Great on a hot day. The narrow alleys surrounded by tall buildings make this sun shade heaven on a hot day. Plenty of walking tours to join or just get a guide book and wander around yourself. There's two or three hours here easily

Great cultural spot. The Gothic Quarter although mainly built in the 19th century, also consists of some medieval buildings, and even has an old Roman Wall. The architecture is beautiful, the small streets are really picturesque, in fact, the whole area is! It is a great place to explore on foot, with the majority of streets closed to traffic. There are some quirky shops and places to eat surrounding the Gothic quarter.

absolutely gorgeous . fantastic building design both interior an exterior... Very popular with tourists an very big crowd around. It seems to have alot of staff an your quite restricted with areas which u can an cant go into or near... but very few signs in English.
Special atmoshpere. I been to similar cities, but it was so special here never seen before. Small tiny streets with very nice buildings and busy nightlife,

Beautiful to see at day light, not so beutiful at night. The Gothic Quarter is full of life (and people) because is near Ramblas, so you must be patient if you don't like very crowdy places. There are a lot of monuments to be seen, including La Catedral (Catedral Basilica de Barcelona), wich is a must see. Also, if you get there, you must see Basilica de Santa Maria del Pi in the Placa del Pi. You can stay in Barri Gotic for hours and not be borred. Everywhere are stores with souvenirs (most of them related to FC Barcelona football team) and cofe shops or little restaurants (but the prices are big). If you go in Gothic Quarter you must go in Placa del Reial and eat at one of the restaurants here (is expensive but is good and the view is extraordinary).The night is not the same thing. The street are empty and looks like from a zombi movie. If you cross the Barri Gotic at night you will see drunk and junky people, not a very nice view. For this I not recomand that you stay at a hotel in Barri Gotic, or if you realy want to stay here, chose one just near Ramblas.

Love the Gothic Quarter. We visited the Gothic Quarter while visiting Barcelona and we loved it. The architecture and surrounding landscape is just awesome. There is an abundance of food and shopping options, along with lots of activities going on down in this district. We highly recommend taking in the Gothic Quarter if you are in Barcelona.

Great place to walk and explore. We spent an afternoon walking around (without a map) and this was wonderful. So much history and architecture to see. Lots of lovely shops and places to eat all along the streets and main areas. Numerous street artists around the edges of the area also made great entertainment. Good to combine with Las Ramblas. Just be aware of going on a Sunday not all shops/ places to eat are open.

This requires repeat visits. The Gothic quarter is a wonder of architecture, churches, govt buildings, shops, wonderous shops and flats. There are so many squares, restaurants and alleyways with amazing things in them that any review is going to sell it short. Just put it at the top of your list! The ice cream is to die for!

Surrounded with shops and nice cafes . Nothing to say about the general church, but I really enjoyed the surrounding. It was very beautiful with narrows streets, great architecture, lots of cute shops, coffee shops, ice cream places and cafes.

Love wandering Barri Gotic!. We love wandering the old streets of Barri Gotic. Seems like there is a surprise around every quarter! There are so many shops and so many "Kodak moments" to enjoy. Will be spending a lot of time here!

A great walk. Our hotel was in the middle of this area very old worldly. The Catedral De La Seu was opposite our hotel it looked very plain from the out side but it was very ornate in side. A great place to just wander and soak up the atmosphere. Plenty of interesting places to eat.
So many quirky shops and restaurants and full of life. Combine with a visit to the Picasso museum or Parc de ciutedella. So much to see and full of quirky entertainers

Magic . We could have walked around in the old streets in Gothic Quarter for days!
Small nice shops, and the smell of food.
This is what Barcelona city life is all about!
Gorgeous. Absolutely loved this area of Barcelona - the cathedral, the streets, the architecture in general, it's all worth seeing.
Wonderful. Our favourite area by far. It;s interesting and pretty in equal measure. Just too many great things about this area to list. Just visit.
Historic area. Take time out of a day to ramble thro' the alleyways and street café paths to savour and people watch. A wonderful way to spend time in Barcelona.
Inspirational architecture. I could have explored the quarter all week, there is so much to see and to be inspired by. I recommend a good wander around.
Nice walk true town. Relaxing and fun walk back in time. A lot of authentic little streets. Allthoug it was difficult to tell where you were going.

Charming streets, lots of hidden gems . Prime tourist location, can be explored through the Barcelona free walking tour that starts in Placa Catalunya (11am and 2pm), although you will most likely want to come back for the bars, sweet shops and art galleries. Remember that a lot of the smaller places close after lunch and re-open in the late afternoon. The streets are full of charm and history - be in the look out for hidden murals and drawings. Worth walking away from La Rambla and venturing here for food and drinks as the prices will be more affordable, and the quality and service will be better. We found the best turon, churros, ice cream and tapas here during our visit, and most of the places we just stumbled upon. There is also a lot of history to be explored here, with notable buildings, squares and churches - a walking tour would be best to explore these, if not make sure to check out a guide ahead of your visit so you don't miss out. Absolute must see whether you're in Barcelona for a long trip or just a weekend getaway.

Twists and turns of hidden beauty, keep looking up!. From the outset you immediately see the attraction of wandering through this section of Barcelona. The tiny streets littered with independent shops, cafes, bars and stunning pieces of architecture.Keep your eye on the upper levels of this area and you will see stunning balconies, connecting walkways and breath-taking architecture. The streets can get congested, but around the very next corner you are likely to come across an open plaza that you are surprised could even exist here.It can be a nice cooling walk when the main streets are too hot and there are plenty of cafes to stop and relax over a coffee or a beer.

beautiful. I saw a wonderful international chorale competition here. This is a very large cathedral, central to many places that you will visit in Barcelona. Sit on one of the many stairs that lead up to this cathedral and have your photo taken by someone. Go inside and pray. Do anything but do spend some time here admiring its ancient atmostphere.

Glorious experience in the Gothic quarter of Barcelona . This section of Barcelona was incredible! The ancient Roman ruins and medieval churches and small roads of the section of Barcelona is absolutely amazing and worth seeing. Spend some time in this quarter just walking around and experiencing this area.

A Visual delight. This part of the old city of Barcelona is my favorite.Very interesting architecture and meandering pedestrian friendly streets. Many interesting small shops and restaurants. Do not miss El Call( the old Jewish part of the city)
Historic adventure. Wander the historic streets to the unknown....shops and oddities await around every corner. Snack, shop, visit museums; a wonderful way to spend an afternoon.

Wander all day. Take your time to wander through the streets stopping for drinks or tapas and admire the old building and some very narrow streets. Do look up because some of these buildings are really worth the time.

Walking tour with Bean Runner Tours. If you want an excellent tour of the gothic quarter of Barcelona, consider Bean Runner free walking tours. Our guide Ruth was knowledgeable, funny and extremely personable. The tour works on tips based on what you think of the tour. You will NOT be disappointed! This is the best time I've had in Barcelona and I've been here 3 times.

Wonderful voyage of discovery down narrow streets.. Wonderful narrow streets with strange quirky shops and restaurants. Every time you come to another street there are more traditional buildings and artist shops. We found a wonderful restaurant called Buddha where the food was fantastic and really reasonable.

The beauty is everywhere. There is something extremely charming about the Gothic quarter. Great shopping for local products and local restaurants. Look up to see the remains of the Roman buildings. Just beautiful.

Great place to walk and soak in the culture. We rented an apartment in the Gothic Quarter, it was fabulous, walking distance to almost everything. The Quarter is rich in history and activity. We were there during the Merce Festival so all the big action was all around us, parades, light shows, musicians, traditional dance demonstrations.Most of the streets are for pedestrians so no major traffic noise, in fact when we did reach a major road on our walks we tried to take the side streets to avoid the noise. Metro is handy to visit the further afield attractions in Eixample. Loved going for our morning coffee to the little coffee shops with terrasses near the Cathedral, sitting outside and people watching with the beautiful backdrop.
Heart of Barcelona. Place where you can feel exceptional charm of Barcelona. beautiful and special with charming architecture and lovely streets.
Wonderful walking area. What a great place to wander around and explore. From the little tapas places to the shops, churches, etc. You can spend a couple days just in this area of Barcelona.

Gothic Quarter. We arrived for our free walking tour with Jana from CityTellers at 10:30am. What a terrific tour of this area. Two hours disappeared very quickly and our guide was very enthusiastic and informative. I recommend this tour company.

Beautiful buildings and narrow streets full of interest. We were lucky enough to have been staying in the Gothic Quarter so had the pleasure of walking its street more than most.There is plenty to see at eye level but make sure you look up so you don't miss out on the gargoyles and artwork that adorn some of the buildings.Plenty of restaurants to choose from, if you spot The Benedict don't walk by.

Narrow, winding streets to get lost or wander in- great restaurants!. We spent hours here wandering the streets, checking out the restaurants, bars, and shops scattered throughout the quarter. We had our first lunch in Barcelona at the Placa del Pi. There is also the main shopping pedestrian zone, about a block in from La Rambla, a large street that goes from Placa Catalunya all the way to the statue of Christopher Columbus on the harbor front.

A welcome break from cars.. A nice place with narrow streets to just wander and check out the little shops and restaurants. Little traffic inside, which is greatly appriciated in a car-filled Barcelona.

Small streets and traditional buildings. Small streets and traditional buildings dominate the gothic quarter. This part of Barcelona houses small creative and local shops where you can find hand crafted arts and clothes. The restaurants here often offer local food, you can find small places with a great atmosphere.

A must do. Get yourself off the tourist trap of La Rambla and do this area. Ensure you get to the Jewish area, the cloisters at the Cathedral (see the geese) and look at the quality shops. Just follow your nose (and eyes) - a good map is helpful - we did it ourselves. While I am sure the walking tours are Ok, save the money and DIY.
Must see! . We loved this area...lots of super cool architecture, shops, and the narrow winding streets of Europe!

Magic Around Every Corner. A friend and I stayed in a hotel in the Gothic Quarter and loved exploring different sections every day. Around most corners, there are lovely little restaurants with patios, interesting shops and quiet...in parts of Barcelona, quiet can be hard to find but wandering the streets of the Gothic Quarter, you can easily find solace.

Great walk around area. We took a Barcelona highlights tour this morning which finished off in the gothic quarter. Loved it. Very interesting history tied to Barcelona beginnings. Our guide gave us an informative presentation on the high points of the history of this area. We had planned to continue visiting this area but sadly a monsoon rain started and we had to take refuge in our hotel room to dry off our squelching shoes and clothing. Would love to go back

Beauty of Gothic buildings plus lovely Port. Enjoyed walking around this fascinating area of Barcelona narrow streets leading to lovely squares with churches museums historic buildings lovely shops/cafes thought these buildings had more character than Gaudis creations !! Walking around the Port area and by the beach area was idyllic and a pleasure ! Overall we thought Barca was kept immaculate cleaners everywhere no litter no rubbish bags plenty of police presence very assuring a credit to the people of Catalunya

Do your home work, then take a walk!. I read up on the original village of Barcino, and checked out all the places that still exist from this era and we spent a couple of hours wandering about the Barri Gotic. We saw the remains of the old cemetery, the place where the aqueducts entered the old Barcino, the cathedral, the steps leading to where Columbus asked the Queen for money for his explorations, and many more historical gems. Along the way we enjoyed the efforts of many different street performers. Take your time and go for a stroll, but do your homework first so you know what you are looking at!
Great walking area. We enjoyed this area so much, we went twice! Watch for the hordes of walking tour groups. Great place to get lost with all the side streets.
Gothic quater. Great architecture, fascinating to look around and full of history, really enjoyed are afternoon here

Wonderful to Wander. It was so much fun just wandering around the little streets here, checking out all of the restaurants and shops, and photographing the street art. We loved it and wished that we'd spent more time here.

Ancient and interesting. The streets within this area are so interesting and need to be seen to be believed.
The eating places are a little pricey but quaint and worth the extra money.
Definately recommend

Great area of the city!. Be sure to wander the narrow streets in the Gothic Quarter. Check out the true Catalonia art painting technique used on buildings. A very beautiful area of the city!!! Also check out La Riberia!!!! Well worth the few extra blocks!
Touring Barcelona. A truly great place to visit you won't be disappointed with what you see yes of history in this wonderful place How I lived out here
Must see. there are nice gothic churches, fountains, restaurants, markets and musicians. not just any but professional musicians. it was a very nice visit.

Walkin. My wife and I like to hike, and it sure came in handy this day. We spent a day walking down the Ramblas to the waterfront, and then dove into the Gothic Quarter and wandered our way back up to Catalunya, visiting dozens of attractions and shops along the way. The architecture, the light, the narrow meandering streets make it a wonderland. There are cafes galore, which is good because it is easy to underestimate the Mediterranean sun and the vertical gain.
unreal. brilliant !!!! the art work, the buildings, you could just get lost in beauty in this fab part of barca

Great place to explore. Lots of sights to see that showcase Barcelona's history. Roman ruins, the Cathedral of Barcelona, alleys and plazas are all fun to explore. Lots of small stores and places to eat as well. Great contrast to the busy Las Ramblas.

Nice architecture. Cute streets. Loads of shops. . Heaven for my wife. Lots of shoe and handbag and scarf shops. Luckily the architecture kept the boys and I amused whilst she shopped. The shops are very nicely appointed and decorated. Good visual merchandising.

Gothic Quarter. Patrick was an excellent Guide on our Tour through the gothic Quartier. Jetzt had loads of Stories about the history of the Quartier.
Highlight recommended

Old part of Barcelona with cathedral nearby. Do a walk in this area close to La Rambla street and notice the architecture of the buildings.
If you're interested to visit the cathedral, be aware that there is an entry fee which is in my opinion not justified. Only good point, is the fat that it may help to maintain the cathedral.

Great area to wander around and get lost. Narrow streets, lovely squares, churches, interesting houses, plenty of restaurants, cafes, bars and shops - this is a great area to wander around on foot and to get lost. Discover the old part of Barcelona at your own pace.
What a quaint and beautiful place . Absolutely stunning so.much to see - be prepared to walk and walk - beautiful architecture -tons of restaurants beautiful catedral.
If Getting Lost Is your thing..... Wonderful part of Barcelona where getting lost is part of the fun. So much history and great tapas places in abundance. Walk, walk, walk. So much fun.
Wraps the History into one location. A great area of Barcelona with plenty of action, history and sights. Take your time to visit this area. I am sure you will enjoy it.

Great week!. We spent a week in Barcelona and spent time in every part of the city. We had a flat in the gothic quarter and it was perfect location. Great shops, tapas and little bars. Very easy to get around. One thing that should be considered is some of the streets were loud late at night so be sure to request an inside room.

Possibly our favourite part of Barcelona!. The Gothic Quarter takes you through narrow lanes with little shops and restaurants along the way. Stop at La Cassola, a sweet family run little restaurant for the most delicious freshly made paella and sangria. Buy your espadrilles from Toni Pons, the original makers of this authentic Spanish shoe. Visit the beautiful Cathedral with its peaceful central courtyard with geese. Walk down the famous La Rambla and make sure to stop at La Boqueria Market for a mind blowing choice of food and drink!

Spend a day here. The Gothic Quarter is one of my favorite areas in Barcelona. There is so much to see here. Spend a day getting lost in the narrow pedestrian-only streets with shops, restaurants, cafe's and beautiful architecture. It is amazing.

Brilliant area to wander. The gothic Quarter was probably the best area to visit, so many little alleys, churches, cafes, shops to be found. It is compact and contained so you do not have to walk for miles in one direction, Ramblas is near by.
Walking and fun Shops. Loved spending time in this area. So many streets, fun place to stumble across great shops and bars.

Lots to explore. A great area of shopping, dining & touring! We randomly picked places to eat and we're never disappointed. Some of our dining finds: Pa Tapas, Living Barcelona 1925, Restaurant Park Guell, Tapes Santos.

Must see. Visit this area when you are in Barcelona. It has beautiful allees, shops, restaurant and lot of culture. Look at TripAdvisor for some nice places in this area what you like because everybody has a different taste.

nice. never seen a black lord. building so nice. loved the old world about the place and small streets around. very nice square. could spend a few hour looking around and taking in all the building lovely old world.

Beautiful. The barri gotic is beautiful and very charming for walking around. In the afternoon when there is the mess you do not have to pay any entrance fee. The cathedral is amazing and the mess was really beautiful, with great singers!

Nice placas to sit and people watch. Lots of winding lanes full of bars, restaurants and shops. We went as two couples and liked the relaxed atmosphere and friendly people. It felt much safer than Las Ramblas, where you are constantly aware of pickpockets. The square by the Cathedral often has entertainment and we were lucky enough to catch a troupe of local Castellers or people towers, where tiny tots climb to the top of human towers eight storeys high!

Interesting. We visited the Gothic Quarter as part of the Free Walking Tour offered by Runner Bean Tours.Another mus visit location when in Barcelona. Steeped i history and beautiful architecture. It is a maze of small alleyways and one may get lost in there. Amazing to find ancient Roman columns inside residential buildings in the Gothic Quarters.One must see it for yourself.Wonderful city, Barcelona. A great mix of old and new.
must do. We done this via the free Barcelona walking tour.2 hours of walking around the gothic quarter , this place is full of history ,you should do this via a tour to find all the spots to see

Its nice and buildings represent the cities past.. There are lots of small places in the Gothic Quarter including the cathedral. With lots of side roads, places to east, things to look at, you can certainly spend a day just walking around. Be careful of people trying to sale you things, I do think it is discouraged and it detracts the area (I personally think). Still the buildings and walkways could be used as a set for Games of Throne. It is beautiful and it is just nice to just walk around the area, looking at small shops and all the other things. There is a lot of history and worth a visit.

Ruins, Romans and Cats. We took this walking tour during the first part of a two-hour combo of the Quarter and the Picasso Museum. It started from the Catalunya Plaza and covered at least a mile and a half through the newer old town, the Roman walls, some Picasso murals and quiet courtyards. We walked by and later went back to eat at the Four Cats, a favorite Picasso (wife does like this guy) haunt. Near the end we passed the harbor and learned about the shipping history of this truly fun and unique city.
My Favorite Area. We stayed in an apartment in the Gotic Quarter. Love the narrow alleyways and collection of interesting shops and old architecture. Stays active until late night/early morning.

Great area to roam I !. What a wonderful must see area to wander in when visiting Barcelona. The old narrow meandering streets hold many exciting stores to discover. We saw roman ruins, the old Jewish section, amazing churches and the wonderful picturesque Barcelona cathedral. A must see in this beautiful city. Try a walking tour. We did and found out so much of the amazing historic information of this area. I'd really made a difference if our appreciation of this historic area .
Fantastic. A must see if you like this sort of thing I loved it the buildings are amazing give yourself time to look around it's well worth it

No trip to BCN would be complete without it, but it's very busy. You must visit the Barri Gothic - it is the old heart of the city and truly beautiful. There are still lots of local places to discover on the windy streets, just be prepared to share the stroll with many other visitors.

a must to visit. very nice boutiques, nice hidden terraces and small bars with nice tapas and good winefound a small butcher where we could eat his fabulous hams with a good glass, just have to look in the small streets
Romantic place. Very romantic place, with old streets and history between them. A lot of muzicians who makes you feel in a fairytale.

Average cathedral. It OK I'd suggest coming here before Sagrada familiar, as it is overlooked. There a door man who won't let you go into the cathedral if you're wearing shorts and vest tops so please be prepared to cover up.

Fabulous area!. We had not stayed right in the Gothic Quarter before, but ended up in that area every day, after walking down Las Ramblas from our hotel. This trip we stayed at Hotel Colon, and our balcony was right on the square, and we looked directly at the cathedral. It was lovely. We could watch the action in the square, enjoy the numerous musicians who would play on the cathedral steps, and really enjoy staying in the area.

Gothic area . The Gothic area can not be missed. Great shops restaurants and galleries.We ate in a wine cellar and the food was superb.My favorite place in Barcelona.You feel like you are in Paris.Love Barcelona

A WALK BACK IN TIME. If you enjoy the architecture and the history, this is a place that you shouldn't miss, wear a comfortable shoes and dress on layers (October is very rainy and windy) walk between narrow streets and enjoy the old constructions, the cathedral and the surrounds worth it to see, you will find the roman wall ruins, the gargoyles on the old buildings, the baroque bridge and small chapel Saint Cristobal. If you visit the Cathedral, with your paid entrance can access the roof just take the small elevator and you will have a great view of Barcelona and surroundings.
It's history all around you. There is so much here to see, hear, taste and enjoy. It's a very lively area that vibrates with life and history.
amazing Gothic Quarter. this amazing Gothic Quarter, has plaza Sant Jaume, the cathedral, the Generalitat palace, and so many amazing pedestrian streets full of medieval and Gothic architecture...
Love this arra. We spent a couple of days exploring this area- there's so much to see. Rich with history. Definitely recommend spending time in the Gothic district.

interesting area. wandering around here in this old area is fascinating. The high buildings are amazing, and create an echoey sound of the singers busking in the streets. The Cathedral is quite impressive, but didn't go in, as it was 7 euros each

Take A Stroll . Barcelona's Gothic Quarter is full of food, art, and entertainment in various forms. There's a wax museum, local artists and "street performers. Don't be afraid to explore the many "alley like" streets, because that's where you'll find some of the best finds.
Runner bean free tour - gothic tour . The entire 2.5 hours were immersed in the Rich Catalonia history. Interesting architecture and rich history. Worth taking the tour l.
we stayed in the Gothic Quarter. I would strongly recommend staying inside the Gothic area when visiting Barcelona. Easy walking distance to the good features of Barcelona.

Great place to lose yourself in Barcelona. Go, get lost, and stop in every shop and restaurant off the beaten path. Great way to spend an afternoon. Tiny winding streets and no cars. Favorite area in Barcelona.

Do a walking tour to really appreciate this area of the city.. Barcelona Guide Bureau gave us a great introduction to the city and this quarter, as part of their Picasso tour. The narrow streets are colorful and fun to see!

Interesting place to wander and take in the sights.. Get a sightseeing book and take in the sights. It is also close to La Ribera (el born) and the Rambla. Have dinner in the gothic area on Argentina (sp) Street. Better food.
Get lost in it to appreciate its beauty. The Gothic Quarter is one of the most beautiful places to visit in Barcelona. I recommend to get lost to appreciate its beauty

Best part of Barcelona. We walked for hours in the narrow, shadowy streets. Always something new to discover. And there are lots of nice small plazas to sit down and relax. A minus: Too many tourists like us.
Gothic. We had a great time meandering through the old streets bumping into shops and tapas bars, old squares and churches.

Always Barcelona . My partner and I always put the Gothic Quarter of Barcelona a the top of our 'must visit again' list that we write each year after a couple of trips to Europe from Australia.We love the area, its splendid buildings, quaint streets and its shops and cafes.Steeped in history, the area has something for everyone, from photo opportunities to food, drinks and gifts.It has a wide range of accommodation from expensive to cheap, for the executive to the backpacker.Among the best locations I visit
Nice walk. Barcelona is a great walking city and the Gothic quarter is part of that. It's large enough that the many tourists don't make it seem artificial which is what happens in smaller places.

3 day get away best location to stay!. Stayed downtown and brought walking shoes. Between transit and caffeine I was able to walked 15-20 miles a day and see everything in 2 days. This is my favorite place to stay and be in barcelona. It's beautiful and it's the most condensed area with the most to see!
Most vibrant and happening place. Next to LaRambla street. Place is most happening with nice crowd. Heaven to shoppers. Alot of branded and unbranded offers..
Lots of narrow streets and tapa bars. This is a place to just wander around. It is a lovely old part of the city. There are many shops, bars and restaurants.
Love it. Walk and get lost and take lots of pictures. The buildings are so beautiful. You really feel like you're in a different era!
Beautiful buildings. We spent a lovely afternoon walking around the streets of the Gothic Quarter. Energetic atmosphere with lots of shops, restaurants, and people.

Go get lost ! !. Go get lost in the Gothic Quarter and enjoy every minute of it. A great magical place with things to see everywhere. Many beautiful squares with wonderful restaurants. Take as much or as little time as you would like.
Walk around . Beautiful place full of many shops and food venues alongside historic churches. Great to walk around and enjoy.

Wandering without a map was ok!. Read some notorious reviews about the Quarter but my fears were unfounded - lost myself in the maze of alleys for a whole afternoon and this proved to be a rewarding triapse!

Interesting!. It is pleasant to stroll through the streets and listen to the musicians!
When you visit the cathedral (7 euros) to spend a bit (10-15 minutes) and wait in line for the elevator and be sure to go up to the roof - a magnificent view!
Nice!. We stayed in this area and had an amazing time. We spent hours just wondering around the Gothic Quarter. Loved it

Don't miss it!. Best quarter of Barcelona. Just walk around there and get lost in the streets of this quarter. It's super beautiful & authentic, you enjoy the Barca atmosphere, the nice shops & restaurants, beautiful architecture, etc. The place to be :-)

Best walking ever!!. The streets at this quarter, and the buildings surrounding it are so beautiful and extraordinary- u will walk like u are in a kind of a dream...
Don't think too much where and when-just grab a small map (in case u get lost) and a bottle of water- and walk along the streets!
Best part of Barca!. I love the streets, the shops, the people, the atmosphere, the restaurants, the museums, the squares... Just the best place to be in Barcelona :o)))
Get lost in the Street of Gothic Quarter . A must do on my list in Barcelona. Shopping, food, it's all so much fun when you do it in the Gothic Quarter.
Wow. It is like to stay in an old town but at the present time. People from all the world is living here. Amazing

Just Wander. 4 of us just walked around aimlessly stopping to shop, get a drink and look at the sights. Didnt follow an agenda. Probably missed out on some sights but didnt care. Trying to follow a specific path can be tricky even w/ a map or gps on phone. Enjoyed what we saw. Had an amazing lunch at El Quatro Gato and very good dinner at Los Caracoles

Tour of the Gothic Quarter. We stayed at the Hotel Colon in the heart of the Gothic Quarter. It was a central location for touring the area. So many interesting places to visit including churches, quaint shops, the Central Market & restaurants.

Stay off Las Rambles and just wander the Gothic Quarter. I don't know why people flock to Las Rambles, it's pretty awful and jammed with tourists and people selling junk to tourists. Take your compass and and map and get lost and have a much better time! And go see the Plau of Catalan Music!

Favourite area in Barcelona.. Loved this area, lots to see and do, meandering along the lanes and passageways. Enjoyed a jug of Sangria from Lantiquari in Placa del Rei, listening to Spanish guitar and watching the world go by. Also watched local people performing traditional Catalonian dancing in the square in front of the Cathedral.
This is the heart of barcelona. Wonderful quaint area pedestrian only except for Las Ramblas. Quiet little vials and bustling brad streets and people everywgere
Interesting. Walking through the Gothic Quarter we found many interesting things. Easy to get lost if you have not a map with you. Lovely

Didn't have enough time here, gotta go back. I was here with my friend in April and it was a rainy and chilly day, so we didn't spend so much time outdoors. The place is very fascinating with its gothic buildings, narrow alleys and small boutiques. There were many tourists and school groups at that time, so it was a bit crowded.
Best of Barcelona. The best place to wander around beautiful streets, loads to see, eat, shop and just be. Could spend days here just enjoying the sights, sounds and atmosphere

Gotico. I've lived here for a good month in 2015 while working in BCN. It's nice and loud and with lots of little shops, restaurants and galleries. In every corner here but also in the neighboring barrios there are so many little restaurants and things to see you never really have enough time.
A great place to wander. Book a free tour of the gothic area to get a sense of the place , come back later and wander through my

Quaint neighborhood with remnants of old times. Walking true the gothic neighborhoods is mesmerizing. You can get lost in there for hours on end. Just feeling the history through the paves. Find a cafe and watch life go by with a cortado. And you will find entertainment for hours. Including myself running around.

A wonderful experience!. I am really glad I did this. Our walking guide that we met at the Travel Bar brought the old to life. While it's hard to miss with your eyes if you enter this area on your own, Max, our guide helped us see it through different eyes with the historic knowledge that goes with the architecture. Max has a passion that is evident through the learning of others. There is so much detail to see that Max pointed out and gave the reason why detail was repeated throughout the walk.

The Heart of Barcelona, must see. We enjoyed a fun day walking through the laneways of the Gothic Quarter away from the key tourist areas. A great way to explore, feel and taste Barcelona at its best. So much to see and you can choose any one of many restaurants and bars.
Nice place to stroll but very crowded. Small Quarter, nothing spectacular but pleasant. Good places to eat, nice little shops. Very crowded in season so be patient.

Wonderful, Quirky Area of Barcelona. I have rented an apartment right by the eastern edge of the Barrio Gotic for a total of 6 months over the past 4 years, and hardly a day has gone by that I don't discover something new and interesting. Yes, the narrow, winding streets almost guarantee you will get lost a few times. But don't let that keep you from exploring the whole quarter. Don't just visit the Barcelona Catedral, check out the shops on the Portal de l'Angel and La Rambla, and think you've seen everything there is worth seeing. There are hundreds of small, interesting shops on the side streets in the area north of the Catedral, and there is a whole vibrant neighborhood, filled with outdoor cafes, bakeries and even more shops in the area south of Carre Ferran and the fabulous Placa Reial, including at least 3 other placas brimming with outdoor eating options. Plus, where else are you going to find a Marijuana and Hemp Museum, along with seed stores enabling partakers to grow their own...hemp
Beautiful. Lots of shops. I am not a shopper so after looking at all of the beautiful,architecture I had enough and time to leav the crazy tourist area and head back to our neighbor hood in Gracias.

Full of character and plenty of atmosphere. We stayed in the gothic quarter when we visited and whenever I go back in future it will always be the place I will stay. It is so central to everything. You have Barcelona Cathedral which is a beautiful 12th Century building, just remember to dress moderately if you want to visit inside (i.e no bare arms or short skirts/shorts)There's the bustling atmosphere of La Rambla and plenty of little windy streets full of tapas restaurants//bars and shops

Exotic. For me gótico barri is the best!There are so many histories behind some doors that I suggest take a free walking tour, that happens every day, to know a little bit more about this village.You will see Picasso art, August templo (very exotic) , statues enigmatic and a lot of histories that only walking around , cannot observeWonderful

Atmospheric streets and surprises. It is a mesh of small streets which feel safe to stroll down and have many small bars and shops which are very unique. Occasionally you come across a larger Square where there will be a street market and typically many little restaurants spilling onto the square. There are churches and museums to explore too.
A Place with a Interesting Past. Walked around this place as part of a tour of the old city, it's a place with a interesting if sometimes turbulent past, time well worth spent.
Great Gothic architecture. Thoroughly enjoyed visiting this place it was amazing. I highly recommend anybody visiting Barcelona to go see

A great tapas at the mad cat-in catalan.. Drinks followed by tapas followed by drinks followed by tapas, cooked to perfection and to die for. Very cosy and atmospheric. A magical night with friends and the lady owner-chef.
A must-see. One of the emblematic areas of Barcelona. Beautiful architecture and amazing atmosphere, although it can get a bit too touristic.

Sooo Much to enjoy!!!!!. We spent the weekend prior to cruising and had an amazing time. Whether walking on the main streets or walking through the gothic alleyways, there was so much to see. The gothic quarter brings you back to that time period!

You will think you are traveling back through time. We were walking down a street and turned into this district. It made me stop and freeze. Im looking at a building from 400AD.. Some of the streets are so narrow unlike anything I have ever seen. Remember when walking through this area, and all of Barcelona, always look up..

Strolling time . Walked all over here and interesting. Streets are very narrow. Oldest city area where it began first. Lot to visit the museums, stores, restaurants, play, churches, etc. you should not miss this area. Worthwhile.

Fascinating. The Barri Gotic is the older quarter of Barcelona. The streets are narrow and cobble-stoned. This area reminded me of something you would encounter in a fairy tale. It is very easy to get lost here, but you can't stay lost for long. If you head in any direction long enough, you will come to a major city artery. I like this neighborhood better than the Rambla. You will find many unique little stores, restaurants and bars. Because the buildings are close together, the area tended to be cooler than other sectors of the city. Though the area is a bit on the dark side and kind of gritty, we felt totally safe walking around, even at night.

Interesting architecture. During my visit in Barcelona I had the change to live exactly in the Gothic neighbourghood very close to La Rambla. It might be a bit noisy during the evening if you plan on getting accommodation here but other than that it's totally worth it. You have a wide selection of bars and restaurants and a lot of places to visit around.

Lost in the alleys. We stayed in a hotel located in the Gothic Quarter and we had a great time exploring all the alleys appreciating the twists and turns, designs of the buildings and generally the atmosphere of the quarter.

Get lost in the Gothic Quarter. The best way to discover Bari Gotic is by getting lost in it's winding cobblestone streets. Has many restaurants, bars and one of a kind shops. You can see old Roman walls, or peek into the seat of the Spanish Inquisition in Barcelona, or enter amazing palaces...so much to see and do. Wear good sturdy shoes.
Holiday. Interesting buildings. Markets restaurants and great for people watching in La Rampla We went several times

Stayed in the gothic quarter for a week. My girlfriend and I rented an airbnb in the Gothic Quarter for a week. It is an amazing part of town. A good rule of thumb is not to eat or shop within 2 blocks of La Rumbla.

3 Days in Barcelona. Day one Hop on Hop off tour of the City. Day two Hop off at the location your interested in seeing in greater detail. Soak up the history of one of the worlds great cities. We love to walk the city so 20,000 to 25,000 steps is a good day.

gothic quarter - good shopping and restaurants. this is a great area for eating ,shopping and pictures - depending on when you are there ,, could be music in the squares ... BAM was on with some interesting music.

Great walk. We didn't take any tour around the neighborhood, we just walked and around there...
It is a very charming area, full of churches and only building (some of them from Roman time).
Wonderful architecture. Went on a tour of the Gothic Quarter which was very informative. Very interesting history and architecture. Don't miss it!

Worth every moment of your time . Sure, we have to pick and choose so we see the most and best sites, but this area is worth the time. Tha ancient buildings, the galleries, the narrow hidden ways - it all adds up to a great experience. On a Saturday we got treated to street buskers and an antique mall. It could not have been better - and it is free.

Maze like streets. This part of the town is a great to walk in. Small winding streets that you can lose yourself in. Each street is different and you can find small surprises during your walk like old churches or a cool stores/restaurants.

Narrow lanes crammed with tourists. Judging by the number of tourists here on a Saturday morning, I think this is one area that really draws in tourists. As our time was limited, we focussed on visiting the big Cathedral and the MUHBA- the history museum - as we wanted to also see the nearby Picasso Art Gallery and the Palau Guell on the same day. The old quarter certainly offers a lot of sights as well as a variety of places to eat from eating a baguette on the run to patio cafes (note: there is an extra charge for eating on the outdoor patio). Ice cream shops abound as do tourist souvenir shops. The cobbled lanes and plazas, packed with people, are, fortunately, pedestrian. Just a fast walk through Gotic's main street was enough for us to feel the atmosphere of this old town as we headed towards the grand bouvelard, Rambla. The old town has a nearby Metro stop - Liceu - on the green line (L3) - which was used to take us back to our hotel after a day spent on our feet.
Vision of Man from La Mancha. One can imagine the intrigue that happened in these streets during the 1400's. Now home to artisans selling their ware.

Day trip to Barcelona . We spent the day in Barcelona and the highlight of my day was walking around the Gothic Quarter. If you enjoy looking at architecture,unusual shops and people watching this is a must but only during the day. Night time is a bit risky due to pickpockets. We stopped in a few coffee shops which were lovely and had the best Gelato ever!! Some fantastic patisseries to visit as well or just enjoy their fantastic window displays.

A Must Visit. We absolutely loved this area. The architecture is amazing and it has so many little side streets which held their secrets until you turned the corners. We only spent a few hours each day exploring it as we had booked other trips, but we wished we had longer to explore them. The Cathedral is definitely a must visit. If we manage to go again next year, we will dedicate more time to exploring it and will remember to bring our guide book which we had left at home.
Barri gotic. Wander thru narrow streets interesting little shops to escape the heat of the day, stop at a cafe in the placa reial for a cool drink,

Real atmosphere and life. Here is the real Barcelona with aromas, bustling but well moving crowds and the best Tapas bars where you eat all you like and they count the number of tooth picks to charge you. Great experiences here.

My favorite part of the city. We stayed at the Hotel Colon, right across from the cathedral. It was the most perfect location to me. Beautiful area with all the winding streets, the architecture, the cafe's, stores and of course the best part, the history. There seems to be something going on in the square all day. Entertainers, musicians, just people watching. We enjoyed sitting at the cafe's and watching people go by. Lots of bakeries, tapas, ice cream, wine, you name it, you can find it there.
Well worth a look. Spend a few hours walking around the Gothic quarter and take in the sites of an era passed. Plenty to see
Ace little area. As the title says really. Lots happening, many eateries, many bars, many people. Really bustling at the weekend. You get the idea.
Wonderful!. We spent a couple days here and loved the feel of this place. We stayed about 15 minutes away and so this was very accessible.

great area for shopping and sight seeing. The Cathedral, and all the little streets around it are great to get lost in. Head east into the older quieter area towards Arc de Triomph, especially if you are a comics fan. some good shops in that area.

So beautiful!. Don't miss the Gothic Quarter if you are in Barcelona. The architecture is fascinating and you'll want to take lots of pictures! Be sure to stop in one of the cafes or bakeries and try the delicious, thick Spanish Hot Chocolate and fresh churros. Make sure to dunk the churros in the hot chocolate. So delicious!

Great area to stay. Just came back last night from spending a few days in an apartment in the Gothic Quarter. What a special place with all the history , amazing Gothic Buildings and narrow winding streets that date back to the Middle Ages that you can explore . The area is filled with amazing areas such as Placa Reial and La Catedral , lots of small bars, bakeries, Pizzerias and Restaurants and borders on La Rambla - not to be missed. . if you want to get a feel for the city this is the place to stay- loved it
Beautiful area. This area of the city is lovely to walk around and see the sites and wonderful buildings. We spent a couple of afternoons wondering about.

Stunning architecture and culture. We fully intended to explore the city from end to end, however, we spent the bulk of our time in the Gothic Quarter. It's so easy to loose yourself in the labyrinth of small winding streets, finding a wide variety of shops from small antiquities through to the 'rubber duck' shop.The architecture was breathtaking, I only wish we could have stayed longer to really make the most of what this historic area had to offer. Whether you plan your trip down to the smaller detail or just go with the flow, I cannot stress how important it is that you visit Barri Gotic. So many photo opportunities to be had.

You should really take a walk here. A very nice and romantic area in barcelona. You should really take a walk here even if you single, with your partner or friends. Nice streets, restaurants and shops...and many places to visit.

Gothic Architecture at its Best. Visited here for the third time and everytime I visit I discover something new.It is a great area to visit if you like neo-Gothic architecture or if you just like interesting buildings. Lots of churches and nice quaint restraunts scattered on every street.A must if in Barca

Very cool and the old Barcelona. Could wander the streets for hours. In fact, we did! Grab a drink at any of the hole in the wall bars, grab some tapas, shop or just walk. A great surprise and will be back.

Beautiful quarter. This very characteristic district in the heart of the city has many things to visit, including the Cathedral, souvenir shops and restaurants. Definitely one places to visit in Barcelona!
Importan. This you can't miss, it makes up barcelona and gives it a special touch to it, you will love it and appreciate all of its surroundings.

Gothic Beauty. The Gothic Quarter is an amazing visual experience from the tiny streets shadowed by incredibly old Gothic buildings. Then you will come across an open area with a huge Gothic cathedral in front of you. Make sure you go inside. Plus lots of great Tapas restaurants and fashion shops.

what the.. I loved this place. I have been twice in 10 year and they are still building it.it's being built still and will be for the next 30 year.wheelchair users can get about but not everywhere. This place is so ornate it has to much to take in that's why it has taken so long to build. You will love it.

Walkable, safe, historic, busy, touristy. We stayed on Via Laietana, the main and busiest thoroughfare through the quarter, that runs to the sea.It's exciting, fun, ideal for a wander, day or night, but it's very busy, especially in the evening. It's the historic centre, so lots of note to see, including the cathedral, the Roman walls, the Viceroy's Palau, the Palau deal Musica Catalana which is a knockout, and the Mercat de la Santa Caterina which we much preferred to the biggest market, la Boqueria, off Las Ramblas, both are tourist traps. We didn't enjoy Las Ramblas at all. There's little of note to enjoy. There are far more lovely places, especially if time is limited.The place is absolutely teeming with life: ice cream parlours, cafes, restaurants, bars abound. Many of the best ones are down the side streets and lanes, so it's worth being a little curious. Lovely art and craft shops, much is Gaudi-inspired but lots of variety is available.We found a great ice cream shop on Carrer de la Princesa that's nene there s hundred years, and a great restaurant on Carrer Comtal, both a little hidden away.We were very lucky to visit during the weekend of the Feria de la Mercè, the annual city festival in memory of our Lady of Mercy. It's fun. And completely nuts.The place can be teeming, so be prepared for the crowds, chill and go with the flow, and it will be huge fun.

Easy to get lost and go round in circles. This area is wonderful to just explore and wonder along finding hidden piazzas and squares lots of bars and interesting shops not forgetting the splendid cathedral. It is easy to get 'lost' but that is part of the fun, you never know what to expect next. Just take your time and enjoy.

Great for shopping, drinks or slow meander. Next to La Rambla with its multitude of shops, market stalls and cafes. Largely pedestrianised with quaint narrow streets and historical buildings. Lots of Barcelona’s main attractions are nearby - Palau Guell, Cathedral, Palau Real/historical museum, Palau de la Musica Catalan, Museu Picasso etc. Placa Reial was our favorite place to stop for a drink/meal.

I really enjoyed the free walk trip . The walk throught the Gothic Quarter was amazing, the guide was helpful we found him at the travelers bar, it was recommended through Tripadvisor. It really tells the ancient history of Barcelona and it helps to learn whwre they are going at the future too. Just come equiped with comfy shoes and excellent camera

Gothic Quarter. Barcelona's Gothic Quarter is the center of the old city stretching from the Mediterranean seafront to Ronda de Sat Pere and from La Rambla to Via Laietan. It used to be the Roman village but now it's now a mix of old and new that can be explored along its labyrinth of cobblestone streets, which can be confusing and easy to get lost in while exploring. There are beautiful plaças (squares), lots of cafes and great shops. It's here in the Gothic Quarter you'll find the Picasso Museum, Jewish Quarter, Barcelona City History Museum and other historic sights.
Lovely area of the city. Really interesting part of the city with small streets and alleys dotted with restaurants and individual shops great to browse and get lost in

If in Barcelona - say there, if not visit!. This is just one of those things that you got to visit, make sure you've got at least a few hours to spend! As time flies by! I recommend going down some of the small allies and then locate a cozy local restaurant and get a snack!

My favorite part of Barcelona. My title says it all, spend a day at least going through the streets of the Gothic Quarter and you will find many little surprises. Shops, restaurants and countless sites that make this a truly wonderful experience.

A beautiful area!. Barri Gotic is a fabulous area to visit in Barcelona. There is always something interesting, be it ancient buildings, cozy squares, shops, museums etc. We spent a whole afternoon wandering around and thoroughly enjoyed it. We also had tapas, an ice cream and soaked up the atmosphere.

It is major reason to visit Barcelona. Probably, Barcelona is not the place where the medieval city centre is preserved, but definitely the Gothic part of the city centre worth attention. All tourists do it, and for good

Such a pleasure to wander . The other reviews said just get lost and enjoy - that's exactly what we did and Barcelona is one of our favourite cities largely based on this. Beautiful hidden buildings to discover with plenty of delicious refreshments and bars along the way. Strolling bliss.

Love walking through this area. if you love walking around gobble stone street and old historical buildings this is a place to visit.
Love stopping by many restuarants trying out tapas or stopping for drinks or small stores, boutiques and souvenir shops.
Prices are decent as well.

Amazing! . Just an amazing place with spectacular architecture and a lot of little cozy shops with variety of things - I bought here a pin-up dress and a several biju accessories - love this so much :)
Best place in Barcelona. For me this is the real Barcelona feeling. These narrow streets and all the old buildings. Many restaurants and Bars... simply great!

Incredible architecture everywhere you look. A great area to wander around and get lost among the ancient, but incredibly well-preserved buildings. Winding streets full of shops and restaurants suddenly open to grand plazas, with fountains and restaurants. Reminiscent of streets in Venice, and St Marco.

The real experience. The restaurants, the small shops, the street art, almost getting lost but ending up,as usual, on la ramble, the a must if you want to feel Barcelona. But don't hurry anywhere-enjoy Coffey or the local estera beer
Bit seedy. Some people say this place is quaint .but I found it dark dirty and seedy ..nothing to see here ...........................................
Beautiful Part of the City. A wonderful place to spend a day, getting lost & finding wonderful shops & places to eat. Beautiful & historical
The gothic quarter. Well worth a visit, walk among the narrow streets, steeped in history, bars, cafes, shops, impressive building. Just soak up the atmosphere.

A wonderful stroll a great way to spend a day. Next to La Rambla is the Gothic Quarter I strongly recommend a whole day walk best to do a tour with a guide This area is steeped in history from the Roman Columns to the remnants of the Jewish Quarter to the steps where Isabel and Ferdinand greeted Columbus up on his return from the New World .Plenty of bars restaurants and shops galore some quaint
Lively. Always stay in this part of Barcelona.Plenty to do and see.Great eating places for all budgets.Easy to walk to the beach.
Amazing place. Whilst visiting Barcelona this is a must see place, I really enjoyed walking around the Gothic Quarter, I can't wait to go back.

Nice place to walk :). Nice place to walk in day also in night.Lot of picturesque narrow streets, church of Sant Eulalia is great! In June 2015 we can get to the roof! Awesome view. Make sure, there wont be mass, when you want to visit this church, because you will see only small part of this awesome church :)

Wonderful area to explore!. Lots of shops and sights to explore in the Barrio Gotico. The streets are fun to wander and mix into the bustle of the daily foot traffic. Start at the top of La Rambla just below the Plaza de Catalunya work your way down to the Columbus Monument near the water.
Old town feel. One can wander through the narrow streets of the Gothic quarter all day. There is old architecture, numerous shops and a lot picturesque squares.
Wow!. I loved walking in the gothic quarter, the small shops, bakeries and narrow streets are a must!!! We visited every day during our vacation and there is always something new to discover.

A wonderful way to spend a hot day. An endless collection of little narrow street with many boutiques and restaurant where you can wander at leasure in the shade and the cool. Friendly people but then again this seem to be the case where ever you go in Barcelona apart from a coiple of so called trendy restaurants in the main town.
nice area. if you want to know about barcelona past this is the place to go a lot of museum and old gothic build really interestind day out
Enjoyed getting lost .... Enjoyed getting lost and wandered around discovering quaint alleys, a small organic market and shops. Was fortunate to witness the La Merce festival 2016 and

Gothic delight. If you go to Barcelona without visiting the Gothic Quarter, you have missed a great experience. The winding narrow and wide streets, the numerous courtyards, churches, shops, cobblestone streets and architecture are a must see.

Such an interesting neighborhood. This was such a fun area to explore and wander through. There was always another corner or alley to go down. The number of shops and cafes was over the top. Great place to go again and again.

Great place to wander. This is the center of the old city. It's a maze of narrow streets and shops with some of the places dating back to the Roman settlement of Barcelona. LOTS of shops and cafes, and some have historic interest. Check out the "street placques" just outside the front door of some of the shops. It designates historic places which in many cases is still a shop with authentic decor and "similar" items for sale.Lots of historic ceramic tile plaques on the walls along the sidewalks depict "everyday life" (such as courtship and etiquette).Definitely a fun and interesting place to ramble. Easy to get lost, so pick a well-known tourist spot to either meet back up if you get separated - or to ask for directions to if you find your whole group lost.

Must see, authentic Barcelona. we were located in Gothic quarter, it is really nice area, you can just walk around little streets and every couple of minutes you will find something interesting.. besides regular stuff, go and see Augustus temple remains, located just 2 minutes from Jaume square.. be sure to visit inside of cathedrale and her atrium garden

Not Scary...a Great Place to Visit, Shop, and Eat!. I thought this area would be scary, with small, unlit, dark, winding streets. Not so. Well, they are small, winding streets....but well lit, with plenty of tourists, bars, restaurants, and shops. The Picasso Museum is located here. Fun, interesting place to wander through! Felt safe at all times. Stayed in the El Born district right next door and would not have changed a thing....great vacation spot.
Beautiful. Really a breathtaking Gothic construction. We didn't plan visiting it but took advantage of this opportunity while unexpectedly found it on the trip.
walking tour. We took a walking tour with Runner Bean Free Walking Tours.Excellent guide and we learned a lot about the area. The tour took nearly 3 hours.

Great area to stroll. The Gothic Quarter is a really good area to stroll and see the old part of the town. There are plenty of restaurants and small cafes as well as historic sights to see. Get a map and take a tour - it's interesting.

Getting lost is all the fun. Beautiful authentic old very narrow passageways(beware of scooters and cars?)with so much to see and buy and eat. Clean and safe with a partner. Bought three bottles of local wine at a small shop for 8,50 €. We enjoyed.

Great old-world feel if you don't mind getting lost . It is like stepping back in time with narrow streets and alleyways. A few streets are commercialized but most are still authentic feeling. Great little shops and restaurants tucked into small locations with a lot of history. At 5 foot 2 inches I feel like a giant in some of the doorways!

Lovely Church but take care at your pockets. Let's be clear: the Gotic Church is very nice, it's interiors and the rooftop..magnificent.You can go by elevator on the rooftop for about 2 euros, and the wiev is nice.The inside garthen with the fountain and the geese of Saint Eulalia..nice especially for children..But do not visit this areea by night because it is visited by thieves so go only by day:)The Church entrance is free.

A decent historic walk. If you are in Barcelona you must visit the gothic quarter to get a glance of the old catalan city. The old houses decorations, the narrow streets, the boutiques and the caffee will immerse you in the history of barcelona
Beautiful . Walking with culture all around, architecture is fab and so quaint.Stepping back in time but also you can envisage the past and all the history with it.Simply a must on the tourist trail.

Interesting maze of narrow streets. A historical area everyone visits when in Barcelona. The narrow streets have lots of interesting shops and cafes. Takes you back in time to imagine what it is like to live there in medieval days.
Good place for walking. You get to enjoy beautiful Gothic edifices. Walk along the narrow streets and be surprised by squares and cafes at the end of some of these streets.
Such a wonderful place. Such a wonderful place . Amazing . WonderfulAnd the streets , and the coffes and and the restaourants and the Tita's Spanish guitar concerts under the flowers....
Tour the Town. A great section of town, the Gothic architecture is charming and beautiful and full of historic character.
Olde world. This is a charming area to stroll around with plenty of cafes/ restaurants and some street entertainers. Many interesting looking buildings.
The Gothic quarter is as romantic as you dreamed it would.. The Gothic quarter is as romantic as you dreamed it would be. The cathedral of course dominates but the many side streets enchant.
Stunning!. So much to see. Beautiful narrow streets. Step back in time. Everywhere you look there is something else to see. Like a labrynth.
Stepped back in time.. Enjoyed the Barri Gotic more than La Rambla. Loved the narrow streets, little bars, great architecture...

Step back into time . . literally!. When in Barcelona, it is a must to take a walk through the Gothic Quarter. Imagine yourself here, 500 years ago, going through your daily activities - getting food, drink, etc. There is so much history in the area. See the churches and drop into the stores. You won't be dissapointed.
Favourite part of Barcelona. The favourite part of our trip was getting lost in the gothic quarter where we spent most of our time.

Nice old place. Nice old place to walk and discover . Lots of shops, bars , cafes and restaurants.
Souvenir shops also.

Traveling Spain 2016. PRO'S: This is the original older part of Barcelona where the Roman town stood.Wandering the streets is part of the fun. Lots of touristy shops but also things like the Picasso Museum. CON'S: Try to walk this area when the weather is not so hot. Early or after six when the shops haven't closed is best.SUMMARY: Strolling the Gothic Quarter should be a part of any multi-day visit to Barcelona.

Excellent tour. Our guide Miguel gave an informative and amusing tour. The walk was gentle and Miguel was exceptional in his rapport with all members of the group. We were able to see and visit parts of the Old Centre that we would otherwise just have walked by. Heartily recommended.

Cultural History meets the modern tourist era. This area is an amazing maze old narrow alleys, myriad mainly tourist related (and tourist priced) items. Well worth a visit and a walk around, with different faces by day and by night. Plenty of great little bars and eating places but difficult to get your bearings in due to the narrow walkways and tall buildings around you. On the outer edge and nearby is Teresa Carles vegetarian restaurant which has an interesting and very nice degustation menu. Teresas own brand house red also very good as well.

Quirky, interesting, colourful..... Also often smelly. I stayed in the area and found getting lost in all the little laneways was great fun. Quaint shops, interesting architecture, lots of history. Every time you turn a corner, you find something else.The only downside was the sewage smell that was often present.

Very unique. We have never encountered anything like this in all of our travels. The Gothic Quarters looks a little like the New Orleans French Quarters except much cleaner and In far superior condition. Narrow roads that look like alleys and lots of excitement abound. Felt perfectly safe except late pm with too many shadows. Wonderful food and shops galore! Friendly people and no language barrier at all. Lots of authenticity with interested and interesting people. The Hotel DO was a perfect location to take in the flavors of this hugely unique and fascinating area!
A must see district!. The Gothic Quarter is a must see district while in Barcelona and is steeped in history with every step.

Old World. Best part of the City to wander, imagine what it was like hundreds of years ago.
Great shopping, for chocolate, espadrilles, have a cafe,
Mesmerizing. This area of Barcelona is like stepping to another dimension. One can marvel for hours at the architecture and artistic symbols. There are many restaurants in this are as well.

Gothic Quarter Stunning. Fabulous area in Barcelona, with wonderful culture and architecture. Its like a maze of winding streets but worth spending a day getting lost and seeing what you can find. Wonderful food on offer off the main streets too.
historic. just a wonderful place to walk around, the history value is incredible, the architecture in the area is stunning, plenty shops cafes and restaurants .

The charms of Barcelona - book free walking tour. Get off the Ramblas and check out he Gothic quarter and get lost in these hidden lane ways. The best option to see this area is to sign up for a free walking tour of the Bari Gothical. In about 2.5hs, you got it all and with guide tour of a trove of good info. Please do tip these guide properly.

Guitar concert at Basilica Ste Maria del Pi. Nightly performances of Spanish/Flamenco guitar in chapel in the Basilica. Fantastic and highly recommended. The setting is beautiful, the acoustics are perfect and the atmosphere is intimate. In a basilica built in 1300+ - the best thing I discovered in Barcelona

Simply stunning. Even if like me you only have a few hours to spend in barcelona do take a couple of hours to explore the old city.You will find treasures at every corner, small meandering streets which offer interesting boutiques, divine food set in architectural splendor.
Awesome. Its a great experience to take a stroll in it, it feels like stepping in an old movie.The best thing to do is to lose track in it and actually its small in size so wont be a problem.
A Wonderful Stroll. Enjoyed a wonderful day strolling through the Gothic Quarter. Tiny narrow streets filled with unique shops and small tabernas. A delightful day.

Check out the shops and the unique quarters. Must say to be one cool experience getting lost among the streets of these quarters. Very uniquely barcelona and in my opinion makes it very special and personal.One or two trips and you will get your directions, then you will be good to explore the various churches as well as the shops and good food. Do check out Museum Picasso and the churches like Basílica de Santa Maria del Pi and Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar to name a few must visits for a trip to barcelona.

Nice but busy. Enjoy wondering and stop anywhere for snacks and drinks. Quirky shops kept us amused. We found ourselves here to get away from vehicle and pedestrian crowds. There are many open plazas with restaurants and bars offering refreshments. The jungle filled balconies are a delight. It is such a special part of old Barcelona
Loved the Gothic Quarter. Better than I thought it was going to be, definitely worth a visit! Amazing buildings and loads of lovely little shops down the side streets.

Historical Alice in Wonderland!. The Gothic Quarter is a maze of beautiful old architecture and at some point you will get lost at the narrow streets start to look the same and every corner turns into another corner and this is the beauty. Getting lost in history cast in stone...

Favorite neighborhood in one of my favorite cities. Barcelona is one of my favorite cities and I always stay in the Old City , or Gothic Quarter,. Aside from all the charm of the narrow streets and courtyards, there is Gothic influence in the architecture of such buildings as the Cathedral. Multiple shops, bars and great restaurants are all within walking distance To me, this is Barcelona.

An interesting part of Barcelona. This area is really interesteing to walk around in. I would also recommend to join a guided tour in. You will learn a lot about the history of Barcelona, many entertaining and interesteing stories.
Enjoyable. Enjoyable walking in Gothic Quarter. Good for exploring the small streets. You can see a lot of beautiful buildings, visit the numerous shops and restaurants
Nice walk. It was a lovely walk with all these gothic buildings and the cathedral. Many stores while u walk too

Memorable!. Full of history,beautiful buildings and true Catalan spirit.You can also find hidden gems like a giant sculpture of a Cat that we found while sneaking throu the tight streets full of amazing attractions.It's worth spending time among locals and discover places You won't find in official guides.

Barca in a day . If you have an opportunity when you're in Barcelona you must visit the Gothic Quarter.. They're a little shops restaurants tapas bars around every corner... The people are friendly it's safe and an opportunity to take a lots of photos...

Endless alleys. We have wander in the Quarter for a few hours every day for 3 days and it wasnt enough.
A lot of very special shops and nice resturants, bars and cafes.

At night ..cheap place and drunk people. At night young people are going from one cheap bar to another and shouting in the streets. They will end up drunk for the most part... Some small bar are quiet with older clients but generally full.. Some nice restaurants: Sensi, Mirilla,... where you need to book.
Well worth visiting. We stopped her on the Turistic Bus; it is en route. Very interesting to have a wander. We went to the Picasso Musuem here....fantastic
wonderful. many, many alley ways to get lost in and be adventurous if you choose!!! There are several districts, each with their own personality. Much to see and do.
Gotic Area. This area is a rabbit warren of wonderful cobblestone streets and little shops and restaurants. I stayed in this area and loved just getting lost.

A jump back in the history. Very charming neighborhood, busy during the day for shopping (you'll find every store you can possibly imagine) and pretty calm at night. I used to have walks with my boyfriend late night, walking through the narrow streets surrounding the gigantic Gothic cathedral. When the bell of the cathedral rings it feels so magical. Definitely one of the nicest areas of Barcelona.
Aggabee. Great for walking in and out of streets at night. Saw some wonderful and creative paintings on buildings. Fun shops and restaurants.

Worth exploring. This is a busy place with heavy traffic on the main roads, tourists and locals thronging the larger streets and in between it all a myriad of small streets and little areas with cafes and restaurants. There are some great buildings and museums as well. You can't come to Barcelona and not explore around here.Just be prepared to walk a long way so make sure you take plenty of rest stops in local cafes.

gorgeous ambience - really worth a stroll around. the architecture & atmosphere are fantastic - despite so many small back-streets we felt very safe in this region & would definately recommend tourists to pay a visit
Beautiful Gothic Church . Beautiful area. Women are NOT allowed to show legs inside. So not shorts, skirts or short dresses. Therefore I wasn't able to go inside

Lovely atmosphere . Gothic quarter is full of atmosphere, you can enjoy every step of your way.But it could become a nightmare if you stay there in hotel/house as it's very noisy all night long. It wasn't simple try to sleep at night time.

Great walking tour . Today I took a free walking tour of Gothic Quarter which turned out to be very interesting and informative, thanks to our outstanding tour guide; Max. He shared so much history and events that made barcelona the city that it is today. I am not a history fan but learning about how the Gothic quarter was established and went through metamorphosis over and over again was absolutely amazing.

Interesting but confusing. This is the oldest section of Barcelona. It displays the architecture and cultural heritage of the city beautifully. Its narrow, winding streets can be a bit confusing. Fortunately we had a personal guide (highly recommended) to help us maneuver the area.
For wonderful sight seeing and stroll. Many attractions with interesting shops, street entertainment and restaurants. A busy place especially at night

Cultural and Historical. Barri Gotic is old Barcelona. The streets are narrow and twisting. Many restaurants (from coffee to sandwich to tapas and more) and shops. Walking the streets gives you a feel for the culture. Getting lost is part of the allure but have a map to find your way out. Incidentally, skip Mercat de la Boqueria, which is extremely overcrowded, and go to Mercat de Santa Caterina, which is also a food market where the Barcelonians go. There are adjacent neighborhoods to wander and get lost in. Just be a little extra cautious to avoid isolated alleys.

Narrow side streets where you can get pleasantly lost. You can get lost in the Gothic Quarter and this is a good thing. The small narrow streets lead on to another and before you know it your down by the harbour or out on La Rambla. There is the Cathedral and Museu d'Historia to see plus street performers and at the weekend a vintage market. Day and night it's packed with tourists. Walk it a few times as I'm sure you will find streets you miss the first.

Must See. This was my 2nd visit to Barcelona and I knew I had to go back to the Gothic Quarter. I love the atmosphere and the people. You can go during the day or at night and it is very interesting and worth the trip. It is crowded at times but it is so worth the time and effort to see it all.
