Been here before and still worth touring. It seems some things never get old, and that is the real old Gothic Area. Filled with narrow stone streets and historic finds around every corner. Always worth getting a walking tour your first time

Like traveling back in time. This area is almost magical in that it really makes you feel like you've stepped through a portal into another way of life. There are lots of shops and places to eat, which is nice, but it's really the narrow streets, the architecture, the little balconies lining all the buildings, and the cobbled roads that almost make you feel like you're in a different time. The streets are very pedestrian friendly, and there aren't many cars around. We booked our hostel in this area and if/when I come back to this city I would book it in this area again, definitely. It always felt very safe walking around this area, even at night, and I'm a person that tends to get nervous about that very easily, so the feel here is very good.

Gothic Quarter. Visited chocolate museum. The sculptures were amazing to see & the chocolate wasn't bad either. Decided to carry on & walked to Picasso's Museum & Museum of modern art. Both were great. Along the way had a chance to visit several little bars/cafe the food is fantastic & cheap. Didn't get to the church, but well worth the visit.

My favourite area!. Loved the gothic quarter, beautiful buildings, pedestrianised streets like a maze perfect for just wandering and exploring. Lots of individually owned specialist boutiques rather than big well known chair stores. We enjoyed sitting in street cafes just watching people walking by and the street artists.
Get lost there and don't forget to look up!. Barri Gotic was one of the best places I've ever seen in my entire life. Charming, quaint, cozy, wonderful!

Step back in time, so different from Las Rambla. You literally step back in time when you walk through the Gothic Quarter. Narrow streets and tall buildings, so much different than the Eixample neighborhood. One is quickly reminded that this is how Europe lived 500 years ago. Plenty to see and plenty to take pictures of. Cathedral de Barcelona, Els 4Gats are the highlights.
Lovely area to wander around. Just of La Ramblas. Full of restaurants, shops etc. Picasso Museum is in this area ans well worth a visit.
Interesting! . Great architecture. .... shopping and cafes. You need more than a day to wonder through these streets
Nice! . Nice architecture, great feel. Easy to wonder around and enjoy all nice courtyards and narrow streets.

Cathedral roof top. The cathedral is free to enter...make sure you are appropriately dressed or you will be turned away at the door. Pay 3 euros for lift to rooftop its worth it alone just for the view and to take pictures of the spire and landscape. It also gives you a good idea of distances to other attractions.

Lose yourself. A great area to wander around with no fixed route. Located on the left hand side of Las Ramblas as you walk down (South) it towards the sea front. It is full of narrow streets, alleyways and squares which are full of shops, bars, restaurants and cafes. Definitely an area worth exploring after you have been all the way down Las Ramblas and beyond to the Maremagnum shopping mall on the sea front. Don't miss the Cathedral de Barcelona which is fairly centrally located here in the Gothic Quarter.
If you can fit it in, do so!. What an incredible section of Barcelona. Old sections, gothic buildings. Just awesome and not to miss!

Stay here. In the middle of all the action. Restaurants, sights, shops, & hotels. I'd definitely stay in this area again. Farthest attractions are gaudi church and park. Only other reason to leave is to go to the beach.
Great old section of town . Lots of junk shops, Tapas bars and small quaint shops to wander thru. Get off La Rambla and check out the history of the area.

A definite must do. . Don't go early. Delivery vans clog the alleys until around 10 am. By ten the shops are starting to open. Walk as many of the really narrow laneways as you can - More interesting and unique shopping.

Breathtaking. The second day in Barcelona we went on a tour of the city and ended up here for a couple of hours to walk around and explore. The architecture was phenomenal and amazing to see. So much to see and do we could have easily spent the day there and in fact on our free day we did go back to explore more.

Mind blowing visit.. Walking from the Casa Batilo we walked up a street fashionable street and continuing up the street we ended up in the locality. Wow is the first word that comes to mind when you enter this vicinity. Small narrow cobbled lined street and medivial structures surely impress. Suddenly one other turn and you end up in a plaza lined with restaurants and street vendors. This is another area on every travelers must see list. Barcelona is one of the most scenic, friendly and beautiful cities I have ever visited. I will look at buying my next international property here in BEAUTIFUL, SAFE and FRIENDLY BARCELONA

just awesome. if there is one area to not miss in Barcelona this is it. one can get lost in the different alleys and interesting facades. old gothic architecture was really interesting. do not miss this quarter.

Enjoy getting lost!. Barri Gotic was the only area in Barcelona that I roamed with GPS turned off. I was going in circles, around and around, turning from busy roads to tiny alleys, exploring little shops and cafes all around. It was magical, just to wonder around unknown place whose every part was so pittoresque, so unique and beautiful! Don't forget to look up sometimes, there are many great balconies and windows! There I experienced the most beautiful play of sunshine and shadows that I have ever seen!Magical!

Lovely walk. Lovely area to stroll around , some great photo opportunities. Early evening before dinner is a great time to visit. We would definitely recommend one of the many walking tours in the area to really understand the splendid architecture and history of the beautiful area.

Buildings older than my country!. Labyrinth heaven! Full of history… You never knew what to expect around the corner! Musicians playing in the streets, a place to sit, or another windy road to walk, etc. I saw buildings dating back to The Roman Empire!
Gothic quarters. You should take the opportunity to walk and get lost in the small lanes of gothic quarters Also if have time visit the Picasso museum and City Park

Plenty of sights to see. There's plenty to see and do around here from the huge amounts of restaurants and fast food, the Picasso friezes and strolling La Rambla but the highlight is the cathedral and surrounding streets. This area is situated close to the beach and there's plenty of metro lines for getting to the castell and the Olympic stadium or the Sagrada familia. Buy a T10 ticket which is good for 10 trips, and the best value for money It can also be used by multiple people, just stamp it for each person travelling.

Wonderful to wonder about the Barri Gotic. The Barri Gotic is a fantastic area to simply wonder around, get lost, walk some more, and find unexpected treats along the way. It is chock full of churches, museums, the famous Barcelona Cathedral, neighbourhood apartments, restaurants, bars, shops, small hotels and hostels, and wonderful medieval architectural details. It is quite a maze, but compact in size, so no problems to eventually find your way back to one of the larger streets. You'll enjoy spending hours, or even a few days, exploring the wonders of the Barri Gotic.

Best part of Barcelona. Definitely the best place to stay in the city. Lots to see and do, plenty of restaurants and bars so something for everyone but with lots of other attractions on offer to. Lots of warnings about pick pockets but we had no issues so I think it is just a case of being careful as you would need to be on many other places.

Interesting area to explore. Many interesting shops in the area to explore. Unlike the wide space in many parts of the city, Gothic quarter is part of the old city - many small and narrow lane. A lot of walking is needed to explore this part of the town.

My favourite place in Barcelona . It is literally my favourite place in Barcelona!!! Apparently it's a very old district with antique touch!You would go through many narrow alleys, just when you about to think you're lost you find another building/thing that would take your breath away!High recommended ! MUST VISIT!!

Must See. An absolute must see. I recommend getting off the main stretch of the Ramblas and just wandering with no purpose around the Gothic Quarter. Great shops, art galleries, the churches with their beautiful court yards are fantastic for a little relaxation. So many art shops and the street art is amazing. Down the side of the big tourist information building there is a Vietnamese cafe, it's tucked in the corner and noticeable by a large mural of two people kissing made from photographs. Beautiful food suitable for veggies. It's one of those places, just when you think you've seen it all you turn another corner and there's a whole new set of streets to explore.
Best part of Barcelona!. The most fascinating quarter and the origins of Barcelona. Roman remains, quirky narrow streets, lovely bars and restaurants - not to be missed!

Beautiful part of the City with lots of little side streets full of treasures.. The Gothic quarter is one of the most beautiful areas of the city. We it's small winding streets that open up into beautiful squares with a hive of activities from street markets to eateries and small independant shops. The stonework and style of the buildings wonderful and i'd of happily spent more time wondering the streets of this hidden gem.

the labyrinth of goth. the labyrint not of Pan (in Guillermo Del Toro movie) but of senses, the labyrinth of the gothic aspect, mystery, dark and history, yesterday is present, is different, is attractive, That is the Gothic Quarter in the heart of Barcelona, a hot spot that erases memories, sentiments, feelings, that place longs from Las Ramblas until Via Laietana and makeds the difference. There is the Cathedral, Plaza Reial, Calle Ferran,Plaza del Pi,City hall, Historic Museum among others, therea are shops, bars, restaurants, musicians in the streets, open markets.. above all there is history, myths, attraction, often dark, little narrow streets that hide secrets,or evoke imagination, the old combines with the new, thw tourism with art, the gothic mystery with thee mystery of life, all that in the labytints of mind and heart, in the heart of the city that some times and for several reasons wants to live in a difeerent way, in a free way. The spirit of freedom and independence lives in Barrio Gottico, in my personal oppinion it must not be destroyed from the touristic spirit that also dominates Barcelona..

Beautiful architecture for early morning stroll. The Bari Gotic borders the famous Las Ramblas strip in Barcelona and represents the narrow streets and classic architecture of old Barcelona. Best to visit either during the "shoulder" tourist season or early in the morning else the time you spend dodging the crowds will diminish the experience

Beautiful . This is a beautiful church the arcateture is amazing and it's worth walking around all the little side street so you can get a good look at it from out side. The only down side is found to it was the you were not aloud enter with short trousers..
Mary & Andy Baylis. The most fantastic city we have visited,will be back soon.So much to see & do.The Barri Gotic is full of incredible architecture,So many places,aromas etc that fill your sences.

Barri Gotic area of Barcelona. We've visited the Barri Gotic area of Barcelona twice within the past three years. The vibe is great, although one does have to contend with many other touristas. Food and buildings are highlights.

Very strongly recommend visit here - fascinating array of quite old & new. You can spend as little (like nothing) or as much as you'd like in this fascinating area. it combines things like walls built by Romans with a modern (funny) Pill Shop. There is a lovely square, massive cathedral, extensive shopping and great people watching. Often there are street musicians (we heard an opera singer, a dixie banjo player with a trumpeter, and piano player, plus others. It's a fascinating, historical, lively area. Strongly recommended.

Some of the coolest architecture in the city. You definitely have to stop by the Gothic Quarter in Barcelona. It's one of the most unique places in the city. The architecture is clearly different than from other parts of the city and it continues the beautiful flow of diverse design and innovation throughout this city. The restaurants are excellent and there are plenty of great sites to visit.

You cannot get bored there!. This labyrinth of narrow streets is just amazing! Although they are very narrow, they contains so much - shops for everithing, bars. tourists, street performers. There are also lots of squares linking the streets. Maybe the only place where you could see a shop for bath ducks, for candles, for nargiles and so on and so on.

Great old European city style . On a recent visit to Barcelona we spent a couple of lazy afternoons wandering the Barri Gothic district. Best tip we'd have is to get a good map but put it in your pocket and get lost. A few too many touristy shops due to its closeness to Las Rambles, but still fun to explore.
beautiful area. loved staying here. beautiful buildings and some quirky shops and restaurantes...very central for all the sights and only minutes walk fro Las Ramblas
Getting lost in this place is a must-do!. Beautiful place to get lost...at least during the day... plenty of things to do and see, from sightseeing to eating, drinking or shopping.

Amazing building and restaurant . Visited the gothic quarter of Barcelona. Beautiful buildings and restaurant. Nice side walk performance and singing. Venture through the small alleys are interesting with nice shops. Restaurants. Graffiti at each of the shop doors are also beautiful. Nice to walk around and savour the environment. A must visit when in Barcelona
The Gothic Quarters. If your into history the Gothic Quarters my be for you. It has very beautiful architecture.Stone work and ironwork Also there are many shops intertwined if you enjoy shopping.
Good place. You must enjoy your some time in gothic quarter. You must see the narrow streets and make shopping. You must see and breath in the gothic quarter.
Narrow gothic place. Very narrow streets.... Cathedral is there and old and enjoy full street with many different tastes... Must go there to walk few hours... Art lovers Picasso museum is there ...

Interesting and authentic. This old area maintains its charm. The narrow streets, full of small shops and restaurants, is calm yet lively. Recommended to those interested in history as well as for those wanting to get away from the city hustling and bustling environment.

Stunning . Everything about the gothic quarter was stunning. The architecture, the culture, the narrow alleys.
Pro tip: if you're a picky eater, food is hard here (and in Spain in general). There's an Argentine empanada place that will save the day and will cater to every picky palette.

Great to wander and wonder. There is so much to see as you wander around this area. A map is essential if you are not familiar with the myriad of streets. It is shaded given the narrowness of most of the side streets - and few cars. I enjoyed this excursion.

Beautiful Architectual Building. We went to on the Bus Tour running by City of Barcelona, which you can see almost all the attractions from it. They had three course (Red, Blue and Green). It cost 28 Euro for adult per day but it is worth it, because you do not have drive crazy traffic in Barcelona.

It's ok. Not sure why it such a big attraction.
The cathedral is impresive, but that is about it. Streets are crowded with organized tour, and frankly, if you ever visited places like Old-Montreal or Old-Quebec, this won't do much for you.
However, it is a nice walk to get from one point to the other.

A.M.A.Z.I.N.G!!. Couldn't get enough of this fabulous area. Bought nougat on Chocolate Street, the most amazing 'rubber ducks' from the rubber duck shop for our grandchildren and ate sensational tapas and pinxtos. We wandered for hours, enjoying the architecture, shops and beautiful doors, and, of course, the beautiful churches

Birthday trip.. Amazing area of gothic architecture...alleyways , buildings .and art.the cathedral is a must .make sure your dressed appropriately...men and women no bare shoulders . No short skirts , no short shorts .

Great place to explore... I did so via a free walking tour!. Took a free walking tour of the area which provide a great historic overview and actually double backed afterwards to do a little shopping and further exploring... with the maze of streets it's easy to get lost (in a good way)

Fun Area to Stay. The narrow and winding streets are a little confusing at first but exploring the Gothic Quarter is a lot of fun with lots of little shops, restaurants and cafes. It can feel a bit crowded depending on when you are there so be prepared.
Gothic day. About 45 minutes walk from our hotel, this area did not disappoint. Beautiful architecture and an amazing Gaudi exhibition right next door!
Everyone loves this area.. We actually stayed in the Gothic area, and were surprised daily at the number of times we turned a corner to find another square we had not stumbled on before!

Wonderful Place. Roam the little dark streets of the barri gotic, with all the restaurants, cafes and shops. It might seem a little unsafe at night, but there are always plenty of people walking around and it's fun to get lost, especially after a few glasses of wine ! Just keep your wits about you and be alert, but we never had any issues. Before you know it you'll be on las ramblas ! We are so happy we explored the area as our hotel was quite close by. In fact, most of our nights out were here and we loved every minute of it. Well worth the time !
Best place to stay. It's all going on, Gaudi, cathedrals, markets, cafes and restaurants. Grotesques and gargoyles on most streets, loved it.
Gothic . Patrick was our tour guide. He obviously loves Barcelona and was a great guide. He made the tour very interesting and knew a lot about the City.

So much to see, too little time.. Our hotel was just off the Ramblas and within walking distance of the Gothic Quarter. We spent hours wandering thru the streets admiring the gothic architecture, churches, cafes and retail shops. We spent 2 days in Barcelona and didn't even scratch the surface.

Barcelona cathedral. The Catholic cathedral is in the gothic quarter and is a must see for gothic and baroque fans. Elevator costs 3eu to rooftop for a very nice panoramic view of the city. I felt like Quasimodo exploring the rooftop. But the cathedral needs a lot of extensive upkeep i.e. Many stained glass windows are broken and missing.
So cute and fun!. We stayed in a hostel in this area. It is super cute with adorable streets and restaurants. The beach is nearby. You'll definitely find something to do.

Excellent place to walk after sunset . Evening time I think is the best for visiting, so you get to feel the place, visit the shops, bars, enjoy the atmosphere.. Visiting George Orwell square is a must..

Don't miss this neighborhood. I could spend all day walking around the gothic quarter. The shops and restaurants are great and the charm is unending. Don't miss this area on your trip. Look for the gold plaques on the ground to know a location is old and authentic.

The cathedral is definitely worth a visit. I visited the gothic quarter without any guides. I just followed the map and few recommendations. The place is full of local shops that were extremely nice and entertaining. The streets and all buildings are kind of masterpieces. The place smells authenticity and respect.

Quaint and silent place. This place has a lot of history behind it and a lot of stuff to see. Tough to find your way there inside but with google maps things bcum easy. The sites r known for famous movie shoots like the perfume etc and also known for one of its restaurants where famous hollywood actors have sat for coffee. There are a couple of other things which u must study beforeyou go to this place in order to understand better what it stands for. The best way to reach this place is to cycle it and better with a cycle tour.

Fantasitic and worth it. We took a private tour of the Gothic Quarter through Barcelona Day tours. Fantastic. This was one of the highlights of our trip. We went back on our own as well. Highly recommended

Allow yourself plenty of time to wander the maze of beautiful streets. With hindsight it may have been wise to join a tour or at least buy a guide book as we may well have missed parts, but we just chose to wander at our leisure and found so many amazing buildings and sights around every corner. We took more photographs than ever before as we found so much to capture. It's unique and fascinating.

Found by accident. Although we'd seen a bit of the Gothic Quarter on our bus trip (highly recommended) it wasn't until our last day that we wandered around the lanes doing a bit of last minute shopping when we stumbled onto a square in the Gothic Quarter and the amazing gothic church - Placa del Pi I think it's called. Definitely have to go back to Barcelona to explore more of this fab area .

Fantastic for a wander through some fabulous old and winding streets.. We managed to take a couple of wrong turns but found the Cathedral eventually, along with the new Gaudi Experience museum and a fantastic Antiques market. Loved having a wander.

One all hours. Stopped over in this area for the night before continuing on our hol, went out on the streets getting on for midnight and the streets were so busy with folk drinking, eating, chatting, it had a really good relaxed feel about the place, really enjoyed it.If you found this review helpful please like it.

Terry. We stayed in the Gothic Area and fell in love with its passageways and architecture! The bells of the churches fill the neighborhood of restaurants, merchants and shops with music! Walking down La Rambla and seeing the Market de Boqueria was beautiful! We took a free walking tour of the Gothic area and it was a great tour!
Nice place in Barcelona. El barrio gótico is a place in the center of the city that is like the old town. I strongly recomend to go there and see this different part of Barcelona

Amazing labyrinth of winding streets!. Must see area of Barcelona! A maze of beautiful winding streets broken up by serene squares and picturesque churches.Well worth a visit, number two after Sagrada Familia.
A must see whilst in Barcelona!. Absolutely stunning architecture and plenty of activities to choose from such as museums, restaurants, shops, markets and more!
Gothic quarter . Incredible architecture dating way back with an awesome history behind it all! One of the courtyards is used in a lot of films which is interesting to see
So great!. This neighborhood is so fun- great people watching, shopping, eating, drinking. The best place to get lost in!

Superb architecture and lively nightlife. A labyrinth of narrow streets and tall buildings, the Gothic Quarter offers jazz bars, souvenir shops, small restaurants, open air events and performances. You can't get bored of this place, it is a unique, living piece of history combined with a sensible approach to mass tourism.
very good. Had lunch here and food was fantastic a little expencive but staff very nice and helpfull.lovely area to watch people come and go

The Gothic Quarter is wonderful . Get lost in the winding streets of this amazing part of Barcelona. It has an abundance of shops; leather, unique goods and high street favourites. Musicians are playing in the streets and there's something around every corner. Reminded me of diagon alley from Harry potter. Full of culture and character. Fantastic little tapas bars; really authentic and great restaurants. Highly recommend.

Get lost in ancient Barcelona. Pop on you walking shoes and wander through this area. Every corner has a new surprise, quant shops, ancient churches, medieval squares, cafes, markets - a must do and its free!!
A must. You have to go, the place is magnificent, lively and beautiful architecture. Dont eat there (over priced), but spend some time and have a drink.

We really enjoyed this area both day and night. During the day take the free walking tour to get the flavor of the history from pre Roman to present day. Great little alleys and streets winding past many shops of all types. At night the restaurants and sidewalk cafes are wonderful. Things are happening in the squares and especially catch the street performers really good. We actually spent time stopping and watching them.

The alleys off the main streets are delightful to explore.. We stayed three days in Barri Gotìc near the Cathedral. There was a book fair going on. There is so much to see and do in this area alone. The Roman ruins were a treat.

Love this Quarter of town!. At first I could not understand what and where was this Gothic quarter so I went at the information office in La Ramblas at he Gran Teatre to ask around. The man at the desk was very rude. He just told that the Gothic quarter is practically this.... He spoke to me without even looking at me. All the time his eyes were on his laptop. I think tourist information offices should be equipped with staff who are tourist friendly and make eye contact, be polite and give service with a smile. Gothic quarter is a very nice place. We stopped for a paella and sangria. Very yummy.
Great walk. Tremendous walk down narrow pedestrian only streets with tapas everywhere and incredible architecture.

Super nice area. The area of Barri Gotic is very nice and you can wander endlessly around its small streets. Perfect for people who like to go to touristic places but also for people who love to walk through narrow, quiet streets. There's plenty of shops and nice bars. Definately worth to pay a visit!

Narrow winding streets with a surprise around every corner.. Well worth taking a day to explore the Gothic Quarter. lots of quirky shops, plush hotels bars and restaurants and a real taste of Old world charm.

Average cathedral. Nothing spectacular, hidden away in the gothic quarter, barcelona cathedral is big inside, need to be dressed appropriately otherwise wont be allowed in, only a few euros entry fee. Good experience but average.

Amazing culture, food and catalan atmospheric feel. Gothic Quarter is nothing but spectacular, from old century buildings to boutique spanish tapas bars and restaurants. Great shopping and fashion , your bound to get lost for days in the small alleys ways of this great natured part of Barcelona
Get lost!. Go and get lost in the gothic quarter, its an absolute labyrinth of narrow streets which open up into court yards with bars and bistros in. Go early though - it is a bit of a maze!

Well worth a visit. This is a great place to walk around during the day with all the little shops explore and architecture to see. Its even better at night when all the little bars and eateries open. Recommended

Always before 9am!!. Beautyful and charming area in the city center, but the amount of tourists is disgusting. To get lost peacefully from one little square to another, enjoying the silence and feeling like an explorer, just plan your visit before 9am. I have been living in this area and it's the only nice and quiet moment of the day. When tourists start swarming and flooding the streets, you will be done and ready for a coffee in a lovely terrace by the Cathedral

For people to enjoy the old clasic Gothic small streets. Staying for 3 days in downtown Barcelona we visited the busy small crowded streets. Small botiques with scarfs or shoes or leather purses are a heaven place for women looking for nice things. And the men can enjoy a cold bear on the coquet terrases looking at the young girls walking. The gotic buildings are so well preserved you believe are a movie scene.
Old town in the center. Old streets typical view, many small gift shops, good restaurants and café, several old cathedrals and people from all the world

The Best. Just the best part of Barcelona.
As simple as that.
Close to the best tapas and bars/restaurants, also a very short (10-12 min) walking distance to the beach and marina.

The best area in barcelona! . The best and my favourite area in barcelona! Its the oldest part of the city full of small narrow streets, gotic style buildings, you gonna travel through the years to go back to the medievo, also you can find a lot of small squares and monuments. Its full of nice charming restaurants and bars in the streets that you will walk through. Definitely the best part of the whole city of barcelona. Enjoy
Cool area of town . Loved this neighborhood. So many cute little shops down these tiny streets. There's some great restaurants too.
Impresive. If you are in Barcelona, it is a must see place. Go and spend some time walking around enjoy the architecture and tiny streets with nice restaurants.

Especially impressive at night. I loved the gothic quarter, especially at night. The narrow streets and the gargoyles create a spooky atmosphere, violinists play haunting music that echoes along the cobbled streets and the cathedral looms large and imposing. very impressive!

Great walking area to explore. Spend some time walking around here, get lost in the winding streets. While walking around here you'll also encounter the Catedral de Barcelona and many restaurants and shops.

You could walk for days. The winding streets of the Gothic Quarter are lined with wonderful restaurants. The Picasso Museum and the Barcelona Cathedral are near and worth a visit, and the beach is a short walk away. Stay in a hotel in this district for a very authentic, old-world Barcelona experience.
Super for wandering. Lots of narrow lanes leading to beautiful squares and impressive buildings. Plenty of shady spots for eating and drinking.
Gothic Quarter. We had a local tour guide take us around the Gothic Quarter narrow streets lovely architecture old church on one side and government agencies on other side easy walk all flat.

Spent most of my time in this area. There are some lovely shops in these little streets and if you keep walking you eventually get to La Rambla. Theres some nice restaurants and bars in the gothic quarter too. The cathedral is worth a visit but ladies need to cover up or you won't be allowed inside. The history museum is also an amzing way to know more about the heritage of the city.

Wander, wander, wander. The Gothic quarter has the most gorgeous buildings, so if you have time in Barcelona, grab a map and get lost in the streets. Stop somewhere for a coffee, or a wine (depending on the time). Wander around the tiny street, explore the churches and chapels, look in the shops and generally lose yourself.

Just wander, it's marvelous.. One of the great joys of our time in Barcelona was starting at the magnificent cathedral, picking a direction and just walking the Barri Gotic - meandering would be more appropriate - with the express intention of getting lost in the wonderful maze of calle and passages. It's easy to do, and it's fun. The architecture, shops, churches, cafes, restaurants, courtyards and the proud displays of Catalan pride, make it irresistible. Take a camera, wear comfortable shoes, and have fun, see if you can find your way back to where you started without GPS!
In another world. Walking in Gothic Quarter, it's like in another world. Love the architectures. Ladies can't get in the church with shorts and tank-tops.

Barcelona . Wonderful. Stayed @ the KK hotel and the service was amazing! Saw Gaudi's magical masterpieces. The restaurants near the KK hotel were perfect for couples or evening family. Perfects vacation.

Absolutely disgusting horrendous place. To say I was shocked at how horrendous this place is, is an understatement. The place is a massive $hit hole. Filthy smelly dirty streets, graffiti everywhere and I mean everywhere. Pickpockets, beggars, even on the beach while trying to relax. Drug dealers and male prostitutes on street corners. Beautiful sea, but a beach full of litter and cigarette ends in the sand and to top it off, I've spent the last few days housebound with a severe bout of diarrhoea from the place, I'm assuming from drinking bottled water. Avoid at all costs. This could be a beautiful place, but it has been destroyed and I would not go back if you paid me.
Unique, well preserved heritage. Consider it as a place radiating ancient tradition, culture and the main reason you will immediately take a liking or even fall in love with Barcelona ...
Beautiful. Gorgeous part of the city, away from trafic, with a stunning church. Bring your camera and look into the small, local shops with all of theis specialities.
Tourist haven. Very scenic and beautiful architecture, beautiful and amazing unique clothing stores and fantastic Jamon and patisseries are abundantly available.

Do not miss it!. You must visit this area if in Barcelona. Some breathe taking architecture and lots of food and drink to suit everyone's taste and budget. If you are looking for cheaper eats and drinks be sure to go down the quiet little side streets.

Stay here on your trip! . Best preserved Gothic Quarter anywhere in the world. And large enough to wander around every night of our 6 day stay, finding different street, shops, restaurants all the time. And all equally fascinating. It is the most colourful and vibrant area I've ever visited. Full of creativity and Catalan culture. We were lucky enough to have booked hotel in Carrer Avinyo, so handy for all parts of quarter. We are already planning our next trip.

Beautiful Area. Such a beautiful and scenic area with so many shops, restaurants and spots to take wonderful photos. Do yourself a favor and spend some time getting lost in all the little streets the Gothic Quarter has to offer.

Get lost in there!. The streets are a time capsule and transform you back to Gaudi's time. The architecture and the environment is unique. You will come across a lot of restaurants and shops and get a true taste of Barcelona!

Just walk around everywhere. So much to see here. Just walk, turn into an alley and get lost in here. There is so much to see from people to architecture to incredible buildings and good food and drink. Don't go in with an agenda, just walk and look there is plenty to take in.

Great location . It was my first trip to Barcelona, and we stayed in the this area. So close to everything..great food, the harbor, Rambles, train stations and overall a hip cool place....it is a perfect location ...

Quaint alleyways and lanes keeps one enthralled.... It was so fun to wander along the back lanes and alleyways of the Gothic Quarter where we stayed during our stay in this beautiful city. Loved the fabulous architecture of the buildings and meandering around. That's how we came to the Plaza Reial for some great eats, fun entertainment. Lovely artistic buys available for those so inclined also!! We will definitely come back here again!!

A "must see" in Barcelona. We had a guide to show us around first. We checked it out after out tapas tour. There was a great street show in front of the cathedral. It wasn't too far from our hotel, although be careful of people telling you it's a short walk there as we had older friends with us and one had a bad knee. But there are plenty of taxis everywhere so you can flag one down if needed. The "tourist" market was neat to see, but the prices were higher than the "locals" market. Very similar to Pike's Place market in Seattle WA.

Narrow streets full of character and people. What a fabulous area in which to go wandering. The streets, actually too narrow to be called streets run at different angles and with many changes of direction. The balconies above almost touch and you walk in deep shadows most of the time. The narrow alleys are interspersed with tiny plazas.It is the perfect place to just wander about for a couple of hours and soak up the atmosphere and then close by near the church of Santa Lucia there is a huge array of restaurants.

Amazing finds all around this area. Lovely culture, amazing shops and the restaurants, so many wee gems to find. Make sure you check out the inside of seemingly small tapas places. Some of them reveal amazing restaurants hidden out the back.
Beautiful. Beautiful things to discover by walk. Lots of museums, gelaterias artesanas, tapas restaurants, bars, shops. Noisy at night.

Enter into another world!. The Gothic quarter is phenomenal! As you enter through the roman gate it's not too hard to imagine how life was hundreds of years ago! Each alley has special places to explore. .take an afternoon and trasport yourself!

Worth exploring. Charming area, although full of tourists, this historical area gives a glimpse of Barcelona's history. It is located off La Rambla, a main artery and tourist attraction. Among other sights is the Major Synagogue and Jewish quarter, at de Marlet 5,off Dominic Street, and close to Gelaaatri Di Marco at Llibreteria 7. Marco is the son of Aldo, for those familiar with gelato in Israel. Ample Street has many bars and restaurants. It's definitely worth exploring.

Gothic tour. A free tour where you pay the tour guide what you feel it was worth. The tour lasted over 2 hours and the guide gave lots of history of the area and made the time go rapidly. Lots of great history about the quarters. Had a marvelous time. Group size was about 18 which was manageable in the narrow streets. Tour was worth a lot!!
Wonderful place!!!. The Gothic Quarter is such a special place, you can see the cathedral and so many places built so long ago that it makes you feel you are still living in medieval times

Amazing wonderful archetecture. Tough to beat this section of town. winding tiny streets with one find after another. little shops and cute restaurants dot this residential neighborhood to make it feel old and young at the same time. Can get overcrowded so pick your times carefully.
Another Gaudi masterpiece. Gaudi's vision was inspired by his religious beliefs. This area is filled with great examples of how his vision is forever reflected in Barcelona's central area.

First visit to barcelona. Ok first, if you don't like touristy areas this would. It be the place for you as it has many shops etc. But it is also old and full of interesting architecture like the Roman aqueduct built into the walls. Be prepared to roam a lot and bump into people! Recommended.

Interesting web of streets. We stayed in a hotel which was situated in the Gothic Quarter, so we were lucky enough to be able to spend some time exploring much of the area. We were also lucky enough to have a fantastic and informative guided tour of some of these streets provided by our hotel. The area was buzzing, especially the Cathedral Square. The area is absolutely fascinating, with loads of ancient and interesting buildings. There are many quirky little shops, bars and restaurants to investigate as well. Keep a camera handy and wear comfortable shoes, you'll need both.
Gorgeous Example of Historic Gothic Architecture. Beautiful inside and out. Definitely worth the stop even if you have visited a ton of churches throughout Europe. A gem!
History and Beauty. Great spot to wander through and get away from the hustle and bustle of la rambles. Little laneways are just amazing and you know each one has a story. This is a must

Get lost in time!!!. I walked around this are for at least 3 hrs. This was one of the best places ever and also the La Bocqueria is not faraway from it. Try the free tour, you will like it. Don't forget to tip your tour guide!!!

Step back in time: Roman structures, Medieval and Renaissance marvels.. Meander through narrow streets of the older parts of the city, and let yourself discover Italian design medieval buildings. The placa in front of the cathedral on Sundays (fall, winter) hosts the Sardana, traditional Catalan dance.

Barri Gotic experience. Barri Gotic is full of streets that are calm and beautiful. There are many shops and places to sit at. Definitely suggest it if you want a calm and relaxing day. Just stroll through the Barri Gotic's streets.
Stunning!. Another beautiful building that has so much detail. There are so many building, monuments etc all around Barcelona that you should take time to look up and admire the buildings.

A hour or two strolling around. A quiet beautiful area of Barcelona full of history and quirks. A must see if in the city. A afternoon that is well spent just walking around the many little alleys that make this quarter what it is.

Rich history. See the remains of a Roman aqueduct built in to the walled city.The Gothic area is full of tourists and some of the best souvenir shops in Barcelona. Wander through the narrow streets. See the bullet holes etched in stone walls from bombings and executions, a reminder of the city's past. Talented licensed buskers entertain the crowds. Stop for tapas at one of the many bars.
Great walking area. You can walk around and never see it all. Quaint streets with shops and restaurants around every corner. Just loved this area. We did two days walking around there exploring.

Really great area to get lost in and find lots of treasures. The whole area is so much fun to stroll around in. You can get lost in all the different alleys. Lots of great places to shop, to eat, to grab a coffee. Many different types of shops. Great people watching. You can be lost in this area for hours.
Very interesting. If you inform yourself about the highlights and monuments in advance, the visit is much more fruitfulCatalonian capital has an incredible history... !!!
Iinteresting. This is a great part of old Barcelono. Very clean with very interesting architecture. This area shows the different architecture in the varying ages.

Beautiful . Great neighbourhood to walk around and stay in whilst in Barca. On the outskirts of the main city centre so is a little quieter with heaps of great bars, cafes and restaurants. Really interesting shopping boutiques around this area too. Fabulous!

Funky neighborhood. Very cool!
Several stuffed streets of funky stores, 5 star hotels, restaurants and many historic buildings.
Walk unhurriedly and enjoy every good thing the neighborhood offers!
Loved exploring. This was our favorite part of Barcelona. We loved exploring the shops and tapas bars during the day and strolling the streets at night. We felt very safe here.

Cute neighbourhood to get lost in. Super cute area with great architecture. Worth checking out and getting lost in. Lots of little stores to pick up souvenirs and little places to stop at to look in. Picasso Museum is in the neighbourhood.

Lots of history here. We stayed here for 3 nights and explored absolutely everywhere around this old town. Check out the hanging hams and why they are hanging!
Check out the night terror tour as well. It will creep you out in the Gothic quarter. Lot's of intrigue and fun facts to find out.
Chill.. Best barrio of Barcelona full of surprises everytime i go. I like to dwell and hangout there. Definiteley you must visit the Church there.
Do Not Miss it!!!!. A must see!!! Absolutely loved it! So mysterious & charming! Lovely bars & restaurants to try out! Will be back!

A sense of old barcelona. From the cathedral to the oldest synagogue in europe a historic fun place to roam. Easy to get confused in with the narroow streets going in all directions. Outdoor cafes to enjoy a coffee or a drink.

Lose yourself for a few hours or a few days. This must truly be the most beautiful part of Barcelona. Lots of narrow alleys dating back hundreds of years, exquisite little shops, restaurants and bars, and plenty of souvenir shops line these streets. Amazing surprises around every corner - markets with everything you could eat or drink, churches more beautiful than the Cathedral or intimate eating places. Make time for this experience - and if possible use one of the guided tours available for this area. We'd recommend Runner Bean but there are many to choose from.
Old and beautiful . We went there not expecting much, but we found lovely quiet streets, with pretty views and architecture pieces.

Something to see around every corner. I loved that there was something unique and new around each corner, down every alley. All you have to do is look up, and pay attention to detail. Such a rich urban landscape!

Cathedral -Old Gothic Quarter. if you don't walk down the las ramblas but the other parallel street you find this hidden treasure and main square, leading side streets running into the Gothic Quarter. For Christians a real place of peace and worship and a must see place.
Beautiful. Beautiful place. Lost of things to see, do, eat and drink. Lots of nice quirky little shops. I would definitely recommend!

Interesting area with a wide choice of restaurants. It repays the time spent wandering around. There are many interesting street scenes, eateries and attractions. I find it slightly off putting to occasional smell the drains. Just wander about and see the sights.
Best things in life are for free. Amazing architecture, stunning climate and breathtaking views. Great for walking and taking pictures. Definite must see in Barcelona!

A walk through bygone days. The Gothic Quarter is the centre of the old city and so named because it used to be a Roman village & thus has some remnants of its glorious past. The area dates from the medieval times and features winding, cobblestoned, & narrow laneways with surprises at each bend, and impressive architecture along the way. There are numerous shops, cafes and restaurants throughout the area dotted with medieval buildings amongst the more modern ones. One of the main attractions in the Gothic Quarter is the cathedral with its stunning courtyard and its tasteful interior. Take a relaxing stroll and simply immerse yourself in this beautiful part of Barcelona.
Love this area!. Great place to just walk around and get lost! Find a musician at a quaint square and stop to listen to him bc you'll probably never find him again (as we learned) ;)

Very interesting place. I was there last week, didn't have time to go inside but for sure will check it out next time! The outside of Barri Gotic is really pretty and looks really interesting. This place is so nice too because it's so close to alot of interesting restaurants and stores nearby.

Beautiful area of Barcelona. This in an incredible part of Barcelona. Narrow winding streets and incredible architecture! Numerous shops as well as cafes and restaurants which are better than those found in the more "touristy" places. Highly recommended.
Nice to visit. Great architecture and places to see. But very touristy. Don't bother to eat there...locals don't seem to!

Great area to get lost!. Nice area in the heart of Barcelona, full of history, amaizing monuments, the cathedral as many others. Good restaurants and areas for sopping! Crowed all the time, was there during the morning, midday and afternoon! Safe and lots of helpful people for guidance.

Amazing architecture and more. We spent the day before ort cruise in the Gothic Quarter of Barcelona. Beautiful buildings with flower covered balconies, narrow cobblestone streets and lots of quaint shops. Surprisingly clean streets and us 3 women felt very safe. Plenty of little street cafes and markets. A great place to visit, enjoy some tapas and a large jug of sangria!
Get lost and walk around!. It's a maze of old Barcelona barrio. Buildings are so interesting and unique. We came across some old (1st century B.C) Roman structure. Really quaint.

Hidden gem . I had dinner in one of the restaurants in the gothic quarter, there is plenty of stand selling all crafts and loads of entertainment at night.... Easy to miss this as its hidden off a side street

Enjoyed this area. While on a walking tour of this area we got to know a lot more of the older barcelona and appreciated the stunning architecture and the stories behind this fascinating old part of the city.
Plenty of restaurants and bars and a good vibe.

Another Stunning Part of Barcelona. Narrow walks with old buildings with all the newness of cafes and restaurants. Truly off beaten track is where you want to be. Prices are lower for food when you get off la rambles and this area is a dream. More nestled of all the area I visited. Spend time in the Gothic, you won't regret it.

Beautiful architecture, narrow side streets and history.. A great stroll through the narrow alleyways, cobblestone streets and view of the various buildings, architecture of the Gothic quarter - a difference from the more modernistic approach of many of Barcelona's architecture. Note on the Barcelona cathedral - no shorts or sleeveless tops allowed inside. So bring a shawl and/or wear short sleeves if planning to visit.

Great Experience. For anyone who enjoys history, this is a must. It is so cool to be able to experience what it was like to walk around Barcelona way back when. I love how the streets are so narrow and everything is so close together and old.This was one of my better experiences here because it's impossible to find things this old back home. We took several hours on our own to just walk around and get lost in the area. We saw so many little restaurants and boutique shops. Along with old residential buildings. Later in the week we took a guided tour of the area and the mystique was not lost the second time. It's like each time you check the area out, you discover something new.I recommend you just meander around and experience the district for yourself. You'll immediately feel the attraction.

Fun !. This area of bcn is an absolute must !Quaint , unique and it's a maze! Don't just walk north-south. Let yourself wonder around the small streets and you'll find incredible restaurants , shops and beautiful architecture !

Loved the Barri Gotic!!!. First, I stayed there for a week or so, so I got an inside scoop of what's really like to live at El Barrio Gotico while in Spain. I loved it!! You can easily get lost while roaming its streets and that's only part of all the fun. The locals are really nice and very helpful if you need directions or tips on where to go. The local food is good, cheap and amazingly tasty! Playa Barceloneta is nearby and you can go there without using the Metro, just grab a bottle of water and take a walk! Make sure to get some Paella at any restaurant!! Amazing!! Also, know how to get to La Rambla, there the nightlife is always fun and easy-going. Getting to know the Metro system will help you get around easier around Barcelona, just download the metro app and you are good to go!!
Mysterious. Very climatic, reminded me a bit of Diagon Alley from Harry Potter, very narrow, small streets, decorated with flowers on the balconies. Another must-see!

STUNNING!. A must visit...This is original Barceolna. The tiny streets leading to big squares. History is all around you. The buildings and streets are a work of art themselves. Shops are all around , if you want to buy souvenirs, the shops there offer less price for the same items sold for double the price at Las Ramblas. Also, if you get more than one item , you have to bargain.

Beautiful part of beautiful city. Really nice quarter. Full of great small tapas bars, small shops, the time has stops there. That's the Barcelona at its best. You can see everything on foot and feel the city beat.

Great neighborhood. Dark, gotic and yet so beautiful.It will take at least half a day to see everything, but it is definitely well spendable.Sugestion: Book a free walking tour with the Sandemans guys and you'll see the best parts and also good histories.

Fun place to roam around. My friend and I happened upon this lively area on a Friday night and we were not disappointed! Lots of restaurants, shops and people watching. It was fun to meander around the maze of streets and drop into whatever place caught our fancy. If you love feeling the energy of an area and do a little people watching, this is the place to be!

Gothic Quarter full of atmosphere!. Enjoyed wandering the narrow streets and imagining the history that took place in this area of Barcelona. Full of atmosphere yet we didn't feel uneasy. The little stores and restaurants are full of friendly people and very inviting. Start from Placa de Catalunya and wander down Avinguda del Portal de L'Angel and just wander off into the side streets. Great place to while away your time. We stopped in Placa Reial and there were a group of young men who were performing acrobatics - incredible performance on the spur of the moment! A great area to wander around away from the intensity of La Rambla.

Very interesting for people who search for culture. I loved this place as it puts us in the mood of old times and the vanishing European old culture. Unfortunately, All Barcelona streets are modern, so when going to the Gothic quarter u go back to the genuine culture.

A very lively place. After being here one week, I would definitely stay here again on my next visit to Barcelona. It is a lively quarter, with many winding narrow streets crisscrossing crazily (orienting is not easy) and few large avenues (the Ramblas foremost). Lots of highlights to see, with some Gaudi' masterpieces (Güell's palace) and churches and cathedrals and museums; thousands of bars and restaurants catering to a very lively crowd, theatres, shops and what not! Not far by metro from anything of interest in Barcelona, when you are tired of crowd and want to get some beach time just take a train from the Lyceum metro station in the middle of the Ramblas. Same for visiting other Gaudi's masterpieces, few stops from Lyceum and you are there. But the feel of the place is too nice by itself. There are many hotels too, and at reasonable prices.
Bring your walking shoes. Fantastic area to explore and get lost in. Be sure to go in the morning when weather is cooler and not so crowded

My favourite place to hang in Barcelona city. The gothic quarter is just a sensory masterpiece! The architecture all of the oldest of pretty much everything is here! Visit the ancient ruins hidden under the city centre! And the Saint Maria cathedral (it's creepy but do it!) The people are lovely it helps to know a bit of Spanish though, The shops, heaps of stuff to buy! Great art and book stores to hidden around! The food! GELATO!!! You must try the gelato! And churros (Spanish donut) with a pot of melted chocolate! To.die.for! Of course tapas too! Warning: food with never be the same once you have visited Spain! If your in Barcelona your missing out if you don't come here... That's all :)

Wonderful. Book a guided tour to get the most from your visit, this is a magical city
Free entry in the mornings, there is a fee in the afternoons

Popular tourist area. The Gothic Quarter is a very popular area with visitors and houses some of Barcelona's main attractions, eg, the Cathedral. The narrow streets with delightful buildings provide an excellent atmosphere, with the area bustling with visitors and locals going about their day-to-day activities. There are many cafes, restaurants and shops although we found the area around the cathedral as being the busiest. A great place to spend half a day or so while soaking up some of the history of Barcelona.
Interesting. With its narrow alleys and old buildings, it is an interesting place to walk around with some nice churches and small shops dotted around.

Perfect place . My favourite placeTo Visit both on the afternoon and evening. Full restaurants and good entertainment. Extremely safe and gives a very cultured and warmFeel to the city . Favourite place in Barcelona
Sightseeing . Excellent restaurants make your way to the royal square where they have entertainment. There was a young girl who has the most amazing voice. Sent shivers.down my spine

interesting streets and architecture. narrow, cobbles streets with pretty buildings and nice shops and restaurants. Weren't staying long enough to fully explore so next time would go n a walking tour to find out a little more information about the area

Used the Rick Steves App. Rick Steves, the best European tour company, has a free app where you can download various audio streams relating to Europe. We downloaded his audio tour if this area. It was like having a personal guide for free.
Hello, history!. Lots of old buildings, beautiful people with attitude plus shopping. What could possibly be better? Food perhaps, but that's close.

Small area around Cathedral Barcelona. . Can be walked through in 30 minutes. It consists of narrow streets and old buildings, and museums, Nice walk and exercise Its small area surrounding the cathedral.C U AROUND.

Meander and discover. Brilliant for walking around and soaking up the atmosphere. Beautiful architecture, good shops and restaurants, loads of touristic stuff and some excellent boutique designers. Happy Days :)
Nice cathedral, too crowded.. This Cathedral was lovely but there was too many people everywhere so we just did not bother to go inside.

Gothic amazing!. Just loved my stay! We stayed in a rented apartment very very close to the gothic quarters. Easy access, vibes were amazing as were the tapas - worth a stroll ... Everything about that area was just amazing.
Great historical area to this fun city. We really enjoyed a walking tour of the gothic quarter and learned so much about the history of Barcelona. This was our favorite part of the city!

A walk to remember thru the history of Barcelona. Be prepared to put some mileage on your walking shoes as you tour this section of the city. Easily accessed from Plaza Cataluña (major stop on Metro), there is much to see; beautiful old architecture, restaurants, shops, etc. Keep in mind that may people actually live in these buildings so tourists are mixed with locals throughout. We did our own tour but did see many small groups being led by a local tour guide who could provide deeper knowledge - would have done that had we known ahead of time. Allow at least 1/2 to 3/4 of a day to do this area justice.
A must see. We walked with no destination and had a perfect night, everything is nice to see, there is a lot to visit and take pictures.

Pretty area- good for walking. We took a walking tour through this area. There are tons of beautiful sights to see. I recommend wandering through the narrow streets and exploring the little courtyards and shops everwhere. The cathedral is beautiful- don't miss it.
Very interesting. This was much more interesting than Las Ramblas with quaint buildings on cobbled streets, narrow alleyways and a square to sit and watch the world go by.

A maze of beautiful architectural adventure . Walking around the gothic quarter, feels like a movie set of historic building! Little bits of Harry Potter and magical Disney palaces... The place is a maze of wonder, every building looks like it has a story behind and the buzz of the people just add to the mystic power of the place. A must visit.

Dani with free walking tour was great!. My boyfriend and I went on a free walking tour today with a tour guide named Dani. We just happened to stumble upon her in front of La Catedral with a big blue umbrella saying "free tours" so we figured why not! It was a great decision and worth the 2 1/2 hours we devoted to it. Dani had a great energy, was quirky in a lovely congenial way and she was really helpful with directions and city suggestions at the end of the tour. Her tour is totally free, but we (along with most others in the tour group) did give her donations because it was worth it.

We love it. If you like walking,than you have to go to this area...Buildings,streets,restaurants, pubs etc..Theres everything...Ots nice for a walk with everybody( I was with 9 year daughter) ...You can sit anywhere and just look what's going on,almost on every corner there's musician, they're playing great so its nice to listen bit longer, you can find there many hidden beautiful places...

Spent a lot of Time Here During My Vacation. Awesome area! Tons of shops, places to eat/drink, outdoor and indoor people watching as well! We also enjoyed the quaint/mysterious small alleys and streets throughout this area. Every time we turned the corner it was a new adventure. My friend commented she felt like we were in the movies several times as we strolled.
The place to be. The company chose a hotel in this location and for good reason.. it is very central and very accessible. The neighborhood is very interesting and love mingling with the local..

amazing. great area to walk around although difficult to navigate !
Stunning sights, quite safe and lots of interesting quirky and independent shops

Must see!. The gothic quarter offers amazing buildings to wind through and small cafes and shops to browse in. They don't stand out from the beautiful buildings but tuck themselves away to allow the buildings to take centre stage.
wander around for a few hours. Wandering around this area is very interesting, checking out what's around the corner, another alley with wonderful fronts, doors, wee shops etc

Even better at night. Gothic neighborhood looks much nicer after sunset. Best area for drinks and food.
Near cathedral at night you will always find a musician playing guitar, it's sounds magnificent because of amazing acoustic at this place.

History Preserved. Very interesting district, many historic buildings to be viewed and appreciated with time in hand.Don't rush this area but take a stroll through all the little alleys and lanes and find very interesting history, architecture, museums and a wealth of Catalonia's rich past.
A good comfortable pair of footwear highly recommended.
A must see area when visiting Barcelona. The Gothis quarter is full of narrow cobbled streets and interseting buildings. The old cathedral is in this area, also worth a visit

Great part of the city. We went here a couple of times for a wander and to eat. Lots of shops and restaurants of all types. A good place to do all sorts of things, there are museums and other attractions so definitely go there.
Good walk. Walk through this area to see the very old buildings, some with gargoyle carvings. There are also several restaurants and tapas bars. Very short walk to the La Rambla area.
Wander all day . . .. It's fun to wander through the narrow streets (though easy to get lost in them!). Worth having a guide to explain the history of the quarter.

Beautiful!. When I was booking my ticket, I discovered that the tour + miniconcert had a student discount, so that sweetened the pot. I'm really glad I decided to book the miniconcert version of the tour.

Genuine Mediterranean experience. We loved wandering the streets of the Barri Gotic, look up and you might see a sculpture on the window balcony above you. Around the next corner might be a beautiful cathedral, or a square with outdoor dining. Spend a few hours here just exploring without an agenda. Its magnificent.

Best part of barcelona. We loved the Gothic quarter. We attended both restaurants, clubs, and site seeing. Very interesting place and can find plenty of places to eat, drink, or shop. Not far from the beach either if you decide to continue a day in the city.
Dirty, smelly and full of excitement . Don't let the stinky drains, graffiti and dirt put you off. The Gothic quarter is edgy, interesting and different. Go for a wander!

Awesome place to walk, dine and explore. This was the one place where we went to every single day to walk around and hang out. The place is very lively with lots of people walking around, street performers doing their act and plenty of dining and shopping options. Very nice architecture and old buildings it seems like you are walking back in time. Narrow cobbled streets give it a unique feel.
Lovely stroll. This is a great place to get a feel for the great architecture of Barcelona, its just beautiful wandering around and appreciating the history, stunning! Loved it here.

Great history . Gorgeous part of the city to be in and should be viewed as part of a walking tour to add a historical slant on the lovely architecture. Found some of the restaurants to be overly expensive here however.
Amazing. Great architecture inside and out. Less crowded than Gaudi's and free depending on the time of day. Before 1pm and after 5:45pm
The true spirit of Barcelona. I visited all areas of Barcelona, and I can tell this is the most genuine area of the city. Small roads and paths, a lot of small cafes and resaturants
Very interesting to walk around. Great place to get away from Las Rambla. Sure it can still be busy and crowded but I love walking around here, grabbing a coffee or just people watching.

Wonderfull. Its a wonderfull part of Barcelona making you live the history again. It was a pleasure to get lost in there ruelles and to find in every one an estonishing decorated building. Also the very old churches are wonderfull

Nice area to visit and to stay in. Stayed at Hotel Regencia Colon in the Gothic Quarter near the cathedral. This is a very busy area. Short walk to get on the Hop on/Hop off bus and to La Rambla. Short walk to restaurants and shops. You won't be disappointed.

Perfect to explore when you don't have a clear plan. This is one of my favourite areas in Barcelona. Just walking through the Gothic Quarter is an activity on its own. There are so many narrow streets and gems to discover. We also ate supper at a restaurant in Placa Reial one night and the atmosphere was very special.
Went here for dinner and drinks. Seems a lot safer and classier than La Rambla! It was a lovely atmosphere and you could stumble from bar to bar. We went back two nights in a row!
Good. Good time to spend here. Very good atmosphere. Specially in the evening. it is very lively.I like it a lot
One of my favourite parts of the city. I love walking through the streets of the Gothic quarter. It's so lively and you never now what you will see on your next turn. Beautiful for photos!
Last day in Barcelona. We went on a Sunday and it was beautiful. Be careful of the beggars outside. There is security making sure you're dressed respectfully before you enter on (Sunday).

Worth Walking Around. We walked through the Gothic Quarter during a guided tour we purchased via Viator. There were many beautiful churches and other old buildings. These provide wonderful examples of Medieval architecture. It is worth walking around just to find the unique buildings around every corner.

Fun to wander and get lost. A great area to spend several hours wandering, getting lost, shopping and just enjoying the architecture. A must see on a trip to Barcelona. Wear long sleeves and long pants/dress so you can get into the religious buildings, we didn't and missed out.

Beautiful architecture!. Prepare to walk and possibly get lost. The Gothic Quarter is somewhat like a maze, filled with amazing restaurants and shops located in the alleys. Makes you feel like you are in a different world, during a different time. Highly recommend visiting.

A chance to see Roman/Medieval Barcelona. We have loved Barcelona, its wide boulevards and fabulous Modernistic buildings, but wanted to see something of the ancient city. The Barri Gotic has that, mostly hidden away down side alleys. Some Roman gates and columns, a medieval square where Columbus came back to show his "Indians" to the Queen and King, and a hint of the old Jewish quarter.
a nice walk. so much history! have a good guide book or do a tour to soak it all in. its very interesting and worth wandering around.

Amazing. Such an amazing part of this great city. It has endless streets and alleys with lanes branching off to more, you will get lost in the history of this place...the church is a must see for the views alone
Picturesque old barrio off las Ramblas. The old picturesque bohemian part of the city, off las Ramblas. Narrow cobblestone streets, lovely outdoor chafes and shops, charming old buildings

Following the Spanish civil war. We spent our time following places that were used in the Spanish civil war and by the Nazis. Incredible place and so many places to visit and find all kinds of different surprises. Incredible!

Must visit for history lovers. A must visit but highly recommend you go early in the day. Do not visit at night as you will find that it can be a hive of activity for pickpockets and beggars. Visit the Cathedral but highly recommend going early as later in the day incurs a charge. he winding streets and old shops/cafes are enchanting but do please, please watch who approaches you. If you scream 'tourist' you are more than likely to be approached by vagrants. As the local tourist office with tell you quite directly these people are often dishonest and after distracting you while an accomplace cleans youi out. Just say 'no' firmly otherwise they will continue to pester you!
Big g . A beautifull area in barcelona we were there on a sunday morning and it was perfect not to crowded .the cathedral is stunning and free to enter

A maze of hidden streets. . A maze of quant streets filled with small shops, restaurants and bars. If you are one to get easily lost take a map. Allow a couple of hours just walking around to take in the sights and explore.

Do the Free Walking Tour then explore on your own. Very small area but lots of history. Free Walking Tour is good first stop, then explore more on your own. One visit will be sufficient and only need a few hours.
Nice walk. Nice area to walk around very close knit streets and lots of little independent shops to visit too. Also a nice church is here so worth a visit.

Amazing!!!. This is such a unique place. It's everything you dream about for a holiday in a European city. You can literally feel the history coming out of the walls around you. You have to visit the Gothic Quarter!!!!!

The other Barcelona. I liked walking in this area better than the new parts of the city. It is like the other face of the city. It has the history, the Gothic buildings, the narrow streets. If you go to Barcelona, apart from the new and modern, go to the old city, especially if you are a history lover.
Fun Area!. The Gothic Quarter was one of my favorite areas in the city. Lots of shopping, small streets great for pictures, good restaurants, and more!
Sighting . You must go and see the gothic quarters , very impressive , there are so many different buildings to see and you would be amazed
Place to be! My favorite part of Barcelona . I love the small streets with all the different shop and little restaurants. It's near Placa Reial and has lots cocktailbars in the neighbourhood.
Plenty to see.. Many little alleyways which have many shops and plenty to eat. The cathedral is amazing. I would also recommend walking around the whole area.

Were staying here. Really great location full of interesting architecture and great restaurants. It can get busy and the best restaurants should be booked in advance. Lots to see and lane ways to wander thru. Very safe

Great place to travel!. Beautiful little streets and avn's, but the main beauty is the kathedral inside the gothic quarter.
Stunning creation and unbelieveabele struction.
A little recommendation from my own mistake-if you want to get inside, dressed respectable, no undershirts and no short dresses cause you want be allowed to get in.

Great adventure . Gothic Quarter is a neighborhood where you should definitely visit while being in Barcelona! The place is like a labyrinth of narrows with shopping places, churches, cafeterias and many other things. I recommend that you visit Gothic Quarter during morning hours because at night it might get a little bit dangerous(local tip). If you like wandering and discovering don't use the map and let the adventure begin!

It's very nice. We stayed in the Gothic Quarter. It is very nice, the walks, the buildings, the narrow street, everything is nice. The walks that leads you to a lovely square where performers do there trick's and I do mean their trick's, so be careful... Gaudi designed one of the building in the Gothic Quarter...

Out of a movie set. Great experience! There are many restaurants, awesome boutiques, souvenir shops and pretty impressive buildings like the Roman towers, Barcelona cathedral an Santa Maria de Pi church.

In the middle of it all... Staying at the heart of the Gothic Quarter, was the best choice for the real flavour of Barcelona. Coming for a small village in the French countryside to a town like Barcelona is a bit of a culture shock, but being intrepid travellers well worth the transition. Vibrant, alive and full of passion.....easy to feel how it might have been in the middle centuries.... street sellers, musicians, and everything within walking distance. An experience of life at full volume ;)

Amazing. Wandering around the many quaint streets it is hard not to be amazed at how wonderful it is here. The Cathedral is well worth a visit but be sure to arrive able to cover up. So many other stunning court yards and unique little shops. Loved it!

Excellent place to stay. We stayed with my wife in the lower part of the gothic quarter, and it turned out to be the best! We have the gothic quarter, Barceloneta, the port area plus las ramblas a couple of minutes away! With that, possibilities are endless.Highly recommended!!

Everything great about Barcelona.. Reading about the Gothic Quarter in guide books may make you think twice about visiting, but our experience was one of incredible delight. There are numerous restaurants, awesome boutiques, souvenir shops and plenty of historical buildings.

Only place to stay in barca. If u r going to Barcelona u must stay in the gothic quarter. Great boutique hotels. We stayed at hotel neri. Awesome. Walking distance to everything. Born for shopping. The gaudi houses and sagrada familia.

Best Place in Barcelona. The Barrio Gótico is a magical and romantic place which every travler must see if in Barcelona. The narrow streets, the street artists, the large crowds sworming through everything is very cool I recomend doing it in the afternoon. Clothing shops, bars, trinklet shops, souveniers are at every corner. Don't forget to see the market.I
Lovely cathedral . This place is stunning and we'll worth a look it's also really nice to site out side and watch the world go by.
beautiful . beautiful building historic sight in barcelona worth the price we paid defo worth a visit if you are in town
Gorgeous!. Really lovely area of Barcelona - amazing architecture, really interesting shops and just a really great place to spend an afternoon wandering around.

Watch Where You Walk. Very interesting city with plenty to see. Very crowded this time of year. We followed some of the published walking tours and detoured off a few streets...this can take you from populated, safe streets to very sketchy ones in a matter of a block. Not saying it is crime-filled but you definitely need to be careful, esoecially at night. Also, mind where you step...fair amount if dog feces around as the owners don't pick up after them. All said, it's an interesting area to tour with plenty to see and good places to eat.

Nice place to walk and fin. You can either walk through and enjoy the nice view of the gargoyles or stop in a nice bar around the neighbourhood and take some tapas.Dont miss a visit to the catedral. Just be aware of pin pocket.

Beautiful!. This area really is the place to be while in Barcelona. While there are many sights to visit in the city, simply staying in a hotel somewhere in the Gothis quarter gives on the chance to spend an inordinate amount of time walking, eating, shopping, clubbing al within a 2-3 km radius.

Nice shops, restaurants... Center of Barcelona. Our hotel was here, and we walked around the neighborhood a lot.We felt safe and home. You can find nice shops, fine restaurants and Tapas places. Very beautiful and old buildings. Lovely

Great in the afternoon after siesta . So many great places to eat and really cool shops. Wish we had stayed in this area. Can be a little dodgey once the shops close down and we were offered drugs multiple times. Streets and architecture have a lot of character.

Gothic Quarter, a Must. Our visit to the Gothic Quarter was a real eye opener to some of the history of Barcelona, the Catalan people and Spain itself. There are few cars but many bicycles and scooters. This is easily off set by even more bars, Tapas venues and amazing historic buildings that just reek of events gone by.

Beautiful, a must in Barcelona. The old walled part of town is beautiful. Is full of music, street artist, the cathedral, museums, and lots of restaurants. Lots of the restaurants are for tourist and overpriced, you pay for the location and ambiance. Take your time to walk around the streets, have a beer, a coffee and some pastries.

A must do. the Barrio Gótico is without a doubt my favorite place in Barcelona, it allows you to visit the history of a wonderful town, meet random places you weren't expecting to see or find (like a rubber ducky shop) and all in all, fall in love with this side of town

A great place to wonder around. The Gothic Quarter is one of my favorite places in Barcelona. It's magical!! Full of History, its narrow roads with tall old buildings abrace you at every corner.Lots of shops, cafes and cool restaurants it's full of hidden tiny squares and places.You will get lost and fund all the time, for sure!

The Church was very nice. I entered the church and was stunned by the very gothic view. It was also so holy and i could feel a warmth in my heart for being so blessed. I was a very nice experience being in this church.
So pretty. So much to see and so many pretty little streets to explore with cafes, bars and lovely clothes shops. The cathedral is beautiful!

Buzzing with tourists . Lovely quant part of the old city of Barcelona. It's an amazingly lively part of the city with history, shopping, bars and restaurants. Extremely touristy and must do!! The cathedral is gorgeous and one can spend a whole day or two exploring this area by foot and soak in the spirit of Spain.. While there, a flamenco dance performance is a must watch!!

Must visit. Wow.. a neighborhood in a big city with little to no cars! Suggestions: 4 Gatos, Bodega Birritz 1900, and Pulperia Celta to eat..Of course.. the cathedral to visit.. and just walk around and enjoy this history!Dont forget to visit El Born next door!And

So much history and character on these streets!. This was one of my favorite parts of Barcelona, we were lucky to go there with locals who knew a lot about the history around this neighborhood. Take a few hours and walk around all the lovely narrow streets, look up to check out some gargoyles, be entertained by street performers, check out the shops and have some delicious paella at La Fonda. It is a half day activity and highly recommend taking a good camera!

Walked, ate and shopped ... perfect way to spend a vacation!. We all loved the Gothic Quarter. The energy and vibrancy of this part of Barcelona was infectious. My spouse and I walked 8-10 miles each day (and we were celebrating my 60th birthday) and our sons walked 15-20. At each turn there was something new and special to see and experience.
