Great area to walk, shop and eat. The Gothic area is one of my favorite in Barcelona. There is a ton to see and it is fun to walk around the shaded alley ways in a old city on a hot day. Don't be afraid to take an alley and explore where it ends up.
Daytime walk. Loved walking through the gothic quarter and stopping at a few cafes and bars along the way. I highly recommend stopping through here during the day time hours!
Gothic Indeed. The Gothic quarters is truly a wonderful place to visit to see beautiful architecture as you wander along narrow maze of streets.
Shopping . Lots and lots of shops mixed with gothic buildings and a bit of gaudi. There are big brands and local crafts next to each other.
Wonderful. Walking around the Gothic Quarters felt almost surreal. The architecture is like nothing I have ever seen. Beautiful shops and art gallery's.

Great place to get lost!. We wandered through the lanes and alleyways of this exciting place, full of old buildings, restaurants, interesting shops and historic landmarks and enjoyed it all. There's so much to experience!
lovely place. beautiful place to spend some time strolling around.lots of cafes and restaurants around.not to be missed
Great. Very nice city quarter. Old, stylish with beautiful streets. Lots of cafes. Great place to go for a walk and take some pictures
Meandering streets. You could easily get lost in the alleys & streets but you were never far away from one of the main streets. Turn a corner and you came across something different. Love this area

Barcelona at it's best. Best (free) part of Barcelona. Beautiful narrow medieval streets next to the much overrated Rambla de Catalunya. A must visit for anyone spending more than two hours in Barcelona.
Very charming and intriguing place. Only in Europe can you walk in such narrow streets :) We loved the charming neighborhood. The church is spectacular from the outside, but we did not go in.
didn't like it. didnt like the dangerous area around. borne its close by and seems safer. no one touched us but many people came close by to sell us things

Have a Tapas+Rosé after the tour, you'll need it after too much culture. . I don't know if it's the heat, or bc scent rises, but all of a sudden during a self guided walking tour I would get a whiff of sewer stench or a body B.O. Then I would smell fried calamari (This is true in entire Barcelona ) Smells of the town aside, it's a chuck full of things to see. Must see the Cat4 restaurant where Picasso used to hang out. Gave me goose pumps thinking I'm standing where Picasso stood. I couldn't get into the church bc I had on shorts n tank top. The church was pretty good from outside though. Surprised it was free to get in the church. I couldn't get into Picasso museum also tkts must be bought online in advance if I want to go in. so I went to the souvenir store n got some nice Picasso reprints. It takes about 2 hours to walk through all the areas. I was touring w a slow walker so I finished the tour w nice tapas n rosé.

Gothic Quarter. The Gothic Quarter of Barcelona, is one of the nicest places to visit on the old side of the City, where you can find all ind of Museus like Picasso, Churches like Santa Maria del Mar, , little streets plenty of Bars/Restaurants , and also near the Borne Museum where the antiche Romans rests have been found and restored since some year agoA place you cannot miss at Barcelona to visit walking

Medieval town . I will always prefer to stay nearby whenever I visit barcelona again. This place is buzzing even in the night. There are various beautiful old buildings with ancient spanish architecture. The cathedral is also located in the gothic quarter which is worth a visit. There are many narrow lanes which can only be reached by foot or on the cycle. Placa reil is one of the many squares filled with cafes and restaurants. I did a cycle tour with my son and really enjoyed it. In the nights you can hop from one bar to another because they all are so good and lively. Its a little touristy but then even you are one. Please have a burger at BACAO after you finish with the bars. This place is opened till 2 am and believe me there are queues even at that hour for grabbing a burger. Overall a great district for shopping, entertainment and its gothic feel.
Wander through the alleyways . Sit and soak up the sounds and views at a pavement bar and get lost wandering around the tight alleyways

Time travel. Old Town dates back to Roman times before Christ was born. Time travel thru ancient aquaducts, gates, walls and streets. Then buildings from 12th century onwards. Facades are not supposed to be destroyed.Lots of cafes, grocery and souvenir shops in area.

The true flavour of a European medieval town. Gothic still offers the ambiance of an old medieval city without being too touristy. There is something for everybody from culture over history to food and drinks.Just like the city originated from the Gothic area, this is a good place to start your city trip.
Lots of interesting shops and buildings. The whole area is worth a stroll as there are so many interesting buildings and shops, (independent and chains)The whole of Barcelona is amazing!

Just walk take your time and just walk. What a beautiful place to just walk around no set path no set direction no time limits its magnificent place to stumble apon buskers great sights shops churches basilicas and the true beauty of Barcelona.yoi could 3alk fof a week and not yake it all in i truely love this place.
Fascinating area. Well worth spending time walking around the historical streets and soaking up the atmosphere Street musicians and theatre add to the atmosphere

Interesting streets to stroll and view buildings. We walked all over the area and enjoyed the unique buildings from top to bottom. Could take 1000's of photos. The restaurants are a bit overpriced so suggest to do research on tripadvisor before wasting time and money going to any. Also watch your belongings as we were witness to 2 pick-pocketing.

Tour with New Barcelona Tours. Visited the Gothic quarters with Filipa from New Barcelona Tours...one of the best decisions...she was extremely knowledgeable, funny, well versed with the area, fluent in english...it was a pleasure ...would definitely recommend everyone to take this tour n ask for Filipa is possible.

Worth the wait!. Every great city almost certainly has to have a great cathedral...and Barcelona's is no exception...it has to be seen to be believed...similar in scale and mass to that in Palma, the contrast from the bustling city to the quite solitude, the cool interiors, the hidden catacombs and just incredible splendour, make it a journey worth taking...if to simply get out of the mid day sun!Next to the main entrance is the new Dali museum.. another must see...

Worth seeing but not absolute highlight of Barcelona. This quarter is definitely worth seeing and it is hard to avoid indeed, as it is very large. However, it is not the absolute highlight in Barcelona: the absolute highlights are the Miro Museum and Sagrada Familia.

Best barrio in Barcelona. Great place to walk through--architecture, historical monuments (eternal flame), Cathedral (Catedral Santa Maria del Mar), museums (Picasso, Chocolate, etc), restaurants (Los Caracoles!), shops, street art, etc. Ramble around and discover a new treasure or ten.

Join the herds!. Beautiful place to visit in one of those rare occasions in which winter is hard and it actually snows in Barcelona so that there's no one around. In any other occasion (unless you wake up really early) you're bound to be trapped among thousands of other tourists all willing to enjoy the beautiful city and ruining the whole experience by their sheer numbers. It happened in Venice and it's coming to Barcelona. The kind of success that becomes the ruin of a place. Ah, and after you're done with the stroll don't forget to visit some American coffee chain, to promote local businesses and feel like if you were in Dakota.
Great!. Everywhere you turn there are amazing buildings & churches!You go around looking up, opened mouthed!!
Incredible architecture. Well worth a walk through this area to see the ornate architecture. We got there by hoho bus, but one can catch the metro easily.

Amazing area to wander around. Take a stroll round here, it's full of interesting shops, authentic restaurants, amazing architecture and historical buildings. Lots of narrow streets to get lost in and lots of hidden gems to discover. My favourite part of Barcelona!
read the story behind. its really important to learn who is Santa Euleiula(I misspelled probably jeje) and the story of the building, how was is before and compare with gothic architecture.

Barri Gotic a must see, free attraction!. Get lost in the narrow streets, the colorful small stores and feel the vibes of this old neighborhood! Spend at least a couple of hours to wonder around, trying to discover the hidden corners and spots that will make you love more this city. Look up high into the sky, the balconies, the graffities, the signs at the streets... In Barri Gotic you can find cafes, restaurants for a menu del dia, tapas, cervezas (beer), touristic shops (the pills shop, the ducks shop, with paintings, with handcrafted things, pretty much everything). Even if you won't visit the interior, the Cathedral and the rest of the churches in the area, combined with the museums located in the area, make Barri Gotic a must in your bucket list. You can reach the area on foot from various metro stations and bus stops.
Like you're in the game of thrones. Beautiful place, music echoing the pathways, there are a lot of good restaurants too. you sort of expect kaleesi and her dragons to show up :P
Very pretty . There is no much to say, is it?It's what it is, a lovely area full of life and amazing architecture.

Heart of Barcelona, a walkers paradise. The best part of Barcelona is just walking in the Barri Gotic area, any hour of the day.You can walk the same block in the morning , in the afternoon and at night and each time it will look and feel different. Cobble stone streets overflowing with people, food and life. History, charm, food, all intertwined in an architectural maze that will surely get you lost but you won't care. Find a good square, and sit at a table and enjoy some tapas and people watching at its best. A melting pot of world visitors enjoying this centuries of friendly city.
Tour of Gothic Quarter. Do not miss taking a guided tour of the Gothic Quarter. So many beautiful buildings to see and the history' associated with the area.

Get lost in Gothic Architecture. In Barcelona, one of the best things to do is to walk around the Gothic quarter and explore the small streets and all they have to offer. I found myself very interested in the sights and sounds of the Gothic Quarter,
lots of history here. I used a bust tour, then walked around once I felt familiar. Very interesting history and culture. Good shops and little places to eat. The streets can be confusing.

A worthwhile amble. Worth stepping aside from the main haul of Las Ramblas into the altogether more interesting streets and alleys of The Gothic Quarter. Look up and around as you wander to see the great variety of styles in buildings and architecture.

Hidden gem. It wasn't until the day of departure that we discovered this gem. It was next to the hotel. The layout of the streets are narrow and tower above the floor below, this obviously at night meant that we were too cautious to fully stray off the main populated areas.In the daylight however the narrow streets brought a glimpse of maybe the real Barcelona. Small squares with restaurants and shops, well worth a trip.
Must visit. When in Barcelona, you must visit the gothic quarter and discover the hidden gems of the city. I'd recommend a walking tour for better exploration

Walk walk and get lost in those streets to get the best.. I would suggest one to take gothic quarter free walking tour. With that one will get good idea of the place. This place looks its best during evenings due to lights been lite. There is a cocktail bar called neri, which is shot in many movies. Even cocktails are amazing. A must visit place.

Small streets and many shops. I like this quarter because of the pedestrian streets and the small shops, bar and restaurants everywhere. Located in the center of Barcelona, it's at a walking distance to everything.
Stunning architecture!. Great lively area for restaurants, entertainment and shopping. Barcelona Cathedral was free and very nice. Such a contrast to the Segrada de Familia.

Very pretty and great bars . We have been to the gothic quarter twice on our trip, once during the day and once in the evening.There was a great atmosphere on both accessions with all the old buildings and churches it is very beautiful it is filled with bars, Ice cream parlours and cafes. It was a really nice stroll with both my grandmother and daughter appreciating different parts.
My love!. I've been there so many times there and still wanting to walk again thru its narrow streets full of history and amazing experiences.
Long Weekend. A great place to visit with loads of fantastic small bars and restaurants of all standards, thoroughly enjoyed.

Historically Amazing. Gothic Quarter is huge and amazing place. Its historical place are mind boggling. Good amount of restaurants and shopping in this quarter. This is a must visit while in Barcelona.

Unique. Our first stop was the Gothic quarter, we were immediately inspired by the structure and architecture of the old buildings. It was very crowded it was hot but it was still well worth the walk-through, we shopped we dined we had a marvelous evening there. In fact we went back on our last day just to hit some areas that we glimpsed over on the first walk-through. A fantastic area of Barcelona it is very crowded be aware of pickpockets.

Classic old Spain. Very pleasant with narrow cool streets on a hot day. Lots and lots of eating places and little bars. Pleasing architecturally and not at all threatening or dingy . We loved rambling around its rabbit warren of old streets and poking in and out of shops and restaurant / cafes. Spent happy hours here - whole family was happy. Old Spain - reminding me of trip to Toledo and Seville when younger. We ate at a little street restaurant on Las Ramblas which runs to the west side of the Gothic Quarter . Great way to spend our last hours in Barcalona. ( see next review for details).

Great vibe. Barcelona is definitely much better at night as the city comes alive. The gothic corner has lots of nooks and crannies so it's lots of fun to walk around and explore. Of course the usual tourist traps exist but what do you expect.
Very interesting. Beautiful older part of this wonderful city. Lots of great architecture. Lots of shops (unfortunately for me) if you want them

Get lost (in the best possible way). I almost missed the gothic quarter. It's proximity to the Las Ramblas and all the touristy junk kept me away from the area. Luckily I took a bike tour which spent some time in the area, and then went back later that evening after an early dinner for a few hours of strolling. It's a rabbit warren of history, where every corner promises new surprises. Little boutiques cafes, restaurants down little side alleys with centuries of history looming above and around you. Then, suddenly, you are in a wide open square n front of a church or some other beautiful public building, before plunging back into the maze of side streets.On the negative side, I wouldn't want to be a woman walking alone in these streets after dark. It's not that the area feels dangerous, its just that there are too many dark secluded corners when the sun goes down.

Don't you dare to miss it!. The most beautiful neighborhood of Barcelona. Atmospheric, interesting, intriguing! Las Ramblas is only the means to go to Bari gotic. Go to restaurants in Carrer de Ferran, have photos under the bridge of Carrer de Brisbe (Palau Generalitat), buy interesting gifts, visit the Cathedral and plaza trial.
Top. The best place to walk around very typical and relaxing to have a day in Barcelona. You can go through the Ramblas and jump into it in a while
Nice place. If you like to look @ churches. This one is in the top twenty. Old . Very nice inside Women have to were clothes below there knees. Men no sandles
Lovely historic area . Great to walk around, take in views, pop in and out of shops and grab a bite to eat. Would recommend as also near main shopping street and market. Can all be done together..

Get lost in the old time. We really love Gothic Quarter. You can spend as much time as you wish and get lost in the old time, and never feel bored. Walk around the narrow streets or sit down in a coffee in one of the beautiful squares. Very relaxing. Look at this picture, it is just like the one on magazine cover, really love it!
Beautiful neighbourhoods of walkable city. Aimlessly walk from street to another and get mesmerised with the architecture, beautiful homes and buildings.

I could (and did) wander around here for hours. The Gothic Quarter has so much to give from shops to restaurants and a whole host of wonderful architecture. We spent days wandering around it and I really didn't tire of it.
GREAT GREAT BARS!. Absolutely amazing and cozy. We spend a whole afternoon just going from bar to bar enjoying drinks and tapas. Really really great.

Lose the map, follow your heart in the Gothic Quarter. After using a map my first day just to get my bearings, the best thing I did in Barcelona was put the map away and just start walking. I know most people don't want to get out of bed early when they are on vacation, but in Barcelona, if you start walking the gothic quarter at 7am, it's like have the whole world to yourself. So quiet, peaceful and the lighting is amazing. The bakeries are just opening and the smells of fresh breads and pastries are enough to send your senses into a tailspin. Also, head to Santa Caterina Market to watch then setting up the produce/meat stalls - it's not as crowded as La Boqueria, more mom & pop. The shopping is incredible too. You will need many days to get the adequate number of retail therapy hours required to make you a happy, healthy vacationer.
Super cool. . Get lost in these streets you won't regret it! Gorgeous and maze like. The old gothic buildings are amazing and the shops and restaurants within are really cool.

Interesting rabbit warren of streets. The great crowds of the Ramblas don't get further than one street away from the main area. Plenty to wander around - the Roman fragments, the churches and the streets. You do need a good map though.
Nice Quarter. Narrow streets, little shops, small cafés and restaurants, old buildings, all kinds of people, .... just wonderful

Tea in gothic area. A nice walk through history. Interesting the perfum museum shop, personalised perfums and amazing jewlery. Oppened on sundays to. A Stop for a tea theres is a very special place round the corner in a square called Caj Chai,all types of tea. Alone or with company is a recomended walk on sundays.

Picturesque surroundings. What's quite amusing is that the narrow, winding streets create quite a labyrinth what means that it may take a while to get your bearings! I recommend that you should always look up and around you or you may miss some of the best bits. The Gothic quarter has many peaceful squares where you can relax and enjoy your surroundings. However one of the main attractions, right in the heart of the district is the huge Cathedral which has a stunning courtyard full of plants and oddly, geese!

Barcelona sites. So much to see and do in Barcelona. Architecture is amazing. Clean city. City never sleeps. Did on off bus tour and it gave us a nice overview of city and took us to all the highlights.

Amazing architect and history. Enjoyed a free walking tour around the Gothic Quarter which was amazing. If you manage to get a good tour guide who understands the history then you're in for a real treat as the Gothic quarter has a lot of sad interesting history and wonderful architect.
Favorite part of Barcelona!. We enjoyed it so much that we went back a couple of times, getting lost in the narrow streets, trying out great food, and just a great atmosphere.

Historic neighborhood is wonderful!. A maze of pedestrian only alleyways, Roman ruins, churches, apartment buildings with laundry hanging across the lanes, flower-filled terraces, churches, shops, restaurants, pretty squares, and some great old architecture spanning 11-15th centuries. On Sundays there are some fun open air markets selling food or antiques, but some of the shops are closed. Highly recommend.
Great area for walking around. We enjoyed walking around the Gothic Quarter and were glad we had the Rick Steve's walking tour to give us guidance and information on the area.
History!. Beautiful area. Full of history. You can find the old wall in some places, even a roman temple inside a building. The narrow streets are full of shops, restaurants and bars. Amazing place
Architecture. Barcelona as a whole contains some of the most beautiful architecture in the world, and it definitely has its own style. The Gothic Quarter is no exception.

Very pretty!. Very pretty narrow streets with amazing architecture and cafes. Little boutique shops to wander in and out of. You also stumble across the cathedral whilst winding through the the tiny streets....amazing and very Spanish/Catalonian

For the love of Art. My every evening in Barcelona was spent in the Gothic Quarter and yet there was so much more to discover. Even if one is not an Art aficionado one sticks around the area simply for the captivating atmosphere of the quarter.

Touristy, but nice!. Even if the Gothic quarter attracts a lot of tourists, for me it managed to retain its charm and I enjoyed walking through it and found good food and drinks too! There is a lot of musicians during the day and music was also played on the square at night as an open air concert and it was very enjoyable. great quarter!
Something New around every corner. Easy to access. Plenty to see and explore. Around every corner you'll find something new to explorer and visit. Several museums to visit.
Perfect area to walk and absorb the culture.. Terrific area to walk around, eat, shop, wander into the cathedrals. We returned a second day and continued to find new spots.
Old world. Leave the Ramblas, plenty of reasonable bars in side streets manny with set price menus. Try the cafe at Barcelona market, 3 courses and drink 12.95 Euros.

lots of beautiful buildings here. I was very impressed with the Gothic district, as many of the buildings are very interesting take a day and walk around and really pay attention to the detail. Very nice.
Scenic Place. We stayed in the Gothic Quarter during our visit. So, we had ample opportunity to walk around and marvel at the architecture.

A must see. Great buildings and vibe. There is so much on offer in this precinct for wide variety of interests. From bars, cafes, old buildings and general shopping. Whilst you have to be here it is worth getting bike to explore some nearby shopping strips that have less international visitors and local vibe.

A must see when visiting Barcelona. Barcelona's Gothic Quarter definitely needs to be on the to do list when visiting the city. The narrow streets in/around the cathedral are rip for exploring, and are usually quite shaded, which is a welcome relief during hot summer days.
Find the little gems. I love the small winding streets full of little gems at every turn. great little bars and restaurants. the cathedral is also well worth a visit.

Awesome Barrio (neighborhood ). You cannot leave Barcelona without walking around The Gothic neighborhood. I felt I was back in colonial time walking through the small laberints streets, enjoying the mini botigas (boutiques) street vendors, museums, the small plazas, churches and restaurants. You can delight yourself during day time as well as night time! The Barrio speaks for itself.
Beautiful Architecture. Lots of amazing buildings, beautifully preserved and I couldn't take enough pictures to do the area justice. Must visit in Barcelona .
Fab area . We wondered around here most days, shopping, eating drinking and plenty of nice architecture to see, it buzzed pretty much most times of the day, a must visit..

Lovely lanes and beautiful architecture . We stayed in the gothic quarter which by day is very hectic and full of tourists but has great restaurants and bars which are unexpected and unassuming by day but at night come alive. There are hidden gems everywhere and by night it is romantic and offers beautiful streets to walk down

Great to stroll around at night . Amazing area to stroll around at night. Lots to see and amazing archetype of the gothic period. During the day it also beautiful but the night time set up of lights really make the place stunning.

The oldest architecture in Barcelona. Focused around the Cathedral, this is a busy area of alley-ways. Some Roman foundations are visible and you'll catch loads of painted 'statues' and other performers to throw money at (some of them very good (particularly late afternoon around the back of the Cathedral).

The Gothic Quater. Just walking around you will see the cathedral and lots of Gaudi.
Also the area is full of bars and restaurants which are expensive and not very good value.

So much more to find and excite. Some would say that the Gothic quarter is in fact "new" having been rebuilt for one of Barcelona's many expositions, but you'd never know it, if it's true! The churches are amazing and if you take a moment to appreciate how difficult it is to build similar structures today, they become even more interesting. The Quarter hides many bars and cafes, some with amazingly low prices; you'll also find handmade fashion shops and other artisans plying their wares, but you'll need to spent some time looking. My advide: wear comfortable shoes. A really nice part of the city.

Gothic architecture well preserved.. You can take a guided tour or just take a walk, step back 600 years and use your imagination what it would have been like to live here.. Tour is recommended so you learn . all the secrets of the buildings

Catalan Life at its best. The Barri Gòtic offers nice small alleys in wonderful atmosphere. The quarter makes you really feel beeing in Barcelona. Historic landmarks like the gothik cathedral need to be visited in every case. Little markets, nice small restaurants and boutiques invite for side-seeing and some rests! There is also very nice hotels for a pleasant stay. The entire quarter needs to be discovered by walking, as there is mostly no car access.

Super place to get lost. I love these little alleys all over the plave. Looks like the old town of Bari (Italy) which I've also loved. Recommended to get lost in small streets stuffed with design shops and bars
Reminds me of Hollywood in the 90s. A massive gothic quarter. We walked a long way and still had much to see. Its cool but not somewhere I'd want to be too late at night.

Lanes of interest. This was like the lanes of Brighton but with the warmth of Barcelona sunshine. Such a variety of buildings, shops and churches. We had wonderful times exploring the different routes. There were shops for all the family from the traditional tourist shops to other home grown designers selling more original wares. I would certainly recommend a free walking tour by runner bean tours as it introduces you to the area so when you return you know where you are going.
nice outing... we came here after a visit to the main Cathedral, and we had a nice stroll aon a guided tour around the gothic quarter.
fab area. close to everything....perfect location for people watching and soaking up the best of Catalan food and atmosphere.... lovely shops, restaurants and atmosphere.

My favourite area in Barca. This is my 3rd visit to Barca and every time, I've been drawn back to the Barri Gotic time and time again. Everywhere you look there is something to catch your eye: the mysterious passages, the architecture, quirky shops, huge range of bars and restaurants to suit every budget.I love it. Do NOT contemplate visiting Barcelona without factoring in at least one slow table through the Barri Gotic.
Walk and walk. The Barri Gothic is in the middle of Barcelona, near the seaside and the centre. There are lots of shops with typical food or souvenirs, it's pretty cool

Gothic Quarter and nearby. I like to walk, so, besides several circles inside the quarter, I also made a semicircle around, visiting La Rambla street and adjacent places.Just look at the pictures. Authentic European architecture and spirit at their best.

Great area for ambling. We walked around the Gothic quarter most days and seemed to find new streets on each occasion. It's has beautiful narrow streets, with numerous boutique shops and restaurants and places of historic interest. Well worth a visit.

Beautiful historic area a must see. An area just to get lost in.
Beautiful alleys with historic labrynthine streets. Make sure to see the Carrer del Bisbe.

Spoilt for choice. So much to do and see here and many of the attractions are free of charge. The Cathedral is magnificent but take note, they are very strict around Mass times and the dress code is quite strict - no hats/vests for men and no shorts/short skirts/bare shoulders for ladies (they are happy enough with patrons buying a 3Euro scarf to drape over themselves from the vendors outside). Depending on the day you may find a market or traditional dancers/performers or such like in the square.The Municipal Art Exhibition is very good - displaying items from local contemporary artists.Lots of lovely boutique shops and designer chains to be found. There's literally nothing you can't buy here and there is a vast array of bars and restaurants to choose from to suit every taste.The Spanish seem to have upped security in the country generally - which is understandable, since the last time I visited which was 5 years ago - I noticed that there were fewer hawkers of fake/copy goods along the seafront, back streets or close to visitor attractions. In some ways this is good as it feels a lot safer walking around the city. Especially so for those travelling by yacht or custom car (which I wasn't but clearly in this area quite a few people do).Just go and see and enjoy every aspect of Barcelona - I have been 6 times now and would go back tomorrow. I just love it, I'm not bored yet and I haven't exhausted the place. I hope you love it too.
Gothic Heart of Barcelona. Here you may see the profound impact that Gothic Architecture had upon Barcelona Spain, and the Habsburg nexus that made it possible.

Very nice wander through the old streets. There are some wonderful cafes, shops and architecture hidden away in the Gothic Quater, and a very good museum next to the old cathedral. Well worth the visit, especially the market

I just loved it!!!. This became one of my favorite places!I absolutely loved walking around the Gothic Quarter. Those narrowed streets full of little shops of all kinds, people walking up and down, and some singers singing opera.... it was fantastic!At the hotel, they told us that if we wanted good food, we had to go to the Gothic Quarter, so we did. We went a couple of times and had paella in two different places. Not regrets. It was delicious. There are little cafes and we also enjoyed coffee and pastries. I can't wait to go back and taste more of that delicious food!!!
Anniversary trip. Such amazing architecture, so much to see! A city full of interesting things to see and do. Lovely people.
Searching for the Synagogue . We visited the area in search of an ancient synagogue. We found it down one of the tiny back streets. It was closed at the time but could see the signs for it.

You can spend hours wondering the streets of this historic area . This a one of the areas that you can spend hours walking though. You can feel the history. And when you have seen enough, head to Las Ramblas which is close by, for lunch at one of the many tapas bars and soak up the atmosphere.

Gothic area. Amazing Cathedral and subterranean Roman ruins in the Barcelona museum - not to be missed!!Quality of food in all the restaurants we ate in was high and not over priced. Try Placa Reial for great ambience.

Winding passageways and hidden bars. A perfect afternoon and evening spent exploring the stunning architecture through the winding streets and many bars/shops. Street performances can be found in many of the main squares, love it!

Quaint. We stayed in this area and highly recommend it for its access to nearly everything you want to see. You are a block away from Las Ramblas, near the Metro, Plazas, and eateries of all kinds. The shopping is incredible!

Great Place to Just Wander and Wonder. This is the old part of the city. It is a place full of variety and wonder. You can see things from Roman ruins, to boutique shops and more restaurants and bars than you ca shake a stick at! Forget your walk down Las Ramblas, go here instead

Touristy but beautiful.. The hotel NH carrer del Duq is a good option in the gothic part. There is a good restaurant with upper terrace near the Cathedral you can't miss it as it has white umbrellas on the terrace. Good for lunch. Food not bad, should book.

Tour guide recommended if church viewing is your objective. . We took a taxi to the Gothic Quarter. I misunderstood what it was. It's actually a neighbourhood filled with shops and restaurants and of course a variety of churches. It was interesting to walk around and check out all the streets lined with various shops etc. I did see some of the churches but I regret not using a tour guide to take me to specific ones that I had read about. Definitely worth visiting.

Get off the main roads and wander, just wander.. The old quarter has some amazing finds. You just need to get lost and wander about. Look up, look back , there are sights to be seen everywhere. Get off the tourist route and find some gems.

Our Hotel was in Gothic quarter.. Little did we know how close our hotel was to everything. We were in the Gothic quarter down a small alley right off of La Rambla. Across the street was the la Boqueria (food market) tons of restaurants, shopping, everything. Cool little alleyways, beautiful churches and everything you need close by.

Amazing. Beautiful architecture along the narrow winding streets . Shops / bars / museums / Roman ruins it's all here. It's just a really nice atmosphere and you can feel the history of the place. Well worth a couple of hours wandering around

Great half day walk. Good to learn about the old-city. There are some hidden gems that you would discover while strolling around. If you wish a guided tour, simply stop searching and reserve online with the free "Runner Bean Tours".

SO MUCH TO SEE AND DO IN THIS QUARTER!!!. First of all the city of Barcelona in itself has so much to see and do...The Barri Gotic is part of the old city...with its winding streets and surprises around every corner its a must see and get lost in...Actually getting lost is the best way to get to know anywhere in Barcelona. The Gotic has amazing restaurants pooping up left and right. Great smaller museums, including the Picasso Museum which is just wonderful...You can even go into Hotel Neri which is a Relais and Chateau hotel...absolutely stunning and have a drink. Around there are more bars and shops and restaurants that will blow your socks off!!!!
Lovely area.. Nice area to have a wander, plenty of shops, bars, cafes and restraunts. A lot quieter compared to las ramblas area and much nicer.

Architectural Marvels!. This quarter boasts some of the most beautiful buildings I have ever seen! The intricate details and unimaginable designs make for a feast to the eyes! One in particular is the Barcelona Cathedral. Definitely worth a visit when in Barcelona! A photographer's dream!
Could spend all day. It's beautiful. What a lovely area to just wander and get lost, only to discover you're not too far away from where you started.

A beautiful rambling area in Barcelona. The Gothic Quarter is located within walking distance of La Rambla and the Boqueria market. It is full of shops, restaurants, historic sites and the most magnificent Cathedral. A very different environment from the Gaudi architecture seen all over Barcelona. This is much more old Europe style.The Cathedral costs 7e to enter. The admission fee includes access to the roof top observation area. Well worth the cost. The Cathedral alone could take 2 hours to visit.the Gothic Bridge is next to the Cathedral as well. Very unique. The shops and restaurants are full of character. Some chain stores but many local stores as well.Plan to spend a few hours in this area exploring all the little gems in the Gothic Quarter then head to the Boqueria for lunch and then have gelato in La Rambla's main avenue.
A must place to visit. We spent hours wandering the streets through the ancient buildings and streetsMake sure this is on your must do list and enjoy a Sangria on the way
Amazing. So interesting and the buildings are beautiful. A must see for anyone in Spain. If you want to have a look inside the churches wear or take something to cover your shoulders and knees

Unreal!. Barcelona has so many facets. New town, beach, ports and Gothic quarter. The Gothic area is really busy but is definitely a tourist must see. So different to anywhere else. Each street opens up into a new piazza and brings something new. Only the packed streets prevent 5*.
Walk walk and enjoy. Such a good neighborhood ! It is one my favourite place in Barcelona.Just go there and get lost and fun !
Good for a wander. A lovely area of the city to wander around. Plenty of churches, shops, cafes and street activities. No need to spend much if you don't want to...just amble and watch!

Nice - but now wow!. Compared to other European cities, this is very nice but not unique as the rest of Barcelona is. It should be part of your overall things to see, but you can leave it to the end of your visit. Gaudi and Picasso should top your list.

Beautiful buildings. Barcelona is a wonderful city, it has the best of both worlds culture, beach, shopping, There is so much to see so many photos to take, it is very busy but there is always somewhere to sit and watch the world go by

Loved this area. It has a charm I just can't describe,, lovely shops , nice bars with great drinks, very crowded on evening time but still pleasant..
Definitely must visit,, and i wld advice u to stay there

Many hidden gems in the side streets. The medieval centre is quite compact and easy to see and navigate, but many lovely side streets with the history of the city told by the architectural phases you pass through.

Interesting area away from the hustle and bustle. Narrow roads with a lot of character. Walking through one would stumble on interesting sights including The Cathedral, Santa Maria del Mar, Santa Maria del Pi and a few metres away The Picasso Museum.

Very vibrant area. The views of close quarter residence and small squares where locals and tourists mix to share leisurely lunch is an experience e not to be missed. A number of avenues that can take you to the old town and the sea front. A weekend break will only give you a snippet of what is on offer.

A brilliant stroll.... Spent half a day here strolling through the narrow streets, A proper peaceful place and the cathedral looks magnificent. We didnt have time to go inside but i'm sure its as spectacular from the inside as it is from the outside. Get off at the luciu metro station on las ramblas, follow the 'Cathedral' signs and stroll through the narrow streets.
Great architecture . Great example of well preserved architecture in a stunning city. Well worth taking a few hours aside for this

Must-see!. The gothic quarter with its narrow streets has the side effect of leaving you in the shadow on a hot day but there is of course much more to see. Tiny and old stores, fabulous food places, the calmness of a neighbourhood without cars that breathes history. The church is of course the highlight and withholds something that makes it unique.
Loads of bars hidden away... . This area is animated at night with hidden away bars, and restaurants. On a Sunday evening, we did a few bar hopping and feasted off a few tapas with friends..

So much things to see in El barrio Gótico. Yes you'll find great universities in Barcelona. And yes there are great museum in Barcelona. But thousands of years can be found inside the Gothic sector of the city, on the left side of the Rambla Catalunya when you walk down. You can spend hours and hours by walking through out the history of this great city.

Full of hidden gems. This area is an absolute must for people visiting Barcelona. I was lucky enough to find accommodation within the Gothic Quarter and I really loved it. I can easily spend hours walking around and find interesting placa, shops, restaurants. Highly recommended.

Taste of the old with plenty of new. Easy to get lost for hours in these wonderful narrow streets full of secret squares, magnificent historic architecture, buskers and boutique shops, or just sit back and enjoy a sangria and meal alfresco. Place Reial was full of acrobatic buskers when we were there. Tends to be cooler on a hot day also.
Best Gothic Quarter in Europe. The Gothic Quarter of Barcelona is the best in Europe. Ancient Roman walls, Jew quarter, Churches, narrow streets.... history everywhere ...unforgettable.

A great visual stroll. The Gothic Quarter is great for a walk anytime of the day. I prefer early morning when it is not so crowded. Try to get lost on one of the small streets or what you may think are alleys. You can not wander too far off course because of the major streets surrounding the quarter. Explore and have fun. An architectural wonderland. Take you time to stroll or walk slowly.
Great explorations. Really fun to wander these tight little streets. Safe and clean, except for the omnipresent smell of sewer gas throughout Barcelona....

Fun to get lost here. The gothic area is a must , getting lost in the thiny narrow streets and finding little shops and cafe stores.In weekends go up to the park aside it and visit the great fountain inside it.From there getting to the port is easy and yuo can spend all day there.When shops are closed it is like a meuseum for graphity works on each shop door there are owesone color works.
Such character and architecture. So many places to see here. Such different architecture and a lot of history. Easy to see on your own, just get there.
Great. Great area with lots of attractions to see. And some lovely little streets. Really worth passing by.

Beautiful but very touristic (of course). Probably one of the most famous parts of town - and therefore super crowded and everything has the extra tourist price tag. I would recommend to stay on the right side of the main street - there are some beautiful little alleys with little shops, and it feels like in the 18th century.

Where we got engaged!. A lovely area to wonder around. My husband proposed to me at night outside the Barcelona Cathedral which was all light up and a very romantic setting. There is so much to see and do in the Barri Gotic and we even caught an improv. group singing opera in one of the streets. Wonderful! The markets and restaurants are fantastic too!
Ausgezeichnet. Probably the most beautyful area in Barcelona.Plenty of Shops, small streets, great Food and amazing fews everywere.Skip the Rambla just stay here!
Lovely exploring. Put your map away and just stroll around the Gothic Quarter. Everywhere your look there are amazing buildings and lovely authentic little shops.
Stunning. Fun to get lost on all the narrow streets. I'd suggest day vs. night and while there see the Gaudi exhibit. Beautiful place to stroll around.

My kind of street. I never get bored of this street. Walking in the neighbourhood and getting lost everytime trying new bar or a new restaurant. You can feel the street's life. You just feel alive again.

3 night honeymoon. The gothic quarter of Barcelona is excellent as it is pretty much central .We stayed at the Hotel Rialto for bed and breakfast.The area like the city is full of beautiful architecture and history for the explorers out there.The area also has excellent tapas bars and resteraunts,which we totally enjoyed along with the many bars and pubs The Lennox Pub is one of these we will be returning soon for a longer stay to explore the city more.

Trashy but nice. The problem with the gothic Quarter is that the inhabitants do not care for it. It is one of the best preserved old towns in Europe but it is becoming a scary place to walk in. I can guarantee some of the best tapas and wine bars if you decide to explore it.
Nice place. Crowded but nice, people singing in different places, shops now and then, coffee stops amd restaurants.
Just roam the little allies. The best way to experience this area us just to walk around with no specific intention and finding cool allies, shops, cafes and restaurants

So cool. This is the picture of old Europe. Walk through the narrow alleyways and explore at your own pace or take a tour. We did our own thing and found all the sights no problem. Cathedral Barcelona is a must see! A spectacular gothic cathedral. (You cannot enter with short shorts/skirts and your shoulders must be covered, no tank tops.)
Lively quarter, for a afternoon walk. A lively quarter for a walk. especially in the afternoon, when the shops are also open. But if you want more rest go early in the morning.
Just get lost in the streets. You can spend a whole day just walking in its streets. Everything has a miningfull historic background. Nice restaurants to grab some montaditos around the cathedral.
nice medieval walk. Nice gothic architecture, I think this is a bit less crowded quarter than the rest of popular Barcelona's streets, good for medieval mood walk by the evening :)

An interesting Part of the City and NOT Jammed with People. This is the part of the city to go to for great little tapas bars, especially at night. The old buildings and historical landmarks like the Cathedral are not too full of people. Take your time and wander, stop for a beer and a bit when you wish, and soak up the true aura of the city.
Nice atmosphere. Very nice atmosphere inside this quarter.Very good especially inside hot whether because in this quarter is temperature more lower than in another parts of Barcelona
Beautiful. A highlight of Barcelona. We started at the Cathedral. We visited late afternoon and it wasn't too busy. Lovely shaded area to view the cathedral opposite.
A must in barcelona. Get lost in this amazing part of the city and explore the littel streets and find a cafe to watch people walk by

Don't miss it!. We visited Barri Gotic on a hot summer Saturday before the crowds got too crazy, and we loved it! We followed along Rick Steve's exploratory walk and visited the Roman temple ruins, the 4 Cats bar where Picasso hung out in his early days, the Cathedral, and much more. You could easily spend a whole day, if not more, exploring all the narrow little maze of streets. I highly recommend ducking into an inviting cafe for a snack or drink :)
Delightful. We had an enchanting walk through the streets, We didn't use a map, just wandered, experiencing surprises around each corner.

Free Walking Tour. Our first day in Barcelona we did this tour. We also stayed in the area for 1 week after we got back from our cruise. Felt safe day or night. Walking distance to Las Ramblas and to beach area
A Must See in Barcelona. A very charming part of town, the Barri Gotic is full of quaint shops and restaurants, we spent a bit of each day roaming the streets of the Barri Gothic.

Gothic quarter you love, you love.... The Gothic quarter is beautiful, its labyrinthine streets, bars, restaurants, art galleries, churches, the cathedral is very beautiful and you do not quite know everything, my second time in Barcelona was in March and owe repeat, it is both to go.

Beautiful!. The Barri Gotic and the area around is absolutely beautiful. With the small alleys and little shops, with this chapel and its wonderful architecture in the centre. This is a must-see in Barcelona.

Laneways are where it's at! . Get off the main streets and explore the smaller streets and laneways. There is a lot to see both residential and retail to give you a feel for Barcelona, including amazing architecture. Do a free walking tour of the area (donation model), it's worth it.
Lots to see and do. Worth a visit. Some interesting small galleries - many of which are free. Some amazing architecture so don't forget to look up.

Definitely worth a visit. Start the day off with breakfast at Milk and go from there. It's a must see. We strolled round soaking up the buildings and culture. Food and bars are amazing and people are friendly. Very easy to get lost.

Atmospheric labyrinth of cobbled lanes.. We stayed on the edge of the Gothic quarter and loved it. We just wandered around, coming across across amazing cathedrals, art galleries, squares, bars, restaurants and shops as we did so. Google maps was our friend as well ! We had planned to ride around the labyrinth of streets but in the summer holidays they become crowded just as the bike hire shops open. Plan to spend a day or two just in this spot alone and to thinks it's only been since 2000, that the Gothic quarter started to be gentrified and on the tourist map.
Must to Visit. Old city and very worthwhile a visit. It has small alleyways with shops of all sorts. Must visit the Basilica of Santa Maria del Pi which is also there - amazing church!!

Lovely part of Barcelona worth a visit.. Definitely worth a walk around as there is plenty to do, see, eat and drink. The area has some lovely quirky shops, amazing Catherals and generally is lovely place.

Lovely stroll. Just take any side street off Las Ramblas and stroll through the Gothic quarter and fall across small and large squares, little restaurants and bars and of course the Cathedral of Barcelona. Lots of small artisan shops also

Beautiful buildings, delightful shops, delicious tapas. Barcelona is a beautiful place, but having done a whistle-stop tour on the open-top bus, I can categorically say The Gothic Quarter is the prettiest part of the city. It has an abundance of great shops, lovely restaurants and quirky, yet beautiful buildings. It is simply stunning. Treat yourself and stay at the Hotel Barcelona Catedral, which is stunning and perfectly located to take in this wonderful part of this eclectic city.

fascinating. We were somewhat surprised as we thought we were going to an area of "Goths" rather than visiting some beautiful gothic buildings. It was one of the most beautiful places we have visited on our extensive travels. About a 15 minute walk from the main Barcelona square but well worth it. On the way back stop off for coffee outside on of the many cafes and take in the whole atmosphere of the surroundings
An interesting walk if you take a guide. A guide will help you get the most out of this area. You need the history to put it all in context. The walking tour put on by the tourist board was excellant
Gothic Quarter . Plan to spend a day here. Great atmosphere, shopping and food. Can get busy - so leave early. Grad some lunch and sit and listen to band playing in square
Amazing experience. So much history to see in this cathederal. a popular place to go to and then after that wander through the old lane-ways with shops and restaurants

A must do. We stayed here and very glad we did.
A vibrant place full of cafes , bars and shops a beautiful place well worth a visit and spend time browsing
Gothic Quarter. The best part of Barcelona is Gothic quarters to stay, dine and shop. All tourist attractions are within walking distance. You can find many good hotels around the area.
Gorgeous quarter of an already amazing city.. Don't miss this - so nice to meander through the narrow passageways and stop for a drink in one of the many sidewalk cafes.
Gothich balcony. Take The roads between the inner street.U can find too much history and little cafes and shops.At least u need 2 days travel

Spend the day. This is a fun, interesting area...by day or in the evening. Many historical sites as well as shops, bars and cafes throughout the narrow charming maze of streets. If in Barcelona, I would always save time for this!
Nice place to walk around. Not much to say. Pretty, nice to walk around. Great architecture. It's close to the beach so you can include that as part of your adventure. Good sunny day activity.
Disappointed. To be honest, this was a let-down. We were expecting to spend the whole day roaming through the aisles, but in the end, we just walked through.

Spend plenty of time here. One of the highlights of our trip. Could spend days here. It is so beautiful and fun to just walk around and take in the sights of it all. Arcitecture, culture, shops, bar, food. Loved it and going back in a few days!

AJ and Vera: Ah, the stories!. AJ, alias Andrès Jennings of Sandemann's New Europe Free Walking Tours, brought the Gothic quarter to life: the people, their history and hardships, the spirit of Barcelona, the significance of the various flags everywhere. He showed us the big picture, then pointed out the unique details, making it all come alive. After this morning tour, we booked his "Rowdy Gaudi" afternoon tour as well as the company's evening tapas tour: super value for our money, and with Vera our evening Tour guide, we learned why tapas/pinxos came to be and where to enjoy what. Mmmm!

Amazing place full of beautiful architecture, eateries, bars, shops and boutiques!. You can't possibly visit Barcelona without experiencing the gothic quarter, with its stunning ancient buildings, fabulous shops/ boutiques, great eating/drinking experiences (try one of the Gelato shops - amazing ice cream, fab range of flavours!). Also, the home of the 'must visit' Picasso Museum. Wonderful experience, wish we had more time to explore everything!

Rent here?. We were torn to rent in this location or Barceloneta... Picked eta only because its next to the beach but this area is our fav to stroll in BCN and a 10 minute walk for us. A must visit! Some great hotel and apartments to rent and great places to eat...

Interesting place to walk around with a cathederal. Short 10 mins walk from the La Ramblas main street, you arrive in the Gothic Quarter of Barcelona. Although, from the name I was expecting crowds of people in Gothic style but we found just hoard of usual tourists walking around. The place was nice to walk around with lots of eateries, shopping and souvenir shops... Some pubs around but since it was early evening, there were not much crowds or music in there... Overall, an interesting area to walk around and see people.

Great place to wander about.. I'd heard you should watch your wallet and purse, and I suppose that might be the case, but we had no issues. A great place to shop, eat, people watch, etc., in the midst of old cobblestone streets, and teeny alleys and..... end up at Plaza Reial and the main shopping street (which name escapes me at the moment).

Must Go Place - Spend half a day here... Good History, Would love to go back. My wife and I spent 4 days in Barcelona around new years (2015-16), and loved this place the most... I am not saying Park Guell or Sagrada Familia are not great, but this place has the feeling of getting lost in rich history of Spain.. Next time, I would only go to this area...

Amazing architecture ... worth do the streets by walking. you see yourself on a different atmosphere by walking on this neighborhood... Very small streets, very different constructions with a lot of small and (sometimes) fancy restaurants or shops. Save yourself some time to waste on Plaza Real before going to Barcelona Cathedral. It's worth...

Should be high on your list.. Narrow streets full of atmosphere and history. Boutique shops and yummy restaurants. My suggestion, sit inside to eat and drink like the Spaniards do. You're out walking all the time; inside is always cooler and 'when in Rome'. Not to put you off, but remember to keep a closer eye on your kit when evening comes. One of the sad facts of a big city.

Beautiful cool cloisters for a hot day. The Gothic Quarter is a fun area to stroll around, with plenty of small shops, cafés and restaurants. Following a tip from my Catalan neighbour, I visited the cathedral, where I loved the cloisters.

Give yourself lots of time. This area is a must do of Barcelona but you need to give yourself the time and freedom to go down lots of side streets, look into store windows, do some shopping, enjoy a street cafe, and discover a square or look inside a cathedral. Tip: take a map so you will find your way back eventually.

Beautiful. A lovely area to wander through - lots of little boutiques and cute cafes and bars. There is a lovely cathedral here too. One of the days we visited, there were lots of locals performing some kind of dance out the front, and that was really nice to watch. There was also a guy making bubbles with a giant bubble wand, and a street performer doing acrobatics with a giant hoop, which was pretty cool. Its a great place to spend a relaxed morning or afternoon.
A Barcelona Must-See. We spent two days exploring this ecclectic and historical area of Barcelona. Amazing restaurants, street vendors, shopping, cultural sights, and of course, people watching
Interesting walk. Interesting walk through the old city of barcelona. Narrow streets with many small shops an nice atmosphere. Even on a sunday where many shops are closed

Great place to literally lose yourself!. Barri gotic is a maze of narrow beautiful streets where if like myself you have little or no sense of direction getting lost is quite easy. But here getting lost is part of the fun and leads you to discover far more. Just off las ramblas the Gothic quarter is another must see in Barcelona.
Love the historic architecture . Great day trip. Explore history. Have lunch or just tapas. Shop and see the sights. Or just hang out and people watch.

Beautiful part of the city. It's a little touristy, but it's truly a beautiful part of the city. The Roman columns are hidden in the heart of the quarter. Lots of quirky tapas and cervezerias. Cobblestone streets line the narrow alleys.
Great place . We had Sunday breakfast here great choices to eat with nice outside views even the night lovely attraction.great for young and old

Very nice . Nice architecture and churches. Nice mass. Sometimes there is a folklore dance in front of the church in which you can participate too. We really enjoyed it. Easy place to find pinchos and lots of stores to go shopping for either clothes, shoes or souvenirs.

Beautiful. Lovely to walk through this area and explore all the old buildings and cathedrals. Lots of history and photo ops in this area. Do try and enter the cathedral when here, but be aware of the dress code...no short shorts and shoulders should be covered.
Astonishing Gothic architecture in the heart of the city. As an architecture-lover I am not objective, but Gothic district in Barcelona is amazing. You can wander around small streets all day!

Definitely worth visiting . We went to gothic quarter we had young child & teenage boy with us we all loved looking at the old part of this city. There is plenty to see here & lovely little streets. We went to a bar opposite the opera house which was really nice & made the best cocktails I'll put the details on a review We also ate at a Mexican where the locals eat which was called Rosa Nigra book in advance if you have very young kids as we had to wait a hour for the table
Tours Tappas & Friends. We enjoyed a very informative evening with Paula. Lovely, interested and interesting guide, very passionate about her subject, food and Barcelona.

Great place to visit. Our second visit to Barcelona and we spent hours wandering around the little streets. Beware of special tourist prizes for drinks at small shops and some bars. If there isn't a prize on the menu or displayed on item ask first. A bottle of water can vary from €0.75 to over €3.

Reasonably pleasant for an hour or two. The baking, seedy streets of Barcelona are hard work but at least in the gothic area the narrow streets afford some shade. There are some nice old buildings in the neighbourhood but frankly we are hardly short of mediaeval splendour in Europe and this is at the modest end of the scale. Worth an hour or so of you're in town.
Great getting lost in the narrow streets!. Beautiful and excellent little shops at every corner. You can spend hours scouting around. Lots of unique creations and inviting terraces.
Look up! . Some great shops and cafes throughout the area. Architecture is fascinating so don't forget to look up, otherwise you miss the best of it!
Idyllic place ! . Is one of my favourite squares. You can find different gothic and important monuments.And you can drink some coffe in front the fabulous cathedral.

A Place to get lost.. This is the part of Barcelona that I love to get lost in, and I do get lost. It's good to see that some cities are determined to keep sections of their past alive.The Gothic quarter is full of narrow streets, odd shaped buildings, its more like a maze, but it's still fun.I have always enjoyed my visits here.
Not to be missed in Barcelona. The most amazing part of the city. Explore tiny little alleys and bars forever! Best at night! Loved it for the true feel of such a vibrant, free and exciting city!

Quaint. We enjoyed an early day stroll in Gothic quarter. Narrow streets, beautifully decorated apartments, lots of small shops and restaurants. Got much busier after noon, so go early if you want to beat the crowds.

Old town in Barcelona. Get lost in the streets, if you don't mind the unpleasant smell. You will find a lot of churches, but Cathedral of Barcelona is the most beautiful one. Enter from right side, for free, to see the garden first, and then proceed to inside. Also, by that entrance is a small plaza with best free wireless (the unlocked one). You can take a book with yourself and spend a lazily afternoon here. Note that you have to be dressed properly to enter the garden and the church. Best take a shawl with yourself just to be sure. Of course, there is always someone to sell you one. The church is best to capture from outside around 16h-18h. There is a tourist office nearby, but don't go there! The tickets they sell are double price than when bought online or at place and they are very incompetent to help you with anything else (The good tourist office is at Palau Robert). There is also a lot of shopping stores and Happy pills is my favorite (next to that tourist office). For 6,5€ buy yourself as many candy as you can put in a medium bottle. It will last you for days and it's very yummy. Also, the mini bottles (2,5€) make best gifts. Be sure to visit Picasso museum, also.
Interesting area. We were taken on a walking tour around the old city, which has so much history I'd never known about! Very interesting to learn, plus the architecture is beautifully intricate.

nice place to walk around. i think this is the best part of Barcelona for mespend many hours just walking around this areait is a good area to get lunch and dinner for fair prices and good food quality
Cool disctrict. Good place to wander around and look, worth a walking tour or perhaps one of the tapas night tours that run.
Nice place to take a stroll. Not much to do but follow the narrow paths and enjoy the area. It is near the cathedrial and a fresh food market. Nice place to get lost in.

Amazing. The Barri Gotic is a maze of quaint buildings, history, little eateries and narrow, cobblestoned streets. There is lots to see and often lots to watch with buskers and festivals. Beware of inflated tourist prices in eateries and shops although you can generally barter the prices down if you show interest and then shock at the price!
I wish I could ive here !!. what a wonderful place just to stroll down its historic streets. so much to see, every square, every street is filled with details and art!
Amazing . This gothic quarter is chock full of surprises. It's worth it to not even take a nap and just wander. You'll be amazed at what you find.
Gothic area. Loved this area with its quaint buildings and narrow streets. Lots of shops and places to eat as well as the tourist attractions

Geese in the cathedral!. This is a really interesting part of Barcelona and a complete change from the wide avenues and Gaudi architecture of other parts of this lovely city. This area has narrow streets and its very own bridge of sighs across one of the alleys at the rear of the gothic cathedral. The cathedral itself is large and impressive as well being a cool area in the summer heat. The cloisters are home to a gaggle of geese. The whole surrounding area is worth seeing but I would recommend a good map as it is a bit of a maze.

Great place to wonder around. On the weekend came here to discover more of Barcelona. I live in Eixample so this is a lot busier and touristy part of Barcelona. Great variety of small shops and historical sights.
Best Area of the City. This area of the city is fantastic great places to look about lots winding lanes with great sights and lots places to eat and drink can get immersed in the area.

Stayed in the Gothic Quarter - great ambiance. The quarter is terrific to walk around or just find a café somewhere and watch the passing parade. A must see in Barcelona. Just stay away from Ramblas, which is a huge tourist trap.
Beautiful quarter. This ancient quarter is just beautiful. It's very unique in Barcelona and have a lot of tiny shops. The main street has all the main designers for the shopaholics.

Stunning architecture. The gothic quarter really did live up to its billing as one of the most stunning architectural areas in not just Barcelona but in Spain as a whole. With so much variation in the design of the buildings and a wide variety of shops, cafes and bars, people of all ages can enjoy an extended stay here.

Wonderful experience. We spent two days in Barcelona and stayed in a hotel in the Gothic Quarter. We explored the area during the day and evening. The buildings are beautiful and it was excited to just explore up and down the narrow streets. There are plenty of great restaurants to try.

Don't miss this old part of the city. This is very charming to walk around. The restaurants and shops are great and the market with all of the food/fish/meat - is irresistible. Take the time to find this area - it's worth it.

An Undergroud Surprise. The Gothic Quarter is found off the La Rambla. Make sure to have a map because there are many small alley-like streets and it is easy to get lost. Visit the Cathedral and then go around it to the left and enter the Museu d`Història de Catalunya where you will find a wonderful museum that showcases the original Roman town. The museum has many informative displays about the history of Barcelona and then you go down in an elevator to the remains of the Roman city. The site is very extensive. Well worth a visit.

Great place with a guide. We booked a two hour walking tour through the Barcelona Tourist Centre and it was a great and very informative way to see the area.The guide was very knowledgeable and the pace was very easy going with lots of time to take photos.

We stayed in this Quarter. Heaving, bustling, plenty of narrow side alleyways. Full of life and too much to seeand feel. It runs to the side of the main tourist spine of La Rambla and offers plenty of small 'boutique' shops and pista, pasta/ paella restaurants. Weird shops, parlours, you name it. Slight seedy feel in places but everyone just a on with it. We stayed in Plasa D'agla and was close to La Rambla and the sea.
Beautiful site. This area of Barcelona is a must- see during your visit. It is a glimpse into the time in history and architecture.
Great for exploring. We had a fantastic day just wandering around the alleyways just off La Ramlas. Forget the map and you'll eventually see everything but wear good walking shoes.

Wander around and discover gems. We stayed in the gothic quarter and couldn't have been happier. It is a wonderful pedestrian area where around ever corner there is something special. Whether it be a quaint square, incredible architecture, or delicious little cafes - it's all wonderful.

Just like the title says it.. GOTHIC. Forget batman gothic, this is true gothic era times look and feel to the place. There is so many things to see and take it in as you walk in the many small and tight streets. The church was awesome!

Must see. We did a walking tour of the gothic quarter, using Sandeman tours, and loved it. A wonderful way to learn some of the history of Barcelona and to take in the key sights along the way. Definitely worth doing at the start of your trip so you can then go back and see some of the more interesting sights in more detail.

We spent days wandering the gothic quarter, it was so intriguing, so Spanish, I'd do it again... Our hotel was within this area and we spent days here, lots of little restaurants, bakeries, sandwich bars, the Spanish Bread! Omg! Little taverns, we tried so many small eating places, wish I had their names.... all great! Larger places where the food platters are outside to choose from, you MUST try the seafood platter with the razor clams, WOW! We found neighbourhoods where the children have only asphalt squares to play in, but others where there was a large sandy area with playgrounds, dogs barking in top floor apartments, we really saw Spanish life. We also stumbled on some of Gaudis more hidden masterpieces and were delighted. Well worth a walk, souvenir places with gorgeous things, shops selling amazing things, window frontages that are so spectacular you take a photo...it doesn't end. Small clothing shops that sell just what you wanted for 10 euros! Then neighbourhood shops which have to be seen to be believed, more of a homes front room, they invite you in.... The archways overhead, the buildings themselves, the feel of this gothic place, the depth of it is something I will always remember....if you get a chance come here and just wander....
Amazing . Gothic Quarter was something different to see from the bright colours that Barcelona is famous for. A must see, very interesting

Gothic Quarter Barcelona. This is an amazing area to walk around. There is some great architecture in the Gothic Quarter. We were there in June 2016. As it was very hot we meandered through the streets & laneways. We used one of Frommer's walking guides which we printed out before we left.

Amazing architecture - OK scene. The part of Barcelona is well worth a visit for its spectacular historic architecture and the layout of the streets and plazas. Buildings are well preserved or restored, so you really get a sense of the centuries that have been lived-out here. Local shops, restaurants and bars are mostly tourist dives, so not necessarily with much attention. But, it's a lively place.

Nice but too Noisy at night. We went at late night for a cup of coffee. The place is full of many bars at night were many tourists and locals get drinking tell late. The street smells and bad odors all around the area. I recommend to avoid at late night.

What an interesting place. Little attention has been given to this area of Barcelona compared to the more usual tourist sites, and it may not be the place for all people, but being from NYC I found this area to be most interesting and reminded me of village. The architecture is amazing, small streets, many local bars offer you a look into the true local Catalan culture. I plan to stay on this area on my next visit as it is more trendy and has numerous great looking hotels. I had dinner in a couple of places here, as well as visited some clubs and had an amazing time. A must see walking tour for Barcelona visitors.
Beautiful Gothic Quarter. This area is not to be missed. From the beautiful churches, to the little tapas restaurants and boutiques, a great place to visit.
Gothic quarter. Very good atmosphere lots of good restaurants and shops.The beach is well kept with plenty of restaurants and shower facilities.
precioso. the best neighbourhood if you want to walk around admire the buildings, the cathedral, listen to amateur opera singers, or simply eat or have a beer at one of the many terraces.
Prioritize This Over Las Ramblas. The Gothic quarter is a beautiful area to explore on foot. The Cathedral is definitely the high point.

Go in thw winter. It is an awesome neighborhood with great architecture there is no doubt. i love to take a stroll in there but there are soooooooo many tourists that kind of take the fun of it. It should be a typical neighborhood , calm, with typical foods and music. Now it is just a conglomerate of thousands of people and McDonald everywhere.

A trip back in time!. This is an amazing area to visit. You can spend hours just walking through the laneways, plazas and coming across cafes, shops etc. Just a great experience and the architecture and history has to be seen to be believed.

Breath taking!. Everywhere you look is just beautiful! There are great restaurants and bars around the gothic quarter too! Try sensi for tapas, milk and the benedict for food and the box for cocktails!
My favourite part of Barcelona!. This area is stunning - the buildings, the history, the stories, the boutiques, restaurants, bars, the street artists - all of them make this truly special :)

Save your legs for this one and dont miss it. But lots os time aside and walk, walk and walk. Take your time to stroll along all the narrow streets of the old town and indulge in all the old time wonders that was preserved for us to see. This is a must see experience and no review can do justice to the "must expereince it on your own in person" attraction. Every step you take and corner turning is pregnant with more wow reactions. The cosy hidden bars and restaurants is a treat and offer great food and beer at really reasonable prices. Watching some of the local living there is also an experience as they continue with every day life. Take your time to walk and experience and don't be in a hurry, even go back more than once and you will find more hidden gems !

Amazing place, full of secrets. I spent two years living in Barri Gotic. Such a wonderful, lively place full of twisting, cobbled streets and stunning architecture. Always remember to look up as well as around. The old Roman wall walk is fascinating and the cathedral is beautiful. Plaça de Sant Felip Neri is also one of my favourites and I'd recommend a night time stroll along Carrer del Bisbe.
beautiful walk. Full of history and great Tapas at end of walking tour. Again we did a guide. Go early morning or later due to we went while it was hot.
No two buildings alike!. no two buildings are the same in Barcelona, the Gothic quarter is an architectural masterpiece. a few great stores along this area too

The Barcelona Gothic Quarter Tour: Interesting and Informative. You will definitely get your 10,000 steps on this tour! We used Javier Lopez from Ovation who is funny, charming and very smart. He knows his buildings and cultural history. If you enjoy seeing cathedrals, the old Jewish ghetto (middle ages), and other historically significant buildings, you'll enjoy this.

Great Area for Exploring and Browsing. It's not a huge area and easily walkable in a couple of hours or so. The narrow but well-kept streets is an interesting place to explore outside of the museums and churches. There are shops, cafes and restaurants throughout. Police were stationed throughout and always felt safe. We started at the Barcelona Cathedral, heading to the back of it and circling back in about 90 minutes. It's also just as easy to start off the Passeig Gracia Avenue.

Quaint little area. Beautiful area of Barcelona. The cathedral ( not Gaudi's), the Temple of Augustus, part of the old wall and the Picasso museum are found here. Many shops and places to eat. We found a great empanadas place.

Very nice..lots to see. Walking through here takes you a few years back. A lot of things to see and little shops all around. We ate in a tiny place and were very satisfied, sorry I don't have the name.
Nothing special. Really dont get why this place is famous. Very crowded. street performers ok they are a bit more creative than ones in covent garden.

Great area to get lost on purpose!!. We love just walking up and down all of the streets and alleys checking out all of the unique shops and restaurants. Look there is a section of the Roman Wall, hey isn't that the Picasso Museum? Don't forget to look up at some of the hidden archways

Amazing. The Barri Gotic is a maze of cobblestones and little shops and eateries. There is lots to see and often lost to watch with passing buskers and festivals. Beware of tourist prices in the eateries.

My favourite are in Barcelona. This is one of those places that have soul. You could spend hours and hours walking trough these little alleys and find something new every time. The little shops, the cafes, the old houses, the churches. Everything is unique and very enjoyable.
Awesome!!!. Althouh I live in Barcelona,Barri Gótic is my favourite place for walking, it's like live in Middle Age.

Loved wandering around the narrow streets. We loved this area in the evening and the way the narrow streets would open up into lovely squares surrounded by wonderful buildings. Loved sitting in the warm evening air, having a drink and just people watching. All part of the wonderful Barcelona experience.
Must see. Nice quarter. Awesome small streets. Just get lost on them. If you see a small street with few or no people, walk that street.
Fun place to walk. Take your time and enjoy the interesting places. It is an easy place to get lost, but I would suggest that you not fight that and instead enjoy wherever you end up.
Go get lost. A great place to get lost - or better yet take a walking tour to learn the great history of the area
Amazing. We did not go inside any of the churches, we just walked around and looked at the amazing architecture, make sure you wear comfortable shoes, its a must place to visit.
Lovely. Wow what a start to my holiday. Turned around the corner to see this fantastic building all lit up at night.

The place to stay in Barca. On my second visit to Barca, I chose to stay in the gothic district and was not disappointed. Thoroughly modern on the main thoroughfares, just off of them you will find narrow streets lined with interesting shops, cafes and restaurants and other attractions.
Amazing. Definitely Barcelona is full of places to visit. I totally recommend! Try to go before others destionation,it´s a really quick visit doesnt need to spend to much time.

interesting local flavor. This is an area of tall old buildings, narrow streets, and a lively mix of bars, shops, cafes, and residences not to be missed in any visit to Barcelona. Located off the Rambla de la catalunya, it's well worth a lengthy visit.
Great for wandering. I spent hours wandering around this beautiful area of Barcelona. Even on a hot day the narrow passageways between buildings were shaded, which was nice.
