Narrow winding lanes!. We took a Trixi bike taxi around th quarter, down hidden lanes opening onto huge squares with amazing architecture!

Cast inlets. I've been a visitor to the Gothic Quarter of Barcelona on and off for forty years. I generally start at the Cathedral and let the winding streets lead me to wherever they will. The barrio is great for cute shops, bars, eateries and buskers. The street of the Picasso Museum is mostly a venue for a classical guitarist whilst the castanets ring in the alleyways around the church. Start walking and you'll be surprised
Wonderful exploration. Give yourself at least half a day and just stroll about. Keep the map in your pocket and see what you find. Its beautiful with amazing sohps, cafes and sites
A great place to wander around.. A really wonderful place to wonder around, very easy to spend an afternoon or even a whole day here.

We took the Sandmen Free walking tour . Turned out to be the best. Learn so much about art and history., one of the best tour including paid in many European cities. We paid 41 Euro for the Vatican tour, it was boring, over crowded and learn nothing.

We love the upper areas the BEST! . Be forewarned that the closer to the waterfront the sleazier the crowd. With in he Gotic quarter you could wander for days. We thought that the cathedral tour was so interesting and had fantastic views of the city. It's cheap and worth it. The Roman ruins and walls were fascinating but the crowd was dense and the later it got the creepier it was too. We definitely felt like the shops were more interesting, sage and fun to shop through closer to the Plaza Catuyluna.
Something different around every corner.. A lovely area of the city to explore. There are many different and beautiful buildings. Look up to appreciate them all.

Go get lost here.... This area of Barcelona was one of my favorites. Take some time to walk around and get lost in the Gothic Quarter. There are tons of great shops and tapas restaurants. Very much preferred this to the crowded chaos of La Rambla.
Gothic Quarter. Just meander through the streets and admire the architecture, chic shops and bustling quaint restaurants

Barcelona's Mysterious Hot Twin Sister . My favorite part of Barcelona. It's enchanting, (air)tight and interesting. Getting lost there is more lust than anxiety. Grab a nice sangria to share (or not) and relax in a cafe in dead end in this lively part of the city. It really has a whole different vibe from the rest of the place, definitely recommend!

Historic Core of Barcelona. Well... It is definitely the top area visited in Barcelona. However, I must say it is under the shadow of other historic highlights of Europe. So, if you had previously visited Florence or Venice or Rome or Athens or Istanbul, it is not as interesting. But this is your first time with an European old town, it is appealing. I must also add that the main draw for Barcelona is not the Old Town but the Modernismo, the art / architecture of the 19th century.

The beating heart. The Barri Gotic encompases the historic and cultural heart of Barcelona. It is here that the visible ancient Roman city wall circles, where narrow laneways still evoke a grand trading past.

Every corner has a hidden surprise. While traveling from one attraction to another, I did everything on foot so that I wouldn't lose any sights.What's to be said is that this quarter is magic with a splendid architecture in most of the buildings. There were even some "attractions" that I found without expecting.

So much to see.... And buy. The old section of Barcelona is probably the coolest area to just walk around and take in the narrow curving streets and cool old buildings. It also has a ton of tapa restaurant and a shopping area of high end stores.

Amazing architecture!!!. We took a tour that took us walking through the Gothic Quarter. The architecture is amazing and learning about Spain's history was fabulous also. Can't miss this treasure in Barcelona.
Atmospheric. We loved being lost in the maze of old streets and hidden squares. Seeing history unfold as you walk. Fine array of shops and cafes. Not to be missed.

And essential part of any visit to Barcelona. The architecture in this part of the city is fantastic. You need to walk around and take him all the sites. There is no city quite like this where you can see this kind of architecture. Don't waste any time at low rambler get out and see the various types of architecture that you will not see in any other city. There are also museums including the Picasso museum that is nearby.
Great walk. Suggest you look up Rick Steves who has a great walking tour of this area. The route picks up all the key sites and gives a reasonable explanation

Gothic tour with Andrew. An informative tour delivered with loads of humor and energy. Andrew is a fantastic guide. The tour takes you through the oldest parts of the city, is delivered by an Englishman who has lived in Barcelona for more than fifteen years and who had adopted the city as his own. Just great!

Magical part of Barcelona. If you want to feel the magical atmosphere of Barcelona, like from Zafon´s novels, you can find it in Gothic Quarter! It´s a perfect location for afternoon walking, coffe breake or evening drinks.
Interesting. Lots of little streets t wander around. The buildings are so fascinating to see. Absolutely amzing - such a shame places like this are covered in graffiti!
Get sweeped away by small streets. Great for a walk. We enjoyed it very much, small streets, nice architecture, cozy restaurants, what else do you need for the perfect night out;)
This is fun - A must see. Very crowded. Lots of tourists. It's worth it, though. You have to see it. Very touristy. Keep an eye on your valuables. Eat somewhere else -- as I say, very touristy.

So much to see!. A walk around Barcelona's Gothic Quarter is a must on any trip to Barcelona. It contains so much of the city's oldest history, and therefore, much of interest. I did a free Runner Bean Walking Tour of the area and I highly recommend that route. It's always a bit more interesting to get some local color and anecdotes to bring the buildings to life.
Super interesting architectural tour . For those of you who like gothic architectural buildings, it can be a great place to spend the hot noon time. The street are narrow and mostly shades.
Fantastic cathedral. Be sure to cover shoulders if going inside. Stunning alters inside well worth seeing. An excellent example of medical building
Beautiful!. I am so glad we stayed in this area. Every lane leads to a pretty square or a church. Wander around and have fun. Avoid Ramblas - overcrowded and totally not worth it!

Touristy but cool. Roman ruins in the Spanish History museum are impressive, and the shops and restaurants are unique (and in many instances, very old). But it is very touristy, so be prepared for crowds.
The atmosphere!. The atmosphere and the interesting buildings! In this area you can spend the day with your family or friends!
Love the area!. The Barri Gotic is awesome to walk around. The beautiful Barcelona cathedral, the alleys and quaint stores and cafes. Wonderful area of Barcelona.

Must visit. Our favourite area to explore during our trip. When we return we will make sure to book a hotel in this area!We spent hours wandering the alleys getting lost and felt like we had only scratched the surface when we left. Amazing architecture, many places to eat and drink.Within the Gothic Quarter, I would definitely recommend a visit to Placa Sant Felip Neri. A quiet square tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the surround streets. Rich in history and still bearing the scars of the civil war.

Fascinating and exciting to wander round. A good walk round old historic Barcelona . Alleys and bridges reminiscent of Venice . Opening into characterful squares good for a drink and people watching . Also cool to walk through if very hot .

A lovely historic area. A very interesting historic old area to stay or visit, good variety of resraurants and shops, market and also on the tourist bus route. Within walking distance of most central attractions, restaurants and shops.

Add to your itinerary!. Too much to write. There is so much to do and see here. There are restaurants and shops everywhere. This is definitely a must see when here. Lots of narrow streets to get lost in like in Venice!

Lanes of Gothic Quarters. We took a free walking tour for Gothic Quarters. Our guide took us through the history of Barcelona while walking around its narrow lanes. This is easily the most interesting part of the city. Luckily for us, there were some local celebrations going on and we saw the famous "castles" and folk dance at the square.

Beautiful. Very beautiful area in barcelona, lots of little streets and the cathedral is beautiful. There are loads of little shops and cafes to see in the area. Worth the trip up to see the streets and alleyways. The cathedral was 7 euros in and was probably worth that if you want to see those kinds of attractions.
old town. perfect spot to get lost in barcelona. nice cafes and authentic shops to discover. and also there's alot of little squares to hang out.
Beautiful - A must visit. Very nice walking around the old quarter. Lots of people in July but it is really interesting. And one of the few things free in Barcelona...

A great place to wander. This Barcelona's old town dating back to 14th century. The masterpiece in the centre is the the Cathedral called La Seu. Barri Gothic is a maze of narrow streets interspersed with squares flanked by old buildings. The place is generally heaving with hordes of tourist so it can be very difficult to really get a feel for the place. However visit early morning and you can walk about without the crowds - the only people you meet are locals going about their business.As you might expect there are restaurants and cafes everywhere. The food is better value the further you get away from La Seu Cathedral.

A definite must do.. The Gothic Quarter is the old Barcelona. It is full of history and small interconnected streets (if you could call them that). It was so interesting and there are plenty of little shops and restaurants to visit. The culture here is great and there is a number of church's to visit (just remember to take something to cover your shoulders or you won't get in some). Spend a day just wandering around getting lost, then have a cold beer or wine and watch the others also getting lost. This is a definite must do and my favourite part of Barcelona.
Nice!. This is a very exciting and pretty area right in the heart of Las Ramblas and Boqueria. Small alley like streets with no car traffic and lots of restaurants and bars. A party place for sure.
Awesome!. Wander the streets. Get lost. Lots of great restaurants, buskers, fabulous architecture and great atmosphere. Lots of areas to walk without cars.

Nice walk in lttle roads. We walked our way from Passeig de Gracia, which is the road with all the beautiful shops, to the Barrio Gotico, which is a completely different scenario.Small streets, little shops, more intimacy, big sudden churches like the Cathedral and Santa Maria del Pi, You are walking 400 years ago, with musicians and acrobats showing their abilities, pretty touristic shops, and tapa places not particularly good.The atmosphere is very good though and well worth the walk!

Like walking in a maze. A fascinating part of the city of Barcelona with marvelous shops, a fabulous food market ( a great place to lunch) and incredible history including the spot where executions from the time of the Inquisition took place.

Not to be missed. In fairness who comes to Barcelona s a tourist and not visit the Gothic Q. You'll find its a pleasant stroll through the lanes and squares with several epic churches to visit and several bell towers to climb and get some spectacular views of Barcelona.

Shopping on the other side. Those who are seeking for alternatives are on the right place for shopping. The old town offers a lot of opportunities to walk around and to find thinks beside the mainstream.
My favorite area. The area is amazing. So many interesting sites, Spanish restaurants, wine bars and history. We spent most of our evenings in the Gothic Quarter.

Don't miss this historic section of Barcelona. No visitor to Barcelona should miss this energetic neighborhood. Lots of restaurants, cafes, tapas restaurants in the midst of the ancient roman walls that remain from centuries past. Many street musicians and artists are found around every corner.

A cool place that connects a few famous landmarks around. The Gothic Quarter is filled with cool cathedrals, Plaça del Pi church and cobblestone lanes lined with shops, bars and restaurants. Souvenir shops are a dime a dozen here and you have to work hard to drive a good bargain. It is also within walking distance to the Barceloneta Beach if hanging out at the beach is your thing.But the coolest things happen after the sun sets in a little area called Plaça George Orwell within Barri Gotic. Bar hopping here is on another level. :)
Curamba. Life, colour, vigor, charm, warm and inviting. Great place, friendly people who are multi lingual polygots.

Missed to explore inside. Unfortunely we missed to explore inside the old quarter. We knew that there were endless aisle of beautiful gothic architecture. We just only viewed the buildings from a distance. Definitely we will go inside once we were there again.
Fabulous architecture . Great place to just wonder around and get lost. So many cute alleyways, shops to look at. Seemed like quite few places to eat too but the buildings are the main star.

Yet another cathedral. . We are frequent travellers to Europe. We have been visiting cathedrals in almost all the european cities big or small. Yes its good to see if you have spare time after sagrada familia, Barcelona beach ,La Ramblas and camp noh otherwise there is nothing much to see except the nearby lanes which speak about old Barcelona.

El Born!. Near Las Ramblas is hectic, crowded, and overpriced, but still a must see. Stay in the Barri Born of you can on the edge of the Gothic Quarter and you can walk to all, it is slightly less crowded, and there are better restaurants.
Nice place to walk around. If u want to know the history get a tour guide. We just enjoyed the walk around. There are lots of shops and cafes around. Street performers

Great area to explore, eat, and learn!. This area can appeal to all ages. Close to the harbor, it's a wonderful place for a few days at either end of a cruise. While there, be sure to include a Devour Barcelona Tour--we enjoyed the evening Wine and Tapas Tour with our guide, Fintan. There are also tours directed to families with children. It was a highlight of our trip to Barcelona.
Stroll around the gothic quarter. We had a hop on hop off bus, but preferred to wander round the streets and find what was round the next corner, beautiful buildings, a must got allvisitors

Lovely. There is lots to see and do, entry of places to stop for a drink and food. Came across street enter, opera singer, giant hola bloopers and an open air concert. In evening saw local dancers fascinating.

Amazing place. Must see if you are in Barcelona. It's the old city with so much history. Beautiful street to walk through and it's just north of the Las Ramlas street that devides the gothic quarter from La Raval neighborhood. I would recommend to do a free walking tour of the quarter as it ads another dimension to the experience.

Gothic Quarter Barcelona. We were staying in El Born which is charming in itself but the gothic quarter made an interesting change and well worth spending some time wandering the streets. Some nice bars some of which have live music

Beautiful, historic stroll through medieval-era streets. This is a must-see area of Barcelona. it's like taking a step back in time by at least 500 years. Start your walk at the Barcelona Cathedral and meander your way over to Placa de Catalunya or La Rambla. This is the historic heart of Barcelona that is not to be missed.

One of my favorite places in Europe. My second time in Barcelona, love the Gothic Quarters, especially the square near the palace, great place for a beer. Love walking in the streets in the evening listening to street entertainers.

Barcelona is magic. What a cool and Nice place
You feel in security everywhere in Metro , in the streets all night and day
The gothic area is enjoyable with all those loudy croudly restaurants
That the City of joy
Compared to paris this is a top

Stroll and relax. Great area to wander around. Worth a visit to Barcelona Cathedral - free after c. 5pm. Make sure if you are a woman that you have your shoulders covered and are not wearing short shorts or you will be refused entry. Beautiful inside - a mass was taking place which restricted the areas we could visit but there was some beautiful singing to make up for this. If you need to eat in this area wander a few streets away from the main square for some cheaper but delicious food. If you want to do the Picasso Museum don't bother going when it's free on a Sunday as the queues are crazy!!Worth a visit to the African art museum - also free on a Sunday afternoon and very cool to wander around when boiling hot outside.

Our favourite part of barcelona. my wife and i with our friends spent a long weekend at barcelona and did various attractions, the gothic quarter was our favourite, well worth a look around the shops and some of the old buildings, great views and atmosphere.some great bars and resaurants

Get lost here! . The Gothic quarter in Barcelona is a must see. We wandered around this area a number of times during our 3 night 4 day stay in Barcelona. So many wonderful buildings, quirky shops, cafes and Bars. You will come across street art, buskers and aromas to entice you.

Best free activity in Barcelona!. Barcelonas Gothic quarter is a delight to stroll around. You do not need to plan anything, just wander around, see the quality street performers of every kind, drift in and out of the shops, bars and restaurants at a leisurely pace.This is suitable for young and old alike. There is so much variety in a relatively small area that easily bored children will always have something to amuse them, wether it be quirky shops dedicated to selling only rubber ducks or quality ice cream sellers.Just hop off the metro and roam around is my advice. Be mindful that if you enter the cathedral, which is relatively good value, ladies in particular, you will be expected to cover your shoulders and upper legs if wearing short shorts. Fortunately we encountered the entrepreneurial shawl seller who wrapped up my partner for 3 euros!

Two day visit after Cruise. We spent two days after a cruise in this quaint old town part of Barcelona. We felt very safe even late into the evening. Wide array of shopping and eating places. Be sure to visit impressive and ver old cathedral.
Big must. Excellent option for a stroll. Beautiful neighbourhood, good restaurants and cafes in the area. Close to the centre and the beach
Another world. Not only did this area offer a lot visually but it also provided some great respite from the heat. We all loved the area, lots of amazing photo opportunities!

wonderful walk. This is an area where you can easily just wander around for hours whilst enjoying the views and the atmosphere. lots of little tapas bars, shops and the architecture is amazing. Worth a walk around just for the sake of it; but like the nearby ramblas it is worth keeping your wits about you.

beauty in it's every single corner. Its an old town heritage. I found it really exciting. Spend 3 days there in 2014 Nov
Been to Picasso museum was an experience..

Beautiful part of the city. I could have spent our whole holiday walking around the gothic quarter, the architecture is stunning. We stumbled across a Mexican street food style restaurant and unfortunately can't remember the name of it but the food was out of this world, so cheap too. People were queueing out of the door while everywhere else was half empty which is always a good sign but the service is incredibly efficient and we didn't have to wait long so if you see a busy Mexican on your wonders around then brave the queues!

Best part of Barcelona. The Gothic Quarter is the best part of Barcelona. There are more shops, restaurants, hotels, etc etc than one can take in. You can walk anywhere and everywhere, even down to the sea. Can't wait to return.

One more art!. Seeing quiet a few of the gothic and cathedral places they now seems to look the same. But the stroll outside is nice, many different things to do from eating to buying special item you would not have thought of.
Nothing gothic about it 😊. we loved staying in this area. Easy to get around on foot and public transport. Love the food and the sights.

Interesting history, authentic neighborhoods. We did an electric bike tour of this area so the guide new a lot of interesting historic points that were out of the mainstream.Loved the gothic cathedral, Roman ruins, and modernization but integrating the historical.

Great experience wandering the narrow streets!. I think the Gothic Quarter is one of the best parts of Barcelona to explore on foot by yourself. Just wander up and down the narrow streets exploring the different shops and cafes can easily fill a day, you never know what you are going to discover around the next corner.

Special but a bit confusing. This area of Barcelona is truly special in the sense that most medieval parts of Europe is not preserved this well. But... Be patient!!Do not expect to find the same place twice. The streets are many, and the look quite similar. If you have a mind for shops (like I do), try to memorize as many as possible it will be your way back .... Besides the shops the streets are very similar. But inside this place there are in fact cultural gems around every corner so take your time... And do not get stressed if you feel like you get lost. Find your way to the cathedral and you will be close to La Rambla and your way out of the narrow quarters of the gothic area.
Beautiful for a walk. Beautiful neighborhood. Make sure you spend here at least a full half a day. There are so many small alleys and shops to explore. One of the highlights of the city.

Like being in medieval place . We were enchanted with narrow corridor style streets full of little shops, cafes, bars, ice cream parlors and so many other things. Every once and a while we would run into a square full of restaurants and tapa bars with outdoor seating. It is quite magical and brings out the Mediterranean feel of the city. Unfortunately, the place is also covered with graffiti which litters the place. I wish the city would find the way to fight it somehow. Highly recommend going into the shops to look around. Many of them are much bigger than they look from the outside and host art exhibits or museum arts. Also, many shops carry their own design hand made items like clothing, shoes or jewelry. A fine example is La Veintinueve boutique selling shoes designed by its owner and hand made in Barcelona.

Plenty of things to do, and eat. The gothic quarter has everything you need, just wander around and you'll find something that ticks the box. We mainly aim for food and drink, and there is that in abundance around this area, can't go wrong.
Just a nice part of town. You can spend a lot of time, just walking around in the narrow streets, looking at different buildings, small changes and weird elements.

One of my favorite spots. It probably is one of the most authentic neighborhoods in BCN. It holds an old charm. So many great photo backgrounds. It feels lively and it has that medieval charm. It is a must!

Nice Stroll. Lovely place to stroll through in Barcelona. Great cathedral with Sardana dancers out front at 18:00 on Sunday's (very, very special to witness). Highly recommend popping into this neighborhood.

The Gothic heart of Barcelona. The Gothic Quarter is the heart of Barcelona, it is the very center of the city and the oldest part of it. During your stay in Barcelona, you will sooner or later come to the Barri Gotic. Why? Because it is home to some of the most interesting sights in Barcelona: the Cathedral, the Palau de la Generalitat, the MUHBA (Museo de Historia de Barcelona), the Museu Frederic Marès, the Placa Reial, to name but a few. In the labyrinth of old streets you will also find lots of shops and restaurants as well.
Excellent History!. Did a walking tour of the Old City and it was fun with lots of history! Plenty of spots to catch shade between buildings while taking it all in.

Great for wandering and window (and real) shopping. Very old architecture; narrow winding streets. Mostly interesting stores, some eateries, churches, fountains. If you are interested in the history and culture, take one of many inexpensive walking tours. Some are even "free." You can tip at the end. The also sell other activities and tours. Most meet in the main square next door.
Amazing Area to Visit. Brilliant Architecture, fantastic food, great people watching...just a charming area to get lost and explore!

My favourite part of Barcelona . I loved the Gothic Quarter. I wasn't expecting it to be as edgy as it was which was a great surprise. The street art and cool little streets to get lost down saw me wandering around them multiple days of my stay in Barca!

Visit it around 6 p.m.. We were in front of it around 6 p.m. and felt like in a fairy tale. Somebody was playing "Ave Maria" on his trumpet. I wanted to save these sounds only for myself and forever... There were many people around enjoying the beauty of the Cathedral and everything connected to it.
Great walking . Very nice area to wander around in, amazing architecture and cool streets and things to look at. A highlight of Barcelona.

I could disappear, here. Every twist and turn in this place is interesting. I am a fan of slightly shabby chic, living architectural wonders and also interested in social constructs, why we organise the way we live the way we do....so somewhere like this is perfect for me. It is one big shopping area, true, but unlike modern,brutalist shopping arcades, this is not relentlessly concerned with extracting your cash without delighting the eye in many ways. Barcelona is a place that is not preoccupied with perfection, but obsessed with living life in the now and you can tell this from a visit to the Barri Gotic. There is a lot of graffiti, some quite good, a lot of it average, almost all of it deliberate, a lot of empty buildings but it never feels edgy, just funky. The range of eating places, clothes shops, butchers/bakers/candlestick makers is amazing. I basically spent two days there and didn't get bored, neither did my teenage kids.

Stunning architecture. The whole area is quaint and original feelings of little alleys and highly decorative baroque featureI would say literally wander, have no itinery and get lost in the area to explore

very interesting and orignal district. walking though el barrio is a must have experience; buildings, shops, churches, taparias and local people make it just so true! Unfortunately just one NEGATIVE remark: the Placa REal was really DIRTY, DIRTY, DIRTY; and BAD smelling all around the FONTANA; I really cannot understand why, at night or early morning, someone is not taking care with modern means of the HYGYENE of this amazingly beautiful and historical placa.

Can't miss this area. From a woman's point of view you can't miss this great area of Barcelona. It's filled with good shops, small bars and restaurants. Armed with a map (a must!) wonder deep into the area and explore. Don't be afraid. You can stumble across some beautiful buildings amongst the alleyways.
Gothic Quarter a revival of the old times. We had our hotel Hesperia in this area, which we can highly recommand. Everything is within reach, and you can nearly touch the mediaeval times

Beautiful Architecture and History. Walking through this area takes you back in time. The attention to detail in the ornamentation on all the old buildings is spectacular. Even the rain spouts on each building is unique and interesting.

Everywhere you turn is a beautiful view!. GothicQuater is a great place to wander around Barcelona. Small shops and restaurants abound. History all around. The bells were ringing and guitarists playing soft Spanish tunes were filling the air. Bring a camera for great pictures.
Area Mixing tourist attraction and real life. Do not hesitate to lose yourself in the area which will allow you to rub shoulders with the real people...

Great experience!. Narrow streets, amazing buildings, street musicians and puppeteers, a great place to shop, eat and explore the city. Plenty of museums and historic buildings to visit, including the old Gothic cathedral. It can be overcrowded.

I just love this area. One of my favorite neighborhoods in all of Europe (that I have travelled to so far, at least). So much is happening at all times. So many charming streets to wander around in. I just love the vibe here.

Old town. This is an interesting part of Barcelona with lots of small shops
Eateries with inexpensive snacks. Artitecture, churches and photographersdelight

The chain stores have taken over. We visited the Barri Gotic about 6 years ago, and it was really nice and unique. Now it's overcrowded and just a bunch of chain stores & Starbucks. I hate to say it, but Barcelona has lost one of its main draws. I won't return.
Pitoresc . It's really nice. I advice going in the afternoon, sunset as the barrio gets a darkish and pitoresc atmosphere and is obviously less crowded. A must-go when in Barcelona.
Must see. You can't miss this if you visit Spain,.so much to see and so unique. The grand Cathedral is just amusing, you feel like you are in a different world once you are inside.
Summer in Barcelona. The Gothic quarter was really neat. It reminded me of Harry Potter when you went down the narrow side streets. Shopping was great.

Very interesting and bustling neighborhood. We enjoyed exploring this part of Barcelona. Loved doing the tapas tour through the Gothic quarter...went to the Picasso museum here also...a lot to see and do.

You have to love Barri Gotic. I never get tired of the Gotic quarter, it surprises me on every visit. Excellent food, from Michelin rated restaurants to holes in the wall, most all of them serve good food. The pitoresque streets offers great shopping, and the atmosphere is fantastic.

Just explore!. As with many of Europe's finest cities, Barcelona has a wonderful charm that can only be experienced with a measure of spontaneity. I stayed in the Gotic, which proved perfect for my interest in exploring its many streets. While I was only in Barcelona for 24 hours, I got around quite a bit entirely on foot, only using a taxi at 5am to get to the airport. The neighborhood's location is perfect because (without time constraints), you can find charming routes to walk to the beach or major sights such as La Sagrada Familia. Of course, La Rambla is a gem in its own right for those interested in experiencing Barcelona by foot.

Great place to explore. Just walking around the labyrinth of streets and wide open courtyards is interesting enough. Then you have little stores and sidewalk cafe's, museums and architecture that dates back to Roman times. All this for the cost of your feet and the energy it takes to move them. Great place to spend a full afternoon exploring.
Top much tourists. . There are too much tourists. And mostly touristy restaurants. Messy. Histprically interesting. I do not suggest eating in the area .

Beautiful . The gothic quarters are stunning to walk around. The beautiful cobbled streets and squares are perfect to wonder around. My problem came when I wanted to visit the Barcelona cathedral, I was wearing shorts and a t-shirt and was allowed in unless a brought a scarf to cover up (no problem) however a man without a shirt on was allowed in and wasn't asked to cover up. I have no words to say about this. Apart from that slight hiccup it's a beautiful place with lovely bars and restaurants.
Many stores and narrow streets.. It's nice to wonder around the narrow streets for a little. However, it's not the most well kept place (as is true for Barcelona streets in general).

In the center of the "action". I went to Barcelona with a school class and we booked at a hostel (Fernado) jn the Gothic Quaters. This is the place to be. Everything is within walking distance or you drive with the underground L3. But theGothic Quater has so many hidden gems. A must see.

Historic Barcelona. We did lots of walking around the Gothic Quarter. It is a maze of ancient, historic buildings, and narrow winding roads. The architecture is amazing and there are lots of shops, and supermarkets in the area.

Great time in the Gothic. We spent two nights in the Gothic area. The first night we ate at lot Candela restaurant which was a great find. The food was good and the service was tolerable. Walk by the Arc de Triumph on both nights.

Enchanting. Do not miss.. The Gothic Quarter was my favourite place in Barcelona and I ended up spending 3 half days here. The cobbled stone alleys are cool in the hot afternoons and some of the enclosures provide a lovely feeling of being cut off from the crowds. The acoustics here are fantastic and at any time of the day on any day (in the summer atleast) you will find musicians playing guitar or violin or saxophone or percussion or just singing. If you enjoy music, it is magical. You will also find magicians and puppeteers performing along with people blowing giant soap bubbles. It tends to be incredibly crowded right outside the Cathedral but in the smaller streets, the atmosphere is just lovely. If you do not have much time in Barcelona, make sure you come here for a visit. I felt it was an experience I will always treasure.
lots to see and do. good to sit outside and watch the dancing troops display acrobatics. Many small arts shops and galleries nearby

So Much of Barcelona's heritage is found here, it's a must to visit. The Gothic Quarter’s buildings pays homage to the Catalonian capital’s (Barcelona) medieval heritage. Beside the grand Cathedral there is a 2,000 year old Roman temple. A notable story relates to the plague where apparently the Christians blamed the Jews for causing it. The theory is that the Jews washed more frequently than the Christians (who bathed once a year!) and that the Jews traded in silk, whereas the Christians dealt in wool and the plague was spread by fleas off rats. As more fleas in wool, they were never eradicated so the plague kept reappearing. Many Jews were slaughtered by the Christians. An odd story but there are many others relating to this area of tiny streets/laneways where it is only possible to walk. There are some amazing places of interest and you have to walk it but do so only during daylight as it can be dangerous at night. Having said that, I did go to a Flamenco Show in the Old Quarter, did feel some trepidation walking thru the narrow streets with one other, with groups of young men staring at us. We made it out safely but I would not do this on my own. There are many bars and restaurants also to explore in this area. You can’t go to Barcelona and not spend time in the Gothic Quarter.

The tourism industry is determined to destroy this area but hasn't succeeded yet!. It was so much more authentic 15 years ago. Today 9/10 stores have been turned into businesses catering to tourists. If the tacky souvenirs would just go away... Some beautiful surprises still and the cathedral is worth seeing. Try look past the neon and tourist trash and see the lane ways and buildings and imagine the history that has happened in these lanes.
Great Strolling Area. Stayed in this area and loved walking everywhere, hanging out watching musicians play at the plaza, eating and enjoying gelato.
Lazy afternoon. Ideal for an afternoon of shopping at the little shops, strawling around in the streets, watch people whilst having a coffee
Super beautiful place. Very nice placem especially if you have read The Shadow Of The Wind by Carlos Ruiz Zafon before! It has it's own beautiful climat.

Very busy . Full of tourists which takes away from the charm simply because the waiters are just looking for trade and constantly bothering you and e shops are just full of rubbish. The food was nice but a little overpriced. The architecture was beautiful and the squares and back streets were lovely to walk around.

Excellent area to stroll around in this lovely city. take a diversion down a street off La Ramblas to find the Barri Gotic, this is a lovely maze of tiny streets with an abundance of chic, interesting and unusual shops, you would have a vintage dress shop next to an artisan steelworker shop next to a wonderful tiny bakery next to an upmarket furniture shop next to a shop selling just plastic ducks! dotted with cafes and small restaurants in lovely small squares, we really enjoyed walking around.

Old town Barcelona. This was my favorite part of the city !!! Do not miss it !!! Take a bike tour with a company called "bike tours " ... It was a great tour and we saw a lot more than you would see on a walking tour !!! The best part of Barcelona !! Hands down !!!

Utterly charming. Given how close it is to the sprawling and busy Las Ramblas, the Gothic quarter is a much more mellow experience. The architecture is stunning and the pace is just that bit slower. Lots of craft shops and narrow lanes to lose yourself in. Well worth a visit.

True Gothic taste. A nice contrast from the other parts of Barcelona, the Gothica parts of the city are lively with impromptu performances and gorgeous cathedrals (just a heads up thou, some of these traditional cathedrals may have a 'dress code' -- aka require more modest ware i.e. no mid-driff/torso or shoulders showing, skirts/shorts past knee are fine)
Must see. It is free to walk around the city and see these amazing sites. If you want to hear more about the history, sign up for a tour. There are free walking tours too.

a must see city. we went to Barcelona for the first time and was very impressed, although it is a very busy place we found the metro system is cheap and a great way to get about,we are going back dec 2016
Sore feet. Lots to see and do in the Gothic Quarter. Spend time just wandering around to see what you can see, and get sore feet like we did. Not to be missed.
Beautiful Place to Visit. Safe to walk around anytime. Beautiful buildings and great restaurants. This is a big pedestrian area.
beautiful!. It is the best place in barcelona in my opinion, the streets are just amazing! We spent most of our stay just walking the streets and discovering new places.
Yeah . It's ok but if you go during a power cut you'll have all your possessions stolen and you will leave the gothic quarter naked and covered in melted cheese and brioche

Photography heaven. Absolutely loved the area. We came across a lovely second hand market to browse round. Lots of hidden squares and streets loaded with little restaurants bars and shops..well worth a visit.

Just Beautiful!!!!!!. Without a doubt my favorite place in Barcelona. Very romantic, a lot of charm, with a lot of cozy places to eat of have a drink. It looks scary at night, but my husband and I walked very late, several nights and never was a problem. I can't wait to go back.
Perfect place to get lost!. My favourite quarter in Barcelona! Every corner you turn has a new discovery. It is close to everything!

Charming old part of town to wander in and feel the history. The Gothic District is a beautiful place to walk (and eat!). While we got locked out of the Picasso museum (get tickets ahead of time), just walking to the museum was a treat and not to be missed. You also come upon different traditions and activities around every corner (in our case, a giant bubble maker and parade of "little devils" with large poles of sparklers and firecrackers).
Walk Around and Lose Yourself in these tiny streets. What a fun area with lots of shopping and dining options to walk around either during the day or at night. We loved it.

A lively maze of narrow streets and squares. Just wander and try and find your way back. Pick a restaurant for the evening, grab a beer, some tapas or just a fresh fruit smoothie or icecream. Go into a church or a market. Just wander .....

A great stroll. The Gothic Quarter of Barcelona is an amazing place to stroll around, with new sites around ever corner. Buskers are everywhere and add a lively atmosphere. Myself and a friend were also lucky enough to stumble across the famous human towers of Catalonia one Sunday afternoon. Make sure to check out the inside of the Cathedral, whose vaulted ceilings and white geese (real geese!) are truly impressive. Entry to both is free at certain times of the day, so make sure to find out when that is and save yourself €8

Historical alleys.. What we loved the most about this area are well preserved medieval walls, buildings & streets dotted with small but good eateries , bars & shops. A very lively place in the evenings.

A Wonderful Place to Get Lost. Dark, narrow, winding alleys with a very interesting and eclectic mix of shops-- we spent several hours just wandering through the streets and stores, thoroughly enjoying the environment. Interesting medieval-to-19th century architecture and history. Definitely an area you should explore!

Nice place . The gothic quarter at night is lovely, aloof of musicians and singers that perform in the alleys here, everyone gets involved which is nice to see. The cathedral is nice and the architecture in some of the streets is stunning. A lot of restaurants and bars here so fun for everyone.

Beatiful streets. The Gothic Quarter will always be special to me as I proposed to my now fiancé here. The streets are beautiful but can be busy during the day. Late at night they are much quieter and far more romantic. Was nice to get away from the crowds and just walk around in awe at the beauty of the small labyrinth of streets. Definitely worth a visit.
Barri Gothic. My wife and I loved this part of Barcelona. It is a maze of a lot of narrow streets with all kinds of shops and restaurants. 10 minute walk from Las Ramblas. A must do.

So much to see. Quaint area with bars and shops in every alley/street. The Tapas was delicious in all the bars we sampled as well as in the Market area off Las Romblas. History is everywhere. Easy to walk around but never felt lost

Walk every street. Explore explore explore!
Murals everywhere, talk to the locals. Ask lots of questions and you will be rewarded with an extraordinary experience!

Incredible Architecture. The gothic quarter is a must see. It encompasses pretty much everything there is to see/do in downtown Barcelona. The architecture is incredible and the people watching is just as good.

Magical!. The Gothic quarter is a great place to wander and shop. There are many little food stores and high quality retail. It's all pedestrian, too, so you don't have to worry about traffic. On our trip we went to see a Spanish guitar concert at a cathedral in the Gothic Quarter. What a perfect way to experience Barcelona.

Neat area to visit. Lots of narrow streets and all the buildings have the cute little balconies. Lots and lots of shops and restaurants. We would check trip advisor before stopping in at a restaurant. Neat plazas along the way.

Adventure abounds. This is a spectacular place to put away the map and just start walking. Endless excitement abounds around every corner. Beautiful architecture and detailed carvings and sculptures that take you back to a time and place you've only dreamed of. People are so friendly and interesting to talk with. Leave time to spend at least one whole day exploring this area. The food and shopping and sites will delight all the senses. Definitely enjoy the tapas bars.
Stunning!!. This is a gorgeous part of Barcelona!! I think the best part of Spain is all the unique buildings and churches. Don't miss out on this special part of the city!

Beautiful Cathedral and Historic District. A very interesting area filled with narrow streets containing interesting shops and architecture. Don't forget to visit the Picasso Museum! Close to subway stops and worth strolling around in for a couple of hours at least.
Too beautiful. When you come to Barcelona, you have to put this place to your list. It is more than beautiful.

Past meets vibrant new life in Gothic Quarter. The Gothic Quarter Barcelona is the remains of hundreds of years of architecture, faith, independance, struggle and passion in Barcelona. Today it is filled with new life- an amazing place to visit and see history alive with modern bars, shops, cafes and museums- all in narrow, winding streets of amazing beauty. Walk it- but take a map its easy to get lost.

Take along stroll. We thoroughly enjoyed our stroll through the Gothic quarter of Barcelona. There's lots of great shopping here as well as gorgeous buildings in the graphic design. Go find some funky clothing shops and other items that you can get in other parts of town. It's nice also because there's a lot of museums here as well. Take some time and stroll around.

Wonderful area! Skip La Rambla and go here instead. . We LOVED the Barri Gotic. The streets were gorgeous and there were a ton of shops worth shopping in. We will return here. We also found a delicious bakery - La Colmena on the Placa de l'Angel as well as a good delicious, American style brunch restaurant called Milk. We will return for a second visit to the Barri Gotic during our stay in Barcelona.
Shoppy. Lots of little streets overflowing with shops and restaurants. Spent a day wandering about - great time.

my favourite part of barcelona!!. loved staying in this area!! so beautiful! tiny cobblestone streets and cosy historic tapas bars! so different to what im used to in Australia!! great to just wander and lose yourself! loved shopping here-found some unique hand crafted jewellery, Pikolino shoe shop has gorgeous comfy shoes!! food was great! also bought a jacket here. not just tourist shops but excellent quality boutique shopping.Go down the quieter side streets to find Antique shops and friendly local tapas bars.

Some very impressive historic buildings . Home to the cathedral of Barcelona this part of the city is interesting to walk around. Quite a lot going on with several places to get lunch and coffee etc. Worth a visit.

Lots to see. We booked a half day tour to see this area. You can do it on your own. You can get info from your hotel or use the Rick Steve's book. We booked a half day tour through Viator.com. While the guide was a sweet woman, she had difficulty in communicating in English. It was a bit disappointing. There are many great restaurants which we visited for lunch and dinner.
Put on your walking shoes and explore. Fascinating area, wear your most comfortable shoes and start walking! Go slowly & look for the small details.

Perfect place to stay. Our hotel was in this neighborhood. The Old City is a maze of tiny medieval streets that have hidden stores and cafes. Must see the Cathedral. The neighborhood was also close to the water.
Thriving part of Barcelona. A beautiful maze of winding streets with plenty of hidden gems throughout, with restaurants and bars serving food until late at night.
Fascinating & Busy. Loved the spirit and feeling of this area. Small narrow streets, busy shops and lots of bustling activity. Don't miss it.

Historic and cultural. Enjoy a relaxing walk around this fantastic part of Barcelna ans soak up the culture and atmosphere. You can do this as part of a guided tour but I enjoyed walking and experiencing it at my own pace.

Beautiful area!. This is a beautiful part of Barcelona! It is easy to walk around and there are lots of lovely restaurants and shops! The architecture is amazing! Well worth a walk around when in Barcelona!

Amazing city. I love the old Barcelona and exploring the little streets.
on 3 sides of the city you can find parts of the original roman walls.
I cannot wait to go back one day

Stunning. The gothic quarter is my favourite area in Barcelona, it's stunning everywhere you look theres something to look at, there's always some act performing ner the cathedral just lovely to watch and enjoy the atmosphere. Walk around the cathedral because there's so much more to it that just the front, it's almost magical with violinists playing down the little cobbled streets.
Lovely . Lovely place to walk round, lots of places to eat and plenty to see also lots of market stalls of nick naks and collectables (if that's your bag)

Stay here if you want to walk Barcelona. If you want a central location near all the restaurant and culture of Barcelona, stay in the Gothic Quarter. You will be close to everything including cathedrals, the Marina, the beach and lots of bars and restaurants.
Great area and very impressive buildings. Amazing to walk through this part of Barcelona. The Cathedral is impressive and the old narrow streets around it even more. I loved to walk around this area.

Our neighborhood in BCN. We rented an apartment in Barrio Gotico. And it was a perfect choice. Centrally located you can walk pretty much anywhere or catch a cab pretty much anywhere or jump on a number of subway lines. But it would be hard to find a neighborhood that has a more complete array of choices for food and places to visit practically at your footsteps. My favorite activity was to get up in the morning and walk around the medieval streets while everyone still slept. Soon you'll figure out the streets and find little shops, restaurants and bakeries where the locals shop. I would absolutely stay there again.

I could live here...in the winter. We slept and shopped and ate and walked in the Gothic Quarter, in the middle of summer, through the masses of tourists, and this place just gets under your guard so that you end up mesmerised by its cool, winding streets and laneways. My favourite thing above all else is the street art, finding little gems on doors and walks, small symbols of rebellion, many of them great pieces of design. There is much to love about this place, even for a country boy from Australia, but make sure you walk slowly and look upm down, left and right.
Great places to see, eat and drink!. Lovely place must visit if your visiting barcelona. Visit some of the local bars and restaurants away from the tourist trail to get the best food.

Favorite part of Barcelona. What an amazing area to walk around! Completely loved it. Great restaurants and amazing shopping.
Very narrow streets perfect for walking and people watching as well as non stop eating
A must to visit in Barcelona. Many of the sights to see are in the Barri Gotic. This is the old area of Barcelona. The history began here. Barcelona Cathedral was worth a visit.
Spectacular. What a beautiful and magnificent place to walk about on a hot summer day. The cathedral lies at the heart of it all and it is well worth the modest fee to walk around inside.

Very interesting.. A real treasure in architecture. Great boutique shopping as well. If your in the area well worth a look but look up and view the architecture it is well worth it. Can get very crowed as the street are very narrow but it all adds to the atmosphere.
Lovely area to wonder around. Dont pay for tours. Just walk around alone to enjoy a gothic area with lovely buildings and back alleys and streets. Some museums are available in the area.

Sagrada Familia, highlight of our trip to Barcelona. Be prepared to be amazed at this stunning piece of architecture! The architect was a legend before his time. Colour, light, shape and even the peacefulness of this building has to be seen to be believed. I cannot wait to go back as I do not feel you can take everything in in one visit.Just another amazing part of this stunning city, I have fallen l in love with Barcelona.

Fun place to explore. Great place to spend an afternoon or two. The streets are narrow in places, and it's easy to stumble across unexpected things, whether it's a shop, Roman ruins, a cathedral, etc. I would agree with what others have said that it wasn't as Gothic as I had initially expected. Some of the small side streets are quite dirty, but we've visited places that are significantly worse, so it didn't bug us too much, especially since most of the areas are quite clean. We spent the better portion of two days exploring the area. We took a walking tour our first day with Runner Bean, which was awesome. It was a great introduction to the Gothic Quarter, and we actually went back and explored more of the areas we didn't have time to check out on the tour the following day. We got lost a few times, but that was when we came across the biggest surprises! It's worth spending a few days exploring here, because there is more to see and do than initially meets the eye.

Another architectural wonder piece. Sit on the steps overlooking the plaza. Look at the fantastic architecture surrounding this church and than the church itself, another architectural master piece. Loved the facade, unfortunately the doors were closed
Love!. Being from NY I really enjoyed staying in this part of town. So fun and rustic, and yet hip! Barcelona's pulse is in this district.

Its like being back in time!. The narrow streets and multiple local shops make you feel you are back 100 years! Awesome Experience, Great Shops and the the Best food spots are located here ! Don't miss it!
Casa Balto. How wonderful to see this piece of living architecture. And how ahead of his time was Gaudi. The colours and contours and the fact that it is so well preserved.

Imposing and Magnificient. The cathedral has a very imposing presence in an otherwise crowded neighbourhood which is anyway full of historical buildings and historical sites. You do not see the structure coming till it literally unfolds in front as you take an unsuspecting turn into one of the many open squares with Cafes and shops. But this one just takes your breath away. Coming from a country which does not have too may mega historical churches perhaps we are easily moved - even by those standards - it is a magnificent site indeed.
Great place to stroll. Not as gothic as I was expecting and quite dirty in places, but still a nice place to wander around the narrow streets. Interesting shops and objects to look out for

Besutiful. Just stunning architecture my favourite part of Barcelona with its quaint little shops cathedral and little coffee shops and eateries It's a cross between French and Spanish influences there is so much beauty to take it !Absolutely love it!!!!
A must visit while in Barcelona. This is an area of town that every tourist just visit. Small narrow streets, cute shops and tapas bars, will want to make you stay for days.
Barcelona Old Town. The narrow streets were a treasure chest of shops, bars and restaurants. The only difficulty was picking the best ones, there's simply too many to choose from.

The corner of heaven for gothic architecture lovers.... If you love medieval architecture, this is THE place to walk in Barcelona.Just walk around, and loose yourself in the small alleys...BTW, if you like medieval Spanish architecture, do yourself a favour and drive out to Ermita de Sant Medir, 45 car-minutes from down town Barcelona...
Cozy but crowded. Its a beautiful area for sure but in July its sooo crowded and most of the stores seem pretty generic with the same stuff in them. A quick walk around here is enough.
LOVELY ARCHITECTURE. Well worth a walk round. Nice contrast to other areas of Barcelona and you get a feel of times gone by.

Just magical. We wandered into the Gothic Quarter after a visit to the market.. and we were so amazed .. we loved wandering about the streets.. we got lost but didn't care. We spent hours here and could spend more. We were there early.. so there were less people so I think that added to the joy.

Get lost here (Barri Gothic) now!. What a great spot to wander and get lost for a few hours during your trip to Barca!If you love old buildings, history and a bit of mystery you will love exploring the Barri Gotic. We missed this on our first trip to Barca- so made it a priority on this trip- we were not disappointed!Have no agenda and no immediate plans afterward and explore one crooked street and plaza after another. Eat, drink, shop and enjoy along the sights, sounds and smells of this amazing and historical spot. Be bold and ask the shopkeepers and apartment dwellers about the history of their their shop, apartment or the Quarter itselfStart or end your visit at the Boccaria market which is just across the Ramblas. Don't wast too much time on the Ramblas unless you love crowds and trinkets
Speechless. The Gothic Quarter is amazing the architecture is second to none... Must do the tour of Catedral de Barcelona for 7euros
Great place to wander. Heaps of restaurants and shops to gaze at here. Quite safe at night and we got to see the street parades with fireworks.

Daily Majic. An antic quarter of the city with magical atractions hiden in its small allies . The main attraction is the cathedral & the activities infront of it every sunday noon & the amazing oprera singers in the small streets next to it ... and in every corner there is a hidden cafe or a small church or an antique shop that is just too good to miss on My favourite shop is the bobble tea shop ... & the small chocolate street (petritxol) <3 ♡♡♡
Awesome adventure . This area is amazing. You can wander around here for hours and enjoy it. The churches, markets and alleys are stunning. Take your time to wander.. best advice I can give.
Beautiful area. A lot of tourists , but definitely worth the visit lots of small shops and narrow old streets. Beautiful architecture

Just Walk. This area, off of La Rambla, can be filled with tourists, kitschy shops, high end boutiques, the smell of piss and plenty of graffiti. But, similar to Venice, it's a great place to just walk and get lost in the narrow alleys where you will, despite the throngs, still find yourself alone on a peaceful narrow lane and realize how amazing it is really. And as you stroll closer and come up to the Cathedral from behind, you just may find opera singers utilizing the natural acoustics of the stone walls and high facades singing beautifully. I had limited time in Barcelona and purposely avoided La Sagrada Familia just to walk this area instead.
Living history. There is just so much to see and do in the Gothic quarter weather its history, architecture or the the more mundane eat drink and shop.

Charming Barcelona neighborhood. The streets are long narrow and filled with beautiful buildings, great shops and cafés. The true personality of this great city can be found on every street. Enjoy a great walking tour.

Gothic wuarters. Filled with little boutique shops down small winding streets (in addition to the inevitable tourist tchotchke shops) and dotted with history, the gothic quarters can please many different palates.

Wonderful atmoshere. Lovely to wonder around the narrow streets and you can find real treasures, and beautiful little squares.
Cathedral worth visiting, has lovely trees inside, and the plaza Real has very interesting street lights.
Historical buildings worth reading up about
Interesting area to wander through. Lots of interesting sights packed into this area. We enjoyed going through the cathedral, wandering through the narrow streets, people watching, etc.

Not to be missed !!!. AMAZING, this is one of the oldest neighborhoods in Barcelona, full of small streets, shops, buzzing with people and .... look around you ...the architecture is just STUNNING.Many time I just wonder the streets with my camera and sometimes I even forget to take photos, it is that impressive. Don't worry if you turn left or right, it is a safe bario worth exploring at any time of the day or night. Go, explore and enjoy.

Always worth a visit while in Barcelona. I've been to this area of Barcelona many times over the years and the architecture is beautiful. Yeah, you'll pay more for the touristy experience in shops and restaurants, but the setting is fab. Worth a visit.
Interesting and colourful. Allow yourself plenty of time to explore the Gothic Quarter. There are many colourful eateries although most don't open until later in the afternoon.

Get Lost!. Half the fun of the Gothic Quarter is getting lost in it. You are walking down a narrow path, when you realize it's a small street and a motorbike zooms up behind you. One of my favorite things we did in Barcelona.
Love it! . It's a beautiful space where you can see the cathedral, all the gothic monuments and walk all over to see beautiful cafes, different bars and exquisite restaurants!

Best place to stay in Barcelona . It's 15 minutes from the beach , 10 minutes from plaza cataluna bus station , and las ramblas is right in the middle of it all. Great markets , little coffee shops and tiny streets such cool things to see and get lost amongst ! Stayed at No. 18 apartments. Highly recommended.

A gothic stroll. Enjoy the beauty of the Gothic Quarter in Barcelona, give yourself at least two half days, be prepared to get lost and find surprises along the way. Picasso museum is wonderful, Cathedral placa is worth a stroll, take time away from La Rambla and just lose yourself in alleyways full of surprises. Love it!

A maze you'll enjoy getting lost in. We love visiting Europe and finding good local cafes to eat, or just to sit in the sun and watch people go by. We stayed at a hotel in the Quarter and ate many delightful meals here, the narrow streets, cafes, and shops were all we hoped for.

Extremely beautiful. Just wonder around this area and take in the atmosphere. Quaint shops and cafes abound, with endless back streets and alleys. Don't bother with a map, go with the flow and see where you end up!
Walk for ever. This neighborhood is amazing and you can spend hours or even days just walking around visit cafés, bars, museums. There is so much to see and experience
Enjoy getting lost in time. This beautiful area is full of little shops, restaurants, churches and hidden squares that are a joy to explore.

week end trip. We were staying in a hotel on the rambles an was taken in with all the charm an character with the Gothic quarter, busy place with all the interesting shops an a great place to stop have a coffee an people watch

Spend some time here.... Wander the narrow streets, have a coffee, a beer, or some tapas, this place has a great atmosphere and amazing history. Late evenings, the locals come out and it is the place to be

Vacation . Loved the quick access to shops, markets, the metro, restaurants, its central location is very nice. Must stay aware and alert as pickpockets are actively seeking quick picks, per the Locals.

Gothic Quarter nice. nice area of Barcelona you must have seen. Maybe by a tour with Free Walking Tours Barcelona. I did an other tour but that was less good than my experiences with this organisation.
lovely old world charm. just strolling around the gothic quarters is the best experience one can have.lovely shops and tapas bars beautiful architecture.safe at night

Unique neighborhood with many things to do. Barrio Gótico is a great place to walk around and just wander. There are many busy plazas, but also many small streets to escape the crowd. The sections of the Roman wall are very interesting and the cathedral is definitely worth visiting. Both are free to see!

So much history. The Gothic Quarter is such a lovely part of Barcelona. The old streets, the small shops and the history taht surrounds it all makes it charming.
You can literarly spend the day the there walking aroung, shopping and just enjoying the beauty that surrounds you. You can also view it by taking a free guided tour : Runner Bean Tour.
Beautiful area. We walked around with our guide and loved the area. Went to the Cathedral and went through the Holy Door.

Old City. We took a free walking tour, which was very well organized. It took us around the Gothic Quarter 2,5 hr. We enjoyed it thoroughly and would recommend to anyone. At the end, we gladly tipped our guide in order to sustain the service.
It is a great learning experience of Barcelona's history and culture.

The medieval past serves up fun lunches!. In the Gothic Quarter, the medieval buildings face narrow streets, and it's quieterthan the other quarters of Barcelona. But they have an unexpected treat: tiny shopsserving special cheese and cured meats, with rolls, and a glass of your favorite Catalanwine. We stood in a corner with perhaps l5 other people around us - as close as on aNY subway - and the good feeling and great food for almost nothing was reason enoughto go to the Gothic Quarter. We didn't see any churches that day (it was a very short visit).

Walking through Gothic Quarter. If you have not been to a medieval city the Gothic Quarter is a must when visiting Barcelona. The crowds are less than LaRambla, but there are still plenty of shops and good restaurants.

Let yourself wander and get lost. Go around corners to unexpected squares, discover out of the way galleries, churches, shops and cafes, Don't forget to look up at the little balconies, crossways and lamps hanging from the walls. Talk to the locals about how life has been here in the barrio through the years. Feel what OLD really is. Don't miss it.

Loved staying in this area. I really enjoyed staying in this area during our visit. It was old, the streets were cobbled, the buildings were architecturally interesting. Coming from America, I see modern buildings all the time, so I wanted something different when I came to Barcelona. This did not disappoint. It did make catching a cab to the airport more difficult and carry the bags was interesting, but it was totally worth it.

Charming area to explore.. Don't miss this area of Barcelona. It is a lovely area to spend a few hours or a whole day. Narrow streets full of shops and eateries. In the evening street performers are abundant. Every turn of a corner brought an opera singer, dancer, accordionist, violinist, etc. gothic architecture, a beautiful cathedral, hidden plazas. Don't miss the wonderful St. Josep Mercat, or the Placa Reial

Rich in culture. The Gothic Quarter is definitely a place to visit if you go to Barcelona, it offers culture with a chance to see the Cathedral and the old architecture of the city. It also gives you a peak into the busy atmosphere of the city and a great choice of bars and restaurants. I would suggest paying this little quarter a visit, well worth it!

This part of the city is beautiful. It's exactly the type of place you think of when you think of old Europe. It's a nice place to walk around, though a tour is probably better. You'll miss the history and the nuances if you're not with a guide.
Nice little streets, old architecture. Nice small streets and old architecture with also some nightlife in some extravagant cocktail bars, shops or just to stroll around.
the old part of a great city. what i love about european citis is the combination between the new and the modern parts of the cities and the old parts especially in barcelona.
Lovely visit to the gothic quarter. Great place to just walk around. Check out Picasso's museum and the churches. Have some gelato. Overall a very nice place!

Real character of the city. No trip to Barcelona would be complete without a trip to the Barri Gotic. Narrow streets leading into attractive squares. Bustling. Great for shopping, restaurants and bars.
Enjoy!

A Nice Area to visit. If you would like to go somewhere with a lot of the local people (an tourists) - a nice walk through area. Pleasant shops, and a very nice church to visit. Ancient Roman wall ruins still there.

Not to be missed. We loved wandering amongst the shops, streets, churches. Lots of food shops and restaurants. Gothic Quarter is next to Las Ramblas.
Lots of people walking all over. Keep an eye on your belongs. This area gets very crowded.

Wonderful to explore. This area is awesome to just wonder through and get lost. Or you can take a guide book, and enjoy it's rich history. Either way you will not be disappointed. Many shops, restaurants, bars, tapas! Spent our 1st & last night in the Barri Gotic.

Intriguing area. We really enjoyed exploring the Gothic Quarter - full of intriguing and winding cobbled streets which unexpectedly throw you out into a picturesque plaza! It is a bit of a maze and we made good use of the free map given to us by the Aerobus airport shuttle bus to help our navigation! Really interesting place with tons of history (not all of it as old as it looks!).
Wonderful space for roaming. This barrio was the prefect setting for a morning's leisurely stroll. So many interesting architectural gems!

A Walk Back in Time. The Gothic Quarter is interesting and well preserved. You can wander it on your own but a tour guide is really helpful especially if your time is limited. We did a free walking tour with Runner Bean Walking Tours (pay what you want when your done) and it was excellent. You get a real feel for what the City was like during the medieval period.
Gothic. This is the other side of the Gaudi Sagrada . The hop on hop off bus route takes you pass the side of the church but you have to get out and explore this absolutely marvelous piece of work.
Nice afternoon. Barrio Gotic is the old town. Really nice to visit, it is very busy, full of restorants. It is a little bit dirty place

It's a fantastic neighborhood, but you need a good map or an exploring personalityu.. We stayed in a hotel in the middle of the Barrio and it was great. But the Barrio neighborhood is like an old medieval town. The streets are very small and run around like a rabbit warren. Very easy to get turned around. If you do, it's not a problem. Juar keep walking straight and in 10 minutes max, you'll...


More

Gothic splendour. Barcelona as we know has several distinct areas,this is my favourite. A maze of dark cool narrow streets ,bohemian shops small bars all very atmospheric and then opening up into a lively plaza. Find the Picasso museum the history museum, cathedrals and enjoy people watching over an inexpensive lunch with a cheeky wine
Then come back for more.
Beautiful area!. The gothic quarter is a must visit! It is absolutely beautiful and SO clean!! Best time is to walk round in early evening!

Best part of Barcelona. I've never liked BCN much (stopped over a few days on cruises), but this trip discovered the narrow streets of the Gothic Quarter, full of boutiques, wine bars,and small restaurants. Now, that's my kind of place! Will come back to Barcelona now just to explore this more.

ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL. Streets full of surprises on every corner. A lot of plazas, interesant restaurants and beautiful buildings.
Gothic architecture on its fullest.
Great to have some Montaditos, Tapas, Pizza or Papas Bravas and go for a walk.
Take your camera with you!

Atmospheric and interesting but touristy. Small historic streets which are easy and fun to get lost in. Loads of history, churches and interesting parts, boutique shops and friendly people, make this a great area of the city to visit.

4 Day visit. Spent an entire day walking round the Gothic Quarter. It just didn't stop giving as we walked round from plazas to cathedrals, churches, monuments fountains and the endless little cafes and tapas bars
Beautiful architecture and iconic for Barcelona. If in Barcelona, you must go into the Gothic Quarter. The architecture is something to see and there are great shops and restaurants in the area.
Great fun aea. My wife loved strolling around in the Barri Gotic and getting lost and finding new places for Vermut, Pizza ne Ice Cream. Close to subways and the Beach!

Perfect wandering. Great area to wander around. Maze of small streets with lots of restaurants and bars. Most quite touristy but still lots of Catalunyan atmosphere....washing strung from one side to the other.
area. this area is nice and have historic buildings. You can find cafes so better sit and rest and enjoy your walk then.

Great shopping and Restaurants!. We had a lot of fun walking around the shops and enjoying lunch during our most recent trip to Barcelona. We definitely recommend walking around this area next to Las Ramblas.

There is always something new and surprising!!! . Absolutely lovely!!! It's amazing that you are in the crowded city of Barcelona but enter the gothic quarter and it seems as if you were in a whole other place. The good thing about the gothic quarter is that you can even if you walk by the same street that very same day, it's always gonna be different.

Winding walks. Full of narrow streets, nooks and crannies, with interesting shops and artisan workshops. You could spend days exploring here. Take a map as the winding streets are confusing. Small cafes, restaurants and tapas bars are found everywhere and many are excellent.
A wandering. Fantastic place to wander round.breally interesting and historic, happened on it by chance and wouldn't have missed the experience

Charming area to wonder around. Barri Gotic is a charming area in very central Barcelona, with narrow street it can look very peaceful (on the inner streets) but also very crowded (on the major streets and avenue). It's full of tourists year round. Many restaurants, bars, cafes and delis.
Good for shopping. I was expecting quaint narrow lanes with little squares and courtyards but its really now just a shopping area

But we love the old neighborhoods, so we are baiased. We wandered through this area a couple of time, enjoying the medieval center of town, but were amazed at the crowds, even though we were there in June. Apparently, this is a good town for eating, old charm, shopping and small shops.

So much to see .... The Gothic quarter stretches south/south-east from Placa de Catalunya, the main square in the city centre. It's a fascinating area to stroll around, taking in the magnificent cathedral (make sure to go inside and up in the lift to the top), the beautiful concert hall (must take a tour here - it's exquisite) and various museums. There are tiny alleys, numerous bars, restaurants and little shops selling everything - and of course some ancient architecture to enjoy as you explore (remember to look up).
Truly wonderful. So enjoyed walking around this area. So much to see from the fabulous buildings to street entertainers and good eateries ( apart from one Bilbao Beria). Wonderful atmosphere

So much to see. This is a great area to walk. Its gets very crowded in the day, but if you go early in the morning you can walk freely to all the sights and get some great pictures. A great way to see Barcelona and not spend money unless you want to.

The best in town. Just walk and walk, find some place to eat tapas and have wine, relax and then continue walking... And taking pictures! Picturesque small streets. If you have to do it at night, you will find it amazing too.

Charming . Just experiencing the quarter was well worth the visit. It was refreshing after all the hustle and bustle of Barcelona main centre. You will find some people trying to sell you the self stick and other trinkets. They aren't aggressive though so no worries. Need to visit here.

Old part of Barcelona.. Busy area. A few beggars outside the old church. Lots of shops selling gifts. Loads of cafes. Numerous ice cream establishments. Tourists everywhere with smart phones and selfie sticks. Plenty of narrow streets to get lost in.

Lovely. . We were actually staying within the gothic quarter on a recent visit and it's amazing , loads of quaint higgledy piggedly streets , lovely bars, restaurants and shops. My top tip would be to download a map to your smart phone as you WILL get lost, but it's fun !Just when you think you've mastered all the little lanes, you end up somewhere new !Give it a visit.

Amazing place. This little place full of history, is nested in the Beautiful city of Barcelona. Tiny roads weaving around a beautiful church, bars restaurants, quaint local shops makes this place so enchanting. There is loads to see in Barcelona and I really liked barri gothic and will put it as one of my favourite places to visit.

If you can get through the crowds, there's ampl photo ops. Lots to look at, take you time and check everything at your leisure. If attempting to check any of the Gaudi hot spots, book first or queue up for ever.

Lovely. Stayed in the Gothic quarter by the information centre and took us a few days to get our bearings- then figured out how easy the place was to get to other areas rather than catch a taxi.. couldn't quite believe we picked so central to what we were doing.loads of atmosphere and always felt safe- even at night- although probably a little more aware at those times. Shops were open till about 9pm... selling mainly tacky souveneirsTook so many photos of the place- very quaint and beautiful, but did question the authenticity of certain places- can't have it all however!Great place to also just sit and people watch... such a vibe...or walk around...only limited by your imagination

This is the old world feel. The barri Gotic area is what I like to see when visiting a European centre. Here the streets are narrow, the buildings older. There are beautiful churches, lots of little shops and restaurants. There are plenty of people, but it's not the rat race of La Rambla. Close to the El Born area, it brings you closer to the sensation of times past

A place so rich in history and culture. A wonderful place to visit while in Barcelona. The Cathedral of Barcelona, the Picasso Museum, and La Rambla are just a few attractions. Many buildings in this old part of Barcelona date back to the 5th~15th century. In addition to history and culture, there are so many wonderful restaurants and cafes to please any palate and budget.

Most beautiful part of Barcelona. Barcelona isn't that big of a city from a tourist standpoint so you are able to see a bunch of it in a short amount of time. If for any reason you have to choose, the Gothic neighborhood stands out as the most beautiful district. Lots of small beautiful shops and cafes are between historic buildings, wonderful square entrances, and beautiful churches. It is easy to both get swept away in a crowd or continue a bit further into the alleyways to lose yourself .
Hidden gems. Go for a wander. The food market off from La Rambla is delicious. There's even a temple of Augustus hidden near the Cathedral.

Free tour with Ponce. Really loved the free tour with Ponce, as it gave an interesting and really good overview of the Gothic Quarter and its history, alongside with some of its most outstanding buildings and people.
great walking/shopping. Great shops and restaurants and architecture. YOu can spend hours around the gothic quarter. I also suggest the bus tour.

Breath taking architecture - must see!!. I've been to Bcn many times before on business and never been to the hotel quarter before - now I know what I've been missing!Wonderful architecture, stunning church, lovely narrow lanes and quaint shops & bars (which are no more than a nook really).Definitely add to your list if visiting.
Worth spending some time there. It was a great walking tour experience. You can easily spend half a day walking around and soak up the feeling. Just remember to bring your walking shoes :-)
