Great place to wander!. There are many destinations to hit in the Barri Gotic, but it's also a wonderful place to wander! Like many European neighborhoods in big cities there are lots of tall buildings very close together, tight alleys, and the like. But this one oozes character at every turn. Beautiful, fun, energetic.
Very Atmospheric. This is a wonderful area to wander around. Stunning old buildings, beautiful old fashioned shops and glorious architecture.
Amazing old town. I loved walking the streets! There was such a vibe. I found classical music and circle dancing. Then a samba parade. So many quirky restaurants and bars.

History Abounds . A meander through the Gothic quarter of Barcelona, accompanied by a guide, guidebook, app-filled smartphone or a knowledgable friend will yield an afternoon's delight (no, romantic couples, not that kind!).Religion plays a central role in Barcelona's history, as protagonist and instigator; so unsurprisingly it is much in evidence in the quartier Gotico: churches, relics, streets named for a vast variety of consecrated or nominal saints. Narrow pedestrian paths with sharp angles seem suitable only for walking but one encounters the occasional vehicle trying to navigate the alleys, containing either a harried and nervous tourist or a small delivery van driven by a relaxed local, or occasionally a bicycle rickshaw. If not for the cobbled streets, it would be ideal for roller skates.Besides being an opportunity to hear colorful and imaginative stories, make sure you stay hydrated, taking a bottle of water with you, along with a capacious bladder. Restaurants and bars or toilets are not as much in evidence as in the rest of the city.

something from the past. Barcelona is a city that it was really made after the industry revolution.this neighboorhood reminds someone the medieval era.it is something different near the interesting an modern buildings the town has.i loved it.especially the view from the top of the cathedral

Don't forget to go here. Gothic Quarter is a great leg stretch or bike away from Barcelona Beach.. Stumbled onto this great neighborhood by accident. It's got a lot of local charm. Quieter than other neighborhoods. Worth a look. Small restaurants and a fresh food market. The park that lines the highway near the beach goes forever and is peaceful and pretty.

Photographers paradise. The history and architecture in this place is a heaven for photography lovers. Anywhere you point your camera you will end up having a great shot. It is a must see, walking around between the beautiful buildings is a lovely adventure.

buzzing!. i spent a whole day wandering around these little lanes and sat in various cafes and bars when i got tired. at every turn there’s a lovely cafe or bar and the whole place feels alive and energetic. i ended the day watching the euro cup in a bar and then went dancing in marula (which was free to enter just before 1am). marula was chilled out and fun with nice music. not a “scene.” i also did the picasso museum on this same day (2 hours). enjoyed that too. very informative. i also spent half hour in the cathedral (i did this in the evening when it was open and free as there was evening service going on.) all in all a lovely day.

Two centuries of history. The Gothic quarter is the heart of the original Roman settlement and for many years the core of Barcelona. The Roman wall, the Roman columns, the 14th century gothic cathedral, bomb damage during the civil war, and other medieval buildings are all fascinating to see. Three hours of walking encompassed a great deal but I still want to go back again to the see the museum and the underground Roman artifacts discovered in the course of new construction. A must see in Barcelona.
Magical!. You could wander around here for days. I loved the atmosphere and the variety of buildings. Winding alleys lead into silent courtyards and there are unexpected gems scattered throughout.

Best Part of the Old Town. Our favourite place of the older part of Barca. Lots to see, shop and eat! Great architecture and feel to the place, especially in the evenings. You can spends hours here. Oh, and don't forget to visit the indoor market for some of the best fruit, fish and veg you will see.
A wonderful wander. Wander though incredible streets with lively and lovely passage ways stop for a coffee or a beer. Slow down your paced of love de and enjoy it.

Love the Gothic Quarter. The Gothic Quarter buildings are beautiful and the Quarter has some of the best restaurants and shops in Barcelona! I especially like the Architectural Store for unique gifts. The Quarter is within walking distance of the beach, mall and Hard Rock Cafe. This is one of my favorite places to visit in Barcelona!!

Old part of the city. Great area to walk and get lost in the tiny streets to discover shops and bars. Don't forget to visit the "Templo de Augusto". Ask around so you are directed but it's behind the Cathedral. Few columns left but nice to see them between buildings. Go to Plaza Real and have a beer there! Pay attention to the architecture and decoration of old buildings.

A must see!. Stunning. Free early in the day (but do check). Not to be missed; you could easily spend two hours or more there as it is so beautiful. Note that you are not allowed in in shorts, etc., - ladies were being offered wraps outside (payable). In a super area too.
Another great area in Barcelona. This walk takes you to the Old City. We enjoyed the sights and felt quite safe strolling around at night.

A place to relax and just wander. There is so much to see in this area. Lots of tiny avenues and the occasional square with cafes in. Many unusual shops and businesses. Ideal to get a break from the heat and just wander taking in the charm of the area
Amazing architecture. Barri Gotic is situated in amazing old town of Barcelona. If you are in Barcelona it honestly worth to visit this place.
Beautiful medieval quarter. Highly recommendable to visit the Gothic Quarter. Lots of things to see, good food and beautiful churches.
Interesting. Great architecture. Not too crowded. Great little restaurants and bars. Free entertainment in the form of music and little acts by people.

Turisme de Barcelona Tour is great. If this is the tour provided by Turisme de Barcelona at the Turism Office on Ciutat 2, I would say do it. I took a few group tours during my Spain vacation. This 2 hour tour was the best of them all. Our female guide was very good and personable. This tour company far exceeded the 2 tours I took with Julia Travel. Turisme provided a map of all the sites we saw. Each person was provided with a headset so that we could hear our guide. The guide added some suggestions on what to do for fun in the square later in the day. This was a great tour.
Nice Place to visit. Great place to visit and take lots of pictures. You can't go wrong in any place in Barcelona. I will say Barcelona is my favorite City after Rome.

Happily lost in the labyrinth . The Jewish quartre within the Barri Gotic unexpected delights at every corner. Lose yourself and your cares. Look for surprisingly quiet hidden courtyards and secret bookshops.
Full of interest. The area is full of interest and so many things to see and do. The Cathedral is a must see - visiting between 12.30 & 5 will cost €7, other wise it's free
Get lost in Barri Gotic. The Gothic Quarter is a labyrinth of small streets, interesting shops, museums, and quaint restaurants and bars. Get lost in Bari Gotic and enjoy the experience.
You can walk everywhere. This neighbourhood is very small and you can just walk around without a map, best way to explore. ( you won't get lost). Very good for shopping too.

Very interesting.. I loved finding all these little finds in the streets and alleys of Barcelona. For the Gothic Church/Cathedral you can book to go in or sit outside and enjoy the view of this magnificent masterpiece.

Favourite spot in BCN. Full of pedestrian alleyways, shops and eats. Did the Runner Bean free walking tour of the Old City which gave us an overview and history. Then did our own exploring afterwards.

Very lively and cool!. Wandered through here to look at the shops and architecture. Beautiful area, can get very crowded, so watch your belongings. Street performers, cafe's and the cathedral- all very interesting!

A place like no other!. Allow plenty of time for this Quarter. Stroll both directions and look up. Walk and look from both sides of the street. Watch to see what others are photgraphing...surely you missed it!

So much to do in the Gothic Quarter. We stayed in the Gothic Quarter for 2 days in Barcelona. There is so much to do, so many stores and restaurants and history everywhere and Las Ramblas was always busy with people and merchants.

get lost. the best quarter of the city that you will surely love to get lost in. amazing building architectures every where, look up at the flowers, a nice place to take pictures, grab ice cream and enjoy the walk
Cathedral. Beautiful place!! Amazed at all the detail. we were there for about an hour as we had to get bus but easily could of stayed there longer. Really recommend visiting!

Otherworldly!. Lovely area of Barcelona. Nice to wander. Like taking a step back in time. Great city. Narrow streets. Our hotel was in this area and it was a great spot to stay. Central to everything. Very easy to navigate but at the same time you feel tucked away. All you need to do is turn a corner and your in the ramblas!

A Maze Ing. The Gothic Quarter was our first introduction to the pedestrian-only streets in the older cities in Spain and we loved it. You have to be careful where you are going if you are keeping to a schedule, but it's a fun neighborhood to get lost in. Our AirBNB was in this neighborhood which was perfect because it allowed us to walk through it multiple times a day. Also a great location for good restaurants.

Wonder around by yourself. No need to pay for this tour, is so much better if you wonder around by yourself. There's so much to see and enjoy, and there are many many free walking tours in Barcelona, at the end they'll take you to a restaurant and you choose whether to stay and eat there or not. Barcelona it's such a dreamy city to walk and enjoy. Low budget travelers will enjoy just as much as those travelling with lots of money. But adventurous travelers will enjoy every bit of it just by walking around.
Loves this neighborhood . You have to visit this neighborhood when you're in Barcelona. It has a great vibe, many nice restaurants and shops and it is fun to just walk around here.

Lovely (but maze-like!) neighborhood. If you're at all interested in history or old architecture, you must check out Barri Gotic when in Barcelona. This has everything from Roman ruins to medieval churches, all in a warren of crooked little roads. It's easy to get lost, but it's not a huge area, and you eventually come out on to some square that orients you. There are a lot of little shops and restaurants, so it's easy to get lunch, snacks, or souvenirs, although things are rather touristy. You can take guided walking tours of the area with a variety of companies, which can be a nice way of getting an introduction to the area (without getting lost!).

Fun Place to Visit on Foot. This area of Barcelona is ancient, crowded, I'm pretty amazing to see. Their tons of tourists and vendors on the streets selling a variety of fun souvenirs. The Picasso museum is also in this area and the museum has a fabulous coffee shop to visit as well. This is well worth it if you were looking for an afternoon walking trip.

step back in time.... stayed here while in the city and enjoyed walking the old narrow streets, so much history here that includes old homes, churches, Roman ruins and more. a great experience. love the vibe of the place=. the architecture is great.
Beautiful area, fun shopping. We had a lovely day walking through the Gothic Quarter and visiting the shops and restaurants. The architecture is stunning, and the shops were fun.

Good place to visit especially in evening. The Gothic Quarters are walkable from Las Rambla. The narrow lanes with beautiful architecture in building take you in medieval times. There were many musicians playing music in those narrow lanes. The experience was good. Good places to eat and cafes were there.

Very beautiful for a stroll. Great location and architecture for a stroll to appreciate the atmosphere and style of Barcelona. If you like to explore and see the decor of the city, this is the place to take your walks. Some great little streets with shops and food dotted all over the place make it also very enjoyable to get lost and to just roam free. Keep a gps handy to relocate your favourite finds again later on!
Beautiful architecture. Always look up to see the amazing buildings - full of history and atmosphere. A real sense of old Spain.

Fascinating area. This city will wear you out if you aren't careful. We walked through the area coming home after a day at the market off Ramblas. Tight street from the medieval ages. Plenty of shopping but I liked the streets the best. Wander about and take it all in.

Old Barcelona. The name tells the story - this is the medieval city of Barcelona, steeped in history. Ramble along its narrow winding streets,visit the an assortment of artisan shops, and stop for drinks and tapas. The Gothic Quarter offers a wonderful counterpoint to the touristy Ramblas nearby.

Beautiful old city!. This city has such a history! Learn about it before you come and you will appreciate it all the more. There are several streets and alleys to explore and if you can, do a free tour of the area. The cathedral has a history and several people with various talents will attempt to entertain you. Only drawback to the area are the beggars. Go to the big Bohkaria market and see the delicious foods available.
Interesting . Interesting part of Barcelona, lots of history and stories behind the buildings.quirky and creative architectures aswell as amazing little bars and restaurants! !!
Worth the visit. Wonderful part of town. Just get lost here. Beautiful narrow little alleys and gorgeous buildings. Go here and take your wide angle lens with you.

spookily brilliant. We stumbled on the gothic quarter by getting lost in the many streets surrounding, this great building has fabulous statues and its beautiful inside, a little spooky and eary but really enjoyed looking around, lovely and quiet and in the end a nice romantic building and surrounding streets, with lovely restaurants and street music.
Did free walking tour. I had did a walking tour in Valencia the day before so I found part of the info repetitive. Loved the buildings.
Quiet characterful streets. Lovely area to wander about and explore. Lots of lovely cafes and boutique shops. Especially nice on a hot day as the streets are quite shady.

Get lost in the maze that is Barri Gotic. Barri Gotic is a very nice area where you can just get lost, walking between the bars and restaurants, for hours. The medieval houses and narrow streets are also a good place to hide from the sun during the day.
Soul of bcn. This is the medieval heart of the city and not to be missed. It's really been fixed up nicely since I was last here 30 yrs ago. Lots of nooks and crannies to explore.

Gothic Quarter. This was an amazing place to eat, shop and just browse. The shops had a great variety to suit all tastes. You could wander around for hours, and still not see it all. Wear good walking shoes. My father who was born in Spain really enjoyed the Gothic Quarter.

Whats around the next corner ? who knows ? lets keep walking. Interesting places to eat and have a drink with quirky mix of shops of artists, bakers and small intimate and also bigger restaurants and retailers. Its easy to get a bit lost but that is half the fun and seeing where these laneways lead you to walking through super impressive architecture. Its must do !. You never know where you might end up as a surprise becomes a highlight with a cool bar to stop and watch the world go by
Historic section of Barcelona. A must see area of the "old" Barcelona. The cathedral is worth the admission. We were fortunate enough to hear the choir while we were there.

Best place to wander in Barcelona. This is the quaint part of town with winding streets and great food. Try to book a hotel near here. Many tours start near here so it is convenient for that reason too.

Beautiful . Words cannot express the beauty in this place! It's so olde world it's like you're right there in the medieval times. An absolute must see.. Take in all the little winding streets and soak up the real culture of Barcelona ❤️

Best location to stay in!!. My Boyfriend and I stayed in the Gothic Quarter and it was amazing!! There are so many shops and amazing tapas everywhere!! It was so much fun going down all the side streets and exploring this wonderful area! Every turn we found something we loved!!

Fantastic place to get lost!. Took my twins for a birthday weekend treat. On the 1st night we got lost in the Barri Gotic while looking for a pizza restaurant. Such a maze of intricate little streets, people out strolling on a Friday night, luckily there are street maps on most corners, we looked for a restaurant and found a beach! Good thing is, following morning we found it easier to navigate. A lovely place for a long weekend.
Gotic neighborhood. It's amazing to return to this quarter and discover new streets every time. Barcelona is a really amazing city.

Interesting area with plenty of places to eat. The Gothic Quarter is a great area to wander around in Barcelona. It's less touristy and has interesting alleyways and buildings to check out. There are also lots of places to eat, and we found a great little place that was very well priced and of good quality. You can spend as much time as you like - we were in a hurry but enjoyed our brief time wandering around here.

Awesome. Very very cool place and it is free to enter. It is a good place to go as well since there are a few good things to see around aside from the cathedral which is a very nice building on its own.
It's ok . It's ok to walk around I wouldn't go out of my way to walk around here again, but I guess if it's you first time take a visit one off
Amazing. Really recommend spending a few hours walking around the Gothic Quarter while visiting Barcelona. Don't miss it
Look up to appreciate the architecture. Walk slowly and stop and look up to appreciate the wonderful buildings. There is so much to see. Try a tapas bar for a late lunch.

Magical. We stayed in the Gothic Quarter at Hotel Ohla and it's a wonderful hotel. It's VERY central and within reasonably easy walk of most of Barcelona.The old buildings and windey streets with their multitude of squares and plazas really are beautiful. There are so many cafés, bars and restaurants to enjoy as you explore.Can't wait to visit again and this is exactly where we'll stay again.
Barcelona is beautiful. I saw this as part of my bus tour of barcelona and it's absolutely beautiful. It is so easy to get carried away in Barcelona and just keep exploring!

Just wandering is awesome. Getting lost in the Gothic Quarter is a perfect way to spend a day. There is so much to see from small shops, galleries, cafes, musicians & of course the narrow streets & architecture is very special. A must visit.

Perfect place to wander through and get lost in. Absolutely loved wandering through the Gothic Quarter - each building is individually beautiful. We wandered aimlessly for hours with our cameras, occasionally going in to a tiny tapas bar or stopping at an outdoor cafe for a cold beer. Each time you turn a corner there is something gorgeous to see!

Trendy quarter oozing character and soul. The Barri Gotic is a nice balance to Las Ramblas and the Gaudi sights. Lose yourself in the maze of narrow streets with its quirky little shops and beautiful old buildings - so much character and soul.You could spend all day in this trendy quarter of Barcelona, milling around and stopping for tapas and a coffee. Due to time restraints I didn’t get to see as much as I would have liked and I think when I next visit I will take advantage of the walking tour in order to absorb the full history of this fascinating area.If you get chance pop into the El Born Centre Cultural, an old market building that was being renovated when they discovered an extremely well preserved neighborhood from the early eighteenth century underneath of it. You can view the archaeological dig from above for free and there is also a museum (6 Euros, I think).

10 days of new adventures eating, art everywhere you looked, history, memories.. Walked to most sites. Bus and metro available and cabs reasonable and plentiful. Tapas everywhere, shopping for any taste or budget, or no budget. Cleanest city I have ever visited. Walk from 10th century to present. If you text while you walk, don't go, you will miss too much.

Place to check out for sure. Easy to get lost, it is a fascinating walk with some cool and interesting places to see and visit. We enjoyed a little old world and the shade in the warm Barcelona sun. Got to go

Gothic indeed. I do know why but walking through this part of barcelona reminds me of the old Jack The Ripper walking through the back streets of London. The name definitely suits the feel and design of the buildings in the area and walking through it in the evening can be romantic and at night, well thats when all the freaks come out and play, early morning(before the street cleaning crew) you can smell the urine and the after effects of the previous drunken night activities.
every building is beautiful. make sure to look up at the balconies. I developed a thing for wrought iron. Most built about 1890-1900, as far as i can tell. Stunning.

Interesting. Historic, interesting place to wander. Some great photo ops and tons of tourists doing the same thing as you! We took a walking tour with a guide so we could get a bit of the history and color of the area and thought it was a good choice. Lots of winding narrow streets to explore and many great places to eat and drink. Lots of shopping and night life for those who are interested.

The place to sit and watch the world go by!. Wonderful old part of the city with tiny narrow alleys and lanes, no cars!, bars and cafes in the squares, lovely shops, street entertainers, little squares with trees in. Pick a good spot, order your G&T and just people watch! Fascinating.

A taste of antiquity . You'll feel like you're roaming the streets of Jerusalem's Old City. Barcelona's Gothic Quarter rivals any ancient district in Western Europe. Don't miss the little hidden gems like the Temple of Augustus, dating to the first century, yet tucked away near the Cathedral behind a door. Take a look at the tragic past of the Spanish Inquisition when visiting the one of Europe's oldest synagogues. Don't miss the church Gaudi attended, often filled with playing children.
Lovely. Strolled round this Quarter in the afternoon and evening. It is a lovely area with great buildings, places to eat and shops.

Worth checking out. Located off La Ramblas, this quarter contains gothic architectural styles (hence the name) and a couple nice spots. I'd recommend checking it out, even if just to wander aimlessly around to see what you find.

Wandering through the mediaeval part of Barcelona a joy. Although there is some controversy about the "authenticity" of the Gothic part of Barcelona there is enough mediaeval quarter left to enjoy. Remains of the Roman temple of Augustus are apparently present but not being an archaeologist I cannot confirm. However there are enough alleyways and many small streets opening out into squares. Most of the quarter is pedestrian only which means you can wander around with some freedom and examine the buildings at close quarters. Some of the buildings have undergone reconstruction at some stage but they still fit into the overall Roman city. You are likely to find the City Hall, the Palau de la Generalitat, the Cathedral and other Gothic buildings, such as Santa Maria del Pi and Sants Just i Pastor churches. In the Gothic Barcelona one can also find the old Jewish Quarter, and the remnants of the old synagogue. Although it is still very touristy, and close to La Rambla this part is more attractive part of Barcelona.

Wander around a bit looking for bars and restaurants . Easy to get lost or turned in the wrong direction, but many of the locals speak English and can help you to get where you are going. Lots of small bars and restaurants that seem to attract interesting crowds.
Loved it! . Really amazing part of Barcelona! A must see, full of amazing back streets, culture, architecture, cute shops and cafes, street performers, and gluten free eateries!

Interesting and Enjoyable Part of Town. Lovely old town with lots of interesting architecture, shops and restaurants. Good place to just wander and get to know the City. Much better option than dealing with the crowds on the Ramblas.

Great walking tour. Did this with free walking tours.
Really interesting and informative.
Area full of diverse interesting things
Be sure to try Curros and Chocolate in Chocolate alley. Maybe a Tapas or two!!
Some different styled churches - Gothic and Catalyn "Gothic"
Great area. Loved the area beautiful Cathedral plus great eateries and shopping!! We stayed at the Hotel Colon which had amazing view of the Cathedral and Gothic Quarter!!

Fantastic. Beautiful area of Barcelona and utterly unique. Go back into the past and see the amazing buildings of this place. You just will not want to leave. There are also shops, bars, restaurants and more here. Anyone would love it here 😀

Old world and chic all at once. We stayed in this section of Barcelona. Old world charm mixed with modern chic. Fun to walk about and window whop. My son stopped at a barbershop and got a haircut. Many cafes and restaurants offering sidewalk seating. Good tapas, wine and people watching.

Filled with history. What a great place to explore and full of history going back centuries. Strongly recommend guided tour to get most from your visit. Spain has seen so much history and there are buildings here that date back to all of it.
Loved this area. Just walk around this area, visit the cathedral and enjoy enjoy even a drink (we chose Sangaria) at the plaza and the nice market there.We came back again and again.

Stunning architecture. Really interesting area of Barcelona make sure you take a scarf or similar to cover up if you want to go inside the Cathedral. Nice places to eat around the square lovely little shops to browse too
Get the feel of the old Barcelona. The Gothic neighborhood is really fun to get lost in. The narrow streets and old buildings really gives you the feel of the old world Barcelona.

Loved!. I could spend days in the Gothic Quarter! We found fun bars, shops, and beautiful architecture! Winding through the streets can get you a bit turned around but that is part of the charm. Plan on spending some time here!

Walking tour. This is a fascinating place that is easily seen on a two hour walking tour. I came back another day to go through the history museum and the Roman ruins were amazing. Very inexpensive and well worth the time
Lovely area. This is a lovely area, especially the church. Ladies beware, you have to cover up before going in. There's plenty of street sellers selling shawls for €3.
Peaceful Place. Nice bars, beautiful architecture. Pleasant strolling through the streets, cool among the buildings. Can be expensive for a beer in the area......stick to Cava! Sjx

Runner Bean Walking Tour was the best. We walked and walked slowly as we learned and delighted in the history of the Gothic area of Barcelona.
The Free tour is well worth it! We gave a good tip with great willingness.

Atmospheric walk in the old historic center. Very enjoyable walk around the gothic district. Go there in the morning just when the shops are opening. The buildings are very interesting and the narrow streets adds to the charm of the place. The cathedral abs then hall areas are very interesting. A very good walking tour for the entire city.

Wander Around. My wife and I only had one day to explore Barcelona, so we stepped into the Gothic quarter after walking half of the Rambla. The cathedral is the heart of it, and if you can find your way, you can finish the walk off at the beach. It was a wonderful slow walk that only took an hour.

Get lost in the narrow streets. We took a walking tour and a tapas tour which has us walking the narrow streets with cute shops and bars/cafes. We returned on our own and enjoyed wandering the Barri Botic streets that opened up into squares. A beautiful stroll worth the time as its indicative of Barcelona's past.
Gothic Quarter. Love the history and architecture you get to view while walking through the Gothic Quarter. The Cathedral of the Holy Cross and Saint Eulalia is a must see.
Bar Gothic. Beautiful cathedral with free entry at the centre of the Gothic Quarter. Lots of narrow streets with shops restaurants and bars.

Take a wonder. After the hype of la Rambler take a stroll around the narrow streets of Barri Gotic . There are lots of quirky shops , restaurants and bars just soak up the atmosphere and get lost in the streets . Find your way to the beautiful Basilica , museums and interesting Placa,s. Expect a big day of walking .
Pleasantly lost!. So much to see! So many different kinds of food! Tough to navigate but did not mind getting lost in the area!
Lovely. This is a nice place to see. Sometimes on weekends there are people singing opera near the cathedral. Lovely.

Gothic Quarter. Just walk across from La Rambla two blocks and work your way down to the waterfront. It's just narrow pathways that reveal all sorts of things.
Really enjoyed this a bit quieter than the Main Street.

Fun and historic . Such a beautiful city, the barri gotti does not disappoint. With shops amidst the old buildings and evidence of economic challenges in empty ones as well, there are fun Spanish goods available. Drawback is a lot of tourists and shops that cater to them, with somewhat sleazy trinkets and restaurants with English names to appeal to the timid tourist. If that's your thing you're in luck.

Amazing!. I've never been to a Gothic styled old town, so this actually took me by surprise. The buildings are tall and streets are narrow, and it feels like a cool maze on a hot day. Hard to miss when in Barcelona, and it's definitely a must on the list.
Beautiful buildings. Very nice architecture. Visited the Barcelona Cathedral. Very somber compared to the Sagrada Familia. Be sure to visit the Gaudi Museum just outside.

Lovely corners everywhere . This is a historical area of the city. You could barely see new buildings. A lot of buildings have very interesting decorations and designs. Visiting those bars and local shops are also fascinating. I had a nice meal at Sensi bistro and I found a vintage jewelry store called "heritage Barcelona" extremely interesting.

Love this place . During the day at one of the ubiquitous cafes, at night at one of the equally ubiquitous pubs, or just wandering around the mainly carless streets. I simply love this neighborhood. At night you need to dodge drunk backpackers and a multitude of drug dealers, but we never felt unsafe.
Amazing!. We explored on our own, then the next night went on a Tapas/History Tour through the Gothic Quarter. it was amazing and made me fall in love with Spain!

Worth the Time to Walk Around. Picked up a free tour, given by a very well versed guide in English. Great place to walk around and small streets with many cute little stores and great little restaurants.

travel back in time. to walk around in the Gothic area is a travel back in time and to sit Down and use Your imagionation you can watch Knights walking around or horses passing through.chatedral is beautiful but just walking around in this small tiny stone streets are beatiful

Beautiful. Gothic Quarter is the best neighbourhood in Barcelona.
We went there twice and we loved it. It actually looks like PRAGUE there.
Central to everything. Very vibrant part of Barcelona full of history.Close to a lot of attractions and just a small walk to the beach front.

The REAL Barcelona. Great area to wander, lots of interesting, quaint shops, cafes and restaurants. Fabulous amount of history, great to explore in the evening also, when the area becomes alive.
We always felt safe here between 9 am and 11 pm.
Nice area. This is a nice area in Barcelona, we only spent 1 night there but there was allot of building spotting today and allot of restaurants with variety.

Got lost. Definately get a map as it is so easy to get lost. There is a FREE WALKING TOUR at 10-30am every morning from the main sqr in barcelona. Plenty of cafes and bars beware of pick pockets and only keep to the busy tourist areas after dark

Charming!. My husband and I walked around the Barri Gotic a lot while we were in Barcelona. We followed Rick Steve's Barri Gotic walk for an informal tour. The streets and buildings are a picturesque gothic style. We also found several good restaurants in this neighborhood. The Barri Gotic is a must see when visiting Barcelona.
lovely architecture. lovely place to visit.All different styles of architecture.Din`t go inside,not sure if there is a fee but worth a visit.
Awesome. You cannot visit Barcelona without visiting the Gothic Quarter. It's truly neat and there are lots of little shops and cafe's.
lovely. Steeped in history with Barcelona Cathedral at its heart, this is a great place to wander around the myriad of streets with plenty of shops and bars to try out.

Stunning. Just a lovely visit to this massive church. So peaceful and quiet stunning interior Very reflective of the area in is situated in

Wonderful. Spent the afternoon walking around the Gothic Quarter, so much to see small back streets and lane ways.filled with so many shops and places to eat offering tapas and sangria. This is the best area of Barcelona full of old world charm. Very close to La Rambla and a must see.
Stopped on our bike tour. We have a quick visit and was very impressed. You don't need much time to enjoy and appreciate this amazing structure. We were awestruck by the beauty and workmanship.

Vintage shopping!!!. I went for a nice solo ramble around the gothic quarter, really lovely area. I specially enjoyed the vintage shops, I literally couldn't hold onto my money. If you like vintage shopping please give a lot of time to this area!!!
Amazing place!!. To much history in one enchanted neighborhood, i advice to walk it and go for tapas in different places!!!

Incredible Architecture. We took a city tour which included the Gothic Quarter. Wonderful history and quant buildings and churches. Gives you the feeling of what it was to live there a few hundred years ago.

Long weekEnd. Lovely and great location to the rest of the city. Pretty area, all the buildings are old fashioned but gorgeous! Xoxoxoxo

Soak up the Atmosphere. We loved soaking up the atmosphere in the Gothic Quarter of Barcelona. Great little bars and restaurants to stop for tapas and sangria and to just sit and people watch and remember, wow I'm in Barcelona!

Amazing . Just wander the streets and be awed by the buildings, the architecture, the narrow alleys and get lost. As in most parts of Barcelona, pick any plaza, any sidewalk cafe and have a glass of rosè and enjoy!

Can't Miss. This is the best area of Barcelona, full of character, old world charm, unique historic architecture and old wind-y streets filled with shops -- of course, unavoidably laced with a bit of tourism. Next time, I will find a hotel in this area.

Lovely area!. Lots of lovely narrow streets to wander around and plenty of unusual shops to browse. On top of that there are a few cracking restaurants for lunch or dinner. Tosca is a great place for lunch - do the 'Menu of the Day' for 12 euros and you won't regret it!
A Photographer's Dream!. I've visited Barcelona only twice and have fallen in love the place. Such a great vibe. Excellent for taking in the sights. Make sure you take a camera...!

Narrow streets with lots to explore. When visiting Barcelona I love taking a walk around the Gothic quarter. So many things to see and plenty or narrow streets to explore. Loved seeing and hearing the buskers while walking around and the cathedral is lovely.

Unique Ambiance. Would strongly recommend going during low peak times - either earlier in the morning or during siestas as the streets are quieter and there is a great opportunity take pictures with fewer people in them.to offer a unique feeling.

Great atsmosphere. Lovely area to wander around, with great little bars and restaurants and tons of history. Also some great shopping.

A veritable cornucopia of old and new. The Gothic Quarter has been named after the fact that it once used to be a Roman village which has since been fully absorbed into the city of Barcelona, and if you know what to look for, there are still signs of this fact all around you. Be prepared to get neck ache, as you need to spend time looking up, not just along or down, otherwise you will miss all sorts of interesting architectural features that make this part of the city so special. It is the mix of the old and the new that brings people from all over the world to stay in the Gothic Quarter. The Gothic Quarter is full of placas (courtyards) where you can relax, take a breather, grab some food and drink and enjoy the scenery, but to get to them you have to wander through the narrow streets and admire the architecture above your head, or perhaps if that is not your thing, window shop, peeking into the vast array of wares and goods on display. Many visit the Gothic Quarter at night, as it is vibrant and alive, with all sorts of bars and restaurants, competing for your attention. The night-life in the Gothic Quarter is lively to say the least and you will always find somewhere to have a drink or a dance. Expect to get stopped or be handed a flyer, as you wander around. Some even go so far as to almost drag you into their venue, but don't allow this to happen unless you wish to go inside, as they work on a commission. The narrow streets are stuffed with shops, and you will quickly max your credit card if you enter some of the more up market venues, because this is just one of the places in Barcelona where you will be able to purchase designer goods, or unique one offs that have been hand made. It is a great place to visit day or night, so enjoy yourself, get lost in the wonder of it all and most important of all, thank whichever god you happen to believe in, that you are in Barcelona.
Don't forget to take your camera. Wow .... loved it. Roof of my mouth got sunburned looking up at all the buildings with my mouth open.
Love the narrow streets !. The little stores and streets are adorable. went there many times, to eat, to shop or just to walk around. Had a great time
Quaint but be vigilant!. Lovely part of Barcelona, be careful with belongings and keep an eye on your money. Try getting a tour of possible. Awesome graffiti spots!

Amazing. Favorite part of BCN. . Can't say enough about this neighborhood. It's all around gorgeous and everything you come across is a hidden gem. Lots of little cafes, restaurants, and shops hidden in every corner. This neighborhood has beautiful cathedrals and tons of history. It's such a nice change of pace from the busy/modern city center and really makes you feel like you're in Spain. Every time I'm in BCN I spend hours exploring the little streets. It makes you feel like you've gone back in time. Highly recommend!

Well-preserved Charm!. The charm of Barcelona, for me, is in the Gothic Quarter. The tight, winding streets are so well-preserved and timeless. I admit that during my first visit to Barcelona, I was afraid to navigate these streets as a solo female traveler, so I took an inexpensive walking tour that was offered by the local tourist office. However, since that initial introduction, I feel that the streets were all-along tourist-friendly. So, if you want to visit the area on your own, without a guide, I would recommend that you access it off of Las Ramblas and enter through Carrer de Ferran. Ferran will eventually open into the Plaza de Sant Jaume, where the tourist office is—in case you need help or a map. If you continue past the plaza, Ferran turns into Carrer Jaume and then it is called Carrer de la Princessa, which leads you to the Picasso museum—if that is your interest. Otherwise, I would recommend using the Plaza de Sant Jaume as your reference point in navigating the gothic streets in that area (left of the plaza if you entered via Ramblas and Ferran). Look for the beautiful gothic bridge between two buildings off of the plaza, and that street (Carrer Bisbe) will take you to the Barcelona cathedral. If you want to meander prior to going to the cathedral, you might take the street right of the bridge street. It will soon bend right and straight ahead of you will be a building, in which is the Temple of Augustus. The Roman temple has been enclosed by medieval apartments—a fascinating sight. The temple is free but well-maintained, so don’t be afraid to enter it even if it’s a little neglected by the main tourist crowd that tends to take Carrer Bisbe instead of this tiny (nameless?) neighboring side street. Once you leave the temple, you can continue along this small street which will wind to the back of the cathedral. Once you see the massive structure, you will know that you are not lost, so just enjoy the surrounding architecture and follow along the edges of the cathedral. You will also pass the cathedral’s cloister gardens on this route, so you might head inside and then access the cathedral through the garden entrance. Once you build your confidence in exploring these dark, narrow streets, adventure through the rest of the gothic quarter. There are so many gems to be found here! Shoppers will especially be pleased by the unique stores. My favorite is the Basilica Galeria, a jewelry-lovers haven (off Carrer Bisbe at Carrer Sant Sever)!
Love it!. We walked there both at day- and nighttime. Very beautiful district with little shops everywhere. Loved it!
Loved it!. Our favorite part of Barcelona. . Barri Gotic was a wonderful place to explore, where the old is mixed with the new.

Quite Blah!. Yeah, nice if you're coming from middle America and your cookie cutter homes. I would also highly suggest going into the Cathedral when it is free (Paid between 1-5pm if I remember correctly) and seeing the 12 white geese that live inside the church. Very unique!

Hidden squares and playgrounds . Went for a walk around, plenty to see, little squares with cafes dotted around and in some there are clean, enclosed play grounds, perfect to sit for a while whilst the kids take a break and blow off some steam :)
it is a must.. Real gothic architecture, full of bars and great restaurants. Have a walk and then choose where to dink or eat. I recommend places with lots of people.

Medieval Section of barcelona. The Gothic Quarter is the tangle of narrow streets and passageways which includes the Barcelona Cathedral. It runs from the Las Ramblas to Via Laietana and unless you are a local it is a maze of streets which are easy to get lost in or to relocate at a later time. If you go through this area with a trained guide, the whole area is full of history and stories of intrigue. If you go by yourself it can prove to be a jumble of meaningless old streets and buildings where you never turn up where you expected to. So get a trained guide and enjoy the area.

So much to see and do!!. Endless narrow streets and alleys to wander, old Roman walls to discover, and several medieval cathedrals at which to marvel. Lots of shops, restaurants, and small hotels in this historic neighborhood.

Fantastic location. A must see while in Barcelona very close to plaza Catalunya and La Rambla you can discover the area on foot and enjoy the architecture of the Gothic churches especially the Cathedral.
Typical old European city. It was nice to stroll the streets ,get lost and enjoy so many places that we discovered.Shop and restaurants owners were very friendly.

I would encourage anyone who has an interest in architecture to vist not only this structure but the work of Gaudi as well while here in Barcelona.

A Wanderers delight. A great place to wander and explore. The narrow streets are very interesting and when hot they are a great place to escape the heat. Not so sure how safe i would feel after dark, but great during the day.

Scenic, Romantic, Barcelona's best. I love wondering the streets of the old town. Every now and again you get rewarded with an amazing cathedral, great ice cream stop or bar. My favourite thing to do in the evenings.

Movie Quest. Very interesting place for those who like the old towns.Narrow streets with the little squares where you can find cozy restaurants and coffee shops. And whenever the less, the movies have been created there. I was following "The Perfume - Story of the Murderer"Entertaining!

the charming part of Barcelona. the Gothic Quarter is in fact the old town of Barcelona and the most romantic one ; it is located between the Las Ramblas boulevard and the Mediteranian seafront to the northern part of the city;here we find the narrow,picturesque streets with little shops,art galleries,small cafes and bars and naturally the old buildings ; it is always a pleasure to take a walk through the Gothic Quarter; most important to see. In the Gothic Quarter are the Cathedral of Barcelona and the Picasso Museum ;

Enchanting! . Three of us explored this area on rented bicycles. It's the best way to check out the area, and you can make stops along the way! We were overwhelmed by the beauty of this part of Barcelona. It was a little crowded though, and I'm sure it would be even more so during summer!

A Lot of History for One Quarter.. Our family thoroughly enjoyed the Gothic Quarter. Highly recommended for lovers of history. I was personally enthralled by the amount of history in this one quarter.

Great . This is a lovely area lots of little shops and the church is beautiful if you go before 1pm or after 5pm you can go into the church for free we walked round and in and out of the maze of streets getting a tasty snack at the bakery.
For a quiet walk at summer evening. It is a perfect quarter to have a romantic walk with your partner at twilight. During the day it is crowd of people.
Shopping!!!. Loved by the ladies. great to wander in the narrow streets. Opens late in the morning and stays vibrant into the evening.

Barrio Gotico. The Gotic barrio is a place situated in the old city and the architecture will make you feel like going back in time. There is also multiple places to have an excellent time with friends and family; there are so many tapas and coffee places that time won't allow to visit them all.

Free Tour. We took a free tour with Bean Runner and it was the best we did during our visit to Spain. The guide was informed and his English was excellent. He also had suggestions for us for our remaining days in Barcelona.

Stayed and played in the Gothic Quarter . Barcelona is a huge city. We stayed in the Gothic Quarter in the Laeitana Palace and walked all around the old city. We took a walking tour and Picasso museum tour through Barcelona Tourist Bureau (booked online and had the best guides ever) once you get your bearings the old city is full of history, shopping, bars and restaurants. So many great places to eat. Try the small hole in the wall bakeries and have a cake and coffee. The street of books is the perfect place to by a beautiful journal. We loved Barcelona so much. Stay in the old part of town - you won't be sorry.
History in a word. This part of Barcelona is amazing. A lot of small bars and tapas restaurants. Also loads of neat individual shops this is a must.

Exquisite part of BCN - not to be missed!. So much beauty and history here, it's very easy to walk around the gorgeous Gothic Quarter--we got a great quality paper map from our excellent Runner Bean free walking tour. Don't try to use the GPS navigation on your phone; I suggest going analog for this experience. We thought--because of all the tiny winding maze-like streets--that we were going to get lost, but we only got lost in the exquisite charm and humbling history. The Cathedral, Placa Reial, El Call, the list goes on and on!
Unique. The architecture is very unique. The Cathedral was amazing. Reminds me Of whiches and warlock stories. Decorated with lots of gorgoils. We certainly have nothing like this in Canada.
Great part of the city to explore!. Just wander through this quarter and get lost in the majestic part of Barcelona! Really great and cheap eats can be found here as well

Impressive area. I have walked through this quarter by night, by one can still see the beauty it incorporates in it, starting from the Barcelona Cathedral and many others. It is a must thing for everyone who goes to Barcelona to go around this quarter and this for me reminded me of the old cities which are in Malta especially Mdina.

Picturesque. Students of history and culture will definitely enjoy strolling along the streets of the Gothic Quarter. Booked a tapas tour that included a historical walk of this area; the next two days, my daughter and I discovered even more gems, including a place of flamenco dancers.

Easter getaway. Whilst visiting over the easter holiday we decided to have a walk into the Gothic Quarter. What a great idea this has to be the best decision me made whilst in Barcelona, we must of visited everyday there after during our visit. Lovely coffee shops dotted around, the electric atmosphere with people dancing to the brand that were playing on the steps of one of the most beautiful building I have ever witnessed. This is definitely a must.

Loved this. Very authentic back streets , good shopping , go to the shops further down I front of the Estacio. de France train St.back of the Ramblas. Near the Picasso museum. Great for food and shopping.

I would love to live there!. The Barrio Gotico is simply amazing! Absolutely the best district of Barcelona. The small streets are so characteristics and you feel like being in another century. What I loved most was the cathedral of Santa Maria del Mar.

One of my favorite areas of the city. We started one afternoon near the foot of Las Ramblas - and spent the next day and a half exploring all the nooks and crannies of this area. In daylight, the small twisting streets are beautiful and evoke a feeling of days gone by - at night, as the crowds thin out, the area picks up a less restful vibe as more homeless emerge - we had an uneasy feeling late at night on a couple of streets with our way forward partially blocked by scruffy-looking characters.From our standpoint - an area of the city not to be missed - particular in daylight or early evening!

Just Get Lost. This really is a fun place to just wander. See an alley...and explore it. As Yogi Berra said: "when you come to a fork in the road, take it!" Nothing fits this area better. There are shops and restaurants and people watching. This is fun a and easy city to walk, so do it!
Stunning. Very interesting architecture,and a lot of places to see,there's plenty of shops around and restaurants

Amazing buildings throughout . We walked 25,000 steps today, wow around every corner, shops, restaurants, museums, churches filled our entire day. Even a military wedding at Santa Maria del Mar. Inside was breathtaking, take the 2$ trip to the roof.

Beautiful neighbourhood. Really a beautiful place, the gothic cathedral is beautiful (you have to pay to get inside) and the whole ambiance is great. Streets are very narrow and it's very easy to get lost, but totally worth the time. Nice boutiques and small shops selling clothes and little cafes.
wow factor . Great place and another reason to go to Barcelona. Be sure to grab a coffee and pastry mid morning and take it all in.

Gothic beautiful. The most amazing besutifjl buildings, set off in small narrow streets with the lovely balconies each is different. The shops are in keeping with the architecture and there are a maze of them. We walked about untill gone 11pm and felt quite safe. Just as you think youve have seen it all another small turn brings you another discovery. Lots of luxury shops and amenitites
Such a picturesque area. Best to just roam and absorb the atmosphere. Cathedral is strict on covering up so definitely no shorts or bare shoulders.
Great walking tour off the Rambla.. This area has a blend of high end hotels and restaurants mixed with the masses walking the nearby Rambla street.

Wonderful area to explore!. Lots of shops and sights to explore in the Barrio Gotico. The streets are fun to wander and mix into the bustle of the daily foot traffic. Start at the top of La Rambla just below the Plaza de Catalunya work your way down to the Columbus Monument near the water.

Calling all History Buffs. We saw the Barri Gotic with an official, licensed Barcelona guide. While expensive, I would've walked right through the area without understanding its historic, religious and governmental significance. And it's a safe bet we would've gotten lost amoung the side streets. If you're hiring a guide (available through most hotels), make this one of the places you visit.

amazing!. I was there every day at night and every time I saw something new. To those who love to walk and see small shops and different design of shops-I recommend- the streets are amazing. also full with shops of Zara and desigual. It was just fun.

A great place to wander and explore. I spent a few hours just wandering around and grabbing a coffee. The narrow streets and abundant shops are everywhere. I also was in search of a folding knife for picnicking and found a specialty store that had exactly what I wanted!Fun and free - if you stay out of the shops!

Great Historical Area. The Gothic Quarter has some gorgeous older buildings that gives the area a lot of character. There are many small shops and restaurants. We enjoyed it so much we went there more than once on this trip.
AMAZIG!!. Spent an entire two days here, I have the place memorized! I love it, I recommend the free tours that meet in the gothic quarter

Great location!. In the heart of the Gothic Quarter is a place called "Palau Dalmases" - a palace built between the 15th and 16th century - where you can see live performances (Spanish music and dancing) in a small cozy environment of no more than 25 people for approximately 20 euro. This includes a wine or cocktail. Our favorite and most affordable tapas bar was "Tapadu", close to the Picasso Museum. There is a guy handing out fliers for this restaurant as it is slightly hidden from the main street. Only €1.50 for most tapas. Very delicious!

Beautiful area just off the Ramblas. Great for a stroll in the daytime and worth a visit to the many tavernas offering sangria and tapas.
Lots to admire in every twist and turn as well as a magnificent cathedral

F1 weekend . Brilliant ...
This is a fabulous place to go .
Cafés. Bars and tapas ..
Plenty of entertainment going on
Something for everyone .
We would go again given the chance .

Beautiful architecture, a real historical gem.. A very colourful place. Historical and interesting places to visit apart, the quarter offers a unique, valuable experience, a walk through one of Barcelona's most sought places.
Lots of shops, cafés and restaurants as well. Full of people day and night.

So much to see - make sure to allow enough time. Barri Gotic is a wonderful place for a leisurely stroll - especially if you like to punctuate your sight-seeing with frequent refreshment stops at the local bars and cafes. We loved the relaxed atmosphere, the constantly changing street scene, the amazing friendliness of the local people.
Don't plan. Don't book a guided tour. Just stroll.....and discover.

A very nice neighbourhood!!!. I love this area. The small alleys, a lot of people/tourist walking around but it's not annoying. I came across a very nice street performance. It basically like a puppet show, a very entertaining one and you can really tell that the performers (2 ladies) gave so much thoughts and efforts into it.I also came across an older man singing in his guitar. Man oh man his voice was so so so good and SOOTHING. He was old, probably in his mid 50 or maybe 60s. He dressed himself very nice. Converse, hat, i think jeans and rolled up sleeve blue shirt. I forgot the exact area, i think it's near an art museum? (i honestly forgot). There was a corner and stairs where people can sit, and a cafe with outdoor chairs.I wonder around this area for hours i think and took quite a lot of pic. The small alleys have some murals / street paintings.
Great place to see. It's a great place to come by. The narrow streets, old buildings, the big church, the small shops and the good food is well worth a afternoon or evening visit.

Walking Tour. A beautiful old city quarter, with many winding streets with lovely arches and artefacts around every corner. A photographer's paradise. Although, we were not impressed with a fee to enter what's still a working church at the cathedral.Within a short stroll you are back at the marina district.Many pleasant restaurants and bars at night time, although like most large cities you need to be aware of your surroundings and keep your possessions secure.
Worth the hype. Enjoyed getting lost in the side street. Well worth the visit. Dedicate quite a few hours so as to enjoy it.

Must see!!!. I loved the gothic quarters! The ancient streets filling with shops, restaurants, bars and people really gives you a different feel of Barcelona. I would suggest a walking tour to get some history about the area and try some local tapas and SANGRIA!!! I can't wait to go back.
An interesting area.. You could spend a few days fully exploring this area. There are many interesting buildings and alleyways to explore over time. Great to get an overview of Barcelona.

Historic Walk. As the name implies, the neighbourhood/area has lots of Gothic buildings, making it one of the oldest parts of the city. Every nook and cranny is filled with quirky buildings and shops etc. As you wander through the maze of streets, you'll come across some famous monuments such as the Gothic Cathedral of St. Eulalia, the Parliament building of Catalonia, the Picasso Museum, Placa Sant Felip Neri, and of course vibrant modern-day culture of artisan shops and authentic culinary experiences (including that of the 4 Cats Restaurant which Picasso frequented). If you're doing the walk by yourself, then make sure you have a good map or better yet, Google maps. But, I would highly recommend taking a free walking tour (google is your friend) because it's chilled out, you meet new people, and learn of various tales :)
Winding streets. The gothic quarter of the city is easy to get to and on any walking tour route- The streets are small and littered with shops and things to pop into!

Perfect location . My family and I stayed in the gothic quarter during our 4 day stay in Barcelona. I think this was the best decision we made! So many great restaurants nearby, small coffee shops where locals visit, bars, supermarkets, pharmacy, shops, and its near the beach. The gothic quarter has it all! For a great restaurant visit any of the Sensei Bistros (especially the one located on Regomir Street). The bars in the gothic quarter are all pretty great as well.No complaints here!

Beautiful area with unique shops.. Just wander around the area and you'll be intrigued by the tiny cobbled streets shops with beautiful wares and lots of Cafes to indulge in the finest of Spanish pastries and hams.
Brilliant. Very scenic and a lot to do, some very nice bars and restaurants around this area, and definitely a worthwhile visit

Like a dream. Walk through here at night. You will find opera singers and musicians playing throughout the streets. It's almost surreal when you look around at the gothic architecture. Truly like a dream.
Great architechture. Enjoyed the gothic architecture throughout the area capped by the gorgeous cathedral in the middle of the quarter

So much to see with great food and wine. This area is just a stone throw away from La Rambla area (not my favourite part), so much to see, great place to walk around with lots of photo opportunities. There are so many little streets so it is easy to get a bit lost so just go with the flow. We spent two of our five days in this area as it was so interesting and relaxing. There are many good priced eating and drinking places and it is not unusual for the buskers to come and entertain the diners, that is until the police arrive and move them on!Definitely a must see area and it has far more to offer than La Rambla for sure. If you like outdoor eating then this is the place, just have a look at the menus before you sit down as one or two of the restaurants are overpriced.

Rod. Gothic quarter shopping is great lots of Qirky shops, great clothes and shoes, also some of the cheaper bars and Tapas!! The highlight has to be the Old Cathedral a MUST SEE!!Better inside than even the majestic outside suggests!!

Or the mother Gothel quarter. As my three year old called it the mother Gothel quarter was amazing too - a must is an omelet in the cafe to the left of the cathedral ( maroon in colour) not the one on the corner but just down side. Amazing and must go up on roof of the cathedral can see for miles
Amazing place. This area is full of old world charm rather than the hectic style of the sea front or la ramblas. Quaint shops, restaurants, alleyways and sights. Best part of Barcelona by far
Walking through history. Old world charm, well marked neighborhood walks in travel books, many historic buildings, cobblestone streets, Roman era walls.

Must do with family. We went a few time to the Barri Gotic with the family. The stroll through the old streets, the churches, places and kid play grounds are tremendous. Our two small children enjoyed the walk, the stops on play grounds, the food and ice creams. For adults, the architecture, the history and some of the local hip shops are really fun.A must do if stay more than one day in Barcelona.When eating or ordering a glass - copa - of good wine always go one or two streets away from the tourist venues and listen if some of the customers are speaking catalan or Spanish. The wine will be better and cheaper. And the locals are very, very, very friendly with children especially if you try to say two or three words in Catalan.

Best part of Barcelona. The Gothic Quarter is by far our favourite area of the city, you can wonder around for hours criss crossing the narrow streets and whilst some of the shops are commercial/tacky/tat places there are some wonderful oddities too

Great place to get lost. If you have a few hours to walk around, I definitely recommend it. It transports you back in time and the buildings are absolutely gorgeous. There's a great market called the Santa Catarina Market tucked away. It's less crowded than the Boqueria Market and definitely less touristy. Also, the Catedral de Barcelona is quite close and you can take a lift to the top and see practically the whole city. If you are in the city and have a little time, go see this. You won't regret it!
A must. So many wonderful sights! Great architecture, nice shops, don't forget your camera for the visit, take your time and walk where you feel like

get a good map. we really enjoyed our walks through the Gothic quarter and probably would have seen more with a good map. so much to see here and it is definitely worth several hours or more. would come back to this area for sure.
Transport back in time. It's a great place to eat and drink and wander through the maze of streets. This is my favorite area of Barcelona.

Get lost there. Wander up & down winding corridors. Look in special shops like the one with a golden crane statue. If you're lucky you may find a small unpretentious bakery with delicious coconut cupcakes. Take a break in an old bar!
Nice architecture. Basically old town Barcelona, nice old medieval type buildings with lots of shops and restaurants, very love neighborhood
Architecture Heaven. Beautiful place to walk around with amazing medieval buildings and amazingly narrow streets the Gothic Quarter is a must see.
Go down any alley for a surprise.. Compact village of alleys and balconies. Find an alley, walk down and find a surprise boutique waiting for your Euro!
Amazing. Love getting lost here, and finding all these little restaurants, outdoors gardens, shops and bars. I also loved staying there last year. So central.

Amazing place to visit. The church is amazing to see and a true work of art. We visited the Sagrada Familla the day before but really fell in love with the level of ornate detail done so many years ago. This is absolutely a must visit while staying in Barcelona.

Give yourself time to get lost meandering the old cobbled streets and soaking in the Ancient Architecture.. Recommend Googling 'free walking tours' (pay what you like at the end) for the history and an overview. Tour guides also recommend the best places to eat and can help with additional questions about the area.

Exquisite . A fantastic blend of architecture & Spanish culture. The streets are even more romantic at night with hidden tapas bars, pizzerias & gelato bars lining every alley way. Be sure to taste the gelato from Gilaaati de Marco (it is the best!) & if u r needing a quality, filling meal - the chicken wraps from the halal shop was delicious. Italian sports bar make great pizzas. Lovely area to just walk and explore this city!

My Favorite Part of Barcelona . What an amazing place! This is one of my favorites in all of Barcelona. I love the narrow streets as well as the pedestrian only access. Shopping is amazing and there is access to a wide variety of bakeries, gelato stores, and wonderful restaurants. No trip to Barcelona would be complete without spending at least half a day wandering the streets of Barri Gotic.

Great for wandering beautiful old streets. I walked here two different days while in Barcelona and enjoyed it both times. For the first time in my life, I literally got lost and walked in a circle, which was pretty funny, and also shows how the streets aren't really straight, some run at angles and then stop at a big cathedral or another building so you have to circle around. I really enjoyed the buildings, and the streets and the shops even.
One of a kind park. The park is set on different levels and offers great views at the city. A walk in it is just as nice as visiting the Gaudi monuments are.
Get lost and explore. There's something wonderful to be found at every turn. There isn't anything even close to this experience in the United States. Don't be a fraidy cat. It's dark at night!

Amazing architecture. I loved walking around in Barcelona's Gothic Quarter. Every building has an amazing architecture and historical background. I felt like I was in a different time era :) It was magical...
Brilliant. Absolutely must do whole in Barcelona. Very clean and tidy. Quicky little tapas bars and coffee shops. So much interesting and exciting little passage ways all over the place.

Great strolling thru mediaval times and trendy shops. A safe medieval environment between the Ramblas and the Citadelle Park with lots to see and many shops with trendy goods and cheap prices, a must do when the temperature rises since it is cooler inside the Gothic Quarter and the Cathederals.

Great place to get lost. The streets are full of little interesting quaint shops and bars, very old worldy and magical. The high buildings show the age of the streets, very atmospheric, a must visit and have a wonder around when in Barcelona.

Path of history. If you love history, you'd better plan to spent at least three days to walk though this area. It is no joke. This place is packed with footnotes of Spanish history over the past two thousand years or so. The ice cream stores along the way will sweeten your journey, I promise

Go the cathedral in the Barri Gotic!!. This area of town has a lot of history. Don't miss the Cathdral, and just around the corner the outside of the royal palace and the Catalan archives which house the original legal contact between colombus and the king and queen documenting his quest before he left to find America (not visible to the public usually, but a giant picture of this yellowed paper is on the interior wall.

Lots to see.. See the historical museum, with palace, chapel, and best of all Roman ruins where they made the disgusting rotten fish gut condiments people could not enough of. It's fascinating, and also close to food

Surveying Barcelona from top of bell tower at Basilica de Santa Maria del Pi. After lunch at the La Boqueria market, we decided to explore the area of Gothic Quarters nearby the Liceu Metro station. The myriad of small retail shop clustering the small narrow lanes in the area are interesting. Good variety of ladies wear , souvenirs and food outlets available. As we wonder along, we arrived at the Basilica de Santa Maria del Pi. Signed up for the 11.00am guided tour that includes visit to the bell tower.Its a true example of Catalan Gothic architecture. Were impressed by the massive stained glass rose window. The highlight is the climb up the narrow stairs to the top of the bell tower....here we were rewarded by a good aerial view of the surrounding Gothic Quarters and enthralled by the hourly ringing of the church bells. Truly memorable visit.

Beautiful area to explore!. I highly recommend roaming the streets and alleyways of the Gotic district. You will find shops and restaurants around every corner, coupled with centuries old cathedrals and buildings. Sit down in one of the plazas and have some tapas and a cocktail outside and take it all in! I recommend sitting in the square outside Santa Maria del Mar church. It's a beautiful church that the Catalonians have a great fondness for and it is beautiful to have that as a backdrop to your lunch or dinner.

Forget the map and immerse yourself in this neighborhood! . This is a great neighborhood, with tall buildings and passages narrow enough for no cars. Shops, restaurants and taverns galore! It was fun to get lost and just see what was around the next corner!
Walking around a history-filled quarter. There are much places to discover in the gothic quarter, it's quite interesting walking around wandering in this beautiful place, a must-see in Barcelona

Barri Gotic - just fabulous. My favourite area of Barcelona - filled with intrigue and a wonderful atmosphere. Steeped in wonderful architecture, many tapas bars and great shopping. A must explore area of Barca.
Great to walk around. Great area of the city to just walk around. Some beautiful buildings and lots of restaurants and sights.

Lovely little alleys . Whilst bustling with tourists, I guess this is part of its charm. Just off la ramblas, the gothic quarter is a throwback to the past with its winding alleys and hundreds of boutique shops selling their wares. Granted, it is heavily geared towards tourists but there is some sort of magic to the gothic quarter, you never really know what's round the corner. It also is pleasant to discover new shops every time you decide take a different alley. You may come across a historic door, or an old church. Eventually you'll end up at la ramblas again but it's a lot of fun. Best of all, enjoy it with an ice cream from one of he many vendors!

Charm and real histoy. Walk into the Barri Gotic and walk into history - with a modern twist. The streets are narrow and windy, the buildings tallish and plain but really old, the squares generally tiny but charming, the shops often filled with edgy design, small bars and restaurants abound. If you are lucky, there will be a small market or two, maybe featuring Catalan products or artifacts made from recycled materials
Amazing Neighborhood. Most historical part of Barcelona, exquisite architecture, cathedral, houses, museums, restaurantes, small streets, definitely a must go and a place to walk around

Vital and teeming with people, shops and beautiful architecture. It's a great place to stroll, look and admire the ancient buildings, shop, eat, visit a museum, church and watch street performers. There is a lot going on and a lot to experience. As usual though, mind your personal effects as there are pickpockets as well as snatch-and-runs (or snatch-and-cycle).

Great place to get lost!. We wandered around the Gothic Quarter and just took in the scenery. The streets and buildings are beautiful. There are plenty of shops around depending where you go. The best part was when we walked away from the touristy areas and we had peace and quietness.

It is best to be introduced to Barri Gotic by a local tour guide. It is best to be introduced to Barri Gotic by a local tour guide. We booked a 2 hour walking tour and Tapas with Trip4real . David was a fabulous and very knowledgeable tour guide. He showed us many buildings that would otherwise be overlooked unless we understood the era in which it was built. From pre roman to modernism, there is so much history of the Catalunian people and we thouroughly enjoyed an evening walk with him , ending up with tapas.
A must. One of the oldest districts in Barcelona. The feeling of walking through a medieval town. Full of tourists and souvenir stores but still worth the visit or even a walking tour.
Must see. A definite place to visit. Lots of history and full of tour groups. Lots of good restaurants filled with amazing deserts.

Great views. Very nice to walk around and see the small streets. Beautiful architecture with unique shops that sell the coolest stuff. Just walk around the streets and look around. There are many nice surprises there.
Very nice. Old and ye modern atmosphere happy people. Planty of reasonable parking places. Veriety of shops and boutics... good place to hang out...

A must-visit in Barcelona. This historic quarter has lots to see and do - the majestic 13th century Cathedral, Roman walls, historic buildings, interesting streets, and so many good restaurant, café, and bar choices. We have been to Barcelona 3 times, and visit this area every time!

A must visit. a must see while in Barcelona. This is the old part of town with narrow winding streets. Lots of small stores & cafes. Has a unique architecture. I specially loved their lampposts, which reminded me of Indian jhumkas! It’s easy to walk around the streets with the baby in a stroller or a carrier. The place gets crowded, beware of pickpockets.
History and architecture. Fascinating 2000 years of history and beautiful architecture. Highly recommend the Old City Tour by Runner Bean Tours for a fuller experience.
good to walk and walk. there is a lot of places that you have to see like macba and the cathedral. its a long walk on the little streets and you can see all the inmogration in the city.
Narrow streets, small shops and restaurants and open plazas. A great walking experience. Around each narrow passage are shops and restaurants, which then open into plazas. Take time and stroll

Walked almost 10 miles. This is such a great area to walk around. We were out hours just popping into small stores, cafes, bars, walking down the alleys. We were there when the Christmas decorations were up, and everything looked so festive.

Very interesting. We took a 1/2 day bus/walking tour. Part of the tour was going to the Gothic Quarter. We would not have thought to go there were it not for the tour. Our guide explained the significance of the area. We were there in mid May and the area was jammed packed. I cannot imagine it during the summer.

What is there better to do in the evening. Atmosphere a plenty. Try to get a hotel near and then you can wander into the narrow streets in the evening, site outside and eat tapas and watch people go by. Wonderful
Great place for a stroll and a expresso. I roamed the neighborhood for several hours while my family went into the Picasso museum, I had a blast, roaming all the narrow streets.
Fab. Great place to stroll and take in the ambience. Lots of lovely shops to browse or spend also great places to eat tapas. Loved the markets - 1 indoor ( lovely tapas at Bar Jean) and one outdoor .
Lovely place. Great to wander round, I've never seen so many Alters. Icing on the cake was the Gaudi structures in the roof.

Summer of sunshine @ el nacional. We chanced upon this gorgeous old worldly old marketplace which now houses a flurry of pubs, restaurants, cafes bars in the most picturesque and English countryside meet nouveau designs with such a vivid and warm finesse to the interiors and we wished we had seen it earlier. Have a nice cocktail, order some bakery delights or just a crunchy salad and let the buzz and joie de vivre take you to your own sweet place, great for breakfast, lunch, dinner and all times in between, on passeig de gracia, you might miss it if u aren't looking: revel in the vivid ceilings and artsy decor that is just quirky and right and have a a memorable meal.
Awesome!! . We highly enjoyed moseying around the gothic quarter! Lots of neat shops-- great vibe and yummy food and drinks!! Definitely check this out!

comfortable shoes and loved walking the streets. so many wonderful little streets to wander. could spend a long time walking thru here. lots of shops, restaurants. just admiring the architecture is amazing in itself

beautiful area to explore. We went on a walking tour through the gothic quarters and the architecture is truly impressive. Usually I am not a fan of guided tours as I like to go at my own pace, but we were a small group and our guide was very competant. The tour took about 2 hours and since you stay in one greater area it is easy to return to places pointed out on the tour and have a closer and/or longer look.

Best part about Barcelona. Walking through the Gothic Quarter was actually the best part of our recent visit to Barcelona. We thoroughly enjoyed just wandering around stopping in little shops or taking in the architecture.

Interesting walk. The Gothic Quarter is a unique place and you can tell the crowd is a little different here. Looks like younger locals and tourist hang out here at night. The architecture is beautiful and if you have time you can spend it getting lost through these streets.
Historical Church . It is a very historic church situated in the center of the old city, there is no entrance fees , it is one of the most famous place in Barcelona

Great place to wander around - loads of character. A bit more upmarket / mainstream than the Born area where we were staying (in terms of shops), but still jam packed with gorgeous architecture and wonderful cafes and bars. A good spot to find some sunshine too - as there are a few big squares. Cool place.
Plenty to see and do. A very good way to spend a few days walking around the streets and sights. Easy to get lost in the area, but then - who cares?
Beautiful architecture. It was great to just walk around and take in the architecture as well as some of the quaint shops/restaurants in the area.
