Gothic Quarter is a true Spanish experience. Visit the Church for free, eat fantastic and reasonable priced Tapas , visit art gallery and shop for cloth and fair priced souvenirs. the narrow streets will have you imagining what went on a 100 years ago.

Just lovely. The Gothic Quarter is just an amazing area of Barcelona. It features tons of historic buildings, a unique atmosphere, loads of little shops and plenty of great restaurants and bars.
It's also on walking distance from La Rambla so great to combine both during a visit to this lovely city.

Gothic Architecture at its best. This is a very important place to visit if you are in the City, Barcelona has a wealth of amazing buildings thanks to the likes of Gaudi, but Gothic Medieval churches are often over looked which is a shame. Okay i love in yorkshire and we have quite a few of these floating around but this is a great example, plus if you are brave they do a rooftop tour, when i visited health and safety was optional and tourist had an argument with security, but it was an experience. i cant really find fault with the church itself, it was a stunning example of a gothic architecture filled with loads of relics and murals and a few tombs etc, but was annoying was how little it was valued by the city, in the UK places of worship like this tend to have some grounds surrounding them , greenery and trees , where as here houses were bulit almost up to the walls of the church which i felt was quite sad.
Nice! Historic place. If you are in Barcelona, you have to visit the Gothic Quarter too! This has many nice restaurants, and historic view of the city! very live and vivid place!

Gothic Quarter. We loved waking around this area of the city. We choose a Free Walking Tour to help us understand what we were looking at. The area is safe for walking day and night. We choose to eat at several of the restaurants in the area. We really enjoyed eating with the local residents who lived and worked in the area.

Beautiful and architecturally rich. It was very difficult to decide what to photograph, as there are so many interesting architectural details. Oddly there is also a lot of graffiti on the metal rolling doors commonly used by the shops. Some of the graffiti was done very artfully, perhaps by the owners. The area is one of the best we have ever visited for just wandering around and enjoying the beautiful neighborhoods. Don't just go for the main sights!

Dramatic on the outside, beautiful on the inside. This cathedral is a lot bigger then I had expected it to be - it really makes an impact! It is almost sinister on the outside with its Gothic style and carved figures, then once your enter it, it is beautifully stunning with stain glass windows they are almost floor to ceiling - tip: dont miss the interesting museum on the floor below.
Amazing place. Great day or night clean safe well lit shops restaurants small eateries lots of history. Friendly and kind. Barcelona is a gem web info I read before coming is outdated.

Amazing architecture. So many building to admire so many laneways to explore. It is difficult to get lost as every direction leads either to a main square or major attraction so you can have confidence exploring every little alley, there are so many hidden gems to discover and photograph.
Interest and gorgeus! . You must go there full of history and beauty. I studied about the district before go there and I just loved it. The streets by themselves are history!
Beautiful neighborhood. Very old buildings and narrow streets, markets, cafes, etc. You can spend a whole day walking around.

Incredible part of the city - day or night!. Definitely visit this area of Barcelona during your stay. The old charm and Gothic character is definitely something to see. There is a big difference and feeling of when visiting during the day and night so I recommending seeing this part of the city for both.
Great area. Great place to wonder and to shop, great buildings and plenty of small streets to see the street art. Just be careful with your belongings.

Jump into another Realm. Barri Gotic or the Gothic quarter is one of the most exceptional places in Barcelona. It is like being in another century. The narrow streets, the shops selling weird stuff, the ancient buildings, the art that is engulfed into every corner. You cannot miss visiting this place. Also, there is a very nice shop called "La Casa Vella" where you can get your picture taken in Spanish clothes surrounded by Spanish decorations.All in all, it is a must go-to place. Absolutely magnificent.

Nice way to spend an afternoon in Barcelona. I wish we had had more time and energy. We spent only about 2 hours including lunch in the quarter but were worn out from earlier in the day. Lots of old beautiful buildings packed together separated by a slew of a mix of tiny alleys and big placas (squares). All sorts of eclectic stores and loads of restaurants but LOTS of tourists on some of the areas so you don't feel alone. Not a must but a good way to spend a few free hours.

Historic. Amazing architecture. There is a guide on the esplanade tourism website which is really helpful. You can download that and follow the route which will help you navigate through the the maze like pathways in gothic quarter. Again there is a lot to learn here. But if you are not interested in history, art or culture please avoid.

A must see just aside La Rambla. Just walk a few steps aside the too crowded La Rambla, and loose your self in this ancient quartier of old Barcelona and you will enjoy the shadowed,quiet,pedestrian narrow streets, and you will also discover almost secret squares with nice terrasses looking at the discret but beautiful cathedral.

A visit to the Gothic Quarter. This part of the city is the oldest and most traditional section of Barcelona, with lots of interesting buildings and architecture by the original harbour. The narrow roads snake between the buildings like canyons, with many bars, restaurants, boutique shops, churches and the cathedral. Once you start exploring it's easy to get lost in the rabbit warren of streets, so make sure you have a local street map, or be prepared to walk miles if you take the wrong turning!
LOVELY AREA. Very scenic and atmospheric, but to get a full experience I recommend a walking tour..Loved walking around this area..

One of the most special neighborhoods in the city. Barcelona is a city made for strolling and the Gothic Quarter is one of the best places to get lost. Every corner boasts interest architecture, street art, musicians, sculptures or cafes.

To many touristic traps and, in the night dirty!. Unfortunately there are too many business shops that are tourist traps. The segnaletic for the important historical buildings are not so evident and in the night is dirty.
Lovely part of the city. . This makes it for me. This is the Barcelona I love. Quaint streets and vibrant shops, twisting lanes that merge into one another.
True Barcelona History!. This quarter is a must visit on a Barcelona trip because it contains some of the sites that first originated in Barcelona's history.

Very visually calming. Easy walking, pleasant trip. Plenty of architecture to keep you attentive. Building varied , pretty and quaint. Plenty of heritage to admire. Styles varied. Struggled one times relating to reality, would I want to live here ?. Don,t know but short stay is mesmerising.

Medievalist Mazes. Go wander the narrow streets and get lost. You will be both transported to another time and caught in the bustling throngs of today. Find some respite from the crowds of the Ramblas in the intimate corners. You'll be delighted at every turn-

Enchanting quarter. This is the old Barcelona. Before the 19th century expansion, before Gaudi and Picasso. It's a muddle of shady narrow streets and alleys with small plazas and squares scattered around with no rhyme or reason. Very scenic and atmospheric, but to get a full experience I recommend a walking tour, and preferably one with an accredited catalan guide not one of those free tours with some stoner college kid from England who doesn't know what he's talking about...

Take a stroll back in time. Loved walking around this area as it was fun to just wander among the narrow cobblestone streets and get lost. After trying to figure out where we were on a map we gave in and realized that sooner or later we'd find our way back to La Rambla Street and we always did. Great shops to find souvenirs and places to eat as well.

Charming. From the Roman Ruins to the narrow winding streets, this place in a must to see right after Sagrada Familia. We hired a guide at the local tourist bureau and were disappointed. She spoke english but her accent was so thick we had difficulty understanding her. We would have been better off using Rick Steve's walking tour. In any case you can easily spend more than half a day wondering around this medieval part of the city.

Great place for a wander!. We had churros for breakfast in a well recommended café then walked them off just wandering through the streets, markets and people watching by a beautiful fountain! Easy to step off the beaten path and keep an eye out for unexpected beautiful buildings and bridges.

Interesting but small Gothic area of a city. Not that it isn't an attraction, just after you have seen other Gothic quarters, it is small there isn't a lot to see. There is a very beautiful church, and remnants of the old city wall. Some of the area has been reconstructed.

One of my favourite parts in Barcelona. It is a heaven for gothic architecture fans as I am. Just walk the narrow streets and you'll find history on every corner. The whole area is the example of Catalonia's richness and power during the medieval times. Please be aware, that cathedrals are closed from around 1pm till 6pm every day.
Beautiful to walk there at night. Getting lost at night in the gothic uarter is a memorable experience to try! You can feel the energy of the old people walking in the old tiny streets...
Nice buildings . Great architecture amd alleyways to.walk through. Has loads of weird.funky stores to check out and great photo location.

Shopping and Food. We didn't stay in the Gothic Quarter, but went almost every day. The boutiques and restaurants are amazing and worth more time than the Ramblas. I found great gifts and shoes at pretty reasonable prices. For how unique the items were, it wasn't too bad of a deal. Plus, we wandered into more than a few restaurants for tapas or cappuccino that were exceptional.

The place to be. This area is a great base for exploring Barcelona you are surrounded atmospheric streets and squares full of great restaurants and bars. Transport links to all the attractions and walking distance to las ramblas and the ports and beach
Very Nice Walking Tour. We did a free walking tour (using Runner Bean) and thoroughly enjoyed learning about the history and buildings in the area.

Architect fabulous. At the end of most streets there was an unexpected suprise. Buildings amazing. Odd plant pot ended up in the street from a balcony. Loads of churches to visit one having access onto the food & up to the bell tower for a small donation, views amazing.
Lovely. Wander, Get lost, find a quiet placa and absorb the ambiance. Find the bullet holes from the spanish civil war, discover the seld-made amazing ice cream shops.

Best Base . We rented an apartment deep in the old city.....so lucky for us it was so deep we had quiet nights and mornings! The area is fantastic on foot~get lost and enjoy the sights, sounds and flavor of the old city!

Old winding lanes with lots to explore.. We thoroughly enjoyed getting lost in the maze of alleyways. Our hotel was situated nearby,so we ducked in here a few time including at night. Always something happening, bars and street entertainers and the magnificent Santa Maria del Mar Gothic Church.
Very interesting. We did this as a walking tour. Very interesting and rich in history. Beautiful architecture.great place to wander around in and lots of places to stop for coffee, sangria and tapas

Authentic Spain. Steeped in history culture and architecture. Lots of shopping from happy pills(pic n mix gums) to high-end designer. The cathedral stands in the centre with an antique market to one side and street performers to the other

Interesting history. We did a free walking tour through travel bar. Highly reccomend as this area is absolutely full of history. You would miss it all if you went on your own. The buildings here aren't ornate like the ones by Gaudi, but again, it goes back to the history and the melting together of ancient and modern.

Wonderful for walking around the old Barcelona.. Great sight seeing, from the Picasso Museum, Cathedral, and a must is the Historical Museum of Barcelona which covers its origin and rich Roman History, taking you amongst the ancient Roman foundations discribing life there . A great experience.
Also visit the Parc de la Ciutadella and Arc de Triomf.
lovely area to wander around. lovely area to wander around, get some food, some drinks. Shop a little and take in the lovely cobbled streets and buildings.

amazing place for just wandering, eating and drinking and generally just soaking up the atmosphere. small squares with bars on virtually every corner, wonderful cobbled streets, wine bars and eateries

Nice walking overthere , typical restaurants and some Gothic buildings. Typical restaurants and some Gothic buildings , maybe better to do this with a guide .Don't forget the Borne and Barcelonette neighbourhood where you see the real people.
Place to walk and enjoy. Place to walk and enjoy all the time every part of it is a history is just breath taking ... You will know the real barcelona in this part of the city
Beautiful . Walking distance in las Ramblas. Close to the cruise port and is free to the public. They still have mass and is open to the public.

Take a magic walk through Gotic! - but leave your credit cards behind on day 1.... This neighborhood is stunning but check this out with out the credit card in hand - spot the great places to find treasures and bargains and go back again I a focused mode. Otherwise it can and will be costly ;O)So many rare places to see and a million of shopping opportunities, but as said save them to a more focused mode - and just cherries the architecture and the environment during your walk through this magnificent area of Barcelona.Take time to se the Cathedral (beware of the "small skirt" declaration - women need to cover their legs!! - men don't ;O)At the tourist info you can see scaled models of the Nou Camp Nou + the history behind this - quite interesting - and the staff here are kind helpers to find way to explore Gotic even further.

Fine if you have time, but not your priority in Barcelona. This is a very fine example of medieval city center and it is nice to stroll around. But you find find this in many European cities. Many historical city centers in Italy are far more interesting. If you have limited time, I advice to visit other unique things in Barcelona, such as Sagrada Familia, Palau de la musica and the Modernist houses in the Eixamples (Casa Battlò, casa Mila, etc). Otherwise, go for an half day in Barri Gotic, and you will not regret. Visit the Cathedral.
you need to walk and visit all the tapas bars. lots of walking, great tapas and awesome architecture. Need to set aside about 3-4 hours. A most when in Barcelona

Lovely place to mooch around. If you just want to wander round and soak up the ancient atmosphere then a stroll around the gothic area is highly recommended. There are lots of little hidden squares with bars, restaurants and cafes... Even little playgrounds for kids. This is one of my favourite areas of Barcelona.

The best area of Barcelona. In my opinion this is the best part of Barcelona. Simply exploring the narrow alleys and back lanes is huge fun. There are hundreds of little cafes, bars and restaurants to choose from and all considerably cheaper than the Ramblas which is only a 10 minute walk away. Just take your camera and explore.

The old city area is full of history. We joined a walking tour around the Gothic Quarter and thoroughly enjoyed it. The streets are narrow and kept very clean. It was in the morning and hardly anyone local was out. Definitely worth a walk around if you like history and older landmarks.

Old city. Intriguing old part of Barcelona with lots of beautiful old buildings, great places to eat and shop, streets to get lost on and people entertaining. The pace is much slower than on La Rambla.
Most interesting area. The gothic area seems the most authentic area, less modern than the rest of the city.interesting to walk the streets. Next time i would stay in this area.

Very fun area for sightseers . We did enjoy our many strolls through the area. There are tourist traps and plenty of great places to sit down and eat. There is even a cute little flea market by the cathedral with some pretty interesting antiques if that is your thing. Well worth the time to explore during the day and at night.

Not nearly as interesting as other gothic quarters. My wife and I visited Barcelona and walked through the gothic quarter. And it was more about small shops then the history of the space, there do t seem to be much of the old building remaining. But if you want to be in a large group of people in small streets this is the place for you

Historical blending. This area of Barcelona is very intriguing with its historical significance and winding streets (please take a map with you while touring the area). There are quaint shops and small local cafes to enhance your walking tour.
Beautiful Old Buildings. So easy to walk around and enjoy all the old sites and shops and wander down little alleyways day and night to find new things everywhere we went.

Nice walk and architecture . We spent around 3 enjoyable hours in the gothic quarter. It was v nice to see the buildings and architecture. There was an antique market in the square which was lovely to browse and you can easily walk to la ramblas and the boqueria from there.

Old City Feel. We spent several afternoons exploring the Gothic Quarter. The old streets with guild names, the dark stone buildings, the small plazas and the Roman ruins all lent a gothic air to the place. It was fun to stop into small shops, admire the art, watch the street artists, have a tapa and drink at one of the many bars/cafes, sit in one of the many Plaças, and take in the atmosphere. We followed our guidebook's Gothic Quarter Walk for lots of information, but had just as much fun taking a wrong turn (easy to do in these twisted streets and alleys) and exploring something new.

BARRI GOTIC..THE HEART& SOUL..BUSKERS..STREET FLAMENCO.... Just off Las Ramblas,this historical quarter,with its mazes of tiny,narrow cobble-stones paths&courtyards(Places),the Gotic is so authentic&interesting,the history&secrets contained in the walls of the buildings is palpable,like going back in time,don't be surprised if you come across spectacular street artists,tucked away in an alley,like modern,spontaneous flamenco dancers or a string quartet,meander the streets for hours,the unique specialist shops,incredible food,mmm..Jamon(Pata Negra)stop for a Rioja& people watch for a while,shop at the fabulous flea markets,I would recommend staying here,very economical&you can immerse yourself in the culture with its many galleries&very central,close to the beach.....

Beautiful sense of history. For me a wander around the gothic streets of Barcelona are a must when visiting this wonderful city. It adds a different dimension to the tourist area of la ramblas or the port. You get a great sense of the history and the buildings and architecture are wonderful to look at. There is also the cathedral which is busier but stroll around the streets to see more
Fantastic spot in Barcelona. When you hop on and of the tour bus, you should spend time on this area as it beautiful both to the eyes and for good shopping

The best part of Barcelona. This is by far the most interesting part of Barcelona to walk around: amazing churches, lovely cafes and restaurants, interesting old buildings and lots of lovely shops.
You can happily spend hours walking around these old streets.

Great walking tour. This is a wonderful way to spend a few hours. The cathedral is beautiful and the surrounding buildings just as amazing. All the little side streets with shops, galleries, cafes etc make this a peasant and relaxing place to visit. Not to be missed
Barri Gotic. A must if you are seeing Barcelona. And a good guide will unlock the secrets for you for a better understanding of Barcelona's history.

Interesting walk round. Enjoyed walking round the gothic qtr. some lovely buildings, the old cathedral was interesting as we're the romantic ruins but be wary they take a good hour to walk around all underground so don't think it's a quick visit.

Nice place for en evening stroll . The place was recommended by a friend as something must visit in Barcelona. I wouldn't say the same. It's a nice place for an evening stroll. The surrounding architecture is pretty good and the narrow streets offer you a nice scenic beauty. There are small old pubs where you can sit and enjoy a cold beer

Beautiful Cathedral . This gothic cathedral was quite awe inspiring. The whole Gothic Quarter takes you back through time and is very enchanting. You can almost see medieval life happening all around you.

Spend hours enjoying the Gothic Quarter . Highly recommend walking around this area with a guide. There are plenty of free tours (you pay the guide by tipping). We took Runner Bean tour which was excellent! The tour was 2.5 hours.
After our tour, we spent several hours wandering the narrow streets, having lunch, shopping. Highly recommended!
Lovely. If you like historical architecture the Gothic quarter is definitely a place to visit with pleasent cafes and bars too,history museum is found here and that too is worth a visit

Beautiful. Amazing part of a beautiful city. One of the loveliest 'old towns' I've ever visited. There is something new to discover in every little alleyway and plenty of cafes, ice cream shops and restaurants to sit down and wind down after a long day of exploring.
Bars. Great tapas and amazing bars...we bar and restaurant hopped, nobody cares how much or how little you order.

Mystifiying. Barcelona is one of the most culture forward cities in the world. Tons of art, past & present, combined with the flavors of Spain make it a must do in Europe. The Gothic Quarter specifically combines elements of the past with it's narrow corridors and architecture. Take a stroll through and you'll find yourself excited to see what lies around the the next bend!
Enjoy the Art and Architecture. We walked many of this areas alley ways taking photos of the many gothic buildings and walking in and out of the shops, a area to really enjoy.

Worth a visit. The Gothic Quarter is one of the most beautiful to explore. So many cute side streets and exquisite architecture. We stopped off and had dinner at a restaurant in a little square we stumbled upon while exploring the Gothic Quarter and the atmosphere was something special.

Walk around and spend some time. Very nice and a little confusing. Maps and GPS work sometimes. Plan on getting lost. A lot of good shops and cafes. Surprises abound. One of the many gothic quarters in Spain. Be prepared that it is crowded much of the time.

Beautiful little side streets. We loved the little side streets of the Gothic Quarter. Lovely little shops & away from the crowds. The Cathedral was beautiful. You could spend a good few hours just strolling around, so enjoy... we did..

Beautiful. On the advice of a friend we stayed at the H10 Montcada which is in the Gothic Quarter. This square is amazing and the cathedral, not to be confused with the Sagrada Family church, is probably often overlooked but spectacularly beautiful.

Wonderful walk in vibrant old part of city. . Plan to have beer or wine and tapas and Pintxos. Get a good walking tour and follow the paths. No guide required, but it will help you enjoy it. This is an exciting part of town

Great ambian. Just wandered the streets and soaking up the atmosphere. We did take a walking tour with feel free tours and learned so much more. Do not miss Gothic Quarter. Our hotel was just steps away on La Rambla street and was a perfect location to Barri Gotic. Great cafes and bars. Safe, friendly and fun!

Stroll Around, Stop By a Cathedral, Enjoy Some Lunch. The Gothic Quarter in Barcelona was a highlight of our trip. We walked down from Eixample after we had checked into our hotel.We visited the Barcelona Cathedral, wandered the old narrow streets, and stooped into a place for lunch my wife had researched.The architecture is very cool. It is clean and felt very safe. This is a great thing to do your first day if you arrive early on a flight from the US. It will allow you to see plenty of things and orient you to the city in general. Take a cab ride back if your hotel is nearby. Cab fares in Barcelona are very reasonable.

Just go wandering. Lots of atmosphere in this area, easy to reach just off La Rambla (on your left as you look down towards the Christopher Columbus statue). Just follow your nose and your eyes as there are lots of funky little places. Leads onto the El Born district which is also funky but less expensive :)

Artistic street walk. We found ourselfs right in there while walking down to the beach. The narrow streets and the old buildings makes you feel like in old days. There is a famous church right in the middle and lots of souvenier shops around it. Palau de musical is also right on the way to there.

Beautiful. Beautiful buildings and some fabulous restaurants; steeped in culture.
We had a friend living in Barcelona who acted as a tour guide, showing us different places to return! The food was good if you look for more authentic rather than touristy places and chocolate street (Carrer de Petritxol) was worth looking at in awe if nothing else!
Old part of the city. It's a walk through time...see these small places and those magnificient building when the stone was queen

felt like the real Barcelona. Barcelona feels like any other European city - it's pretty, has some beautiful buildings, and great food, but for us was not a 'wow' city. This area though, the old Gothic area, felt like the real old Barcelona, it had character and soul.Lots of gorgeous alley ways and windy streets to explore, great tapas restaurants to stop at.Well worth a few hours of your time

Interesting during the day; Magical at night. This is just a vibrant place to visit. The old architecture is wonderful - from the ancient Roman walls to the beautiful Cathedral. As old as it is, it's just bustling with people and life. During the day it's nice (maybe even an antique market in the square), but don't miss walking there in the evening. The lights give it a special glow and who knows what street entertainment will show up - violins, operatic voices, acrobats, you name it, it just might be there for the watching. Even with the crowds, I felt safe.

Gothic quarter. The Gothic quarter is definitely worth seeing, many things within walking distance. Stunning architecture, but gets pretty crowded and can be very hard for the average person with an average camera to photograph.

You cannot go to Barcelona without going to the Gothic Quarter. . This place amazes me, I walk around, go into the shops, the bars, eat tapas. It seems to go on for ever, my sense of direction is poor, and I can often get lost, but in this area I don't mind because their is so much to see and do, and if I see it twice it's worth it! They say some areas can be "dodgy " but I have never had or seen any problems, but as always, keep your valuables safe, and don't advertise them.

Romantic and wonderful. This is a beautiful glimpse of history. We strolled through the nooks of this great quarter and found wonderful little tapa restaurants. Highly recommend and evening stroll here.
Shaded walk. If you like to walk around admiring the architecture this is well worth it, lovely and cool narrow streets and some excellent eateries.

Back in medieval times. just walk, watch and listen. there is nothing you will see twice, you will never get lost even though you though you are lost. Get a guide to make it more understandable and ajoyable.

Charming!. One of the most charming and best preserved gothic neighborhoods in Europe! It is a definite must for people coming to Barcelona. Tiny streets and magical squares, old buildings, remnants from the Roman wall and temples, street musicians and much more.

Great place to esape the crowds. All people are walking the La Rambla and during 5 days that we spent in Barcelona we went only once to La Rambla and it was far too busy for us, so Gothic Quarter we walked many times through to avoid the crowds, plus far more interesting place then the La Rambla that run along it. The streets are narrow, nice buildings, cafes, shops.
Best of old Barcelona. Lovely narrow, sometimes cobblestones streets and alleyways full of lovely shops, squares, boutiques and restaurants.

Most interesting part of Barcelona. We spent most afternoon in the Gothic Quarter or El Born area, after visiting Gaudi's architecture or museums.This is a great place to stroll through the narrow streets enjoying the bars, restaurants, shops, Basilicas and incredible old buildings. Wear comfortable shoes as this is a lot of walking, and bring your camera. We always took the Metro to the Jaume 1 station and then explored from there, Its just of the Rambla where most people seem to go. We only visited the Rambla once and did not return. I have left several other reviews of places we visited in this area, so I won't repeat, other than to say prepare to spent many hours here enjoying the experience of old Barcelona.

Put on your Walking Shoes and Take a Local Map. Just east of La Rambla, the winding, cobblestone walkways of the Barri Gotic are a good place to stroll around, explore some interesting shops and boutiques, stop for a coffee or drink, and immerse yourself in Barcelona's old neighborhood. Take a good map showing all the little streets, as they change names every block or so and it's easy to get turned around.

A Great Place to Walk. This area goes way back in time and includes the Cathedral of Eulalia as well as the Palace where King and Queen Fernando & Isabella received Columbus from his first trip to the new world!

Old part of the city. This area is based on the old Roman town on this site. It is an interesting collection of narrow streets, shops, bars and restaurants. It is typical in having the dwellings complete with balconies and which can be covered in flowers or washing - or sometimes both! The area centres around the old Cathedral (I pity it having to compete with the Sagrada Familia though) which has some interesting buildings around it. Worth spending some 'wandering around' time here, especially as it is close to many other central parts of the city and makes a good morning or afternoon excursion.

Mediavel Buildings of Barcelona. This road lies in the centre of the city old Barcelona. Many of the buildings date as far back as the Roman times. The mediavel Jewish quarter is located in this area. Most of the streets are narrow with them meeting in a square. All streets forwarding. A unique experience indeed.
great way to spend an afternoon. great way to spend an afternoon by walking around the gothic quarter and taking in the culture. good for a sunny day and to sit in a few squares or outside cafes.
A walk to remember. A walk through the gothic quarter is a must do if you are in barcelona. A free walking tour the gothic quarter is reccommended to get the full experience. Good place to hangout

history of this place is amazing!. I would definitely recommend wandering these streets to explore but i would say you should go on a FREE Sandemans tour (go with Andy Pitt the Brit) to learn the history of Catalonia and where the hidden spots are!
barri gotic. wonderfull clean place with a lot of little and not little attractions and museums gotic style churches street painters and musicians

Wonderful experience. This is a must-see in Barcelona. Rich history, Roman and medieval buildings, Picasso Museum. The Cathedral is wonderful. We also enjoyed the tour of the very small medieval synagogue.

My favourite area in Barcelona. I loved this area, there are a lot of windey streets to discover. We got lost walking around here but loved it.
Plenty of places to eat and drink and soak up the amazing atmosphere. It was only a 5 min walk from our hotel too.
Walking the Gothic Quarter. I joined a Sandeman walking tour around this part of Barcelona - just magic, spent a whole day pottering around exploring. Really a must see.
Beautiful.. Although it does not compare to the Sagrada it is still an amazing place to visit and well worth seeing. You can also go up on the roof where there are amazing views.
Amazing architecture.. Beautiful architecture Wandering around the streets you are constantly looking up at the amazing buildings.. shame the graffiti is everywhere!!

Don't miss this area!. We stayed at a hotel in the Born area, the neighbouring area. We walked the Gothic area streets every night. The narrow cobblestoned streets. The people. The shops. The little restaurants and bars. The gelato shops. The squares. We LOVED it. Certainly made the biggest impression on us.
Sight seeing. We went to the Gothic Quarter and bought beautiful scarves, delicious gelato and visited one of the oldest Synagogues in Europe, Sinagoga Mayor de Barcelona.
Do you want to feel the middle age?. See how Barcelona should look then, in dark times. But much better if you read "the shadow of the wind" from Carlos Ruioz Zafón, an explore the city.

Do a walking tour!. We did a free walking tour of the gothic quarter with Sandeman's and I'm so glad we did! There is such a fascinating history behind this area, and as fun as it is to wander around, eat, and see the shops, it made it even more meaningful to understand why things are the way they are!
Really nice walk. Really nice walk, lovely area to walk around so much history and so many beautiful buildings and really nice side streets to walk down.

Heart of Barcelona. Lots of mom and pop businesses, tapas, pastry shops, bars and people. Hidden surprises around narrow streets. Be sure to stop into the market off la rambles for some great fresh seafood olives veggies fruits and meats of all types. Walk to the marina and Columbus statue at the sea.

Nice to walk and loose yourself. Small streets with a lot of small shops and little restaurants to loose yourself in. You will loose your way but the main streets are never far away.
Good to do after visiting one of the main attractions for example in the afternoon

A great place to explore and wander around.. Such a fabulous part of Barcalona. So many things to see the Gothic Cathedral is like nowhere else. Winding streets and lovely squares, great quirky shops and eateries and lots of places to have a welcome coffee or beer.

Beautiful, amazing, worth spending every minute in. Walking around the Barri Gotic is an amazing experience, if you do nothing else in Barcelona then take the time to wander the streets of this quarter. As you're walking, make sure you look up as much as you can, as there are many interesting and quirky things higher up on the walls as well as at eye level.
Must visit place in the city. Gothic quarter walking tour is the must when you are in the city of Barcelona. Amazing architecture and streets, absolute walking pleasure.

Fascinating glimse into history. Walk the narrow streets, visit the cathedral, have a beer in a plaza with acrobats and musicians in front of you. Image what it must have been like hundreds of years ago.

LOVE the Barri Gotic!. The Gothic Quarter is one of the most interesting parts of Barcelona! It is here that you'll experience the medieval side of this beautiful city. It is largely closed to traffic which makes for a perfect walking tour. There are extraordinary examples of medieval architecture along with lovely shops and outdoor cafes.

One of my favorite places to get lost in the city!!!!. Stumbled across this place by accident when I was trying to take short cut back to my hotel and found myself delightfully lost! The alleys/roads are narrow - be aware that motorbikes can whizz along at any hour of day or night and you'll feel like you'll get run over....There are many little bars/shops and hidden architectural gems around every corner - loved cloisters in the Cathedral with 13 sacred geese, Roman ruins of Temple August, and so many more treasures. Was taken here on photography tour and cocktail drinking tour and heard about the storied history of the place!!!

Singing in the rain. It rained for three straight while we were in Barcelona and the Gothic Quarter became our main walk-around area. We enjoyed the Cathedral and poking in and out of shops,looking for presents for the kids back home. There are a lot of hidden restaurants and bars to stop in to escape from the rain. Alleyways are one of my favorite draws in going to Europe, and this district has many.

Just lovely. Beautiful little alleyways, small shops, lots of cafes, restaurants and bars. A very romantic place indeed. Make sure to spend some time here so you will not miss anything. Have a coffe on one of the little hidden squares, watch the world go by!

Nice walk. I liked walking around the Gothic quarter, it was much quieter than other areas of Barcelona and had some lovely shops and buildings, worth seeing. We went to the cathedral whilst over this way.
Cosy labyrinth . I can stroll in Gothic for hours, so much to see and do. It differs much from other city's and it's really worth a visit for its architecture and history, if nothing else.
Amazing. The old part of the city, you can see it in the constructions. Very nice to walk there and see all the special shops and restaurants!
Absolutely amazing - a must do!. Absolutely amazing. Beautiful churches and architecture. Great walk around. A wonderful way to spend our day.
beautiful church. Close to picasso museum. magnificent architecture. Love the stained glasses soooooooooo much! There's fun stuff to watch outside the church, too:)

Wandering is encouraged. We spent the best afternoon just exploring the streets of the Gothic Quarter. We found quaint plazas, cute shops, street performers in front of the cathedral and wonderful architecture. Get away from the crowds on La Rambla.

Roaming around the Gothic quarter. This is the older Barcelona, from before Art Nouveau. Much more Spanish. It has lots of curious and interesting concept shops, as well as loads of restaurants. We ended up eating in an excellent Japanese restaurant! We saw an old citizen of Barcelona protesting against the tourists that trigger a price surge and "kill the very soul of Barcelona"! We found an old, traditional churros bakery - which tasted exactly like the churros I had had years ago in Madrid. A very enjoyable stroll.

Old part of the city. Don't miss the Roman Columns and the Roman aqueduct. We loved walking through the very narrow alleys to discover old churches and buildings. I'm always amazed that the Spanish use those tiny alleys to drive through!

Awesome to Walk Around. My teenage son and I visited this area more than once during our visit to Barcelona.Originally, we intended to go to the Picasso Museum, but it was way too crowded. So, we just started walking. I bought some great gifts at a good price in this area. We tried a tapas bar and picked up some candies and pastries at the local sweet shop.Despite our being completely lost, we stumbled upon the Barcelona History Museum and had a great time there too.There are so many history, shopping and restaurant choices in this area that I'm sure there is something for everyone.We were able to get to and from this area by both metro and taxi for a reasonable price.If you are in Barcelona, this is s must see area.

Always a pleasant walk-through . Don't know how many times I've walked through here now on my third visit to Barcelona. Great shops (especially if you get off the main streets) and cafes and historical sights. Most you'll miss unless you're looking up or taking your time.If you're new to the area, take a RunnerBean Free Walking Tour for an informative introduction!

Wandering Delight!. This is a place to wander with absolutely no agenda!You never know what you'll find in nooks and corners.It's a closely packed maze of narrow streets leading in various directions.Lovely cafes, bars and restaurants can be found everywhere!
Just a great place to explore . Wonderful area off ramblas. So many little laneways to explore plus great food and shopping. Definitely worth a half or whole day.

Charming apartment at Placeta de Sant Francesc 1. We really scored with this apartment! Only a few steps from Placa Reill, tons of stores and restaurants around, and extremely lively. Noisy and narrow lanes, but quiet in the back of the apartment. The apartment has absolutely everything in it we needed...comfortable furniture, fully stocked kitchen, and beautiful brick and woof beams restore to its original design. What a perfect place to hang out for a week. There's even a washer and dryer (rare here), and air conditioning in the bedroom. Wifi a bit slow, but not here for that.Paulin was very welcoming and attentive.We would absolutely stay here again! Highly recommended to anyone who wants a centrally located and comfortable stay.Exceeded all our expectations.

Wonderful place to get lost in the streets. If you like shopping and are interested in something unique or antique come to the Gothic quarter. Get lost in the streets and make sure to visit some of the beautiful churches located here.

Be careful. The Gothic Quarter is hard not to like, it is old, full of character and charm and filled with interesting shops and restaurants. Don't go here if you are in a hurry as the fun is to get lost within its' walls. There were a few shops that were manned by intimidating "owners" so if you are looking for some tacky souveniers (of which I am a huge fan), choose a shop in a more populated area and above all be VERY aware of your belongings everywhere in Barcelona.
Great!. This part of town is old and has narrow atreets full of bars, pubs, restaurants anf shops. A must for everyone just to walk and wander around.
Exceptional !. Such a unique feel to this area. I cant say enough about all the buildings, each one so unique .. I loved Barcelona , hope someday to return

Wander freely. Great part of town to wander down tiny alleys and admire the architecture of old buildings. Lots of restaurants and shops to pop in to, or just keep trying to get lost in the alleys (we couldn't!).

some beautiful buildings. some beautiful buildings and nice shops - this is the best place to eat here https://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/Restaurant_Review-g187497-d3349054-Reviews-La_Castanya-Barcelona_Catalonia.html and the gaudi museum here is great too

Inside a Time Machine. This is the acorn the great city of Barcelona grew out of ... and had the wisdom to preserve. Repurposed now as a quaint tourist trap, it's crowded and colorful and fun. No cars! I'm more comfortable here than anywhere else in Barcelona ...and everyone else seems so too. Don't miss it.

Great walk. Enjoyed walking through the Gothic Quarter en route to visit the Picasso museum. There are Picasso outdoor murals within the city you can see while visiting. Overall easy walking and pleasure to see the narrower streets and charming atmosphere. There are also Roman ruins along the route which are interesting to spot along the way.

Barcelona at its best!. So much character in the Gothic Quarter. Architecture is fantastic, varied but beautifully styled. Well worth a couple of hours walking the area, check out the little streets of the beaten track & stop off at a pavement cafe.

Great Place To Enjoy Getting Lost. Every place you turn in the medieval center of old Barcelona there is a visual treat. Ancient, narrow lanes, parts of the original Roman wall,and shops and excellent eateries are all there. Prepare to spend a lot of time there because every minute will be fascinating.
Great Neighborhood. It was great to see the beautiful buildings. Would recommend anyone to have a walk in this neighborhood.

Great experience. The Gothic Quarter is very charming and full of things to see and do. The people are friendly and helpful. There are tourist information centers spread around the city and very helpful directional signs to help you navigate the area. We walked everywhere and really enjoyed ourselves.
worth a visit. i was living in heart of barrio gottico.nice place for a walk back in history.just crowded in peak season

Eye candy. This is such a fantastic section of Barcelona.
The buildings are rich in delicate detail.
They are of another age that's lovely to see and enjoy.
Well worth a couple of casual hours just walking around and taking lots of photos.

LOVE LOVE. Stayed in the Gothic Quarter for a week and I have been day dreaming of going back. We stayed in an apartment 2 blocks from the Gothic Cathedral and it gave me Goosebumps every time I walked by it... absolutely stunning and creepy yet gorgeous and mystical at night!! Buskers will play instruments and since in the narrow streets every day/night and it will bring tears to your eyes, the acoustics near the cathedral are incredible!

History. The history museum is excellent, showcasing several rooms of an ancient Roman house--the actual excavation area. The Gothic Quarter is a maze of narrow streets, shops, cafes and beautiful cathedrals.
Lovely and historic . We enjoyed wandering through this interesting part of the city. Lots of details to take in, and we liked just exploring the area on our own with no particular plan.

Great to get lost in. So many little streets and ally ways. Fabulous place to get lost in and find a little restaurant to park up and watch the world go by. Beautiful buildings and the cathedral is stunning.

Coolest, trendiest place in town to get lost in!. You can't be in Barcelona and not take a day or two to get lost in the myriad of old streets, churches and narrow passages that line the Barri Gotic area. Great spot to walk up and down, adjacent to The Ramblas shopping area, and full of classical Spanish architecture and charm.

Exquisite ambiance. The gothic quarter is an exquisite place to visit that returns you back to history, the church is extraordinary, the narrow streets all down the place with artisitc and souvenir shops on both sides, a great big square full of restaurants with msuic and live shows where you can dine and enjoy the atmoshere.

Crowded Ramblas. Way too crowed. Just a busy shopping street. If you enjoy inflated prices and hordes of people, this would be your place. The market is worth a visit, even though it's also crowded, good food both fresh and prepared. We enjoyed the El Born district much more.
beautfiul neighburhood.. Beautiful neighborhood filled with old architecture and little shops. And the best vegan ice cream place in town!

Walking Back in Time. Around every corner is a photo opportunity! Our apartment was on a very narrow alley with an assortment of sounds, and smells. Easy to find tapas and wonderful bakeries. However had to close windows at night. Barcelona is on a late-night schedule!

An interesting visit. This historic city centre in the heart of Barcelona is a brilliant place to visit, packed with tourists, so many beautiful Gothic buildings, plenty of places to relax, drink a coffee, eat a snack, it is a very touristy area, so somewhat pricey, but well worth a visit
wonderful!. The best thing I've seen in Barcelona; lots of medieval buildings and churches, narrow streets, many shops packed with weird things, the Catalan soul beaming all around.

My favorite part of Barcelona. Great place to get lost and walk for hours on end. This area is full of shops restaurants and is alive with tourist. We spent hours lost walking through Barri Gotic. Plus you can see the basilica which is very impressive.

Unique, idiosyncratic, authentic...an experience.. Be sure to read a bit of history on this Quarter before you go for a full experience!! No matter what kind of a person you are, there is something (or a lot of things) there waiting for you. You can just walk around and enjoy its tini streets, local neighbours, cafès, "granjes", authentic old-fashioned stores, typical food and drinks...There are important art museums in the area too. There is impressive architecture from the old city as well as preserved ruins. There are historical landmarks of the city, for those of you that are into History. There is a strong artistic vibe too.Ideal to just walk around the entire day and soak in a very unique, idiosyncratic, authentic experience from one of the many Barcelona's that coexist in lovely harmony one next to the other.

Historic Gothic Quarter is tops. Roman walls, vibrant market, narrow streets, cathedral and cloister, historic squares plus shops, cafes and much more--wandering through Barcelona's old town area is a great way to spend a day. We got there using the Metro which took us to within a few blocks of the cathedral. Wandering through the narrow streets was half the fun.

Gothic Quarter. Be sure and wander around the gothic quarter to see remains of the old Roman city (I would recommend a guided walking tour as the medieval parts of the city are not sign posted and the streets can be confusing for tourists to navigate). The Cathedral of Barcelona is free during parts of the day so be sure to check when that is, I believe it's in the late afternoon.The cloisters are also worth a visit. Every Sunday and some Saturdays there is local dancing in the square in front of the cathedral. The small streets are beautiful with many restaurants, shops, and places to grab a drink. A very nice way to spend an afternoon in Barcelona.

One of the Best Areas I have ever Visited. The buildings, art, music and history of this area is just amazing. I specially enjoyed the artists playing live music some of whom were very good. Just visit this area and discover it on foot visiting the buildings that interest you and stopping at the street performers who amuse you.

spontaneously beautiful. Barcelona is the place where you will find different architecture structures. Gothic architecture is different from rest of europe.. I suggest you to go for barcelona walking tour so that you know the history of Barcelona..you will love it for sure.

"Lets get lost!", our guide suggested with a glint in his eye.. Every corner provided a new discovery. From amazing tapas restaurants and museums to interesting and trendy shopping, to churches and Roman ruins...all down narrow winding streets

An essential part of any visit to Barcelona. This is obligatory. You must experience the magnificent Cathedral, the old medieval palaces, the various museums, what is left of the old Jewish area, around the Plaza of St Jaime, and take a stroll along the world famous Rambla, plus stopping at the Plaza Real for a Cava, before venturing into the Plaza of the Boqueria, and make sure that you keep a tight fist around your purse or wallet at all times! It is exciting, but beware of purse snatchers and other surprises. In all, any traveler would know how cautious we must be, but this is such a fascinating area of Barcelona that you have to experience it in fully awareness in order to truly enjoy it. You have so many choices around here that you can easily spend your whole trip in the Gothic quarters and surroundings. But there is much more to Barcelona.

Barri Gothis is verything that Las Ramblas is NOT!. After 15 minutes on the truly horrible piece of Barcelona that is Las Ramblas, we managed to divert onto the Gothic Quarter.Chalk and cheese! Beautiful old buildings and decorative facades, artisan style shops, galleries and quaint coffee shops are dotted around. You can wander up and down the various side streets, get lost in the maze of winding streets, and eventually find your way back. No morons trying to flog selfie sticks etc but instead a really nice feel to the area and plenty of buildings. little squares etc to occupy you and to enjoy.Very worthwhile place to visit and a million miles away from the tourist trash can that is Las Ramblas.

Lose yourself in history. An area of narrow streets and alleys with surprises around every turn. Tiny squares with tiny restaurants and quaint shops suddenly give way to large public areas with constant activity
Gothic . Walked around on a rainy day looking at churches and the sights of the city. A guitar player played in the narrow streets and made our journey feel very authentic.

Carved stone, alleys, Bars and Tapas. Barri Gotic is our favourite area of Barcelona along with the beach itself. Don't really Ramblas as too many touts and find Parallel a bit ugly architecturally and spread out. The Gothic Quarter has everything we want- beautiful buildings, decent bars, restaurants and tapas and near to the hotels we tend to use. We've always felt safe walking around at night but take the usual precautions of not having valuables on show. Amazing how many tourists there are that wander around with their bags or backpacks open.
Not to Be Missed. Lot's of history. I would suggest a walking tour to get orientated; followed by time to go back on your own to enjoy fully.
Lovely walk. I really enjoyed walking around the Gothic Quarter. Lovely architecture, but unfortunately not a lot of information on any of the buildings.

My favorite part of town.. Call me medieval, if you like, but the Barri Gotic continues to be my favorite part of Barcelona. I love the maze of streets and alleys. Technology caught up with me, though, and this time I had an offline map and GPS guidance, which unfortunately prevented me from getting lost. LOL.

The heart of the city but overrun by tourists. A must nonetheless.. This area is very atmospheric and is the heart of the old city. There are many interesting small streets and tapas bars and, unfortunately, tourists. There is something for everyone be it hen parties, young families or couples.

Only drove througj. We only drove through this area but the architecture is very pretty. Our guide explained that the hospital area is designed moorish. And Guell area by Gotti and this gothic area by another architect that I can't remember the name but it clearly shows all the history in each of the areas. Do this area with a guide.

Amazing district. With so many of the medieval buildings still in place ( as well as Roman ruins underneath) , this is a great area to wander around in. It is a pretty small area so will not take long. Download a walking guide or a good map and explore. There are lots of tour groups but it is worth fighting your way through and many little alleys are empty except for the ancient buildings.
Evening Stroll in atmospheric quarter.. Lovely stroll after a meal in a small cosy restaurant. Barcelona has so many different areas and contrasting architecture.
walking Streets with numerous shops. A vibrant walking area with shops & restaurants & close to the Barcelona Cathedral & nearby Del Mar Cathedral.

Get lost and enjoy.. Make sure you keep stopping to look up while wandering around this amazing area. There are plenty of small areas with tables to sit and have a drink to watch the world go by. Interesting little shops.
Good visit. Worth walking through visiting Sta Maria del Mar, checking out the scene to the beach...visiting Picasso Museum, etc.

Incredible experience!. Truly one of the wonders of the old world. The beauty and the history of the Gothic Quarter are so moving and so monumental. The entire area has such a feeling of mystery and a sense of those who have gone before. This place, for me, is one of the wonders of the world.
Weekend break. The Gothic Quarter is a great place to visit in Barcelona. Full of history and atmosphere. Lots to see and do.
Lots of Interesting Architecture. It was nice to wonder in and out of the many small alley ways and discover the city.Lotss to see and very pleasant walking.

Great walk - great sites. What an interesting part of town! Taking a leisurely walk through the Gothic Quarter, the old part of town - a slice of history of Barcelona! Cobbled streets, narrow walkways, interesting people, and what appears to be a great selection of places to eat.

This area is a must see!. Barcelona is such a great walking city, and the Gothic Quarter is so incredibly beautiful and there are so many things to see and do! You can go into some of the beautiful churches (for a fee), get some shopping done, and we were lucky enough, in November, to have absolutely beautiful weather.
Time travel. Very beautiful place with hidden locations! You can travel in time into the dark midle ages! The Chatedral is the trip for the 12th century! Dont miss it!
Let yourself get lost and look up. You could easily get lost in this beautiful part of the city for hours... Be sure too! Every corner sees a different view of ornate balconies and architecture.

beautiful place worth a visit. We got a bus with Thomas Cooke and upgraded to the tour instead of the free time. Thank God we did or otherwise we would never have seen this beautiful place, ciara the tour guide was amazing telling us that if you went before 5 you had to pay in but after five was free into the church was was stunning and well worth a visit.

Nice typical place. Very interesting area to visit. Buildings are nice and preserved, the small , very small streets make you discover another Barcelona. Its more quiet than the other touristic parts of the town, and its a free place (at the end you could find something free at Barcelona ! ). Don't hesitate to turn without special goal in the streets, its the better way to be surprised by this area.

Barri Gotic wear we lived. Great days in this neighborhood; close to so much to see. Small streets that wander and open up on plazas where you can sit and sip and nibble and enjoy the weather and the people watching. Good restaurants, good food! This is the place.

Very old and amazing place. Very beautiful, with architecture going back to Roman Times. Easy to walk around and if you get lost, it is ok because it is not big enough to be lost forever. The Roman wall and columns should not be missed nor should the several churches.

"Going back to a different time!". Walking around in this area gives you the feeling of visiting a time in history. The building are well preserved. The look is so different and unique to its time. Perfect for a learning adventure. There are also shops and restaurants in the area to make your stay more enjoyable.
Recomend. Really nice and calm place - in the day many touristsRecomend to take a walking tour in the late evening Romantic as well

Some interesting little shops. When we visited on Sunday most of the shops were closed and boarded up. The following day the area had a totally different feel with fun shops and cafes, street entertainers and loads of tourists.
Charming neighborhood. The little and puzzle streets of the Gothic Quarter are the best place to get lost in Barcelona. Dont use a map, and just walk !
Nice walk. Had a nice walk there for a couple of hours and had dinner.It is of course a quarter to visit and we did so coming back up from the port but nothing to die for I am afraid...
Twists and turns. Great for walk of twists and turns. Always something interesting to find around the next corner. Great for a relaxed meander, whilst stopping for the odd beer or coffee !!
visited many days roaming these charming streets. historic section of Barca with beautiful architecture; lined with restaurants and boutiques, small plazas.

Old town. Barcelona old town is everything. Tourists. Bars. Cafes. Old buildings. Museums. Atmosphere.
You can find traps for tourists and hidden cheasures.
And the sea is always nearby.
Go there and look for your self.

It is like traveling back in time. It really feels like you are couple hundred years back in time, very interesting place to see. But watch out, easy to get lost there so always bring a map or ask directions.

Beautiful but stay clear of the many beggars. Had a good look around, it's a beautiful must see but watch out, there are pickpockets and scammers. If you wear your back pack on the front as most do, avoid showing your money etc in public then you should be fine but it does put you on edge. The beggars come in every shape and size and disability but it would test the resolve of the most Christian of people. I saw one women crying 100% of the time every time I past in fact, wailing loudly but strange, no tears! I saw a guy with bent legs and his trousers rolled up to give a close graphic view however I saw him later enjoying a cigarette with a mate with trousers rolled back down. I don't give money to disabled people in the street in the Uk and didn't out there. To be honest it does take the edge off the city. The begging I'm told is generally scamming.. That set aside its a city with a lot to see and the Gothic Quarter is a good start !

Like stepping back in time. Walking the narrow streets and seeing the architecture really gives you the feeling of what it was like back in the old days. I recommend a walking tour to really learn about the history.
Love wandering around here. Lots to see and interesting shops along many different lanes. The architecture is interesting and you can wander around here all day
Scenic and old streets. I highly recommend walking aimlessly through the Gothic quarter and exploring all the different streets and alleyways. Every turn is something new and impressive.
Awesome!. A great neighbourhoud to visit and to stay at if you're not afraid of crowds day and night! It is the old Barcelona close to the sea, beatiful!
Interesting area with a variety of things to see and do. We stayed in the Gothic Area so had plenty of opportunity to explore. If and when we return to Barcelona this is where we will head for

Intriguing visit into history. Narrow, winding streets with surprises around every corner - cafes, shops, artisans at work, solo musicians playing in small open placas with great acoustics. History comes alive with the remains of Roman walls, the cathedral, beautiful old churches, guild houses, the deserted Jewish quarter. I could spend weeks there, walking the stone streets of the Gotic and learning about the waves of citizens that make up the history of the beautiful city of Barcelona. One could spend days just sitting in the placa outside the cathedral watching the spirit of Catalunya on display in the dances and street performances. Never mind San Francisco, I left my heart in Barcelona!

Our favorite area!. Loved walking around the Gothic Quarter! There were so many beautiful things to see. We just walked aimlessly and found so many cool things. We stumbled upon a couple of cute markets with great local hand made items to purchase. Definitely don't miss out on this!

Gothic quarter. We were a group of twelve and we stayed in the hotel DO placa Reiale which is in the gothic quarter right off las ramblas. It was a perfect location and a wonderful hotel.
Everyone had a wonderful exploring the gothic quarter and all its hidden treasures.
Great place. I loved walking around here so many streets, to choose from, easy to get lost. Several coffee shops and restaurants all over.

Something for everyone. We had two days to explore the Gothic Quarter. You can walk all day and still see something new. Great shops, cafes, restaurants and bars. Cathedral and Churches nestled in as well.
Need to Walk the Gothic Quarter. we found this to be very interesting. But it must be walked and enjoy all the area. We were lucky as the weather was great. But if not take an umbrella.

A Walk in the Gothic Quarter. Coming from a cruise ship, we checked into the Tryp Apolo and decided to walk to the Cathedral of St. Eulalia in the Gothic Quarter to attend Mass. While the main avenues are wide and easy to travel, the side streets are narrow, stop and start at angles in small plazas and make finding your way somewhat difficult. It took us longer to find the cathedral than planned and we arrived half way through Mass. The cathedral is beautiful but because Mass was in progress, we could not view the entire church. There is no charge to visit the cathedral. Next door was the Museo Diosesano with a permanent exhibit of Antonio Gaudi. The museum has an entrance fee. We spent an enjoyable hour viewing the history, influences and examples of his work. Walking around the area we saw the remnants of Roman walls and other museums we did not choose to visit. This is a very interesting part of the city and worth taking time to visit. Walking tours are available (for a fee) if you are interested.

A must see area. This is really the heart of the historical area of Barcelona. Old buildings, narrow streets, lots of shops, restaurants and historical sights. Touristy for sure and as such mostly overpriced so search for the better places to eat or just go elsewhere. While interesting to wander to appreciate the history a tour is really needed.

Interesting but touristy. Disappointed with how much development and the type of development that has occurred. Good place to check out plazas and architecture but I actually prefer the newer section of the city.

In my opinion,it's a must!. Very beautiful roads with old gothic buildings,that can take you back in time.You can find there the neighborhood of the Jews,called el key(written in Catalan el call),which has the must narrow roads and a little synagogue,the Cathedral,el museo d'Historia de Barcelona,which shows you all the history of the city until now with a special way.Also,many shops in which you can buy special things that remind you the city,eat and drink.

So much history!. This area can get very confusing if you don't do your research ahead of time or are walking around alone. The first time I walked around the Gothic Quarter was with a walking tour (Runner bean - definitely worth it!). If you enjoy learning about the historical background of cities, then you should definitely do your research on Barri Gothic before going! Then certain alleyways, signs, building, etc would make more sense when walking around the area. Barri Gothic is worth a visit!

A place to get lost. I love this area of Barcelona. It has many old buildings, some pieces of the Roman wall, a number of great museums and of course all the terraces one would want. A lovely place to get lost. Just go with the flow and stop wherever you feel like...
Lovely streets to explore. Loved exploring all the little beautiful streets. Lota of interesting shops bars restaurants and cafes. Recommend a visit and keep an eye on your bags!

Quite amazing and very clean. Exploring the alleyways is fun but doing the research first makes it truly interesting. The alleys are full of history and surprises if you know what to look for. Alternatively guided walking tours are easier but make sure to clarify your interests to the operator in advance for tailor-made experiences.

This is where it all happens.... I love this area, there are loads of tourists but get over it. Its all small streets great bars and restaurants and all you imagine Barri Gotic, I've been three times and this time stayed right in the middle and loved it.
Next time I'm trying Born, and it can't come soon enough.
The historic city center. So many interesting things to see. Just walking around and discovering the city. It's always entertaining. One of the reasons we love Barcelona

a nice walk, to see the visually appealing gothic neighborhood of Barcelona!. this is not really a true attraction, as it is a neighborhood or beautifully architected buildings that provide for a relaxing activity and a nice walk, obviously since it's a walk through a neighborhood, this is far more appealing in nicer weather.
Pretty. We spent quite a lot of time here as we also did part of a tour around this area. It is very picturesque and pretty.

Nice small shops and a great market. The quarter offers a bunch of really nice small shops as well as a large market in a very special building. The Cathedral is also placed in this part of the city as well as the big "Rambla" at the edge of the quarter.
Gothic quarter. Beautiful architecture, this neighborhood has spirit! The buildings and allies are just one of a kind! Interesting place to visit, love it!

Well worth wandering -- Gothic Quarter holds many interesting streets, important locations & sights. You have to walk it to see and experience it. The Gothic Quarter, probably best seen initially through one of Sandeman's free walking tours, is full of all sorts of interesting historical, cultural, and architectural sights. It is well worth the tour's 2-plus hours, some steady walking, and a nice tip at the end for one of Sandeman's excellent free guides. It is also worth a return visit to the Cathedral and some additional wandering through its warren of colorful streets.
love it. Every time I come to Barcelona I must walk through this neighborhood or i feel I have not been to Barcelona.

Just what you expect in Europe. As Australians we are impressed by the historical aspects of the European cities - impressive cathedrals, narrow cobble-stoned streets. It's the feel of longevity. You could explore these streets for days & always come across something interesting - a sculpture, an impressive courtyard, a quaint bar or restaurant. Ok it's touristy but who cares. The Barcelona Cathedral is a great example of where more works - more gold, more stain-glass windows, more intricate details. Don't forget to take the lift to the top which gives a great view of all of Barcelona - only 3 Euros. Been to Barcelona 3 times & the magic of this area always surprises me.

So much to look at!. We went back several times to see the different buildings that make up the Gothic quarter. The cathedral is definitely worth a visit as is the Gothic arch to the right of it. The local businesses are largely independent shops and the peopleare very friendly. The jewellery shop under the arch even gave us a gift each with our purchase!
Great place lots of nice restaurants. This is the heart of tourist Barcelona and an absolute mast to visit. Wonder round interesting streets and stop in nice eateries for Tapas and drinks.

Perfect for a stroll. If you want to go for a stroll in Barcelona, the Gothic Quarter is a must. Narrow streets and alleys, impressive stone buildings with lots of character and plenty of interesting corners to wander around. Also many shops, restaurants and some of the best ice cream places in the city.
Plaza Real. Stayed in some accommodation in the Plaza Real in the Gothic Quarter just off the Rambla and all I can say is that this precinct pumps day and night. Love it!!!
The place will bring you centuries ago!!. If you want to have the experience to live centuries back, do not miss walking Saturday or Sunday at 8 a.m. Don´t look for a place, just walk and enjoy!!
Walk and get lost and end up on the same street again. Nice for slow walks - but far to many tourist traps. But some nice little shops and bars with happy people as well
Amazing building. Such a beautiful and peaceful place definitely worth a visit bit of a trek on foot but worth it.Despite all the city bustle outside it is so quiet inside amazing architecture

Windy streets, good shopping, good food and wine. With a title like that what is not to like. The Pikolinos store has great shoes. Just go walk and get lost and find yourself and watch peolple and eat and drink wine (or beer) and enjoy. Ramblas is basically one of the boundaries of the Barrio.

great cathedral. This cathedral is free to enter at certain times and is well worth a visit.Nice to be able to visit something for free.their are women dressed in black sitting on the steps begging this can pull the heart strings thoe.but it does take you back hundreds years when you see it with the location around you .

Atmospheric. This is a great part of the city, it's easy to lose yourself in the crisscrossing, narrow streets. The buskers are great but the street hawkers are a bit annoying and sell utter crap. We did a walking tour too with Runner Bean. They do a variety of tours and l would recommend them highly. Lots of nice shops selling good quality goods plus the shops selling inevitable tourist tat.

A fascinating glimpse in Barcelona's past. Walked with a guide for an hour - then went back to explore the tiny streets of this historic quarter of Barcelona, from the old jewish quarter to the Cathedral
Have To See It. Amazing old area full of history and souvenir shops. The cathedral is beautiful and the Gaudi Museum very interesting.
Interesting to walk around. Nice cathedral, plazas, markets. Cobbled streets. Visited very old synagogue which was interesting. Very near La Ramblas so well worth visiting
Great vibe. Always busy. Lots of small shops and cafes. Some lovely churches free to enter. Very narrow streets. Picasso museum area especially interesting
Vacation . The Cathedral is a must see! Wonderful area to walk around and shop. Great restaurants. We had a good time walking around through the old streets and alleyways. Very beautiful area to see.

Beautiful medieval architecture, specialist shops, cafes & bars in the oldest part of Barcelona.. The Gothic quarter of Barcelona ( Barri Gotic) is a centuries old, atmospheric area with beautiful architecture and mysterious laneways mixed with bars, restaurants and boutique shops selling ceramics, prints, art materials, shoes, chocolates and clothing.Leading off Las Ramblas, the medieval Gothic Quarter has the Barcelona Cathedral as the main focus point (if you get lost within the narrow streets, you can usually see the spires to reorientate yourself). Highlights of the Barri Gótic include Barcelona's cathedral, the political hub of Placa Sant Jaume, the medieval Placa del Rei (Royal Palace), the Temple d'August and the city's Roman remnants, the Palatine chapel of Santa Agata, Picasso Museum and the Museum for the history of the Catalan. The area is worthy of at least a day's exploration-and even then you will not necessarily see all that can be discovered. Be prepared for a lot of walking: start early in the morning when the area has a quiet about it (and the tourist throngs have not yet arrived). Because the roads are narrow and cobbled, most are closed to regular traffic and are more or less pedestrian walkways- which makes for pleasant walking. And don't worry about rest stops throughout the day- you will find many small, inviting Cafes for coffee and pastries or bars and restaurants for sampling a glass of Vermouth and and plates of tasty tapas!

MUST SEE. This is fascinating and even if you are not big on the architecture you must see it. The detailing on the buildings are exceptional, a lot of wonderful little cafes and shops in the narrow streets and 10 minutes away from amazing shopping district. LOVED it

Amazing, Don't Miss It. One of the best parts of the city. History around every corner and great museums. I strongly recommend getting tickets to major attractions online. It can be a challenge to get what you want and when you want without online planning.

Site seeing. The Gothic quarter is a love old world part of Barcelona with the Gothic church at the heart of itWell worth a visit Walk down old streets & narrow passage waysWith the hi walls it's nice to get out of the hot sun

Great walk. I loved this neighborhood (I guess that's what it is) I walked all afternoon through it, about 5 hours and loved every second and might go back tomorrow. So much to see and do, galleries, shops, museums, churches, bars, coffee shops, restaurants. You name it's got it. There are A LOT of people and you have to be careful with your stuff but other than that it's a perfect place for a fun afternoon of walking, sightseeing and shopping.

Forget the map. Enjoy the walk.. This is a very fun area with a great history, many attractions, small shops, restaurants and other places of interest. We also found it a great place to get lost because you always stumble across something unexpected.

Historical highlights. This area provided us a wide range of experiences, but we enjoyed the history here more than in other Barcelona areas. From the columns in the Temple of Augustus (actual) to the tombs along the road outside the walled city (recreated), we could imagine a much earlier Barcelona. Be sure to see the small door of the Jewish Synagogue. Remnants of Roman towers are very close to the impressive Gothic cathedral, which you can go to the top of for a grat view to the sea.
A never ending maze !. Fabulous, highlight of the trip. Non-stop unique shops, tapas and stunning architecture. Easy to get lost haha but keep walking and you'll find your way.
A really interesting part of Barcelona. The Gothic Quarter is a maze of narrow streets with a great deal of history. As you wander around you will find lots of little bars and restaurants.

A perfect place to get lost!. I was in Barcelona for 4 days, and every day I went to Barri Gotic and found new things and streets. The food is nice, the atmosphere is amazing but entrance fees are a bit too much for the museums.

A Maze of delights. We wandered through the Gothic Quarter on a beautiful sunny afternoon, The buildings are fantastic wander through the alleyways opening on to Plazas where you can sit with a coffee or beer and just watch the world go by or be entertained by the street entertainers (both with their acts and watching them play cat and mouse with the Police) Lots of interesting and unusual shops to find.A great way to spend an afternoon

FASCINATING The oldest part of Barcelona.. Do a Walking Tour (Free Walking Tours are great, you give the Guide what you think the tour was worth at the end of the tour....several hours.) Your Guide will fill you in on the main historical events and buildings of this old part of Barcelona, established by the Romans, in an entertaining way, full of amusing little stories about the Catalunian people....and you won't miss any of the interesting squares and buildings tucked out of sight. Once you have done the tour, you can spend hours exploring the narrow streets and shops that make up this area. Wouldn't have missed it!
A lovely few hours here. Beautiful architecture and lovely shops. We visited a great antiques market and got some great bargains.

Interesting, fun alleyways with lots of colour. Mostly tourists but still very appealing to walk through all the crooked little streets and gawk at the various shops, restaurants, and people. And it's wonderful to turn a random corner, look up, and see a magnificent cathedral, church spire, flower covered balcony or just a beautiful old - VERY old - wall!

Gorgeous memories and views in the Gothic Quarter!. We enjoyed the atmosphere and the walks around exploring the Gothic Quarter. I would recommend this area for couples and families who would like to get out and explore Barcelona. There are many restaurants and beautiful stops along the way! The Quarter was gorgeous at night too! We got some wonderful photos.
