Atmospheric. We stayed in an apartment in this area and it was absolutely gorgeous. It wasn't easy to find initially but once you got your bearings it was easy to get around on foot. The area is full of fantastic tapas bars, restaurants, bakeries and squares. There's lots of activity and atmosphere all day.
Barri Gotic Walk. When we travel it is with a Rick Steves book in hand. We especially enjoy the guided walks which allow you to become familiar with the area and pick favorite spots to return to.

Amazing buildings and streets. The gothic quarters are truly amazing and breathtaking. There are many little shops and restaurants in the quarters. Make sure you spend your time getting lost in its beauty.

Fabulous area you shouldn't miss. This area is great to wander around and get lost in. We were lucky to come across some opera singers performing, truly beautiful. It felt safe at night. Nice restaurants and cafes beautiful buildings, so much character. One of my favorite places in Barcelona.
Barcelona. The gothic quarter of Barcelona was very beautiful with lots of history. Many musicians playing on street corners with lots of vendors selling hand made jewelry. A must see 😊👍
So much to explore. Wow! So much to see and do! A new adventure around every corner! You feel transformed back into time! A perfect European experience!

Great area to spend some time in without bothering where you are going. During our recent trip to Barcelona we spent a couple of hours rather aimlessly wandering through the Gothic Quarter. There is lots of interest to see in this area with a number of unusual shops. In particular I would mention 2 Bis which is very close to the archway over one of the narrow lanes. Well worth a visit.

Not spectacular. Honestly just okay. We wandered around for a while, bought something in a trendy little shop, ate some absolutely delicious artisan chocolate and then had a very mediocre lunch. The architecture is far from spectacular, and the shops range from cheap tourist stuff to cheap trendy stuff.

My favorite part of my trip!. Maybe I had a past life here. I love the way Barcelona integrates the new and old in the gothic old town. I love the narrow streets and surprising discoveries. I'd tell you about them, but then they wouldn't be a surprise!
Barri Gotic. Narrow straight lanes, roman walls, it's like going back in time. Lovely restaurants and beautiful squares.

Very romantic. Very very romantis place better than Rambala or the la sagrada familia!
You can eat and drink here as well for good price!

Take a walk. Relax visit this part of the city, better in the morning, without haste. Look, is full of nooks and details. From the magnificent Cathedral to the Plaça del Rei (King's Square), where the Museum of History of the City is, up the narrow, winding medieval streets, see a medieval synagogue. Let yourself go, there are some nice corners to sit and have a drink or eat something, or let yourself go by Fernando Street to the Plaça Reial to enjoy a cool beer.Another day go to the other side of the Via Laietana street, visit the Basilica de Santa Maria del Mar, the Picasso Museum and take a few tapas on the Moncada street on the Born district, trendy place at night. Notice,keep at safe your belongins as in any tourisic place.

Squeezed streets full of history. The place is great and should be visited. The place where Barcelona started from. It was a place with 40000 inhabitants, the biggest city in the region at an own time. The downside is it's not too clean on a look and a big number of indian shops don't fit well.

Better on summer, but still cool on tiny raining day.. Manny churches, stores from top to the bottom over the street. Of course on summer it's really crowded but it a very way to start to know Barcelona.Enjoy it.
Just wander. Researching ahead of my trip, I was so concerned about navigating around and getting lost. But that is part of the fun. Wander around and you'll hit squares with all sorts to see.

Great short w/e trip with my 11 year old. Highlight was Nou Camp + the beach (Barcelonata)All within good walking distance, taking metro to places was overall trouble-free (the maps are a tad confusing - too much info)
lovely streets to explore. There is something around every corner, shops, town hall, cathedral, restaurants, market, Las Ramblas. We enjoyed just wandering and admiring the buildings and squares.

A Must See!. We stayed in this area, which was a great decision. It is close to everything so walking is a great option. The history really comes alive when you are surrounded by this area of the city. So much to see and do!
Wow architecture. Amazing Stone streets narrow paths and buildings from the 1300's Lots of Stories Behind These Walls.

Stumbled across this on an evening stroll. Stunning. Full of atmosphere. We started off on Las Ramblas looking for a bar or restaurant. We wandered and found the area by chance. So happy we did. I'm not someone that would usually get excited over architecture, but this area is truly beautiful. We went in the evening, which I would suggest to be the best time. Don't pass it up if you get the opportunity to visit, do it!
Great tourist area. We did our trek through this area. Lots to see, and tons to eat!Everything is so beautiful and well kept. Lots of gaudi buildings to seek out as well
Historic. Well worth a visit for history or architecture lovers - hundreds of years of history and a real insight to historic Barcelona

Bustling area with lots to do . The area can be overwhelming if you don't like crowds. There is so much going on from the market -La Boqueria to the chocolate shops. Ok. So I like good food! Gaudi to gaze at and plazas to sit in. Don't miss it if you're in Barcelona.
Simply stunning. I could use many days just walking around and take in. There is so much to se, to fell - the ambiance is fantastic and even the kids was taking in.This is a must se

Very nice atmosphere with cathedrals and narrow beautiful streets. This is one of the areas of Barcelona. It has charm with nice architecture. It has a lots of restaurants and shops. Having a stroll down this place gives a pleasent experience.
Great Gothic Quarter. Lovely area, full of beautiful Buildings and little streets. Great place to wander around or sit and people watch.The beautiful Cathedral is a must to vidit
Gothic is right. It has the typical gothic feel once inside. Feel free to walk around and explore. The intricate details of the buildings are admirable.
History. do not think of missing such a place when you visit Barcelona, you will love thatz experience walking in such glorious historical polace

Old Quarters Of Barcelona. The leisurely stroll of the Gothic Quarter started from Placa Reial meaning Royal Plaza.This is a square in the Barri Gotic of Barcelona,Spain. From the Catalunya Metro Station,you walk up to La Ramblas and walk down for about 20 minutes and on a left turn is Placa Reial.From there,we proceeded to other buildings of Gothic origin.You cannot escape from Gaudi's architectural influence in the buildings even in the Gothic Quarter.The narrow streets,monuments and churches presented beautiful designs.In addition,the numerous independent shops,bars,and restaurants are always ready to lure you inside to taste their charms.Overall,the stroll in the Gothic Quarter can take about 2 hours and a good exercise as well.Those who love History and Architecture must not miss the Gothic Quarter.

To experience it all take a tour. Beautiful buildings with centuries of history throughout the walls and streets. As they can't talk please take a tour, I would highly recommend 'Runner Bean Tours'
This isn't a necessity but you won't find all the back alleys and definitely won't be able to read up enough to enjoy.

Beautiful place. VEry beautiful quater to walk around. History surraunds you .
A lot of shops opened as well even on sunday.

Let yourself roam!. One of the best parts of our visit to Barcelona was winding around the Gothic Quarter, visiting shops or bars, staring at the history. As you wind around, you find yourself in yet another plaza full or people and music and activity. Put away the map and wonder around this jewel of Barcelona!

The Best Adventure. You could literally spend hours and hours wandering around and discovering neat shops. If you can, grab a walking tour to explain the architecture of the city. It can get pretty confusing and you'll easily get lost but when you figure out the general layout of the gothic area, it will feel like you've traveled back in time.It's great to do anytime, day or night. This is the first thing I think about when I think of Barcelona.

Lovely and Historical . The narrow, winding streets create quite a labyrinth that its easy to get lost. The Gothic Quarter has many peaceful placas where you can relax and enjoy your surroundings. One of the main attractions right in the heart of rhe district is the Cathedral. The night life is vibrant, with many choices of restaurants and bars. Shopping is also amazing. The Gothic Quarter is perfect for an afternoon or evening stroll. It is the cultural hub of the city and suitable for any type of traveller.

Rough Scary Place with some nice things to see. We have visited a number of similar "Old City within big City" locations. There are some nice things to see, but parts of it are really rough. We saw someone being robbed at 8am and someone tried to take my wife's purse at night walking back from the restaurant. We stayed in the middle of this area and there were kids on the street corner below our room right outside the front door. They unlocked the door of our hotel when you showed up at the glass door. Lots of graffiti too. Not ideal for most travellers looking to enjoy their vacation

Great to walk around!. This is one of those places where it's great to walk around and get lost a little bit. There are a lot to see in this area. Also, consider going on a walking tour to learn about the history.

Very interesting area of the city. this is a good area to explore. Lots of narrow streets and interesting squares, monuments and churches. Good bars, shops restaurants and coffee stops mixed in. A good place to meander and relax.
Wonderful place. The most wonderful place in Barcelona!!!A lot of things to do...Beautiful architecture and provides you the best medieval atmospheric mood...
Beautiful. Just stroll & get lost in the streets of this quarter, lots of independant shops bars & restaurants to visit you wont be disapointed

Back to the Midle Age. As the name tells us,this is not a new quarter. The narrow streets and the old houses offers us a sort of taste or smell of what was here in a far past. Absolutely worths a walk.

Very interesting an fun.. WOW!!, loved it, the bars shops and food are incredible. Its clean and even tho you are moving among some really tight and dark places we never felt unsafe. People are everywhere having fun. the incredible variety of the shops, bars restaurants is mind blowing.
Wonderful architecture. Amazing architecture, traditional yet clean. So worth seeing. My favourite part of Barcelona for sure.

Beautiful landmarks, but don't be fooled: many of them are 20th century reconstructions.. The Gothic Quarter has planty of remarkable places of interest: the Barcelona cathedral square, the Santa Maria del Pi church, the bridge at Carrer de Bisbe, the Plaça del Rei, remains of roman walls which surround the old town, and lots more. But some of them were rebuilt/restored in catalan gothic style on early 20th century, like the cathedral main façade and the Bisbe bridge which, although looks much older, was built in 1928.That aspect part, it's a great place to wander, very scenic, surely a no-miss for your first time in Barcelona.

Heart of Barcelona. Staying there put us in the heart of Barcelona. Within walking distance are the Cathedral, the Basilica de Santa Maria del Mar, the Picasso Museum, and the harbor. And, many great restaurants!

They missed the Jewish Synagogue from 3rd Century. The Gothic area is amazing, but we were very disappointed that the Inquisition has been a bit forgotten about and the oldest Synagogue from the 3rd century wasn't even shown! I think they don't spend enough times telling the Inquisition story and tend to dismiss it a bit!

Worth spending a long afternoon after lunch. After a lovely lunch accompanied by a jug of Sangria, the Barric quarter came alive to us on the lovely sunny afternoon in April. We kept the map inside and simply walked around taking in the sight, sounds and smells of old Barcelona. The amazing architecture, decorated walls and narrow twisted alleyways got our imagination all fired up and we had a few good laughs.There is plenty to see for the well-researched and otherwise. Carry your water along and allow yourself to get lost in the meandering alleyways. There will always be music or the smell of food to guide you to an interesting artefact.

Lots of nice places to sit and have a drink :). It's very animated area, with lots of shops and pubs, and you just have to get lost on the small streets.. i recomand going each evening in different places, there's always something to discover :)
Beautiful. Nice to walk, just stroll, visitt nice churches, have some tapas, have some drinks, end up on the seaside.
Wander away.... Go, go, go...just wander the narrow streets and enjoy. We eventually found our way to a main road to find our way home.

Fun. A pleasurable time. Many varied and interesting shops. All different price ranges. Something for everyone.
There was a church that we tried to enter, but there was an admission fee. After seeing the Sagrada de Familia we were not in the mood to pay.

Fantastic area full of shops and restaurants. A walk round reveals something new every time. Bars,cafes restaurants and small shops in every alleyway. We walked round on St George's day which was way too busy but in the evening it had calmed down when all the daytrippers had left . The cathedral and some of the smaller square are good and the Plaza Real is very pretty.

Great for evenings!. I was blown away by the activity here in the evenings (6pm onwards). Musicians, skaters, hawkers, and the entire town descended upon this place. A couple of great singers made use of the acoustics of narrow alleyways to rake up a good haul on the night :)Great place to get lost in. Shops start shutting down around 8pm, but the place retains its charm long after that.

Beautiful neighbourhood, nice architecture. These are the remains of the gotic period, really nice buildings :D this is a good place to just take a walk and admire the views and the people . Eventually stop at the stores or to drink some tea somewhere
Nice area of Barcelona . Get lost in the streets of this quater. Lots of shops, which is closed on a Sunday. Narrow streets. Lovely atmosphere.

Beautiful. Gothic quarter is beautiful with plenty of history, restaurants, gelatos places. Starting with the Roman pillars, Barcelona Cathedral and Del Mar cathedral along with beautiful old buildings, this is a must. The atmosphere outside the cathedral is beautiful. Don't forget to extend your trip to El born where the Roman Ruins are and also Picasso museum. You can end the trip in Park Citudella in El Born or Barcelonetta Beach. Plenty of ice cream shops in between.
Beautiful area of narrow streets,shops and cafes. This is a lovely area to wander through, where you will suddenly come upon the unexpected like a jazz band playing in a quiet square

Winding cobbled streets and surprises at many turns. Just wandering the charming ancient streets and alleyways is enough reason to spend some time in this part of Barcelona. The shops and restaurants are plentiful, including places to pick up a comfy pair of Espadrilles. Stop to enjoy the architectural suprises on surrounding buildings, and don't forget to look up every now and then, The Museu Picasso is here. The massive cathedral dominates a plaza and is another stopping place. There are several references to Christopher Columbus to be round here as well.

Stepping into another world. The wonderful gothic architecture let's you emerse yourself in another world. Game of thrones fans will feel they have stepped into Kings Landing. The array of small cafe/restaurants combined with the unique shops (selling everything from books and clothes to rubber ducks) mean you could easily spend a day exploring the quarter. Really lovely day out.

Go get lost! . This neighborhood is just spectacular. It is so worth it to wander the streets and explore. This is how we found some amazing shops, squares and restaurants. The architecture is breathtaking too.

Great place to explore. Loved walking around this area. There are lots of little boutique shops/bars/restaurants. Head to this area for the main sights e.g. the cathedral but meander on your way there/back to explore the different walkways.
Best part of town. Love the old gothic area, has so many good restaurants, the cathedral of Barcelona and great Tapa restaurants, the Museum of Picasso is there too.

many attractions and shops here. This is where many hotels are located. You will probably wander this area to visit las Ramblas as well. There are lots of tiny shops as well as 2 markets in the area. This is the heart of the tourist section of Barcelona.
Free Walk aroung the Gothic Quarter. Enjoy the sunny days, go down La Rambla and have a walk around the Gothic quarter. Basically the city is the museum in this case. Enjoy this retro architecture.

Very interesting historical area.. I hate to hear the word "Amazing" being used so frequently but the Gothic quarter is just that. Used the "Walk Roman Remains" in the "Time Out" Barcelona guide book and was amazed at what was still remaining. You must visit the Roman Remains Museum which was the highlight of the trip. The Gothic Quarter also a fantastic place for eating and shopping and just wandering around and digesting the surroundings. What also should not be missed, and it's very hard to do so, is the Cathedral. The cathedral is free to visit but the Roman museum entry charge was 6 Euros but it also includes free access to many other areas of historical interest.
Fascinating. Lots of lovely alleyways to explore, magic restaurants and the Cathedral was spectacular. Better than La Rambla

A True Gothic Taste . The Gothic Quarter is the oldest part of Barcelona where one can find the old Barcelona cathedral.We were lucky to visit the quarter during Saint George's Day and witness the activities.
Surprising Treasure. The Gothic Quarter quarter by foot takes you down narrow streets that suddenly might open to a square. The architecture is amazing...see even more with a double decker tour.

Shopping heaven. So so so great for loads of really different individual retailers,great for a wander round,expect to get a bit confused as to where you are when you come out the shops,it's abit disorienting.

Go for a Wander. Found off to the left of Las Ramblas in Central Barcelona. A total rabbit warren of little streets with wonderful old crumbling buildings containing numerous bars restaurant and shops. You will get lost but eventually you will end up on a main thoroughfare or a square where you can find your bearings. This is old Barcelona and I feel if you do not visit here you would be really missing out. Only word of caution is to be careful with your belongings as the narrow lanes are a pick pocketers paradise but just be mindful and soak up that atmosphere!

Very touristy but worth a visit. A must do while in Barcelona, even though a tourist driven attraction. A lot of souvenier shops and not too busy when we went through, we were warned to watch out for pickpockets as they were frequently experienced here but luckily it wasn't shoulder to shoulder with tourists as this time of year. There are heaps of restaurants offering tapas mostly, we located one off the main straights and found it excellent. It was still a touristy street but much quieter than most, I would avoid the streets where you see no tourists! Most streets look the same but worth wandering around without a route plan as it was easy to find our way out of.

Take a bike ride through this beautiful area!. I went to Barcelona on a long weekend trip with some friends from the university I was studying at in France. I am so glad we chose to visit Barcelona and visit the Gothic Quarter. The Gothic Quarter is absolutely beautiful with stunning architecture and friendly people. I highly recommend taking a bike ride through the area! We ended up spending a lot of our time in this area because it was so beautiful.
Get lost in the maze of narrow streets. Wonderful area. Visit the Cathedral which is spectacular and wander round the authentic narrow streets with lovely shops, not just for tourists. Very historic.
Amazing. My favourite area in Barcelona, fabulous architecture, culture, restaurants, cafes and magnificent Cathedral.

Barri Gothic or the Gothic Quarter. Leading off Las Ramblas, the Gothic Quarter is mysterious, atmospheric, centuries old, a place easy to get lost in. Narrow dark with buildings so close, you can touch them with your arms outstretched. The streets criss cross one another, connect the different localities and show the interests of the local population. Large squares, some with churches, places to sit and drink coffee, break up the maze of the streets. Important buildings are situated here, places like the Picasso Museum, or the Museum for the history of the Catalan culture and the University. Some streets such as Petritxol specialise in arts and crafts; ceramic, prints, art materials, quirky shoes, art chocolate, while in the square at the end of Petritxol lies a beautiful shop selling household scissors and knives etc.

Walk and Get Lost!. What an incredible neighborhood this is. We walked down the narrow alley ways and ran in to the most unique buildings and shops. You really can't get lost, somehow we always found our way back. Just look for the church tower! There is an outdoor flea market most of the time in front of the church and a food market hall that has lovely fruits.

Nice walk. It was nice walk through historical part of city. Museums, majestic Catedral de Barcelona,Generalitat and lot of nice small shops and restaurants. Some nice inner yards and places. One of part of city I advise to visit.
Cozy area. A very nice and cozy area to just walk around and stop in some nice cafe and restaurants. So buitiful old buildings.

Our favorite part of the city. The first two nights we stayed "uptown" but spent the last night in Las Serras, right on the edge of the gothic quarter. Though it's fun to walk up the big avenues near the Majestic hotel (Passaig de Gracia) we really enjoyed just strolling around the gothic quarter's narrow alleyways, cute stores, gelato shops and locals mixed with tourists. The neighborhood just next door is Born, a bit more "local" but similar in terms of charm. if you only had a day, I'd wander around here and explore
A walk through another era!. Amazing to walk through the Gothic Quarters. It makes you feel that you are walking through a another era, great feeling!

Very atmospheric. Shame about the tourists.. Of course anything this old is going to be atmospheric and well worth a visit. And of course, we're all tourists at times and of course it's that flow of tourist money that helps keep things going....but oh such a shame that there are so many tacky gift shops, nasty tourist trap bars, restaurants and touts...not to mention the tourists themselves. Truly BArcelona has so much more to offer.

Stroll and drink it in. If you are a lover of fine architecture then the streets of the Barri Gothic are amust. Interwoven passages of sublime buildings and cafes and bars to tempt you all the way. From close to the Picasso Museum to the Cathedral allows you a splendid stroll and opportunities for fine photography to boost your memories.Anthony

Wonderful place to stroll around by day and by night. We loved wandering around the narrow alleys and streets. It's filled with tiny shops, bars, restaurants, and tapas spots. There's often various musicians with pretty good talent playing for tips. Wish we could have lingered longer and enjoyed them more. Beside the Cathedral, an opera singing trio was singing in the square. They were incredible! Make sure you stop and admire the architecture. Every where you look another fascinating feature pops up. We loved the ancient Roman ruins underground, and behind the Cathedral. Worth the 7 euro ticket, which also gets you into a few other museums.

A Great Walk!. A walk through this section gives you a historical,perspective as well as an update on where this part of town has been and is going! The streets are lined with beautiful shops, cafes and historical,buildings - we loved the area- you could spend a lot of time wandering about! Enjoy!!
Lovely Historical City Center. One of my favorite parts of Barcelona, this historic city within Barcelona is full of wonder and great sites.

The old heart of the town. The oldest part of the town should be interesting by itself. City walls, narrow streets and ancient buildings are perfect surroundings for walk and photo safari. If you add numerous shops, restaurants and cafes, you can complete the perfect impression of the Quarter, esspecially when you find the shop with all whiskeys in the world.

Beautiful Architecture: Free Looks!. Great for strolling. I was surprised at how close most of the buildings were. It had me second guessing if I was in the right place. Anyways, the buildings are beautiful and super unique and there are also plenty of shops and restaurants around the area so you can stop to eat once you're finished admiring the buildings.
The old part of Barcelona. A must do!. Walking through the narrow streets of the old Barcelona is a must do. There are great little shops everywhere and the area calls for many photo opportunities.
wandering in the gothic area. Just wandering in the narrow streets and browsing the small shops is a way to enjoy the atmosphere. Some beautiful churches with very ornate inside areas.
Beautiful stroll. Which ever way you end up going there is beauty right around the corner. Well worth an afternoon (or more).

Very interesting. Great pubs, eating places & shops!
Keep your personal belongings close to you , then simply wander around.
Try & eat in a traditional tapas bar!

Fun to explore. Full of hidden little alleyways and squares with lots of history and fantastic architecture. If you can, get a guide to show you around as you will learn so much more. Be sure to read the many plaques and signs as they give so many interesting facts.
nice stroll through ancient quarter. It's lovely to stroll through these ancients little alleys. Lots to see above and below, great to sit at any of the many litle squares for a drink.
Great place to walk and take in the history. Amazing architecture and narrow passageways - good number of places to eat and drink - well worth the time to investigate

A lovely historic and charming area to stroll in. This is the old town area of Barcelona, a delightful maze of tiny winding streets, lined with cafes, bats and facscinating shops. Be prepared to spend an entire day exploring this area and even then you will not exhaust it (although you might exhaust yourself - be prepared for a lot of walking, my guess is we covered at least 15km in one day!)

Favourite part of the city. Could spend hours wandering the tiny streets. Hidden churches, and lovely bars and restaurants. what was really enjoyable, were the opera singing buskers hidden away in little squares. Just follow the sound and join in.

Amazing. I am totally enchanted with this part of Barcelona! It was my home for two months this winter and I absolutely love it! On every corner you can find something interesting and worth seeing! Absolutely amazing!
Well worth seeing . The sense of history is palpable. The shopping and the people are good. But be prepared to get lost... GPS is not accurate. The street signs are good however. Go.
great place to wander. We stayed in the Gothic quarter and spent many happy hours finding our way around. A great place to explore and it gives you a flavour of Barcelona away from the main city.
Beautiful. It was a lovely surprise all the side streets and activity. A real special part of Barcelona. Loved it.

Very romantic. It is one of my favorite neighborhoods. I love it <3
lover of love architecture, I love its narrow streets and its palaces and churches in Gothic style.
I fell in love
I will be back <3

Gothic. A very nice place recommended.
A very nice market near the basilica.
You can order a tour with a guide.
Place to wander. Lots to see as you stroll and take in the history of the city. Excellent place to just get lost and discover.

Tiny streets and alleyways of a previous time. Very stunning with lots of buildings well preserved. A lot of work in restoring buildings had been done over the years. Get a map and wander or better still a walking tour. Always busy

Trip back in time. Love this area and the fact that they have small markets and street stalls.The architecture left my neck hurting from looking up all the time. Loved the gargoyles and all the detail in the door ways. The church and it's high walls are stunning as well as the statues and bells. Felt like I could explore this area for a lot longer. Nice squares with good places to eat.

Beautiful but dreadful air quality. There were certainly many beautiful sites to see but the air pollution was awful. Walking around the rest of Barcelona was worse and the grid road layout in the rest of Barcelona makes walking through the town an unpleasant experience.

A must-see in Barcelona. I would suggest that you take a guided tour of the Gothic quarter to learn about the history. It would be fun to stay at one of the small hotels here, too. The Gothic quarter is the heart of Barcelona or old Barcelona.

Beautiful tiny streets. I absolutely loved the gothic quarter of the city. The hidden churches that looked nothing from the outside but were very ornate and decorative inside. It also had lovely little seated areas wher you could watch the world go by.Parts of the ourskirts of the gothic quarter were less desirable & I did feel a unsafe (even at 3pm). I certainly wouldn't have liked to have ended up there late at night. I do suggest that this does not put you off & that you go have a wander around.
Travel back in time. Super quaint! Don't be afraid to meander these interesting streets and visit the shops. Truly and interesting place to explore

Beautiful And interesting . Wandering through these tiny streets is so much fun. Appreciate there has been much restoration work but it appears to be sympathetic to the old city. Taking a guided tour will give you a better understanding of the history but this really is a beautiful and interesting area

Great area to amble around.. We visited Barri Gotic on a Sunday morning. It's a great area with lots of narrow streets, alleyways and squares (Placa).
A band was playing outside the Cathedral and lots of people were dancing the Sardana.

Great place to wander. The Gothic Quarter is such a great area to just get lost in all the tight streets and wander.. Lots of interesting buildings and shops but I enjoyed the walk through the area more than anything

Very interesting old town. Great buildings, narrow alleyways, old, old, old homes, roman ruins, stately cathedrals, what more can you ask for? A great way to wander around, even better if you have a guide
Dont miss this. A great area in a brilliant city, well worth a guided tour as you will learn and see so much more, If you have the time, dont miss this
Old part of Barcelona, Narrow streets. like many european old cities, the Latin quarters or old quarters are very charming and full of little surprise
Warm atmosphere! . Very crowdy and full of tourists, but still a must when visiting Barcelona. Get lost on the small streets and make some stops for sangria and tapas. You won't regret!
Fantastic area to explore on foot. We spent days here just wandering and stopping to shop or have a drink, a truly lovely area, the cathedral was vast but very beautiful.

Milling around the quarter. Great time here in the quarter and the lanes had little surprises everywhere. We managed to get some fantastic pictures in this area.
Our highlight was seeing Philip Vitali and his group playing some fantastic music. Anyone visiting must check this guy out - he added a sense of ambience to our afternoon
loved it. Very nice quarter to visit. We has great weather to walk through. One should walk between the narrow alleys. We entered an ancient synagogue
Beautiful old back streets. Nice place to spend time just wandering, some good offers on fixed price lunches, lots of fascinating corners to poke your nose in.

Definitely the highlight of my visit. I find Barcelona fascinating. Mediterranean in climate, it's a compact city, where thousands of years history unfold within a small area. So I find myself one morning at its birth, the Barri Gòtic, or in English, the Gothic Quarter. I am lost, and I love it. The medieval city of Barcelona, the Gothic Quarter is a sprawling city ripe to explore. The only way to explore it by getting lost in it.I find immersing into the history of Barcelona particularly challenging, especially within the Gothic Quarter. Being the largest medieval city that remains today, it's confusing to navigate for the first time and to discover the sheer wealth of history. Half the time I am lost in this city, and the other half trying to remember what I've seen.The streets are so narrow, the buildings are so close together that catching a glimpse of anything but what is in front of you was difficult. Perhaps this is the reason I find myself lost all the time here, there isn’t a visible marker that i can get my bearings from. But I felt this adds to the charm of the city. I talk a lot of being lost here, but I find that being lost here was the best part of my experience.
old nice church. this is a very old cathedral with excellent architecture. both exterior and interior of church is very nice. entrance is free. it's worth to see it.
Interesting walk. Very interesting area with a couple of churches etc. stay on the main path or the area can be a little sketchy. Not at the top of our list, but interesting nonetheless.

Great place to get lost. Fantastic area of Barcelona not knowing what is around the corner. Very easy to get lost. Heard music one Friday night and followed the sound to a square with a local band playing music and traditional Catalonian dancing. Great atmosphere and beautiful buildings.

Interesting part of Barcelona. Interesting area to have a wander round, laze about or have a drink and tapas at a cafe/bar. Some parts seem a bit dodgy full of interesting characters so stay streetwise. As is the standard for Barcelona you will be harrassed by streetsellers and beggers.

Most beautiful part of Barcelona. If you don't stay in this tourist-heavy part of Barcelona, it is certainly not to be missed for a visit. It is a beautiful area with fantastic little streets and historical buildings. The tourist shops go mad around La Rambla, but a bit more inside the quarter it is all history with some shops, but they are certainly not annoying.

A Great Late Night Visit. Trendy, historic, and cool all in one - the bars and restaurants are top notch, and the experience of wandering the little alleys and corners of the quarter is quite memorable. Definitely worth stopping by late!

Take a stroll. Get off the touristy La Rambla and walk a couple of blocks over to the old city and gothic quarter. Enjoy a leisurely stroll down narrow streets and through squares with great little tapas joints. Stop at St. James to enjoy the street musicians. Easy to get to from the Metro.

packed full of charm. This is a beautiful part of the city of Barcelona and we loved staying here. There is plenty to see within easy walking distance and you are also close enough to other parts of the city by bus or metro. The narrow streets off the main thoroughfares offer many hidden gems of restaurants (see separate review of Cafe de l'academia, in particular) and the Gothic cathedral is well worth a visit (also reviewed separately).
Comfy sandals a must !!. Loved it here, every street was charming. Lots of surprises around every corner !. Wee gardens to sit in, bars, cafes shops a plenty.

A different side to Barcelona. The Gothic quarter in Barcelona is very different than Barcelona's Modernisme. When one visits Barcelona, one has to go to the Gothic quarter and not just focus on Gaudi's works. The roads are narrow - very medieval in contrast to Barcelona's uber modern roads. There's also Barcelona's cathedral, the synagogue etc. One must go there and just wander around to immerse oneself in its charm.

Favorite part of BCN! . This is the coolest area, IMO, of Barcelona. It's so old and tremendously well kept, countless cafes, restaurants & bars, countless little specialty shops, not to mention the charm of the buildings. I simply love this section. La Catedral is definitely worth a visit if here!
Great architecture.. Great atmosphere.I am a solo traveller and you need to be a little streetwise. You will be approached by street sellers.
Gothic.. Lovely to walk around the interesting narrow streets and admire the architecture. Cathedral was stunning.

Worth exploring. On the site of the original Roman town of Barcino, this historic quarter is full of character. The warren of small pedestrian streets hold lots of interesting little shops and restaurants. A trip to Barcelona's cathedral is also worth a visit.

Warning . Yes this is a fantastic area but a warning there are a lot of pick pockets working as a team around this area we were followed and my daughter had her purse removed from her bag - only carry closed bags be wary - spent 2 hours in the police station and everyone else there had had the same story - very sad for such a lovely area.

Happy to explore. A great place to simply walk around even without plans. The quarter has much to see and despute the size on the map it is not at all big and us serviced by several Metro stations.Lookout especially for the Gothic Cathedral and the Basillica Santa Maria del Pi, both worth a visit to the interior.
One of the best neighbourhoods of Barcelona!. I really liked this part of Barcelona. Walk around, don't look at your map but look at the places around you. You'll be surprised!

Delighful. A lovely old part of the city with narrow lanes and a lot of character. Very picturesque.It felt pretty safe here, even walking down the back alleys. There were a lot of interesting little shops and bars to be found by wandering off the beaten track.Very worthwhile.
unforgettable experience. the architecture is breathtaking as well as the history behind the whole area! Would recommend a audio tour more than hiring someone.
unforgettable experience. the architecture is breathtaking as well as the history behind the whole area! Would recommend a audio tour more than hiring someone.
Totally breathtaking. We came into the Cathedral via the courtyard and was blown away ... When we got home I started reading about The history of the Cathedral and Gothic quarter

Barri Gotic is really a great place to visit. Most talk about how noisy Barri Gotic is and that's understandable because the main streets are very crowded and lively. But the back streets and alley are a delight with many nice little breakfast places and lots to do. And, we were able to stay in a hotel that was off the beaten path on a side street and you would not know that it was the same city. We stayed at the NH Barcelona Centro and it was 2 blocks off of La Ramblas but it seemed like it was much further. We were able to walk to every museum and site we wanted to see, eat at many wonderful restaurants like El Melic Del Gotic, a delightful off the beaten path restaurant and MILK a nice place to grab an early breakfast and coffee before sightseeing. I have nothing against McDonalds, Starbucks, or Hard Rock but do yourself a favor. Unless you have kids pleading with you, don't go to the same places you can visit at home. Go to the local restaurants and enjoy the food and ambiance thoseo places offer.
Wonderful!. This area is classic old Europe and full of churches, Roman walls etc. Some interesting shops and restaurants as well.

A maze of small street with hidden gems. This was my favourite activity in Barcelona. Walking around the maze of very narrow streets and high buildings and finding so many little shops in the most unexpected places. The area is very lively although it would seem at first that every street is dark and not safe, it isn't the case. There are people everywhere and little bakeries and specialist shops in the darkest places. Unique!

One of most interesting areas of Barcelona . So much history but definitely take walking tour to learn and see the really interesting parts which you would miss if trying to do it alone. Great restaurants and shopping and very lively area.

Secluded spotlight. Even though Barrio Gothico is in the center where all the noise is, you will get quite a different feeling. It'll be like you are in the suburbs, miles away from all the prying eyes (mind the tourists :) ). It is a wonderful memory.

Wonderful walk, fabulous churches. Walking around the Barri Gotic should be near the top of your list of things to do in Barcelona. Fascinating ancient streets and alleys. Wonderful old architecture. Don't miss the Cathedral and take the elevator to the roof (a small fee). Santa Maria del Pi is a fascinating church with a great history.
Something to see around every corner. So much to see. Worth visiting more than once if possible.Streets are narrow in places and pickpockets are about so take care.Lots of places to dive into

Great area to wander aimlessly. Beautiful architecture, if spoiled in areas by some modern additions.Just wandering about finding the lovely little side streets is great and obviously there are some amazing historic buildings, squares etc. Really enjoyable and a good place to forget the world and it' s troubles.

Great Architecture. Barri Gotic has great gothic architecture....the oldest in Barcelona. The narrow winding streets and filled with tiny places to get a bite as well as touristic shops.
One must watch their bag/wallet as there are many pickpocketers. Best to see in the daytime and early evening. Restuarnts tend to be more touristc versus quality.

Beauty wherever you wander around.. It doesn't matter what direction you look in this city, there is always something amazing to see. The Gothic Quarter is amazing, full of so much I wouldn't have expected to see.
Amazing. What a truly wonderful experience, this area is breathtaking, the buildings and details are unbelievable.

Weekend away. We went to Barcelona from the 8th to the 11th April and spent most of the time in the gothic quarter. The cathedral is absolutely amazing. We wanted to go to the Picasso museum but when we got there the queue was hours long so we went to a different art museum instead which was really good. There were street performances and musicians everywhere which also created a really nice atmosphere. Every building is absolutely beautiful to look at and the bars and restaurants are lovely.
Cool place.... Do the Sandeman's free walking tour with Billy - a lot of interesting stuff if you want a little Barcelona history!

Interesting . Had a very nice walk around the Gothic Quarter. Didn't do any "activities" in particular but it was certainly an interesting place to walk around. Plenty to see and also lots of things to do, should you choose to enter any of the buildings or museums.

An old section with charm. This is an historic section of Barcelona with narrow streets and tiny passageways. It is similar to the ancient quarters in a number of European cities. I just love to wander such areas and soak in the history.

Love the Gothic Quarter. One of my favorite places to wander around in Barcelona. Always something new to see. Walk down one of the small streets behind the cathedral until you have no idea where you are and you will definitely find some unique shops and places for coffee.

Get lost to find amazing history and architecture. We had plans for our first walk in Barcelona but somehow they didn't turn out the way we planned and that made the experience so much more than we expected. My daughter suggested to us that getting lost is the best idea and that's what happened (unintentionally). She was right. We walked for about 4 hours and saw wonderful buildings and a beautiful city. We also had one of the best coffees ever at El Magnifico thanks again to being lost. You cannot visit Barcelona and not see the Gothic Quarter.

WOW!. This area is a maze of gothic proportions. We did not have time to take a purchased/private walking tour, but with such narrow winding streets with tremendous historic significance, I feel we missed some important details and places. GO and find time for a tour so that I can read your review of what I need to see on my next visit to Barcelona.
Superb architecture. A lovely part of Barcelona. Full of interesting streets and alleys with beautiful buildings. Stroll around here for hours.

Get ready to be lost in the history of Barcelona here. This area is a must visit for your visit to Barcelona, even if you are here for one day. The streets are too ancient, dark and narrow, the buildings leaning into each other at places. You might find this place a bit crowded, but then so is any such place. Every building of the quarter has a history of its own. Just take a casual stroll on the streets of Barri Gotic and head down to any of the local tapas. Some experience!
Medieval feel. We didn't stop off to explore this area whilst doing the bus tour though walked through it on day2 of our stay. Amazing architecture and coffee shops
Very Enjoyable. The Gothic Quarter is very cool! Best just to wander all the streets possible. Lots of narrow streets. You can spend the better part of the day seeing things. Would not miss this.

Get lost and explore this amazing district. amazing district in barcelona..recommend that you walk around and explore... so much to see and do... whether it be restaurants, museums, churches, shops, etc....beautiful... go when its sunny. it makes the whole place magical!
Pretty quarter!. The cathedral is the main monument to see in the Gothic Quarter.Nice quarter that take you into the that time of the history.Very nice to walk into the narrow streets.

Just get lost and drift through the narrow streets. I am usually not the kind of person to NOT plan everything ahead, but for the Gothic Quarter you simply need to let go and walk from left to right and see where it gets you! We started at the Museum Picasso, then found the Church de la Mer (absolutely charming!) wondered to the Cathedral (Bit expensive, but if you go inside, don't miss the cloister garden!), hopped into a restaurant and kept on walking. The impressions you will get are wonderful, with or without a planned walk. Even our 8 year old loved it, as you can jump into little shops for treats. Lovely boutiques along the way as well.

Rough round the edges but amazing. We stayed and spent most of our time in the gothic quarter, which is an incredible area. Narrow winding streets (often smelly so be warned) with loads of balcony and window boxes overhead, amAzing buildings and squares and loads to see and do, coming to the city and not going here would be, in fact, ridiculous.

Beautiful. Beautiful church and architecture. Loved walking around and looking at the beautiful buildings. Great to people watch. There was an open air secondhand/antique market that had some really cool things.

Authentic Old Ciry. With no imagination, you can imagine the narrow streets 800 years ago. Wandering the streets is the best way to see it. Lots of attractions -- cathedral, Picasso Museum, Roman walls.
Gothic quarter great to wonder around. So much culture and fantastic restaurants and bars, check out temple bar and oharas. Best Vegan burgers in town in this area Gopal

Lovely place to wander around (just be careful!). This area of the city is beautiful to wander around, lots of narrow and winding alleys with medieaval buildings. The downside is that the streets are quiet so getting mugged can happen - I was attacked and had my phone taken whilst out on an early morning photo shoot. Other than that the area has a great mix of shops and restaurants and is a lot less hectic than the more commercial areas.

Better than expected.. Tiny alleyways, designer shops, exquisite restaurants, slightly claustrophobic, worth the visit! In a sunny day is a wonderful place to go, not as nice if it's raining or cloudy.

Lose yourself. Just wander, give yourself a few hours and just let yourself get lost. There are too many landmarks for you to get properly scarily lost, so let yourself go. One of my favourite areas of the city.
Get Lost and Have a Great Time!. Forget the map. Just wander around and enjoy yourself! There are numerous restaurants, cafes, and shops just waiting to be discovered.

It is not so big but is nice. You can walk and go to the caterdalla for free, I really enjoy it. You can get lost, and in love. But i did not pay to the church i believe wa around 10 euro and the church it is really small. BUt is great if you have the money go for it!
Fascinating. Lots to see of the past well preserved and advise to check out as part of a free walking tour where you will learn about the Catalan past
Superb . One can walk and stroll for hours through the small roads and ally's with the nice shops and beautiful surroundings.Absorb the atmosphere and enjoy!
Really fun to explore. I really liked the area here. It was great just wandering around. There were so many cute streets and random churches that were very pretty.

Interesting afternoon with quirky shops. Had a really fun afternoon on a walking tour of the area led by my teenage daughter reading from a guide book...mostly making up the stuff the book didn't cover. Lots of interesting shops, buildings and cafes. Well worth a visit.
Old city visit. Get off the laid out/ planned streets and into the old town, Narrow streets, limited skyscape but look up anyway. Around every corner there's another 'wow' moment.
Get happily lost.. Many happy hours could be spent meandering around the Gothic quarter and over the main road Barceloneta. Lots of lovely shops and cafes, original cathedral, markets. Much fun.

Journey through the history. Took a walking tour to Gothic quarter , my apologies not remembering the name the young lady who took us through the tour but she was fabulous , the tour guides collect you from your hostels or hotels and then you accompany them to some more hostels , once there are enough people you are taken the the historic catalunia plaza , the guides then segregate the tourist according to their preferred language and you are assigned a guide , thus your journey starts , As you pass through lanes and by lanes history gets alive , I was taking the tour on Sunday and probably there were many activities being held , I particularly liked the drummer performance , the journey gets completed in 2 hrs and ends at the harbour , you can walk your way back through the same route at your own speed or go to visit Columbus statue and then via la rambla Street return back to catalunia square .
Great atmosphere. Loads of shops bars and restaurants within romantic architecture. We were warned of crime here but didn't see any. Comforting police presence probably helped with this.

Interesting shopping and eating precinct.. It is an interesting area full of shops in alleyway around Ciutat Vella south of the el Gotic. It is next to La Bambla. There is the Cathedral with arts and craft market at the Square. There are a number of tapas restaurants in this area which have been reviewed in Tripadvisor.

Barcelona Cathedral . I loved it here, I loved it that much I booked to actually stay in the gothic quarter. The cathedral is amazing you must experience the lift up to the roof to see the view. Well worth a visit.

Loved it. Rented an apartment in the Gothic Quarter and on arrival late at night my husband looked concerned. It was dark, shutters covered in graffiti were in abundance and there didn't seem to be any sign of life. Come morning, shutters were up and we were surrounded by shops, tapas bars, cocktail bars and artisan shops. Loved it. We were about ten minutes walk from Ramblas and Port Vell so it was a great location. Felt like we were experiencing the real Barcelona. The nearest hop on hop off bus stop is at the Gothic cathedral so only a short walk away. Would definitely return.
Not as gothic as expected. The good:Nice strollInteresting architectureThe bad:Not as gothic as expectedNot massively unusual
My favorite part. If you are planning to go to Barcelona don't miss this! I believe it's the most beautiful part of the city! Take a coffe and walk through the streets! You will love it!

nice place. i thought as people mentioned here its free entry , the day i came i saw long raw of people waiting and when i reach near the door i found people paying (for something).any way i was not ready to wait this long.the out side of the church looks great, and the area surrounded is awesome one of my best areas in Barcelona.

nice place to walk. Nice place to have a walk and to enjoy the old city. Though my wife is more about Florence (when she did similar style of walking), I need to admit that this place and Barcelonetta are probably my most favourite areas here...
Splender. The unique feeling of the gothic quarter came with unexpected fun. It's winding streets were adventurous.. ending with an antique outdoor market !

Stroll around. Barri Gothic is one of those places where you can just stroll around and enjoy beautiful architecture. Also, the area is very vivid, with a lot of people on the street, but not to crowded, as, for example, Las Ramblas. Also, on Tuesdays, there is great antique market- in my opinion, best place to shop antiques in Barcelona. There are lots of monuments in this quarter to see, such as Barcelona Cathedral, which is free of charge

A wondrous architectural maze.. Of all the attractions in Barcelona this was the finest. As you wander around the narrow streets east of la ramblas you are transported to a surreal unspoilt part of the old port. Look into the air and you will see balconies so close across the narrow street that neighbours could shake hands. To the north is the cathedral and the south the prominade. The streets are full of small shops bars and tapas eateries. My personal preference was to keep going east to La Ribera and El Born. The cultural centre at El Born gives a great insight to the port and its changes through the ages. This facinating former market building is a free attraction.

Grandeur of its time.. Walking through the gothic quarters you reach to the square where the cathedral stand was a good experience. I think they should also allow the visitors who wish to pray to go in the prayer hall.

Great way to lose a few hours in Barcelona. The older parts of the city are a rabbit warren of small streets unsuitable for cars but they have them anyway! Amongst the streets are innumerable shops, bars, restaurants and several interesting museums too.A fascinating place to explore.

Wonderful. Having got off the metro at Jaume we wandered through the narrow streets of the Gothic Quarter taking in as much as we could en route to Las Ramblas. The narrow side streets are marvellous and there is plenty of hidden gems for all to enjoy. Also plenty of shops and cafes to replenish energy levels along the way.

foodies heaven. Cornelia and Co, the Daily Picnic StoreWe wandered in here because the window had some interesting homewares. However, on entering we noticed it was much more than this. Lovely food, packaged to go or great place to eat lunch. We stayed for oysters, tuna carpaccio and burrata with pesto and tomato. We also bought a set of Louise Bourgeois coasters.

Unexpected Suprise. Saw this while on a free walking tour in Barcelona, was a real treat, lots of people sitting around eating, live performers playing, a lot of detail, love the Gotic look, it is my fav. A must see when in Barcelona! Love all the statues on top.

Straight out of the novel. "Shadow of the Wind" by Carlos Ruiz-Zafon! A stroll through these streets takes one back in time to another era of intrigue, romance, and drama in the former Barcelona. Indeed, this part of an enchanting city has much to offer.
Fee Entry, Great atmosphere. This church is free entry, great worship place and nice architecture. There is a night market in front of the church area and some street performers.

Great place to walk around.. We spent a good amount of time wondering this neighborhood. There were a fair amount of places to get tapas and a drink. It's a little touristy, but very much worth the time.

Some fab streets off the main La Rambla. Get yourself away from the crazy La Rambla where the restaurants are a bit cheaper, the cathedral is free and fairly awesome and the streets more typical of old style Barcelona
Fascinating for a walk around. This was one of may favourite place for soaking up the atmosphere. Lots of little streets, eateries, and beautiful buidlings. The cathedral, of course, is a must.
Nice area to wander. We did not pay to enter the cathedral but we enjoyed walking the cobblestone streets, admiring the beautiful sights and popping in and out of stores.

Free and fun. Just off the beaten path from La Rambla , this eclectic blend of Olde Towne allows for independent exploration and discovery. Lots of room for youngsters to run in the plaza in front of the cathredal.
Like thrown back in time. Perfect area to stroll for shopping, restaurants and people watching. Narrow streets, cathedrals, plazas. Recommend the free Runner Bean walking tour through the area.

Medieval architecture, great sights and shopping. Unique experience in Barcelona - ability to walk around medieval quarters, across narrow streets, full of shops and restaurants.You can find lots of interesting and beautiful buildings, plazas, churches, yards. Great place to walk around for a day or two.
Great. This is the old part of Barcelona, beautiful, relaxing, yet full of beggars and the souvenirs shops well overpriced.
Great day.. We spent most of the day in the Gothic Quarter visiting the Cathedral, many shops, the Stoke Bar for Tapas, and more.

Beautiful architecture and great surrounding atmosphere. My friend and I didn't go inside but the atmosphere in the area is lively and busy. The exterior design on this building was so beautiful that we had to stop to take pictures during our rickshaw adventure.

Hours of adventure. You can spend hours exploring these beautiful little cobblestone streets, the many little tapa and bar places along with many boutique stores not to mention the awe inspiring architecture .
not worth 18 €. only the entrance kosts 18 euro to just go inside the church. the church was worth a visit but not for this price. I expected more.
stay in this area. If you want to enjoy true Spanish street life and local features of the city, this is a great location. Visit placace del pi. Lovely quiet square.
Loved this place.... Great small narrow streets with lovely quaint shops. Lots of lovely places to eat & drink every way you turn. A visit here will not leave you disappointed...

Narrow interesting streets. The streets are narrow and full of spanish character. However, they feel very run down due to shops that are no longer in residence and more graffiti than I have seen in one location. In fact graffiti seems prolific in Barcelona. Worth a stroll through to La Rambla.
Lively. The street scene changes by the hour as shops/ restaurants/ bars etc open and close. This is a repeat visit and I am still surprised at what the town has to offer. Love it.
Great place to wander around. Great place to wander around and get lost in. Lots of nice shops and cafes. Nicer to walk in the evening when not many tourists and Chinese.

Gothic . As part of the old city it's a lovely place to visit with lots if charm
Would I go back yes
Would I recommend it yes

Medieval Barcelona. Lots of old buildings including the cathedral. Don't miss the Gothic bridge and the Roman Temple of Augustus (hidden up a side street) which turned out to be amazing. Also the Jewish quarter is within the Gothic quarter. Check out the cathedral cloister which has palm trees and a pond with fish and geese. There are also lots of remaining Roman walls. The whole area is very atmospheric.

A labyrinth of cobbled narrow streets steeped in history. Do not miss out on breakfast/brunch at the Milk Bar & Bistro followed by a wander around the labyrinth of cobbled narrow streets steeped in tradition and history. The architecture, the shops, the churches. Lots of places to stop for a coffee or snack.
In the evening a visit to a live flamenco dancing club is a must.

Lovely to explore. Lovely architecture and lots of little lanes to explore leading to plaza's and hidden finds! Recommend looking for hidden little eateries off the lanes rather than on the main Las Ramblas.

Europe in the Middle Ages. If you want to guess how people lived several hundred years ago traipse then the Gothic Quarter as this is a must see in Barcelona. Few cities have been able to maintain a strong residential commercial and devotional heart as well as this. Narrow streets with barely any sunlight being able to hit the ground the area is a trove for ones imagination. Totally car free and cobblestoned narrow 4 to 5 story buildings press up against neighboring houses and suddenly you turn a quick corner and you could be standing in front of the open square where the Cathedral is ( started in the late 1200's) or by the Piacsso museum. It rained our first day there which was scarcely a problem just added essence in some odd way as we raced around the tight streets. This is a must see and the ma y restaurants bars ice cream stores all provide plenty of incentive to spend hours in what is the heart of the city

A Place of Beauty. On our recent visit our Hotel was located within the Gothic Quarter, the history in this area of Barcelona is phenomenal, each and every step you take there is so much of interest for you to admire, just to walk the narrow streets is a great adventure in it's self with all the quaint little shops and marvelous architecture.

Narrow Street Leading to New and Interesting Experiences. Husband and I spent several hours wondering through the Gothic Quarter, first with a guided group and later on own. We found the environment very interesting. To see walls that had been built before the birth of Christ was thought provoking. We were in the Gothic Quarter during daylight hours and ran into no problems, but we were warned by both our guide and our landlord to beware of pickpockets. We took precautions and had no problems. If you are in Barcelona and have the opportunity, I recommend visiting the Gothic Quarter.

We wish we had more time . You will love the alleys and the stores and the art and the creations and the architecture and the ability to get lost and the kids will love it and... and... oh... did I mention that you will love it?? Definitely a must do location when in Barcelona. A place that needs probably a week to properly conquer and a keen eye for the side streets and little stores that draw you in for hours. We were disappointed we just didn't have the time but it is definitely a place that would bring us back to Barcelona as a family. We saw a few boutique hotels that would make it super handy to stay in as well. Make sure you go a walking tour with local guides and you will get a feel for the area. Definitely recommend the Runner Bean tours for this as this is how we did it.
Great wandering. Walk and get lost. Best metro is Jaume although many others do too. So much to see and great little shops and restaurants

Do a walking tour. Amazing architecture and history. So many things I wanted to find out about so I did a half day walking tour. Well worth it. Beautiful buildings, churches and little winding streets.

brilliant for watching the world go by. we stayed in a small little place right in the heart of this area and were very glad we did as all the restaurants and also the sea etc are within walking distance
Atmospheric and full of history. Very pleasant area of Barcelona that includes the Gothic cathedral and Santa Maria. Plenty of bars, cafes, etc, plus lots of street musicians. Nice atmosphere!

Architecture dream. If you love Gothic and Neo Gothic architecture, history,tiny winding streets,little eateries. This is for you . Go mid week and early in the year, avoid the crowds and take the Runner Bean guided tour for the inside story
Wonderful scenery in the gothoc quarters.. Best out of all the others. Theres lots to see and do. Plenty of history to keep the minds of people busy

Gothic touch. Great architecture, lively surroundings and exciting streets:) We felt there safe and secure, although it is in some places quite crowded:) When in Barcelona, definitely visit this area as well!

Chocolate con churros. Rebeca from Te Guio en Barcelona was our guide. We had a wonderful time (12 people--seniors, middle age, young couple, and a child). It was tailor for everyone and we had a great time walking and seeing all the sites Rebeca took us. She took us to a Dulcinea (where local people go) to have chocolate and churros).
fascinating history and interesting streets. We had a great time exploring the Gothic Quarter. The food on the main streets isn't special but if you keep looking you will find some gems.
Beautiful. Wonder around winding alleys. You never know what you will see. The cathedral is so beautiful and moving.
Atmospheric. We loved wandering in this wonderfully atmospheric part of Barcelona. It's buzzy and full of ambience even on a Sunday evening!

The unreconstructed old city. Much of Barcelona was torn down and rebuilt in the mould of modern industrial trends in the late 19th & early 20th century (evidenced in the 2016 exhibition at Palau de la Virreina). The Gothic Quarter is the exception, combining the delights of an older Barcelona metropolis with the detritus of modern tourism. Quaint narrow streets are as thronged now with visitors as they would have been with traders in the past, and the aim of parting visitors from their cash remains as strong. If you look beneath the usual souvenir tat, the smaller cafes are great and the sights worth visiting. Be prepared to queue for timed tickets to venues & wander round just looking in between.
Great area of Barcelona. We visited here and found this area of Barcelona to be a hidden gem. This is definitely a place to include on your agenda if you have time.
Brilliant architecture & lots to see. This area is full of amazing & interesting corners and alleyways. It takes you back in time. Great bars and places to wander.

You can spend ages here, but be careful which alleys you go down! . Great range of tapas, shops, sights, amazing buildings, odd people. You can spend ages here. Strongly recommend the bar with a forest in it next to the wax museum.
Gothic quat. Love this area in Barcelona great in the day for chilling in the small squares great little bars offer drinks or tapas good at night too

An Old City. If you have been travelling around Spain for two weeks or more, then Barrio Gotic is just an old barrio.The structures around are from Gothic style with the highlight of Cathedral de Barcelona. There are many tourists (as always) around the area and the street performers are part of the attractions in the barrio. However, if this is your first time to Barcelona, it is nice to walk around this area, sit down and have coffee and enjoy the surroundings.

Amazing Architecture. The architecture is fantastic and this is a great place to get lost in. There are tons of shops and restaurants. However, a damper was put on this trip when my daughter's handbag was stolen while we were eating lunch.

A place to lose yourself. The Gothic Quarter in Barcelona really is an incredibly beautiful part of the city. With the narrow streets and interesting little boutique shops, bars and restaurants that you can find hidden amongst them it's definitely worth an afternoon of anyones time to simply wander this part of the city to see what treasures you find.
Worth a Walk. Very crowded and filled with lots of chain stores, like H&M and Foot Locker, so that's strange. But the architecture and rambling, small alleyways are cool.

Tour through Gothic centre. We signed up for a free walk tour. At start the tour leader recommended a Euro 15 each cost - so was not free! The tour of 2 hours was very informative and well worth it. We were 7 on the tour which was conducted in English. We learny a lot aout the history of Barcelona and saw many things we probably would have walked past. The tour meets outside the Hardrock at 11.15am and finishes around 1.30pm. Recommended if you have a couple of hours spare. You must book in advance via the interney

Beautiful and full of culture . Full of culture! Getting lost (during the day) in the gothic quarter assures a world of adventures! There's lots of beautiful restaurants and cafés, all very reasonably priced. The cathedral was absolutely stunning and the atmosphere was incredible.

magical!. This area of Barcelona is like entering into a very different time and place. Mysterious and magical! The streets are narrow and winding and lined with old buildings (some pre-date the gothic period; there are even a few that go back to the Roman era). The cathedral is magnificent, especially at night. We shopped at the Christmas market, which was well worth browsing. And, we had nothing but good experiences in the restaurants and bars we visited. A must see for anyone visiting Barcelona!
Such fantastic place to wander. This little corner of Barcelona reminded me of Venice with its maze like streets that did not have room for autos. Tons and tons of shops and museums. A must see.

Beautiful architecture. The gothic quarter is by far my favourite area in Barcelona. Its beautiful architecture and cute quaint streets make every step through them interesting and intriguing. Nothing better than grabbing an ice-cream and sitting on the steps looking up at the cathedral.
Great for an evening wander. What can I say.... just take a wander along any street in this area to get a flavour of this fantastic city.

Beautiful area - we stayed here and walked for many hours around the area.!:). GO THERE! use a day and just walk around the tiny small streets - feel the atmosphere, lots of cafes, coffee bar, shops. The big cathedral also is pretty awesome.
Must cover. Great for coffee spots, excellent pastry and cake shops and people watching. Lovely churches to discover in side streets. Get lost in the small streets.
Wow. The architecture is amazing. If your in Barcelona you have to take 1 hour of your time too tour around. AMAZING

Discovering the exciting narrow streets of Barcelona. By far my favourite place in Barcelona. We spent hours walking around in these charming narrow streets admiring the architecture and never got bored. There's also plenty of places to shop for souvenirs or sit down and have a meal or a quick coffee. Although the prices are as expected - higher than usual.
Great area. Lots of lovely little streets, wonderful restaurants and cafes, great tapas everywhere and unusual little squares and churches.

Gothic not so mad as hoped. I was really looking forward to this but it didn't capture my imagination in the way I thought it would. It is definitely worth visiting but maybe do some research prior to your visit in where to go. It was fun to get lost in the streets as suggested by some but I think you need to have in mind some of the landmarks you want to cover. There are 2 gorgeous cathedrals which are free to enter.

Weekend break. The gothic quarter is a fantastic place to explore, ever new turn uncovers a new interesting piece of history and outstanding architecture. With little shops and bars round every corner, to sit at and pass the day away. A must is the square in front of the cathedral de Barcelona.

Great part if the city. Stay in the gothic section if you can. We stayed at the Hotel Serras. Its right on the edge of the Gothic section and was a great place to stay. We were able to take nice walks every day and night and see beautiful streets and sites. The architecture is magnificent.

A great place to wander and get lost. There are so many things to see and explore in this part of old Barcelona. Some places are Barcelona Cathedral, the viceroy's palace, Gaudi's museum etc. Plan to spend at least a couple of hours just to look around.

Gorgeous olde world charm. Love just wandering around this area and exploring the lane ways and stores. Lots of little boutiques (no high street stores!) and amazing hidden gems, Stunning architecture.
Allow a lot of times to just wander.

If you like history... If you like history this is definitely a great area to visit! The buildings are really unique and there is so much history. I would plan on spending a few hours wandering around and touring some of the old churches and museums!
Stunning and great little shops and restaurants.. I went on a free guided walking tour which was great and allowed me to learn to navigate this medieval warren.

Fabulous Food and History. I visited this area 3 times during my visit. There is much to offer and with a map you can find your way around. If you miss a turn, keep going and you will find something else to interest you. I would recommend a walking tour first to see if that helps orient you to the area. The streets are winding, narrow and confusing but there are shops, restaurants and museums galore. Fabulous place to wander if you have a day to spare. If not, try to see some of it anyway. There Is a church with easy access not through the quarter and there is an ancient synagogue near the church since this was the old Jewish Quarter. Access is easy from La Rambles and you will find better food deals here than right on the main street. You can save a few Euros for a tapas and beverage and enjoy some plaza time since there are plazas all throughout the quarter.

Perfect for just walking around . Worth going a few times - each time of day/night has a different feel. Great for coffee spots and people watching. Lovely churches to discover in side streets. Antique fair on Thursdays outside cathedral worth a wander
Lovely part of town. Have never spent any time in the gothic quarter before but really enjoyed wandering round the streets and alleyways. Quite touristy but in a pleasant way.

As if we stepped back into history!. Loved this part of the city with its ancient buildings, alleys and architecture! The weather was perfect for strolling the city.At night, heard street musicians playing guitars and singing operas!!! They sounded wonderful in these deep and dense streets. Hope you get to visit and enjoy the sights and sounds of quintessential Barcelona!

Great place to be!. I love this part of the city with small streets, nice buildings, cozy bars and interesting smal shops. Especially in the evening to walk around and enjoy the whole atmosphere with specific smells, sounds and different people. In the morning - to have a cup of coffe and fresh baked bun in a small bakery shop - is the best start of the day.

You never know what will be around the corner!. Loved this part of town. Although very popular with tourists, there is a lot to see just walking. No admission fees, just comfortable shoes, a camera, and remember to look up at the street lights!!
Great walking. This is a great areas to walk around and take in the sights. There is lots of activity and restaurants.

Charming and fun. Wandering the streets of the Gothic quarter was definitely one of the highlights of our trip to Barcelona. We went almost every day, even for a while. Exploring the streets was amazing, and sandemans free walking tour was spectacular! It is full of cool shops and cafes, but the streets and buildings themselves are the really magical part

A Great Part of the City to Get Lost In. Don't miss the Gothic Quarter while in Barcelona. The architecture and tight streets give a great sense of the history of the city. We visited the quarter every day while in Barcelona - conveniently located and a fantastic area to people watch and have some drinks. A must-do in Barcelona!

Fantastic mediaeval quarter. Fantastic mediaeval buildings and narrow winding lanes to explore, with lots of interesting, stylish shops and traditional restaurants. Includes the mediaeval cathedral, Roman buildings, Gaudi exhibition (well worth a visit)

Superior city atmosphere. We came here every day in our staying period and enjoyed the incredible nice buildings, architecture, glowing people and fine shops. Don't miss it !! So many different details and nice impressions. The small streets contains a great variety of cosy shops and we always noticed new ones, as it often was the case that some were closed and some open, never knew which one.

Urban Explorer's Dream. Wonderful little streets, loads of public art, interesting shops and eateries. Countless photo opportunities (doors, windows, public fountains, silly and clever shop displays, little public squares where you least expect them). Needs at least two visits.
A great place to get lost. Really cool area with quirky shops, great coffee bars, and nice restaurants. Give it some time, and enjoy the whole atmosphere together with the stunning architecture.

Gothic quarter stroll. The gothic quarter is a great place to find things, from restaurants to clothing stores (a Zara on every corner), tourist trinkets, or fresh squeezed orange juice. Also some wonderful churches. There is a vibrance and energy.
lovely buildings. amazed at the buildings ,the roman ruins under the city are amazing, spent 2 days in gothic quarter but could have spent more it is a place not to be missed

The Place to Be. I loved this area. Our first day ever in Europe so I was highly anticipating home-basing in this area. Steps from our hotel were streets and alleys you just don't see in many places in North America. Quebec City ? New Orleans ? All so old and all so new to a first timer. The only area I was not impressed with was La Rambla...one of the reasons we decided to stay in the Gothic area. Take in mind it was early week in March so quite cool (maybe 8- 10 degrees ... mid 50's ). and raining one day. The buskers, musicians and human statues were not out. I imagine from what I've seen and heard the summers are active, crazy and downright amazing. It was an outdoor mall that could have been anywhere so when we came upon after walking it's entirety we just headed back into the incredible alleys, squares and Cathedrals and lost ourselves in exploration.
Beautiful Quarter. Definitely a must see for those visiting the city. You could spend hours just wandering the streets, visiting the cafes, bars and shops. Lots of great photo opportunities.

Get lost!. The old barri gotic has twisted, narrow cobblestone streets ripe for exploring. Cafes, shops, restaurants abound. Try to lose your way - you'll love where you find yourself. A lovely part of the city.
