Gothic Quarter. Spend time getting lost in the narrow streets of the Gothic Quarter. We have followed a guided walking tour through here and also on a Segway tour. Well worth a visit.

Shop, sightsee and soak it up. This is the heart of Barcelona. This is where you want to spend some time wandering the streets of Barcelona. Eat some pinxtos, drink some hot chocolate, buy some espadrilles. Don't miss the Picasso Museum and the Basilica of Santa Maria del Pi.

One of our Faves. We really enjoyed wondering around this area. Yes, it is touristy but the shops, eateries, churches, and museums make it a must do. We wondered around and enjoyed the entire area on two different day.
a guide or you can get lost. we booked a tour guide in our mother tongue and was very interesting to listen and to learn details about the home town of the guide - I would advise you

Fabulous Narrow Streets.. The Gothic area is probably one of the best areas of Barcelons in our opinion. The quaint streets and squares with their Tapas bars and other varied eateries are just superb.
We spent a lot of time here having seen the other sights and have booked a Hotel near so that we don't have to travel for next year.

Stroll down the Old City.. An old part of Barcelona, its like the backstreets of towns but for tourists. However, do be careful around this area. Pickpockets run rampant in this area and will target you, especially if you look "tourisy". Just bring a little bit of cash when coming here. No important documents or credit cards.

Atmospheric!. We loved walking around the Gothic quarter and all the little side streets... its a beautiful part of Barcelona. You can also pick up Trixie tours where they bike you around and tell you all about the area.
Highly recommend an afternoon wandering around :)
Very interesting.... Take a tour. Just walking around you miss the stories. There is a great churro spot that is worth finding. Xurrero sp? Lots of history

Explore!. Explore all the barrio. We didn't followed the signs, just go where we feel it was nice and we discovered small squares with coffees, old monuments, gift shops, clothes shops with different designs. A lot to see and an excellent vibe. You can find small streets almost without people. We feel safe all time.

Stepping Back in Time. A visit to Barcelona would be incomplete without seeing the Barri Gotic, the ancient Roman walls and the cathedral. There are so many shops and cafes you can while away many hours ambling through the old, small streets.

Something interesting at every corner. There is literally something to see at every corner. We took a walking tour which we highly recommend or you would miss most of it. The street music was also surprisingly good which created the perfect atmosphere to wonder the street.

Lots of charm but also some shady areas. What a great place to lose your self while having a wander. Every turn and cornerhas something different to see. Loved the whole experience. But be careful many of the small alleys were a little intimidating with groups of youths and some beggars. The strong smell of urine in some of these also stopped the whole area being 5 star. But I still felt safer than any American, British or German city.

Best thing in barcelona. In my opinion the best way to live in barcelona and enjoy the spirit of this amazing city. We stayed 3nights in barcelona. And every day we spent hours wondering and walking in the barri gotic. Great old houses shops and Hotels Lots of resturants and bars( any cuisine you wAnt). Even though it was easter time almost every restaurant was open and many shops were open. Lots of tourists making the atmosphere unique. Much better than any quarter in Barcelona.

Beautiful. Lovely area in the city and well worth finding these hidden little streets and literally see where your feet take you.Every street you stumble upon something new and it gives the city a more quaint feeling with real character and the sort of place you find the real unusual quirks of shopping in a big city.
Lovely architecture. Great place to wonder around, some lovely restaurants in the square to have a meal or just a drink or two.

A walk of life. In a lovely stroll in Barcelonas old city, you will find many small spesiality shops, world class coffee (at Nomads), a cobbler or even a maker of el guitars. If your lucky you might stumble upon La Familia, and have some perfect Empanadas for an on the go lunch.

magical place full of history. magical and wonderful walk during the day, i would recommend a guided tour to fully appreciate the history and uniqueness of this quarter, at night enjoy the many places to eat and drink and meet new people
A Must See. You just have to visit the Gothic Quarter if you are in Barcelona. The architecture is a feast for the eyes and your camera will get a workout.
Loved this neighborhood!. Beautiful churches and synagogues, lovely shops! Especially liked La Basilica Galeria and Momo for divine shopping finds!

Fun, interesting, lots to see. This is a really interesting area in Barcelona with lots of fun shops and bars/cafes/restaurants to stop in. Beautiful old buildings and small streets. Really cool; definitely recommend! Great walkability.

LOVE IT. The gothic quarter is a very large area to the right of La Rambla. There are many side streets to the right of this area where you can wander down gothic alleyways in all directions. You'll find artisan shops and gothic churches and building galore. Just explore this whole area. it is a foot job though as there is no transport around and the narrow alleyways are not used by cars at all so its a wonderful pedestrian thoroughfare.

Magic walk. We walked through this magical quarter of colorful city, we stayed out of crowded places...we have found an amazing gift shop with specialities, many magicals tiny streets, some of them living, some forgotten. Magical. Visit when not so crowded.

Fab shops and tapas. Don't miss this area of Barcelona if you are visiting. Give it some time. It's wonderful to explore and get lost down the narrow streets with their beautiful old buildings and there are lots and lots of trendy shops, cafes, bars and tapas places to be explored - enjoy !
great rental. stayed in great airbnb rental w/private passge so we were int he heart of the old city w/o the night noise. Wandered happily for hours.
Shopping amd feasting. Unique shops amd tapas restaurants and bars and ice cream shops and pasticerias. Walking distance to La Rambla and Catalunya Square.

My favourite part of Barcelona. You must see Barri Gotic when in Barcelona. The architecture,restaurants,shops, cafes and people are amazing. You could spend days here just walking and absorbing the atmosphere. As you can tell this neighbourhood has stolen my heart!

Favourite part of Barcelona . I stayed about a half hour walk away from the Gothic Quarter and absolutely loved the place despite getting lost everytime I went. It is like a maze and that's what I like about it, you can be walking along a narrow street and reach a spectacular building, cathedral, museum etc, turn a corner and you have street artists or open cafe, bars to sit in. The narrow streets are lined with shops, cafes/bars as well. It was not too crowded when we went (March 2016) and it is my favourite part of Barcelona.
Beautiful Barcelona. This area was just beautiful, full of stunning architecture and lovely restaurants. Was a bit dark at night with no lighting so I would not want to be walking around on my own

Could spend all day walking these streets. My favourite part of Barcelona. The narrow streets littered with hanging flags make a great view on a sunny afternoon. Lots of little bars and cafes to take a break and eat some local delicacies. Got lost quite a few times but that just gave us more time to discover different places.

Good for exploring. Plenty to see if you like gothic architecture and museums. For the shops check around value varies widely and of course the cathedral is a must. Like a lot of cities beggars are around the main attractions.

Darn Near Everything You Could Hope For In An Historic City. Picassso, Roman ruins, medieval cathedrals and basilicas, trendy fashions, shopping, great restaurants, luscious markets. What else do you want from an historic town center?
I really don't know.
Come here. If you want to visit an historic city you will find it here.
Spend hours exploring . Plan to take your time, get lost and explore this amazing area. So much history and lots of shops to see. There are many squares to sit relax and watch the world go by.
Roam and lose yourself. The title says it all - take a stroll and see where you end up - stop in a bar, sit inside and enjoy as close to the real Spain as you will find here

Guided |Tour is Recommended. We took a 2 hour walking tour with a company called We Barcelona around the Gothic Quarter recently.Without our Guide we would have missed not just the history and explanations but most of the remains as a lot of them are no longer obvious to the eye and are hidden being modern walls etc.A guide isn't expensive and it would be a shame to travel all the way there just to miss the attractions.

My favorite part of Barcelona. As one of my favorite things to do in Europe, wandering around the narrow alleys and local neighborhoods, the Gothic Quarter in Barcelona did not disappoint. It is so easy to loose yourself in these meandering mazes and discover some treasure around each corner, without getting totally lost. The Jewish Quarter, the Picasso museum (the building itself is worth seeing) the different plaças and mercats, churches and cathedrals. You can have Las Ramblas, I'll take the Gothic Quarter. Just in case you are worried about getting lost, which is hard to do, just walk in one direction for several blocks to get your bearings. But pull up the map on your phone when on WiFi in your hotel. Then use the GPS when out wandering around. In some spots you will loose GPS accuracy, but just walk to a more open area to regain the accuracy. We used this method to locate a hard to find gem of a restaurant called La Vinateria del Call. Make reservations and give yourself time to find it.
Wonderful place to wander around and eat/drink. We spent most of our time wandering around here. Well worth lots of exploring. Restaurant, bars and shops which are all lovely.

Beautiful. We walked around here quite a lot on our trip, each little side street brings something new to your day! There are lots of shops and restaurants that are much better than those on the main las ramblas!
Twists and turns.... New sights around every corner and lots of food opportunities. Atmospheric shopping experience but pity about all the people!

Find the free walking tour company. We took another free walking tour where you just tip the guide. It is so with it! And please tip,your guide well, they are so well informed on the history as well as the general area information! We never would have seen the hidden parts of the Gothic Quarter if we had not taken the tour! Don't miss this area of Barcelona!
Gothic Quarter. An area filled with bars and young people, with a lot of happenings in the streets. Lots of interesting shops and street artists.

Tourism. I think this is the hear of Barcelona. All the builgings and atmosphere looks like were Barcelona is born. You can walk in dire streets and suddenly saw the Picasso Museum or reach the sea side. I think all nice reastaurants..are in this place. Must see the sunday morning the crowd in front of cathedral.
Beautiful. We stayed in this area, and it was bustling with energy and fun each night, street performers, shops, cafes, and resturants. We loved it.

Great Area - Near Las Ramblas. The gothic quarter is part of original Barcelona and has some of the oldest buildings within. The gothic area borders the famous and popular Las Ramblas shopping area to the east. Don't miss the little known Muralla Romana (Roman Wall) and old city gate near Baixada de Viladecols. There is also Plaça Reial and Cathedral of Barcelona in the Gothic Quarter.
Guided walk. Our Spanish guide was sooo informative and took us around all the hidden gems this quarter has to offer. A wonderful, unforgettable experience and I cannot recommend it enough

history under our feet. gothic gothic! stepping back into early ages....travelling back in time (800 ages maybe). we love this district....the only disadvantage that there are so many tourist that you cannot enjoy the streets. they shouting,making the mess...strongly advised to visit in the evening when the streets are NOT full. if u get lucky u can meet street musicians as well :)

Love the location if the cathedral. Its a beautiful cathedral, with a delightful flea market outside. Location is great many local spots of interest. Walking the streets gives you a sense Spain's history. Worth a visit

Map sure you have a map or Google maps. I love this part of Barcelona. It's fun to get lost and just explore through here. The problem is that is can be easy to get lost. Some streets are curved or at different angles so you can end up not where you want to go. Which can be fun! But frustrating if you are in a hurry. Check out Plaça Nova to see the cathedral or Plaça Reial!
Nice and original stores. Barri Gotic is located at the end of the ramblas. Allot of original small stores are located here! Defenitly a place you must walk through, place for artists.

Step back in time. The gothic quater is rich and vibrant and steeped in history. To my mind this is the most attractive part of the city. Wander through the dark little alleyways and discover wonderful little shops and tapas bars cheek to jowl with the Cathedral and the oldest synagogue in Barcelona. Do be careful of taxis suddenly appearing you have to hug the walls!
Something different. Wherever you look there is history, oozing from buildings, streets.....everywhere. aAmazing architecture, narrow streets & passages.

Beautiful Place to Explore. I love wandering around old cities and exploring and the Gothic Quarter of Barcelona did not disappoint! It's beautiful, and everywhere you turn, there's something new to explore. At one point I heard some beautiful harp music but it was impossible to tell where it was coming from. I rounded a corner and there was the harpist. I stood quietly for several minutes listening to the beautiful music--the stone walls made for some great acoustics! The cathedral is a work of art. Early in the morning the streets are uncrowded and it was a lovely way to spend a few hours. I visited there a couple times during my stay in Barcelona and just allowed myself to get lost. There was some great shopping there, too!
The real Barcelona. We wandered through the barri gotic, the old city of Barcelona up to the seafront. Very nice. A must!

Wander the old streets, and visit the lovely shops and the Cathedral.. Enjoyed our visit here, there is the Cathedral with amazing shiny metal sculptures in an area outside, loads of interesting shops, cafes, restaurants, narrow streets. Musicians were playing near the Cathedral, all adding to the atmosphere. The Cathedral is free to look around in the morning, there is an entrance fee in the afternoon.

The historic part of the city... Its always a pleasure walking through the historic narrow streets of the Barri Gotic. This time again, it was not any different..I would recommend that you plan atleat half a day walking tour inside the Gotic. Dress for comfort and be sure to wear your walking shoes.
Must see. Highly recommendable, but be aware of all the tourist traps.It is highly recommendable to do a guided tour either by bike or just walking around.
Amazing architecture. This quarter is a must see if you're visiting Barcelona! The streets and the buildings have a special gothic architecture that gives you goosebumps!
Don't Miss the Cathedal!. Wonderful Barcelona Cathedal which is in the Bari Gotic and free to tour. Lovely arches and numerous arches. Don't miss!
Nice. Small shops with special things, cosy quarters, nice old churches with atmosphere, cosy restaurants.

Place you can never miss. . A place for you to know about Barcelona history, from buildings to food. Spend half of your day to walk around here. Pay a visit at the Barcelona cathedral, you will never regret. Recommend!!
Get lost in the narrow streets. Great palce to explore the old part of the city. You can find plenty of little shops and restaurants.

Central Spot. My hotel was in this area which is pretty much central to everything, I was able to walk to most of the venues. I had purchased a 5 day Metro ticket which I used only 3 times, for 28 Euro's not the best deal. the area has lots of alley type streets which have a multitude of restaurants. The place to be for meJeffv

Lovely walks. I loved walking through the gothic quarter. You can spend hours just getting lost in the narrow streets. There are lovely little shops everywhere and great places to eat. Definitely spend a day walking around here and taking in the sights.

A place worth to visit. We stayed in the Gothic district and we enjoyed it. The Gothic district is a place worth to visit. It has many little alleys lined by local and picturesque shops. There are also many delicious pastries shops making great choccolate coockies.In the Gothic distric there is also the Picasso museum . We highly recommend a visit to the Barcelona Barrio Gotico!

Still pretty, but much more commercialised than 10 years ago. Definitely visit - but 10 years ago it was edgy with independent traders and artists with hole-in-the-wall style shops. Now it is full of chain stores that you would find on the high street and posh art galleries. Some might say it was an improvement, but I liked the more raw and traditional atmosphere of years gone by that you found there. The architecture is still stunning & wandering around is still a very cool experience.

No one can miss it and so it should be. The most pleasant qyarter of Barcelona, with it's small alleys beautiful boutique stores variety of museums and historic buildings and great places to sit or eat.
Here is real history.. Every visitor to Barcelona will visit the Gothic Quarter-for history, museums and eating and drinking--one of the oldest parts of the city and most interesting.

Medieval romance. Gothic Quarter is the place everyone should go to see history and culture of Barcelona. Medieval churches and alleyways are so intriguing and fascinating. You can easily get lost in there and don't stress about it. It is beautiful, full of arts and culture. It's completely free!
another lovely place. we sat outside while the sun was going down. a lovely scenic place. a true made of art. definitely a must visit.
Great place. Cool atmosphere, plenty of good little bars and restaurants and monuments. Good area to wander round and recommend this as a base to stay when in the city.

You can get lost in the details. The architecture is stunning, give yourself at least an hour to 90 minutes to walk and stare. Not a single point destination, more of a let yourself get a little lost and look around experience.

A "gothic" stroll.... Nice place to walk around exploring all the alleys, streets, shops and squares you just stumble on to, some beautiful architecture on show and plenty of places to stop for food and drinks...
So quaint. Well worth a wander around this area. The streets are so quaint & querky. Definitely worth a visit. There is some amazing architecture on the building
Nice & Old Neighborhood. Nice & Old Neighborhood with its narrow and dark streets. Nice small cafes ₺ shops. Close to la rambla street. Loved its streets and getting lost around.
Incredible!. This old neighborhood is so charming. It is clean and has great little restaurants and shops. I would love to live in this neighborhood. You can imagine yourself going back in time.

Perfectly interesting but not really why you come to Barcelona.... There are a number of cities in Europe and even Britain with more interesting and larger "Gothic" quarters. This one is fine, albeit on the small side, but with some added Roman wall "pizzazz". But the main point is this is not the 1st, 2nd or 3rd reason to visit Barcelona. Fine of itself but...
Best place for strolling!. From noon untill night pepole are walking in this area. I think it is the best place for booking hotel in the barcelona !. You can go every where by walk !.
I just adored this part of city. I'd like to spend more thime in this city to explore better his streets, and museums, but I saw many interesting places there.
Just go explore the narrow streets. Great day exploring and getting lost in the narrow streets. Came across some lovely buildings and squares. Worth spending some time here
Nice neighborhood. Its a nice and misterious neighborhood loaded with a lot of history. So definetely it is a must see.
Gothic. So many places to see and museums in this area are immense. Take your time to see it. An easy walk down Via Laietana from Plaza Catalunya.
Beautiful Barna. It is great place to start your visit of Barcelona. There are free guided tours and you can visit the cathedral after 5pm for free.

very informative and entertaining. I booked in advance on line with Green Bean "free Tours" where you give what you think the service was worth AFTER the tour is completed. It was very well organised, small groups of people with a lovely knowledgeable guide. Excellent and well worth doing

Fantastic walking tour. You go to Barcelona? You have to go to the Gothic Quarter. Without it, in truth, you are skipping over the birthplace of Barcelona. Roman ruins await you meters under this area at the MUH. The Placa del Rei (nearby) is the where the last Catalonian King died and later, where the Spanish Inquisition hung and tortured people. Everywhere you look is a remarkable building with gargoyles. Everywhere you step, you realize that thousands of years worth of people have come before you. Christopher Columbus came here to try to drum up money for his trip! Street artists, walking tours, bike tours, it's incredible. BEWARE OF PICKPOCKETS. As my taxi driver told me: They want to hablahablahabla to take take take. Hold your bag and tell them vente. (Go away) Lol. Also make sure to see the Boqueria here. The open air market that's the oldest, (I believe), in existence. Don't miss.

Great History & Beautiful Architecture. Great area of the city that has been preserved to showcase the history of Barcelona and its architecture. Enjoyed walking through this area and exploring side streets, shops and restaurants. It's touristy but still a valuable experience that provides context into the history of the city. Strongly recommend.

Lovely . Went here late afternoon and spent a good 3-4 hours in this place as there's so much to see. It's very crowded. There's loads of stalls selling junk but was all worth a look. There are alley ways that lead to long strips of shops and centres it's definitely worth a visit.
Gotico. I read the other reviews about the barri Gotic,but I have to mention something about security. Take care of your belongings from the airport train subway bus and streets of Barcelona.

A must . We spent a full day wandering around the Gothic Quarter looking at the shops, the hidden gems and churches. It is a must stop for everyone. Really good bars and small restaurants and not as expensive as on the Ramblas. Food is better too. Had some great tapas in a very small bar.. Looked nothing special but food was excellent and cheap. Most evening we would end up in this area for drinks and tapas. Good done really good photos too.

Don't use a map. Once you have found the place put the map away and just wander through the shop lined alleys. A great way to spend a few hours just looking at the architecture and discovering churches and plazas that appear when you go around corners.

Lots of things to see and lovely shops. This is one of my favourite places in Barcelona so far. It's full of lovely churches and buildings. It has the charm of the historical places plus it has a lot of cool shops with original art and crafts. I strongly recommend it! Highlights: the Cathedral and the churches of S. Maria Del mar and S. Maria Del Pi

Beautiful area. Great area to walk around and do everything from shop in locals stores to high end galleries, major chain stores and more. Architecture in the area is absolutely beautiful. Many restaurants that over an incredible variety of food.
Quick view. In the morning hours it is nice place to visit. Not crowded. Sunny day makes this place really special. Not difficult to find.

A quiet place, perfect for walking. Narrow streets with lots of outdoor cafes. Many facades with beautiful Gothic architecture. It looks amazing at night when the lighting is switched on and appears buskers.

Enchanting. The Gothic Quarter is the old city and has a wonderful maze of narrow streets. There is a surprise around every corner and the next alley may have a butcher next to a hardware store next to a tiny church. There is an excellent FREE 2 1/2 hour tour with runner bean tours at 11am daily. There is so much history in such a small area.
Busy Ancient Streets. Ancient streets and buildings being used for stores, restaurants and apartments. Great to see the life on the narrow winding roads and alleys.
Nice and easily walkable. Nice area to walk around. Nothing too special in comparison with many other European old towns. You can visit it in just a few hours.

Some of the Best Strolling. If you love to shop, stroll and tour, then the Gothic Quarter is for you. Strolling down the narrow streets takes you back in time and you will enjoy the quaint cafes and boutiques.
Mind blowing. I'm from stonemasonry background and this was a fine piece of architecture to say the least.It's a must visit if you stay in Barcelona.
beautiful and interesting. Loved the gothic quarter was a fave, the architecture was beautiful. Lots of independent shops and restaurants.

Good food, wine, and sights. if you're out for a wander about in Barcelona then swing by here. Lot's of little places to stop for food and drinks; the kind of places you can sit outside and enjoy the weather and architecture.
lovely to explore. Hotel was opposite the cathedral, wonderful to explore the narrow streets. Lovely boutique shops and the usual touristy things.

Nice to wander, shop, eat and drink...... Lovely area to just wander around, inevitably getting a little lost. Some nice shops, as well as some tourist tat! Quite crowded, even in March. Plenty of places to eat and drink to suit all budgets, and some interesting architecture and pleasant little squares. The cathedral is beautiful. Having got lost, we did find ourselves in one area behind the food market which appeared to be full of young ladies (and a few not so young) who appeared to be sauntering around and waiting for something of someone....and quite a few men hanging around in large groups. Probably all quite harmless but we made a quick retreat as we didn't feel very comfortable.
Great place. Fantastic choice of Restaurants and close to Rambles and Train stations,Zoo,Parks and so much more. We stayed at Ciutat Hotel which is basic hut clean with friendly staff.
Great Gothic theme filled with random dragons. Great area to walk around and visit. You will encounter a tremendous amounts of scifi animals and great buildings churches palaces and what not.

Get lost!. Walk the Ramblas once to say you've been there then go to the cathedral, take a side street, forget your map and get lost in this wonderland of medieval streets populated with an eclectic array of shops, restaurants and tapas bars.

love the style. The Gothic Quarter is filled with the typical Gothic style buildings. If you haven't seen them in any other city you definitely should. It's easy to wander around all day and enjoy the atmosphere.

Outstanding gothic quarter tour. We did a small group walking tour through Barcelona Turisme. We prepaid, and met at Placa Sant Jaume. Our guide Jordi was excellent, a true history buff, whose enthusiasm was infectious. We learned a great deal of history, architecture and culture, as well as great detail about the structures and sights we visited. Highly recommended.
Short visit in gothic quater. Allways a visit in down town of barcelona....all the small ways trough the gothic quater you will find on every new visit some new tapas bars or shops
Best part of Barcelona. I'ts the most interesting and lively part of the city. Go here instead of the Rambla :) I'd recommend taking one of the free walking tours around to really appreciate it.

You've never been to Barcelona if you didn't get lost in the Barri Gotic!. This is a real neighborhood from the middle ages, untouched by renassance. The streets are so narrow, everything is so dark, the shops so small, the architecture is so opressing, and yet, it's all so stunningly beautiful.
Defenitely worth the visit and the walk.
You've never been to Barcelona if you didn't get lost in the Barri Gothic!

Really cool, but over run. Very cool. Narrow streets, beautiful buildings and balconies. Hidden courtyards. But also ... Starbucks, sunglasses hut, etc. you have to go, but so does EVERY visitor to Barcelona.

IMHO the spirit of Barcelona is here. Both the Park Guell and Sagrada Familia come a little too close to the kitsch (Gaudi may have been a genius but some of his choices are questionable). This area however has a true old European spirit, a lot of nice places to visit (museums, shops, etc.) and a great Gothic cathedral.
Amazing. We really enjoyed walking around this place. We took some time to eat along the water. There were so many excellent places to choose from.

Walk through the past. Barri Gotic is the beautiful mid evil centre in Barcelona. Narrow streets lined with cafes and small shoppes make it the perfect place to walk and soak up the unique atmosphere of this area. This area is good for anyone, families, teens, couples and people on their own, small book shoppes, artisan shoppes selling hand made clay or ceramic pieces, hand made, hand painted Spanish fan all very beautiful. Rainy days, still worth it with an umbrella.

Put your wallet in your front pocket and just explore. Careful of pick pockets - put your wallet in your front pocket and cover it with your hand. Don't leave anythign unattended on the table. There are a TON of things to see in do in the Gothic Quarter and it's pretty amazing. I saw live concerts (piano in a square), people singing in opera in the garden of a church, and incredible shopping, site seeing, and people watching.Don't make a plan - just go explore.
Popular place.. Must see in Barcelona, surrounding streets full of cafes, bars, food. Architecture is amazing around here, not far from other touristy places in Barcelona

Such a fun, interesting place!. This was my favorite area of Barcelona. You get a local feel and you can get lost here. Every corner is full of surprises - stores, restaurants, free entertainment.All the music you hear people playing in the streets is actually approved by the city. Therefore, these artists have to audition to even be able to play their music for you.I would HIGHLY recommend to stay here to anyone and I would stay here if i ever go back.

Gothic Quarter in Barcelona, Spain. The rich history of this place will amaze you. The church, square and the last piece of the arch will take you back to the old Barcelona. There are lots of alleys to explore and great place to get lost. Love my time here.

Beautiful for walking around this area.. The little narrow streets, the cathedral, the antique market in the cathedral square and especially the plaza de Sant Jaume where you will find on one side the Catalan Parlament building guarded by the Catalan police and on the other side of the square the town hall guarded by the local police is a wonderfull place for walking and taking lots of photos. Absolutely unmissable.

Relax on the Gótico seats. It is time to turn left into the Gothic, Gothic Quarter. Just off the Ramblas you will find the beautiful Plaça Reial, a neoclassical gem that contains the first work of Antoni Gaudí in the city: the lamps of the central fountain. Take the opportunity to have a coffee in one of the bars that line the square. The Gothic has many shops and galleries ideal for snooping. Carrer de Ferran is a paradise of shopping. At the end of this street is the Plaça de Sant Jaume, on which are the Palau de la Generalitat, the seat of Catalan government and the town hall just opposite.Since the Plaza San Jaume, turn left on Carrer del Bisbe, where you will discover a much-photographed arch in Gothic style, is located just opposite the Cathedral of Santa Creu i Santa's Eulàlia, dating from the 13th century. As the main Catalan Gothic building in the city, the cathedral is spectacular both outside and inside. Its many chapels all dedicated to particular saints are all remarkable works of wholly crafts. Many visitors come to pray.The Gothic vault above the Carrer del BisbeThe cloister is also home to 13 geese that symbolize each a year in the life of Sainte-Eulalie, to which the cathedral is dedicated. Especially in summer, Barcelona neighborhood may seem a little stale. To help you get your bearings above the maze of the old city, take the lift to the roof of the cathedral. If you fancy a quiet moment in the Gothic, go to Plaça de Sant Felip Neri.
Same old churches, cool history. The churches and architecture are the same, however good information and places apart of the Spanish revolution.

Walk around. Fall in love . According to my iPhone and its somewhat questionable iHealth app I walked about 25 miles in the gothic quarter and el born during my week in Barcelona. Don't miss it. Go without a purpose. Just wander around.

History, museums and shopping in one area. We returned here after a 5 year absence and only found that what had changed was there were newer shops and our favorite whiskey store was gone. Also far fever pick pockets and gypsies than 5 years ago. But some of our other favorite places were still open. These incredibly wonderful narrow alleys and streets are full of fabulous little shops with local designers and crafts and Wares and certainly if you're a shopper this should not be missed because you will find here things that you cannot find anywhere else. Also some great little spots for eating. And this area is, of course, home to many museums a great church and a monument to the city of Barcelona and those who saved it in a siege in the early 18th century.

Could spend days wandering around here. So much color, culture, art, great restaurants and fun shops. The Ramblas with its market stalls, broad pedestrian walkway, people strolling, fountains, and beautiful low-rise buildings all around. The wrought iron balconies are all different and so beautiful!

layers and layers of history - a captivating place. This place is probably not for everyone, but it does have its magic. It's just a few blocks away from Las Ramblas, but it's a totally different world. Las Ramblas are full of classic tourist traps - shopping, "local" food, lights and crowds. Something you see for 10 mins and you've seen it all. Gothic Quarter, meanwhile, is very deep. It's very unique. There are layers and layers you can slowly discover. It goes back to the Roman times and once in a while you see some churches or buildings with foundations exposed and it shows how this neighborhood was built literally over thousands of years. Since it's been lived and developed all that time, it's not a "no touching" exhibition. The streets are still narrow but people do live here, so you can easily imagine how it was back in the days. Frankly, I don't think I need to say more. If they idea of walking the narrow streets lived for a couple thousands years sounds attractive to you, you'll love this place. If not - give it a try, and if it's not your cup of teat - Las Ramblas are just a couple minutes away, so you can't lose.
Architecture unforgettable . Unique. So much history. Bring a camara. Phone will not do this place justice. There are so many things going on around you, it makes the experience that more complete.

Jackie and Rod from Canada. We were extremely pleased that we had booked a hotel in the Gothic Quarter. We had easy access to everything we wanted to see and do. Close to buses, easy walking, tons of shops and restaurants, all fun to visit and enjoy.
Beautiful neighborhood. One of the best places in Barcelona to visit. I love to walk around here and see all the small shops and museums.Don't forget to visit the cathedral.

Good for a wander round.. Loads of things of interest.Many different architectural designs of building and little shops.Good local pubs and authentic eateries.Beware pickpockets especially people pretending to do surveys.I had money taken in the square by the cathedral.

Well worth a walk around . Area was recommended to us and glad we visited area. Plenty to see and admire in this old part of the city . Could easily spend a long day exploring. When in Barcelona a must see area to visit

historic heart of old Barcelona. this area combines the historic heart of old Barcelona with modern shopping and plenty of places to eat. From hidden alleys in a maze of streets to wonderful plazas this is a wonderful area to browse and ponder before stopping for a drink or some tapas.
Great to wander around. You can just wander around the many alleys and squares and discover many things. We found churces and free exhibitions.
wlaking tour with a history lesson. This is a neighborhood you don't want to miss while in Barcelona. The history is amazing so try and do it with someones who knows its background.

Beautiful area of the city!. The Gothic quarter is something different from the tourist trap of Las ramblas wth some nice boutique and original little shops selling jewellery, clothes, nick nacks etc and some tall pretty buildings to see along the way.
The cathedral there is free to enter to look round and has magnificent detail in the architecture.
Watch out for beggars mind you.

Gothic Quarter. This is a must when you visit Barcelona. The Cathedral is beautiful. The area is a maze of narrow streets that open up into squares where there are restaurants and Tapas bars. It is a wonderful place to people watch on a sunny day. There are also plenty of shops and there are plenty of bargains to be had. Please do not miss this lovely area and do not forget to look upwards to see the architecture.
Very Nice. go along the Nero streets just enjoy the atmosphere of al the little shops and restaurants that are every where

Walk around and enjoy. It is a very nice area to walk and enjoy the small streets, some very beautiful houses and the atmosphere. It is a bit of a tourist trap but if you are selective to can find wonderful staff there. yona s.

Got lost around gothic quarter . We wanted to take a tour at first but the decided to go walking and just get lost a bit around and see what we can find. Beautiful buildings. Lovely streets and amazing cafes and restaurants along the way
Most visited. Stayed in hotel here so was central to everything. Get a 3.4.5. day metro ticket, this will get you about more quickly. Did walk loads but for further locations best is Metro

So much to do so much to see. What a beautiful place, so much to see and so much to do. The Barcelona Cathedral is awesome and a true place for worship. ALso the staff at the cathedral is very tollerant with visitors. The give information freely in between there word. The rest of the area is als beautiful, with nice plakas and restaurants. Also there is the lovely Marcado with excellent food. The vibe on las Ramblas is great. For me, the best part of Barcelona

Lovely architecture . Great area steeped in historical buildings, chocolate shops and buzzing streets. Loved the vibe of wandering around this area during the day, didn't visit during the evening though so can't comment.

The Old Barcelona. Nice little streets to walk around, full of shops, restaurants and surprising places. From the Rambla to the "Plaza del Rey" and the Colombus statue, many squares, churches, etc. to discover

Don't stay anywhere else.. The gothic area is bursting with character. A myriad of bespoke shops, with bars and restaurants aplenty. Oozing charm and lots of hidden gems. You could easily spend the day wandering and not see the same thing twice.

A great place to get lost!. So much to see, so many amazing buildings - the Barri Gotic is packed with history. Wear flat shoes (some of the pavements are a little uneven) and make sure you keep looking up to see all the glorious architecture around you. Expect to get lost as well...it's the best way to find the true Barcelona.

Step back in time. Want a place to get lost and explore the cobbled streets and intriguing shops around each corner. The gothic quarter is a must to wander aimlessly and admire the history, organised tours of the area are a great place to start.
Boutique shops and more. A different shop every 10 metersCobbled streets and a new turn every 100metersWorth exploring with plenty or bars and cafes to fuel up in

My favourite place in Barcelona. Beautiful streets and buildings, there are a few cathedrals worth seeing here as well as many shops and restaurants. Wander around the streets and gaze at the gothic era buildings.
Nice bario. The district is very nice. The church and the cathedral have very nice gothic architecture. It is simply impressive. Must see in Barcelona. The entrance to church is free.

Nice neighbourhood . This is a nice neighbourhood to just walk around, the narrow streets give it a strange look and feel. Don't be discouraged by all the graffiti on the doors, it is a very interesting part of town, lots of good places to eat and shop

Narrow streets on a overbooked city. Barcelona is indeed very nice, city night is fun, but the city is so filled with tourists a dirty neighborhoods that I definitly loved to get lost on the narrow and dark alleys of the gothic quarter.

Beautiful and free!. A beautiful building....most of the exhibits were behind cages but you can see them and see how amazing the church is...there was a service being held while we were there...the music was majestic and added to the gothic feel.

Worthwhile outing... . Our hotel is situated next to La Rambla. The quarter is a great place to wonder and check out some of the beautiful structures.
The Gothic Quarter is the centre of the old city of Barcelona. It stretches from La Rambla to Via Laietana, and from the Mediterranean seafront to Ronda de Sant Pere.

Walk, talk to locals, and just enjoy!. Best neighborhood to get lost in, to wander around discover something new/ols and interesting around every corner, down evvery narrow lane. Full of history, architecture, personality
An interesting walk.. An interesting walk culminating with a visit to the beautiful cathedral followed by a band on the steps with locals dancing.

A must in Barcelona.. You can easily use one day just exploring this part of the city. It is remarkable how interesting and exciting it is to explore the seemingly chaotic virvar of small streets, usually ending up in charming, cosy and peaceful plazas or squares. You have to take care not to stumble when exploring the Gothic Quarter as you tend to always look up to admire fine architectural details of old building facades, the spires of a small church or a basilica or cathedral or the many public sculptures placed in strategic places. When your neck is tired of looking up you can instead look inside the many special shops , bars, cafes and restaurants which are in abundance in the area. Do not forget to admire Julio Nieto's sculptures in Plaça Nova, in a shady corner, just outside the Villa del Arte, or enjoy the ambience of Plaza Sta. Maria del Pi, where the basilica of Sta. Maria del Pi is also located. Remember to give this visit more time, as there are so many things to see and do here.

Don't miss this!. Barri Gotic is the oldest part of the city. It is a dense maze of shops, cafes, alleyways and squares. There are antique dealers, galleries and food stores side by side with boutiques and fast food outlets.

Favourite part of my favourite city. I've visited countless times Barcelona and I can easily say it is my favourite city in the world. My best friend lives here as she is studying medicine and I always visit whenever I can. The city is fantastic but 'El Barrio Gotico', where she resides, is a whole other city compared to the rest of Barcelona. Being the old historic center of Barcelona you can tell and feel the history of the place simply by walking through its tight alleyways filled with small shops and restaurants. The variety of foods is absurd and I have had some of my all time favourite dishes here, along with a great variety in prices if you look well enough. Situated next to La Rambla, one of Barcelona's most well known areas which is always buzzing with life even until early hours of the morning, it is extremely easy to access using Barcelona's metro. Although it has never happened to me in many times I've been, Las Ramblas and the Barrio Gotico are notorious for its pick pockets. Just be alert and you'll be fine. The lovely beach of La Barcelonetta is a few minutes away walking down by the port and towards the iconic 'La Vela', as it is commonly known, hotel which sits on the coast. If you visit Barcelona, you must come down to this area, as for myself at least, it is easily the best part of an absolutely amazing city.

Very nice indeed. I went on a group walking tour around this area, then afterwards, branched out on my own to explore more. It's a lovely area with lots of shops and restaurants interspersed between the wonderful historic buildings. You could easily spend most of a day here!
Shopping. The area is very beautiful but there are far too many tourist shops. It was surprisingly difficult to find a nice coffee shop.
Amazing. I loved finding this place. The narrow streets, the amazing architecture. A must see. I look forward to visiting again.
Lovely area. Some wonderful architecture, lovely alleyways with specialist shops, beautiful churches, great parks, squares and open spaces all wonderfully kept by the local authorities.

Interesting. Nice area to wander around in, alleys and little roads every direction.
Some great shopping and bars and a really nice feel to the area

Awesome Old Town Area of Barcelona. A must see area of Barcelona. It is so fun to walk around, explore the stores, shops, restaurants and bars. Walk down some of the narrow streets, visit the Church, etc.
Highly recommended.
WOW. I didn't want to leave this place. There is so much history here and there are vendors everywhere. A good place to get lost in and enjoy. A must see.

A meandering adventure. Awesome experience. An amazing assortment of history architecture music and food. Easy to get around with lots of hidden treasures. Its worth a slow walk to explore and have some ice cream. A must for families.

Magic... The best part of barcelona center.. it has a great character and it is ideal for strolls with friends and couples.. there are many pretty shops, restaurants, pubs and bars so that you can find what you look for..

Wonderfully Preserved. The Gothic section of Barcelona is not to be missed. Well preserved and while some modern shops have popped up, the area has not be too touristy. My daughter signed us for a free tour and our guide was outstanding!! He was knowledgeable, spoke very good English and was very friendly. These guys work for tips so please be generous!
Gothic quarter. Great to stroll through the streets look in all the shops and grab some tapas. Lovely cathedral. Also the Picasso museum is here.

Well worth a walk around. Go and have a look around the wonderful gothic quarter of Barcelona, you won't be disappointed, there are so many things to see around each and every corner you turn, and don't forget to look up either, as there are as many things above your head also, the lanes are full of bars and shops and restaurant's.A great place to wonder around. Give it a go.
A Journey Back in Time. If you have the time, visit the historical Gothic Quarter in Barcelona. It is like taking a walk back in time. If you enjoy architecture, spend some time here.
Great interesting area to visit. The Gotic area is must see while in Barcelona since it's real nice and interesting to vist and walk thru!

Atmospheric old quarter. Great place to spend an hour or two just wandering and soaking up the atmosphere. The cathedral is also worth a visit,and free in the mornings. The history of barcelona museum is also worth visit,for the roman remains below the floor.
Two minutes from our hotel the ohla. lovely to walk around here not normally one for sightseeing but loved this the architecture throughout Barcelona a is amazing

Narrow, winding streets full of character. Prepare to get lost in this maze of streets but you will be rewarded with some great sights. Shops selling 'jamon' strung up in the windows, gorgeous pastries, clothes, souvenirs etc. Atmospheric, faded charm in buckets full! You might even stumble across the cathedral!
Walking in Barcelona. This is one of our favourite Barcelona walks! Colourful, historic, gives a real flavour of the city.

Great to soak up a feel of the real Barcelona . You can immerse yourself in the culture with many museums and Gothic churches to visit our just walk around the narrow streets and alleyways. Really get a feel for Barcelona.
Good walking. A great place to walk around. There are so many good places to eat and drink. We had a hard time deciding. It's a great place to just sit and watch the tourists and locals pass by.
AWESOME!!!!. Guided tour through the area. I found it worth it and very interesting. We forget how beautiful the "old" world was
The atmosphere is amazing. Go for a walk to the Gothic Quarter. The architecture is beautiful, worth spending a couple of hours.

This is a walking tour only--get out of the taxi!. Take a special walk through an incredible slice of the city. It is a special architectural experience that I wish existed in every city. It is at the top of the to do list in Barcelona!
Under no circumstances should you forget to bring a good camera--one better than your cell phone!

Excellent Location for Shopping . We visited the Gothic Quarter with a tour group (which has been rated separately) and were amazed at the diversity of shops: from bakeries, cafes, restaurants, clothing stores, knick knacks, jewellery, tourist shops, as well as art galleries, museums and churches. If you've been to Venice it is very similar with winding streets leading to all sorts of delights as well as surprises when you come to a park or an enormous Church towering above you.The best part about the area is the lack of people and the number of boutique shops. If you love shopping and want to go somewhere authentic, it is highly recommended.

Definitely have a guide.... Even with gps this section was a maze of streets and alleys. With a tour guide it was very interesting and fun to visit. The GPS will cut out when the streets get very narrow. I started to just use the compass on my iPhone. Turned out to be more useful than GPS on many occasions.
Lovely. A scenic area with lovely traditional alleys outstanding churches and a lot of small souvenir markets restaurants and chocolateries. A must see in Barcelona

nice Area with small streets and plenty to see. this Q was a bit not clear to find since its in fact all kinds of street . we walked there for few hours, many shops , restaurants and Cafe. we had a vey good lunch at one of the restaurants and enjoyed walking there.

So many things to do!. There's something for everybody in the quarter. The Catedral clubs, restaurants, shopping just walking around, you name it. Of course it's mostlyy for tourists but you can spend days walking around and see something different every day.

Mysterious, Historic, Alive with Renovation and growth. Wandering the barri gotic is a stroll thru the past, the present and the future all at once. The 15th century buildings surround you, the sounds of the past whispering thru the winding lanes. The presence of the handsome, busy construction workers scurrying between the ten inch walls, half hidden by sheer drapes, testify to the constant loving care these ancient structures receive as upgrading and renovation occur even as they keep the appearance of the past. It does not matter if you lose your way, all roads lead eventually back to a large plaza where the protesters, the tourists and the Barcelonans deal with life today.

Get yourself lost in the Gothic Quarter. Do yourself a favor and just get yourself lost while wandering the Gothic Quarter. Don't forget to look up at the balconies and take a close look at the doors. Very small streets and a lot of activity to see. Tons of little shops to wander into, many places to sit outside and sip a glass of Cava and enjoy some tapas. It is a great area to spend a day or four!

nice walk and amazing view. One of the amazing walk's i have ever been. Make sure you are wearing some thing very comfy as if u love art and architecture then its a must that you go through this place
Nice Area. Unique area in the city. We walked with our children looking at the interesting architecture and shops. Not a lot for kids to do though. It was interesting for the parents.

So interesting to see!!!!. It's exacting as its name suggests, the Gothic Quarter, all the streets you walk up and down and in and out, everyone of them have different details! I loved wandering them... What a fantastic place it is 😊 It's a must see, there were free walking tours also. We didn't avail of these but there were many that did!
The best of Barcelona. The whole area is absolutely enchanting with never ending winding alleyways full of surprises. Plenty of friendly cafes and bakeries to sustain you along the way.

lots to see and do a good sunday trip.. A great area on a sunday not busy early in the day, but soon fills up. Interesting buildings goudis museum is in this area as is the city cathedrals.we arrived as a carnaval was taking place in the square, around 12pm the locals dance in front of the cathedral great time to sit and watch. We also watched lace makers a whole sreet of them!so much to see in this area.

Wonderful Area for a Walk. Great Bars, people, building and feel! We walked for hours, sometimes stopping at local places for Tapas or Wine or Shopping. Really nice area (and safe) to spens an afternoon!
The real Barcelona. I can see how this would be crowded and hectic in summer so an off-season visit allowed us to experience the real streets of "old" Barcelona. Worth the time and effort.

Delightful day or night but especially night!. Centred around a lovely cathedral and very old monastic type buildings, this area is not that big but so rich in history and the real Spain. Best area to eat at night with a selection of lovely retardants and tapas bars which overall are reasonably priced with very good quality local food and friendly staff. Walk up the alley by the side of the Cathedral in the evening and you may come across the most amazing opera singers just singing for the love of it....and a bit of your change. We were very moved at the atmosphere and amazing skills they showed. All the more powerful for being on a street corner in the dark. We saw many people in tears. Loved this area.
Great to see!. The Gootic area is great to see and walk! Very narrow streets and plenty of restaurants and shops to visit!

The gothic quarter is exactly as it is named . I loved the gothic quarter and it definitely lives up to its name. Especially at night. Some really good restaurants and funky gothic bars. The church in the centre is beautiful, with the geese running around in the middle of it. The only thing I would say about the gothic quarter is to be careful at night, especially if you are a lone traveller. There is a lot of dark narrow lanes and some guys selling drugs, just keep your wits about you, really beautiful and atmospheric.
Lovely area to walk. Lots of interesting non-Gaudi architecture - Santa Maria del mar Cathedral. Lovely little shops with locally sourced gifts.
Must Visit in Barcelona. Definitely an area in Barcelona that is a "must visit"! Small streets, interesting architecture, good food, Spanish culture...

I LOVE the gothic quarter!. This is one of my favorite cities to visit mostly because of the gothic quarter. I love the old world architecture, the very narrow streets and alley's you can wander down and find a cool little bar tucked away or a restaurant with great food. It is so unique from everywhere else I travel that I always look forward to coming here.

Fascinating area. We wandered around the maze of streets and alleyways which make up this quarter and found it fascinating. We learned much about the Catalan people, their origins and ways. If you are n Barcelona, make an effort to get off the main highways and learn to appreciate the small things. Look up to the high Windows and rooftops, observe the doorways and mouldings. You will not regret it!
AmaZeing. Take you time to wander down the side streets, loads of hidden treasures and sights. Some cheaper resturants in the back streets
Lovely for a stroll and more...... Filled with charm, some good places to eat, shop and drink. Different, more sedate part of Barcelona, We came a few times to soak in the ambiance. Worth a visit !!

Great atmosphere and buzz. We only had time for a quick evening visit at the end of our short break but it was worth it. We had a walk around everywhere and missed the last metro because of our enthusiasm to see lots! It reminded us of Covent Garden/Leicester Square area of London. Very touristy with many stalls and attractions, even lots of sex shops (not for the faint hearted apparently - we didn't indulge!!).

Go, wonder and be amazed. This is very different from the main commercial roads in Barcelona. This old part of the city is very charming and beautiful. Take time to look up as well as down to appreciate the different architecture of the buildings. Love the little alleys, little stores. Take your time to admire this area, pick a cafe and sit and just soak it in.

Gothic Splendour on in Barcelona. I simply love walking around the Gothic Quarter in Barcelona & happily spend hours to be taken aback by this magical place. The shops are original & interesting & the locals helpful & friendly. You can walk down 1 street & come across a tiny narrow street that takes you to more stunning architecture & interesting shops. I happily walk the lanes again & again always seeing something I missed the last time.

Watch your pockets. Old buildings and many people around at night if you like parties. Nothing special about this Gothic Quarter honestly. Be careful if you walk alone because some people like to hug you pretending they are drunk but after you realise the guy is being annoying your pockets got emptied in less than 2 seconds.
quaint european feel. adorable little alleyways and architecture make you feel like you've traveled back in time! wander around and pop in any of the adorable and yummy tapas places!

Just beautiful. The food is amazing! The shops are amazing! The people are amazing! It's just a great way to spend the day. I loved everything about it--it's one of my favorite places in Europe. Can't recommend it enough.

Best part of the city . If you can see one other place than the Sangrada Familia see the gothic quarter. Historic,mid evil, winding streets with surprises around every corner.except for Rome- gothic Barcelona is one of the most fun places to explore!

One of those unique places you only find in Europe. Such an old culture - so much history - so well kept! Just a MUST see when visiting Barcelona. More than just seeing it - you must live it. Go shopping, go cultural, go eating! Just enjoy this amazingly well kept peace of history!

Amazing . Amazing visit, extremely breathtaking architecture to look at from outside and inside.
A must see for all ages.
best area in Barca. one of the three ancient quarters in Barcelona and I think the best. Architecture and narrow streets are amazing, just walk and get lost there !

Step Into Old Spain. This was my first visit to Barcelona and, until I strolled the Gothic Quarter, did not feel like I was in Spain. A must see. Just stroll the narrow streets and soak up the atmosphere. Lots of interesting shops and restaurants that were open the Sunday I was there. I didn't dine, but noticed the prices were often 10€ less than on La Ramba. I stumbled upon a beautiful 14th Century gothic church, Santa Maria del Mar, that welcomed visitors and was worth the time spent admiring it.

Enjoy Barcelona's old times.. There are many small streets around the cathedral. Infront of the cathedral many young people are sitting and chatting as a relax place. You can find many restaurants and shops there too. Those small shops are all unique you may find something interesting. So please make a long walk and discover your own time.

One of two "must see" areas in Barcelona.. If you have only one full day in Barcelona, I recommend a visit to the Gothic Quarter and the Sagrada Familia. However, my wife and I spent two days in the Gothic Quarter and could have easily spent at least another. If you like to party and drink, then even more. This is a great place to wander around, with hundreds of things to "discover"!
Stunning area. Incredible architecture at every turn and great places to eat and drink and relax. Lovely little picturesque streets to wonder through with boutique shops.
Loved it!. Love this area of Barcelona! Great to walk around and enjoy!Nice shopping area for tourists! Lots of cafes and small boutiques....

Beautiful City. We stayed near the cathedral in the Barri Gotic to be close to everything and it was the perfect location. Within walking distance to many restaurants and sights and easy access to the metro. We happened on the Sardana in front of the cathedral - an 11 piece band playing for a traditional group dance that everyone can join in.
Beautiful area of Barcelona that is NOT to be missed!. Great food sitting in the squares throughout the gothic quarter. Tapas and sangria and people watching. Doesn't get better than this.

The heart of historic Barcelona. Worth an attentive visit! A walk around the Gothic Quarter is a delight for those interested in history and architecture. A guided tour can be a good option, since those not familiarised with local history will be able to fully grasp the magic of the place by themselves.
Interesting. Wonderful area to wander around in lots of narrow streets and alleys opening up into squares with bars and restaurants. Lots of interesting little dhops
Take the time to enjoy it.. This area is absolutely stunning. Take the time to just walk around and explore the streets, cafes, shops and the quirky sights along the way!
Amazing. Fabulous to walk around , enjoy the ambience of the area, v great architecture . Good shopping, definitely a must visit
Beautiful place to visit and stay!. I stayed here during my trip to Barca and it's absolutely beautiful. So much beter than the touristy Las Ramblas street!

Obviously a must. For sure anyone who passes to the center of Barcelona, will see this neighborhood, or area, and maybe take a walk. And I strongly suggest a half day there, eating drinking, and shopping. All this apart from the arquticture, which make up the the name of this place, Gothic. Just make sure you have your belongings safe, and under your eye-range at all time, especially in this area in the night time.Enjoy

Explore it!!!!. Don't miss a walk through the streets of the gothic quarter with a map for help! You will find so many little shops, squares, buildings with the characteristic architecture! Just get lost in the neighborhood and you will enjoy it!!!
Great place to be. The Gothic Quarter has great scenes and arquitecture. There are many cafe's,shops and restaurants in that neighborhood.
Fascinating walking tour. An absolute must to understand the history and development of the City... take it slow, and enjoy the F&B places you'll encounter along the way...

Get lost in a maze of medieval streets. I recommend walking around the barri at night when all is quiet and you could believe you are back in the 15C or 16C...only to discover a great tapas bar (or possibly a boutique hotel whose restaurant will be happy to serve you). A time machine in the middle of barcelona.
Great scene and arquitecture!. Everytime you walk by this area you get surprise with the beauty of it's arquitecture! No matter the time of the day you will love this part of Barcelona!
Most enjoyable cafe's, shopping in this neighborhood!. Loved touring Barri Gotic neighborhood! The food, markets and sights were all what we were looking for.

Great place to lose yourself for a couple of hours. My wife and I travelled here for a 2 night stay prior to cruise. The Gothic Quarter is a delight and we pre booked a free 2 hour tour which started o/s the cathedral. Where the 2 hours went I'm not sure , beautiful area to walk round,perfectly safe more than enough sites to visit and virtually traffic free. Only observation - plenty of beggars !!!
Great place to walk. We spent a couple of days just exploring the Gothic quarter and we really enjoyed it. So much to see and places to pop into

Great, just super crowded. Went on a Runner Bean walking tour (highly recommended) of the Gothic Quarter. Tons of fascinating history. The main issue is the crowds and lots of tourist stores, there were times I was dodging people left and right. I recommend going in the morning before the throngs of people emerge.

Just keep the map and get lost in Barri Gotic. A truly enjoyable experience to wander the many streets in the gothic quarter and discover hidden jems! Quaint cafés/restaurants and shops line most main streets while the little alleyways gives you a sneak peek into the living spaces of residents living in the apartment above...simply stunning buildings that are really charming. It makes for great photo opportunities and and can be explored in the day and evenings, we totally loved it and almost somehow always make it a point to go there almost each day during our stay in Barcelona!

Nice Night Tour . Went at night and looked just like your in a movie. The lighting was perfect and the walk is great. You can feel safe as there are police all around. We took many good pictures around the Gothic Quarter.

labrinth streets with history. beautiful architecture and is the old city in barcelona. Many churches and buildings from the Medieval times. Just walk around and look around but also be careful of pickpocketers too.

Great place to take photos and shop!. The gothic neighbourhood(barri) has a few beautiful gothic style cathedrals and lots of small shops where you can find almost anything you like, also toards it,s extremety, in the angel's square direction, shops become a lot more dens:)

Aimless Wandering. Was recommended this area by friends and wow. A perfect place to wander aimlessly, losing yourself down the beautiful, ancient streets. A perfect feel of old traditional Barcelona buildings and streets which open up into secret squares or churches. Plenty of interesting, historical features which you could fail to spot if you don't look in the right places. Could spend hours here, was beautiful to stumble across many buskers in this area late one evening, all remarkably talented which was just perfect to stand and admire in such a beautiful area and city. 2 hours felt like 2 minutes!
Main street of my hostel. Good street , lots of turists , safe day and night time Good restaurant around and shopsAmazing buildings and art Very clean and lots of police all the time good good

Wandering Around. This was a great place to just wander around. The day after we wandered around, my exchange student and her sister took us there. They were able to tell us some history behind some of the buildings. Good time there. We did hunt down the old Roman columns too.

Goosebumps . Stumbled across this accidentally and what a wonderful stumble it was.......took our breath away, hair on the back of your neck goosebumps moment. Not a particularly religious couple but felt compelled just to sit and take in our surroundings. Worth a visit

Sick City. Love this place so much already. Only been in the city three weeks and feel like i have been lost down the beautiful streets for years. One of the best places to just wonder with no place to go. Took a bike out yesterday and rode a little further out and it was just as amazing. Surfing, skating, photography. Its all going on
Do not miss it!. One of the best parts in Barcelona, very quaint and genuine, many places to it, nice architecture, better feel than the overrated Gaudi places.
Second Favorite Neighborhood. Behind the Borne District, the Gothic District in Barcelona was fantastic. It was fun to get lost in the narrow and winding streets.
Barcelona Gothis quarter. Real feel for Old Barcelona - narrow streets and alleyways that suddenly open into squares or churches
Take you time. Get lost in the alleys, and wander aimlessly. The surprises and the beauty is where you least expect it!
Winter break. Spent a long weekend in Barcelona with friends we stayed in a lovely B&B in the Barri Gotic area very central for all amenities
Great City Walk. We followed the Rick Steve's guide to the Barri Gotic and really enjoyed learning about the Roman roots and current unique aspects of this neighborhood.

my favourite part of Barcelona.. wandering through the narrow streets. The Gothic Quarter comprises a series of narrow labyrinthine streets full of amazing creative shops bars and hotels. Colourful and vibrant. Great fun exploring for all ages. Full of character and colour. One word of warning.. sound really travels, so if you want a quiet nights sleep choose your hotel carefully. Ours was stunning but we chose a balconied room overlooking the street so I could watch the world go by.. however the flip side was the street carried on til 4 in the morning on friday and saturday. It would have been fine with the double glazed french doors shut, but I like fresh air so ended up stuffing loo paper in my ears because of the street noise!!
Give yourself time. There are treasures around every corner. If you can, go here during quiet time like early Sunday and again when the place is alive like Saturday night.
Good old quarter . This is the historical heart of Barcelona with lots of fine buildings, churches and square. Worth a visit, lots of interesting buildings, shops and bars.

Really nice area to stroll around. This is an area in Barcelona with narrow streets, surprising encounters, nice (coffee) bars, interesting must-sees such as the Cathedral. Many streets are pedestrian areas, so you can really enjoy with no cars on your heels.
So Much History!. This area has an aura of mystery. Strolling down the narrow alleys one can imagine the people who walked these paths centuries ago.

Barri Gotic ar dóigh, muy bien, excellent. Stayed in Carrer d'Avinyo in 2015. This is Barcelona's gritty, exciting and hugely interesting Gothic Quarter, puts you in close proximity to the Boquieria, Las Ramblas and much else that is well worth seeing. I will be returning there this month. This is an excellent base for exploring the city and has lots of great eateries, some wonderful architectural gems and is jam packed with Barcelona's great history and Catalan culture. Can't recommend it highly enough.Barcelona's Gaudi attractions are really worth seeing especially La Sagrda Familia also worth looking into the Travel Bar Free Walking tours where the guides are veritable fonts of knowledge who will get you under the skin of Barcelona.If pinxtos, tapas and great seafood and steaks float your boat then you'll be more than pleased with Barcelona.

I cant say enough good things.... We are staying in this area of town and I cannot say enough good things about it. It is my favorite area of Barcrlona for walking around.. Eating and residing while here. Every block has cool sites... A ton of eating choices and is simply wonderful!!!Stay here or get here to walk around and enjoy all there is to offer.

Better than las ramblas. In my opinion a better shopping area than Las Ramblas. Narrow and winding streets give a very medieval feel with quaint and quirky shops around every corner. It is very easy to loose yourself in the streets for hours but relatively simple to recover your bearings.
Impressive cathederal . One of the center pieces of old town. The Cathederal is imposing and impressive. Nothing super spectacular just an old architecture with lots of work.
Historical - amazing part of our Barcelona trip.. It's like stepping back in time to wander through the gothic quarter in Barcelona - every corner you turn is just amazing and just so historical.
The old town. Lots of narrow streets with shops and restaurants and homes of the locals, lively and amazing architecture
Must visit. Barrio gotic is very caratteristic quarter located in the very centrum of Barcelona. Must visit the placa, the storical archive and the cathedral, which is free open after 17:30, else 7€

Best area of the city. If you want to see anything of the city and the sights then this is a place to visit. Easy to wander round, lots to see. We stumbled upon the area and were amazed by the beauty of the churches and architecture.
Good for Meals. Well worth a visit. We ate a very nice meal here. Lots of choices with regards to places to eat. Would visit again.

Romance is in the air. Walking the Barri Gotic was perhaps my favorite part of Barcelona. We walked this neighborhood both during the day and at night. The evening walk was very romantic. The cobblestone street, iron lamps and stretch streets were simply breathtaking.

Get lost in here!. If you have time to spare, I can't think of a better place to get lost than the little warrens in the Gothic quarter. It offers a bounty of quaint local boutiques, eateries, museums, churches etc. that are just wonderful to stroll in and out of.

The old town of Barcelona. This is a great area to see what Barcelona was like before the Roman wall was torn down. The streets are very dark and narrow. It is best to take a tour or hite a guide so you can fully understand this area.
Lots to see. Follow the local maps to make the most of your visit. Free local tours also available if you want to use them.

Fabulous maze of streets, alleys and squares worth exploring. The Gothic Quarter is a joy to walk around it's winding streets and alleys, bringing you out onto squares every now and then and some impressive churches and general architecture
Old Town BCN at its best. One of my favorite moments of the trip was enjoying a glass of wine at a cafe across from the Catedral de Barcelona. Loved this area.

Very informative. My husband and I enjoyed the tour through the Gothic Quarter as our host was incredibly knowledgeable about Barcelona's history and sites. There was plenty of time to stop and take pictures and ask questions. We revisited some of the places shown later on in the week and knowing the background of places made it much more interesting.

Great area to wander. Delightful Old City area full of character and interesting shops, stunning churches, great coffee and cake shops and marvellous restaurants. The labyrinth of narrow streets are amazing and make for a very pleasant day of simply wandering about taking in the architecture and trying not to get lost!

Lots of small shops, beatiful alleys, cathedrals and Roman remains. It is a several days tour just to walk all the alleys, and there is something new to see almost at every corner. Beware though to go when the shops are open ( open around 10 and close around 9-10 pm ) as when the shops close, the metal curtains are drawn down and it looks very dull. Plenty of restaurants and tapas places

Stunning area of architecture..... We stayed in this area at H10 hotel Montcardo.... Beautiful area to stay... Opposite cathedral & Picasso museum.... Simply put on your walking shoes & walk through the narrow cobbled streets & alleyways... You just stumble upon amazing architecture & keep looking up.... Truly stunning x

Full of character . One of my favourite things to do when visiting a city is to explore the 'old town' if there is one. This quickly became one of my favourites. Gorgeous, quirky, intriguing. Most definitely worth investing your time in to wander and explore.
Lovely romantic streets. If yoou already visited all the standard tourist attractions, than just hit in Gotic part and chose some nice bistro to sit and drink sangria.

Get a free guide and.... ...explore the Gothic Quartier to learn about Barcelonas history. This tour should basically be the start of your visit in Barcelona. Because you not only learn about its past but also got an idea what this is all about and maybe a hint or two for a good drink or dinner. Because the Barri Gòtic is full of nice bars and restaurants.
Get lost. Just a fun place to get lost and wonder around taking in all the sights and sounds. Great little restaurants all over. Great architecture too

Nice area to wander.. We stayed just on the other side of Las Ramblas so it was a short walk to the Gothic quarter, we went in the daytime and evening and loved all the quaint back streets and trendy bars and restaurants. It was fun exploring and we saw some wonderful architecture, don't forget to look up!

A perfect way to spend endless hours. This is one of the most picturesque areas of Barcelona with its narrow winding streets, people playing music on street corners, beautiful architecture and it the fact that it contains Le Catedral, Santa Maria del Pi and Santa Maria del mar, Placa Reial as well as beautiful squares, coffee shops, places to eat and an ambiance that cannot be matched elsewhere.The Gothic Quarter is directly off Las Ramblas and once you're there, you can walk around for hours finding new streets, getting lost, visiting the sites or simply sitting back and having a coffee and watching the world go by. It's a good idea to have a map with you as it can be easy to lose your way but for some that's probably the fun part.
Brcelona must see. This is a don't miss area of Barcelona. Lots of restaurants and shopping in the immediate area, and close to the beach.
Nice old town. I liked these narrow streets and the middle-age houses. On Sunday about noon, you may see human towers.

Great area to wander to get lost and found.. I stayed in this area over Christmas thinking it would be so festive only to learn that the real festivities in this area are at the Epiphany, when the children get their gifts and when the real excitement sets in for them. Although the Christmas market was great and the music was amazing. Imagine hearing an opera by a singer on a narrow street corner alongside a cathedral. I couldn't move. Lots of shops and cafes, and spooky and Gothic. I was there 40 years previous on my honeymoon and nothing has changed, I loved it. Easy walking to lots of other sites and the beach, make sure to take in the Flamenco shows along the Rambla.
Very interesting. A really different part of Barcelona but a good one with many nice coffee shops and retail shops such as vans and american apparel.
Great history . We really enjoyed seeing all the history and viewing the original architecture. But beware the school trips of children.
