Lovely to walk around.. Felt quite a safe area. Visited the Picasso Gallery. Lots to see and do. Quite busy with tourists etc.
Favorite Barri!. I absolutely love waking down the narrow streets checking out all the cool architecture in the daytime and the graffiti at night. So much art everywhere!

A great vibe. Spend a few hours pushing the stroller through the Gothic Quarter. Small alleys opening into wide spaces, large costumed festive characters parading through made it an event to remember for our little one. Some great shops and also a great little rock bar on the outskirts of the Gothic Quarter (The Bollocks rock bar).

Lose hours just wandering around here. This was our 4th visit to Barcelona and still found new sights in this historic city area around the Cathedral and Placa Real. beautiful buildings squares and street scapes around every corner. Spend lots of time looking up as well as taking in doors, windows carvings and other architectural details which abound.
Beautiful. You can walk for miles and still find new stuff. Had some great authentic pinchos in the orio €1.95 each wow and cava €4 bargain lunch , avoid tourist traps go where the Spanish hang out

Great bars! . We stayed just on the other side of las Ramblas so it was a short walk to the gothic, we only went in the evenings but loved all the quaint back streets and trendy bars. It was fun exploring and we saw some wonderful architecture. I loved that we sat outside a busy bar in February drinking cocktails and eating nachos

Rich in history; where you will want to spend a lot of time. From the Roman fortresses to the Jewish Quarter, to the restaurants rich with history, you will want to allow a lot of time to wander these streets with guidebook in hand.

Lovely . We stayed in a hotel in the quarter, I loved it. I walked around it for days and never found it boring. The streets are so small that everyday I found new places even though I was heading mostly one and the same destinations, so charming and romantic, full of bars and restaurants, the night life is flourishing. I will definitely book a hotel in the neighborhood my next time in Barcelona.

Great place to walk around and get lost. The gothic quarter is a great place to walk around, the buildings are beautiful and narrow little roads. There are so many quirky little shops, tapas bars and food places to find. You can walk around for hours.
Lovely area. Very nice area to walk around. Architecture is very pretty and romantic. There is also a lot of art around.

A must do / see / walk around .... This an amazing area of Barcelona. The narrow streets. The small shops and lots of great finds in there. The markets are stunning with the range of fresh produce. A must do.

nice area for a different side of barcelona. there are many age-old buildings in this area with interesting history. it has many shops offering unique clothes, bags, accessories, etc. made by local designers. a nice break from the department stores and brands.

Great day . Fabulous experience! I live in Barcelona and i went to downtown whit my old mother and my teenagers dauthters. We walked for all the day visiting lovely places, cool squares amd fantastic gotic churches.

Great place to walk around.. Beautiful old buildings, narrow streets and many interesting places to eat and drink. We went into a wonderful bar that had a second floor lounge with old sofas and a chaise longe. They said they made the best Mojito and I tended to agree with them. Cannot remember the name but it was on the corner of a square. We loved it....
Walking the narrow streets. We spent hours just wandering through the streets popping into shops and cafes. Prefer this to La Rambla

Lovely area. We went around the Gotham Quarter as part of a walking tour. The history within the area was amazing. We even sat on the steps where Columbus was met by the King of Spain after his return from the Americas

Narrow streets filled with the mediterranean spirit!. Walking through the narrow street of the Barri Gotic was one of the best things we did during our stay in Barcelona. The streets are full of live, commerce, mediterranean architecture, typical bars... And the street are clean! The city invites tourists to walk around care-freely for hours and n every corner there's a new surprise: an amazing building, an historical land marks or an ancient ruin.

Love to stroll around this area. no car traffic allowed, therefore, a wonderful stroll around with interesting shops, restaurants and the lovely Cathedral of Barcelona...hire a bike ride along the most narrow streets to see Roman columns and synagogue and other historic landmarks (18 euro for 30 minutes). Skip the Picasso Museum, art was skimpy...not worth it

A piece of history . This is good for history fanatics. Walking in a narrow alley was like walking back in time. Buskers are everywhere playing love songs. There are shops and pubs/restaurants especially in Plaza del Mar. I went to this Irish pub and got free drinks courtesy of fellow Pinoy. Thanks Ronnie.
great for walking and exploring. leave a few hours to wander the streets, explore the alleyways and shop. Its worth the time to do on your own

Lose yourself..... ......amongst the Barri Gotic's winding narrow streets with it's plethora of quirky little shops and restaurants. There are museums aplenty and interesting buildings to entertain and amuse you. A must see when in Barcelona.
One of the most important places to go in Barcelona. Perfect people watching and get a great sense of the old city. Make sure to get off the Ramblas and walk down the side streets.

Great old town at any time. It seems no matter how many times you visit the Gothic Quarter you'll find something new. Be Chocolate was our favourite find here - for serious chocolate lovers. It's very, very touristy with a lot of derelict places but has a wonderful feel to it.

Fascinating old area for a walk.. This amazing old area of the city is a must to see the original heart of Barcelona. The building's and alley ways are incredible, you can easily get lost in your surroundings. A visit to the Cathedral should be included even though you have to pay, it is worth it.
Take a walk in this part of the city. The historical buildings and the small streets have a very special atmosphere. Everything is full with shops, restaurants and bars.

Doing a little bit everyday. We are staying in El Born right next to the Gothic Quarter. We started by following a walking tour via IPad and ended in the Cathedral. Later we walked around the Cathedral then went home. Saw a little more each following day. So much to see so it is good to have some form of guide to catch most areas. Wonderful area-can't see it all unless you are from Barcelona.
Very fun to wander through.... A must see in Barcelona. Wandering around the Gothic quarter is a fun activity with nice stores and restaurants.
Loved walking the Gothic Quarter. I loved the tiny alleys and cobblestone streets. Great way to experience the old city, especially as an American :)
EXCELLENT. even if you are not into churches I advise you to still pay this a visit just for the history content alone.

The heart of the city!!. The heart of the city.Visited last weekend, and spent a lot of time here.Lovely erea to wander, eat, drink and absorb all the charm, beauty, architecture and history this place has to offer. The cathedral, is absolutely a must see.Full of cosy resturants, charming bars and nice boutiques. A place you can wander and explore something new in every narrow street and around every corner.We accidently and surprisingly found ourselfs in the middle of a huge festival dancing the streets in all kinds of costumes and instruments. Jumped right in - so much fun!

Stroll into Gothic. This afternoon I went for a stroll with my partner into the Gothic district.The Cathedral was amazing with huge pillars at the front keeping up the main spire.I don't think that I have ever seen so many side altars in a cathedral. The Cloisters provided quite a unique touch with yet more side chapels, but a nice quiet area for the monks in the past, with live geese to give it an authentic air.We went up the lift onto the roof. It was nice to see another high profile view of the city and it certainly highlights what a miss-mash the architecture is.We then went for a stroll through the tall, narrow streets which seem unaltered in centuries. We found a nice cafe for a drink and snack in 'George Orwell Sq' We then took a stroll along a st which seemed to specialise in pizzas, before emerging at the tail end of 'The rambles'

Nice Walk. We took Rick Steve's Barri Gotic Walk to the cathedral square. We chose not to see the cathedral at this time because of the exorbitant 7 Euro entry fee. Our favorite spot was Placa del Rei, site of the royal palace when Christopher Columbus returned from America. The adjacent Viceroy's Palace is fascinating. It includes a facsimile of the 1492 Sante Fe Capitulations, a contract between Columbus and the monarchs about his upcoming sea voyage.

Walked for miles in this area or so it seemed!. Fascinating little streets with the cathedral, shops, cafes, resturant and brilliant architecture. Great to see the dancing on Sunday in front of the cathedral and listen to troops of opera singers at night down the street on le of the cathedral. This was our favourite area

Lovely area just off La Rambla. We spent a couple of hours just strolling around the Gothic quarter, finding winding streets and backstreet shops full of antiques and curios. Barcelona cathedral is stunning from the outside. You need to pay €7 to go inside but we didn't bother. Instead we sat outside and listened to a great violinist play on the steps. There's a lively café near the cathedral called cafe Bisbe (I think!). Very nice service and reasonable prices.

Beautiful. Stunning neighbourhood full of bars and restaurants. Its eclectic mixture of buildings makes this place a must visit. You might get lost between all the little streets but you'll find on the way luxury boutiques and plenty of tempting shops with beautiful crafted gifts.
If you dont visit this place you have not visited Barcelona

Fascinating area.. The Gothic Quarter is one of the best areas to see in Barcelona. The Gothic Cathedral is magnificent. Lots of restaurants in the area and lots of narrow streets. At the weekend there is lots to see in the square in front of the Cathedral. Street musicians etc. Worth a stroll around.
Favorite area of Barcelona. This is both a fun shopping area and awesome museum/architectural viewing area. The streets are narrow, the vibes are great.

Walking to the past.... We follow the guide "passportbcn" that make us walk by this magic place and discover a lot of secret spots, restaurants, gardens, ruins.... at the end you are few steps from the Public Market,
Cathedral Square. Started at the Cathedral square markets and then went down numerous little quaint side streets with wonderful bars and shops in the original gothic setting

Great place to visit . Narrow alleys. Artists everywhere. Great restaurants. Dark. Interesting. Cool. Lovely time visiting the Gothic District. Took the street car & had a great time. Wine. Wine. Yes. Wine.
The Gothic quarter - get lost here! . Lovely area to wander, eat, drink and get lost absorbing the beauty & history! We hired bikes too & rode around through the cobblestone streets!
Walking Tour. Do the free walking tour through here. It gives a lot of great history and takes you around the major points of interest.

Everytime I'm in Barcelona. Everytime.. When I first lived in Barcelona in the mid 80s the Barrio Gótico was a rather scary place, old, rundown, overtaken by the seediness of a big city that was already at a low point. Fast forward 30 years and I don't let a visit go without wandering at least a half day if not a full through the tiny streets that make up the now alive areas of Barrí Gotíc and El Born.At every turn there are new and interesting shops and restaurants, and as long as you are far away from Plaza Catalunya they are almost all one off shops, with little connection to big retailers. On our last trip we found a wonderful little toy store with carved wooden letter puzzles from a Bulgarian toy maker, on the trip before that an olive oil decanter with a Picasso theme (ok, that shop was more touristy than I usually like, but I'd been looking for one for a while and really liked the one I found). Shop owners are worried about the gentrification of the area and the fact that the personality of the Barrií is getting priced out of the area. That would be sad, and it is something to watch for, but at the moment I relish those hours during every visit there.

Enjoy the old city-. The perfect place to just wander through the streets. If you are on a cruise, it is an easy walk from the harbor. This is one of the oldest areas of Barcelona, so the architecture and feel of the area transports you back hundreds of years. There are shops and restaurants, so plan to spend some time here.
The place to stay.. You can spend hours just wondering around the streets getting lost is not a risk, you will soon come out onto a plaza with good sign posts.
Like like like. I love the Gothic Quarter. Every corner something new to reveal. Great tapas bar . And historical building. Can't skip this place on a visit to Barcelona.
Beautiful place . Very nice narrow streets and cozy restaurants, shops and everything you need all around. Great arcitecture too. My favorite area in Barcelona.

So much to see in the Gothic Quarter. Spend some time walking the narrow pathways of the Gothic Quarter and you will not be disappointed. The square is lively and a great place to sit and have a drink and enjoy the passing mix of tourist, locals and entertainers. The Cathedral is beautiful and free entry as well. Take a look inside. Explore the stores and alleys. Some great photo opportunities here.

INTERESTING MAZE OF OLD QUARTER. This is close to La Rambla but is much more authentic, cultural and interesting. It is a maze of winding streets with ethnic shops, cafes and historic places of interest. You could spend hours just wandering around -
Amazing historic adventure. While visiting Barcelona, one has to visit the Gothic Quarter. Beautiful with rich history and nice attractions for tourist and locals alike.

Much to see as you walk. Many shops, architecture and people as you take a nice walk around. A few people hassle or beg but for the most part quite beautiful and peaceful. Each corner brings something new. Bring you camera.
Lovely lovely. Most atmospheric cafes, lovely buildings really safe to walk around. If you love walking around this is a must "on your To Do List"

Great architecture . We had an open top bus tour of the area and would recommend this as a good way to see all the different buildings some amazing architecture lots of café and bars when you get off the bus a must visit area if you are in Barcelona
Nice. beautiful buildings only I do not like what has a lot of gypsies who beg in front of the church, is not favorable to us as tourists!
Intriguing. Restaurants, shops, architecture, galleries. Always something new to find as you stroll through the delightful streets.
A surprise . A surprise lying in the middle of barcelona city, where tiny lanes with medieval walls at the side lay throughout the place. A very casual place to stroll through and spend an afternoon.
Barcelona Gotic. There is a bit for everyone in Barri Gotic. Shopping, food, relaxation, culture. Be aware of pickpocketers and beggars.

My favorite area!. I fell in love with the Gothic Quarter! So much history, interesting architecture, little shops, cafes, street musicians, wine, food, gelato, brick laid streets that all meander down different back ways, and an overall feeling of excitement. Walk everywhere! I fell in love with Barcelona here. I will definitely return!

It's lots of streets!. Nice to walk around. Nice shops and bars. But too many people trying to grab you into their restaurants, but a firm face gets past that! You can't come here without wondering around lots. So a must
Beautiful area to explore. Just walk, see the pretty architecture and get lost!!! Just hold onto your handbag, so I've been told but had no issues myself.

History mingled with modern architecture. After 5 visits to Barcelona I think I know The Gothic Quarter well. It is located just a few steps from Las Rambles. Meander the streets and discover wonderful squares where you can stop for a coffee, tapas or a glass of cava. Discover shops with wonderful glass, antiquities, jewellery and clothes. Look up and see wonderful buildings and round another corner you will find a small church. You will pass the schools of music, look out or listen out for musicians on a street corner playing ...eireee. Never worry about getting lost I think all streets lead to the Cathedral , which is well worth a visit, which is located in the square ; where at Christmas you will find the Christmas market. You will also find lovely restaurants for something special In the evening. Such a romantic walk at night.

Go Now Before the Tee Shirt Shops Take Over . The old quarter with quaint narrow streets where people actually live in historic buildings. Unfortunately the ground floor shops are increasingly given over to tee shirts and tourist junk staffed by shills from across the globe. Don't buy anything and maybe they'll go away making room for boutique hotels.

Great for a walk. The quarter is very charming, full of little shops and with lovely architecture. There are many restaurants and cafeterias, and many other places where you can enjoy your coffee or vino tinto.
A place to wander. Wan full of small shops, wander the old, narrow streets full of small shops, bars, cafes and restaurant. Stand in front of the cathedral and watch the bubble man in the sunshine.
Beautiful but a little dangerous. This area of the old Barcelona is quite beautiful but it is dangerous because there is an army of pickpockets

A very pleasant, interesting area.. This historic "city centre" contains many historic buildings including "La Seu" Cathedral, the museums "Diocesa","Frederic Mares" & "Historia de Barcelona" -- and much more. For those "like me" who prefer to "ramble around" adsobing the atmosphere, and "peope watching" there are many tapas bars etc. to rest and relax at.
Amazing. Very beautiful. Fulled with different stores, places to visit, to buy. The Cathedral is wonderful, we can enter for free and it's huge.

Take a map with you. . It's great to get a little lost on it but take a map or you may never return.
Loved to see the constructions.
Visited during afternoon and the sun going down made everything looks a little golden.
Beautiful.

In the heart of the city. Our hotel was located in the Gothic Quarter. It was right in the middle of everything, footsteps to La Rambla, Maremagnum, the Port etc. Lots of history and beautiful Architecture
Great to visit. Amazing if you love History, and are religus. But you need to be active to see it all. Lots of cobbled streets.

Want to walk in Salvador Dali's shoes?. Gothic Quarter is fun...small boutiques & Tapas lunch spots...A must visit is
La Manual Alpargatera, a historic boutique catering to the best espadilles...all
handmade & reasonably priced...While you wait your turn, plan the styles you are interested in...Your salesperson will stay with you until you are finished...Hope you have room in your luggage for multiple pairs!

Most Old, Most Rated. It's an old Barcelona quarter and at the same time an interesting piece of Barcelona city. With a Segway tour I visited it tasting typical food in old restaurant.
I advice you Gothic Quarter!
Great walk in the streets of the Gothic Quarter. My accommodation was at the gothic quarter, walked around the gothic quarter and biked round it too and still aren't bored of it.

Loved! Do the Runner Bean Tour with it to get all the history.. Get lost in the Gothic Quarter - check out Chocolate row, Picasso Museum, all the boutiques and shops. Highly recommend the free tour from Runner Bean which starts everyday at 11am.

beautiful and interesting ,could walk around for days. always loose track of time walking around and wondering off the side streets, everything is here restaurants,bars,shops and quirky places as well as quiet spots to sit with a drink or coffee
will never tire of this place
be wary at night of pick pockets and can be a bit scary if woman alone
Great Architecture. The cathedral itself is stunning, and in general the buildings are worth the visit. It's also a good idea to take some of the side streets and visit the small shops in the area.

Take the time to stroll..... Loved all of what we saw of Barcelona, but the Gothic quarter really is special. Great photo opportunities, loads of bars, restaurants and shops but the area has kept it's medieval feel. We loved to wander through the narrow streets getting lost in-between each meal and drink!
Beautiful place. Don't you ever miss a visit to this place. Narrow streets, with beautiful sights and numerous places to eat and drink. A jump into the XIX siècle!
Quirky fun area. Nice area to walk around in, lot of small shops (though surprisingly quite expensive). The Picasso museum, etc is all here. And lots of great small restaurants and bars.

Great to explore for a day. I spent a week in Barcelona around Christmastime, and went to the Gothic Quarter several times. It's an easy walk from La Rambla (where my hotel was located) and has several points of interest.The Catedral de Barcelona is a beautiful Gothic church, full of history. I followed along reading my guide book about all the chapels, and learned why the choir is placed in what seemed to be an unusual location (not so unusual in Spain, though). Nearby is the Gaudi Exhibition Center, a small but very well-designed museum about Barcelona's most famous architect. I definitely recommend this if you have any interest at all in art, mathematics, architecture, urban design, or Gaudi.The Muesum of the History of Barcelona (MUHBA) was also excellent! You get to walk down through the archaeological remains of Barcino, the original Roman city. The Picasso Museum is also nearby, and I'm sure it's a good museum (one of the few in the world dedicated to Picasso) but the layout was a little confusing.It's easy to lose your sense of direction as you walk through the narrow streets and alleyways. Watch for the brown signs pointing the way to various points of interest. Also, Barcino was built on a hilltop, so if you notice a slope, going uphill will take you back in the direction of MUHBA and the Cathedral (which I used as a center point for exploration).

Don't miss this if in Barcelona. Everyone else will tell you to go to Sacrada Familia in Barcelona, but if you are short on time (we were) and have visited many European churches (especially the Vatican - and we have), then another church is nice but the Gothic quarter, is kind of spectacular.

Beautiful walk in the centre of the city. A very vibrant place with a lot of Gothic architecture buildings and narrow streets, which gives you a feel of the bygone era. Must visit for the immensely talented musicians displaying their talents in that area, if not for the nice walk. You will also come across several little shops for interesting souvenirs and gifts

REAL Barcelona. Absolutely amazing part of the city. Narrow streets, cafes and restaurants everywhere, stunning architecture and loads of small boutiques shops and then the markets that you just come across. you could easily spend a couple of days exploring this fascinating neighbourhood.We first wandered around at night and felt totally safe and then spent most of the next day doing the same.Another "Must do" in Barcelona.

Experience to remember. Visited Barcelona for the second time (from South-Africa). The Gothic centre beautiful, old buildings, lots and lots of cafe's and places to eat. Accessible via the Metro (get of anywhere on the Rambles - from there "pop in" to the Gothic Centre. Nice shops, cater to all prize ranges
Lovely area. Hotel catedral is a perfect place to stay in this area. Barry Gotic is full to the brim with shops, bars, restaurants and fulfils all that I needed for a great stay.

Beautiful square . This is one of my favorite places on Barcelona. I go there sometimes just to listen to different musicians playing there or just wander in the vintage market there. Such a beautiful atmosphere. It is very touristic but you still can overcome this aspect and enjoy the uniqueness of this quarter
Nice place. Very nice place with interesting buildings and lovely cafes, restaurants and narrow streets. Perfect for a nice walk

One of the TOP attrractions of the city. It is the TOP because you can find there a lot of TOP restaurants, shops, pubs... Everything placed in very gothic area with tons of atmosphere.. I felt like in medieval times, awesome. I enjoyed spending there hours just walking.

One of the best neighborhoods in Barcelona. Narrow streets and historic buildings, small cafes, restaurants, and shops all around. We spent half a day here, drank coffee, browsed the shops, then ate dinner. The whole neighborhood was very lively and filled with both tourists and locals. There are all kinds of restaurants and shops to choose from so anyone can enjoy themselves.

A"Must See" in Barcelona. We can't imagine going to Barcelona and not visiting the Gothic Quarter. The resturants, coffee shops and bakeries are often housed in historic buildings so that eating, shopping and relaxing over a delicious coffee can be enjoyed while experiencing the history and architecture or gothic Barcelona. It is equally enjoyable on bicycle or by foot.
Beautiful. Tiny street and very easy to get lost. A stunning place to wander thrugh, get a bite to eat and shop in little boutiques

Full day enjoy package. From this place you can see the entire Brcelona. Ihis place is one of the top most Place in Barcelona.
You have to use rope way to reach this place.

Wonderful place to wander. Beautiful area to wander about....beware this is also a main pickpocket area. The streets are narrow and quaint, opening onto charming squares. There are places where the original Roman walls poke through. Many cafes and restaurants and street markets in the weekend...selling everything from ceramic to veges and pastries. Lots of little interesting shops tucked away down the streets selling unusual items...not just tourist tat. Well worth it to wander about, have a coffee, take a photo, have a wine, wander a bit more and more photos. Charming

Barri Gotic. It's the old Barcelona. Narrow medieval streets and alleys sometimes open unexpectedly into little plazas. The Jewish quarter is located in this area. Lots of restaurants and jewelry stores.
Great architectural sights. After seeing all the Gaudi buildings, the Gothic Quarter is refreshing to see more traditional historical buildings

Great vibe, clothing shops and food. I spent a lot of time in the Gothic Quarter during my visit. It's good to stay near by, there's lots to do. The Petritxol laneway is a must for chocolate lovers. The Gothic cathedral is beautiful, but if you're by yourself be careful of the gypsies. I was taking photos in the evening, and turned around to walk back, and there was one right there, and she scared the hell out of me. I thought she was a witch.

Fascinating historic area. Lots to see - we loved the museum of the history of Barcelona, with its Roman ruins and mediaeval hall and chapel, and the cathedral. The Christmas market was wonderful fun, too.

AWESOME!. We spent 4 incredible days in Barcelona and we stayed in the Barri Gotic area. It was great, wherever you go is nice and whatever you see is great. Huge churches and lovely squares. It is the perfect location to be close to the best things to see. Recommended!

Excellent for getting lost and stumbling on beautiful buildings and shops !. The Gothic area is by far my favourite place to get lost and stroll around. Lovely little lanes and some great wine bars and hidden gems.

Be there an hour before sunset, Light is excellen. This is not open at all hours. We had to wait and it was worth it.Nice music vendors are there and many locals going to and fro.People watcher place. Inside so sacred and beautiful. Would like to revisit this again.

Stunning area to stroll round.. This is the highlight of Barcelona for me it is like going back in time. The area has great museums, architecture and churches and shops. It easy to spend hours investigating the alleyways and spaces in this fantastic area.Highly recommended.

Wonderful area. This is an exceptionnal areas full of gothic buildings "as if" they were like yesterday and before, The atmosphere and the architecture give a combination of historic and present feeling. Great place !

Fantastic architecture. This is a great area to just wander around. I'm not sure where it starts or where it finishes but that is not important. There are some magnificent buildings alongside mysterious dark narrow alleyways. Very atmospheric.
Beautiful. Great to admire the cathedral and beautiful historic buildings in the heat of the day, with the alleyways and courtyards and squares.Found some lovely bars and shops here also.

Gothic is best. I think the Gothic Quarter with its maze of streets and architecture is the best. Look up and you are sure to see ornate carvings and stunning detail on the building. It is also the place for good resteraunts and quircky shops.

Amazing architecture in barcelona. The interior of the cathedral is simply amazing with huge pillars and a peaceful character
The square outside of the church is also busy with a good mix of locals and tourists, there are always buskers and an overall chilled and relaxed atmosphere
Great to wander around. Lots of small shops and photo ops off the beaten path. Start early to avoid the crowds. Easy to get lost, would definitely recommend a GPS map app on your phone.

Yes it's touristy but there's a good reason why. Great wandering through the old streets and alleys and impossible not to be charmed by the architecture. One of the best old city centers in Europe. Great museums everywhere. Even though it's tourist heavy the restaurants tend to be excellent.
Nice area. This area was one of my favoure during my 4-days visit. A lot of architecture, good restaurant, small bars, nice people.

Just wander aimlessly. Just wander around from the cathedral. So many beautiful sites await at every turn. We had no agenda, just walked around on a beautiful sunny day and let the architecture surprise us.

History in the streets.. We were staying quite near the Gothic quarter. We walked through it and ate at some restaurants there. The cobble stone streets and the stunning architecture were fascinating. A must visit whilst in Barcelona.

Great walk. It's a great walk especially when you see the residents mining their on business and how normal ppl are are living on those old buildings. It's a must see. Just a little note for anyone loves street art: look up, there are lots of stickers and masks are hanging on the corner of most buildings

A walk through a bygone era. A mesmerizing walk which takes you to a bygone era.. Every building and corner has a story to tell. The brilliant architecture ,narrow streets, colorful shops creates an ambiance which is unforgettable. During night time it makes the place even more intriguing and beautiful. You can find many restaurants and souvenir shops. It is admirable how the city maintains and preserves such beautiful locales right in the heart of the city
Worth seeing. Lovely side streets, shops and fun place to people watch. Cafes are reasonable with delicious sandwiches.

Great nightlife.. Great nightlife, many cozy bars with friendly staff. Also some good restaurants!
In the night, there are some man who offers beer in the street. When you buy that, they ask you to buy some drugs. So keep out or maybe try ;)

Something from another time - Take time to explore. I love the quaint streets with new things to discover around every corner. The Barri Gothic in its present form has been inhabited for hundreds of years. This is not a new subdivision in a housing estate. Every street and corner has a story to tell.

beautiful. when I arrived here it view took my breath away, and after paying 7e to go inside...that to was breath taking...well worth the entry fee, you can also go to the roof with amazing views of the city

Wander around :). Charming neighbourhood to spend a portion of your day wandering around. Lovely gothic architectures, medieval styled narrow streets, hidden gems in every bend. The atmosphere also brings you back in time.

Gothic Quarter. I have lived in the French Quarter in New Orleans & now live 10 minutes from there & I would compare the Gothic very close. Both are so much fun & so easy to tour. Plenty of booze, food & hotties walking down the middle. One of the neatest things there is the big market with everything you would ever want to eat & flowers that are beautiful. It is unbelieveable.

Beautiful. We had a chance to take the morning and wonder around the streets. There is a park on the border that was nice to wonder through. In the Gothic Quarters we just walked casually enjoying the ally ways, the little shops, sitting on benches, people watching. A must do.

Hidden gems around every bend. Great place to wander this way and that. Loads of great shops and places to eat. Watch out for pickpockets! Very busy area. My husband's pack got opened, but apparently the thief didn't want baby diapers. Lol.

History and beauty around every corner. Had a superb day walking around the many shops, squares and archway of the Gothic Area. Topped off by a wonderful roof top gaze from the Cathedral. Whilst you may at times feel you are getting lost, the lanes of the Gothic area always take you home. There are may shops that entice your wallet and you really feel the calming energy. We stopped off to try a wonderful (if not a touch small) glass of Penedes wine and some Tapas. So much History and only a step away from the Ramblers...in fact one almost fesses the other. Definitely worth a visit

worth a look. we veered slightly off our track one day but came upon this part of the city and it was worth a look., It was in the daytime and not sure how safe it is at night, Lots of Gothic buildings almost within buildings

Amazing. LOVED the Gothic Quarter. Not sure I would visit late at night - lots of side streets, angles, hidden corners, versus during daylight where if you get lost, you wont panic. Maybe thats just me.Stunning architecture, history, shops, ambiance, atmosphere, food.

A walk through history. In places you can still see the ancient wall in the narrow streets. It's a good idea to take a guided tour of this area so you can understand the significance of what you are seeing.
Walk and get lost!. Just go there, walk and always always look the buildings, the beautiful small streets, the musicians playing, you will feel like you're in a whole different world.
Very nice small streets. Beautiful cathedral and most buildings with nice architecture parts. We walked the small streets for an hour. You can find places to eat or drink.
Pleasant to walk through. Nice part of the city you should visit. Close to Ramblas offers some interesting examples of gothic (and pure gothic) architecture
Dark, medieval and narrow. I loved this quarter of Barcelona, the streets are very narrow and it's a little dark and medieval styled. Nice if you like to walk around. The cathedral is impressive.

Charming place. My wife and I stopped in the Gothic Quarter on the way from La Rambla to the sea front.The place has its unique character and is very charming,with little narrow streets and beautiful little shops and places to eat.Well worth a visit.
Not to be Missed. loved just wandering around this more interesting part of the city. Came across some great bars and shops just off the beaten track, well worth a mouch
Gorgeous walk. Would recommend walking around and shopping and eating at the local businesses. Beautiful streets and architecture.

Excellent on day light, dangerous after 10:00pm. It's great to get lost in tiny medieval roads, with many shops and food places. Be aware that after 10:00pm it gets difficult with people offering you substances or go go girls

An Excellent Walk and Area, Magic at Night. During the day you get to see some great architecture from various ages, including some really great art nouveau storefronts, to churches left scarred from the Spanish Civil War. Great food and cafes, and great attractions. Barcelona is now one of my favorite places to go.

Loved it!. Wow! What a fantastic area of Barcelona this is! So authentic! A fantastic feel about the place. Just wander on through this area to gain a sense of history. Local shops selling their wares, a maze of streets with delicious cafes. Take in the sights, smells and sounds of this wonderful part of the city. Will come again!

A place where you want to get lost. Just wander around and you will be overwhelmed by the tiny little streets, the lovely little squares, the atmosphere ... It is a trip back in the long history of Barcelona with all its marvel.

Pleasant walk in an area full of history. This unmissable area of Barcelona offers a pleasant and relaxed walk, spotting fabulous Gothic architecture and also some wonderful options of bars and restaurants.

Great place to wander around for hours!. Take a map with you and don't be afraid to stop and ask directions. This part of the city is really amazing with beautiful buildings and a maze of back streets. Once you get off the main streets there are so many shops and tapas places that you'll be kept busy for the whole day.

Feel of Middle Ages. Been in Barri Gothic of Barcelona three times, and I am looking forward to visit again. The Cathedral is truly a Gothic monument among a city full of modernism architecture. In Barcelona one can walk through the ages.

Beautiful area!. Barcelona has got an amazing history and this is confirmed for example in the Gothic Quarter. Beautiful ornaments and the passion which you can feel in every brick (especially effect at night) makes this area must-to-seen for all travelers! Plus, this is Barcelona, so everywhere you will have a contact with catalan history! Try to relax and just walk randomly - you won't regret it...

Wander in wonder. You can almost forget your guide book in this sprawling yet intimate and in places cramped quarter of Barcelona. Just take in the sights, sounds and smells and you won't be disappointed.

The Catedral located in the Quarter is beautiful. The Catedral is an outstanding piece of architecture inside and outside . Where you look you'll find a piece of art . The all Quarter is very interesting and colourful. Many little bars and restaurants , artesanes shops , grafitis and gifts shops too
So much to explore. We stayed in Barri Gotic and loved just wandering around. There's so much to look at, and lots of interesting places to eat and drink.

Charming quarter. We were set up in Barri Gotic. It is so nice, you can feel this charm of an old city. I loved its streets, a small ham shops. It is faboulos. I will always be set up in this quarter.

Fascinating. One of the most lovely territories in Barcelona. Spending hours to slowly explore around and getting lost in narrow streets is fascinating! There are many lovely places of all kinds. Tapas places, bars, restaurants.. Small shops. Just lovely..

The labyrinth of streets and squares. This is the old town of Barcelona, famous for its narrow streets, medieval buildings and even remains from the ancient Roman settlement. You will have a feeling of moving through the labyrinth, as you wander through its streets and squares, admiring the architectural and cultural sites. This is definitely one of the highlights during a visit to Barcelona, but, once again, be aware of pickpockets and thieves.

Spent days walking around this area, never got bored.. Just go and get lost. You'll love it. And no matter how lost you are, you'll never be more than a few steps from anything you could need! If you get lost enough you'll find some great streets with fun restaurants and bars that feel a little less touristic than the rest of the old quarter.And on Sunday's, when the rest of the city is closed, this area is your best option for finding some food, drink, shopping, and the occasional large supermercato that is still open.
The best part of this wonderful city. If you travel to Barcelona it's a must to spend time in the old town, wonderful buildings, the best places to eat and drink.

I live here and love it!. I often find myself wandering these streets alone with my camera! The character of the Gothic periods (15th Century) and the later Renaissance period where restorations were made lets you love getting lost for hours.
Friends. Old part of Barcelona, with hidden charms. Old buildings, each with probably many stories to tell. Would not recommend going alone from late in the afternoon and during the night
Amazing. Really amazing architecture with the maze like narrow streets. Safe enough, if you take small precautions and be aware of pickpockets. So far it was fine for me.

A strollers delight. This is the old centre of medieval Barcelona and although there has been some questionable renovations over the past 100 years this still remains a remarkable experience.Roman ruins, medieval buildings, the jewish ghetto, neo-classical additions all co-exist in a fascinating mixture that constantly throws up surprising delights.Restoration and gentrification has been in progress for some years now so don't be surprised by ongoing building projects, winding alleys littered with trash, brazen exploitation, sleezy hotels, dive bars, good restaurants etc.All this adds to the charm if you are looking for true experience and not sanitized Europe.And do be careful of pickpockets.

Walk around. Beautiful area filled with nice restaurants and gift shops and beautiful buildingsBarcelona as a city was warm and sunny during my visitI recommend also that you go one the early morning to the see side and take the telepgric to the mountain .. Or just enjoy setting on, the benches in Th sun and feeding the birds.Amazing views
Time traveling. Very well preserved neighborhood, architecture keeps you speechless, and you feel like you have traveled in time.
great walk.. Take time and wander thru the Gothic Quarter. Enjoy the beautiful architecture, ancient streets, tiny shops, and city living.

Beautiful gems of Spain. Thousand of years of culture fill the streets and life of Barcelona with Roman foundations, Medieval layers...and neo-gothic facelifts! Beautiful!! I recommend the Runner Bean free guided walking tour.

A fabulous place 😍. The most lncredible place i had ever seen in Barcelona. You will feel that you went back many years ago. The historical buildings were amazing.
Had visit the quarter many times in night time and before sunshine to take a wonderful shots to this fabulous area.👍

Beautiful part of a Dirty, Smelly City..... I really enjoyed the Gothic Quarter of Barcelona. It was a very historic and inspiring place. There are so many things to see and I feel it would be the best place stay on a trip here. The city is vast and not very nice, so The Gothic Quarter is a nice reprise.

Walk through history. We spent a wonderful day walking through this area of Barcelona .
It's well worth the effort especially the architecture , small interesting shops , cafes , restaurants .
A fascinating part of this fabulous city.
Excellent district to stroll about!. Wonderful old city with narrow alleyways bustling with restaurants, bars and boutique. Nice atmosphere and feel around the quarter!

Historical, fun and interesting. What fun labyrinth of alleyways, around each corner there is something fun to see, we found a museum that was not on our map and decided to investigate so glad we did transported back to the Roman era and saw part of a village that is 3-5 floors below. So if your unsure about the next turn take it you never know what you will see or find. Hoping to go back someday. We where there 8 years ago so this review is very late in being done and for that I am sorry as so many people may have missed an opportunity to see something that they would have missed if they did not take an unfamiliar path. Happy Travels

One of the most interesting places in Barcelona!. We recently visited Barcelona and wanted to see the Barrio Gotico (Gothic Quarter), due my aunt got married in the Cathedral which is located there. We were not able to enter the cathedral due a huge lane but we saw it from outside and was very beautiful!The surroundings are great, the passages and corridors full of shops, restaurants and people make this place unique!If you like history, this place will take you 500 years ago!Also if you like art, you will be able to see the Market where local painters sell their masterpieces...I was able to buy a nice painting, some sort of transparency with a frame and a LED light, very nice for 140 euros...

One of The Best Neighborhoods to Explore in the World. All the buildings are so distinguished in character, I loved whole time just going around it, its like a mystery unfolding itself slowly and slowly.

I love this place. This place near from my hotel. I stay at h10 juat walk like 7-10 minutes asian leg (lol). The place is awesome when u go there day or night. Near from that place u can see zara,manggo, disney store. If u go to gothic quarter dont for get to take pic barcelona sign... ❤❤.....

A place where you see the old and new.. There are very few places that have the perfect blend of old and new. The Gothic Quarter has areas that several centuries old and great new constructions. The Cathedral there is not only a religious place but also one to admire for all of it's art and structure.

Beautiful part of Barcelona. Wander these narrow streets lined with period buildings right in the heart of Barcelona. Individual shops, bars and cafes make this an interesting part of this bustling city.

Lovely and scenic; great at night. I feel that Barcelona's gothic quarter's streets are at their most beautiful at night. All the restaurants are most likely still open (some restaurants only opened at 10PM!) and the views are just stunning. Also, there's a lovely environment bustling with activity, perfect for a night-time stroll to admire the scenery.

Beautiful place to visit day or night.. One of the best places to visit in Barcelona, full of history and beauty. It feels like you're going back in time going there. Besides it is full of stores, bars and pubs, full of nice people.
Great walk around.... The Gothic Quarter is a beautiful district to walk around. The church is very nice but the best is to get lost here and just walk around the narrow streets.

Atmospheric area . On our visit to Barcelona we kept getting drawn back to this area. With its labyrinth of narrow streets, many opening into amazing squares and stretching down to the waterfront and beyond. There are Churches Basilicas and The Cathedral to see. Easily accessed from La Rambla there is much to see and admire and many food outlets to try the many types of cuisines.
Wow. We found this place by accident. Really nice wax museum. But bit expensive! You will amaze with their work.
# days in Barcelona. We nearly missed this, definitely worth the trip to spend a few hours wandering around this historic area.

A Journey Back in time. We joined the free walking tours and was thrill and entertained by the exceptional story telling of the guide Bille. A wonderful guide to the various history of this quarter. The narrow streets and quint buildings and cobble stone paving has many intriguing story to tell

Area NOT to be missed in Barcelona. The Gothic zone in Barcelona is an area not to be missed...I recommend just walk around enjoy the small streets, enjoy the great buildings and the flavor of this area...end in the port and take a walk in Paseo Colon than sit to relax in the port.
eerie at night but lovely walk in the daytime. good little tapas bars around this quarter although is said to be dodgy for pickpockets we as a family were not confronted by any off these people

Lose yourself in the Gothic Quarter. If in Barcelona definitely spend a morning get lost in the Gothic Quarter. It has narrow streets filled with interesting shops, old style buildings and some beautiful cathedrals. Just wondering through this amazing and beautiful area is a lot of fun and very interesting. A must see on any trip to Barcelona.

Great alleys!. When we got here there was an antique market outside the cathedral which is worth a gander. Try not to touch anything on display though as some shop keepers don't appreciate it. So if you want to know how much things cost or want to have a closer look, ask them instead of helping yourselves. Having said that, not sure if this antique market is always opened here.We really liked walking and discovering alley ways and see how the other half of the world lived. Take the chance to snap some pictures when you come across good alleyway spots. Nice little shops everywhere selling all sorts. There was one jewellery shop in particular which I love! They had the most unique pieces I'd ever seen!We also got lost a couple of times (I think it's a lil maize-like) but we carried on walking as it helped discover new things along the way and ended up in a different area :)

The heart of old Barcelona. The Gothic Quarter should be one of your "must see" attractions at Barcelona. Narrow streets, small plazas, and here and there grand buildings such as the Cathedral and the large gothic basilicas. To spend a morning wandering around. My recommendation: have a GPS or an application like Google Maps available.
Beautiful part of the city. Lots of independent businesses and beautiful architecture. Beware of thieves and don't trust anyone business cards, my advice is ignore them.

a very interesting place to walk. Gothic Quarter and Born is an area where you have to visit.You will need at least half a day , walking through lovely pedestrian streets admiring many interesting buildings. In Born area (attached to the Gothic Quarter area) you will find all the local designers for shopping and many nice restaurants, too.

Take a walking tour to see it in detail. We took a walking tour organised by some youth/hostel oraganisation. It's free but at the end you can tip your guide. It's a 3hr tour but you get to see the quarter in detail. You find quaint little shops as well as bar and restaurants here.

Go Exploring..... People have said in other reviews, get lost in the Gothic Quarter and we agree with that. There are so many narrow and twisting streets with great surprises around each corner. Great shops, foods, drinks, etc. that you will have a great time. For those that want more structure try the Sandeman walking tour, excellent.

Get lost in the Gothic Quarter!. An easy and relaxing walk filled with great architecture, cafe's and a mix of local and franchised retail stores. This section of the city adjoins the seafront with its own local produce stores. Most retailers speak some english so we didn't have any problems making our purchases or getting directions. Public transport and taxis are plentiful here and we felt very comfortable and safe throughout.

Wandering through the Gothic Quarter. I loved wandering through the narrow streets and alleyways of the Gothic Quarter on my recent stay in Barcelona. There is something for everyone. If you love architecture, it is stunning, if you love food, there are some lovely restaurants and if you love shopping, there are interesting little shops.
Bring a map. This is one of the more interesting sections of Barcelona. It is easy to wander through the maze of streets running through the quarter. But bring a map

A beautiful Cathedral!. Another beautiful building loaded with history. The masses were all Spirit-filled with beautiful music in a gorgeous Gothic cathedral with a very interesting history. I do just wish they had less fenced off but do understand it's being necessary for good maintenance of such precious things.

There is Nothing Like Strolling in the Gothic Quarter at the Break of Dawn. Any time is fun for strolling the incredible medieval Gothic Quarter, but the break of dawn is my favorite. It's quiet with just the early morning workers hosing off the streets and alleys. The bakers are preparing their croissants and there are very few people around. No tourists that I ran into. The architecture is awesome in this old Roman village and the streets are intimate. There are restaurants, cafe's, bars and shops. Look for the Cathedral in the heart of the district.
Take the walking tour!. Took the walking tour of Gothic Quarter by one of the local guides who do it for tips. Excellent tour and saw lots of the old Gothic Quarter. Highly recommended.

Do yourself a favor, Get Lost in Barri Gotic.. Wander the narrow streets and passageways of the Gothic quarter and you'll be continuously surprised by what you might find. A Pablo Picasso fathead, a jewish synagogue, medieval architecture, an eternal flame, a gothic cathedral, and the best Chocolatería in Barcelona are just a few of the treasures you'll uncover. Give yourself half a day to wander this quarter and you won't regret it.

Tiny streets, crowded area. One of the places I liked most there. Tiny streets, you can just walk and see the houses, stores and small restaurants. Very safe, didn't feel anything strange walking with my camera, backpack...

Amazing!. A wonderful building steeped in history. The Cathedral does close at certain times of the day so best go to see it fairly early in the day, it is a beautiful building that has a wonderful atmosphere.

Our favorite Barcelona neighborhood. Was nice to take in the charm of the old, narrow city streets and stumble on plazas, shops, cafes, and restaurants that didn't just cater to tourists. It was especially nice the further you go away from Las Ramblas. Don't forget to visit the El Born neighborhood as well, for more of the same, especially around the plaza at the Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar.

Vibrant part of the city. 2nd time to Barcelona but first visit to the gothic quarter.Great place to just wander and take in the atmosphere, stopping for the occasional coffee or glass of wine.Some beautiful building throughout the area and well worth a visit
Must visit. Must visit in Barcelona! We rented an apartment there, it is amazing with the small streets, shops and bars, the interesting architecture and very spiritual atmosphere.
Beautiful area. This area is simply beautiful. It is full of beautiful old buildings. It is amazing how a city can be so beautiful and diverse! It is also full of small restaurants and shops!

Best Area. When I go to Barcelona I try to stay in this area in Ciutat Vella district.. The Gothic Quarter is stunning. The Architecture is beautiful mainly because it used to be a Roman village. Most of the streets are very narrow and cars cant really get through although some do try lol. There are a lot of attractions in this area and La Rambla is a must.
Lots of shopping. Really loved the Gothic quarter. There were so many authentic and unique stores, great bakeries and coffee shops and great places to eat.

Nothing special. Yes, narrow streets pack with cafes and restaurants and shops and with many people too! You get the feel of the "old world" but it is also similar to Venice in these manner therefore it doesn't do it for me. It is only ok. Nothing special

Architectural Amazement. The Gothic Quarter of Barcelona is about a 10-15 minute walk from the central square (where you will find all of the tour buses and tourist information booths). Great little walk where you will be fascinated and amazed at the architecture on the buildings which line both sides of the street. I was so captivated by this splendor that the majority of all the pictures that l took, while in Barcelona, were of the buildings and the monuments. I would strongly recommend that you join many of the walking tours that are available as the locals are very well informed on the history of the buildings, churches, monuments and area.

what an amazing place. I walked around the old gothic quarters in Barcelona with my family in Dec 2015 and it was an amazing experience. Whether it is the cathedrals or old walls of the city, it was beautiful. I would strong advise to take walking tours if possible

History and Art. If you want to know something about Barcelona History, you should walk through the small lanes of this quarter. There are beautiful churches and monuments you can visit and there are also many restaurants
Walking. Nice place for a stroll with gorgeous architecture, but nothing more. Too many people and the cafes around here seem a bit too touristy.

Historic stroll . This place is historic yet modern. It was well lit during our visit for the Christmas season and we felt secured with lots of police presence. Marvel at the Roman ruins and remnants of Barcelona's ancient Roman past. Have some pastries and tea at the Els Quatre Gats - hang out of the city's Modernist artisans! Don't forget to visit the Gothic Cathedral of Barcrlona and many more!

Go for a fascinating wander. This is one of Barcelona's most interesting areas. Old, old, old but with shops and cafes, lots of winding streets that open onto little markets and impromptu street musician performances. I could have spent several days enjoying this neighbourhood.

take me back!. The Gothic Quarter was my favorite area in Barcelona. Adorable tiny streets, great food (be careful of mid-late afternoon closings), cheap but perfect wine, and awesome people watching.

Prepare for interesting walk. If you planing to spend some period in Barcelna you must spend 2 days for walk thrue Gotic area. Old town, interesting shop, small restoran, good not expensive food. Take foto with you, good map, and jst walk on the small streets...Do not scare you can go far than you can find back way...
excellent part of old town. winding streets, old architecture and shops, very quaint and olde worlde. excellent part to visit to see the old part of town

Nice place for a stroll. Nice place for a stroll, but nothing more. Too many people for my taste, and the cafes around here seem a bit too touristy - again that might be on me - I like the small back-alley cafes better..

Not To Be Missed. The Barri Gotic is an architectural delight not to mention the whole area is filled with quaint boutique shops and trendy restaurants and bars. I highly recommend you don't miss wandering about while you are in Barcelona. I was so enchanted with the narrow passageways and gothic architecture that I went back twice! Upon arrival I kept asking locals how to walk to "barri gotic" and no one knew what the heck I was talking about. If you are talking to locals say "barrio gotico" instead. Just my $0.02. It easy to spend several hours wandering about and you can venture to the night markets and cathedral as well. Be sure to get there!

Get lost here!. Awesome place to spend some time and get lost - lots of cute bars, restaurants, old churches, squares. We went in December so it wasn't super hot or crowded and we were able weave in and out of cafes and old points of interest for most of an afternoon without feel rushed. Just beautiful!

A surprise around every corner.. There's lots to see in these ancient alleyways. A surprise around every corner. The best restaurants are here in the old quarter and don't forget to pay a visit to the old Cathedral De Barcelona.

Fascinating!. Try booking the guided walking tour! Try booking it early in the morning as it is the only chance you'll get to see the streets of the Gothic Bario without it being packed with tourists! The guide talks a lot of useful history and the experience takes about two hours!

a blast in the barri!. Don't miss this neighborhood! We took an afternoon to just wander and follow our noses, no plans, but had such a great adventure exploring the shops and finding wonderful spots for meals.

Rambling off the Ramblas. Last visited Barcelona's Gothic Quarter 29 yrs ago when I vowed to return. Well I finally did, good thing too - such a beautiful place to explore/discover, something for everyone.

I Could Spend All Day Walking These Streets. Yes, it's touristy, but if you can walk on the lesser used side streets, it is very beautiful and awe inspiring to walk these ancient streets. they are stunning. My favorite part of Barcelona.

Exceptional, fascinating, delightful. A perfect starting point to explore Barcelona. We wandered here many times, finding new side streets, ancient treasures, shops, cafes. There is in fact so much to explore that I hope to return for a third visit.
Lovely area. It was fantastic. There are a lot of restaurants and bars. It is the best nightlife area. It is worth to see the cathedral, santa maria del mar church and plaza sant jaume.

Pick pocket. I was enjoying the City .. Barcelona
A great city but .. as warned by many .. Pick pocket is everywhere .. like Rats ..
Why the city never try to clean the mess
Police is everywhere yet all the pick pocket is everywhere ..
Barcelona city council MUST do something..

Go early or late or on Sunday to see the dancers and motorcyclists. We had the benefit of staying in this area so it was not crowded at all early in the morning or later in the day. On Sunday morning you can see the folk dancers outside the cathedral and the motorcyclists all dressed up for the ride. There is also a lovely gallery right next to the cathedral.Well-worth doing the first walking tour of the day around the back alleys. Also, have a photo taken near the Barcelona sign next to the cathedral! A real Barcelona flavour.
Walking, walking and more walking. Streets are quite old and picturesque - Central Bar inside main market is a wonderful gastronomic experience

amazing cathedral. we arrived on a Sunday as Mass was being celebrated but the public were still allowed in which gave a wonderful atmosphere with the singing. The cloisters have a flock of geese amongst orange trees and chickens too. No pressure to donate any money unlike cathedrals in UK.
Lovely and romantic. It is very romantic to walk through the small streets of the gothic quarter by day or by night.Many small and warm tapes bars, bakeries around.

A must go on a visit to Barcelona. A maze of narrow streets. Lots of small restaurants, bars, and shops. The architecture is amazing. We felt quite safe and comfortable walking around even when we reached a street with the ladies of the night in doorways. Nice little squares with tables outside. Looking forward to going back on our next visit to Barcelona.
Stunning. A lot of beautiful architecture, shops and restaurants. A great walk for 2-3 hours. A little bit crowded, but not to much as I was there in winter :) Generally, love it!
Gorgeous Ancient Architectural Location. A must visit location in Barcelona, just off La Ramblas would be Barri Gothic. Gorgeous architecture, ancient buildings, lively atmosphere.
Great neighbor !. Really nice vibe in the goticcc !! Nice walk packed of ppllll !! We couldnt get into the cathedral but looked very nice from outside as well !!

One of the nicest areas in Barcelona !. There is not much to say - just take the next plane to Barcelona and walk through this part of the city. Much has been done to maintain this part of the city as much as possible and they have done a good job.

Very beautiful. The Gothic Quarter is a must go in Barcelona. You can go for a stroll there and see all the beautiful buildings, park, shops, restaurants, ... Don't visit the Rambles alone, there are nice small streets next to the Rambles.

One of our favourite places to visit in Barcelona.. Old world charm, lots of narrow streets filled with unique shops and restaurants, great churches to visit such as Barcelona Cathedral and Santa Maria del Pi.

My fav area of Barcelona . A maze of tiny streets and alley ways. Hundreds of little quaint bars leading off all of them. Easy to get lost and hard to find the bar you were in the previous night. So take a card off the bar. Sat out in the street drinking and relaxing until the early hours. Very chilled. This is my favourite area of the city. Not to pricey and not to busy.

The best part of Barcelona!. The Gothic Cathedrals are frozen in time. There are no "later modifications" from the Renaissance or Baroque... as an architect, I could spend hours just sitting inside...The narrow streets are very charming and you can find there some nice little cafes and restaurants. The Picasso museum is right in the center of the Gothic Quarter... Do both - visit the Gothic churches and feast your eyes on some great Picasso pieces - it is a wonderful combination!

A must see in Barcelona. The Gothic Quarter was one of our favourite places to stay - so much to see! And the architecture is amazing as well - with plenty of cobblestone pedestrian-only streets with excellent shopping and restaurants. The history is amazing too - especially with its Roman beginning & influence.

Lovely. I love ancient gothic buildings and those in Barcelona gothic square is just beautiful. This city is just beautiful. It's very crowded , but it's worth visiting and take in the sights. It's beautiful.

The alley ways are endless. T. The archictecture and ambience is breathtaking. Visit the Barcelona Cathedral, the old Roman Towers, the Jewish Quarter, La Place SAnt Jaume and countless cafes and coffee shops for meandering.

The alley ways are endless. T. The archictecture and ambience is breathtaking. Visit the Barcelona Cathedral, the old Roman Towers, the Jewish Quarter, La Place SAnt Jaume and countless cafes and coffee shops for meandering.
Geese!. Very interesting, cobbled street and old world charm. The Gothic cathedral was a highlight, having millenium-old murals and geese in its grounds!

Nice Area.. The cathedral is perfect the complete opposite of Sagrada Familia.. More of an authentic or antique Barcelona. Great shopping, dining, and vibes in this area. Ran across a Gothic Market while here and it was very nice!
Fascinating. Just take a wander around with no plan in mind and discover little alleyways, shops, bars, historic sights and everything inbetwen
Favorite local spot. Nice atmosphere, quieter w nicer restaurants surrounding. Great for photo opps, free! My favorite spot. Love the outside seating, not crazy busy

Just wander around!. Every new street or block brings new stores and restaurants, so we just wandered around following the lights and sights. The location is central to most major tourist attractions, so it's a great area for tourists to stay. Be careful crossing the streets, and don't buy anything from someone selling off of a blanket on the ground - there is a fine for this.

Beautiful barcelona. A beautiful area full of shops and bars and places to eat.perfect for a slow walk just taking in the amazing buildings and scenery and then finding a great spot to grab some food.have a drink,tapas and soak up the wonderful atmosphere of this lovely part of Barcelona.

An amazing part of Barcelona, I hope they don't destroy it with horrible new buildings!. Great to just walk through, a maze of tiny old lanes and incredible tiny shops. I wish they'd renovate more and take care of the old buildings instead of putting in horrible new architecture

Gothic . Gothic quarter is beautiful. We stayed at Barcelona catedral hotel. 2 mins from cathedral in the square. Xmas market was there up to the 23 December. Lots of bars, tapas and shops in the area. Would def stay again.
take your camera. Wonder off the main street some of the walls are from the15c , every side street opens onto something new

Essential Barcelona. What a great place to just wonder around with no agenda and just get lost in the wonderful architecture and experience the vibrancy of this magnificent city. Full of bars, restaurants shops, churches and galleries you can lose a day just being amazed and delighted.
Intriguing. The ancient narrow streets were just fascinating. We found a wonderful little cafe that served the all time best paella con pollo. Simply the best ever
Gotta Go Gothic . You have to visit this area of the city....Lots of great sights and bars to visit. So much to see and do x

Enjoyed. A slice of Barcelona it is so worth seeing.We went ourselves first and had lunch in one of the small restaurants which was delicious but later we took a free walking tour of Barcelona which brought us around the Gothic area fully and our experienced guide gave us the history behind the gothic area in a fun and interesting away
Labyrinth of delight. Fascinating warren of the good, the gritty and the gastronomic - have lots of time - so much to take in! Found one of most unique shoe shops Hector - radical unusual stuff.
Absolutely amazing. Lots to see and lots to do! Just immerse yourself in the sights, sounds and smells that are all around you.

Exploring!. We came here and just got lost in the beautiful buildings and Barcelona culture. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves & just meandering through the old streets and seeing the locals flocking here mid afternoon. It was a great thing to see and there are some beautiful buildings!!

Medieval maze of streets. Cozy, busy, and it feels like there are a million bars, shops and little restaurants in this quarter. And then all of the sudden you end up at a litlle plaza where most of the times you find terraces to eat or drink or there is a historical building. A big contrast with the big avenues.
Excellent history. Amazing historical sites. Cathedral recently finished renovations. Close to harbour. Good walking tour.
Very nice. Thias neighborhood in barcelona is very nice. Lots of small restaurants and bars - wonderfull tapas.

Great area to wander around in. I loved meandering down the streets behind the Barcelona Cathedral. Very old architecture mixed with small shops. Also I happened upon the city hall square which was quaint and a nice surprise.
Gorgeous. For those who like to follow maps, walk, and take pictures. Wonderful buildings, narrow little streets that seem safe enough for the tourist to enjoy the sites.

Get lost in the winding streets of old Medieval Barcelona. Simply after five minutes in this area, I knew I loved it. There is so much history there, and getting lost down the narrow and winding streets is part of the adventure. There are so many wonderful shops, cafes, galleries, and museums. It is a wonderful blend of old and new, and there's always some great find around every corner.

Beautiful architecture and even graffiti . Every building is of interest due to design or surface. Get lost among the streets and enjoy the exploration. Gothic figures and detail make everything interesting. Businesses with graffiti paintings depicting the business are respected and not painted over

Very quaint narrow streets and beautiful arcitecture . Definitely make your way east, off of the Ramblas and check this area out. It's relatively quiet and not touristy like the Ramblas. Beautiful photos ops and nice cafes and restaurants. An absolute must if you have a few days in Barcelona.

Nice for a day of strolling. Even on the Sunday we were there, this is worth strolling through. Beautifull buildings, avenue, walkways, with museums, shops, bars and restaurants, the Ramblas, all. Next to the Sagrada Familia, not to miss when in Barcelona.

Must Visit. This experience is for any traveller a must have. You have to walk the streets to feel this historic image of the city. If you have not alot of time you can rent a bike also and enjoy this artistic streets.
Holiday. Nice area well worth stay. Lots to see. Plenty of places to eat and drink. Would come again and stay for long weekend.

Get lost around there!!. The experience of walking among those million small and colourful streets (take a look at the clothes hanging on the balconies!) it's priceless... to find out the shops of everything you can imagine and the little bakeries... loved Gothic Quarter!

Rich History! 2 to 21 Century co-exists!. Next to Metro Jaume I. There is so much to see here. You can spend a day or two here. Don't miss the Jewish quarters, and the ancient synagogue! Very good B&Bs available in this quarter.If you are a vegetarian don't miss to have amazing lunch or dinner at "Vegetalia", just near the Martyrs Flames monument on the side of Stalla Maria del Mar.

Great area to walk around for a day.. The Cathedral is nice to see as is the waterfront. We loved browsing the market, unbelievable seafood selections. The waterfront and beach area was also a pleasant stroll. we visited in Dec. It ust be jammed during the summer.
Not all who wander are lost. Lose yourself in the myriad of small medieval streets and pretty little plazas. This IS Barcelona. Go find your own story...

Easy to get lost. Spend some time in the Gothic Quarter and wonder the winding streets. You could spend hours here wandering and enjoying the cafes and beautiful architecture. It's pretty close to the main shopping areas and could easily been made a day out of.
Also probably a good opportunity to tie in a visit to the cathedrals and what not.

Go to the place through the bigger streets. The Gothic Quarter is clearly marked out in the tourist map. Hence, we cut through to it from Las Ramblas through the back lanes. The back lanes (also part of the Gothic quarter) was deserted and a bit scary even though we went during the day. There was also a strong stench in the back streets. For better experience, I would recommend to use the bigger streets to enter the area.
A beautiful piece of history in the heart of Barcelona.. A leisurely stroll is recommended in this beautiful neighbourhood, it is loaded with incredible architectural detail.

Beautiful old part of Barcelona. The Gothic Quarter is a very lovely neighborhood in the old part of town. The quarter consists of beautiful, narrow alleyways and streets. In the centre of the quarter lies the cathedral: a magnificent gothic cathedral, definitely worth a visit. Wander around, take a left or a right turn here and there and experience the old Barcelona. Since it is also visited by a lot of tourists, I recommend to look for cafe's and restaurants in the small alleyways and street and stay of the main roads, as to avoid touristy restaurants.

Romantic . Don't miss amazing hidden patios with fountains, enjoy street musicians and delicious food. Every time when our rout was through gothic quarter we explored something new than we didn't mentioned before. If you are a night life person and even when not try to visit this place in the night, you will feel yourself like in the middle ages

Hidden gems in every square and alleyway. Getting yourself into the Barri Gotic is one thing, however getting yourself out is another. A labyrinth of alleyways and squares leading to medieval buildings and architecture, this is an unmissable experience in Catalonia. All you can want and need, restaurants, pubs, bars ,clubs, shops, street performers and sellers who have everything you could ever need. Mean once you're in you'll never have to leave. Short distance from the beach and adjacent to La Ramblas this is the heart of town. Siesta'ing people flock here all day and night, leaving the area with a constantly good atmosphere.

stroll through the old streets and find nice little shops. This is the old part of the city. take your time for a walk through the narrow street before or after you visit the famous museums located there like the Picasso museum or the Jewish synagogue.
Nice place to walk. I did a fantastic free walk tour inside the gothic quarter. There is a lot to see, visit and eat around. Half a day would be plenty in my opinion

Lively, mostly pedestrian and cosy area of Barcelona.. It is plenty of quaint crafts shops, cosy restaurants and lovely corners, small squares with stalls and lots to see and enjoy. It's an area which caters for sll tastes and totally lively. A total must if visiting the city.

Great Place to Visit and Walk. I spent a day in the Gothic Quarter, walking around, shopping and looking at architecture. It is a very picturesque part of the city, with interesting buildings, a beautiful Cathedral and good restaurants. The following day, I took a two hour walking tour of the Quarter through the Barcelona tourist office. While the tour was primarily in the area right around Plaza Sant Jaume, the tour guide provided a lot of historical information on this section of the city and highlighted its importance since the Roman era. We also visited the Christmas market and received a good (though graphic) explanation of the Christmas log and other Catalan Christmas customs. All-in-all, the Quarter was an excellent place to visit for at least half a day and I would recommend the walking tour. Although you can visit without a guide, it increased my enjoyment to have the additional information.

So many things to see and do.. A maze of streets, shops, and architectural wonders. We found quaint little restaurants,a myriad of shops, and ancient wonders, like walls built by the ancient Romans. You could easily spend a day here and never see it all.A must see!!

Very Cute and Enjoyable. Just having a nice walk around the Gothic Quarter can easily turn into a day's exploration. Beautiful, cultural, fun, and alongside the nice tapas places and shops, a worthwhile day!
Just Keep on Walking!!. The best area in Barcelona to just walk and admire! Lovely architecture and full of history, dedicate a few hours to see the churches and streets.
For architecture lovers. Good place for walks along the stone walls, especially in hot sunny day. Take a breath through the hundreds years of history. You can find good and quite cafes there.
Beautiful. The architecture is remarkably impressive. It's easy to get lost walking through the narrow winding streets, but it must be on your itinerary to visit.

Like stepping back in time . We enjoyed the area during the day as well as the night. During the day we walked around and admired the amazing architecture and the stunning remains of the ancient Roman walls. There is a great museum under the current city that slows you to walk to same hallways of the ancient city. (muhba Palaca Del Rei) at night many bars and cafes are opening offering delicious food for every budget. We ended the night with a treat of live music in front of the cathedral. One of our favorite nights in Barcelona! Highly recommend staying at least a day in the area, we wished we had booked a hotel closer!
amassing place. it" s needed ours to walk to see , to feel to taste the atmosphere. THE CATALONYA HISTORY around with old and nice small streets. enjoy a local specialties
Beautiful!. Beautiful area! I just loved walking around and taking in the architecture! You should not miss this area if you find yourself in Barcelona!
beautiful. If you enjoy walking on the streets, just go there, you can get lost a hundred times and still end up in a beautiful street

stone masons at their best. if you are a fan of architecture or just appreciate beautiful craftsmanship then the gothic quarter is a must!! the level of detail is simply amazing!...not to mention the history attached to these structures.
