A walk back in time.. Absolutely loved this area. Stay here if you can. Las Ramblas, The Market, Shopping, outside entertainment, and Tapas. The whole Barcelona experience. Our favorite part of Barcelona!

Heart of Barcelona. We were fortunate to catch the Spanish Food Festival the day we went here. It was a perfect opportunity to try out all their wonderful seafood, jamon, wine, ice cream, churros and many more. However, this whole area especially the little streets beside the cathedral and the museums are very interesting. Off limit to cars, you will enjoy walking and browsing the variety of local shops selling all kinds of Spanish food and goods. Definitely a highlight of Barcelona.

A Gothic quarter like no other in Europe. Nestled in the heart of Barcelona surrounding the old Roman city, the Gothic quarter is an interesting fusion of the very old and the trendy. Old buildings and walls containing trendy shops. The centerpiece is the Gothic Cathedral, which stands in stark contradistinction to the Basilica de la Sagrada Familia. The former is a church in the tradition of le Cathedral de Notre Dame in Paris (sans flying buttresses).
Very beautiful area!!!. Great area with many things to do and many coices to eat or drink something throughout the day, in the night it s not so safe!
lovely building. What a lovely building yet again in Barcelona , would recommend you go in when it is free at some parts of the day

Not to miss. What could be better than exploring the winding narrow streets of the Gothic area? It truly is a must to see. The architecture alone is captivating, but the shops and the street life are fascinating. We spent many hours wandering and exploring. It was truly great!

great place to stroll about..... just absolutely loved walking around this part of the city, great shopping, loads of little strange and unique shops down alleyways and side streets, basically, i just strolled and drank beers at the little bars and restaurants and slowly got real tipsy and loved it, my girlfriend loved it as much if not more as the clothes shopping is so amazing, defo be back..
Amazing, Beautiful!. Such an amazing place. Interesting awe-inspiring! I couldn't imagine going to Barcelona and not touring.

Best Historic Area of Barcelona. Loved the Gothic Quarter. Takes you back in time is cleaner than many other parts of the city, has some of the best food and is close to many attractions. If you want to truly feel like you are in a different time and place - stay here...

Gotic Church is worth seeing. The main attraction in the Gotic Quarter is the church and it is worth seeing. There are many small streets or walkways that you can get a little lost especially at night.
Wander the streets and get lost. I love this area in Barcelona , winding streets , tall buildings boutiques, tapas and bars , spend some time wandering
A lovely maze of streets. Perhaps this is one of the areas of Barcelona that is easy to miss, but it's worth a visit. There are some lovely shops in the maze of streets, but bring a map!
Beautiful. I loved rambling the ancient corridors of this old quarter. Thinking about the people who have wandered those same streets before me, stopping for wine and tappas.

A special place. I got lost in the Gothic Quarter and it was OK. I was just happy to walk around this special place. I even found a nice place to have lunch. The narrow cobble stone streets are delightful. If in Barcelona , this is a place to leave time to just roam.

Great place to shop!. We visited here during the day and I loved getting lost in the streets and discovering the small shops and restaurants in this area. It's a great way to see the Medieval part of Barcelona.

Lovely old Barcelona. This area is a beautiful historic part of Barcelona just to the side of las Ramblas. It is a maze of little streets with amazing buildings and cafes, restaurants and churches to be explored. Definitely worth visiting.

Hanging out in the quarter.... Before I found myself deep in the middle of it all I kept asking for directions. The best answer I got was just aim south (from H10 Urquinaona) and get lost. THAT was great advice. I had a wonderful afternoon just wandering the streets, cool shops, food...a highlight so far.
Beautiful sights around every corner.. Walk - just walk around and don't be afraid to get lost in the streets. All lead back to a main road....

Cool and interesting layout. We did this part of the city with sanderman free walking tour which was brilliant ad it's very easy to get lost. The guides are also pretty good with the history too. Be careful with belongings as can be pick pocketers around.

Loved this place! a must go!. I visited Barcelona with my husband recently. We both loved the Gothic Quarter- the mysterious architecture, the huge beautiful cathedral, the narrow streets with huge doors, tiny boutiques and the lively night life - everything about this place was breathtaking. If you are in Barcelona, this is a must go place. The city tour buses have a stop at the cathedral.

We stayed in the Gotic and wandered all about. Had a great time.. We explored the Gotic from our hotel several times, once via Rick Steve's walking tour and then just as we were out and about. A really neat place.

Walking tour of Gothic Quarter. Very important to do a walking tour of the Gothic quarter if you want to understand it's history as well as know what you are seeing within this old city. It is a very walkable area, and there is always something interesting to see as well as lovely shops and restaurants. We were lucky enough to see Catalonia dancing and a band in front of a gothic cathedral as we strolled by on a Sunday!

A must see if in Barcelona . Just ambling through the narrow streets to get to this magnificent Cathedral is joy enough. Built in the 1200's this church is a testament to the devotion of men. Everywhere you look. There is a object, painting or statue that wants to remind you of God. Yes,even the pews with the X marked on them. If you visit at certain hours the visit is free otherwise a small fee is charged.
great atomspher in a rainy day. Walk around and enjoy the old buildings and narrow roads and shops. fountains and restaurants are also there for enjoyment.

Gothic quarter is awesome.. So much to see & do here! An amazing place. We had a walking tour which really showed how much history is in this amazing city. Then got lost on our own exploring the many back streets & lane ways. Great food available at reasonable prices.
Fabulous quant & narrow streets.. Trek of historic area included many shops & cathedrals. Neat walking area that should be great for photos!

fall in love with barcelona. the cathedral and the area around it are simply amazing. words like "quaint", and "picturesque" do not do justice. i do my best to experience whatever place i am in and not just live in my camera lens, but i took over 700 pictures in just over 3 hours as we walked down the alleyways and through the cathedral
Love it!. The entire neighborhood is fantastic! So much to see around, so many beautiful details and the way it's taking care! It's really beautiful!
Lovely to walk around. We went to the Picasso museum and also visited many shops on the back alley ways. Lovely way to spend several hours or more.

Get lost in this amazing old part of town.. It is charming with its narrow street, various shops/bars, and amazing vibe.
There’s obviously the plaza in front of the Cathedral, but don’t miss other places like Plaza Reial or Plaza del Pi.
Gothic Quarter. A great way to spend a few hours wandering the lanes taking in the wonderful buildings, realaxing in the cafes and taking in the atmosphere!

Exceeds exptectations. Take your time and walk around for hours in the Barrio Gotico. And then come back again. Enjoy the architecture, the street musicians and all that comes along with this beautiful area.
Just wander and admire. Great area just to walk around, shop, and enjoy the amazing architecture. Some cool churches, Roman ruins, and places to eat.

Awesome!. Best area of Barcelona for sightseeing and shopping. The Barcelona Cathedral gave me goosebumps. It was spectacular. Loved the small streets and shops and then the square. Very close to Las Ramblas and a good walk.

Fun by day, but warned to avoid at night.. We accidently found ourselves wandering the streets of the Gothic area whilst trying to find the location of the office for a Segway tour. Despite other reviews we did not witness any pickpockets or crime and felt quite safe (obviously taking great care of our bags etc). The Placa Reial was a lovely lively square with restaurants all around where we enjoyed a good meal. We were warned by our Segway tour guide not to be in the area too late at night though as it gets quite rowdy when all the bars open.
Great architecture and narrow streets.. I loved the atmosphere in the whole area. Visiting some of the museums and Tapas bars.Great to just walk around
Loved the Cathedral. the cathedral was amazing and very inspiring. we did not stay there for long but we loved the place, great place for photos and a bit of rest between visiting places
A great wander. This is a fascinating place to wander and get lost in. Lovely alleys...great tapas places...amazing atmosphere.
Great place to spend the day. Windy cobbled streets with interesting shops, and if you get tired of shopping you are a couple of blocks from the beach.
Enjoyed people watching. Lots of people mingling about, singing, dancing. Enjoyed watching people, found a number of craftspeople with stalls of merchandise, reasonably priced.
Great area to wonder around. I really enjoyed wandering around the Gothic Quarter. The old buildings, some back to Roman days, the churches, and the tapas bars.
great walk in gotic centre. It was the first quarter we visited in Barcelona, the cathedral is very nice as well as the surrounding area .
loved it a lot!. we did a tour of the gothic area and it was EXCELLENT. the gothic area is very interesting but hard to figure out without a tour. we would have gotten lost easily!!
Must see . The gothic quarter is just as I expected. There is some fabulous architecture and you could lose yourself for hours in all the little passages and alleyways. Take your camera!
What Makes Barcelona Great. You'll need a pair of good walking shoes and the desire to wander. Or just taking a walking tour that you can arrange at any tourist information center.

This area is spectacular. We stayed in this area and the history and architecture is truly awesome. Please do not visit Barcelona without a trip to the cathedral and the old cobbled streets - fantastic.
Great for wandering. These narrow streets with various shops and restaurants is an afternoon well spent. It's also a great place to sip on a cappuccino and watch the street performers.
Nice experience. You will enjoy the small , long streets and the vitality of the city. Also here are many turist attractions to consider.
Interesting busy area.. Lots of shops & restaurants. Try to visit The Cat Bar vegan restaurant which opens at 6.30pm. By the way, there are no public toilets in Barcelona!!

Loads of atmosphere and fun place to be. . The area is buzzing with many bars, musicians at every corner, shops with loads to shop , pubs, bars, cafes and many hidden gems. It will surely be a pleasant surprise to the first timers. Repeat visitors are there for obvious reasons. Not to miss if you are in Barcelona.

So beautiful! . Great to walk around and enjoy the
spectacular streets. The atmosphere is so nice among the lovely buildings.

Get a Map and Go. As with most old, old areas like this, it's winding so a map is handy. Plan to spend some time wandering and rambling here. There are great little shops and good places to eat and/or drink. It's absolutely charming.

Just get out and walk! You will be happier!. Barcelona is a unique city and just walking around does a lot of good. The architecture is wonderful, awesome, and just plain wowzies! A great place to get a work-out in and people watch. All of their walks are just a city disney-land-ish! And fun!

Mrs. Lovely wee narrow streets off the Rambla with a great variety of interesting shops tucked away in odd places. Better further away from the centre, less tourist tat and better bargains! Superb architecture if you take the time to look up. Lots and lots of interesting places to eat and drink and a nice atmosphere.
Amazing loved it. Loved everything about it....just wandering & strolling around the streets was great....love Barcelona

Just lose yourself in the narrow streets - you won't be sorry!. On our last visit to Barcelona we only saw a small part of the Barrì Gotic. This time, we rented an apartment there and spent five days exploring its nooks and crannies .... 5-6 miles a day and we didn't even. Priced cause we enjoyed everything we saw. It was nice to start learning the streets and knowing where to buy our favorite churros or where to have a chocolata or una cervesa. We LOVED the area and will stay there on our next trip in a few months!
Enjoy. Great place for a walk. You feel like you've traveled back to the past. When in Barcelona, you have to spend some time in the Gothic quarter.

Wonderful part of Barcelona, pay for visiting the catedral. We spent a beautiful day in gothic part of Barcelona. I especially recommend to pay for visit of the catedral (7 EUR) which allows you to see it all including wonderful view from its rooftop (elevator all the way).
Find the lift!!. Beautiful building- make sure you find the lift to the roof , cost included in admission price , for amazing views of the gothic quarter and beyond.

Amazing. You can get lost in these laneways for hrs.
Amazing shops, bars and restaurants. Very cool hamd made clotjes and jewelery. Many piazzas to site see.
Intriguing maze of medieval streets. We loved wandering in this area. Some unusual shops for poking around in and more quiet places to eat than on the busy, hectic Rambla nearby.
Amazing architecture. The architecture, the feel, the narrow streets, the squares you happen upon make for a wonderful stroll around this Gothic old town.

Wonder in Awe. This is another must see in Barcelona, stroll around the ancient Gothic Quarter and marvel at the beautiful architecture, clean streets and charismatic alleyways. Full of great places to eat and drink with a wide selection so you can fine dine or eat cheap. Loose yourself in this labyrinth of alleyways and thanks to the simple layout of Barcelona always find yourself again.

Incredible architecture. A must see for photos - the attention to detail was fascinating, and there's lots to see an do in the vicinity. It's worth visiting the market across the road too, for exotic fruits and meats.
History at its best. Lost in place , small streets and surprises at every corner - this is a history by itself.Very interesting day and night, either by the tour or wondering around

From two thousands to today. That's the oldest side of the city where we can see the roman walls, the rests of the Barcino city. Otherwise we can see the thousand years age when Barcelona was the most strong community aroun the Mediterranean sea in the middle age.

Really interesting and different. Loved the narrow streets and the quirky different shops on offer. Did not feel concerned although had read about pickpockets etc. We went 10 am through to 4 and felt quite safe

A maze of narrow streets!. This is a lovely area in which to wander. Lose yourself in the narrow streets and pathways, going between buildings that lean in towards each other! Find the Picasso Museum and church of Santa Maria del Mar here, as well as some of the most expensive restaurants in Barcelona, but also some great cheap ones too.

A very nice walk. Had a lovely stroll through this old and pretty area of the city. Really enjoyed the intimate courtyards inside some of the old buildings. If there's a door open, have a peek! Lots of shops, squares and tapas bars to poke around in.

Good for architecture and shopping. wonderful maze of small and large streets, many shops, many tourists, and cultural events throughout the year. We have seen the castellares (human pyramids), Sardana dancing, parades of giants, and various bands all in this district. Many of the shops are parts of chains and many are tourist joints, but many are also one of a kind boutiques with great clothes or oddities. Worthwhile part of any trip to Barcelona.

Loaded with old world charm!. We arrived during a wine and food festival. Score!!! Very fortunate. I would say the area in the courtyard where the food vendors were had roughly 10k people floating around. The food and wine was amazing. The setting was also truly spectacular, amongst all the old churches and historic buildings, shops, tapas joints, and narrow walk ways.This is the part where I tell you that you need to prepare yourself. I grew up in a city and thus was forced to develop "street smarts". Every city, regardless of where it is, has warts. For Barcelona, those warts come in the form of pick pockets. These folks are world class, I mean really really slick. I was tested several times. It is like a sport to these folks. Do yourself a favor and leave the big purses at home. Wear an inside wallet or other apparatus and you'll be fine. Keep your eyes up and be aware of your surroundings just like in every other city.Oh man!! The wine, the cheese, the tapas, particularly the octopus.......was fantastic! They KNOW how to make this stuff in Barcelona. The whole vibe of the place was nice, oozing with character and charm, and locals were super friendly. Just about everyone there spoke english, but take a little time to learn the basic dialect in Catalunya and the locals open up even more. Respect the culture and the velvet ropes will part! I will be back!!
Variety and interesting. The streets around the cathedral are great to explore. Shops and restaurants are open till late in all the small, narrow streets. Great.

Like a bohemiene traveler. This place is a labirinth (easy to walk, do not worry, you will not find the White rabbit, even if you could face some extra-ordinary character here) of historical littels treets where you can find almost everythingt. Eat and drink, shops and music, crafshops and freindship from all over the world. NOT fancy. Luckily us, I would add.

Amazing. Walking through the area i kept imagining dracula to come swooping down from the balconies! Very atmospheric area with amazingly intracate architecture. Just be very careful as this is a pick pocket/muggers hotspot, we saw an elderly couple near this area who had just been robbed at at one point myself and my husband felt wary about 2 young men who seemed to be taking a bit of interest in us. Make sure your bags/money are hidden and dont carry expensive jewellery / cameras/phones or lots of money, if you stay aware this is an amazing area to visit

Enjoy this incredible medieval city at different times of the day. Enjoy this incredible medieval city at different times of the day: early in the morning with delivery trucks and no tourists, at noon with plenty of sunshine and light, and by night: same places, completely different ambiences. Don´t forget to walk along “Carrer de Ferran and Carrer de Jaume I” streets between “Ramblas” and “Via Laietana” by night. Plenty of places to eat and shop.Mind it´s extremely easy to get lost, even with a map. Maps fool you into figuring long distances as in normal cities, but everything is extremely close by. Prepare beforehand (or book) some walking tours (there are some freely available on the internet), as they are designed to get you to many interesting but intricate and otherwise inaccessible places, like the “MUHBA Temple d'August” with its 9 meter high columns remnants of the ancient roman settlement of Barcino.
Barcelona is the place to visit. Amazing place loads to see and it's by the sea. Restaurants and bars everywhere, loads to see and do and only a short flight from Wales.
Good to wander through. This area is good to wander through, stopping at galleries and independent stores and having a coffee. Soak up the atmosphere in the square outside the cathedral. Just lovely.

Barri Gothic-an interesting place to stay in Barcelona. We came here for 4 days and are interested in a variety of activities. This is an old part of the city and had the absolute best food market on the weekend. It also is the original center of town, is very old and also has a bit of everything. Recommend the Tapas Tours with Alicia on the Urban Adventures site--wonderful. Took an enjoyable cooking course today in this area at the cooking school after a tour of the fish/food market--very cool. Saw the Flamenco dinner and performance at Cordobes which was very good. We also wet on a Gothic walking Tour. You might want to take the Off and On Bus Tour if you are unfamiliar with the place to plan your adventures a little. Enjoy

This is where to stroll. Much more fun to ramble down these narrow cobblestone streets than Las Rambles. As soon as you get away from Las Ramblas, the fun shopping and eating begins. Also, many photo ops with interesting ancient architecture.
Lovely. Recommend a good pair of walking shoes, there is so much to see and you will walk miles without evening knowing it.

Wandering the back streets is more interesting than La Rambla. Finding your way through the narrow twisting alleys and lanes is like a treasure hunt through mediaeval history and then landing in a square or at a notable sight. There are little shops bars and restaurants everywhere. Although described as the seafront to the top of Plaça de Catalunya, I treat the Barri Gòtic as the northern part above Carrer de Jaume I and the southern part as Cuitat Vella - although they are largely in the same style. Much prefer this to La Rambla.

Old World Charm. Perfect for wandering around the narrow streets with no particular place to go, although there are many historical buildings and squares to see on the way. Nice independent shops and cafes too if that's your thing

Must see !!. There is Carrer de Ferran shopping street, Barcelona Cathedral, Placa Reial and Placa Nova which is nice to visit.I have been on Sunday, there is a mercat (flea market ) on Placa Nova, many delicious food stalls to try.

Real Barcelona. Great area to explore, this area is a maze of small streets with an array of tapas bars, cafes and shops. well worth a half day explore!It can get busy at times, but with regards to pickpockets, well it's no worse than any other world city, just be aware.

Small scale low key streets and dining. A nice historic neighborhood which won't break the bank, the Gothic quarter is full of student types, dreads and skaters. This population gives the place a relaxed informal feel. If you are an architect ir planner, the little alleys and plazas make for fascinating spaces great for sketching and reconsidering urban form. Many little gems of restaurants exist in unexpected places, making it a fun neighborhood for exploration. Avoid the more obviously touristic places and go for the quirky dining establishments with menus off the beaten tapas path. If you want to be posh this isn't the place for you, but if you want a casual atmosphere you will find it here. A good mix of tourists and locals makes it a nice experience.

Beautiful Area!. We wandered from Las Ramblas into Gothic Quarter. Nice shops and beautiful architecture - wish we had more time to explore - will return. We enjoyed the area. Lots of beautiful buildings, shops and restaurants.

Best location to see sights on foot. We recommend the Old City, and especially El Born, for first time and/or short visits, because so many iconic sights are within a comfortable walk. You can reach the cathedral, Boqueria and Santa Caterina markets, Las Ramblas, Placa de Catalunya and even the marinas in 15 minutes or less. And there is an endless selection of eating and shopping places all around, many on the charming narrow streets.Be aware, though, that this area can be noisy and lively, so if you don't know the city, get some trustworthy advice about the precise location you might stay, especially in an apartment. The interior may look nice (they always do), but the street outside may be uncomfortable.

Historically interesting and atmospheric area. We did a sandemans walking tour in our first visit to the gothic quarter. Excellent way to learn all about this area. Great little eateries and patisseries all around.
Nice for wandering.. . ..with plenty of eating and drinking opportunities. Some interesting architecture. Great for trying different tapas and generally not expensive.

don't get lost. A warren of Alley ways full of shops,bars and restaurants. It gets very busy with both tourists and pickpockets so be careful. If you can stop and look up, the architecture is stunning. Visit both day and night to appreciate the atmosphere

Worth visiting. Gothic Quarter is the oldest area of Barcelona. It's narrow streets with bars, shops, restaurants and cathedral are main attraction for tourists. All old buildings have been preserved beautifully. Worth spending 2/3 hours.

A pleasant walk through Old Barcelona. Access to the Barri Gotic is very simple as the area is directly accessible from Las Ramblas. In this area there are narrow but well paved streets (the preexisting cobblestones have been replaced by much friendlier paving) containing some really lovely boutiques for those interested in shopping, some traditional eateries. It is fun to just wander around the narrow streets and see what pops up around the next corner
Atmospheric. Walkable, atmospheric, some pretty stone architecture around. Tiny streets, larger squares, some shopping.
So glad we stayed here. Every turn is a postcard.. Stayed at The Mercer (wonderful) for my 50th. Never wanted to leave the neighborhood. So unique and charming, great food.
Fun place to walk and shop. We really enjoyed just walking through the narrow streets, taking photos, and browsing in interesting little shops. Fun place.

Stepping back in time. Just a few blocks from Las Ramblas is the oldest area of Barcelona. Walking through the narrow streets takes you back to Roman times. Don't miss viewing the Gothic cathedral and cloisters, the remains of the old city walls, stores and restaurants.

Barrowload of culture. With narrow streets and high buildings the Gothic quarter is a must do and see on a visit to Barcelona. Lots of bars, quaint shop with artesan goods, churches everywhere and most importantly and even at night it feels perfectly safe.

Touristic but enjoyable. Gotico is nice to visit. there are great bars, shops, markets and places to eat. However you have to know them, to not fall for the numerous tourist traps. On the whole very enjoyable.
Lovely building with great character. The Gothic Quarter is lovely, all the building have been perserved beautifully, keeping the original character. Nice stroll down the avenues

Barcelona's Gothic district was fabulous. Barcelona Cathedral, narrow pedestrian streets and good restaurants make this area a must see. After eating Tappas at Cir e Cle we made our way to the Catherdral and stumbled upon their Food and Wine Festival. This was a very fun and tasty experience as you could imagine. From there we walked to the piazza square. The architecture is spectacular everywhere you look. You will also find street performers with amazing talent. There is something to behold around every corner.
Pleasant neighbourhood. Enjoyed the stroll down the narrow streets loaded with restaurants, bars, shops, people.. nice atmosphere.

Interesting neighbourhood.... The gothic quarter is an interesting place with all sorts of different shops, ethnic restauants and grocery stores. Whilst certain parts of the quarter were definitely very charming, I would rank it as below average in terms of priority if you are pressed for time in Barcelona like I was. In the evening, the neighbourhood also appears to become a little bit seedy, so I would suggest travelling in groups.

Love this area!. To me, this is the best part of Barcelona, where you get a real feel for the old town. The architecture is amazing, love discovering things through the little streets. I have been to Barcelona many times, but discover something new every time I walk through this area. When you look up, you always find new details that you had not noticed before! Just like there are always new little shops, tapas bars, and all kinds of weird and wonderful people going about their daily lives.

"A must to visit". We loved the gothic architecture and buildings throughout this area which we had seen a postcard of that friends sent us a couple of years ago - so pleased we made a point to visit.

chocolate museum. €5 entrance fee which is a bar dark chocolate with a bar code, you watch chocolate carving, making modelling good for hot chocolate history of chocolate and no queses just in princess street off of bus route red.

Lovely old town. walking round the old town is a great experience, the tight alleyways and small shops are a great way to discover things. There are lots of hidden churches and courtyards that are orth sticking your head into. Its not too busy and is a good way lose a few hours.
dont visit if you dont have enough time. not something special.narrow beautifull streets but if you are visiting barchelona for a day or two, prefer to see casa batllio and sagrada familia

Endless small shops and interesting small streets. You can spend hours here pottering about. Great variety from shoe shops, Spanishtouristy shops, small cafes. A bit crowded so choose your time. Best not on Sunday's.

A must-see on your trip to Barcelona. This area of the city includes incredible shopping, the Cathedral, significant historical sites, and Las Ramblas, a wide sidewalk filled with the citizens of the world, numerous souvenir booths and many flower booths with an intriguing variety of blooms, seeds and bulbs. Get out there and stroll!

Bari Gotic - the soul of Barcelona. All the guidebooks tour the Ramlbas in Barcelona as the first most site to see. We enjoyed the passiagatta especially the amazing 19th architecture and the Boqueria (a review coming later). But the Bari Gotic, with its wonderful labyrinthine alleys is the heart and soul of the city. Spend a couple of hours wandering through, be willing to get lost.

history from roman times and gothic. the Streets are narrow, the walk is nice, the archeological and history museum, cathedral with cloister , roman walls and tower, pastry shops and boutiques. easy to get lost, get a good map

Fantastic vibrant area. Part of the old city the gothic quarter is a. Wonderful maze of streets and squares that are great fun to explore
Generally pretty crowded at most times of the day there is a wide variety of shops and historical sites to visit

Segway tours. We went through the Gothic Quarter in Segways, it was lots of fun,mans to see all the old churches and buildings. So much to see. It was also the Merce Festival, so we saw all the giantCharacters out in the square . We missed the human towers, though, that was a pity.

Get Rick Steves and do his walking tour. What a great walking tour Rick Steves has in his Barcelona book...Hidden gems all along, and the Roman Gates, the Basilica and the shops are all wonderful.
Find lunch along the way.

Maybe the Best Old Town. You could spend a month here getting lost - and that would e well worth your time. This part of Barcelona is a never ending series of streets and alleys populated with interesting shops, wine bars, patisseries, restaurants and workshops. I and my wife got lost here several times -- and enjoyed every moment - looking for the Synagogue, and then the Shoe Museum, then a place to eat. Unlike centros in other cities, this old city is relatively clean and the shops unique with goods not found elsewhere. We stopped for wine and snack, for espresso and a pastry, looked at things to buy that we did not and found this a wonderful place to be busy and chill out at the same time. That said, if you are not a walker, and want to take a peek, you can cut over from one of the larger avenues and spend but a few minutes seeing what this part of Barcelona looks like.

This is a place to just wander. While Las Ramblas is great for people watching, the Gothic Quarter is for wandering around the "old" section of Barcelona. This area is full of interesting streets, shops, restaurants and an old church that is worth making a visit (its free). You will find this area just off the lower end of Las Ramblas, (the end by the Columbus statue). Its a great area to just wander and get lost. Its not so big that you will likely get hopelessly lost, just ask for directions if needed and you'll easily get back to where you can find yourself.

Lovely to walk through. Enjoyed a nice walk, but if you buy something check your chit and your change. We experienced this in more than one establishment, not only here but all over Barcelona.It is a shame, this wonderful city deserves better
Trendy Place. This neighbourhood offers everything... nice shops, restaurants, museums and interesting streets to stroll
A city full of life. Barcelona is a colorful, vivid, and vibrant city, so full of life it is worth visiting time and time again.

Unsafe but wonderful. Our mobile got stolen here. It was a high end phone and we could never recover from that instance throughout our trip. But still I should not give a partial review because of that incident. The old town is full of history, it can be a good location for morning and night photography. If possible take a walking tour. It's beautiful and will definitely leave an impression on you.

Not to be missed. This has to be one of the special places in Barcelona. I would rate it above Las Ramblas. The little alley ways, shops, squares, restaurants. Gosh I could go on. Was only in Barcelona 2 1/2 days but crammed a lot into that time. Go have a wander around you will enjoy.
Awesome. . This place is a must if you're going to Barcelona. Beautiful streets and cafes everywhere. Plenty of great architecture and shopping!

fascinating. went on a walking tour for 2 hours which was excellent and gave us information we would never have known. Amazing place and so unlike anything I'd seen. Book through tourist information or online but in advance as busy.
Great street walking.. You just have to let yourself get lost (but have a map for when you're ready to get out). There are lots of great shops, restaurants, cafes, and bars.
Great Walking and Exploration. So many restaurants and shops - this is a great place to just wander around. We had a great time discovering all the little shops and some very wonderful food.

Wonderful. Wonderful. Wonderful. . When you hit Barcelona, head straight for Las Ramblas. Then take the first turn off for the Gothic Quarter & don't even look back. Stunning architecture, wonderful atmosphere. Fabulous little bars, restaurants and shops and a rabbit warren of streets for you to lose yourself in. Probably the most relaxed, bohemian, interesting & captivating area I have ever had the pleasure to spend time in. We absolutely loved it. i WILL return.
Lovely area. I love Gothic Quarter, really enjoyed walking along the small street and getting lost in them. Great restaurants :)

Not to be missed!!. This neighborhood is what makes BCN special. The ancient apartment buildings with laundry hanging from balconies, cramped shops and cafés, narrow winding streets, hidden squares, cathedrals, museums, markets, open squares...if you only go to one area in BCN--this would be it. Wandering through and getting lost in the maze was such an amazing treat. There is a great energy in this neighborhood. We went back again and again. So. Much. Fun.

Gothic Quarter always my favorite area in Barcelona. Full of surprises, narrow enchanted streets that open into plazas. It takes you back in time. I would say it is after Sagrada Familia next thing you must see and walk while visiting Barcelona.

Favorite Part of the City!. Gothic Quarter is great! Did a walking tour (highly recommend) through the Barcelona Tourism office to get our bearings and learn about the amazing history of this area. So much to see here. The Cathedral is beautiful. Right off of the Ramblas. Boqueria Food market also in the nearby area.

wow. Really Great! This place is like a maze. It feels like at every corner you will discover something new. It is built for Tourists. The area is very clean and there is alot of shopping and restaurants which is great. The feeling of being in the gothic area is at times like a movie or ancient europe. Very charming in every way.
The heart of BCN. Fantastic.. Narrow streets, beautiful buildings, shops, restaurants... Very special!! Even with a kid it is entertainig... Be prepared for a huge crowd.
Fascinating area. I loved wandering around the narrow winding streets here, window shopping in the small independent shops and soaking up the atmosphere.
Old town squares. Gothic Quarter or "Barri Gotic" is example of seaside town architecture. Beautiful squares, cathedral, narrow streets,...One of "mus see" in Barcelona
Very charming!. You need to visit this charming area. Many nice places to sit down for a good meal. Lovely atmosphere.
Spent three days just exploring. Historic buildings, shops, bars, restaurants, this has the lot ... and lots of them. Just wander round and you'll have a great day.
Great old town area. Lots of old buildings, little shops and cafes. And the harbour nearby.Fantastic atmosphere. You can easily spend a whole day in this area and not see everything.
Wonderful, historic, walkable Barri Gotic. The Barri Gottic neighborhood is walkable, accessible, handy to most major sites, full of great restaurants.
Striking mixture of gothic architecture. Includes a wonderful cathedral in classic gothic style, as opposed to the Sagrada Familia, lots of bistros and little shops

Fascinating Warren of Sites and Shops. Barri Gotic, the old, formerly walled city of Barcelona is a warren of small streets heading off at odd angles anchored by the main cathedral. It is full of shops, bars, restaurants and historic sites and a great place to wander through or be lost in.

Go on a walking tour, massive amount of history, architecture and info to miss otherwise!. The day we set out on our cruise, we had 1/2 a day left in Barcelona, so we hiked down to Plaça de Sant Jaume and joined a tour. One note of caution, we were told the tour started in Placa de Catalunya, and it didn't! The information office is there, but the tour started in St. Jaume. Nice walk down Las Rambla tho! Very good guide, a bit hard to hear tho at times but a very popular (crowded!) place. Another note of caution, there are some churches in Spain who still enforce a dress code, i.e., no short shorts and shoulders covered! Our daughters had to wait outside! If you like history and architecture, this is for you.
really interesting and safe. Enjoyed time visiting this area with my son and we both felt safe but found it difficult to match roads to maps
Just stroll around and enjoy. Very colorful bario- lots to do - the market , stores, restaurants , people -especially on Sunday's when most of the places are closed

Good Place to Visit. The Gothic Quarter has the Cathedral, which is a must see. It also has very good museums like the Frederic Mares, which is very interesting and also a must see. The narrow streets have many interesting stores.
Lots of see. Great area to visit, Lots of different shops, cafes & restaurants, Great atmosphere & locals are welcoming. Lots of great architecture to see
Loved it. Gorgeous narrow streets. Loads of atmosphere.. endless old cafes and shops. Shame aboout all the graffiti.

Beautiful! Absolute must see . Beautiful quarter that gives you the proper atmosphere of a medieval time. Many small local shops and even though it is popular it is not over crowded with tourists like other places!
Lose yourself . We went looking for the Romans ruins but found so much more. This place is a complete labyrinth of streets and places to visit and pretty much all free. Wish we had more time

Beautiful historic buildings with crooked streets. I read in trip advisor reviews that the crooked streets of the Gothic Quarter were a must. I loved the historic architecture and the character of the neighborhood. There were many shops and restaurants. It also was right next to Las Ramblas
The best part of the city.. For us it was the most atmospheric, interesting and beautiful part of the city. But not the best to sleep in - noisy.
Beautiful buildings. We visited on a Sunday and it was extremely busy but loved the buildings and alleyways. We had planned to go back but there was so much else to see we didn't make it!

Couldn't enjoy myself . Maybe due to the timing, however I couldn't enjoy my walk around the gothic quarter. We did go on a Saturday so I'm unsure whether this had anything to do with my experience. Although the gothic quarter does have some beautiful things to look at and it is a lot better than la rambla. I would recommend going at a less busier time, if I go back to Barcelona I would definitely try it again.

Gothic Quarter. Barri Gotic, is the old town centre of Barcelona, many of the buildings date from the medieval times, some even from a Roman settlement. It is an Pedestrian only area, it is like a labyrinthine, with many small streets opening out onto squares. Look out for the lovely Bridge Carrer Del Bisbe. You can spend a bit of time at this area lots to see and plenty snack stops. We stopped here with the red route on the tourist bus.Tip if visiting on a Monday the museums are closed.
Barri Gotic Barcelona. A great area to walk around in. This was the old Jewish quarter before the inquisition. Don't miss visiting.

Get lost!. Wander through here and you are bound to get lost. Then the fun really happens. Around this corner will be an amazing tapas bar, around that corner is a shop specializing in hand crafted soaps. It is just an amazing place to wonder through.
nice, relaxing, great place to stay. stayed there last week. would recomend as very relaxing, clean, friendly location with everything close - tourist attractions, restaurants, port.
interesting. Great neighbourhood!! We would highly recommend staying in this area or at least wandering around it for a few hours.
Great to walk around this area. Walking around, going in to some of the historical monuments and museums, eating tapas and other local delicacies...very enjoyable
Beautiful . Worth a visit to this part of the city..roads are narrow but lovely place to have a stroll around.......

Cool architecture, art and shops. A fascinating part of Barcelona, stretching from the Arc de Triomf to Las Ramblas. There's a fascinating debate about the architecture of the area, and the street art represents a war between artists and politicians. The shops are also well worth exploring, a little off the beaten path and a little offbeat, too.

Medival magic. This area is the oldest in Barcelona. We decided to stay in the Gothic Quarter and nailed it. If you want to feel the great vibe the locals enjoy this is where to be. The narrow streets with tiny supermarkets and cafes filled with friendly locals enjoying life. It is a magical wonderful area that makes you feel like you've stepped back in time. It is very well lit at night, safe and clean. There is graffiti on the roll up doors of the shops but none on the buildings. Once the roll up doors are open graffiti is gone. From this area you can walk to the beach, La Rambles, Sagrada Familia and up to the Garcia area. Great central area to explore this great city.
best place to have coffe. grate time to wonder around no real target just walking looking eating and having lots of sangaris and coffe

Amazing experience!. Walking up and down through narrow lanes in Gothic Quarter is an amazing experience reminds me of Harry Porter.However, watch out those guys who distributing brochures and selling toys. They are professional pickpockets.

Better than La Rambla. A very cool area to get lost in. We spent a day wandering. Unfortunately it was a Sunday and most of the shops were closed.It is a nice alternative to La Rambla with eclectic shops.

The place keeps on giving!. The gothic quarter is right up my street! It's a combination of bustling main thoroughfares, narrow streets and squares and every corner turned reveals fresh surprises. There's artisans'workshops, galleries, shops selling tat, museums, more churches than you can shake a stick at and enough cafes and bars to see you through the day.The diversity of architectural styles is amazing and it all fits together so well. The area is mainly flat and in challenging for those who find walking challenging and there's plenty of bicycles to hire for those who want to speed through though you're likely to miss things if you do.I'm already planning a return visit!

A must see area of Barcelona. We walked this area with a free local walking tour which met up and left from Plaza Catalunya.(not really free because you should give the tour guide a tip at the end!) It is like a rabbit warren, so would highly recommend seeing it via a tour as you don't get lost with them. They also give you lots of history on the area. Our tour was 3 hours long which flew past - so make sure you go to the toilet before you leave! If you want to return to the area afterwards, which I did, for a longer look, at least you might have a better idea of land marks to go by.
Great place to walk. We enjoyed walking around the area, happening on shops and eateries. It is not supposed to be as safe at night, but was perfectly fine during the daytime, early evening.
In my opinion, the best of Barcelona. It's fantastic just to walk arround and get lost in the tiny streets of the Gothic quarter. Very enjoyable.
Must see.. No visit to Barcelona would be complete without a walk thru the Gothic Quarter with its narrow streets full of restaurants and shops. Takes you back in time.
Great for strolling. Nice median for walking Las Rambles. All the upscale stores but almost all available in the USA. Great architecture and plenty of spots to stop for a coffee or cava.

One of the highlights of Barcelona. My wife was able to see much more of the city than I via Hop on Hop off tours (I had business). We had the opportunity to walk around this area and if is fabulous - so much to explore. The cathedral was a highlight as is the many alley ways and cafes

Gothic Architecture with Modern Day facilities. Its is an "All You Can Walk" type of deal. You walk around through narrow cobblestone streets viewing the buildings that are centuries old. It is like a labyrinth, you may get lost but Google map rocks! you will find a way out. Its a town with old cathedrals and churches worth visiting. You may encounter street artists displaying their talent. Most of them are musicians but we did catch a fantastic puppet show.This old town is well equipped with modern day shopping boutiques, restaurants and tapas bars. Its a great place to hang out with friends or the special someone.

Beautuful. We had a nice sunny day in Barcelona and after we went down la rambla we decided to go up to placa cataluna on barii gothic and it was really nice. The big church is amazing actually all the arhitecture it's beautiful ..at one point I didn't know were I am but it was fine because everything it's beautiful

Full of atmosphere. We stayed in this area and would definitely go back. It's a very central place to stay and full of life. You can walk around in the hub bub of it all and then find a quiet little square and relax over a glass of wine and some tapas watching the world go by.Mmmmm, lovely!

Just take a walk. If you have any device with GPS - just walk around the narrow streets and get yourself lost a little.When you feel done, just look at your location and find the way home. The whole quarter is beautiful and i don;t think you need route, just explore it.
Beautiful area. Was very impressed by all of the architecture in this area. A sight to be seen. Beautiful building and street shops.
Really cool !. Great little cobblestoned alleys and streets to wander through. Be careful you don't get lost !Tapas everywhere. Cute boutique shopping.

Worth It. The Gothic Quarter is worth it if you enjoy architecture. It can be crowded so watch your bags and pockets! Be sure to dress appropriately (knee-length pant/dress/skirt, shoulders covered) if you want to take a peak inside any of the churches in the area! Also, be wary of anyone selling on the streets in this area...I saw a man shamelessly selling fans that he had picked out of a garbage can.

Wonderful afternoon here. Loved the gothic quarter - architecture beautiful and you can just spend hours wandering around the narrow streets ( stopping for a beer and tapas of course). Lots of lovely shops too - really glad we took time to just explore this beautiful area
Wonderful place. Had a wonderful time wandering around, only here for a short stay...but loved it all had a great vibe...
Throw away the map. Seriously just get lost and wander about enjoying all the atmosphere of this medieval part of the city

Great place to walk and shop and look at the Architecture. WE walked about 1/2 hour before reaching the old Gothic area and it didn't disappoint. The shopping along the way repeats a lot of what you see in the Las Ramblas areas but fun to window shop. Visited several churches as well . Love the old architecture which has been so well preserved.

Charming. We walked around the gothic quarter in the early evening. We stumbled on a free guitar concert in a 14th century church that was not in any of the guidebooks, St. Just, and we thought it was wonderful.
Great area to wander. Lots of little shops and restaurants. It's very maze-like so if you find someplace you'd like to go back to make sure to leave a breadcrumb trail.
So cosy. We took a lot of strolls around the Barri Gótics since we lived right near for a week and found many small and cosy alleys to take in the atmosphere.

Get lost in the Gothic. The Gothic quarter can get very crowded at times but it is still worth dealing with the crowds to see. You can still find some amazing squares with wonderful street musicians in the evening. You need to be willing to walk and loose yourself to find that special spot.

My favorite place to get lost. This neighbourhood is amazing, narrow old streets sometimes dirty but full of character. Some of the streets and squares are full of history, so don't miss out. It's really touristy so it's full of nice shops and yummy stuff but I still love to stroll around.
so many shops to see. walking around checking out all the different kinds of shops was a day trip in itself. you get a stiff neck just looking up at all the architecture it's amazing.
Chic epitomized. The absolutely chicest city in Espana,if not Europa as a whole-forget Paris or Milan. Beautiful people , architecture,etc.
Amazing Area. Popular tourist area, very busy with La Rambla on its border and the amazing La Bocqueria Market, to explore.

Place of wander. Loose yourself for hours wondering through all the narrow streets and alleyways in this historic quarter of the Bari Gothic and you won't be disappointed. No shortage of options from bars, cafés, high street shops, boutique shops and museums to tattoo parlours. Really has it all with a great atmosphere.

Great place for a leisurely stroll. Fascinating area with narrow streets, great architecture, and lots of quirky little shops, restaurants and ice cream sellers. Allow a couple of hours for a relaxing stroll around.

Roam the streets and get lost in the wonder of shops & people.. Stay at the Catalonia hotel in the middle of the area. What a treat. Everywhere we walked was a delight of seeing something new & different. Shops & eating while strolling the alleys. Stop & enjoy - do not be in a rush ! A wonderful city from every district .

Worth a visit. A warren of streets but well worth exploring.It was really clean and we felt safe. Restaurants all appealing and not overpriced.Good selection of shops and art galleries. Enjoy the evening ambience.

As good as it gets. I've been fortunate to have visited (or revisited) many of the major European cities in the past five years. I can't think of any where such a small area packs in so many attractions. Athens comes to mind, but really things of interest are spread over a larger area as they are in Amsterdam, Lisbon, London and Paris to name a few. If you are spending more than one whole day in Barcelona then allow at least one day here and you won't run out of things to see,You'll need either a good large scale map (say 10,000:1) or have a data connection for Google Maps or similar. I was here every day for five days and I found I could still get totally turned around by the labyrinth of tiny alleys and squares. That's part of the fun but of course if you do get lost then often you can't see the sun to get your bearings so it can be frustrating.One way to start is with the Barcelona Historical Museum which gives you a (mostly) underground tour of the original Roman town and some of the early churches. The Barcelona Cathedral with its geese and the columns that remind you of the Sagre Familia would be a must-see. At meal times be sure to shop around as prices vary greatly and the quality of the food is generally good so comparing a few places can easily save you ten euros per person (or more).The Picasso Museum is just to the north of the Jaume I metro station so while technically not in the Gothic Quarter its only a few steps away.

Hub of activity. great place for food -especially the small alleys- and small buys/souvenirs. Keep hold of your valuables though. Good place to have a stroll after dinner or during the day for a gelato. It is always packed with people.
Great area. Nice area for restaurants, bars and shops. Worth a stroll around the streets. Can get very busy in the evening.
Great area. Less touristy and full of great bars and cafes. Keep an eye on personal belongings. We didn't feel threatened at any time and we had an apartment right in the middle.

Every nook is an adventure waiting to happen!. Barcelona is so grid orientated which is wonderful but then to come upon a higgledy piggledy area is fun too. You can lose yourself here but will always find something enjoyable. I love it. It has a character of its own. You need a day to explore or just do bite sized chunks.........fall into a tapas bar....enjoy....wander around....visit churches, picasso museum etc. Probably best not to have a itinary for this area as if you make it to site no 1 on your list it will be a miracle!!! Its just so walkable with friendly people everywhere.

Best walk. You would love to have a walk in the old city area ... Nice views and old designed buildings nice n friendly people ... It's like typical old Europe... To me I enjoyed have a walk tour there ... Just relaxing and passionate

Smaller than I expected, but still cool. The Gothic Quarter was a cool neighborhood to walk through, but was smaller than I expected. It's cool to walk through all the little streets and alleyways, but my friend and I found better shopping and eating opportunities elsewhere.
Great place to shop!. I love this place. Loads of unique and specialist shops, handy for souvenir shopping. You can get lost for hours browsing all the shops down the little alleys.

Cafes and Bars every few corners with great food. Charming old world feel and very clean and everyone was very friendly. Hard to choose which place to stop at. As vegegetarians there was a lots of choice as everywhere provided something. At every turn there was a photo opportunity of Barcelonianan life. Really easy to get to and felt safe all the time

Barcelona's history from the start... This combination of tall buildings and narrow ones is the heart and beginning of Barcelona. This is the old neighborhood were all the working class, guilds, and general population use to live within the city walls. The city was built as a Roman colony back in the beginning and developed inside these walls during the Middle Ages until times changed and it was forced to expand beyond the walls. The Gothic quarter is full of specialty craft stores, small restaurants (the good ones), and small squares close to Sta. Maria del Mar and other important gathering points. I guarantee that you will be coming back to it during your walks hoping to find something new. You have not visited Barcelona unless you spend some time here.

A must tour area, the city tour bus stops in the centre of the Gothic Quarter, so much to see and do ,. Great starting off spot, the city tour bus stops right in the heart of the Gothic Quarter, great for shopping, sight seeing, lots of little bars and cafes, it was October, we felt perfectly safe just wandering around, entry to the cathedral is free and spectacular, you will need a goo 4 hours to see most things, at night time the atmosphere is electric
Very interesting. This is a must to go to in Barcelona - interesting history and buildings - never seen anything like it. Need good comfortable shoes as the pavements are quite uneven and cobbled

Lovely. Very interesting place. If you like architecture and small boutique shops this is a nice place to get lost in. We wandered around not really minding where we were going and found plenty of things to interest us.

Fun, lively and interesting. Had a great time wondering around this neighborhood, there are many tourists but it doesn't detract to its beauty. Amble down towards the seaside and enjoy the fantastic views

4Days of waking in Barcelona. So much to see here you never go down the same red twice ,be prepared for a stiff neck as you will be constantly looking up .Lots of interesting little shops bars and coffee shops . just make sure you book your tickets to the Piccasso Gallery on line to avoid disappointment also it's closed on Mondays .Dont forget to do the cable car from the beach to Mont Juc.

A Must See. Can't believe that I didn't visit here my first two trips to Barcelona. From the handcrafted artisans to the marvelousness and delicious eating venues to street performers and quant cobbled streets, it's a beautiful district. So much to see and do.

European Celebration. So much to see this this part of Barcelona. Plenty of great architecture, shops, restaurants and cafes. At night things really come alive with the lighting of the beautiful Gothic Cathedral and other ornate buildings. During our visit, we saw some free night concerts including the Barcelona Symphony Orchestra playing in front of the light up Gothic Cathedral. It seemed that the whole of Barcelona was in a festive mode which makes me wonder if that happens all the time or were we just lucky to be there in mid-September? When we go back we definitely with return to this part of the city to spend more time discovering the winding alleys and streets.
Less touristy. We spent part of a day wandering around the Gothic Quarter, which had delightful narrow streets, little squares and great cafes.
Really beautiful. This is the old part of town, just off the Ramblas. This is the real Barcelona and worth the effort to walk around this area.

wonderful wandering afforded. I really enjoyed simply walking around the Gothic Quarter with no particular destination -- kept coming across wonderful squares with cafes and musicians, and really interesting architecture

Make sure you set aside enough time to have a relaxing walk around here. The area is quite pretty with a lot happening. Many stores and restaurants. We found a great little tapas place that was reasonably priced. I am in awe of how the young man serving us could speak to me in flawless, fluent English, after just speaking Spanish to the person ahead of me, then start speaking French rapidly to the women in line after me.
Time Traveler. Wandering the narrow winding streets of the Gothic Quarter was like stepping back in time. Best done early before the streets become over crowded.

Take the Free Walking Tour with Runner Bean. The gothic quarter is a must-see in Barcelona and it was greatly enhanced by our fabulous Runner Bean guide who provides a free walking tour. We tipped heavily as that is how they make their money. It is well worth it as they provide a lot of information in a very entertaining fashion.
Back in time. This is only good if you enjoy old cobbled narrow labyrinth like streets, old churchs and small bespoke shops.

Wander. Just give your time to wander through the streets. Lots of buskers on different corners. A few little markets along the way. Art structures occupying the different plaza's and just beautiful old world architecture to enjoy. Churches to visit and of course many restaurants and bars along the way

Nice to Walk Through. We took a walk through the area there are many small shops and cafes plus some nice old buildings. It does attract the crowds but you have to expect this. Great place for a morning coffee and breakfast.

A Must See in Barcelona.. First of all I will say get a good street map. I used one of the information kiosks on Catalunya square. This is the Old Town. Although the buildings seem large and the traffic busy there is a lot to see here. The top end around the square is good for designer shopping. You can walk all the way to the sea front on the Ramblas. Lots of side streets and alleyways can be explored. There are rooftop restaurants and even aroad where all the Irish bars are. At night the streets light up. There are market stalls and a feeling of good holiday atmosphere.It is the area to look at the old Architecture. Just off Catalunya square you can get a bus to the seaside resort of Sitges. This cost 4 euros each way and is about 40 mins. ride. Well worth a day out. I repeat, a street map helps to point out the landmarks. You could just stroll up and down the Ramblas and enjoy what you find.

The Barcelona Gothic district. Stayed at the NH hotel centro , right in the heart of the Gothic district. A definite walking paradise. We were just steps from the Barcelona Cathedral . Take the lift up into one of the towers for a fantastic view of the city and roof tops . Visit the Picasso Museum and see how Picasso's art evolved in a beautiful building . The Picasso Museum is free on the first Monday of the month.The streets are narrow and extremely charming , filled with tiny shops and great restaurants. Visit the Barcelona Arc D' Triumph on a broad boulevard lined with period street lights. Don't forget the Rambla a very wide street with a boulevard in the center , it becomes teeming with people all day long. We had the best Vietnamese food in the Gothic and fabulous Local food at reasonable prices. People are very friendly . I look forward to another visit. BUT beware Barcelona has a huge pickpocket criminal element , my traveling companion was a victim at the subway station. These are professional thieves who prey on tourists.
Amazing historical area. Impressive old buildings, nice small shops, historical sites, gorgeous places - you should go there for a walk, definitely.

Historically very intresting. We took a walking tour in the Gothic Quarter and learned a lot about the history of Barcelona as well as of Spain. The Qurter is also a very bust area with many little shops and restaurants. Always busy with people day and night.

Highly interesting for walks. This area is not to be missed in any visit to Barcelona. The narrow streets, shops, and the architecture are very interesting. We spent hours simply walking along and taking it all in. There are lots of spots to stop for coffee or lunch and take in the atmosphere.

This area has to be included in a trip to Barcelona. Very interesting and very photogenic part of Barcelona to wander around and is really a must to pick up the atmosphere of Barcelona and an insight to how things were and are today. A great place to wander

very romantic area near the parlament park. very romantic area near the parlament park, every street is deafrent from each other lots of specials stores close to the center (10 minutes walking) & quiet area.

Beautiful architecture. Great area to just wander around and view the beautiful surroindings. Many great buildings and sights to wander around. For those with money burning in their pockets, its a great place to shop wiith independent and chain stores alike.

The spirit of of Barcelona. Once in Barcelona, get out of the hotel and just walk in this district. Enjoy the beauty, the architecture, history. It doesn't matter where you go, you will love every step and every building there. No excursion or guided tour or hop on hop off will give you the pleasure you get when you just walk. Guided tours can be very good but they force you to see the city the way they see it. Try to get your own feel - you will not regret it
Amazing Architecture!. our hotel was in the Gothic Qtr. The architecture and history of the buildings was amazing. It was not difficult to get around. recommend walking vs driving.

Awesome! . We loved the Gothic Quarter best of all I think. So many little narrow streets and paths. Around every corner, a new find of a bistro, sweet shoppe or gift store. I loved coming across 3 young men in a little courtyard singing opera. Amazing! !! I'm sure we could go back there and discover more gems in this beautiful, old section of Barcelona.

A Wonderful Way to Spend an Afternoon. We were in Barcelona for a week and tried to experience the city, mostly by foot. We spent a lazy afternoon walking around the Gothic Quarter which not only has some wonderful history, the very old architecture combined with some very new and local artist boutiques were both a wonderful contrast and allowed you to truly get a good feel of the city and the people who reside there. There are also ample sidewalk cafes where you can stop for a coffee, sangria and tapas of your choice. Even on a drizzly day, this area has so much energy and is so compact it's well worth a few hours of getting lost and wandering around.

great place to wander. the Gothic Quarter is a great place to wander without an itinerary--there is something surprising around every quarter including shops, foods and of course lots of history. That being said, on our last day we hired a guide for a 3 hour tour and realized how much we missed on our own. Both types of experiences are worth it--it is a place to visit more than once.

Love it!. I could wander around the gothic quarter all day - so atmospheric and full of history - remember to look up and not miss the beautiful balconys and buildings! Reminds me of edinburgh old town alleyways and closes. Lots of interesting street performers and qurky shops
Lovely place to wander round. Lots of nice cafe and as you wander round it is surprising what you come across!! Don't miss the Cathedral and the Basilica.

Hours of fun just wandering the streets of Barri Gotic. I was told it was going to be good and it didnt dissapoint. I spent a whole day just checking out shops, cafes and architecture. Best place to get lost in Barca.
Barri Gothic Walking Tour. An interesting section of Barcelona. Some places a bit difficult to locate just using the guide book.

Must go for Barcelona . Even if you have only one day in Barcelona, this is one of those places that you must visit to see the essence of its history, architecture, and its beautiful old churches. Maria del Pi, MUHBA, Plaça Sant Jaume, and the magnificent Catedral de Barcelona are all in this area. Little windy narrow pathways in between beautiful old buildings are breathtaking. Then they will suddenly just open up to a grand Plaza, with people chilling, children running around, musicians playing Spanish guitar, breeze and romantic melodies just washed over you. I love this place and will definitely return if I ever get to go back to Barcelona. Plus it's adjacent to El Born, with lots of great coffee shops restaurants and museums. You can probably cover both districts on the same day.
Gothic quarter. Wonderful narrow streets to lose yourself in ( not literally!). Lots of surprises round every corner. Beautiful churches and open squares.
The Heart of Barcelona. If Barcelona is a truly unique city . Its special grandeur comes primarily from this quarter. Not to miss .

Jumping back in time. How not to spend an afternoon or an evening there. It's beautiful and full of treasures to suit everyone's taste. We spent an hour in a candle shop just selecting our future christmas gift and this was the very first shop we saw.

A great place to spend a couple of days.. This is definitely the touristy part of town but worth a couple of days here. The streets are the typical European small, winding streets that you see in post cards. You can definitely wander through the streets for a couple of days. Visit a couple of churches but check the opening and closing times just to be sure. If you see a tapas restaurant or a bar you want to revisit, either take a pic or write down the location because with the winding streets you won't find it again. I would suggest walking a little bit and then finding a spot for a bite and a drink. Wander some more and repeat.

Beautiful area. Simplest way to see this area if you have limited time is to take a self guided walking tour. Easy to follow and you MUST visit the cathedral. Go in the afternoon when the crowds are lower

A must when visiting Barcelona. This is the heart of the old city and the core of the tourist area. It is interesting to just stroll the small streets and alleys and absorb the atmosphere. While busy during the day, it's even busier at night when everyone comes out to eat, drink, party and be seen. Many great sights and restaurants.

No trip to Barcelona is complete without seeing the Gothic Quarter!. We spent a very good part of five days just walking this section of town.The place is a warren not to be missed. There are great restaurants and shops throughout, also churches and museums. We went to see the Picasso exhibit, the Miro exhibit (in another part of town) and then stumbled onto the 4 Cats, a hangout of Picasso and his friends.

Gothic Quarter of Barcelona walking, shopping, dining experiences. Amazing sites to see, wonderful shopping in small boutiques. loved Uno 50 jewelry. the bake shop of Unbo is worth just looking at even if you don't sample the goods. Many amazing cafes to grab a Tapas and Sangria. not to mention the amazing architecture to admire in all directions.
Beautiful. Lovely area of the city which joins the Born district which is equally as nice. Lots of little streets and lovely architecture mixed with bars, restaurants, markets and galleries.
Great. Great to wander round. Each time I visit I find somewhere different. Narrow streets full of quirky shops and restaurants

narrow streets, don't miss chocholate museum. I was very surprised with what we found in this interesting corner of the town, many historical sights, nice street coffe bars, street artists on saturday, definitely a place to visit

Beautiful old gothic neighbourhood. Loved this part of Barcelona. I wandered around the alley ways exploring the tiny shops and tapas bars, sipping wine, taking pictures. There are gorgeous churches and arch ways, lots of history to be found. I recommend it early morning, the light of the rising sun makes this area very special
Nice and interesting walking area. Great place to walk around in a narrow street and people watching. Old buildings and cobble stones streets. Much better than Las Rambla.
Interesting. Forget the overcrowded Las Ramblas. Take yourself for a stroll around the narrow streets here and sample some of the amazing Tapas and bars
Cafes and shops galore.. Barri Gotic is worth a visit. There are good restaurants, cafes and stores all over. Parts of the area look seedy but I never felt unsafe.

Completely charming. Loved the gothic quarter. Feels like the center of the universe. Very photogenic, narrow streets filled with cafes, shops, bars and restaurants. Very close to Las Ramblas. At every turn, you'll find an unexpected restaurant or gem of a place.

Nice. Lovely. Little streets confusing at first but become strangely diffrent in no time.
This has lots of bars cafes shops studios gallerys, you name it, its got a dozen.
Some places are expensive but theres many a deal to be found.
Cool part of town. Definitely worth a visit to this part of town to get a sense of character and culture in Barcelona. The Gothic Church is a must!
My favorite area in Barcelona. The area is very interesting to roam in and around it, so many things to see and check out. A must during any visit to the city.
Don't miss it.. Definitely go stroll the tourist laden streets. They will be packed but walk back into history and get lost on the streets.
Wander and eat good food!. There are some beautiful examples of Gothic architecture around every corner, also found some great places to eat!

Daytime stroll in the cool shadows of alleyways. This is probably my favourite area of Barcelona, but admittedly it's hard to choose.I think this area is best discovered late afternoon after seeing some of the 'big hitters' or in summer after a day at the beach. Full of character and charm it has many independent boutiques, ice-cream parlours and interesting cafes, bars and restaurants.The El Born area of the district was once a little down-trodden but it's now a cool area to spend the night amongst the trendy bars and clubs. It's like the Olympic Port but without the pretension and price. It gets busy from 11pm - 3pm and it's friendly and safe and my favourite place to spend the night.
Very Photographic. The Gothic Quarter is a great place to wander around when you have seen everything else to see. There are some amazing buildings to photograph so bring your camera.
Loved it. We loved wandering through the Gothic Quarter. We discovered the most amazing restaurant called Sensi. We also discovered the Gaudi museum. It is an amazing museum.

Wander and wonder. Not far from the Les Rambles this area is a fascinating.its well worth doing a tour as the history is fascinating. I also wandered alone and felt quite safe..but be on guard for pickpockets, esp if you stop to take photos.

Take Time to Waste Time. if you only have a day (or a few hours) in Barcelona, wandering the streets of the Barri Gotic is the way to go. Turn a corner to find just what you didn't know you were looking for: an unusual museum like the Mares, a street performer singing opera, a gelato stand, an antique shop (particularly on Banys Nous); a quiet little square like San Felipe Neri where the church is still pocked with bullet holes from the Civil War. If you have a free evening, stop by Santa Maria del Pi because there is often a reasonably priced concert in the basilica.

Very Interesting Tour. We went on a walking tour of the Gothic Quarter with a knowledgeable and friendly guide. There are many walking tour guides so it probably doesn`t matter which one you use as the walk itself is the main thing. You will learn some history and appreciate the quaint and winding streets of this marvelous part of Barcelona. We learned all about the origins of the city plus the correct pronounciation of the name Barcelona.

Fun time, getting lost, and seeing the stores and people. Art for sale on the weekends in Placa de Pi. Not a problem with iphones and gps maps, really a relaxing place to walk and see the oldest part of town,

Nice place to spend the day. I really enjoyed going to the Gothic Quarter to see the Picasso museum, take in the atmosphere and do some shopping. For me it is very hard to find my way in these types of neighborhoods and my phone had no bars in this location. Make sure you pay attention on how you get in to follow the same route back. The shopping there was very nice. A lot of artisans along with tourist stuff but I always look for the handmade pieces for which there was plenty to choose from.

A must see when in Barcelona to experience the old part of Barcelona. I enjoyed the gothic quarter. I did a tour of the gothic quarter which helped me learn to navigate the streets. It can be easy to get lost because there are so many interconnecting streets. But its really interesting exploring the narrow streets, seeing evidence of the Roman occupation, of the bombings from the Spanish civil war, seeing the square where Woody Allen filmed a scene from his movie, visiting churches, musums, restaurants and shops. There is so much to do.

An essential part of a holiday in Barcelona.. Our little guidebook summed it up by saying "just wander to get lost" - very appropriate. Fun shopping, the Gothic churches and cathedral, the market and lots of bars and restaurants.

Stayed in this area. We stayed in the Gothic area ,the area is full of interesting things and not from a lot of the attractions. Bars and restaurants are plenty ,would definitely stay in the area again.

Amazing place, full of history.. A medieval area in the middle of Barcelona, with wonderful buildings, shops, restaurants. We visited the Plaza of the King, where Queen Isabella received Christopher Columbus when he returned from his trips. We also saw a place with original Roman columns. There was a beautiful cathedral, and the entire place is worth a visit.

Beautiful and ugly . Wandering through the Gothic Quarter shows the beauty and ugliness of Barcelona. Somehow the combination makes this a fascinating city. Old and new sit alongside each other with grace and interesting sights are found unexpectedly around corners. Worth spending time just wandering.
Wonderful stroll. This was a great part of Barcelona to stroll around. We came across lovely shops & restaurants to check out. The architecture is wonderful to view.

Very Old Barcelona. Narrow and winding little streets lined with shops selling tourist trinkets and trash give way occasionally to a spectacular site that should not be missed. These include the Cathedral of Barcelona (beware of lines to get in) the Picasso Museum and the "Cathedral by the Sea" on the latter, there is a novel written based on the construction of this church that is a great read an a good prep for visiting the area
Nice and warm. Very nice and warm atmosphere,full of tourists and local people,gives you real spirit of Gothic style

Time-warp. Wandering through this charming old part of BCN is pure magic. We felt transported in time as we walked through the area from the Placa Real off the Ramblas, seeing the entrance towers of Augustus' Roman Barcelona and the history that oozes out of every corner.. Well worth a visit!
Cosy quarter. Nice atmosphere. Cosy shops, cafés and restaurants. Narrow streets. Almost no cars. A lot of small streets to discover. Mix of typical tourist shops and local ones.

its a great place to walk. Its great to wander around the narrow streets of this quarter with its cafes and shops. I found it very friendly and welcoming.You turn a corner and there in front of you is an old church or cathedral across a small square. Its just lovely
Atmospheric . We wandered the narrow streets seeing sights, eat tapas and drinking sangria. All was good. Definitely visit the cathedral.

Loved El Gotica Area. Our heart was located in the heart of this area. A five minute walk to Las Ramblas and even closer to Picasso Musuem. Late night activity, including restaurants, bars and shopping. Quite safe area at night.
