Amazing Barri Gotic. We stayed in this area during our recent visit to Barcelona. The tightly packed streets and old buildings are really something to behold.
Plenty of old restaurants, bakeries, shops and sights to keep you busy!

Take your time to enjoy this lovely area. Wander around the Barri Gotic and take in the wonderful world of Barcelona. You will enjoy restaurants, shopping and people watching. Barcelona is truly a sparkling gem and the Barri Gotic is one of its treasures.
Very old and artistic. Very, very charming old part of Barcelona. Bit spooky at night. You will find there amazing balcony, restaurants, artistic shops, pubs, locals and music spots.

Everything you are looking for in one section of Barcelona. I love this section of the city! It his history, art museums, shopping, clubs and restaurants all in one place. You can purchase authentic Spanish goods to tacky souvenirs and grabbed a coffee and pastry or a glass of wine or beer. I loved exploring the alleyways as you never knew what you would find around the next corner

Okay...but El Born area is better.. While the streets in this area are interesting to wander, the shops are very touristy and generally uninspired. We found the El Born area more enjoyable.There are two shops we came across that are worth noting: Papairvm (Baixada de la Llibreteria 2) is a wonderful shop featuring writing instruments, leather-bound books, and stationary; Orang Utan Coffee makes fabulous coffee (take away or drink onsite) and even has a coffee roaster onsite.

Sense of adventure . Must be willing to get lost...in time and space. So many corners, shops and food to discover. The vintage and jewelry shops are especially unique. Good luck finding what you're looking for.

Well worth doing a tour of this area. We did the free walking tour through the Gothis Quater and it is well worth your time to do this area off of La Rumba.The history, the stories the narrow streets are all so interesting that the 2 hour tour went so fast we could hardly believe it had come to an end.We loved the Gothic Quarter.
Love it!!. Amazing to look at, relaxed walk around and fab quirky shops. Great little eating places and bars. Spent many enjoyable hours wandering around the Gothic quarter.

We were drawn back again and again. Almost every day we were in Barcelona, we found ourselves in the Gothic Quarter--and our hotel was in L'Eixample, near Sagrada Familia. The winding streets and tiny storefronts are fascinating, and it's the part of the city where you can easily and happily get lost. During your visit, make a point to spend at least half a day wandering with no particular purpose--the Gothic Quarter will surprise and delight you.Tip: Our first visit was a free (tips only) 2.5 hour walking tour from Runnerbean Tours. Highly recommended!

Engagement photoshoot location. Love this area. Made us feel like movie stars. Beautiful by day and night. My fiancé organised our engagement photoshoot here. They do a lovely vintage flea market too where I bought a ring box ironically the day before he proposed.

A firm favourite. One of my favourite places in any city in the world. Lots of little streets and amazing squares to wander around and stops for coffees or beer/cava. A photographers paradise. Beautiful churches & architecture.

Beautiful area. We spent a fantastic half day wandering around this area. In my opinion this is the nicest part of Barcelona. Lots of tiny winding streets and fantastic architecture. Most of the churches /cathedrals are free to enter and it is 5 minute walk from La Ramblas (which is awful , full of tourist crap)

Continuation of the mystical magic of Barcelona. The gothic quarter located in the centre of the old city of Barcelona is definitely worth visiting and spending some time in. As is the Catalunyan way there is even controversy surrounding this area of the city that further adds to its charm

Quaint little streets worth a side trip. Talk any of the small paths off of Las Ramblas to enter the gothic quarter. Its quaint with shops and small alleyways. I loved just waking around and people watching.

Narrow Streets, interesting things at every turn. This was a fascinating part of Barcelona. If you go early in the day, you can get in to the Picasso museum without a long wait - a fascinating museum and very pretty building. There is also the oldest synagogue in all of Europe, dating from Roman times, called Major Synagogue, which is a relatively recent archaeological find.
Gothic quarter. we just enjoy wandering through the side streets - food, beer , wine need to be sampled - we felt very safe
Good place to pass by. . If you wanna have feeling about old Barcelona, you pass through Gothic Quarter. The important thing is you have to read a boy history in advance to get better feeling of it.

Great for Wandering!. This is one of those neighborhoods where you just wander and explore. Don't worry about getting lost - find your way later. All sorts of little shops and eateries mixed in with residences. Great neighborhood!

Wonderful. Very interesting to walk down the ancient streets of Barcelona. Do go into as many churches as you visit shops. The Churches are awe-inspiring. Some of them do ask for entry fee, it's for the upkeep of the ancient property.

Nice are and good base to explore the city. Quaint are with a lot of eateries, chocolate boutiques , wine bars and underground fashion boutiques ! It was a nice location to explore the city at the same time.

Beautiful winding streets. Walking through the beautifully built gothic quarter you never know what you will find next. There is something for everyone from major chain stores to little independent shops, from beautiful restaraunts to charming outdoor cafe's. Also keep your eyes peeled for hidden churches that spring up out of nowhere. Will definitely be returning to this beautiful city

A fun neighborhood!. We took an apartment in this neighborhood because we heard good things about it. We were not disappointed. There are all sorts of alleyways with tons of shops that you can just wander around all day. There are great restaurants as well.

Walk, Shop, Eat. This is a beautiful quarter of the city filled with shops, restaurants, plazas, churches, monuments - pretty much has it all. You can reach the Barri Gotic by both metro and bus but must explore it on foot. The Cathedral, Palace of Music of Catalunya and several large Corte de Ingles department stores border the district. The little alleyways are perfect to get lost in and discover new places. Make your was either to or from the Ramblas and stop for a drink and a snack at one of the many tables in Placa Reial. This plaza is especiallly lovely at night.
Great. The Gothic Quarter is really nice and it preserves an "old and vintage" atmosphere. Really worth it!
great walks. We had the luck to be there while they were celebrating their patrionts saint (the virgin) so we got to see awesome bands walking down the streets. Impressive architechture.

Great to soak up the ambience. Lovelly old part of town and a must see allow all day to wander the streets and alleyways. Watch the prices in the bars and cafes. You can be caught thinking as they all seem to offer the same food and drinks but prices differ greatly. We saw popular tapas eg patats from €2.5 to €5.5 beers from €5 to €12 and sangria from €4 to a whopping €14 per glass though generally the quality was the same no matter how fancy the establishment looked. None were exceptional.

Felt sorry for the beggars. The buildings and architecture are very nice. However, it can be very crowded, and many times we encountered smells of sewage, as well as many people begging for money. Our impression was more feeling sorry for the people, and less impressed by what we saw. Hard to really appreciate the facade of a building when a young man is eating scraps out of a garbage can nearby. Hope they get help.

An area for exploring/wandering/discovering :). It's such a cool area.. I want to live here. Just wander around the beautiful old buildings and make sure to check out the "Mercado de Santa Caterina" – one of my favorite markets in Barcelona. If you keep going a little further you can also find yourself in "Parc de la Ciutadella" which is a really nice park where you'll often find cool bohemian-type people dancing, doing some capoeira, or playing guitar.

Perfect Historical and urban blend.. great mix of old and new, lots of little local shops, bakeries and then you turn a corner and bam a ancient cathedral with amazing views, murals and no fee to walk in and explore. then walk out and your surrounded by old Franco style apartment building, cafes, bars and restaurants serving the best tapas you will find. the back streets off La Rambla is where all the best places in Barcelona are to be found. Steeped in history and local provenance.

Barri Gotic. Walking around the Barri Gotic offered a very unique perspective of Barcelona when it was a Roman settlement. Winding pedestrian streets, cute squares, old city walls, and former palaces.
Simply beautiful. Is something that you don't expect, the architecture is simply breathtaking, small alleys, coffe shops, old stores, really beautiful, great pictures.

Nice walk around part of the town. Typical for any older European cities, this is part of the older town with windy little streets, old churches and buildings. Dotted with shops, cafes and restaurants. Good place to kill a few hours and get some quick bites and interesting gifts.
Older part of the city. There some interesting narrow streets and buildings to stroll around, if that's your thing, but not worth a detour if you are tight for time

Visit to Gothic quarter.. Stayed with Family at a hotel conveniently located in Gothic District. Gothic district is very scenic, especially at dusk and night with candle and soft lighting. Really enjoyed that, but didn't care for the many foreign tourists who were there to party and had clearly overdone it. Not ideal when visiting with children. Plus being solicited to buy beer or other items in an alley at night is not a pleasurable experience unless you're there on spring break.
Beautiful scenery. Its streets are nice to hangout whether you are looking for something or have some time to burn. Make sure to check out its squares and cathedrals, also Born district.
Beautiful Barcelona gothic quarter. Wandered around all day, popping in bars & restaurants, getting a friendly Catalan welcome, looking at the amazing sights, definitely worth a trip

Best district . The Gothic Quarter is the most amazing, friendliest district in Barcelona! Somehow we kept wondering back there without even trying! We loved it! Great shops, great restaurants, great people.... And limited to no car traffic.... Which is fantastic considering there are soooooo many cars and motorcycles in the area! This is a must, must, must visit!!!!
Best Place to Walk. This is a very interested neighborhood to stroll the side streets. There are many small, interesting shops and restaurants in this neighborhood.
Must see. Lovely medieval area, great cafes, bars, tapas squares; shopping, street markets. This is a must see area for anyone visiting Barcelona

Splendid architecture, great atmosphere!. We spent a long time wandering the alleyways and lane-ways of the Gothic Quarter soaking up the atmosphere and marveling at the splendid architecture. There was a surprise around almost every corner. Whether it was quirky little shops, interesting little cafes and bars or splendid churches; they were all there to be seen and enjoyed. It was a truly unique area.One little tip. Ensure that you take a good, detailed map with you. Otherwise you may end up getting lost like we did, several times.
Worth a visit. Beautiful architecture, lovely resturants, great shops and museums - there was live music when we were there....a must visit

Very Gothic!. It is very authentic & definitely Gothic!Little Streets with Old Gothic Buildings! Even for someone like me that doesn't appreciate Gothic liked the whole environment. It is one thing to do after checking out the Gaudi Buildings & La Sagrada Familia which should be FIRST PRIORITIES!
So Much History. Walking tours are a must to enjoy the Gothic Quarter.The small streets/lanes are a privilege to walk along while everything is explained !!!

Take a walk through the neighborhood. Very interesting neighborhood with many squares and churchs. Did a walking tour there so I was able to understand everything and walk around by myself. Just walking through that alleys and streets to understand, really nice experience.

The happening place. Center of action, food, museums, walking, old buildings, modern buildings, shopping, Churches, Cathedrals, Gaudy house, transportation (get rid of your car) ...... you name it. Unfortunately also tour bus and cruise ship central, but it can absorb them (thankfully the cruise ship folks go home at night).

Travel back in time! . My very first experience with this center was short of conventional. I actually got lost, but as I was trying to find my hotel I was taken aback by what was on my way. Beautiful stations scattered around the beating heart of Barcelona. Heading there? Grab your comfy shoes and prepare yourself for long strolls. Enjoy!!

Great Neighborhood. The Gothic Quarter is a fabulous walking area. Tons of interesting small shops, Tapa joints, restaurants, and the Picasso Museum. Start at the Cathedral with it's geese,and then just get lost on the winding back streets. You can end up at the waterfront,which is pretty nice as well.

Great Place to Wander. We have returned to Barri Gotic 3 times and are joining a walking tour tomorrow. It is a wonderful area for a leisurely stroll going whichever way the streets send you. We found a great little art shop only because we turned this way instead of that. There is something new/different every few minutes. It is almost like visiting a bygone era with all the modern conveniences. Wonderful architecture - the cathedral s not to be missed. Unique shops. Terrific people.

Old city of Barcelona. The old city of Barcelona, streets are mazy and leads to squares. We took a leisurely walk around the area with a guide listening to the various landmarks of the area. Good time just walking around & learning and admiring Barcelona.

Amzing narrow streets, architecture and curiosities. Loved this part of Barcelona, especially the narrow streets and little shops.
Enjoyed just wandering around there and finding random bits of architecture and curiosities.
A must when your in Barcelona.

Barri Gotic, Barcelona's lovely center. What I loved most in Barcelona :)
We went during the merce period so every square had it's own concert which was amazing!
Let's get lost!. I loved the Gothic Quarter with its winding roads and unique building and shops. It's an excellent way to get away from the madness of La Ramblas.
worth seeing. Parts are unique and parts are commercialized. Best to forge through to the less commercialized areas and get an authentic feel for the best of Barcelona
Good walking experience. Traditional gothic quarter of Barcelona it is a must-walk tour full of interesting streets, small museums and shops

Very atmospheric. This area of Barcelona houses some of the oldest streets.There are many very quaint tight little lanes with small shops and tapas bars . There are some great museums too like the Picasso museum. Its a great place to simply wander and soak up the real Barcelona.

Cozy narrow streets. Revealing cafes, restaurants and shops in the narrow cobbled streets is a great experience. Don't miss cathedral with its flock of geese, visit tea shops which also serve great cocktails at night. It is also a great area to stay.

get lost in the narrow lanes. Comfortable shoes required for the amount of walking you will do. This is a lovely area where you can get lost in all the narrow lanes. Beautiful buildings, churches and the odd bit of graffiti.
Lovely. What a beautiful city Barcelona! Loved the architecture in this area. Different then many other cities we have visited in Europe.

Amazing Old Town - So much to see.. A mix of old and new, there is so much to see in this part of Barcelona, so be prepared to take some time to visitl. Narrow windy streets, take you to many interesting and important sites, from Plaça Reial, Church of Santa Maria del Pi, Church of Sant Miquel, Aguilar Palace: present-day Museu Picasso, Calle Portal de L'Angel and Els Quatre Gats. You will also find the Jewish quarter and Plaça del George Orwell. The narrow roads also lead to many interesting restaurants, bars and shops that include modern or retro clothing, antique shops, art shops. The area is lively. There are also many squares or placas to rest and enjoy some coffee and quiet. There is a lot of history here, from it's medieval roots. Easy access to the area, and metros always within walking distance, so it is very much worth checking out. A lot of fun....there is much to see in Barcelona, so also recommend a hop on hop off bus tour, when the feet get tired and you want to be able to see more, and wouldn't have the time to walk to all places.

Part of our love of Barcelona. We wandered the streets of Barcelona and found this area to be another place to not be missed!! The architecture, history, people watching, the whole experience are not to be missed! We loved this area and we loved this city!
Fantastic maze of antiquity . We loved every minute of exploring the narrow ancient stone passage ways. Could spend the whole weekend lost in there and intend to next time we visit! Recommended.

A walker's delight. My wife and I have just spent seven days in a tiny apartment in the Gothic quarter and loved it. The joys of not driving!It's a lovely area with lots to do in terms of shopping, a few landmark buildings, serious numbers of Tapas bars, and is very central. Not only can you spend hours walking around the quarter and stopping in each plaza for coffee, but it is an easy walk to the La Rambla, the waterfront, the Passage de Gracia, three major Gaudi buildings, the Picasso Museum etc. Absolutely brilliant location steeped in history. Definitely better to stay here than in the tourist hotel area further north.
A must experience if traveling to b. Old and quaint. Our favorite part of Barcelona. Close to museums and the water front, it's a great place to just stroll and get lost in Barcelona
Nicest area in barcelona!!. Amazing part of barcelona . Offering everything you need.. food , clothes , bars and clubs.The vibe in the streets is great!!!

Best Area in Barcelona. We loved the Gothic Quarters and ended up spending a lot of time there on our Barcelona trip. It is full of cobbled inter-twined streets, shops, bars, restaurants and a few monuments.
Good way to spend some time relaxing. Lovel area to walk around. Interesting shops, little piazzas and cafes. Cathedral and churches. Busy but cool and pleasant
Wandering heaven. Great place to wander, feast for the eyes, take a camera!! Narrow winding streets, pretty old buildings. Could have spent a lot longer there!

Take your walking shoes.......... ....... and simply enjoy the experience of wandering around the old streets, taking in the sights and sounds.Pencil in a day - and you'll probably think it's not enough.

Gothic Quarter. Loved it!! This is the place to be! Old buildings, small alleys, great food--happened to be there during a festival and be part of a parade and see the human tower competition...Great place for Pinchos!!

Creat for a walking tour!. If like to walk you will need a full day to visit the Gothic Quarter. The streets a very narrow and the buildings still have a medieval feel. The small plazas are also nice and the cathedrals as well.
Beautiful but touristy place. Wonderful maze of old buildings. Lots of thing to see including museums. High number of touristy shops bring the place down a little.

Explore the gothic quarter on your trip to Barcelona!. So fun an love the quirky shops. Just watch out for pick pockets in the crowds in this area. Great Tapas restaurants and local clothing stores to be found in this area too!

Great area for strolling and sightseeing. Great part of town for just strolling around the narrow ancient streets and soaking in the architecture, sights and smells. Lots of character with ancient buildings, plazas, churches, stores, cafes, etc.
Wander!. Highlight of our trip... just wander and get lost in the neighborhoods and side streets. Part of what makes Barcelona!

Wish We Had More Time. This is a great area to explore if you have the time. After visiting all the Gaudi creations and walking the many boulevards, we only had a short amount of time for this quarter in Barcelona. The streets are narrow and maze-like with lots of gothic atmosphere. There are lots of shops and places for tapas as ll as some Spanish street music. Wish we had spent more time here.....maybe a good reason to return some day. Barcelona was our favorite city in Spain!

Charming but.... Incredibly charming area; only downside are the curio shops with the same old rubbish as anywhere else and restaurants that chase tourists in all thinkable languages . Shame it can't keep more original.
The Gothic Sevtion. Walked an viewed this amazing well preserved area. Especially enjoyed seeing the old Jewish section and learning their valuable input to the Spanish society.

Always pleasant to walk around . This is the type of area one would want to visit everytime in Barcelona. Designed like a maze and populated by alternative kind of shops, it's a good place to get lost.

Very cool. Maze - like labyrinth of narrow streets & alleys with loads of restaurants, bars, shops, you name it. Thankfully there are a fair number of sign-posts around to help you find you way around. Still not hard to get lost, but then you'll probably stumble across something worth seeing. Definitely recommend the great market with the wavy, colourful roof...

Great. This was my favourite part of barcelona.It is always full of people.The buidings are mazing,impressive,great details...you can also find a good range of restaurants but the prices are a little high.
Wonderful . So much fun to wonder around and just look at all there is. Could spend hours getting lost around every corner a new Suprised.
A must visit when in Barcelona. Definitely a must when visiting Barcelona. You can spend hours exploring the numerous shops and alleyways.
great hidden streets . Just get lost and you will enjoy the gothic quarter. We stumbled upon a chocolate shop and many other hidden shops in the gothic quarter with great little cafes.

Barri Gotic. Lovely area in Barcelona with a beautiful atmosphere. Buildings still have the original
facade and there are some hidden treasures. Easy to get to and pretty central.
Just magical. I loved wandering these beautiful streets,listening to spanish music at every corner and admiring the gotic architecture
Contrary to popular opinion, I prefer the Rambla. The narrow streets just seem oppresive, and the prevading grafitti also mars the experience. I prefer tree-lined boulevards and open space.

Heart of the city. As I said in the title this quarter is the heart of the city. The buildings are beautiful, people travling in the streets all day long. Great places to eat, drink, buy souvenirs or just relax in a small placa. Most of the time I have spent in Barcelona, i spent in this Quarter.

Incredible walking tour. We seen "The Cathedral" and many Museums. We visited La Boqueria, where we shopped for fish and fruits to make an authentic Paella with a local chef. An amazing experience! We especially enjoyed the many shops. Oroliquido, was one of our favorites. We visited Tapas bars and shared many delicious plates with friends. One of the cleanest, and fun places to visit!

fantastic experience walkig in the narrow streets. Great atmosphere wandering these old, narrow streets and ending up in beautifulsmall plazas .On the way you see great architecture many small shops and thewonderful Gotic Cathedral

Wonderful place to roam and shop.. We had such good time roaming around in the Gothic Quarter. Lots of narrow paths between ancient buildings with a very interesting history. The Picasso museum is there as well as all kinds of interesting shops and restaurants. Best not to have much of a plan and wonder though we did follow some of Rick Steve's Barcelona Pocket book. Very handy for the maps and restaurants.
Worth a walk around!. Really nice buildings and little quaint streets - worth going for a walk around the little streets and finding little shops and cafes.
impressive. It sia nice neighborhood of the city with narrow streets, old buildings, nice shops and etc. I recommend not to miss it.

Can't wait to return and experience it again. One of the best parts of Barcelona as it shows its real Spanish heritage. Includes wonderful Cathedral, museum, lots of narrow streets to explore with amazing Gothic architecture, local musicians and lots of street life. Every building and street is an 'Oh!', you can spend many hours here. Unfortunately my visit was short, but must return to explore more. Also some nice shops.
Our walk. Loved the architecture and narrow streets. The cathedral is stunning. You can go on the roof and gain a brilliant view. The shops are unusual too.

beautiful area to explore. This is a beautiful area to explore with its narrow streets , market stalls and magnificent cathedral . It is a maze of streets and the shops are so interesting and we discovered lovely good value restaurants with excellent food . I think if I return to Barcelona that I would stay here as it is convenient for most attractions and public transport .

Awesome. Went here one night and there was an orchestra playing with lots of pretty lights lighting up the church. Great place to shop and get lost in the little streets.. close to las ramblas.. would recommend going here if you want real shops and not little stands that sell the same things everywhere
Exciting area. Tons of entertainment shopping and bars. Historic area with many alley ways leading to shops and such.

Great city. Love Barcelona early morning is the best time to walk around and see the wonderful buildings with out all the sight seeing groups we used the hop on bus service and stayed on for the full tour approx 2 hours we then marked off where we wanted to go back to and did the rest on foot

Beautiful Old area. The Gothic Quarter is well worth it to see, take a free walking tour of the area to learn more. We did a Runner Bean Tour which was amazing, you can tip at the end if you like it. They run at 11am and again at 4pm
A very special place. Be sure to visit Church St Jaume, simple, precious, a real gem. Even in the midst of the celebrations of Barcelona's fiesta, this offered a quiet space

Walking tour. This is one of my favorite quarters in Barcelona to walk through.
Everywhere you look around you find beautiful buildings, nice little shops and nice cafés.
Stunning place. Such a beautiful area to wander around. There are so many querky and interesting stores down every alley way!
Magical. Just get lost in the never-ending alleys, lots of shops and hidden restaurants. Reminded us of Venice, but without the canals :)

Nice Walks and shops. Nice area to walk in and a lot of shops cafes bars and resturants nice markets you will find Alistair everything here
Close to the sea and you can take long walks by the sea
Good architecture. This Quarter had good architecture and some written and painted walls are very original, you have filling that u are hero of some movie

Great just to wander and find all the hidden gems. The Gothic Quarter is full of facinating medieval alleyways and streets off the Ramblas where you can find beautiful cathedrals, plazas filled with tapas bars, cafes, boutique shops, and plenty of extremely talented buskers. A wonderful place just to wander and get lost enjoying the ambience of the old quarter. A definite must whilst in Barcelona

Endlessly fascinating.. Go slowly and look up and down. Peek through open doorways when possible and see the houses built around a courtyard. The Gothic Quarter can be combined with the Picasso Museum, but it can be done on its own repeatedly so see a side of Barcelona completely different from Gaudi and the Ramblas.

An Intersting Walk Into The Past. Definitely worth taking the side streets off the busy Las ramblas to enter the gothic quarter and get the feel of what the old Barcelona was all about. Very atmospheric and interesting

Beautiful. Ww walked around and around this area for miles in the days we were there and had some amazing experiences both in the bars and wondering around them. Towering buildings with sights and sounds of domestic life above street level, atmospheric bars and shops below.

A good plan and a good map is needed to make the most of this area. We started at Plaça d'Antonio López and threaded our way to Barcelona Cathedral and then out to the Rambles.Wandering around the streets is a real treat, with lots of specialist shops, interesting streets and Roman walls. This is a place where history of a city is on display at every turn. It reminded us a lot of Venice.The Cathedral is worth a visit in itself. A real surprise were the geese swimming in the cloister fountain.In the warren of Medieval Streets it is handy to have a good map to keep track of where you are, and a good guide book so that you do not miss too much.We took our trip in the late afternoon and were on the Rambles by sunset.This was hugely accessible for wheelchair and the streets were large flags rather than cobble stones, making it an easy ride.

Take a stroll. This part is wonderful to simply walk around and soak in the history. My husband had been here to this part of Barcelona multiple times so he knew where he was going. One can get a little turned around so be aware of what streets you are going down.
a nice sroll in the old city. a nice stroll in this place is highly recommended .. great architect buildings , nice shops , great variety and moderate prices

Nice but not my fave.. The only reason we've given this 3 stars is because personally we preffered El Born district. I do think its down to personal preference though. Still a wondeful afternoon losing ourselves down the endless roads. Beautiful place.

A don't miss if you're in Barcelona. My favorite thing to do during our vacation was to just walk around here. We stopped at various cafe's and had drinks and tapas. Lovely way to rest and see the sights.

Little gem off the main track... During my stay in Barcelona i took the Spanish Civil walking tour with Nick Lloyd which in itself was great.It brought us through the Gothic Quarter which is full of little side streets each with their own stories.Well worth a visit.
Wonderful area of Barcelona . Great place to eat and drink in one of the many squares surrounded by beautiful old and fascinating buildings. Good shopping area as well.

Nice place to look up while walking. Beautiful place where you can easily walk a whole day and stop on nice restaurants for a quick bite. Roads are nor baby strollers friendly as you might expect but good enaugh

Basilica dels Sants Martirs Just i Pastor - Ciutat de Barcelona & Cathedral de Barcelona. The area around these historic churches is defiantly worth a look, especially as when you have finished viewing the sights there are plenty of small bars/cafes/restaurants to sit for a time to contemplate what you have just seen… besides the tapas and wine is great too!

Medieval Old quarterof Barcelona. Best area of the city: Quaint medieval streets and laneways, plaza's, cafes, restaurants, tapas bars. Centrally located between La Rambla and the port/Barceloneta. Great shops. Location couldnt be better. Easy access to everything.

Something different around every corner. I stayed here in September 2015 and spent 4 days wondering about the shops, bars and cathedrals generally just hanging out. Not far from the architectural wonders of Gaudi's Barcelona the Gothic Quarter is a labyrinth of nooks and crannies that are quite fun to get lost in. Just when you think you know were you are going, you take a different turn and you find somewhere new. I was so pleased I managed to find the Born district of the Gothic Quarter - which seemed to open up a little and it had a fantastic array of shops and cafes. Next visit - back to the Barri Gotic for sure.
Beatiful. The narrow lanes and alleys lead to more and each reveals another part of this amazing neighborhood. You should just walk around and just let yourself get lost.
We could walk these streets for months!. We found that we saw a different part of Gotic each time we walked through. Great sights and food, especially down quieter lanes.

Not really gothic (or maybe we didn't see whole place).. Not really gothic (or maybe we didn't see whole place). Thought it will be really gothic, but saw few cathedrals, narrow streets, so it was just n old town as in many other european cities.

very nice, but it has to be DISCOVERED, you will fine your own "best" place there for yourself - a shop, a caffe. Stroll around, get lost and found again, sit down for tapas, get a souvenir, do not look into a map, follow occasionally the tourist signs, you will enjoy it best this way

Loved the Journey. It was a little Journey back in Architecture but nit in Culture. The Culture is very modern with touristic spins thrown in Every where. We really did enjoy the walks threw Narrow Streets and the Stone and Iron Architecture. the food however I could not recommend until you are 15 to 20 Kilometers out of town. Our best meal and Service in town was at the Hard Rock sort of a pity but the Tourists are busting down the gates to Barcelona!

GREAT NEIGHBOURHOOD FOR A DIGESTIVE WALK. It is for sure worth a stroll. Some buildings lined with balconies are quite amazing. There are several blocks where the whole atmosphere is, how should I put it - genuine? A perfect place for lazing on a sunny afternoon.
Walk and shop till you drop. Great walking streets filled with endless boutiques and restaurants. Very crowded. Fun people watching.

The heart of the city. winding narrow streets and alleyways, tiny shops and cafes, unexpected sights around each corner. best place to be and a great way to find some cool air in a hot city for the summer.

Magnificent. If you're an architecture buff or just one of those who sees beauty in everything then you'll have a very easy breezy day in the gothic quarter. Which generally speaking begins at the Arc De Triomf and ends at least half a mile if not more in a straight direction. It's u unmissable when you're there and is marked in a slightly darker grey colour than the rest of the city on the map.

Lovely area. This is a great place to wander around in the day or at night - lots of roads and alleys where it is easy to get lost, half the fun!!! Lots of different shops to look at and many foods to try.
Beautiful . Great area with beautiful architecture pieces. Our hotel were in the middle of that area. Alot of tiny roads, that you can gen lost easily and it's recomanded ;))

Truly a sight to behold!. This area of Barcelona is not only fascinating, but it is interesting to see an area in which some portions of the Gothic Quarter are more than 2000 years old. Seeing parts of the original city wall built by the Romans is truly a wonder to behold. The restaurants in this area are also fabulous and the food is incredible. I can't wait to go back!!!!

Getting lost while enjoying yourself and finding unexpected sights. We did not enter many buildings and sight on our stay in Barcelona. Walking around in the historic neighbourhood as well as other neighbourhoods was enough for a great Barcelona experience. In the Barri Gothic you can spend hours getting lost in the many narrow streets and discover new interesting buildings and sight. A map is recommended if you want to visit particular sights, and there are many in this area. As such it is also often crowded with tourists, at least the larger roads.

A area not to miss.. Again anoughter great area to visit with great places to eat and drink great shops too. Lots of independent shops, great ice cream shops, resturants and bars. Felt safe to walk around folk were always friendly.

Carlos Ruiz Zafon's Barcelona - The Shadow and the Wind set here. This is the place to be in Barcelona. If you've read any of Carlos Ruiz Zafon's books then many of the streets and hidden corners here are brought to life in such a new and unique way. Take the book and wander around here beside the cathedral as the streets are mentioned in the story and you'll feel as if you are really walking in the steps of the main characters. There's so much to see and do here - remember to look up as the buildings are something else. one of my favourite areas of the city for the character and the hidden tapas bars!

Lose yourself in a good way.... One of my favourite parts of the city, a lovely way to get lost wandering the alleys, and streets of Barri Gotic. Do a bit of shopping in the lovely boutique stores often selling locally made items. Stop off for lunch or drinks in one of the many bars or restaurants. And then find yourself again, as you work out were you are (if you don't cheat and use google maps;)

Hidden gems in narrow streets. The Gothic Quarter is a fabulous place to stay. It is so convenient for the tourist buses, bars, restaurants and the beach. It contains many wonderful architecturally designed buildings. Las Ramblas is a place to visit if you enjoy the hustle and bustle. There is a food market just off the street with a cacophony of all sorts of smells. We stayed in the Hesperia Hotel which was 10 minutes walk from Las Ramblas and 15 Minutes to the beach. Very centrally located with friendly staff and spotlessly clean rooms. The downside was the smell of drains but you are in the old quarter.You can see some wonderful churches and a cathedral and quite a lot of museums. There are so many places to eat you are spoilt for choice.
Take your time. Wandering in Barri Gotic is an experience itself. You will be plunged into the past of Old Europe. Don't miss the Cathedral

One of the best parts of the city. So much to see here- go walking for a couple of hours and get lost in the narrow streets and lanes, find unexpected surprises like plazas, churches and little neighbourhood parks. Be aware that the area is known for 'pickpockets', but exercising a little vigilance goes a long way. We had no problems.
walk for hours and fast forward the historty. lots of historic attractions..lots of amazing cafes and restaurants. Easy access to the Barcelona Cathedral. Easily accessible by metro.
Heart and soul of the city. . This is the heartbeat of the city. Lots of twisting alleyways with bars restaurants and shops. This is the place to be.

The district to go to. Our hotel was here and it was just lovely walking around exploring what this region had to offer. So many cool shops and amazing restaurants. The architecture is amazing too and it wasn't hard to find yourself next to some interesting building down a side street.
Beautiful and scenic. A beautiful part of Barcelona, well worth a visit. From high street shops to market stalls. Surrounded by a host of different types of street entertainers. Well worth a visit.
Nice walk. So pretty but so many tourists. That's the trouble with going somewhere charming right? Everyone else wants to see it! Take a walk through, but no lingering....
Narrow, Narrow streets!. Great place to go and get lost in (in a good way) with its labyrinth of narrow streets. Plenty of restaurants and tapas bars to choose from.
Wander the Gothic. I loved wandering around this area. Lovely shops, cafes, street performers, artists. A surprise around every corner.
So original. Though not at modern as Passeig de Gracia and Eixample neighbourhood, I loved this place much more than the modern part of Barcelona. so original and full of hidden beauties

A contrast to the rest of the city. It is difficult to escape the noise and the people press of Barcelona town and whilst this does not happen in the Gothic quarter, at least one can immerse oneself in the quality architectural ambience. From Roman to medieval to moderniste, it has the lot and allow ones eyes a rest from the sight of the omnipresent ice cream shops, tapas bars and fast food joints. Take a rest in the quiet squares ((Neri) or the cloisters of the cathedral with its enclosed water and contemplate past cultures rather than the hedonism of that prevailing today.

What a great place to wander around. Try to go in the evening when it is a little cooler. Lots to look at and imagine the history. Once in a while you will see a nice little place to have a snack nd a drink.

Great place for some wonderful food and photos.. Just a must see when you are in Barcelona. Its wonderful to walk around and soak in the history... I loved it here... Its easy to lose your bearings so try to use landmarks as guides... and if you do get lost just ask anyone for directions to La Ramblas and you will be back on track.

Beautiful architecture. With my boyfriend for 10 days in Barcelona and have to say that this area is our personal favourite - stunning architecture and lovely shops. Suggest exploring the alleys as we found some hidden gems when we put away our maps.

The District to Stray In. Loved staying at a hotel across from the Cathedral. This part of Barcelona begs you to explore all the side streets and allies. Convenient to La Ramblas, easy access by metro to other parts of town, this is the place to stay in Barcelona to get a feel of the city. Not as chic as Eixample district but more old world flavor.
Charming part of BCN. Just let yourself get lost in this part of BCN. Many small genuine shops and bar where to stop for a beer or Sangria. Beware of the amount of walking you might do...
Gothic Quarter!. A must see for all of the little corridors, architecture, cathedral. We were lucky enough to be there on a city holiday, hundreds of people everywhere, but so much to see.
History through your eyes and ears. We took a walking tour of this area with Runner Beans free tour. It was great. We saw and heard the history of this older neighborhood of Barcelona.
Gothic. walking thru Barcelona gothic quarter is an experience, surprises around every corner, great places for lunch, museums, squares where you can just sit and relax,
Lose yourself.. A great place to explore, the design means it keeps cool on hot days so a great place to cool down. lots of shops,bars and places to eat. Definitely worth a visit.
interesting. It was very interesting walking through the narrow winding streets. We stopped to look at the cathedral which was impressive. There is alot of history here.
Beautiful!. The whole area is just enchanting! The little cobblestone streets, the wonderful shops, the fabulous cafes and restaurants! So many cultural attractions too. It has it all!

Charming and fun. The Barri Gotic should be part of any visit to Barcelona. It's easily accessible from the Rambla. Even though most of the people there are tourists just like you it is still great for wandering around tight streets and admiring the architecture. Be wary of the restaurants and bars, most of the are tourist traps.
Gothic Quarter stroll. This ancient quarter of the city is fun for shopping and eating. Grab a taxi to it and spend 1-3 hours roaming, shopping and eating tapas!
Steeped in history. Loved the narrow winding alleys and lanes which are filled with shops, bars and eateries, full of history and great architecture

Charming. Very busy and crowded place but still has its charm. It is nice to be visited, a lot of small streets, stores, old houses. There are several very nice squares that have restaurants and churches. This neighborhood is a good transition from Passeig de Gracia to La Rambla.

mesmerizing piece of art. Amazing place to see ancient architecture, its very mesmerizing when you at these pieces of art it takes you to the time when they were built, so precise, so methodical and so much science behind making it makes it what it is.

Old Quarter , you should visit. Walking in this quarter, visiting the old church and shopping from the old market is an experience to try. I like old quarters, you can leave the history of the country while walking...
Stroll around these neighborhood. Great neighborhood to stroll aorund. Lots of things to see to shop & to eat!!! Huge churches to visit.

Great time exploring el Barrio Gotic. I really enjoyed exploring this area walking through the medieval streets, tons of fun stores, old cathedrals, street entertainers, statues, restaurants and museums. Just be careful of pick pockets, I had no problems I just was cautious.

A great part of the city to explore. Of all the parts of Barcelona we visited this was our favourite.
Avoid the crowds and move away from the main thoroughfares to find the bits of real Catalonia in the bars and cafés full of locals.
A great part of the city to spend time
A nice walk. Stopped here and walked around for some time (Was using the on/off bus). An interesting area, with a surprising number of book stands. Church is amazing. Lots of restuarants too.
Not to be missed. The alley ways are wonderful and are very interesting with lots of character. It makes for a fantatisc way to spend a day walking through the area.

Get lost exploring the narrow streets!. This area was our main reason we came to Barcelona. Old Roman walled city is a great adventure. Plenty of cafes, restaurants , shopping . Recommend hiring a local guide to walk you through this historic walled city!

Great to visit and see Old BCN!. I loved just walking around the entire Gothic Quarter. There were cool shops and cafes and old Churches to explore. The buildings were great to see and it felt as you traveled back in time, especially at the Barcelona Museum (to see the Roman Ruins). Turn off Las Ramblas and just get lost in this great section of the city.
stroll around. Barcelona is a brillinat city and this part is lovely to stroll around and relax in. Lots of leafy shaded area and little restaurnts to stop off at.
Really interesting. Seemingly endless lanes, quirky shops and diverse cafes and bars. Looks very different at night, bit more edgy. Loved it!

Barcelona's most interesting quarter. You should take tour of this interesting medieval section of Barcelona. For me it was the most interesting part of the city. In this section is the Barcelona Cathedral, interesting museums, buildings, and good restaurants. It is easily reached by public transportation or walking.

Best part of the city. You must experience this part of the city, with the Barcelona Catedral my favourite place to visit in the city, simply amazing. Also a great area to sit, eat and drink- Milk Restaurant previously reviewed is a great starter for 10

Takes back many centuries. By far the best part of Barcelona, just as you step in this locality, you will travel back many centuries, anyone who has the taste of Gregorian chant will love this area....

It's all a blur. Yes we had a tour guide, but it was tough to absorb all that was there, from Roman walls to gothic architecture, to where movies were filmed. Maybe this is an area better done on your own and just enjoy what is there instead of focusing on so much information.

Ugh. Ok so you have to go here while in Barcelona. But I would not recommend staying here if you are over 30. Stay in Born. Very close but outside the craziness. Born has great restaurants and bars but 80% less hustle, scams, crappy street performers etc. my $0.02

Love it! . Was introduced on a tour of Barcelona, and was sufficiently captivated to want to return. This is one of my favorite places in Barcelona. Little alleys in which you can get lost- but not too lost. Discoveries waiting around every corner- a geletaria, a restaurant, a chocolate maker, a traditional shop of some kind- it's all worth spending time just wandering. It feels perfectly safe, without the commercialism of Las Ramblas. Roman remains and the cathedral add to the charm. A tour might be in order if you want more information.
Good walkabout and shopping. We spent the afternoon doing a walkabout in the area. One can easily spend a full day here visitng the sites, museums, eat tapas etc. (And oh yes, shop till you drop...)
Weekend Getaway. Beautiful place to get away and enjoy the streets of Barcelona! Loved all of Gaudi, Tapas and scenery! Family friendly, and very clean.

A walk through history.. Feel like royalty as walk the stone layed streets of the gothic quarter. The palace, the church and the market literally take you back in time. Try some of the local pastry shops offerings with a hot cup of cafe! Quick and easy access from the subway, so no need for a car. Unforgettable memories are made here.
Amazing!!!! 😀 . Got lost here for 2 day it was fabulous we wondered around the shops enjoyed the culture and tried some brilliant local cuisine we cannot wait to come back

Great Area in Barcelona. This area is very relaxing and has a much slower pace than the more tourist areas.The architecture is extremely captivating and there are so many different restaurants to eat in.There is much less of a rip off culture here and most places are much cheaper to eat than in the Rambles etc.
Get lost and have fun!. Loved this area of Barcelona. Great atmosphere and so Amy wonderful places to eat and enjoy Catalan food.
Most impressive part of Barcelona. Catering genuine spirit. great combination of gothic buildings and art re-creations. Lots of arts and spirit. Must see in barcelona!
The old part of town. Avoid La Rambla and just wander around the old streets - get lost and discover unexpected pleasures.

Romantic. I love walking round this area at night time, hand in hand with my soul mate. You turn the corner and there's a violinist or a small street jazz concert.Go for a drink in many of its bars and walk the night away.

Great for walking, shopping, photo snapping. The Gothic Quarter, i.e. The old town of Barcelona with its little streets, narrow lanes and small shops and restaurants. Be aware of pickpockets, but if you are vigilant you ahould be fine. Lots of photo snapping possible with statues, door openings, churches, etc. scattered around.

Incredible architecture. This area in Barcelona is so relaxing and rewarding at the same time. Nice streets, nice restaurants, nice shops. Lots of tourist but pleasant. And the buildings ! wow, the atmosphere is incredible. Don't miss it.

Joys of Barcelona. Just wonderful to meander along these narrow cool lanes. Little shops and cafes along the way leading onto wonderful views, one thin about the Gothic Quarter, you must remember to look up.
Walk around this quarter, you want regred it.. Best place in Barcelona. Very charming and in real mediterranean style. We've spent one day walking around this quarter.
Barri Gothic. Amazing walk around the place, just dont plan walk around and explore the structures are amazing. Quite a few places to eat around. Get on a bike pedal around and its just beautiful.

One of the best places in BCN to loose the map. I heard once that Veneziano was the best place to get lost. Despite not beeing so big, the gothic old neighborhood of Barcelona is also one of thise places that you get happy to get lost. Many small art galleries, boutique hotels, restaurantes, shops,,, Just wonderfull experiences.

If you like old and creepy.. There is much that meets the eye and much that does not. Understanding the history that brings this place alive can be done by reading or taking a tour with a guide. Let's just say much blood was shed in this area over hundreds of years. So glad we have replaced public hangings with cafes.

It's ...Gothic. The whole quarter looks out of the books and movies. The only thing out of place there are the tourists. The Streets are charming and the taverns also. It's a very nice place to just have a walk. On the way back to the hotel I felt I really wanted to go back and explore some more the next day.

beautiful quarter. we were there every day, trying another restaurant, looking at beautiful stores, listening to music and enjoying the old quarters. We stayed right in the area, so it was obviously a given, to stroll around there. This is probably the most beautiful area in Barcelona. Look for a guitar concert in an old church. Sometimes, tickets can be bought only in the church itself.
a good place to explore. you have to amble through this area if you visit barcelona. it is quite different to some of the other ares, and it is worth exploring

Great atmosphere away from busy streets. An area of old buildings and narrow streets. Lovely and cool on a hot day with lots of different sorts of shops and restuarants. We enjoyed just strolling round without a map to see what we could find.

Gothic Quarter. This is the best way to experience the history of Barcelona from very early in the modern era. There is a lot to be learned about the impact of damage caused by the Spanish Civil War, the history of Jews in Barcelona, and its attempt to preserve its history.Best viewed with a guide.

Amazing Old Town!!. Just wander around this amazing place. Don't miss the museum of Barcelona's history! So interesting that they preserved the original parts of the Roman city of 2000 years ago, then the Visigoth's structures too!!

Lovely place to wander the streets. I love the atmosphere. There's always going to be lots of people milling around but the quiet side streets make the place more tranquil. I like the variety of the independent shops, and the cafes and bars tucked away.

Lovely area a must see. Barcelona has so much culture to offer and the gothic quarter exemplifies this very well. Depending on where you start ensure you make it to el born area too where there are more cafes and open spaces. Great with kids too.

Wonderful place to wander...much to see. We had a wonderful experience walking through this quarter and learning about the many centuries of history...much of which seems to be as current in the memory of the locals now as it was hundreds of years ago. Coming from a country whose western heritage is less than 200 years old (of course our indigenous history is many thousands years older) we find it amazing to see and touch buildings and structures that have been in existence for so long. Definitely worth visiting here with a local or good tour guide, many little shops, gardens, restaurants and places to see,

Heaps of history . A must do in Barcelona. Take a walking tour, I took the feel free walking tour which starts in front of Hard Rock Cafe. Lots of character, stories and charm. You could easily spend the whole day here.

Great part of town. We stayed at the Arai Aparthotel in the Gothic quarter and couldn't have been happier. So many great restaurants and shops as well as a great vibe. Very narrow streets but so much to take in. Wish we could have stayed longer.
Extraordinary. Do a walk tour for this area comprising the old cathedral, the roman walls, and the Picasso museum. It is living history!
Delightful shops. Fascinating place to visit and stroll. Good restaurants, unique shops and delightful streets. Can't ask for more, really...

A piece of heaven . This area of Barcelona is breathtaking. Lot of restaurants and bars with great service. A lot of small businesses to get souvenirs. The small streets you can walk through are definitely a piece of heaven. One stop at "my burrito y yo" for tapas will make your day there perfect. Worth visiting!
Gothic Bliss. Full of old world culture and charm Surrounded by numerous shops and cafés. You could spend days happily getting turned around the narrow streets and alleyways

Architecture? History? Shopping? Eating/Drinking? Got it all!. Depending on your stamina, you could easily spend all day and all night wandering this compact area, browsing the shops and markets, admiring the buildings dating from Roman times to Gaudí masterpieces, and indulging in a snack or a meal.

Spend a few hours getting lost in the Gothic Quarter. Visited on our trip once during the day and once at night. In the evening the place comes alive with music, performances and bars and restaurants. Lots of places to eat and drink. Little shops to visit offering similar tourist goodies and some unique ones. During the day you can appreciate the beauty of the architecture. Worth a visit!

A wonderful area to visit. A wonderful area of Barcelona to spend the day in. Starting at Placa Catalunya in the center of town we walked down to the waterfront visiting shops, cafes, & bistros. We set aside one day to see this area and could have stayed for numerous more days to see everything. We took the Fat Tire Bike Tour which starts in this section of town which is a good way to see the sights in this area.
Walk back in time. I like walking around old cities that don't change to much. Pleasant walk through medival streets. Restaurants galore. Winding narrow streets to get lost in.

Fantastic area to wander and take in the sights.. We stayed in the Hesperian Barri Gotic Hotel which was a great location to explore the Gotic area. It is a myriad of tiny lanes, lovely architecture,shops and restaurants with open squares now and again to sit and have a beer. Keep a look out for the cyclists and skateboarders who appear out of nowhere!.

Barcelona Old Town !!!. It is surely one of the most beautiful and interesting areas to visit once in Barcelona. This part of the city will take you back in history to medieval times. Narrow streets, ancient buildings, beautiful sites and landmarks. Full of restaurants, bars and cafes. A must visit in Barcelona.

Get the sense of the original Barcelona. This neighborhood is very easy to find, safe to walk and centrally located area close to the center of Barcelona - Place Catalunya - as well as the Cathedral. I was a little dismayed to see the commercialization of the area to the many different stores and cafes and restaurants, but the area still has the original charm due to the very narrow and organic street system. Until about 9 pm many of the streets are wall to wall people. It is close to Las Ramblas, another of Barcelona "musts" and also close to the Place Catalunya. We went through the area many times during this stay (we have been in Barcelona a couple of times before) since we chose a hotel in this area for this reason and ate/drank at tapas places several times in this area.
Splendid. Take the free walking tour, pick it up in Jaume. You will be taken round this fascinating area of the city.
It's old. VERY old!. We wandered through here parts of two days this week. There is always something interesting to discover around the next corner.

Barcelona trip . Spent the day wondering the gothic quarter, what lovely part of the city, just walking though the narrow streets enjoying the atmosphere was a perfect day to end our trip to Barcelona.
Don't miss out and hope you enjoy as much as we did

Pleased with what we saw. On such a short trip to BCN we didn't have much time to look around, however we were impressed with the amount of bars and restaurants around this area that is shockingly reasonably priced!
Medieval adventure. The Gothic Quarter is an adventure back in time but with historic sights, trendy shops and lots of tourists. Great walking.
A great place to get lost. A great place to get lost... We wandered for for hours absorbing the atmosphere. Plenty to see... And eat!

Not bad for shopping. I really don't see the whole hype about this place. It is quite good for shopping, but there is dozen things in Barcelona I would visit before this place.
However, maybe this is due the whole expectetion story, which is immense.
You should check it, for sure. If nothing else, it is good for shopping.

Great area to stay in. So pleased we chose to stay in Barri Gotic rather than as close to Las Ramblas as possible. It was so quaint and intimate with the narrow cobbled streets and small boutiques. Loads and loads of great restaurants, cafes, bars, yet still just a 10 minute walk to the big city feel of Las Ramblas.

Great architecture, shops & restaurants. The Gothic Quarter is a must-see when in Barcelona. The buildings are amazing & the shops are like hidden gems with some very unusual products on offer. The restaurants are plentiful & in my experience were very good. The only downside is that the area can become incredibly busy, which makes trying to get in-to buildings/viewing things difficult.
Great area.. Great area for walking around. Lot's of shops and restaurants. Hidden gems all around. Highly recommend.

Great Place to get lost. Well worth getting lost and exploring the miriad of streets all with interesting things around the corner. However, be sure to take a decent street map so you can find your way back out! Recommemnded

Lovely place to roam around. A must visit place in Barcelona to really feel the city old charisma and life style. Most of the sight seeing locations are free (check timings of some of churches, only few hours are free) to visit with a gratuity if you wish for. Lovely tiny streets, cathedrals, small vendors all through.

Fascinating. I would love to go back to this area, so interesting and user friendly. So many interesting shops to stroll through and restaurants, cafes, markets etc. We were lucky enough to stay in this area and to go out the front door of the hotel in any direction, there was so much to see. Going down La Rambla there was all sorts of life going on, people queueing to get on buses, people feeding pidgeons in the square, musicians playing outside department stores, stalls selling all sorts of food and tourist gifts. Just so exciting. If you can, do stay here, the quality of shops is really good and visit the food markets as well. Also there are beautiful old churches and alleyways to meander through.
Holiday escapade. Very nice and refreshing. Enjoyed our stayed on this area. The food was really nice and the people very friendly and loads of entertainer.
All you need is in Barri Gotic. So many hotels, restaurants, shopping, music, art, architecture and people! Around every corner was something interesting to see or hear...
must see!!. so much fun wandering in and out of these streets. Cobblestones, character and surprising sights in every inch!

Must do stroll area! The shopping fabulous! . Enjoyed taking in the beautiful historical sights while enjoying world class shopping. Endless boutiques, nice international stores and (of course) shops featuring souvenirs. Very safe, very enjoyable.

Just full of Magic. This portion of Barcelona is truly magic and somewhat other-worldly. Its steeped in history but scatted with trendy little shops that you can buy clothes or phone covers etc in.We happened upon a street performer who had the most amazing opera voice and when she sang ave maria inferno of the Church is was definitely a moment for me. We spent a long wonderful evening there. As with anywhere in Barcelona you must be aware of pick-pockets etc but regardless the Gothic quarter is absolutely 100% worth a visit. Just magic!
Could spend hours here. Great place to shop and potter about, but not in the rain!. Lots of lovely little shops in tiny streets leading to little squares and plenty of places to eat.

Great neighbourhood. Old bulidings with a fantastic scent of history mixed with friendly people, restaurants and small cafes of all kinds. Also lots of romantic squares and always a new experience/surprise round the next corner. Barri Gotic is close to almost everything, but if you prefer public transport the metro is near by. I suggest that you choose a hotel a bit away from La Rambla because of the noise, but 100 metres away is far enough.

Narrow streets between more then interesting architecture. The most interesting part of any town I ever seen. Simply you can't be bored there, you need only to raise your look on facades you'll find there, and you'll be surprised.

Very interesting place to walk about. Great area to stroll around with lots of interesting things to see. plenty of shops and restaurants. pity that the churches all seem to want heaps of money to enter. doesnt seem right.

Awesome stay in this quarter!!!. The first place I stayed in Barcelona was in this quarter! I stayed in a beautiful roof top apartment and loved it. I read a lot of reviews and they mostly said that staying in this quarter was noisy. I disagree. It was quiet and very central located. If the apartment was closer to Las Ramblas then maybe so. I stayed off Carrer de Ferran near the Starbucks and a hostel and it was very quiet! There is a plethora of shopping and eating oportunities! Very central and advantageous to explore all of Barcelona! If I didn't love the Barceloneta area so much I would stay in this area!!
atmospheric Labyrinth. Explore this atmospheric labyrinth during daylight hours. Amazing character of historic Barcelona and home still to many people.
Great place to wonder. The Gothic Quarter is a great place to wonder around and see the small shops and resturants. Its very busy from noon and till late at night, fun place to walk around

The 'real' Barcelona.... If you want to get the feeling of the old Barcelona, you have to stroll through the little streets in Barrio Gothic. Smell the city, discover secret streets and entrances, pass over great market places ...
Go early in the morning. The gothic architecture is best seen early in the morning when there are fewer tourists. The curving, narrow streets are all different.
Wander. Wonderful, old area of Barcelona and well worth wandering through for a few days. Great tapas restaurants, great shopping and museums! Just go!
Wonderful Area!. Loved this area, so vibrant and full of diverse cultures. Amazing how people can come together in one area and the architecture surrounding the area is beautiful.
Fun. Felt as if I was in the medieval time.As a jew , I had very intense emotions walking in the quarter. It was amazing
Great sense of old Barcelona. This old section of the city is fascinating with its narrow, twisting streets and laneways, countless cafes and funky shops. You could spend days here exploring it.

Interesting old quarter of Barcelona. Easy to spend a day here wandering around the old part of Barcelona city, not as commercial as Las Ramblas with a lot of quirky shops in between some of the more famous names, good for bars and local food and an excellent opportunity to photograph some really interesting architecture.

Don't miss the chance. A wonderful place for a quiet stroll for - well, for as long as you can take, Quaint and accessible, devoid of tourists for the most part, it requires you to simply lift your eyes and look. Narrow streets, marvellous architectural delights. Don't rush, just look.
Walk around here any time to find something interesting. Great for a relaxing stroll , you will always see something interesting. Barcelona Cathedral and Palau de la Musica are not to be missed.

Great place to explore, but do expect to get lost!. So interesting & much bigger than I imagined. Very easy to get lost as the maps all seem to be on quite a big scale. Nevertheless, well worth wandering lost for a while. Do not trust GPS though as the reception is quite poor owing to the tall, close buildings

Great experience. Great neibourhood and great food. you can really feel the living and breathing Barcelona in this little portion of the city. We walked around for some 2 hours astonished at the architecture. great people watching!

A must do place. Great part of the City with fabulous history and buildings.
Very central to a lot of places of interest. Plenty of night life and Restaurants and bars.Lots of people out enjoying the fine evenings.Also felt very safe.

Lovely old area close to the over touristic las Ramblas. Well worth a walk around. Very interesting area of Barcelona with quaint old streets and buildings, if a little touristy. Great to walk around and there are many boutique style shops and places to buy local food.
L o v e l y. A fantastic area for everyone! Plenty of food, bars, shopping and lively alleyways. Definitely visit this area while in Barcelona!

Amazing place to experience Medieval Barcelona. The gothic quarter itself was gorgeous. Full of history that you can feel as you walk through the space, but unfortunately leaves you wanting more. The cathedral is somewhere that you have to visit and was the only building that still embraced its gothic style inside and out. The streets in the area are a little confusing, you think you might be lost, but if you walk a little further you will end up on a main road because the area is so small. Don't be afraid to visit the area in the evening either, it continues to be crawling with people even after midnight. Overall it is an area of the city that you must visit before leaving the city.

Great place for walking around for hours. This neighborhood is amazing!!! Not only is one of the best spots to each tapas and pinxos, but as well is such a cool place to get lost around the little streets. Every block is different and you can see the outside of the buildings that some look old, but a lot of them have old architecture but very well maintained.The best part.. Is that you can just walk and walk and walk and discover things along the way!!
Food, Bars, Shopping. Wandering this area was the highlight of Barcalona. There are so many hidden secrets to discover behind each door.
Nice stumbled surprise. We stumbled across this by accident but so glad we did. The detail is beautiful and such a contrast to some of the other surrounding streets.
Definitely worth a visit. Really interesting buildings and architecture to look at also plenty of areas to eat and shop. Must go and visit cathedral very cheap to get in

In order to find yourself you need to... lose yourself ;). The perfect way to get to know the Gothic Quarter is to lose yourself. Start walking and stop paying attention to turns you're taking or streets you're passing. Gothic Quarter gives people an incredible feeling that they belong. Yes, you belong! You instantly become part of the crowd. And what crowd! Vibrant, diverse, walking with no purpose or with purpose! Always busy, always welcoming - a paradise for people who love to see the architecture during the day and those who want to sense the nightlife and have fun! One of the few places I've been to that appear majestic AND entertaining at the same time. Lose yourself in the Gothic Quarter and enjoy the amazing experience of one of the most beautiful areas in Barcelona!!
great street. getting off the coach at estacion du nord ,this street has some great bars and shops ,well worth a visit
Romantic. I found the place nice and intetesting, but most buildings were the same and after a while got bored, bit definitely worth going
Get lost on the side streets. Lots of great restaurants here. Get lost among the tiny side streets and enjoy the boutiques. W found a lot of beautiful, original art to take home.
charming afternoon stroll. charming stroll. very nice to just wonder and get lost. beware of the usual tourist traps and just walk in to those places that have a lot of locals. can't go wrong.

The Essence of Barcelona. The Gothic Quarter is the core of Barcelona. Here you find the Cathedral, the old Jewish Quarter, and the wonderful narrow winding streets that give Barcelona its magical personality. You also can discover great chocolate shops and fantastic bakeries
Best place. In my opinion one of the nicest areas of barcelona. The best restaurants are located i this area. Worth it to walk through

Lost in time. Each morning we wandered along the small streets of the Gothic Quarter eating breakfast at little pastry shops with the locals. The streets are so narrow and quaint and clean (if you are early in the morning you may have to dodge the street cleaners in their little trucks washing the streets). We did a walking tour with Runner Bean Tours (great company) around this area which taught us so much. In the evenings we wandered around finding little squares with restaurants to eat in and never had a bad plate of food (and we tried a lot). There are lots of little shops in this area, ice - cream parlours, bars, tapas bars, churches, local going about their everyday life and we loved soaking up the atmosphere.

Beautiful place. Loved this neighborhood, beautiful architecture, great shops (tho not very cheap), amazing people. If you love history you should totally check out all the Roman buildings and structures at this neighborhood.
Cool. A really cool area of Barcelona - especially for those travellers who like taking photos. Definitely take a visit to the Gothic Quarter if you're there!
Worth the walk. So very charming. Love the architecture! Just take a stroll around to take it all in! I'm completely in love with Barcelona.

Very spanish and interesting area. This is the tourist heart of Barcelona I suppose.On one side is sea front. The road along sea front is really nice to walk,jog,bike. There is wide pedestrian area on that road.Other edge is La Rambala (the main tourist area in the town. It is happening place also.This quarter has many churches, cafes, restaurants and beautiful buildings to see.You can spend time here based on how much time you have.
Living museum. Great walking area with something interesting and beautiful to see all around the place. Good shops, outdoor stands, and restaurants.

Gothic Quarter & Cathedral. Narrow streets in the old city, little shops and cafes. The cathedral of Barcelona is located here. Our guide reallymade the experience more meaningful and easier tonavigate.
Get lost in this neighbourhood, beautiful. Get lost in this neighbourhood, beautiful.Lots of eccentric stores, tapas bars. This is where most of the city's monuments are.
Very Picturesque!. Beautiful, old architecture. If you love history, take a guide along.We did a walking photoshoot your in this quarter and LOVED every bit of it!
A Look at the past. Walking through this area gives one a sense of traveling thru time into the past. You can really get a feel for what is was to live in the old city.

Great day in Barri Gothic/El Born. Seen one, seen 'em all. How much shopping can you do? Despite my mind set I still had a great time strolling Barri Gothic/El Born. And we ate local and shopped. I even bought things! Had a great day and night.
Must visit. Do not miss the chance to see the old soul of the city .. it is the heart of old BARCELONA , while walking u feel the history ..it deserves ☺

History and modern. So much to see..so many legends.Myths?? Spent 3 tours in gothic quarter and still just at the tip of the iceberg. Recomend the free tour and the medieval torture tour...very inexpensive way to start..then just wonder and google!!

The Gothic Quarter. One needs a day or two to explore the Gothic quarter. The one main thing to see is the Gothic cathedral, which is absolutely beautiful.The best time to go is for the special visit in the afternoon from 1 to 5. You pay seven euros a piece, whereas otherwise at other times it is free. However you have access to the choir, the cloister, and you are able to go up to the roof to see a beautiful view of the city. It is nice to wander the streets of the Gothic quarter because there are many small restaurants and cafés, bars, beautiful stores and a lot of atmosphere. A visit to the Gothic water can be coupled with a walk down the Rambla.

A must see area of Barcelona. Great alleyways and narrow streets to wander and get lost. It is cool (literally) to be out of the sun. There were lots of cafes and Tapas bars as well as the usual souvenir shops.

Lovely place to strroll around. We walked around the Barri Gotic using a route in a guide book and despite getting lost a couple of times, we enjoyed walking the narrow streets and looking at the buildings. If you have the time, it is worth a visit.

Great food, great bars and clubs! . Amazing! We got haggled quite a bit though and it's very intimidating being a young girl and these men promoting their clubs touch you on the arm. However the food in the main bit is gorgeous and we went to a club there and got free entry and it felt like a good quality club like back in England.

Wander down the side-streets. The best time to stroll down the Rambla is in the morning before it becomes crowded. In order to avoid the afternoon crowds wander off onto the side-streets. Every corner has something new and fun.
young and pretty. walking around the Gothic Quarter was a mecca for people watching! We ate and shopped and love the flavor of the area. Fun and easy to get around. People so friendly.

Get Lost. This is an area of the city that it's best to spend hours in. Get lost in the small streets past the tourist area. You'll discover unique stores and great architecture. It's great for dinner and dessert as well.

Stunning old town. Lovely small alleys and old old buildings. You can easily get lost in all the alleys so be aware of this.
Only slightly ruined by the sheer amount of segways in the area from the segway tours, but you end up having to jump to the side to move out of their way, which is somewhat annoying
Brilliant area. We stayed in this area and found it to be ideal for visiting the beach and shops.fantastic to just meander and lose yourself in the streets and atmosphere.
Medieval streets, tiny shops. This area of Barcelona has lots of tiny windy streets, quirky shops, and a funky style. Walk through to feel its style and youthful life.

A must.. This is the most fabulous area. A perfect mix of idiosyncratic shops, ranging from the most tatty tourist tat, to beautiful hand crafted shoes, clothes and furniture. A huge range of great coffee shops, ice cream shops restaurants and bars.

Great place to stay. I loved staying in the Gothic quarter, I was within walking distance to everything I wanted to see. The buildings I. The Gothic quarter are stunning. The streets are narrow which adds to the vibe.

Mark you path with a piece of string!. Incredible history to imagine what used to happen in these streets. Don't be afraid to get lost to discover new parts, areas can be quite different.
Its extra wow if you walk around in the morning as there aren't so many people around so you can enjoy the atmosphere more

Take a stroll back in time, and enjoy the slower pace of yesteryear!. Worth the stroll for a few hours to get the feel of the old city!
Take a stroll back in time, and enjoy the slower pace of yesteryear!

Very beautiful neighbourhood!. I lived there during my stay and i just enjoyed it. Narrow and small little streets, filled with bars and restaurants. Little squares and big churches right next to each other! Just beautiful
Beautiful!. We stumbled across the gothic quarter while wandering Barcelona on our first night in the city. Amazing! Just so beautiful to walk around and listen to all the street performers.
Charming old Quarter. It's easy to get lost in the buzzing streets of Barri Gotic, very lively, charming streets, just as almost every crowded place, beware of pickpockets

Beautiful area to explore. Centred around the beautiful mediaeval cathedral the Bari Gotic is the original town of Barcelona. It is a maze of narrow streets and original features that make it a delight to explore. You'll need to cover up knees and shoulders to be admitted to the cathedral, but it is definitely worth it.

Great walking tour of the Gothic Tour. Had a walking tour with a small group. Our guide Judith was awesome.
