What was nice about walking was that you are able to really enjoy the different facets of the Gothic Quarter, stopping at different locations, and appreciating the architecture history behind it, as explained by your tour guide. For the small price you pay, it's well worth it and much better than if you were to try and navigate the streets yourself.

Overwhelming beautiful . Miles of stunning winding streets full of stores, cafes, beautiful cathedrals, churches, terraces. Forget your map and get lost in the winding streets, you won't regret it. Barcelona, and particularly this part of the city is the most architecturally astounding places I've been in the world so far!

Unique. Lots of shops, restaurants and cafesTake the time to wonder the unique streets throughout the gothic quarter. You can wonder right into Las Ramblas & down to the beach. No issues with pickpockets.

Take the Sandeman's free tour of the Gothic Quarter. We took a very good Sandeman's New Barcelona walking tour of the Gothic Quarter that is free--just tip your guide what you want at the end of the tour. Our guide was "Billy" who was born in Barcelona, raised in Ireland and returned to Barcelona as an adult. She was an informative and entertaining guide and we learned a lot about the history of Barcelona. Highly recommended!

Gothic quarter ....a treasure hunt . Lots to discover and see.. This by far is one of the interesting areas of Barcelona. If like me you like surprises , this is the place to head for. Full of historical discoveries, museums, cathedrals, monuments, squares , amazing architecture, you need to look up when walking or you miss something, because the streets are narrow , cobbled so charming too that you keep looking around you. This area is what I call my treasure hunt. You must come of the main La Rambla and wander into the Gothic quarter. Lots of shop, cafes, little restaurant s with the local feel. And yes, very touristy too. You would love it.
Great place!. We had a great time wondering the streets during the day. At night we went to a couple local bars and had a blast. Must see!

a place of atmosphere. The gothic quarter to me is ideal for everything. you can see all the famous museums {gaudi} etc.THe area itself is a big square with lots of little streets leading to Los Ramblas the most famous street of Barcelona.in these little streets you find different cafes selling typical spainish food, like tapas.Tapas is a selection of foods usually small and you order a lot of different dishes to try.in the gothic area are some of the most well known fashion labels.these are for the average traveller, and are priced at reasonable prices for what you get. there is ZARA , H&M DESIGUAL, LES CORTES INGLES DEPART MENT STORE WITH SPANISH AND EUROPEAN LABELS, and many more labels and unknown labels which are typical spanish. IF you want souvenirs you can get plenty at the gothic area.on the weekends they have a market right in the middle of the souare. there are many good hotels in this area. everything is accessible from here. you can taxi to the beach or see the other important sites. The only thing to be cautios of are the gypsies who come around i packs and could pick your wallet or bag easily.don,t wear a lot of jewellery that would draw attention to you. on the whole a wonderful experience to go or stay in the gothic area .We have stayed there about six times, and would gladly return again anytime.

In awe. Couldn't even imagine anything like this in a Disney film. It's absolutely incredible and you could spend forever looking at everything. I never expected anything as intricate as what we saw. It's very maze like. Shops still bustling at 10pm.

Great to wander. Great wee streets for just wandering around and feeling lkost in time . lots of wee shops,bars and wonderful buildings. Can be a haven in the hot sun as its narrow streets provide natural shade.

Loved it . Me and my husband took a walking tour to Gothic Quarter. Simply amazing as so much history to it and a treat for the eyes. A must do when in Barcelona. Every lane, every corner has its own beauty. Definitely recommend.
From Vancouver
Great Place to Get Lost. Just wonder around and find a nice local place to grab a drink and some Tapas -- and just enjoy the people and sounds of the Gothic Quarter.
Saint felip de nery . I loved it it was amazing took some flicks kissed my girl at the mithical student fountain .lovely there was a magic in the air and i felt it from.second one ..amazing place

Wonderful . Its wonderful place you can visit it and you will enjoy by seeing this sights its fantastic I will come again to gothic quarter I'm feeling there by magic really natural magic I love Spain and all sights there every year I visit Barcelona for this magic
It's Like A Maze. Very narrow roads, very similar road names and style. It's very hard to navigate around the area without a map or following a tour guide. It's a must area to visit in Barcelona.
2 nights exploring . Did 2 nights exploring this area some great bars and restaurants especially the tapas bars you get lost up alley ways Some of restaurants are dearer so have a wonder around

Worth visiting. One of my favourite neighborhoods and quaters in the city. You can either take the free walking tour around the area or just walk around and enjoy the narrow charming streets, and great little shops restaurants and bars hiding, good places to enjoy tapas. Definitely worth spending time here and lots of sight seeing.
Time travel. Amazing structures that stand the test of time... So rich in history a must visit... The Royal Palace and chapel along with the Viceroy Palace is amazing.

Crazy little place.... Barcelona is an amazing place. Before I arrived in Catalonia, everybody told me about the Rambla and how crazy it is. Got off the Metro on to the Rambla people everywhere it was crazy, didn't know what to think. I was staying at the Hotel Call in the Gothic Quarter which is just off the Rambla, beautiful place full of close pathways and little shops really really recommend staying here. I found out where my hotel was via my phone an just looked at this intriguing little alleyway's full of character's and my hotel was just at the other end of it. I remember being quite anxious about walking through here with my bag, I did so and it really wasn't bad an over the course of the week I spent here I gain an affinity for this area. Honesty the Gothic Quarter is the place to be.

Quarter with so much history - fantastic!. This was one of my favorite quarters in Barcelona. The history is astonishing. Make sure to see the remains of the Augustus Temple and do not miss the Barcelona Museum. While in the museum do not miss on the archeological diggings below the museum. It is probably one of the coolest things I've seen while traveling.If you want to go to the Cathedral, go early and see if you can buy tickets before hand. We didn't go in because the line was extremely long and it was very hot outside.

Full of hidden gems. To really experience the Gothic neighborhood you have to allow yourself to get lost in the narrow alleys, taste the local food in the hidden restaurants and stroll around ignoring time! It is a quite similar to the smalls alleys in Venice without the water element

A really unique and fun area to walk though. A really unique and fun area to walk though. Streets are narrow, but you get to see a lot of beautiful gothic architecture. Every street is different and there's always something to see. Great place to do a little shopping or just sit and people-watch.

Historical Barcelona. This place is very interesting as each turn you make will give you a great photo opportunity. There are a lot of shops and restaurants all over this area. I felt like walking around here gives you a sense of the Old Barcelona.

Disapointed. We drove round and round what was called the Gothic Quarter and never managed to really find it! We had the Sat Nav with us and still could not find it. We parked the car in the area and set off on foot, but with no luck. We saw one Gothic building all in all. We hope others have better luck in finding it.

Gothi heart of Barcelona. Loved this area when we visited it last New Year - so lively and full of great shops, eateries and historical monuments, churches etc. We were fortunate enough to be staying in the quarter so all of this was on our doorstep and the area makes the ideal base for exploring the city.

A different side of Barcelona. This is my second trip to Barcelona. I stayed in town and was able to walk the gothic quarter. this is alike a different world. The narrow streets are uncrowded and make you feel like the 16th century. As evening approaches everything turns to shadows and you can imagine life back then.Seeing the cathedral frames by small alleyways is amazing.I recommend a walking tour for a few hours.

an interesting walk.. walking throught this area was just mystical and very interesting. I would say this is good to do on your own. Do a little research before I read dk top 10 Barcelona and lonely planet make my day barcelona..both great books
Rented apartment. We stayed in this barrio ( neighborhood). The location was perfect for seeing and accessing many of the " things to do in Barcelona "

FExperience the real Barcelona. This is the place where the heart of Barcelona lies. The little laneways are the heart and soul of the people. Just do a quiet stroll through these narrow laneways and variety of crooked buildings balconies to get the "vibe" of this majestic city!
View from the hop on bus. View while riding the hop on hop off bus ...they will explain detail for you. Stop and have lunch at one of the many neat spots.
A lovely wander through narrow streets. Loved the narrow streets, the quaint bars, shops, cafes and cathedral. Make sure you stops off at the Place Real and take in the atmosphere.

Stunning cathedral and square. The quarter was very close to our hotel so was lovely to explore in our own time. My sister and I went in to the Cathedral, tickets were €7, very beautiful to look at and so magical to experience. There are some stunning paintings and frescos if you enjoy art and a separate area to sit and pray. The architecture of the quarter is beautiful and for a history buff like me its a wonderful spectacle to actually see, the magic of it doesn't translate in photos and pictures. I felt that although the quarter is sandwiched by shops and restaurants it was able to stand apart and not be diminished by this, unlike my experience of the Trevi fountain in Rome. I would definitely make this a must see during your stay in Barcelona.
Interesting. Cool streets, worth to see it! You can found inside nice small stores or bars and drink in calm a beer or sangria :)
Charming . We really enjoyed walking around this area. Felt like an adventure never knowing what you would find around each corner. Fun little shops and for the most part very nice people.

My favourite part of Barcelona. We loved the gothic quarter and found is such a spectacle. If you can, visit in the evening to see it all lit up or in the day time spend time exploring the narrow streets.

Time well spent!. We stayed at a local hotel, and walked through the winding streets every evenings, enjoying the architecture, and many talented street performers around every corner. Not to mention small bars and tapas places, great food at a restaurant - "Terrace"- (I think that is the name of it)

Amazing gothic architecture. I loved my time spent here, exploring the streets and admiring all of the beautiful gothic architecture. If you are at a loose end during part of your visit to Barcelona, then this is definitely a place to head!

Fresh and clean, friendly and safe, while maintaining medieval charm.. Of the old districts in European capitals, the Barri Gotic is my favourite. Winding, narrow streets with chic bars and restaurants that are fresh and clean while maintaining the grungy medieval charm. Never a dodgy character, always very friendly and safe. Highly recommended.
Barri Gotic. Spent hours walking round the Gothic Quarter while in Barcelona. Lots.of unqiue amazing shops and great bars. Could have spent our whole trip here!
Nice historical vibe. The gothic quarter was on our list of places to visit in Barcelona. It was historical however I thought there would be more to see.

Beautiful, Breathtaking Architecture. Definitely worth walking around and just taking in the beautiful architecture. Go into the churches and cathedrals so you can take in the beauty both outside and inside! It was like going to Halloween town with an incredible history.

Half day in the gothic quarter. The norrow streets very compacted and many shops to visit, and for those who like to visit the churches as do my wife lots to see.
This is a very good experience to wonder around the area, very busy place with restaurants and cafes for those who enjoy morning coffee.

Don't miss it. Great to see and eat.. Great place to just wander around. So many photo opportunities, and great places to eat. When your feet get tired just stop for some Tapas and drinks and head back out for more.

A walk back in history. Followed Rick Steves walking tour on a Sunday afternoon. It was easy to follow and greatly enhanced the walk by explaining it all. On Sunday the Barcelona museum is free after 3pm, so we took advantage of that. The excavated ruins on the lower level are amazing. We did go back through the walk a second time with the rest of our party on another day. More places were open, but the museum was not free.

Something new around each corner. As you get deeper into the Gothic quarter you leave the crowds of Las Rambles behind. Find a shop selling nothing but Carnival costumes. Find a quiet little square where you can have lunch and sangria for much less than at the tourist traps on the main avenues. Finally, find your way out. Bring either a map, a navigation system, or some with a good sense of direction. It's a maze in there.

Another beauty in Barcelona. If you go to Barcelona the Barri Gotic has to be visited. It's a must. One can see the beauty and experience the history of Barcelona in a small quarter that is easy to watch in a day. There are also cafés where you can sit and enjoy the atmosphere. In summer or winter, the charm of this quarter remains untouched.
Like Venice without the canals. Interesting places and plazas pop up around each corner. We walked here most days and every evening, there was so much to see. Very atmospheric.
interesting part of the city to check out.. Lovely winding old narrow streets with different shops. Great for an afternoon wandering and people watching.
Best place barcelona . What an fantastic place. Tiny streets and lots of bars and tapas restaurants combined with Old builidings and possibilities to enter smal Shops.

The best shopping in the city.. If you are visiting Barcelona, you must put aside time to walk around the maze of the Barri Gotic. We spent a late afternoon there when the stores were closing and wished we had put this higher up on our list. Probably one of the best places to find good deals on one-of-a-kind items and to avoid the typical merchandise you find at all the big box stores.

Do you self a favour and visit the Gothic Quarter.. So much to do and see we spent 3 nights and could of stayed another 3, the food on selection is fantastic something for every ones pallet. The local people are very friendly and accommodating markets in abundance and very well priced. Barcelona would be number 1 on my revisit list.
Atmospheric. Masses of little streets with individual shops and restaurants, lots of atmosphere and relaxed. Loved it.
old part of a romantic city never disappoints. Fabulous part of a wonderful city...lovely narrow streets filled with great eating establishments and bars...very atmospheric as night falls

wonderful wandering. Wander from the grand high gothic cathedral to the tiny synagogue with the 3rd century roman foundations. Abundant nooks crannies and hidden courtyards and gardens reveal a wealth of Barcelona's character. Lunch on the Carrer de Colo in sight of the three graces fountian. Afterwards wander into the gothic quarter and then the jewish barrio.The Barcelona City Museum offers great viewings as well.
R. A lively interesting place and plenty of shops ,restaurants and bars, Enjoyed the streets and atmosphere.

Atmosphere, Atmosphere, Atmosphere. Of all the locations where one might possibly stay in Barcelona, Barri Gotic is my favorite. It can get noisy, but it's energetic too, so if you're renting an apartment, try one on a 2nd or 3rd floor. The district is full of beautiful churches, restaurants, cafes, and stores, all set along ancient streets that are narrow to keep it shady on hot days. They may not have a Gaudi building, but the architecture is worth seeing. Las Ramblas, Placa Catalunya the cathedral, and Picasso Museum are all within easy walking distance as are metro stops.
Sooo beautiful. I love Ciutat Vella. Nice to see it during the day or at night. You feel like if you were in the Middle Ages. I love it sooo much!

Worth just wandering and getting lost!. We stayed in a hostel right in the heart of the Gothic quarter, so it was an easy decision to spend the evening in this part of Barcelona. We had dinner at a little restaurant in an alleyway and then just wandered around the old streets. There were lots of little hidden bars and every little alley leads to another beautiful building! We ended up in a square just off Las Ramblas sitting and having a few cocktails.

Fabulous History & Architecture Lesson!. First, I would highly recommend that you book a private tour with Context Travel. We had an incredible guide (Tobias) who offered an extremely in-depth view & history of the neighborhood. We were very impressed to learn about all the centuries of history (& religions), Roman, Muslim, Spanish, etc that have impacted the development of Barcelona. Fascinating!

Gothic Quarter. We always spend a lot of time here when in Barcelona. I just love wandering in the little streets, maybe finding somewhere interesting to eat or drink. And safe too. I have never seen any trouble at all. Definitely worth spending time here

Atmospheric Quarter. The Gothic Quarter's buildings, so I'm told, date from the fourteenth and fifteenth centuries, when Barcelona reached the height of her medieval prosperity. Attractions include La Seu (the cathedral), Museu d'Historia de Barcelona and the Museu Frederic Mares. We stayed in the Quarter, where there are jazz clubs Harlem and Jamboree, flamenco club Tarantos and plenty of tapas and drinking bars. We plan to return someday.

Lovely until night time. Lovely to walk around the gothic quarter in the early evening and enjoy stopping in all the little shops. We did this often and was really lovely. However at night it does become pretty rough and if you are a young woman you WILL get hassled (trust me!). So avoid later on.
Walk around. Beautiful architecture, wide squares and lots to choose from for food! Definitely recommend a walk around and potter around the little shops.

Soak up the atmosphere.. You can't walk through these streets without feeling the history which is in every stone. Anyone who appreciates the past will be transported into the world of our ancestors. I have read original letters and journals of merchants who walked these streets hundreds of years ago. For me it's special. I hope it can be special for you too.

Old Quarter. Walking through this old quarter gives a flavor of the old town. We had a guide who helped us understand the history and move through the small narrow streets. It is also a place wee later wandered.
NICE FEELING TO BE THERE. Nothing extra ordinary.The cathedral on the corner is worth seeing.You need to be in appropriate attire to visit inside.Beware of pickpocketing
shopping and archtecture. Lovely and individual shops, bars and restaurants. Great buildings and a feeling of getting real culture

My favorite experience in Barcelona. When visiting Barcelona, definitely set aside a few hours to roam the Barri Gotic. Don't even bother trying to navigate. Just step inside the maze of narrow streets and wander. Get lost. Stop in some of the neat little shops and maybe stop for a snack or drink at one of the little patio cafes in one of the quaint little squares you stumble across. It will be interesting and likely disorienting, but it will be an unforgettable experience. I was lucky enough to be staying in the neighborhood on my recent trip to Barcelona, so the husband and I wandered through the neighborhood daily. I loved every minute of it! Something to keep in mind: If you're traveling alone, be cautious about walking around here after dark. There are many dark corners and alleys where ill-intentioned people could lurk. I didn't see anything or anyone that made me worry, but it's always best to be extra mindful of your surroundings.

Charming Walk in Barcelona. Take the Rick Steve's Guided walk (audiobook) into the Barri Gotic. What a charming quarter of Barcelona, filled with history and even an unearthed ancient Roman road flanked by Roman tombs. The cafes and chocolate shops are filled with delicacies and must not be missed. Great shopping also- thanks to local artisans and crafts vendors. Don't miss it!
A must do when in Barcelona. I've visited Barcelona a few times now & everytime I love to return to the Gothic Quarter, such a beautiful place & a must do when in Barcelona.
Get lost. Quaint alleys, hidden cafes and shops. Wander about as long as you like and gaze at the unique buildings, plenty cafe bars for hungry and thirsty tourists.
Meh.... The area has really changed since my last visit 12+ years ago. Very crowded and touristy, lots of tchotke shops, smoothies, etc. The unique shops I remember are gone.
Quirky but easy to get lost. Full of great architecture, cafes and shops. It's easy to get lost and can be scary at night. Some lovely plazas with character.

Not many places as cool as this in the world.. Cool little area in Barcelona. Narrow alleys built to keep cool during the summers lines with shops, restaurants and residences. Every turn has a new surprise. Worth spending a couple of hours just wondering this area.

Tour the Gothic centre. We did the free tour with Adam and happily paid a small donation afterward. He was great! He pointed out loads of sites & places of interest and told stories of historical events in a very entertaining and humorous fashion.
Cataluña with firends. Excellent place centered in barcelona but crowded.from morning til midnight.especially during weekend.need more patience to find more way to exit.

Gotic Quarter Awesome. We travelled most days in and around the coolest parts really of Barcelona.(The Gotic Quarter) The cultures and artistry from people who live locally was simply stunning, the food was well priced and very very good indeed as was the service.Certain places I'd now check the drinks menus before actually sitting down. I ordered large beers a few times to find they never sold such a thing except a small half pint and the charged us 5 euro sometimes. Especially in the more coolest beach side bistros/chill out haunts. Highly recommend the Gotic Quarter.

History. A must to see especially with a guide. This is where old Barcelona was and you see all the little streets, all the Roman buildings, lots of history here. Now plenty of hotels, cafes, shops, you could spend hours here.

Great neighbourhood te stay. It's a very nice neighbourhood with very small streets and a lot of little shops. When you rent an accomodation you have to consider that it's difficult to park your car (parking garage can be expensive) I payed for 2 days 50,00 euro. And a lot of streets are oneway streets. It's better to go by bus, metro, taxi or to walk (also in the area Borne).

Lovely area. Great to kill some time and see some of the "old city" of barcelona. Winding streets and alleys are aligned with some beautiful buildings... be sure to have a mapOr phone with gps though, very easy to take a wrong turning!!!

Nice historiqual quarter. Great quarter, lots of cofee shops and restaurants, food and fruits shops, souvenirs shops, lots of points of attraction. It's great to be accomodated in this quarter, you can rent a bike from the several rent a bike shops and explore the town.

Beautiful old streets. Walking and exploring this maze of old and winding streets is a must when visiting Barcelona. Beautiful architecture along with excellent shopping and cafes/bars means you can easily enjoy hours in this area. Some of the streets are quite narrow and busy to take the usual precautions with valuables but it felt very safe when we visited. The streets lead to the Cathedral of Barcelona, the Basílica de Santa Maria del Pi and Placa Reial amongst other amazing sites.
Guided tour. Can highly recommend Runner Beans Free Walking Tour for an interesting look into the history of this wonderful city.
Very crowded old town. It is nice to have a walk in the old Barcelona, on the narrow streets and to visit the small shops in the old buildings,

Great neighborhood . Great neighborhood to walk around. Lots of rambling streets and alleyways. You could get lost, if you don't have some sense of direction. Stores, restaurants, bars, gelato, etc. My mom's purse was stolen years ago because it's easy for thieves to grab a purse and get lost in the alleyways. Wear a purse strapped over your body. Enjoy the sights and sounds!
more than just a quarter. Fantastic area of Barcelona with its small streets bars and restaurants,A lot of history in this area of the city to see during the day and a great night life for all.
Must go place in Barcelona!. Touristic place with lot of shopping and food. Not really the real Barcelona, but so far the easy way to get a bit of everything.

just beautiful. Hired a tuck tuck, very informative guy, went out of his way to show us the wonderful sights and was very passionate about his country, extremely interesting, hour and a half really well spent, definitely recommend

Stop back in time.. This type of area is very typical of Spanish cities and yet is sadly lacking in the UK. The warren of streets are always interesting, sometime claustrophobic yet never threatening. A delightful way to spend time either during the later afternoon or into the evening when they really come alive.

Do yourself a favor, come in the morning, get lost. Had a wonderful time walking around the Gothic area. We got lost so often, but the best part is, you find these nooks everywhere, and nice places to eat and have a drink. It is full of tourists, like myself, so just watch out walking into any place to eat, because it could be more swayed to be a trap with expensive options vs. a lower key authentic place.Nice shopping and good place to just spend the day walking. Also see the Picasso museum while youre in the area too.

Fantastical maze. Take a map rather than worrying about your smart phone. Such a interesting place and some rather lovely places to get Tapas (Bomuth was great) Note that this is an area that may have pick pockets so be on your guard - you will always more than likely look like a tourist but you can take simple precautions to protect your self (I had some inner pockets sewn into my trousers and shorts - try and grab anything and they'd get a shock!!)

Definitely worth visiting. If you enjoy history. We walked trough with a tour guide and it is great to get the historical perspective of the area. Lots of shops and restaurants - old roman ruins- churches and museums.It only takes an hour or so.

Rick Steves does it again!. We did the Rick Steves walking tour of this area and it was so interesting! We weren't the only ones doing it, we saw many others with the book. This is a very interesting area with things you definitely would not know about without the tour. Loved it!

Don't miss this gem next to the Las Ramblas. quaint streets, nice restaurants and shops, enjoyed walking around with breaks for snacks and Sangria. Found it a much better experience than the crowded Las Rambla

hidden gems. The 2 hour walking tour of the gothic area was very informative and gives you lots of ideas for more in depth viewing. Without the tour we would not have found several sites of interest. There are several columns from a Roman temple that are in the courtyard of an apartment block. Always have a very good local street map with all the road names, it's very easy to miss places. The local tour give out discounts for this tour and many others.
Getting Lost in the Barri Gotic. Dense dark medieval streets full of fascinating nooks and crannies. My 12 year old and I came back again and again!

Loved it!. The spirit of Barcelona. So calming to walk down small narrow lanes dressed with beautiful Spanish shops ! Some had exceptional art others had tasteful Ice creams and small restaurants! Felt so calm walking down watching tourists. You come across houses and can't help but wonder the history here! Small fountains, little gardens. Surreal!!
My favorite part of Barcelona. Love stepping back in history and love the fact that so many of the old buildings remain. We actually found the remains of a medieval synagogue.

Nice walk through old quarters. Nice old town tucked next to the modern city, nice walk through old quarters, cathedral, picasso museum, nice eateries, tapas bar and life in general - people watching, worth a stroll

One of our favourite places in Barcelona. A quaint, most attractive area with oodles of character. Not to be missed. We thoroughly enjoyed wandering around looking at the old buildings and shops, soaking up the atmosphere.

Beautiful historical walk with fun window shopping.. There are so much going on in this district. Follow the lives of Picasso everywhere: First of all, don't miss the "menu del dia" (daily lunch menu) at Quatro Gats (4 cats) for 16 euros, you get an amazing five star quality 4 course lunch. Then Streets of Avignon known for his famous painting, "Les Demoiselles d'Avignon". There are corridors, passages, and cheap cafes everywhere! Loved this walk!

Inspiring, lively and historic. The narrow streets of Gothic is home to many street artists, cool shops and restaurants, as well as a wealth of history. Go there for an afternoon stroll and spend some time in front of the Barcelona Cathedral.

Favourite area in Barcelona!. We stayed, played and ate in this fantastic area! Absolute love strolling through old towns with all their character and charm and this is one of the best. Great shopping and restaurants.

Best district of Barca. We stayed in the gothic quarter for a week so maybe I am biased, but I thought the gothic quarter was one of the best neighbourhoods of Barcelona. It has everything you want for a city break and is walking distance from the beach. Loads of fantastic restaurants and lots of nooks and crannies to explore.

In love with gothic quarter!. I love to get lost walking in this small and charm streets, discovering great old emblematic shops and charismatic restaurants. It's a must to visit in Barcelona! Discover the old chocolateries in Petritxol streets (and understand why so many people is waiting for a table outside), buy cheese in a small shop behind the Santa Maria del Mar Chatedral, discover the beauty of the Chatedral itself, visit the museum CCB and understand the history of Catalunya, and take a tapas in the Passeig del Born. Perfect day!

medieval magic. visiting the gothic cenre on foot is like walking into the 13th century, at the info centre in st james square or in your hotel u can book a walking tour starting at 9 am 'til 11 that is well worth the money. then u can wander the winding lanes alone. the Barcelona cathedral was built in 13th century (wear something that covers your arms and legs) and is still the bishop's seat of the RC church in Catalonia. I suggest u sit in a pew and soak up the atmosphere in order to get the full experience of the expanse of the interior of the church. unlike a French gothic which has high windows, Spanish gothic windows r smaller because of the heat of the Spanish sun. like all gothic cathedrals, however, there r 12 side chapels well worth a visit. some hold medieval reliquaries. be sure to visit the cloisters (gift shop) and the 12 swans of st. eualia for whom the church is named. the gargoles on the church r human; the gargoles on the civic buildings outside the church r animals because a cathedral cannot have animals on their roof. there is a roman museum worth a visit nearby. it will introduce u to the underground world of the original 3rd century cathedral and the roman city surrounding it. st james square is renaissance and if u peek past the guards on the city hall there is a lovely view of the interior garden. therer tourist shops and cafes around the square so after u have pic I suggest u pick any land off the square and wander the labyrinth of streets where it is easy to imagine knights on horseback and folk visiting inn keepers lining the lanesif u r adventurous walk towards the water and visit the small medieval church where the sailors and peasants attended services and see the statue of Christopher Columbus. u can easily spend a day or two in the middles ages here.

Don't miss this walkable part of Barcelona. I had the good fortune to book accommodations in the Barri Gotic. I walked through it on my visits to other parts of the city and home again. The narrow, winding streets, the architecture, the iron work, the stones, the age of the place, the markets, tapas, music, people, a constant show.Felt very safe, come home alone after midnight, always something to see or do.

A maze of shops and coffe houses. Shops and alley ways by the hundred. Inexpensive coffee and pastries offered by many coffee establishments in the morning.Easy to wander off the beaten track so get a map from your hotel. Most shops were boutique style with specialised offerings.

Old World Europe. This is a picturesque area that is full of history. Some of the streets and buildings look like they are from hundreds of years ago, while others have hopping restaurants, shops, and bars that are great to visit now. Definitely a great way to see in a different side of Barcelona.
Crowdy. A little too crowdy but still charming to walk trough ( once ! ).The little shops are worth a visit

The best part of a Barcelina visit. My favorite in Barcelona. Very unique experience. Could spends days exploring the narrow streets each surprising you with a magnificent church, rustic square, or just beautiful vistas. Around every corner you will encounter authentic shops, restaurants or cafes. I recommend taking one of the free walking tours to maximize the experience.
Love it!. Went to nooks and crannies after visited the Cathedral, so much histories around, roman ruins, medieval buildings, a lot to see!
Old Barcelona- Narrow streets like nowhere else. History and character galore, and plenty a hidden gem for anyone not scared of a bit of a treasure hunt through the historic streets

Gothic gorgeous but touristy.... Especially this time of year (August). Crowded, and many things are overpriced. But just walking around is fascinating, and even on a hot day it's shaded part of the day because the streets are so narrow. It's amazing how much of the history is embedded in the architecture and urban landscape.
Narrow streets. There are nice narrow streets, interesting museum of the city, cathedral but also plenty of tourists and shops for them.

Get lost and breathe Barcelona. Best is to turn in the tiniest narrowest streets - you can find real treasure there. Handcraft goods, great good, quality affordable brands, stunning architecture pieces and strange people - all that is hidden there. Go have a walk.

Utterly Touristic, but represents a real interest. There are so many people and stores, food stores, supermarkets, restaurants, that is is a giant shopping arcade, with street performances everywhere. However the site itself, buildings, museums, cathedral, churches squares and other places represents a real testimony of ancient, modern and present Barcelona's history, culture and architecture. Raise your eyes to see old façades, sculptures and traditional city houses and you'll raise an eyebrow thinking:"hey that's beautiful !" Of course it is so crowded during summertime you'd better look in front of you, unless you are stuck in the crowd, as it happens often especially near the Picasso museum....The narrow pedestrian streets enable to shelter from the heat in summertime.Barcelona could not be Barcelona without "el barri gótic".

Enjoy wandering around. My favourite area of our trip - we started by wandering around the Mercat De Boqueria before heading into the winding streets and looking around the cathedral. Placa De Reial (although a bit of a tourist trap) was good for cheap food.

Wonderful section of Barcelona. Many small streets and some great small shops that when open show pride in their wares, yet later when closed, all have steel doors to protect from vandals. And what's with all the graffiti, everywhere. The Jewish Synagogue is here too which it's separate review.

Get lost. Don't worry about directions, just wander, immerse yourself in history and get hopelessly lost. You will always find your way back home but I guarantee it won't be by returning the same way. Check out the numerous bars, coffee shops and general stores. It is an experience you will remember forever.

Gothic Quarter is Super Cool. The Gothic Quarter is a fascinating area. There are tons to great restaurants, shopping, tapas bar and the like. The people watching is outstanding. Don't miss it if in Barcelona.
Must visit. Such a lovely place to wander and find little gems and old restaurants and shops. Lovely architecture too, make sure to get good and lost and take a look up every now and then
wonderful old center. Be sure to visit the cathedral: personally I find this one a lot nice than the Sagrada but both are very nice to visit

A place of old and new together in harmony. The modern look is integrated in harmony to the historical buildings. Selected shopping brands, pubs, cafes, restaurants and of course history. All together. Where yoıu can find a smilar place?
A little bit scary i think. Althout i have nothing against gotic style i think the place it is not very well frequented :( unfortunaly
Interesting Tour. I went on a free tour of the Gothic Quarter and it was definitely worth it. The architecture is amazing and the streets are incredibly beautiful.

Central location. We took a room in one of the pensions in the quarter. The location is great central to almost all our activities. Also, there are many places to drink and eat at night. However the quarter is filthy and doesn't feal safe

Lovely walk through. I visited Spain in August 2011,and my friend Jaya and me did the whole art and old beautiful structure walk through Spain !And the Goth quarters are a must. They take you back to a completely different era, it's so different from what you see in Barcelona, it was lovely, if you are a lover of old art and structures and cultures.. This you must do
Very "used" and interesting streets. Face the Barcelona culture.. Interesting area for a walking during the evening. Get lost on the streets and stop for eat some tapas in any spanish bodega.
Nice area. Just to walk around it is great, walking through old streets. You'll like it even if you're not into shopping.
Walking tour of Gothic area. This was a very interesting walking tour with a knowledgeable guise supplied by APT Tours. We visited many hidden places that wecwould never have found on our own.
Take a stroll through the little streets. Enjoy the fabulous little streets and boutique shops and restaurants along the way, stop for a coffee in one of the many cafes
Best walking. Every road has to show you something beautiful, very traditional, very unique, the beauty of Barcelona city indeed... if you can book a room at the area!
Beautiful!. An incredible surprise, an incredible place...what an atmosphere...you must see it, walking all around to see and breath a particular atmosphere...

Nice to see and walk through. Contrasts of modern shops and old architecture? This is where you need to go. The mix of shops is great, shoes, bijouterie, clothes, tourists shops and condoms house, etc.

Cool but hot in August. One of several cool places to roam around and explore.
Barcelona is just plain cool. But wear a hat with sun screen or you'll hate yourself in the morning.
Must visit!. So much character, so much history, you can walk down the streets daily and discover something new. A must see while in Barcelona!
beautiful marvellous buildings. Just walk and take in all that's free in the city, gothic quarter is lovely in the day and night with all the lights

Overcrowded . Very overcrowded but stunning. I liked it very much but without people... It would be better. :-) 2K years old buildings from roman times and narrow streets are must for bcl. But Dont start Your trip due to shock
Well worth spending a morning or afternoon here. Spent a good three hours here - interesting place - nice architecture - loads of people looking for money from you.
Mommy and daughter. Excellent! You have to do this, its awesome, you will walk and never get lost and if you do, you will discover more and more!
Great place. This is a great part of Barcelona, the squares and atmosphere are great. You have to get out there and just walk around enjoy a glass of vino and tapas.

Superb Architecture. The Gothic Quarter (Barri Gotic) is a great place to visit, the architecture is stunning and there is so many small bars to have some food and drink at reasonable prices. It feels were much how I imagine Spain with its narrow streets and ornate balconies. Can be busy but it is definitely well worth a visit.

Loved walking through the narrow streets and beautiful buildings. Our private guide walked us through the Gothic quarter along with the Jewish and Roman quarters. We just loved walking through the narrow streets learning what they were like back then and seeing all the beautiful old buildings, museums and cathedrals..We got to try some authentic Churros in a place called 'Xurrebria' apparently these are the best in Barcelona and they were yummy.
Old world charm. Walk around and get a feel of the historic pathways. Too crowded during July with lot of tourists around. Takes the charm away. Being a tourist myself, can't complain much

Great area to explore Barcelona from.. We spent a week in a great little flat near Placa de les olles. Lots of shops, restaurants and night life surrounded us. It has really great access to the beach, las rambas, markets and some incredible historical sites. The little streets in this neighborhood are also just great to wander around and get lost in.I would suggest finding an apt. to rent if you really want to feel immersed in the area. It can get loud at night and I don't know if the hotel windows combat this issue but I really liked opening all the balcony doors and feeling the pulse of city. Also, the architecture and decor of our flat was incredible and certainly added to the experience. Well worth the value too.I always felt safe in the area although I was super aware of my purse and belongings at all times. That's a must in Barcelona and especially in the busy markets and tourist attractions. Ladies, do not leave your purse on the back of your chairs, ever!The rickshaws are a fun way to great around in this area. We always found one near the boat docks or las rambas.I read some great views before going and wasn't disappointed in this charming neighborhood.

Take an entire afternoon.... You can easily get lost in the Gothic Quarter, but when you leave, you're going to run into Barcelona Cathedral or the beach, and either is great too! Spend time shopping and stopping for sangria (CAVA) in one of the many quaint courtyards and pretend like its an afternoon hundreds of years in the past. It's easy.

Fun in the gothic old town. This area of Bacelona is a must visit. We actually did an air B and B here for 5 nights. It is a maze of local shops, handcrafts, tourist stores, bars, restaurants, people and nightlife. You will not be disappointed or board. It is close to everything...the market, La ram las, the beach.

A great place to just wander at random, explore, let yourself get lost.. This is the perfect place to just wander around, stop in a cafe, enjoy the street performers, get lost in the little winding alleys. It's old and fascinating.

Beautiful and unique area. Beautiful and unique areaAn area of a lot of history with the beauty and atmosphere of calm.Recommended travel and see the small shops authenticity and the small streets.Fun life.
A must see. The architecture was so amazing. The masons had great skill and design an it was breathtaking. Another fantastic walk thru Barcelona.

Gothic architecture . Great place, meandering streets and a great atmosphere with lots of individual shops, small bars and tapas restaurants. The architecture was stunning and the area was very lively.

Thieving has increased - be very careful !!. As you consider touring through Barri Gotic, and other tourist areas, just a short note to be mindful of your belongings.Thursday, 20 Aug, I was shopping in Padevi, a shoe store in the region, and my purse was stolen. The staff were unhelpful, and no cameras in the store for evidence. I also heard stories where the thieves walk alongside you in busy areas, repeatedly dipping their hands into your bag. Barcelona lacks the infrastructure to support you getting your items returned. Be sure to have your passport ready if you want to report to the police. And if you're foreign, they take the reports only when a translator is present - costing you multiple trips. The city's Lost&Found is equally unequipped for supporting. They require the serial number of your ID card or other cards. That is, they can't file your missing cards/ID, etc... they'll need the serial numbers for these in order to input in the systems.As with any tourist attraction, it makes sense to be aware. I noticed over my few trips to Barcelona that the topic of thieving has grown, with more police force present, yet no true solution yet found.

Imagine you're a smuggler and keep moving, a beautiful part of the city.. We'd read tales of pickpockets and unsavoury types in Barru Gothic but, to be fair, we saw none of that. It's an unusual part of the city and a great walk back from the seafront. Not what we expected, but the smells of fruit and the buildings tightly packed and genuinely inhabited by the locals makes this place feel incredibly authentic. Romantic, lively and energising.

Amazing place to walk. A picturesque place in the historical part of the city. Beautiful Gothic buildings with lots of cafes and stores comfortable to walk around. Visiting the Cathedral of the Holy Cross and Saint Eulalia is strongly recommended.Streets are very narrow. I'd recommend to go there early in the morning to avoid crowds of tourists.

Beautiful Architecture!. Great place to wander and explore. The architecture is so beautiful in this area, with different interesting sights to see around each corner. There are nice shops and cafes to stop in as well. This is must see in Barcelona.
Gothic Quarter is true Barcelona... The true old Barcelona.. Every street and building speaks history, the vibe is just so thrilling. You should visit it either in bike or by walking. A must see

Not in August. Great area, but surprised it was SO busy in August ..could not move for people. Have been there several times but never in the month of August, will not do that again in a hurry! Murder.

A must. Magical.. A beautiful, magical, charming, historic part of town. Get lost in the tiny streets. Visit some of the shops boutiques. Have wine and tapas in one of the countless little bars. Stop and listen to buskers. It's bound to be an amazing experience.

Maze of narrow streets. It is worth to take a stroll around the Barri Gothic, since it is a very lively barri. It however reeks of urine on the sidestreets but is quite save to walk around even at night. Nice balconies on the buildings, full of sights and museums.

Winding Narrow Streets - a Walk Back in Time. An hours stroll through the Barri Gotic set in the center of old Barcelona is to step back centuries in history. You'll love the narrow, twisting streets (most closed to all but service vehicles) and intriguing architecture. Modern (turn of the 20th century) buildings are often built on the first floors of the Medieval structures you everywhere you'll see the ancient timbers/lintels. You can also see Roman foundations/walls here and there. As everywhere in Barcelona - watch out for pickpockets - but don't let that keep you from a stroll through history.

with quite differnt looking vs elsewhere of Barcelona. Gothic quarter shows very different look vs elsewhere of Barcelona. Along with the sound of chant, we walked in to small aisle, immediately attracted by the complicated decoration of Gothic architectures. We notices upon the pillars there were some statues with sad and serious looking like saying " do not make any trouble, cuz we are keeping our eyes on you" lol .... there's also some interesting shops worthy visiting! don't miss Gothic Quarter if you are planning to come barcelona!

Almost like in the book "Le Parfum". One of my favorite quarters! If you've seen the movie (starring Dustin Hoffman in a supporting role) you'll recognise several streets, shops and squares. Take any wimsey little alley and end up in a sunny and charming place! Stay out of the bigger and crowdier ways and do be very careful as this is second home to pickpocketers! Then just enjoy the gothic architecture and the shadow in the summer.
Great place to wander . Looking for a leisurely stroll the this is the area. Architecture is fantastic and many little areas to see. Best in morning as the area comes alive.

Brave the tourist throng - and go visit!. Very busy with tourists - in the number of times I've been back to visit over the years - the number of tourists just keeps growing. Sadly a lot more tourists, also don't respect the place and has become dirty and noisy. But of course, being a historical site - I still enjoy visiting it.

Walk ard Gothic Quarters... Very quaint and small shops dotted on every narrow alleys. This created an ambience of nostalgia..wonderful back to the past!We wandered aimlessly .Just getting lost is unbelievably relaxing.Do pop in to shops to browse and you might discover nicknacks that are unique..one of a kind. We picked up a cute wind chime..wonderfully handcrafted and delicate..Also..organic crystals..trinkets..As we walk..just watch out for taxi cabs..because that is where the main road can be found if follow the cabbies route...to find your way out. No problem!Do make time for this beautiful place..its worth getting lost..Oh..also there are many cosy cafes to check out. We had a refreshing freshly squeezed orange juice in one..Service was casual..friendly.Thoroughly enjoyable!

Walk the Walk. Can't go to Barcelona and not see this neighbourhood. It's a great space to just walk through and see some amazing buildings. The barrio has some great restaurants and places to shop and stores to pick up souvenirs. It's not far from La Rambla so make sure to take the detour.

Wonderful area to roam... This is a great area to roam around and see the many shops and restaurants that are here. You can meander through alleyways and find deals on clothing or find a great place for gelato or dinner. There are a couple cathedral's that you'll stumble across also. Charming area to explore.
Beautiful Architecture. The architecture in the Gothic Quarter's is beautiful. Staying nearby there are many buildings to see and plenty of places to eat.

Mark your map, you'll never find the same place twice,. Loads to see, looks different every day, and there are some great places to eat and drink. We walked all over and found some great places we would want to go back to. Trouble is, the city is so seductive we found ourselves wandering through the warren of streets finding new, but never familiar places!

Crowded place but worthwhile. It was April but it is so busy here. The look and feel of it is amazing but be prepared for crowds although there are some nice bars and gardens along the way to hide in. A must see place but hectic.

Don't visit Barcelona without visiting the Gothic Quarter. The Gothic Quarter is great to stroll around and enjoy the architecture of the old streets and buildings. There are lots of hidden bars and stores where you can find out bargains or just get away from the main tourist crowds.

Very nice area to visit and stay in Barcelona. Very nice area to visit and stay in Barcelona. Everywhere there are lots of little shops, restaurants, bars and it is a place very full of life. I truly enjoyed mu stay there.
Worth a meander. Well worth taking time out for a wander around this area. As with all of Barcelona the architecture of the buildings is stunning.You get a real feel for the true Barcelona.
BEAUTIFUL!!. This area for me, is the best area to explore in Barcelona. Let your feet dictate to you and just wander along historical streets.
Great place to walk. You can walk in narrow and beautiful streets and have pleasure. See many sightseeing, eat, do shopping.
Beautiful architecture. Very pretty quarters to walk around. Takes at least an hour for a quick tour. Worth the visit for sure!
Easy stroll. An easy stroll though the streets of old Barcelona. Lots of fun shops to stop at and great little places at get gelato!

Go Gothic!. Don't Miss the Gothic Quarter! It is a great place to window shop and there are clothing stores there offering items actually made in Barcelona. The streets are narrow, like an older European Village, but passable, even on weekends. It is much more pleasant than walking on La Rambla, where the crowds are sometime so thick it reminds you of vehicular traffic in New York or LA. There is a definite vibe there that I would describe as casual elegance. Be sure to take a camera or your PDA.
MKB in the Gothic Quarter. Super place to get lost in and discover shops in small streets and wonderful architecture. A hidden gem around every corner and impossible to get lost in.

Don't Miss the Gothic Quarter!. My family and I took a walking tour of the Gothic Quarter and enjoyed it immensely! I'd been nervous that 3 hours might be too long in the August heat, but the time flew by because everything was so old and interesting. It is also full of great boutiques and restaurants!

HIDDEN GEM OF BARCELONA!. Strolled around early morning before it got too hot. Around every corner there was another gem. Easily to get lost but you soon found another gem to explore.
A visit too the past of a truly magical city.

Timeless area--gothic, ancient, and modern at the same time. The heart of this area is the Cathedral. Its Gothic beauty and splendour are impressive and notable. The Gothic motifs can be found here and there around the Cathedral, in connecting corridors, gutters, patios and so on. If you are lucky enough to be with a good local guide, you can find ancient walls still left in the corners of alleys. The Cathedral is the center of the religious life of the local people. In front of the cathedral building young people play contemporary music. Walk for a few minutes, and you will find yourself in the modern townscape. You can experience times ancient, medieval and modern all at the same time in this timeless area.

Wonderful maze of cobbled streets. The Gothic Quarter is a wonderful place to just wander around. Some areas are busier than others and it is very easy to get lost in the maze. But sooner or later you emerge into a main thoroughfare. It is very atmospheric and a must see when you visit Barcelona.
A door to the past!. Narrow streets, lost of churches and chapels, a lot to learn from...and the best of all: TAPAS y SANGRIA in ever corner!

Beautiful architecture around ever corner. We just loved this area of Barcelona. So much beautiful architecture you will be amazed. You could spend a week in this area and be still finding new and wonderful buildings. Don't miss it, get yourself lost in the narrow lanes and have a wonderful time. Highly recommended.

Very nice neighborhood to go around. I strolled for several hours in this neighborhood, visited The Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar, the Catedral de Barcelona, and watched the folk dancing in front of it.Overall, it was a very nice afternoon.

Great location to tour. After walking on "las Ramblas" we walked into the old city the Ghotic old city, we walked around and enjoyed the shops the ice cream, very nice shops and nice souvenir shops.. we got into the Museum near the cathedral church and we enjoyed a nice tour.
Take the Time. Charming area and the cathedral is worth the €7 entrance fee so keep enough time to view it. Little gems are the Roman remains and the Jewish ghetto.

Don't be afraid to get lost. Narrow alleys, hidden markets, quaint shops - it's got the lot. Watch out for pickpockets - not too scary - just be wary. Lift your eyes occasionally and check out the weird and wonderful building decor.

Fantastic place. It’s a magic and beautiful area with Gothic architectures, it’s kind of a labyrinth with many small streets on opening square. We have walked for hours and in each time we are discovering lots of new stores, art galleries and restaurants.

Step back in time. I haven't seen all,if Barcelona yet but so far this is my favorite area. I love the narrow streets filled with people, shops and history . You never know what awaits around the corner. We stumbled upon a gorgeous old church and stopped to listen to a harpist playing near the steps . Wonderful restaurants too.
Beautiful. walked, and walked and was amazed at the beauty of it. A must see. Check out the gargoyles everywhere.

Beautiful Architecture . This place is outstanding with some of the most beautiful architecture you will find not just in Spain but around the world.
Around every corner and little alley way there is something different..but you have to look up..

Beatiful architecture. Beautiful architecture and lovely cool little alley streets you can wander round. If you are going to Barcelona cathedral make sure you are wearing something that is covering your shoulders and not too short on the bottom or you won't be allowed entry

Great walking section. Beautiful squares with Gothic architecture which was at one time a Roman village.
It has many small streets opening into squares. Most of the streets are closed to traffic making this a very pedestrian friendly neighbourhood Lovely to stroll for dinner or just bar hopping!
Enchanting. Incredible neighborhood, we walked for hours and kept finding lots of new corners, design stores and art galleries.
A great place to wander. If you have a few hours to spare this is a great place to wander, stop often to have a drink and take many many photographs

Transported to a world gone by. We spent a wonderful afternoon strolling the Barri Gotic. The intricate by lanes are a must. Do take a detour from the main thoroughfares and you will be surprised by the grace and charm of the architecture and the people still living in Barri Gotic. Musicians at every corner and delectable aromas from Tapas restaurants entice the senses. The well known placas make for restful stops.
great to walk around. a nice relaxed atmosphere for strolls and interesting buildings, lots of nice little side streets where you can always find somewhere for a coffee, a wine or a snack.

WOOOOOOOW!. Millions of little streets, thousands of shops, a lot of landmarks, plazas, cafes and restaurants are hidden in this special and beautiful gothic quarter. You can spend a whole day just walking around and getting lost every 5 minutes haha. I could spend every day in a gothic quarter! There is a lot to see, to do and to experience! You need to take at least 2 hours and just walk around if you are visiting Barcelona!!! <3 I can't wait to visit Barcelona and Gothic quarter again!!
Wander back in time. An amazing array of things to see and do in this labyrinth of lanes and squares. Plenty of places to have a rest and a refreshment. Just wander and soak up the atmosphere.

The best part of the city.. Just wander about in these streets, check out the shops, the atmosphere. It is a very groovy part of the city but I believe we may reach the end of an era as rental prices are about to be hiked to unrealistic levels and potentially threatening the quirky, eclectic nature of this fantastic part of Barcelona.

The most interesting and exciting part of the city. We stayed in a hotel in the Barri Gotic and found it perfect for our needs. We were within walking distance or a quick taxi ride of nearly everything we wanted to see. You could spend hours just walking along the narrow streets and alleys, passing through the larger squares. Food, shops, everything you might want you can find in the Barri. Unless there's a reason for you to stay in another part of the city, I'd suggest finding a hotel right in the middle of things in the Gothic Quarter (Hotel Arai is a terrific option).

Great for tourists but stay clear of BB w/o air conditioning. Love this part of the city...it is alive with food, fun and people. Maybe too many shops selling the same stuff, but the restaurant and bar scene is great. People always talk ab out getting lost in Venice...you can get lost in the Barri Gotic just the same. Downside - we stayed in a bad airbnb one night...no air and it is very noisy.

History on every corner. But boy does the Bari Gothic smell. At least it did when we visited in August. However being in walking distance to Barcelona cathedral and many other historical sights is very useful. It is also a great place to find cafes and restaurants.

Vibrant City, Nice People. This was the 4th time I've visited Barcelona, and like all other times, I reminded myself why I love Spain so much: Nice weather, nice cities, and above all, very, very kind and polite people, always keen to help a visitor.Muchas gracias Barcelona!

Great shopping!. We spent a lot of time wandering around and enjoying the architecture and the shops. It's incredible how many beautiful classic buildings have been turned into modern storefronts, and to see the mix of these styles.
With guide Tour!. Done with a free walking tour, very nice, so many little Details you would never found on your own. Nice storys behind, a muss in Barcelona!

Fascinating Ancient Buildings alongside Modern Boutiques. We stayed in a lovely hotel in the Gothic Quarter and were amazed by the fabulous old buildings, narrow streets , hidden plazas, museums, art galleries around us. Every time you turned a corner there was another lane or passage,another museum or gallery. It was a shame that we were only there for a long weekend there wasn't enough time to see the whole of Barcelona and next time we go we will book a walking tour so that we can learn more of the history of this fascinating part of the city.

Completely charming. Free tour guides in front of Hard Rock each morning a nice discovery. You set time. Tip suggested. Very interesting tour navigating charming aisles and alleys. Churches, bistros, shopping all there. The underground tour at the Barcelona museum at the cathedral and palace fascinating. Sunday afternoon is free admission to the museum and catgedral

a must see. Beautiful...wear comfortable shoes...We walked here during the morning....when the shops were still closed...and went back a little later in the day......a different atmosphere and a must see.

Shopping Paradise with a lot of culture thrown in.. The Gothic quarter is a combo shopping paradise and architects dream. Stone building,cobblestone walkways, many outstanding tapas restaurants, great bakeries, cafes, and some culture thrown in.The Picasso Museum, the Old Main Synagogue, several churches,several squares. A wonderful way tospend a few hours.

Nice. We've not done all of it but the cathedral and the rest were worth a visit. La Rambla is really touristic, too much during summer I would say except if you like shops for tourists, tons of tourists all around, and street peddlers as you can find in other countries in the most famous places like around Eiffel tower in Paris etc. It has nice things to offer though (nice buildings and old shops etc.).
Come prepared for some fun shopping time.. Can't come to Barcelona without visiting this cute area full of museums, shops and history. Easy to navigate, safe, and full of stuff.

Essential Barcelona. This is the heart of the city and essential to any visit. You can walk at your leisure, see shops, cafes, bars, restaurants, cycle hire places etc, and all the time there are beautiful old balconies, about 4 stories, above you. People live here! They hang their washing out, show their national and football allegiances with flags, grow plants, drink coffee and talk to neighbours all above your head as you wander about. Some little alley ways have no shops. The beauty of the Barri Gotic is how it contains so many different facets but they all blend. Cycles and scooters glide past pedestrians, sometimes you walk past a car park unexpectedly and a car appears as from nowhere, and you marvel that there is enough room for it to pass through the narrow streets.We spent 3 days here and got to know just about all of the streets. Many of the shops just sell tourist stuff, but there are some very stylish shops, antique shops etc, as well. The alleys can be nice and cool when the weather is hot, but anyway you are never far from a cold beer.
This is one of the many musts.. Just like the Passeig de Gracia, one cannot visit Barcelona without visiting the Barri Gotic with its many small shops, bars, tea rooms and restaurants.

Beautiful. I got lost here for a few hours just wandering around looking at stuff, eating tapas in a couple of lovely bars, meandering around the back lanes and alleyways full of really interesting little shops and a great marketplace. A really great day.
Day and night. You can enjoy every aspects of it day and night. Too much things to visit and see, so choose wisely!

Barcelona in a nutshell !. You simply cannot miss this area, it has everything that the City is famous for, restaurants, tapas bars and atmosphere. At night the area is a mix of everything, unfortunately, some of the illegal street sellers are all too obvious and can be a bit of a nuisance in their efforts to avoid Police.

Walk away and enjoy. Specially on the summer I suggest you walk in the first hours, in the begining of mornings. Its a place to observe de details, for sure, specially the architeture. Please, have a small book or guide about Barcelona. It will make your personal and cozy tour really better. Full of coffee shops, small stores, books, ect :)
Walk, walk and walk.... Good place for city creatures :) Just go there, walk and feel the city. A lot of bars, cafes so it's very probable that you will stay there for a longer time.
Lovely area. So many things to sees and do and places to go. Fabulous tapas places and little taverns everywhere. very easy to while away a few hours just watching the world go by.

Nice place to spend a day, or even better book your hotel here!. Lovely narrow streets, and very central location if you are looking at place to stay in Barcelona. A mixture of genuine restaurants and tourist traps but that's how thing are. Nice buildings.
Beautiful architecture. take time to wander the smaller alleys as there are some brilliant hidden away gems for you to discover!

Very touristy, preserved. Fascinating (and strange) for an Australian - a hundred thousand (?) people living in basically a pedestrian zone. Short streets emptying out onto plazas. Heaven to be an inquisitive kid growing up here. Hell if you like gardening. For the tourist, it's a step back in time, with all mod cons. I reckon Terry Pratchett modeled The Shades on this. Keep your wallet in a chest pouch, or don't keep your wallet. Very touristy, with lots to see. BTW, the language here is Catalan. Seriously, it's not Spanish with an accent, it's a different language. Outside of numbers and menus, their English isn't strong.
Architectural marvels abound. Pay heed to warnings about pickpockets and stay safe as you wander this amazing area full of photo opportunities. So much to see and experience in Barcelona.
Endless Beauty. You could walk around this area all day and never get bored. There is something beautiful around every corner and it was with supreme pleasure that we walked around here daily.

Best part of Barcelona. Or at least definitely the most charming area. Altought very close to Las Ramblas, it lacks the swarming crowd of tourists that makes this city sometimes impossible to enjoy. And this is another pro.

Tapas & "Wine Tour. Had a great evening in the Gothic Quarter, especially at the Four Cats Tapas Bar. Lots to see and eat. The sangria was delicious. The best I've had. Small plates of Tapas, cheeses, hams, olives & fish

Wow wow . We stayed in a hotel right in the centre off the gothic corner. Amazing culture, beautiful buildings. Close to sea,zoo,la ramblas, port and beach. Superb choice of restaurants, most very reasonably priced too.

Most interesting area of Barcelona. This area of Barcelona is so interesting! Lots of little streets and passageways winding around so you barely know where you are. Around every corner there is a little slice of Spain that is new (but actually very old). So,e great little cafes and beutiful little churches. Worth a walk around when you have time to get lost and enjoy the ambiance.
Architecture!!!. Beautiful architecture awaits you at every corner. A photo op at every intersection! Lots of bars and restaurants and shops to while away the day!

If you are in to architecture. It's all about gothic architecture. Quiet a different experience. Place to be if you have good camera. And it is nice place to stroll about in an afternoon. Talking about strolling, word of advise for foreigners.. always take a good care of yourselves and your belongings. There are some crooked guys lugging around the city quiet often. I personally experienced a threat from a fake cop. It was a less crowded area in the city and out of nowhere two average looking dudes in a BMW blocked my way. Then one of them asked for my passport (showed me an Interpol ID also!). Luckily I read this in another review so I did not fall in to the trap. I did not freaked out and instead (quiet aggressively) asked for presence of an officer in uniform before showing anything. Then only they pulled away. So, watch out! and enjoy :-)

Gothic Quarter. When we first stumbled on this area we thought there was nothing there but it was 2.30 pm and everything seemed closed for lunch but after enjoying lots of tapas in this quarter at about 5 pm all the shops in the area re-opened and it was lovely.

Pedestrians only. The Barri Gotico was south of our hotel, so we walked through it a number of times. And each time found something new.There are any number of tourist trap shops, but the occasional gem too, and a wonderful bustly atmosphere, and of course the lovely market in the middle as well as the cathedral.Lots of tiny bars for wine and tapas, so a walk through can easily take all day!

This is the real Barcelona. You wanna see the roots (in space and time) of Barcelona? then you need to visit El Gótico, it's the old part of the city. Narrow streets crowed at night, full of pubs, clubs, restaurants and whatever you need...

Get Lost on Narrow Streets. Get lost on the narrow streets of the Barri Gotic and don't forget to look up. Beautiful architecture every where. Put the map away and tuck through narrow streets. Stop and rest along the way. Try to find a quiet street with no people and let your imagination run wild. When you are done, then and only then use the map to find your way.

One of the best experience during your trip.. I think this has be a must. But the way that I like to visit the Gothic is without a hurry and no specific place to go and be lost in those streets. Every corner is a finding and the ones lest visited are the best. You will find stores, cafes, art ateliers, antique stores, monuments. And when you cross av Laietana you will find more amazing things. Barcelona is for walking. So enjoy this experience.

Gothic Historic. If the Gothic era interest you this barrios will be of great interest for you. Nice architecture and building. For someone not so much into the Gothic, the shops and small cafes you'll find will make a visit well worth it.

Can people watch for hours. . I love this neighbourhood! Streets lined with tapas bars and cafes, shops galore of every kind you can imagine, atmospheric streets intermingled with each other and superb gothic buildings to behold. Add some incredibly important sites such as two cathedrals and museums and you just can't go wrong!!

Great little area to stroll. Loved the quaint little alleyways, full of history.
Lots of great restaurants and shopping.
You can lose yourself in here just strolling through. So much to look at

Should be called "Pick-Pocket quarter". This area is prime area for "pick-pockets", so much so that you can take a seat on a stool and not 15 min. will pass before you see some action. They don't care whether it's night or day.... and since the repercautions are nil and none, they will keep on doing it. Perhaps the police is being paid to over see this....literally "over-see'. Look up on Youtube "pickpocket Barcelona" and you will learn more.

Enchanting architecture and tour guide. We loved our first tour of Gaudi's work that we booked the gothic quarter right after our first tour ended. Barcelona is amazing and extremely safe to walk around in. The history given in this tour was extremely interesting for history lovers and the architecture surrounding the city is enchanting. I was never bored during the tour and it was thanks to our fantastic quide Miquel. There are not enough words to explain how great Miguel was, but I'll try ;) for one his English was fluent and easy to understand. He made us feel comfortable and gave us tips on places to eat and had no problem pointing them out on a map for us. The tour guides have booklets with pictures of old city squares, famous kings etc, and pictures from inside buildings that you have to pay extra to see. Defiantly make time to do this tour.

Discover the Mysteries of the Streets in the Gothic Quarter. Make sure to visit this particular area during your stay in Barcelona. The winding, dark streets are filled with many great shops to discover while spilling you out onto plazas, historical landmarks, and cathedrals. Don't miss reading the plaques for some mini history lessons about the area!
An interesting walk. Just a lot of fun wandering around the small streets. So many things to discover. Well worth a few hours strolling around.

Nicest Part of Barcelona. We loved this part of Barcelona, we first came here 4 years ago and can see a definite improvement in the area since then. Lots of pretty alleyways and cool independent shops for souvenirs (not full of tat like Las Ramblas) Lots of nice places to eat, organic bakeries and fast food, artisan ice creams etc..
Atmospheric and interesting. This part of Bcn lovely to walk round, get lost and genuinely soak up the Catalan experience you can spend 20 mins to all day just strolling around

Worth a visit to see the history.. We had a guide around the gothic Quarter he was very knowledgeable and it was an interesting tour to see how things were in that period.Going in the cathedral was amazing remember to have something to cover your knees and shoulders.

Lesley s . Lovely narrow histories streets lots of lovely shop /boutiques selling usual gifts a bit pricy for the tourists not as busy as la ram las which was nice to get away from the crowds we went to a tapas bar it was disappointing for not great the staff were miserable could be bother the waiter was rude pity we could speak Spanish then we would have understood what he was muttering as he walked away from the table !!! It was a shame as inside the Resturant was decorated in the old style very gothic which is why we choose to eat there thinking it was more authentic .another day in the gothic area opposite the caters we had drinks at another tapas bar which was very good friendly staff it was morgen inside white furniture tapas bar with stools good price too

The Gothic Quarter on Foot.. The area looks very different at night when shops/restaurants open and close so it is a good idea to have a walking map ready. The Tourist map doesn't name individual streets so best to download one. If you take in the water front, it makes for a full day out with lots of little squares, quirky streets, shops and restaurants but without a map you will get lost!. We didn't mind but you may have other plans. The cathedral is well worth a look inside. Considering it was August, there was a good atmosphere.
walking, walking. Spent so much time walking the area (and of course enjoying it very much) that we didn't gain any weight on vacation!
Just great!. Go to Tapeo restaurant and sit at the bar and order the froise gras with eggs and the calamari, Divine!
Historic. An extremely interesting and historical area. It is very easy to get lost amongst the maze of intriguing little lanes but well worth a visit.

A tour of the Gothic Quarter. We took a delightful walking tour of this section of Barcelona prior to a cruise. This is a good way to see the everyday business life of the city with uniques shops, bakeries with visually delicious treats, farmer's markets with an overwhelming slection of fruits, meats, fish, etc. A real enjoyable experience
Favourite area of Barcelona. Walk around and get lost in all of the twists and turns. Full of interesting bars, restaurants and shops. Just off the Ramblas. Love it!

Fantastic. If you are in Barcelona, you must visit this district! I like very much the walks through some romantic narrow street. You can find here some good shops with souvenirs and some interesting places, for example Palau de la Música Catalana, the Cathedral, Basilica of Santa Maria, Placa Sant Jaume and so on.

Classic Spanish Architecture In The Gothic Quarter. When I first arrived in Barcelona I saw this classic Spanish architecture and thought wow amazing out with the camera like many others. I wandered round the maze of streets a few times night and day and did not experience even the slightest hint of the danger which travellers are advised to be aware of in The Gothic Quarter. In fact the atmosphere was quite pious with quite a few nice churches build into the area. Barcelona Cathedral is also splendid, free to view and worth calling in at. Towards the end of my stay my perceptions of the area changed somewhat as I mused whether I would or should feel the same way whilst strolling around the back alleys of old terraced housing in England. The large amount of graffiti also lowers the quality of the experience as does the desperate litter situation but the Spanish authorities cannot really be held accountable for that because with the huge volume of tourists walking and cycling the area they cannot possibly keep up and constantly maintain a clean zone.
