There is also a few open squares and many shops selling food, a superb range of souvenirs and really delicious ice-cream which goes down a treat during a hot days sightseeing.
Very nice area to walk. Very nice area to walk, very nice little shops a very good choice of restaurants. Must go back there.

Great mix of things. We walked up and down most of the streets in the gothic quarter over the course of several days. So much to see and do. Shops, restaurants, churches, a variety of people from all walks of life. Worth spending a couple of hours seeing.

Excellent. Great little streets full of character and away from big crowds...
Small shops and great architecture all around....
Loved It. Went all around the Gothic Quarter and loved every minute of it. There are loads of Bars, Restaurants and places to see. All reasonably priced.
Best part of Barcelona!. What a wonderful part of the city for history, food, architecture, and shopping. Get lost and enjoy it!

Was once special, now is "made in china" feel. What was once delightful now has been inundated with hordes of tourist buses, made in china souvenir shops, and chain restaurants and shops. This area has lost its charm and the city should make a greater effort to preserve its heritage.

A must see & experience. I think Gothic Quarter is the one of the best place in the world where you can see the harmony of the past & today. It is really one the important heritages of Spain/Barcelona and the reason why Barcelona is Barcelona.

Living Museum. A living Museum. Worth visiting. Lots of restaurants to choose from,and fun shopping. As with all parts of Barcelona you need to be aware of pick pockets. I was targeted twice on the subway and fortunately was able to fend off their clumsy attempts.
Lovely to wander around. Great shops, cafés, atmosphere and churches to spend a few mornings wandering about. Got lost quite a few times, but found something great each time we did.
Gothic???. I haven't seen nothing gothic there. It is free so you don't loose much, but basiclly nothing special

Amazing old spots. I am enchanted by this part of Barcelona. I feel like a Princess walking along her kingdom, Interesting architecture, amazing colours, many tourists, great shops and expensive perfumes to smell in the street from everyone :) I bought amazing things there and visited great places. Just one example - the Pablo Picasso museum. Vamos, chicos!

A fascinating meander. Just off La Rambla, this historical quarter is a wonderful place for a walk. Narrow, winding lanes lead from one beautiful square to another. The old cathedral is also worth a visit.

Amazing old town.... The port has art work in the water... it leads to La Rambla where everyone takes a stroll. See the old Umbrella factory building, buy a piece of art from an unknown artist, flowers for your sweetheart or dine in one of the open air restaurants and people watch. Follow the twisted streets to see the one of a kind shops and end up on the plaza in front of the Barcelona Cathedral. If you are lucky you might hear someone singing opera towards dusk. Have perfume made to order, buy a specialty bicycle or go to the "Pill" shop to fill your sweet tooth. Dont miss a flamenco dance show or the Palau de Musica.
Nice for a walk. Great to walk around. Some lovely authentic souvenir shops, great gelato shops and really good bakeries and bars.Easy to spend a few hours walking around here.
Beautiful, fun, part of the city. Well worth a visit. Food, Architecture, History. Shopping, plus its cooler in the narrow side streets It has it all
Worth a look. pretty cool area. amazing food and some beautiful architecture to admire. definitely work a look around.
Full of lovely twists and turns. An afternoon stroll with charming shops and lovely architectural detail. Confirms ones notion of living in Europe

This place is unique and beautiful. unique and filled with history. The narrow streets and the little tavernas and bodegas and watering holes as well as the Gothic Basilina and the museums can get you enthralled in the area for days. One of my favorite places to wonder and discover new things and rediscover places again. This is our first trip as a family, but my third one. Love the energy of Las Ramblas and Plaza Real. I am inspired by the wondrous beauty of the various areas within the Gothic cathedral, especially the oldest St Lucia chapel that is so old and yet sti beautiful.

Great experience. A well worthwhile area of Barcelona to visit. Although there are large crowds, there are still areas where it is quiet and you can find yourself alone in a narrow street or a small plaza. Well preserved buildings and streets, with a lot of quirky shops and cafes. One could spend days wandering around exploring what is around the next corner. Keep your camera handy. Spotlessly clean also.

Beautiful!. A personal favourite of mine has to be the Gothic Quarter. With its cobbled, narrow streets and amazing architecture, this place is a must. There are plenty of quaint shops and places to eat. A perfect place to explore!
Just get lost. All the narrow streets of Barri Gotic are like a real life maze! So many nice bars and reastaurants where you can chill down and chat along. Perfect for a afternoon walk in the shade.

Walking & exploring paradise!. Make sure you have enough time to explore all the laneways - every turn reveals another fascinating experience!So much to see and learn about the history of this city!Tip: wear sensible shoes to navigate the cobbled pathways!
Great walk. This area is full of history and great architecture. It was really fun to just walk and get lost in the streets if this area. We will return.

Must Visit. one of the best areas in Barcelona, it's alleys and shops are very cute and worth walking amidst the old aura of the city. The market on the side and the random art work you find is very exciting. Definitely a must see for everyone visiting.
Very cool place. Very cool and historic place. Many attractions to see and many different people from all over the world to meet.

A wonderful place to wander the cobblestone narrow streets!. We only had a short time in Barcelona but we stayed right in the Gothic Quarter and then enjoyed wandering the narrow pedestrian streets around the Cathedral. We found great places for wine, tapas, chocolate and nougat (with extra brought home). There is a free time for the Cathedral in the late afternoon. Make sure that you are dressed appropriately. No short-shorts, tank tops or hats. We saw many people turned away. There are women selling scarves right outside the Cathedral to cover shoulders which is one of my favorite things brought home. A great place to kick-off your Barcelona visit and definitely the place to be if you only have a short time before travel or cruises.

Narrow Alleys and Good architecture. Gothic Quarters are really narrow alleys and great shopping area and good place to explore when in and around La Ramblas. Explore the architecture and shops in the area and stroll around. Good place.
Pretty Streets. Walking around the Gothic Quarter is great! There’s lots to see and there are many shops and restaurants.
A great historic walk. Walk around the streets and travel back through the centuries! A bit narrow and not as clean as other areas, it's still a must-visit, if only for the great tapas and wine bars.
Old Barcelona. Maze of tiny streets with wonderful buildings , squares , shops and restaurants . You can spend hours here and not cross the same street but do take a good map .
Charming! Must see.... Amazing feel to this area of Barcelona. Fun to explore and get lost in for awhile! Lots of cafes and shops and hidden treasures around every corner.
Amazing Architecture. Amazing architecture sandwiched into the city. Definitely worth admiring while strolling through this part of the city!

Very fun and interesting neighborhood. My hotel was in the El Born neighborhood. But I couldn't tell where El Born ended and Barri Gotic started. They seemed like one place to me. So many things are within a short walk: there's a metro stop, the Picasso Museum, the Cathedral and Music Hall, the Basilica and you're about 10-15 minutes away from the beach!
Interesting area. Very interesting area and just off Las Ramblas with narrow laneways and plenty of shops. The architecture here is interesting.

What a nice surprise.. We happened to select a hotels in the Gothic Quarter. What great luck. So much to see just strolling in the area and close to the downtown by beach. We were only here for a day but are planning a trip back for a longer stay.
Must visit. I really loved the Gothic Quarter. It has neat shops and restaurants as well as historic buildings. It is easy to get lost in though so use offline maps to stay orientated.

One of the most interesting parts in Barcelona. I spend a month in Barcelona and I got most of its essence from this small neighborhood. It takes you out from the hustle and bustle of the city into a relatively quieter place, with it's amazing variety of restaurants, cafe's, shops, and amazing buildings. I spent most of my time here in this part exploring tiny shops and i discovered a lot of interesting places. I recommend this part for all the people who like the old towns. It is easy to get there, I used to go there by L3 metro (green) using Liceu station, you will reach la Rambla street and then dive into the narrow streets on the left and enjoy!

Fun and interesting. I liked this area of narrow streets, shops lining the walls, the balconies, and its modernisme history. Fun area to take a stroll, go inside the shops and get a little history lesson. If you're looking for a fun shop, art montfalcon is here. If you're a fan of Picasso, you can have a drink at Els Quatre Gats, where he frequented during the early part of his career. Very crowded in the summer, however.

Get a guide or a guide book. We went and walked around but since we didn't have a guide nor a guide book, we didn't really get to enjoy the history behind some of the beautiful buildings.Bottom Line: Use a guide or a guide book
Gothic Quarter. We really enjoyed our walking tour of the Gothic Quarter. The history and architecture were phenomenal.

Fun to Explore. We rented an apartment in the Gothic Quarter and spent hours just exploring its streets and alleys. Great shops and restaurants as well as people watching. We didn't have a plan, we just explored.

Gothic Quarter is lovely. I visited Barcelona with my family during hot summer when there were so many tourist the streets were filled. However, it was lovely and would not have missed the beautiful Gothic neighborhood, there were souvenir shops in every street and cheap eatery's on every corner, we ate pizza for lunch and people watched. There was a good presence of police and never felt any type of threat from seedy people. It is safe, lovely, and friendly.
Interesting and worth a visit. Absolutely loved this area. Interesting little alleys and beautiful paving everywhere. Would go again.
Great for a walk. Nice streets to walk in with beautiful architecture, has street artists which adds to the experience.
Interesting narrow streets. Interesting little shops in the pictureque old and narrow lanes. Not so many people as the crowded Rambla.

Must , like a travel in the past and not so crowded. Superb to stroll around away from the sun, it is full of small restaurants and artisan shops. I simply enjoyed it. It looks like a movie set! Beautiful.

Feeling the Time Turning Back. Strolling around the Gothic Quarter is fun and something special for us from the North America (considering our history of some 200 years…). Make sure to bring with you high quality camera and snap shot at every corner at any opportunity where there aren’t many other tourists presented in your background!
Jackie b. This is a fab part of barcelona loads to see and do tons of shops and restaurants my favourite restaurant is rossinis in the goth quarter i give it 10 out of 10 food is mouth watering.
Real atmosphere of old Barcelona. Great for unusual shopping and atmosphere. Lovely little streets to wander around with plenty of architectural interest.

A Fabulous Area. Small Streets - A Maze You Wiill Love Exploring & Getting Lost In - we are staying in this area and we absolutely love it. Loads and loads of awesome tapa restaurants, deli bars (make sure you try the aged hams). Most of this area is car free except for taxis and service vehicles. I strongly suggest you wander down the small streets and soak in the atmosphere and the amazing architecture.

Unique escape. Did a walking tour in this area. Quite a surprise to see narrow streets and shaded areas in a warm Barcelona day. The history is interesting with Roman cemeteries and even remains of a Roman temple. It's a great place to wander around.

must visit.. lots and lots of nice restaurants with a wide variety of things to do, the Picasso museum and other attractions, please book your museum tickets in advance. if you are looking for a place to have a drink you have multiple choices here.
Good place to go.. It is the centre of the old city of Barcelona. It stretches from La Rambla to Via Laietana, i Love walking in the streets.

Park yourself only here!. If in Barcelona, there is no better place to stay. Best area to absorb the culture, be with the locals and to top it all...bestest food ever! Try tapas at local places and the beer at local pubs.. shopping is right next door...little boutique shops below the buildings and art galleries everywhere... You will be immersed in area so much that you would not want to go back..

Good places to drink and eat. Lots of good value places to eat. Especially if off the beaten track. Just watch your bags and be prepared for people approaching you to go into bars/restaurants or selling beer.

Explore at your Leisure. Great place to explore but be sure to take a map. It's easy to get lost on some of the winding back streets. A very safe area during the day, don't know about the nighttime so I can't comment. Lots of trendy little shops and restaurants.
The place to be. Walk around. Imbibe the atmosphere. Lots of nice little places to eat, shop etc. Maybe take a guided tour and learn about the history of the place. Its all quite interesting.

Must see - and it is basically free!. Absolute must see if you are visiting Barcelona. No need for a tour guide or itenenary - just enjoy wandering the ancient streets and alley ways and looking at the buildings.Make sure you don't miss the Barcelona Cathedral (which is an amazing ancient building - and is free to enter, although they won't let you in if you are not reasonably dressed - i.e no singlets or dresses without covered shoulders).
Impossible to miss. it is almost impossible to miss this area, interesting with shopping ansdarchitectural experiences, all eras of history together!

Beautiful Gothic Quarter walk. It is definitely worth taking a walk through the Gothic Quarter and enjoy the plazas and narrow streets. Beautiful old architecture really gives you a sense of what it must have been like centuries ago.Now there are a lot of shops, restaurants, tapas bars and side streets with the Barcelona Cathedral nearby.
One of my favourite places in barcelona. I love the gothic quarter. It's winding streets and little shops show you what Barcelona was like hundreds of years ago before the expansion of the city.

Not to old to live in.... As with most Gothic Quarters, the narrow and winding streets provide a magical ground to get lost in. Not as many tourists here as expected (Besides out the Picasso gallery). The old Synagogal is a must see, as well as some great hidden restaurants and cheap Tapas. It is not the prettiest but it has a very real lived in town feel.
Nice walk in old town. Really nice to walk around the winding and narrow streets. Easy to stop in many places for a coffee or ice-cream.
Gothic Quarter. We stayed in George Orwell Square, brilliant location, great squares to drink and watch the buskers. Easy access to lots of small alley ways and niche shops

Aimless wandering...heaven. No plan, no maps, no itineraries...just spend the day slowly meandering. The area is filled with the most interesting shops, fabulous tapas bars, plazas, churches and old buildings. I could have spent many days wandering around this area of Barcelona.
great for walking. love walking on it, great gelatos and plazas to have claras or tinto de verano. nice walk with the family

So charming, day or night . Had a brief two days in Barcelona, and from what I saw this was my favorite area by far. Beautiful and quaint with many side streets to "get lost" down. Went to a cute market near the cathedral as well, had some neat antiques. Beware of tourist traps.
Interesting. This is gorgeous keep exploring It's a lovely walk down the beach Roman city wall old cathedral and lovely streets
Beyond description... wow.... Stunning, just stunning. It is so different from Roman styles of buildings, never thought I would love something gothic, but I was blown away...
An absolute must in Barcelona. A must place to see. Maybe the norrowest streets I ever walked. Beautiful architecture. Take the walk from Ramblas down to the Cathedral
Quaint & Historic. Every street corner surprised you with quaint old shops , street musicians and Tapas Bars. The walk takes you back in time and is a pleasant experience.
Must see. Really interesting area to walk around. Lots of little shops and bars to eat tapas in.We kept going back.
Happy Pills shop. Pick and mix in a bottle.. Lovely wandering through the little streets and alleys into courtyards and discovering new places. Old architecture mixed with modern shops and cafes.
Great for roaming. Such a lovely place to stroll through and enjoy the atmosphere, architecture and history. Tapas bars everywhere. Well worth a visit.

Take your time and explore the Gothic Quarter. I just love Barcelona and especially the Gothic Quarter, you can spend hours rambling around the tiny streets with the quaint shops you would otherwise miss!

Beautiful old architecture. Absolutely loved walking through Gothic Quarter, definitely must visit the quarter to see what the architecture and streets looked like in the past. Can get quite busy. There are lots of street artists (painters and musicians) and also many stalls from which you can purchase handmade items as well as collectibles.

Great for strolls, watch out for tourist traps. A stroll in the Gothic Quarter is a great way to spend a couple of hours getting to know Barcelona. The main streets are lined with shops but the smaller ones offer interesting items such as authentic turron!
exploring. A wonderful area to get lost in. Roame aound this negbourhood and dont,t forget to get som tapas along the way
Quaint. We had a lovely stroll without paying for a guided tour through the gothic quarter. Lots of great little shops to suit all tastes and also places to eat to suit all budgets. Very enjoyable.

A Wanderer's Paradise. For those who love to explore old, historical neighborhoods, and shop in offbeat, locally owned artisan's shops (for whatever), this is the Barcelona neighborhood for you. As a photographer looking for the iconic Barcelona street scenes, this area was a treasure maze of possible shots. I recommend an afternoon of wandering the streets of the Gothic Quarter to any want to get a feel for the birthplace of this amazing city.

Exploring the Gothic Quarter...a Nostalgic Experience!. The Gothic Quarter is what gives Barcelona it's character and charm. There are so many small streets to explore which have unique bars, small restaurants, shops and of which are home for many residents. The streets are beautiful and kept so clean that the public can reminiscence in Barcelona's history and view how Barcelona has changed today. Every night the streets are being washed down. During the day the streets can sometimes become a little busy, at least during June/July when we visited though still far quieter than a trip down La Rambla. Nearly everyday we went through the Gothic Quarter and was by far the best walking experiences we did. We also took a couple of free walking tours to experience the Old City through a company named RunnerBean which took us through many of these small streets too. Well worth exploring and was one of the highlights of our trip!
Fabulous Barcelona!. Loved Barcelona! Plan ahead.. book your tours or get tickets for sights. Be adventurous, go for the food! Stay by the Cathedral or Barri Gotic so you can walk everywhere.

Always our choice to stay. Great history and landmarks in this neighbourhood. We always stay here a few blocks off Las Ramblas as we like the mix of locals and tourists. Always lots of hidden local taverns and restaurants to discover. Various shopping areas where you can find everything and anything. Never felt concerned for safety but keep an eye out for pickpockets.

Tapas heaven!. This is the area we stayed in and found its buildings and architecture amazing, had neck ache from looking up all day.
Also great for traditional style quiet little Tapas bars

History beneath your feet. If you ever wondered what was the city life few centuries ago, walk this streets and you'll feel (with all yours senses) ancient spirit of old city Barcelona. If you have only 2 hours to spend in this city, than this is the only thing you should do.
The old and the new.. Lovely Stuff. A great mix of the classical and contemporary with a miriad of tapas bars and clothing and art shops.

Embrace the history. Our hotel was in the gothic quarter and we just stepped out of it and there was a great tapas bar called Gourmet tapas and round another corner we found a mad music bar that was great. We then came across another bar that served octopus.. We ordered a glass of wine and we were given a bottle. Great evening. We loved all the narrow streets with the flags and balconies.. We wanted to experience the old part of Barcelona and it was well worth it.

Wander and get lost. We found this little place on our last day, and really enjoyed just wandering around, getting lost in the streets and shopping in the little shops. Spend a couple of hours here for a taste of the old barcelona
What a lovely location. This is the true spirit of Barcelona, the Gothic quarter. Every narrow street leads you firther and further into the beautiful maze. Go!

Lovely Historic District. We spend many hours walking this historic district, enjoying the architecture, historic sites, restaurants, nightlife and shopping. We often stopped to take a break at the many restaurants with outdoor seating in the placas. It is the perfect neighborhood to wander & explore historic and contemporary Barcelona

Take the time to get lost in the Gothic Quarter. Fantastic area, we stayed down on the Marina and was an easy walk to the Gothic Quarter. A young guide gave us the perfect advice (without being rude) If you have time take the time to get lost in the Gothic Quarter. Literally we did a few times and discovered more than we could ever hope for. Little bars, quaint shops and squares just teaming with passer bys. Far better than La Pedra which was always over crowded and filled with pushy sellers.

Must visit in Barcelona. I could seriously spend days exploring the incredible beauty around every corner of the numerous, hidden and winding alleyways. Have not had a bad meal yet in the gothic quarter, every tiny, almost missable restaurant is amazing. Plenty of things to do, cute quirky shops, museums, souvenirs etc. Very cool place, a photographers delight!

Old Barcelona. Barri Gotic is an amazing maze of cobbled streets dotted with tiny shops. We explored all the hidden squares and visited the Cathedral and the Basilica of Pi. We had a wonderful time just walking randomly through the Quarter, encountering one architectural delight after another!
Great walk through history!. It was fun walking through the small passage ways and little shops along the way. I would recommend to drop in little shop and enjoy the day in the Barri Gotic!
the place to eat. old area of barcelona plenty of competition amongst eateries of all sorts away from the touts of la ramblas.
Take time to explore. Get lost in this historic quarter of Barcelona. If you like exploring a region on foot then wandering arrow the Barri Gotic will appeal. Enjoy!
Nice place to stroll down. The Gothic Quarter is close to the Ramblas. It has these amazing architectural buildings. Lots of neat shops for shopping.
Great place to explore!. My husband and I loved walking around the Gothic Quarter. We had no plan... we just enjoyed exploring and not knowing what we would find around each corner.

Fun to explore. We always like getting lost in places and just finding our way naturally, which is great for here as you can never get too far away from the centre. Lots of tiny streets and tight corners, very much like Venice, hundreds of shops... lots just rubbish but a lot of nice ones too. Good fun to explore and a must for a visit to Barca.
Barri Gothic. Charming, great for shopping and eating out. Lots of narrow streets but this adds to the mystery of the place.

A worthy place to walk around. Part of the thrill of travel is discovering enchanting neighborhoods with wonderful places to eat, drink and soak in the local culture. The Gothic quarter won't disappoint....each block was packed with interesting places ..the proprietors will reach out to you as you are strolling and invite you to join them for some nourishment or drink,,another adventure is waiting around each corner.
Gothic Quarter - a grand experience. The entire quarter is a cultural & cuisine fest well worth your time. If you like peace and quite, you may want to consider renting a flat somewhere else.

This is where you will end up spending most of your time in Barcelona. There are too many interesting sights to even start the list. Perhaps more importantly you may just want to get lost in the area's narrow streets.

Very crowded and packed vith tourists. Has lost a lot of its original charm.. Nice and beautiful, but VERY crowded! It's very much a tourist trap, with many of the shops selling the very same things. and strangly enough, my daughter wanted a spanish fan, but they were very hard to find. Look for the streets outside the main track, and you find nice cafe's and restaurants.

Don't miss! Highlights old meets new in Barcelona. I love this place. I have been coming to Barcelona for years and I never get tired of this area. It's filled with cute little shops, great places to eat or get coffee, and has a nice feel to it. Would not miss this area if you go to Barcelona and the free walking tour starts here also. Take a while and wander around! :)

If those walls could talk. The area must hold so many stories and witnessed so muvh happenings theough the centuries, I wish the walls could talk. But in the meantime there are interesting shops amd bric-a-brac one could find while exploring on foot.
Great walking section. Wonderful architecture, great little restaurants, bakeries, bars, etc. this is a really nice and relaxed place to stroll around.

Loved this area! . The whole area was alive and I loved the architecture of the houses, just make sure you look up,above the shop fronts to really appreciate the balconies and style of the buildings. La Rambla has everything for the visitor along it, but make sure you are fully alert to where your belongings are, keep them safe. I wandered around this area for a good few hours and could have done more but had a train to catch, I can't wait to go back and see more as I only scratched the surface of this fascinating area.
cosy place. It is just a must see part of barcelona, there is a great atmosphere, and one of the places I always go to, when I am in barcelona. lots of shops and restaurants.
Awesome stroll in the old city. This is a must place to stroll around in Barcelona. Beautiful architecture, cute little cafes and bars. Walking around is free!

Beautiful architecture. Beautiful Gothic architecture abounds, with hints of the works of renowned Catalan artists along the way. Look up and you'll see gargoyles and dragons, among other figures in the most unique locations. If you are a fan of historic sites and architecture, this is the place for you!
Yes, its a touristtrap but you have to see it. If itm wasent for all the nortafrican vednors, pocketthieves it would be amazing. As it stands its much of a touristtrap - but well worth seeing.
Interwoven with history. Something romantic about this place. That is why we have witnessed a photoshoot at this place. The Gothic Quarter in Barcelona is one of the most visited place.
what a maze!. What a fantastic maze of narrow streets and alleyways, a great place to get lost and wander around. Turn the corner and there's a little concert or cool looking architecture.
Reminders of days past.... Fun to walk around...twists and turns in the narrow streets full of small boutiques and eateries. You feel a real sense of days gone by...

Interesting and historic area of Barcelona.. An interesting area of Barcelona, quaint typically Spanish streets which cater well for tourists. take care to track your movements it is easy to get confused and lose your way.

Romantic gothic stroll. Booking our hotel in the Gothic Quarter was the best! We took romantic strolls through beautiful architecture, shops, live music, and restaurants. There is always something going on both day and night. Love!

Mmm!- Not sure!. You cannot fault the architecture of the area and the artist Gaudi features heavily in Barcelona culture. However in the evening and off the main Las Ramblas street the side streets do give the feeling of being dark and ever so slightly threatening to the unsuspecting tourists with some shady characters around.

I just wish I had more time to explore. An area of history, beautiful buildings and a people watchers heaven. Lots of people in the main areas, we spent time just sitting and watching the world go by, it was too hot to be rushing about. All I can say is spend a couple of days taking your time exploring. We were on a day trip from Lloret and tried to pack as much into the day as we could. We did not do it justice, so we will be coming back soon for a nice long weekend in Barcelona and will be ready to spend more time here.
The old city. The Gothic Quarter is great to see if you like the view of the old city. Make sure to see the Cathedral of Barcelona while you are there.
Great place to walk around. the old town and new. It is lovely quarter to walk around, you see lots around you, little street that you go down and you find a little gem

Coolest part (IMHO) of Barcelona.. This was, by far, my favorite section of Barcelona. So much history you can just feel as you walk the closed in cobblestone streets. Spent almost an entire day just wandering around and "getting lost". If you visit Barcelona, you must spend time wandering the Barri Gotic for sure!

walk around the gothic quarter. Really enjoyed our first stroll around the gothic quarter on our 3rd day in Barcelona - so much so that we went back almost everyday after that. Best word to describe the atmosphere in this area is "alive". It feels different walking around this area - unique from the other parts of the city. Although there are plenty of tourists walking around, it feels as though there are just as many locals. Lots of walking tours, segway tours and bike tours in Barri Gotic - make sure to check them out. Our favourite part of the Barri Gotic were the restaurants and bars - almost all were very inviting, making it hard to choose which to go to.

favorite place to walk. Favorite place to talk in Barcelona, though I'm not an expert. Thousands of people see the area every day but the back streets are quiet enough to feel like you've discovered a building or a stone carving on the wall. The Cathedral sets the tone but there are bars and restaurants that stay lively late.
Old is gold!. Its a place to capture the perfect pictures with the raw background! (hahaha). Its wonderful to spend a couple of hours in Gothic Quarters!

A lovely place to spend the day. This was an incredible area. We spent two days roaming thru this part of town. We went into all of the old churches which were all incredible inside- they were worth the price of admission.

Walking the Old City. A lot of history and wonderful cobblestone streets. There is so much to see every time you turn a corner. There is a cathedral and remnants of the old wall and temple of Augustus, and many restaurants and shops as well. A walking tour would be helpful to make sure you don't miss anything. Spent a lot of time there.

Gothic Quarter in JULY. The reviews I had read about the Gothic Quarter did not give it the credit it deserves, I found the quarter a totally magic place with endless narrow streets and alleyways, each leading to new finds, shops, bars. When the Cathedral appeared in front of me at the end of one alleyway, I was amazed I had only walked a few minutes from the Hotel (EL JARDI), Then next alleyway took me a shopping street with which led onto the PLACA CATALUNYA. Going in the opposite direction and in 10 minutes I was on the sea front after just following the narrow alleyways. Explore the Quarter and be excited and amazed at what you find ? I spent 3 day exploring the quarter and LA RAMBLA and cannot wait to go back ?

The best part of Barcelona. This old section of Barcelona is made up of winding narrow alleyways opening onto squares. They can take you to the harbor or over to the Picasso Museum. At first they seem a bit scary like you'll never find your way around, but soon you realize which directions lead where. They are full of little surprises: inlaid tile images on the walls, tapas restaurants, medieval and Roman buildings. The Cathedral is definitely worth a visit, but women must have their shoulders and chests covered. The plaza in front of the cathedral is an endless source of entertainment.

Old architecture worth a look. This area has some nice older architectures. Good area to walk around. Very convenient to the old cathedral. We did not attempt to enter any of the buildings, but the walk was pleasant.
Perfect place for walking . There is an endless number of places to eat, drink or shop. It's a very romantic place too and I highly recommend it to couples.

Beautiful. There is nothing I love more than walking through Barri Gotic. The architecture is nothing short of amazing. I'm also a person who really enjoys pedestrian areas so this is perfect. The restaurants are cute and there are many. So lovely.

Nice place to visit . This is a good place to walk/shop at night. If you are visiting during the day don't forget your hat, sunglasses, and bottle of water. It's extremely hot in the summer. Recommend visiting.
Great atmosphere. Great atmosphere and quiet alleyways to discover. Plenty of typical tourist shops but also interesting shops, cafes and side streets to discover

Transport yourself back in time.. This area is such an amazing collection of building and alleys, you could well be back a couple of hundred years ago if not longer. A good pair of comfortable shoes to walk in and a few spare hours are required here. Try lunch in the Born market where almost anything can be found. Within the market are ruins from over 1000 years ago to check out.
So interesting. I did a walking tour a few years ago so this time I just wandered the streets and really enjoyed finding beautiful buildings and squares amongst the laneways. Allow time to explore!

Touristy area. This is a typical tourist downtown area. Make sure to visit the Mercado de Boqueria, then visit the cathedral (don't war shorts or mini skirts!) and then grab a hot chocolate with churros.

Full of character and history. It was a very hot day and we had been walking for hours so were very tired, so didn't see as much as I would have liked. I was last here 18 years ago but will return again.

One of our favourite spots in Barcelona!. Love love love the Gothic Quarter! Every corner and alley is a photographer's dream. The historic buildings, cobbled streets and rich heritage are a must see destination if you're visiting. You'll find great restaurants, tapas bars and unique little shops. Enjoy your visit!
An experience . You can easily be lost in the Barri Gothic between the local delicacies, tapas and vino. Great street performers and artist in night time.

Traditional town atmosphere. Away from the hustle of the main shopping area and GarciaA nice reflection of the older with the new. Streets are much narrower, but hides many gems of churches and unique shops
must visit !. you have to visit - just so much to see and photograph.Culture and history in abundance. would recommend you take your time and breath the history
Amazing architecture. Amazing views at every turn. It's like walking around a film set. Unreal but Sensational architecture.

Free Tour of the Barri Gotic. A great way to learn about the Barri Gotic is to take a free walking tour that lasts about two hours. Just tip the guide after learning the history and seeing the highlights of this fascinating district. It's a good way to discover the area when you first arrive. Your hotel reception desk or concierge should know where to link up with a tour. Our guide picked us up in the hotel lobby. Carlos was our guide, and he cares deeply about his city.

Visited regularly during our stay in Barcelona. Restaurants, culture, history and bags of quality restaurants and cafes. What's not to like! To appreciate this busy but small part of town, I would recommend a city walking tour early in your visit to fully appreciate the history and stories and culture that make this part of town so attractive. If you want to eat, food outlets are in abundance and it is better to have a look at them rather than going with the guide books. We liked restaurants that were busy with locals rather than the more salubrious venues. However, some of the best restaurants in town are here.

Shopaholic paradise. This part of Barcelona is especially beautiful, since it combines the old, gothic architecture and the vintage shops all around it. Be sure to not rush when going to the gothic quarter, because the streets are very narrow and there is a lot to see. And last but not least, don't buy a lot of stuff before checking the whole place, because there are a lot of similar stores, and you never know in which one you will find a discount! :)
Historical view. Loved the old buildings, a photographers dream, well worth a visit. Good resteraunts and cafés reasonable prices.

Must Do in Barcelona. Although very expensive, the little shops are interesting. The architecture is beautiful and it is really nice walking around in this area. Here is a nice vibe and also many restaurants to choose from.

Tears of Joy!. It's a "must see." The history of the area, parts still standing from the Roman era, the fantastic street performers (who sang beautifully together, bringing me to tears) singing opera, their voices resonating off of the walls, the foods, the vendors, the groups of people who would break out into spontaneous dancing and clapping....it's an area not to be missed. I only wish I had more than the 4 days I did to explore such a rich and vibrant city....

Back to medieval times. In this area you can walk and enjoy the ancient architecture, street artists, some of them really good, and shopping too. Nice activity for early afternoon when is not very hot and is a lot more enjoyable.

Getting lost in Gothic quarter. We walked from Barcelona cathedral to La Ramblas through Gothic quarter. It is a pedestrian only area filled with people. The streets are lined with Souvenir stores, shops and eating places. We had a great time walking through the Gothic quarter. We were advised to be careful with our money and belongings. We did not have any bad experiences. But it is easy to lose your belongings as there are so many people around you.There are really no road signs in gothic quarter. So, we just followed the general direction towards Ra Lamblas and had a great time finding our way to La Ramblas.
lovely food. nice food and very reasonably prices and very friendly waiter we in Barcelona in a heatwave so it was nice to sit outside

Not scary. I had read a lot of reviews before taking my family to Barcelona and all of them had warned people of pick pockets. I had decided to avoid this area because of all of the warnings. To my surprise our hotel accomidations had been changed to an appartment in the Barri Gotic area. And I am so glad it did! We loved the area and exploring the winding streets. Don't get me wrong, I was a little nervous about walking down the dark narrow streets at night, but we never had a problem.

A warren of alleys and old buildings and unexpected squares. It is full of tourists, like everywhere we went in Barcelona in July. But you can still enjoy this ancient part of the city. It felt like the heart of the city to me. There are lots of shops and restaurants and attractions. It is a great place to wander, maybe for days.

Nice place to walk but nothing special. I'm not sure what we expected from Barcelona's gothic quarter but I wouldn't go there expecting anything. The buildings are pretty and it's pleasant to walk there in the sun but I'm really not sure what all the fuss is about. Why is this rated as a must-see above any other pretty, old European town? There are much more interesting things to do in Barcelona!
Charming Walk. Get a taste of the historic section by walking through as part of the journey or as a destination. There are plenty of places to eat and drink. Bring a map.
Gothic quarter. Fabulous for just wandering around , little streets and fabulous architecture. The market was interesting , great food , the ba cathedral well worth a visit

Historic, great attractions, but it is the unexpected moments that really make it my favorite.. The cathedral and the MUHBA are not to be missed here. Everytime you walk by the old buildings, you notice something different. La Rambla has the reputation of being where the action is in Barcelona, but the Gothic Quarter is so much better. On La Rambla you can get a photo op with a painted person, but in the Gothic quarter you can hear opera singers in a courtyard or watch an impromptu concert and dance in front of the cathedral. It is these unexpected moments of high quality street life, plus the amazing architecture, that make it my favorite part of Barcelona.

Strolling Through History And Charm. Go step back in time, really, some of the structures date back over 1000 years. Narrow, cool strret to stroll around for hours. Lots of shopping, dining and museums. This area is a must see for visitors to Barcelona.
A great place to get yourself lost on purpose. Take a walk down these little winding streets to discover traditional tapas bars and lovely boutique style clothing shops.

Super Barrio !. Historical neighborhood.It's a really nice neighborhood with a lot of shops, restaurants, tapas and bars !All the streets are lovely !You have a sevral tours which make you visit this barrio.Ive done the Barcelona Street Style Tours that gives you another interesting view of the city.

Nice but crowded. The Barric Gothic was nice to see but very crowded. I guess it depends on the time of day that you are there. Loved seeing the old buildings and streets. A must see if you're ever in Barcelona.
Living history.. A great area to just wander through at your leisure. Wind through historical cobbled streets and stumble across traditional tapas bars.

Best part is wandering.... Get lost, wander, absorb, and enjoy the meandering alleyways/streets of the Gothic Quarter. Best part of Barcelona. Love the shops and places to eat. Must see when in Barcelona.
fantastic. loved the barrie gothic area, such great night life, shopping, food, activity. close to public transportation.

Forget the map, get lost for an afternoon in a great part of Barcelona!. Walking around Barcelona was fascinating. This area in particular was filled with history, remarkable architecture, shops, restaurants, and bars. A lot of it is closed in the afternoon so it's hard to say if the shops and bars are actually open or are out of business.Stop buy the tapas bars where everyone seems to know each other. These are the real deal. We ate in several of the spots in this neighborhood and didn't have a single bad dish. Tapas everywhere.Wandering around, pay attention to what's up in the air. We saw Picasso's original studio in a building that is locked shut with a chain and looks like it could fall over. The carving in the façade of the buildings is ornate and interesting. This was a very Bohemian area in the day and looks to continue the tradition for the most part today.Barri Gotic was one of the best walks we took, and don't worry... If you walk long enough, and are totally confused as to your location, you will eventually find your way to a main road where there are plenty of cabs to get you back to where you want to go.
Cool Hip Shopping. This place is filled with local shop that carry local designer brands and local crafts, great little cafes and restaurants.
Great area!. The old streets and structures are magnificent. My family could walk this area all day and not get bored. Can't wait to go back!
Greatest little town. Great tapas and drinks around every single corner! Stop at as many places as you can! Feels like where the real Barcelona people live!!!

Wonderful Experience, lovely streets and fine bars to pass the time away. A lovely afternoon spent admiring the quarter, nice area, enclosed streets. Lovely bars to stop at. (I have reviewed some). Lots of little places to explore and be amazed. Its worth a stop if you have the time in a city with so much to do in.

Nice morning walk, no shorts in the Cathedral allowed. Very nice neighborhood, little streets with plenty of stories to tell ( get a good book), just get lost :-) Only bad surprise was the "no shorts allowed" in the Cathedral as we were in shorts of course! We live next door so we will be able to go back.

Barcelona. We came to the Gothic Quarter after a day touring the Sagrada Familia tour. The area is vibrant and busy with many tourists. After a delicious tapas meal we were happy to travel back to our hotel out of this area. I would not have liked to have accommodation in this area.
Great part of the city.. A fantastic part of the city, something that everyone should visit. But I strongly advise doing it as part of a tour, you'll get a lot more out of it.

A labyrinth of undiluted pleasure. I have been spending a few months in Barcelona and few things give me more pleasure than losing myself along the labyrinth of narrow alleys that comprise the Barri Gòtic. Every time I discover more interesting buildings, more quaint corners, more attractive little shops, more appealing eateries and bars. Layer upon layer, the more you walk, the more you learn to distinguish the various stages of the city --Roman, medieval, modern... On one building, today a museum, you suddenly notice the sign of the Inquisition; on another, you can spot tombstones from the old Jewish cemetery that were recycled for construction. Full of surprises, the Barri Gòtic has much to offer --the impressive Cathedral complex, the Jewish Quarter, Government Square, the various buildings of the Museum of the History of Barcelona, and so much more!

great old city. walking around in the early morning and smelling freshly baked bakery and coffee is one of the little luxuries in life you can afford in the old area of barcelona. wanders off and gets off the beaten track, go get your coffee and cakes for 1.7 euro - unbeatable
Teatro de Cataluyna. This is the heart of the old town. Teatro de Catalunya is an amazing building. Go see a performance there!

The best part of Barcelona. The oldest and best part of Barcelona in my opinion, Visit the gothic cathedral/citidel, Its squares, its labyrinth like lanes. I love this area. Good restaurants abound in this area

One of those place that you have to visit, but it is like visiting your mother in law. It is important to visit this place when you are in Barcelona., but I can't really say there was something that will make me to go back. It is nice to see the old buildings with lovely architecture, but if this is not your kind of thing then you might want to go for something to eat. The restaurants are also not special and very touristic. A lot of people walking through the streets in the heat is not really my kind of thing, but at the end I can say, I have been there. It is like visiting my mother in law - I don't really want to do it, but I have to.
Different views in every step . Great waking your self guided. The area is full of rich architecture snd interesting buildings. Be sure to bring your camera.

Walking in the old part of the city. Just such an interesting place to visit and a wonderful area to lazily walk around with Tapas bars at every turn and places of interest such as Las Ramblas with so much going on.

Walking in Barcelona. Barcelona is a city best enjoyed on foot, a new experience around every corner. The seafront has many restaurants, including street food and a very nice restaurant on a boat moored in the harbour. Whatever your choice of good you'll find it here.

Nice but nothing in particular to see. Walking around the neighborhood is really nice. There's lots of architecture embedded into every street. You can also see a cathedral that's the area. We chose not to. We walked around the neighborhood, grabbed some food, people watched, and bought things from a bazaar. It was a nice way to spend an afternoon, but not the highlight of your trip.

History. This area is filled with hidden gems. For anyone who is interested in history or architecture, I would recommend one of the walking tours if you wish to know a little more about the history in a limited space of time. There are some many details and areas of historical significance. Beyond that, it was lovely to just take in the atmosphere.

A step back in time. Grab a good street map and head out into the Gothic area on foot. You can spend a lot of time exploring, shopping and dining in a great variety of establishments. Allow time for the Picasso museum and other attractions that you will come across. If you visit on a Sunday, very few stores will be open. The buildings have not changed over the centuries and Roman ruins are still existing. While the occasional whiff from sewer grates is evident I found the whole area very pleasant and easy to walk around, A highlight of my Barcelona experience.
Architecture Architecture. How beautiful to walk among these buildings. You cannot visit Barcelona without engaging in this world. Gorgeous

Old buildings and beautiful architecture. The Gothic Quarter was a great place to wander around. We quite enjoyed walking the streets and checking out the great buildings. Lots of great things everywhere you turn. And surprise art around some corners. It was a great place to spend the day.
Stunning architecture shame about the poor maintenance. Well worth a visit. Some parts run down and smell badly, not to pleasant to walk through. Architecture is fantastic

true heart of Barcelona. we loved this area so much to see and do shops restaurants tapas bars and so much more take the time to walk around this area during the day and at night when it truly comes to life
Beautiful!. This area of Barcelona was breathtakingly beautiful, and I would recommend visiting this when going to Barcelona!
Good neighborhood to visit. Great shopping location with good restaurants and architecture. It is a great place to spend the afternoon walking through the streets and watching the world go by.
Great cultural area. Great place to visit ,great restaurants , shops and buildings, well worth a visit .BUT make sure you have a good guide book and map or you will miss some great bits
Family trip. Do not try to drive!! A lot of options for restaurants and little shops.We loved the whole area. Our kids loved walking on the little streets.

Get Lost and Go Back in Time!. For most people who live outside of Europe, I think Barcelona's Gothic Quarter is what we all expect Europe to be. This is a remarkable section of the city with architecture that will fill your dreams and whisk you away to another century. Like Venice with its narrow corridors and unexpected squares, the best approach is to just start walking and forget your map. See an interesting passage way? Follow it. Feel lost? Don't sweat it. Eventually you'll come to a major road and get your bearings. Then you can cross it and take the next narrow turn and get lost again in this charming, historic, and enchanting section of this amazing city.
Gothic Quarter. As a tourist you have to see the Gothic Quarter. That said, it is touristy but go anyway and enjoy checking out all the sights.

Historic and beautiful -- don't miss it. Definitely our favorite neighborhood to visit in Barcelona. Lovely architecture, great restaurants and don't miss the Barcelona Cathedral! Good area for walking around.

Olde world charm with all mod cons. You really need to wander aimlessly in this wonderful part of the city. Just walk and you will find lots of little treasures to feast your eyes on and many authentic taverns to sit and sample the wine and the atmosphere. Look up as the quaintness and timelessness of the area is in it's many narrow side street rooftops and balconys. Most of the wonderful treasures I have seen have been just buy wandering down a side street and following my feet, no maps, though if you are a map follower then you will see all the tourist spots but may miss the real feeling of life for the Catalonians. The best is often found tucked way off the beaten track and this area is a treasure trove of architecture and charm.
beautiful!. A must see! Beautiful architecture and a nice area to walk through. It felt friendly and safe. We didn't stay in a hotel in this area but wished we had.
Fantastic. Great history. I took the free tour with Running Bean, it was great and I learned so much about the Jewish Quarter. Fantastic walking tour.

The best part of Barcelona. Wander...get lost... have a drink... go shopping. You will be on streets filled with people and then wander into a small plaza and be almost the only person there. The best part of Barcelona, really.
So much to do!. Great area to explore! So many little alleys with interesting finds at every turn! Many restaurants and shops -and architecturally fabulous!

A place to get lost inside. The gothic quarter is actually a large part of Barcelona and even outside of the area the surrounding streets are preety much the same. It's a great experience to walk around these narrow streets and visit the souvenir shops and bars.
A different flavour of life. Very different from the Eixample district where many of the attractions are located. Close, narrow streets, bags of character. Well worth a look.

Lovely area. Very nice area little alleyways to get lost in Lot of little shops to buy things in be careful with traffic as the bike riders don't seemed to follow any kind of rules of the road some don't even look where they are going
Different from the rest of Barcelona. You feel history, this area super clean is different from the rest of Barcelona absolutely worth visiting and admiring the architecture, basilica etc.

great central place to stay. The gothic quarter was beautiful. Everything was within walking distance so we got to see an awful lot of the city within a short space of time which was great...highly recommend.

Picasso Museum and Gothic Walking Tour. Excellent tour. Tour guide fantastic so knowledgeable and interesting. Very professional organisation . Gave little tit bits of information about that made the walk enjoyable. We visited The four cats restaurant following the Picasso tour which made the tour even more interesting.

The best place to get lost!. If you are from Barcelona or if you are not, but you love ancient quartiers and narrow steets, this is your place. I used to walk in the Gothic for hours looking for hidden treasures to discover, great shops, good restaurants and nice people amazed by its beauty!
Fun. It is so fun to just wander around and get lost in the small streets. I just love visiting this area - there is always something new to see and discover.

If you are sick of Las Ramblas, then go to Barri Gotic!. Very beautiful and gorgeous part of Barcelona!! We stumbled here by accident after escaping the crowds of Ramblas and were pleasantly surprised by the great food and sights.
Wonderful individual shops, beautiful architecture. Fantastic area to visit, away from the hustle and bustle. Lot and lots of beautiful shops, bars and places to eat. Beautiful architecture

Cannot Be Missed. Apart from Gaudi works, just about the most interesting part of Barcelona, with quaint shops, delicious restaurants, meandering, winding streets, and lots of churches, cafes and people watching.
Great historic place. Great place. Just to wonder around the place take in some of the awesome sites. Walking round with your mouth open is not recommeded tho ;)

go visit the Gothic quarter. The Gothic quarter is a must see for anyone travelling to Barcelona. There are lots of lovely restaurants and individual shops to visit. You can find very reasonable restaurants in the little back streets.
Have to see. Have to see! We thought the best area to walk around in Barcelona. Mostly flat, incredible streets with something to see on almost every one of them. Great eats too!

A place you must visit. The narrow streets and the old architecture makes it great experience to vist. A lot of small shops, bars and restaurants.
You can easaly spend a whole day in this area.

Slightly off the beaten path but well worth it.. We stayed near this area in a small hotel, the Regencia Colon, which was quite nice and very reasonable. The hotel staff were quite friendly and helpful and we could walk to many places of interest easily. (If you cannot walk far, this location is still a short distance by cab to many of the major sites.)

Enjoy pleasant strolls through this historic district. Enjoy pleasant walks through narrow streets & wide boulevards - there are many wonderful choices for cafes & restaurants - shopping opportunities are outstanding

Barri Gotic adventure. Barcelona's Barri Gotic is well worth several hours. Do it on a Sunday and see the Sardana dancing at the Cathedral. The area is criss-crossed with narrow streets that open into small squares with cafes, shops and lots of people. I wouldn't recommend it for a night stroll, but it is an adventure in the daytime. We ate several meals there and all were good or better. Also venture into nearby El Born. Much of the same, but its Cultural Center is worth a couple of hours.
Flavor of the City. This Gothic Quarter contains much of the Gaudi architecture, fabulous shops and restaurants and a terrific pedestrian mall.

Stunning! But best with a walking guide. Amazing part of the city and really allows you to get a feel for old Barcelona. We went with a walking tour organised by Hostel Culture and later on our own. It was so amazing with a guide as every corner has a story and our guide, Sophie, had lots of information especially about the history of the area. One of the best parts of out trip to Barcelona.
Fun to walk around. When in Barcelona, it's hard to NOT go into the Gothic Quarter. In my opinion, it's good to get out there and see all that you can. The Gothic Quarter is certainly worth a visit.

Must visit area - really nothing like it in the US. There are simply no places like this in the United States. The history and the fact that roads are simply what we would call sidewalks. I would highly recommend a walking tour. We took one out of city hall that walks you around the gothic area with several stops including interior visits to the Roman temple ruins, Barcelona Cathedral, and the palaces and chapel around Placa Rei. Afterwards we shop and walked. I revisited the area in the afternoon and went to Santa Maria de Pi. It was amazing how the sun changes the quarter. Incredible places for pictures.

Fantastic preservation of historic center of Barcelona. Walking through the narrow streets of Barri Gottic was a great experience. Viewing medieval buildings and passageways was fantastic. The historical significance of walking by the palace where Columbus presented himself and his findings to King Ferdinand and Queen Isabella, after his return from the Americas, was impressive. Really impressed with the Cathedral. Also nice shops and cafés along the way. Don't forget the Quatre Gats (Els 4 Gats), in the north part of Barri Gottic (just off Ave. Portal de l'Angel) for a drink, coffee, snack or tapas. This is where Picasso and his friends hung out in their younger days.

Discover this quarter on foot, an experience..... If you visit Barcelona you gave to walk around here, not I suggest at night carrying valuables although since my last visit 15 years ago there's loads more visible Police and less visible scallywags!Wander around the side streets of an afternoon, find a local bar, have some Tapas and a glass or two of lovely Rioja, enjoy the 'local' feel of the place, this is Barcelona, where real people live.

lovely streets. A lovely area of Barcelona, with Gaudi churches in the square and quaint small streets all round the Gothic architecture is amazing and beautiful and always look up going underneath the arches as there is always some sort of design overhead loads of lovely little shops and restaurants to have a look at or eat in

Intriguing little roads and innovative shops. Intriguing little roads and innovative shops made our visit to the Gothic Quarter quite delightful. I much preferred the entrepreneurial approach to this space than the crowded, over priced and mass produced, big name shops on the fmous street of La Rambla. But then each to their own. The Gothic quarter also offered a myriad of restaurants to suit every pallet. From Fresh Juice and smoothy bars to Vegetarian Restraints as well as traditional Spanish Paella Spots, we enjoyed every minute of it.
Get lost in history. Lovely contrast to the otherwise square organisation of a town! Lovely narrow streets steeped in history with hidden little cafes and shops.

Enjoy wandering the streets of the Gothic Quarter. The best way to see the Gothic Quarter is to wander the streets with no particular destination. There are loads of hidden alleys and stores to explore. It feels like you are traveling back in time when you walk the streets with no crowds.
Fun wandering this old streets and shops. There are many commercial businesses in this area, but also some old shops with Spanish made goods. Watch your pockets since there can be a busy.

Don't miss this area when you visit. My first choice of places to visit in BarcelonaThe maze of streets making up this area are a wash with character. Quickly shops, tapas bars and cafes can keep most occupied for many an hour. I think it's quiet easy to become disorientated when you are in heart of it but even if you do it won't take long to find your way back into the familiar Ramblas and if you aren't in a rush, what does it matter. Enjoy !
History. It is a nice walk through the history lanes. One gets an insight in past & the area is quite well maintained

Wander and roam. Great place to explore for many fun-filled hours. Enjoy the hustle and bustle, some lovely little one-off shops and many interesting old buildings. It is worth getting off the main streets into the maze of small streets around. Be careful of pickpockets

Barri Gotic indeed. There are quite a few nuances of this particular Gothic/Barri Gotic quarter. Aside from La Ramblas, the corridors and pedestrian areas are narrow and built up. The surrounding architecture being obviously gothic or neo-gothic.

GREAT WALK!. Good thing that I was with a tour guide otherwise I might still be there! Wonderful architecture (Gothic), wonderful shop windows, alluring walkways/roads, delightful colours. This area is a MUST if you visit Barcelona. Lots of little restaurant where the local foods/tastes can be sampled. I would suggest allowing at least a half day for this visit. If planning on going here, do some research on the histories of the various structures (synagogues, churches etc.), the cultural histories, and the history of Barcelona. I loved our time here....reminded me a bit of a 'waterless' Venice!

Barselona gothic quarter. Wonderful place to walk around and dive into culture. We saw performers on the streets, people joining dancing in the square in front of Barcelona castle. Nice atmosphere. Also we went to Taller tapas restaurant. Great food!

Like Time Travelling into the Past. This is one of the more fun things to see and do in Barcelona. The old buildings many in Gothic style are relaxing to look at as you wander through the meandering streets. They have many fascinating shops and restaurants to enjoy in the day or in the evening.The Gothic Quarter is what Barcelona is all about.

Family holiday. We found Barcelona in general a fantastic, easy city to visit. The gothic quarter is amazing with its quaint little streets, beautiful architecture vibrant buzz. Some stunning plaza's and beautiful bars and cafe's. In seven days we didn't see everything so would love to visit again.

Barcelona 2015. A definite must go and see for anyone visiting Barcelona. The winding streets buildings are really beautiful. We were treated to an amazing impromptu soprano solo outside one of the many sites.

You can't scip Barrio Gotico. Barrio Gotico is probably my favorite area in Barcelona. I liked a lot the small streets with cafes, bars and galleries. At night can get a bit noisy in case your hotel is in the area.
The place to visit. You likely won't miss this area even if you try. Right off las ramblas (and you'll want to get off las ramblas)

Our third time here and still learning more. Definitely worth a tour with one of the many walking tour companies so that you can learn about the history while walking. Good for singles, families with older children, and couples

The Gothic Quarter. The narrow streets which bend and twist look like someone followed a cow and staked out the paths. This is an ancient city trying to live in the modern age. There are surprises around every corner in the Gothic section, an area that dates back to the 1200's I believe. There are small shops which sell tapas, some boutiques, chachka stores, many restaurants, and divine architecture. But beware of cars, Vespas, and bikes as the Spanish are crazy drivers - not necessarily bad drivers, just in a hurry. I was tapped by three bicycles while walking on the sidewalk. You will also notice that people won't make way for you as an American does. Not the end of the world.....just interesting.

Been twice and would like to think I'll get to go again. Magical. Unusual. Tiny streets, bustling atmospheres, large squares, little shops and tapas bars, beautiful churches, so easy to get wonderfully lost. One of the best places I've ever been.

Great Neighbourhood. This is the nicest neighbourhood for tourists. It is situated near the beach and near most of the tourist attractions. It has many small and bigger bars and restaurants where the local food can be tasted on cheaper prices. Unfortunately there are not any night clubs in this area. After midnight everything is closed.

BCN's historic maze. Getting lost in the Gothic Quarter is very easy, not only because of the tiny streets that seem like a maze, but also because of all the history that their walls retain. It is an OUTSTANDING area of BCN, full of little shops, sharp corners and Gothic churches. Must Visit! spend a couple of hours and enjoy figuring out how you got there, and how you'll get out...

Great Nightlife. The graphic Porter is a wonderful place to walk around at night. There are many nightclubs and bars in the area. Make sure to order a glass or picture of the local sangria. It is delicious.
Gothic Quarter is a pleasure to walk. Wonderful area to get lost in (and we did!). It has wonderful restaurants and shops as well as some amazing attractions like the Picasso museum.

Fabulous . Great walking into the streets within the old city of Barcelona Old buildings are so beautiful and nice.. old architecture and fabulous Excellent experience in the old down town. .Lots and lots of restaurants, shops and cafes where you will enjoy so muchHighly recommended for city walking and city exploring lovers
Great place for a stroll. Great place to walk around the narrow and very old streets. Lots of shops and restaurants to choose from.
One night in Barcelona. Beautiful area. Must see when you are walking around, especially in the evening. Lots of people, great market.

Twisty narrow streets and lots of shopping. Very picturesque. The National Cathedral is beautiful. Be sure to go into the cloister and see the treasure room. Your ticket to the church will get you in. Also be sure to take the elevator to the roof. Amazing views of Barcelona. The streets that take you to La Rambla are medievel narrow and twisty with lots and lots of small shops. Fun place to explore.La Rambla is a boulevard with lots of shops and restaurants and stalls selling all kinds of things. Honestly I found it a bit much and with my family (including 2 small children) not a place I where I wanted to spend a lot of time. We did find Placa Reial just off the main drag which was quieter and nice, with good restaurants.

Amazing!!. My first holiday abroad in 11 years and I have to say this was the highlight of my break. I loved everything about the Gothic Quarter fabulous little shops, restaurants, night life and not to leave out the architecture. This area is the reason I have booked to come back to Barcelona!
Simply simple. I loved this place. It was busy but worth the visit and cool to experience a different area of Barcelona.

The most for tourism. the Barri Gotic is beautiful, especially at night; the close streets the up lighting (you must always look up in Barcelona). But this is also the peak area for tourists after individual monuments so if you are looking to be a local in Barcelona, then this isn't quite the flavour you want.

Lots to see and do. We came here for the day, it was most interesting, we had lunch and the biggest Sangria glasses I have ever seen. There was also a fellow walking down the street not wearing a stitch of clothing but a man bag.
Great area to stay while visiting Barcelona. We rented an apartment in the Barri Gotic area and loved the proximity to everything. It was a charming area with so much to see and do.

Old Quarter. From the grand, old, cathedral and related buildings dating from the 1100s to the narrow, crooked, lanes of the original city, this is worth a couple of hours. Small enough to be easily walked and enjoyed with a good guide book.

Explore it, get lost in it, and enjoy it. Then start over again!. The little streets in Barri Gotic, without any vehicle traffic, but plenty of foot traffic during the high season make for a charming neighborhood in an otherwise big city. We spent about 2 hours walking through its many streets, occasionally stopping by some shops and cafes and taking pics. I'd recommend it both during daytime and evening.

You have to go . You need to make the visit but do not go there hunger as all food is so much more expensive even the water. It is pretty dirty so don't expect something clean and tidy! There are some lovely photos to be had and it is the best gothic preserved area I have visited.
Very crowded but full of experience. Great to visit. You will find lots to visit. Lots of people. All nationalities visit here. Definitely has its charm. Enjoy!

winding streets, quaint walkways, charm and elegance. We love to explore the winding, narrow streets of so many European cities and the Gothic Quarter of Barcelona didn't disappoint. You will find shopping, bars, restaurants and charm as you get lost in the maze of streets.

Atmosphere by the Bucketload. Old buildings, shops, restaurants and bars - what's not to like??
Fantastic place to spend an evening.

Balsam for the soul. What a delightful place. Lots of tourists, like me and you, but this is a thriving local village with neighbourhood shops and apartments. Just wander about, try a gelato, a cake or a coffee. Visit one of the many museums. A treasure.

Neat!. Very cool area, found a silver jewelry store with beautiful items, a fab dress in a made in India store along with leather bags and jewelry all much more reasonable that the other areas. We went to the history of Catalan, archeology of roman city unearthed amazing and Picasso. Oh artisan organic bakery with the best pizza that was vegetarian and my kid said he did not miss the meat, that was amazing!

a walk back in time. If you want to see Gothic architecture at its best with lots of gargoyles watching your every move through these charming narrow streets that were once the center of the Spainish Inquisition this will be a day well spent. You will most likely experience a sample of Catalonian music with the opportunity to join in a Catalonian folk dance in the old city square.
beautiful!. amazing place to see the background of Barcelona. there are hundreds of spots for perfect photo shoots.. just listen to your heart and get lost in the streets :)

Tourist, tourist, tourist. Stayed in the heart of el gotic in july 2015 with my partner. Great as a base as it is so central to everything, but itis completely designed for the tourist looking for chain store shops, chain store food and chain store bars. We did spend a day wandering around in the old jewish quarter which is really interesting- some god walking tours on offer (notably the free walking tour group).. lots of attractikns very near at hand, but lots of hustle and bustle to boot. No soul.

Rich in history!. Luckily we stayed at Hotel Colon, which was right opposite from the main Cathedral the I honestly couldn't get enough of the Gothic Quarter. Its rich with history and it really takes you back to the gothic era. the quarter is lined up with little boutiques, gift shops, pastry shops, juice bars and candle stores. They even have the nicest little cafes that serve the yummiest pastries and coffee. It's a lot of fun to take a stroll down and enjoy some yummy patte's and baked goods. Half a day won't do this neighborhoud any justice. If it were up to me, I would have spent the entire day strolling down the streets of the gothic quarter. We also stopped by a little gift shop and bought some Gaudi inspired ceramic antiques for our home.

Put the Gothic Quarter on your Barcelona itinerary. We visited during the Christmas holiday and this was definitely a highlight of our time in Barcelona. Wonderful examples of architecture influenced by the romans and moors. Do watch for pickpockets - there are a lot of crowds in this area

Beautiful, Easy Stroll...take your time. Thankfully our hotel was in this area, otherwise we may not have walked this area. Streets are narrow and every time you think you've seen everything, something else to make you stop. Amazing architecture building after building, some great outdoor restaurants and quaint little stores. Definitely spend some time here!

When in Barcelona - EAT!. The Born and Gothic districts kiss and between them you will find more wonderful little caffes and squares to wander through than you could possibly fully appreciate if you had years to explore. Cafe con leche con yelo (ice) was required to keep me going in the heat but I could not stop exploring. Everywhere you turn is a new image or vista or intriguing sign or shop keeper. Do keep your bag close in front of you. A young woman on our walking tour looked away for a minute (distracted by a professional) and her phone was gone. Barcelona is unfortunately the second highest pickpocket capital of the world second only to Prague.

Very historical. It's amazing to wander these old streets and alleyways that are hundreds of years old. The free walking tour was a great way to see it. The Gaelic Pub is a very cool part of it, especially in the basement.
Very touristy. Cute, worth a walk through for the old buildings and narrow streets. Mostly stores and gelato shops. Filled with tourist
Quaint streets. Pretty quiet area off the main street, narrow lanes full of character. Probably not good on your own at night, but as a couple it felt quite safe

Keep your wits about you. A beautiful area but not very relaxing due to having to keep an eye out for the pickpockets and beggars. They literally come right up to you at your table as you sit outside a cafe. Not what I was expecting at all.

Soul of Barcelona !. It wasnt until the day 3 of our trip that we ventured to the Gothic Quarter. And thats when it hit us... we are in Barcelona !The place has its vibes, which is when we get the true essence of Barcelona. We just loved walking the geometric alleys & plazas. So much on offer from a gastronomic perspective as well as shopping. But do take extra care of personal belongings. The best part for us was the Barcelona Cathedral...where time stands still. Its a marvelous piece of architecture.A visit to Barcelona is incomplete without spending at least half a day in Barri Gotic.

Barri Gotic - Just get lost and explore.. The Gothic Quarter, which is the old city center of Barcelona, was by far one of my favorite areas of the city. The beautiful and narrow side streets have amazing little shops and restaurants. While there, we saw a wonderful festival in Paca Sant Jaume with Cabezudos (the giants) parading around the square with a band playing.

Cozy streets. I loved this quarter, it was full of surprises. There were lots of nice squares, spend at least half day to discover it. You can shop at many small boutiques, drink sangria and cava at street cafes or just walk around.
Bring a map and enjoy this wonderful area. Just wonderful, enjoy the old town, shops, restaurants, museums, and bring a map :) or just enjoy getting lost in the old town

Lovely part of the world!!. This is a great place with a lovely atmosphere. The architecture is stunning and you can spend hours roaming around the streets. Lots of little shops, bars and restaurants.
Cool place to hang out. Beautiful place to wonder around for the the day. Lots of shops and restaurants and many gothic buildings that were amazingly beautiful!
Great architecture!. I stayed in the heart of the Gothic Quarter. Lots of shops and restaurants in quaint little alleyways. Never a dull moment.

Fabolous quarter. Take the metro to Jaume I and then just take walk in the direction of La Rambla - that's one of the best things to do in Barcelona. Great architecture, narrow streets and some nteresting stores - you will enjoy it a lot.

A walk through time. Meandering through this evocative area is a must for any visitor to Barcelona. You come upon old sections of the original walls, tole murals which explain their history and small openings that turn into beautifully worn paved areas. Spend time here to absorb the patina that time has left behind.
Get lost and enjoy it.. Great place to explore for hours. Loads of bars and restaurants, shops & galleries. Make sure you check it out.
Love Architecture. The best thing about this is the buildings and the designs - but if you are not into the period of these designs it isn't a big deal to miss it.
