Interesting area very lively at nights. In my view one of the best areas of Barcelona, many narrow alleys and old squares full of shops resturants and bars. A major nightlife area to explore and get happily lost in

Where the modern world meets historic old. If you want to step back into the history in a convenient way, visit the Old town in Barcelona. The public bus will take you to its walls from the sites such as the Olympic village or Gaudi's Sa Grada familila cathedral. The Old town is the universe of its own - charming, mysterious and stimulates our imagination. One feels the centuries that passed by within its walls... On the outskirt stands Cathedral de Barcelona, one of the most beautiful gothic architecture in the world. The square in front of it fills with the Spandiars on Sundays who engage in square dancing. Worth watching how serious they take the tradition! The cobble stoned, crooked and narrow streets offer a lot of coffee shops and boutigues, in case you do not care waiting for the last minute souvenir shopping at the airport.

Just wander. This is a wonderful part of Barcelona. Take your time and just wander the streets, stop and have coffee or lunch at one of the many little open air cafes. Browse the shops, pop into the churches, sit by the fountains and just take in what it means to be in Barcelona.
See this on the hop on hop off bus. We stopped here on the hop on hop off bus tour, defineitely worth seeing on a day trip to Barcelona. Lots of beautiful architecture to see here.

"Barcelona's History in a Quarter of a Block". See how Barcelona formed, and then how it grew. The celebratory side, and a dark side for Spaniards, as there was a lot of unrest amongst the Spaniards and the Catalans. Tours are very thorough, so I highly recommend getting on one, through the Office of Tourism, which is right at Plaza Saint Jaume. A walking tour, that will explain the history of Barcelona. It is worth your while to learn of this history, and we bought our tickets on-line, like so many of the activities that we did, and walked in to meet our tour guide. Always best to book ahead. Adios!

fabulous authentic medieval streets. The Gothic Quarter lives up to the hype (unlike the Rambla) because it has retained charm and authenticity. Nearly all the cafes, boutiques, shops, bodegas etc are one offs instead of chains. Just a great place for a mooch during the day as the tall buildings shade pedestrians. And very lively at night I imagine.
Goth city!. Nice little part of the city where we enjoyed Paella. Kind of adding to all this architecture from Sagrada Familia

Beautiful Architecture. Strolling through the Gothic Quarter was really beautiful. The design of the buildings is absolutely breath taking, we enjoyed walking all the side streets and alleyways to soak it all in. Worth the walk.
Best part of the city!. Love the Barri Gotic. One of the most charming parts of the city...with the most character. Do visit the Picasso Museum and sip Sangria at a cafe.

Great for an evening stroll. If you're looking for a place to take a stroll on a warm summer evening in Barcelona, this is a great place to do it. You can practically get lost among the narrow alleys and beautiful architecture. There are plenty of small shops to duck into if you want to rest your feet.

Recommended area of Barcelona. This was my third visit to Barcelona and this was one of the only areas that is the same as the previous visits....
Highly recommended for shoppers , historians and foodies

Hold onto your wallet, guys.. The Gothic Quarter is amazing! Beautiful old buildings and cobblestone streets, like being transported back a couple of centuries.
Stores and Cafes fill every inch of this sector, which made my wife's day. Put on your walking shoes and get prepared... your legs (and wallet) will get quite a workout!

A great place to wander. Lots of winding streets and fascinating places to come across throughout the area. We were warned about pick pockets but only La Rambla seemed to have any real possiblility of this and only if you didn't take sensible precautions.
An study in contrast. Ancient structures and modern buildings are side by side. It's just a wonderful place to walk slowly through and soak in the sites.

Arquitecture of perfection. These little roads in the center of Barcelona, are a delight. Every store, every road, even the cathedral have the most exquisit arquitecture we've ever seen. Just amazing for a relax walk in the afternoon
Stroll through the lovely lanes, eat tapas and drink!. Plenty of wonderful eating and shopping to be had here. Move off Las Ramblas and enjoy this lovely area.

Very charming area. I lived here for about a week, and really enjoyed walking in the narrow streets, feeling that you get a bit closer to the spirit of daily life in Barcelona. Not too crowded, plenty of buildings to study, and shops to visit.
Must see attraction. Great area to walk around, the basilica is breathtaking, very peaceful. It's a must see, just walking distance from the La Ramblas.

nice walk. Nice area to walk around, a lot to see but also nice little places to eat.
We recommend El beso and la luna with excellent tapas

Living art.. A living museum in the middle of the most luxurious part of town surrounded by the most desirable fashion stores clustered into two blocs. Just walk in late afternoon and admire the exquisite art so the facade of several buildings--it is unreal and fascinating.
Mysterious. Loved this part of Barcelona, lots of dark and mysterious lanes to explore and find fascinating shops, eating places and markets.

Grat place to wonder. Narrow streets, ancient buildings, great bars and restaurants on every corner and unavoidable gift shops. Great place to visit with kids during the day and bar-hop at night. If you want to rent here, be prepared for a tiny apartment and noisy streets. Most bars are open until 3 AM, finding a bathroom is not always a priority to the party people, so a bit of stench is always there.

Watch out for your valuables!. The area was worth a short trip, but I wouldn't recommend an extended visit. Some of the streets are dark and dingy, and a lot of people told us that the area was notorious for pickpockets and bag snatchers. Luckily we didn't have any bad experience, but we certainly held on to our bags for dear life!
Nice and interesting quarter.. It has interesting places, old(very old) buildings , nice restaurants, shops and you can walk quiet sabelt sturing the day or night!

The Gothic Quarter is a must see.. The Gothic Quarter is the old original city and has very narrow streets and alleys that are covered with restaurants, ice cream shops, and stores. It is a perfect place to spend part of a leisurely afternoon just strolling around and taking in the area.
full of great site and food place. you dont have to spend a great deal on eating as many retos have dia menusaround 12E beware of pickpockets and drug dealers in this area

A Must in Barcelona. Very beautiful area full of narrow streets, which are full of great shops, cafes and restaurants.
It's a real must-see area in Barcelona. I could easily spend days wondering around there.

Interesting place to wander.. Take your time walking through the narrow streets and admire the lovely old buildings. There are lots of tapas bars and shops. I would also recommend a visit to the cathedral but make sure you are covered appropriately or you won't be allowed to enter.

Gothic at Night. This area was so amazing at night with the lighting in all the alleys. Random little shops on seemingly deserted blocks made exploring an adventure. The age and architecture was impressive. Nightlife and young people were abundant.
Worth a visit. Not blown away by Barcelona, expected more, but pretty quater, lots of small streets, shops, squares etc. Plenty of photo opps.

Incredibly interesting!. One of my most favorite spots in Barcelona. Spend a lot of time here. Had an amazing walking tour of the Gothic Quarter including the Jewish area pre inquisition. Also, lovely shopping. Lovely lunch at La Cerrada - I think that's the name of it.

Serious gothic funky. Cool shops
cool cafés
beautiful buildings
just take the time to walk and get lost. I felt totally safe to wander round even shaded streets. There is real beauty to behold.

Love it amazing . I absolutely love thisnold area of Barcelona. The Bari Gothica area has surprises around every corner of its maze of alleys. Its dotted with many shop restuarants and bars. Barcelona cathedral, Barcelona town hall and the old roman area are fascinating to visit. You can spend a whole day wandering the alleys. Its a must of every visit to Barcelona.

The older quieter church and quarter. The center is the old Gothic cathedral. Many may overlook the older church to see Gaudi's masterpiece, but this church has much to recommend it too. Though older, darker, it is still beautiful. And with fewer tourists, it is more churchy. Outside, there are eateries and other sites, but the small plaza in front of the church can have dancing too. All this is not far from the Plaza de Catalunya and La Ramblas. Much to see and do.

If you don't visit the Gothic Quarter you'll miss the best section in Barcelona. This area was truly the highlight of my trip. After visiting Park Guell and the Basilica of the Sagrada Familia I spent the next two days of my trip just walking the small streets of Barri Gotic. This section of the city is beautiful and truly brings out the culture and history of Barcelona. I visited many beautiful churches and Placas, while also trying many of the wonderful foods, drinks and desserts. I could have walked these streets for weeks....
Beautiful. Beautiful area to walk around. Loved the cathedral and just getting lost. Would recommend just strolling around and stopping for beverage at a local cafe.
fascinating. Get off the beaten track and explore the tiny laneways. Interesting shops appear around corners - also quiet in the back streets. There are a number of very good little bars to be found.

Barcelona Gothic Quarter. The Gothic Quarter of Barcelona is what Barcelona is all about for me.It has a lovely old world charm that is far removed from the rest of the city in terms of ambience.A slow wander through the maze of streets in this area is a pure delight.The only downside is the occasional whiff of sewage erupting from the centuries old drainage system, but i’ve smelt worse in the British countryside to be honest!Beautiful part of this charming City.

less than expected. nice area , love the old buildings but not alot to see and it was less than expected, most buildings have been modified , some keep original . seen much more intriguing old quarters all over europe

Easy walk from La Rambla. Great way to get a taste of Spanish architecture that's NOT Gaudi! We loved the narrow streets and back alleys, and the little shops. Ideal to walk around/through towards the Barcelonetta/beach area, and the narrow streets stay cooler/darker than the broad ramblas.
Gothic area. The Gothic cathedral is a fine place to see,very interesting. The area around it has many good restaurants,and is great for people watching.

Interesting area in Barcelona. Barcelona is a city with many faces. This part of the city is very old and historic. We enjoyed walking throughout the area with our local guide to give us detailed information about the various buildings in the area. I highly recommend spending several hours in the area to absorb this wonderful part of the city.
Perhaps Barcelona's best known district. Narrow streets lined with shops, restaurants, tapas bars lend themselves to the atmosphere of the area. See the old Cathedral and stop for a coffee.

treat yourselves on authentic Barcelona. As a woman on her own, with just a small rucksack on me, I enjoyed every little tiny street here. There's loads of tiny shops, art work and small restaurants. Totally different from Amsterdam, no pickpockets, nobody talking to you to sell something or force you to go into a shop, just a wonderful atmosphere. Of course, you have to take a camera to picture all nice details on the buildings.
A lovely area. Narrow streets, lovely buildings, charming all the way around. Not to be missed. Great shopping, great shops, fine eating.
Gothic Quarter. This is a real find, I would fully recommend a visit, very well priced and excellent quality. Good place to people watch as well,

Interesting walk. Our travel book (Rick Steves Spain 2015) suggested a walk through this neighborhood, and it was quite interesting. We didn't do anything formal, just followed along the map suggested in the book and read about each point of interest out loud to each other. It was a nice afternoon, cost effective, and since this neighborhood in Barcelona has so much history it was quite enriching as well.

A Captivating Part of Barcelona. My experience of the Gothic Quarter was a while ago, but still remains a favorite memory of my time in Barcelona. I booked a walking tour with Runner Bean Tours for which you pay at the end what you think the tour is worth. And it was worth paying for!!! Not only for the highly informed narrative and passion of the tour guide, but because this area has so much soul, beauty and history to experience. Don't miss it.
One of my favourite parts of the city. We really enjoyed walking around this part of the city. It's easy to get lost with all the little streets, but that's part of the fun!

super nice but careful. I really like the zone, but It is dangerous by night, because there are many thieves.Take care with some bars because they are too expensive and you´re fooled with the product and the price. But if you take is a very good place to visit.

Beautiful Historic area. A vey quaint part of Barcelona steeped in history. The Cathedral stand out as the best feature of this area. Interesting shops and restaurants in this area and in the heat of a Barcelona day a respite from the sun.
A wonderful place for a wander. We walked around this area and hopped from bar to bar. The buildings are amazing and the little streets make you feel you have been thrown back in time.

Step into an older world. Fantastic time just strolling and exploring the old lanes. I recommend a guide book or your guide to add details about what your are seeing. There are many best places to explore or just to sit and rest. If you can go on a sunday the Catalan dancing in front of the cathedral is unique and worthwhile

3 Tips - Quaint and Charming Barri Gothic. A great stroll around the narrow and winding streets of the Gothic quarter. Three good things to be aware of:1) The cathedral requires covered shoulders!! Girls, guys, keep that in mind, or they won't let you in.2) The bottom's of the terraces - they are sometimes with coloured tiles. The more colour and tiles, the richer were the inhabitants! So watch for bottom's of terraces with more or less colour, this was an interesting way that the residents showed off :)3) There's an area right around the corner from the Cathedral, called the "Centre Excursionista of Cavalunya" - It's a great little hidden doorway. Inside, there are 2,000 year old Roman columns, mixed with Gothic arches, and a ~1900's building - it's a free duck-in, and it is exactly what the Barcelonian's prided themselves on - Modernism, the mix of different styles in one building!
Great fun area. Be sure to check out this area and give yourself time to explore. It's yet another reason that Barcelona is such a fun city.
Great place for a stroll. Shops, restaurants, twisty little streets--a great place to happily get lost. It and the Born are two places in Barcelona you'll want to stroll.

the Gothic quarter was amazing - we hired a photographer tour guide as well.. This part of old Barcelona will not disappoint - around every corner is something amazing. I recommend hiring a local guide or taking one of the free walking tours led by locals. Our local guide to us to out of the way places not usually seen by tourists.

Narrow, dark, unusual, but very warm and cozy. Very interesting place. Small and narrow streets you can meet real "aborigenes". A lot of souvenir shops and cafes. Quarter attracts with its historical breath. Definitely I recommend!

A maze of wonders. For those who want to push their cultural boundaries and experiences. The Gothic Quarter is a wondrous maze of intriguing back streets, winding passageways, curious bars and top quality restaurants. There are so many different places to recommend in this area. You have to go here if you are spending more than a day in Barcelona
Just amazing. Superb arquitecture. Perhaps a bit too crowded at times. Too many apartments rented out. Should rely more on hotels

Great for walking around!. Go ahead and get lost in the small pathways and streets! The architecture is beautiful and you'll find loads of small restaurants and shops! Provides lots of shade from the hot sun, too. This, I think, really shows what Barcelona is, in it's old traditional style! Takes you back in time!

Get lost in old-age Barca!. Explored this gem with Sandemans New Barcelona Tours - there is just so much to see! It's incredible and the stories behind each little nook and crany are fascinating. Just walk around and get lost in the neighbourhood even if you don't do a tour. Absolutely fantastic - watch out for falling gargoyles (it happens apparently!)

Undergoing building and paving work. Metro Station Jaime. OK for a first visit to stroll around and take a few photos. Expensive to eat and drink throughout, up to 7 euros for a pint around the cathedral, but a pleasnt area wher you can sometimes sit and watch some musicians performing

Be a part of history. Wander through narrow alleys,lean against buildings from the 15th century,then you come upon a church or an open square. Plenty of shops and cafe's where you least expect them.Great fun but mind the panhandlers.

IN THE HEART. I recommend the Tower of Sant Maria del Pi, from where you have a nice view of Barcelona downtown and the shore. The ancient history is presente in many corners of this fantastic area of Barcelona.
Nice to visit, but very crowded. A must see in Barcelona, but very crowded... very touristic... but still nice to visit and enjoy, Welcome to Barcelona!

WOW!. what? Amazing area. You can always find a little place to stop for tapas or an afternoon meal. Food original in family run bodegas. Great shopping and shopkeepers. I would advise against la ramblas simply because I am not a fan of crowds and mega stores like Disney, but spend time getting to know every other part and you will have a blast. Incredible cathedral, museums, tapas, michelin star restaurants, original art, street performances and music. Give yourself time and just relax.
Look up while walking . Look up while walking, you will see statues looking down at you! Wear something which covers the maximum of your body if you intend to enter the cathedral!

fascinating area. if you are crazy about architecture, this is your place. If you like hidden alleys and small european size cities, you'll love it too. Dont plan much, just hit the roads and stop every one in a while to eat or hace a cafe!
Historical and Beautiful. We took an amazing tour of the old city with Runnerbeans tours - highly recommended.The history of the old city is truly fascinating.

Gritty and touristic but still worth it. lots of cool stuff to see. Good shopping, eating and drinking. The area is pretty much overrun with tourists and young people partying the night away. Despite that, come with an open mind and you will not be disappointed
Old & quirky in the cool. Narrow streets in the shade were just great to meander & soak up the atmosphere of the older part of Barcelona city - the buildings architecture, shops, cafes etc

Fun , funky, full of things to see & do- all ages, prices. This is a very unique and winding cobble stone labyrinth of roads that wind around different museums, tons of eateries of all price ranges and shopping for all different tastes and styles. A definite stop when visiting Barcelona ~ take comfortable shoes as you must walk to get the full experience of it; plan on at least a day.
weekend. this is a popular area of Barcelona, plenty of places to eat, restaurants and cafes so everyone is catered for

Great architecture and shops. We went here as part of a bus tour and it was lovely just getting lost down every street watching the street entertainers and nipping in and out of historically important buildings.
Touristy but worth a walk. If you focus on the architecture and history, it's worth spending some time here. The crowds are large, and over-priced touristy shops are ubiquitous.
nice architecture to look at. The restaurant are a little more pricey than on the outskirts. Be careful to assume all restaurants accept credit cards. Ask before you sit down and order food.

Barri Gotic (city part). Very beautiful area of the old city! We started our guided walking tour in this area. The buildings and squares, small lanes and nice bars in the Gothic quarter...just love this area!

Wonderful walk. Our hotel is about 15 minutes walk to Gothic Quarter, we got up early and decided to stroll down for our breakfast. It was wonderful walk like you travel back in time with alleys and historical buildings. There a lot small restaurants and bar to stop for lunch or Sangria! We really enjoyed our day getting lost in Gothic Quarter.
Atmospheric and easy to wander about in.. Lots of corners for a quiet beer or snack away from the hurley burley of La Rambla, but only a stone's throw away.

A nice place to walk. This is a must see place in Barcelona. You may walk for hours seeinf different places in every narrow street. It´s safe but you will need some sense of direction or a little map to find the nearest metro station.

there is something for everyone here. You can feel the culture with every basilica you pass by, every placa and museum, every glass of sangria that accompanies the sounds of a guitar not too far away from where you are. It truly is an experience to tell about.
Tip: walk slowly, keep hydrated and marvel at the wonderful Barri Gotic de Barcelona :)
Lots to see. There is lots to see and it is close to the Rambles. From the seafront to the cathedral, you will find interesting alleys that lead to more charm.
excellent. Brilliant shops which we weren't expecting which let us have a break from walking around the pretty streets!

happily lost. Do not try to find something here, the real excitement is to be lost in space and time. It is not difficult to feel this old city with all the buildings, churches, artists painting on sidewalks. Take some time in one of the cafes and just soak up the atmosphere. Then you will surely be enchanted by one of the stores, and then losing is just starting ..

Very interesting . Wonderful stroll abound the gothic quarter it's highly recommended Entertainment lines the corners and streets The atmosphere is one of a time gone by The buildings are stunning with fantastic shops and eating establishments we went back 3 times as we couldn't get enough

Interesting history. We visited this area as part of a steel donkey bike tour, and our very knowledgeable guide gave us most interesting information about the history of this quarter. If we did not have this information, we would not have enjoyed this quarter as much as we did.

Walk through the area and travel back in time. The area is historic and is a warren of small plazas and narrow streets. Street performers abound. The Cathedral is located here. Lots of small eateries for tapas.
Nice place to wander . Definitely a nice neighbourhood to wander and explore. Unfortunately, the summer heat does take its toll, so take advantage of any and all cha.ces to duck inside the shade!
Fun. Just like most of Barcelona, the architecture is really nice. It's also a commercial area and it is safe to walk around.
Worth a look. Walked through the gothic quarter on way to beach and was impressed. I'm sure we didn't see it all, but it is a must. Lots of restaurants and bars at reasonable prices.
Must see when in Barcelona. Awesome place to go! Other areas of Europe claim to have gothic quarters, I like this one the best personally
gothic quarter.. If you are into architecture from the past this is a must see place in Barcelona. Along with the rest of Goudie's buildings.

Old, charming neighborhood - Not to be missed!. On my first visit to Barcelona I toured the Gothic Quarter with a cruise excursion, and I highly recommend taking a tour so that you learn about the history and significance of this charming, quaint neighborhood. Endless photo ops, wonderful boutiques and friendly shop keepers bring me back every time I am in Barcelona! I usually bring my shopping list back with me, as I typically return home wishing I had bought more of the special local craftwares, chic clothing and lovely leather goods that I pour over in the shops found in this district. You will find countless interesting cafes and Tapas bars to choose from, often without the tourist crowds. If you do not have time for a tour, this area is only a few steps from Las Ramblas, so it is easy to wander around by yourself and thoroughly enjoy it.

Historic buildings with this old district. It is worth spending some time to walk through the district in an nearly morning because many tourists come. There are plenty of old shops around with interesting stuff to sell.

AWESOME. I don't think you can go anywhere in Barcelona without being amazed at the architecture - that said, the Barri Gotic was jaw-dropping beautiful. Amazing and wonderful and WOW - highly recommend it - no, it is a MUST SEE. Tons of stuff to see and do in this city but if you miss this on a visit to Barcelona, you really didn't see the highlight!

Old World charm. This area is very different from most urban areas. my wife took some amazing photos of everyday life here which we review periodically to remember the great time we had in Barcelona. Unique shops in historic buildings and a vibrant atmosphere are not to be missed. Easy walking throughout the district and make sure to include a stop at Las Ramblas after visiting here

Unexpected alleys and streets!. My first trips of many to the gothic quarter I was taken aback by the "labyrinth" of streets and alleys. I recommend to. It take a map and allow yourself to be absorbed with the narrow streets and old historic facades and architecture. There are many little bars, restaurants ( which by the way many offer great ore fix lunch menus) at great prices. Walking through the gothic quarter allows you to experience Barcelona through the eyes of a local. In this neighborhood,myosin will,find the cathedral, ( wonderful in appearance), the Picasso museum, el Palau de la Música (music palace)... I experienced what it would have felt like many many years ago in barcelona. I frequently have visited Barcelona and this neighborhood is by far one of my favorites. The only negative thing I would say is the tourism during high season, but if you visit during months of January through March or even April, you have the opportunity to stroll at your leisure and cover the entire gothic quarter. For those who enjoy night life, nearby you have The neighborhood, El Born, which attracts club goers as well as a varietyof pubs and lounges. All,of this to enjoy at a reasonable budget!
If you like exploring small streets..... A fun way to wander and discover. We stayed across the street from the Barcelona Cathedral and loved the ability to walk everywhere.
Take the Tour. The history is too good to miss.. So glad I took the tour. The history from the early Romans, to Medieval times to the Spanish War are all there to be seen.

Can't visit Barcelona without visiting here!!. Truly a romantic part of town, with its old architecture, narrow streets filled with cafes and charm! Street musicians and vendors of all things fabulous, just strolling through this part of Barcelona will harken back to European vintage character and romance!!!!
Cool Place. A great ambience and an interesting bohemian feel to lots of the cafes and bars. I felt that the Gothic Quarter was a much more interesting and had more depth of character than La Rambla.
Nice place to visit. A large boardwalk with lots of stores and many old and impressive buildings. Don't take more than half a day for it.

A long weekend. Yes walk through the Gothic quarter is brilliant, there is the architecture which when you cast you mind back a few centuries you get real feel for the place, one person there impressed us , she told us she was an opera singer but now too old to perfom on stage, but her voice reverberating off the old walls was literally music to the ears, its a must place to besides las ramblas
great little shops. Great shops and restaurants. Quirky little streets, roman ruins. Wonderful atmosphere. I really liked this part of Barcelona

Medieval Barcelona in the middle of the modern city. A walk through the past this part of Barcelona has museums (Picasso), restaurants and shops. You can also find places to stay in the Gothic Quarter. Be aware - many of them do not have elevators so you will walk up and down stairs to your room. There are surprises around every corner, so it is worth the time to walk around.
Great old area. Beautiful area of the city. Tons of wonderful architecture, shops, food and people watching. Meander and wander through all the alleyways.
A nice place. A very nice place to visit, few wonderful museums (Picazo) and nice coffee shops(leave no tip they get offended)

Cool streets. Great architecture and history behind the buildings. Easy to get lost within the streets but that is the beauty of the area.
Be careful with bags as I witnessed a mugging/pick pocketing incident here.

Lots of ways to get lost, in a good way.... We had an apartment close to Barri Gotic so we wandered in and out all four days in Barcelona. Lots of history, like the 4th Century remains of walls and Roman aqueducts. You'll also find Museu Picasso, the Cathedral and many other museums.There are many restaurants and stores to occupy your time in addition to the wonderful history. Many buskers hang out here and provide a nice soundtrack to your wandering. We heard a couple of arias coming out of an alley behind the Cathedral, which was really cool.It doesn't have to be a destination by itself, but if you're around the area, drop in, you won't be disappointed in this great neighborhood. Great architecture, great sights, great sounds. Don't miss it.
Gothic Quarter. Wonderful area full of little tapas bars, shops and restaurants and lovely little alleyways with interesting architecture

Little side streets. Interesting quarter of Barcelona walking through side streets from port area towards the Cathedral. Lots of little bars and cafes taking you towards Plaza Catalunya or Las Ramblas
Very charming... We njoy to walk, and it is a very charming area to stroll, to take in the charming buildings, and enjoy a light meal in the numberous bistroes..

Get lost and discover local places in the Barri Gotic!. Cute, historic area jam-packed with restaurants, cafes, shops, and markets. Take the time to go down side streets and get a little lost, a little of the tourist track - this will most likely lead you to more local places, which perhaps don't have the tourist price-tag! The Placa Reial is particularly beautiful and full of life at night.

Great place to wander for a few hours. Lovely area just to wander through, many squares, small quaint bars and shops to discover. Some places can be very touristy and over priced, but there are many places that locals go to too. Good place to hide from the heat of the sun for a few hours too.

Relaxing to stroll through this area. We spent an entire afternoon stolling though this quarter with its narrow lanes and high buildings which are in good shape. There are several upscale boutiques selling local made products. There are many restaurants and bars too lining this area.

Enjoyable walking.. Possibly my favorite place we visited in Barcelona. Old, old buildings, narrow cobblestone streets, hidden shops and cafes. Easy to get lost but you always end up back where you need to be. Countless nice shops to choose from. Of particular interest was the outdoor antique vendors located in the plaza beside the cathedral.
recommendable. Great recommendable quarter. With wonderful shops. From time to time hand craft markets. Indescribable great ambience.

Beautiful Gothic Quarter. Went to the Picasso Museum which was very interesting & definately worth a visit. Then roamed around the Gothic Quarter and admired all the old building which have so much character. Lovely atmospher with street performers and lots of cafes & restaurants.,
Old gothic town. Need a lot of time to walk through all nice small streets. A lot of interesting stores - antique, food, small reatsurants

Can't visit Barcelona without visiting this area.. Beautiful buildings, interesting little shops, crooked streets with surprises around the corners. Opera singers, classical guitarists, violinists, Accordian players, Roman ruins. Something for all senses.
Gothic Quarter. Did a walking tour - definitely worth it because there's so much history that you would simply walk past otherwise.
Funky. Fun & Funky area! Didn't realize we were in the Gothic quarter, but it's easy to get lost among the meandering alley-like streets

The Cathedral was majestic.. We sat at a restaurant across from the Cathedral on Saint Johns Day. Musicians came to play and people were dressed in costumes. It was a great place to walk the streets and explore. There are many shops and places to have tapas.

Spend the day walking, sitting, and shopping. It's free, and well worth setting aside time to soak in the architecture, narrow streets, and overall atmosphere. Reasonable clean, I felt very safe wandering around during the day and late into the night after dinner.
Place to party. All most like staying in the French quarter in New Orleans when I was there they had lot of young Britain's there get drunk in the many of pubs
Great Walking Experience. If you want to see how the true people of Barcelona live it is worth walking around the streets. Along the way you will find little bars selling Tapas, Coffee etc.

Perfect for a nice walk!. Loved Barrio Gotico, it's great for a walk during late morning, you will hear street musicians, visit the cathedral and enjoy a coffe or walk down the several quarters (plazas).
Great place to wander. Beautiful architecture and streets. I loved the narrow corridors. Beautiful churches, and close proximity to the water. A great place to just wander and get lost.
Loved it!. If you like history, old buildings, and the feeling of walking through another century - have a visit! It was lovely to walk around the Gothic Quarter and see the architecture.
Nice quarter. A good quarter to stroll through, there a lot of nice shops and restaurants. Take you time and enjoy the atmosphere!
A wonderful part of Barca. The old city is well worth the visit bars restaurants great walking zone with nice shops . Some of the nicest places to eat are there . great shops and a wonderful vibe

Fascinating Encounters Every Time You Turn a Corner. I went on a free walking tour, which was great, but lengthy for an older person like me. Then I did my own exploring and found all of the intriguinging places really close at hand. Don't be afraid to explore! It's a wonderful area with lots of good shopping between the piazzas of historical significance. You can always find your way back to La Ramblas.

History at it's finest!. The gothic style has long been the pinnacle of architectural design from the 12th-16th century. With that being said, some buildings are well over 500 years old! There's nothing else like it!

Rambling and ambling in ancient quarters with surprises on every corner...food, fashion, SHOES!!!. Loved the quaint and ancient lanes. Gorgeous shopping! Great restaurants and cafés everywhere! So easy to walk and bike through!

La Pedrera. Another popular tourist attraction highlighting on Gaudis finest. There is a museum to Gaudi and how he designed some of his work in the loft. Outstanding views of Barcelona from this most unusual roof terrace. Well worth a visit, no pre booking required

A must do. I don't have a lot to add other than be sure that you have a good map; the area is indeed a maze and it can be difficult to track down the smaller sites such as the Synagoga Major or the Augustus Temple. At the same time getting a bit lost in it is part of the appeal, it's a truly remarkable place that should be on the short list for anyone visiting Barcelona.

The best quarter in town to visit. I love the small gothic streets and moreover there are museums and places of interest to visit. Do not miss "Santa Maria del Mar", a church with a heart, made by volunteers and donations of people who believed in what they were constructing. Believer or not, you can feel the history and dedication inside.

the narrow streets of Gothic. Walking distance from the sea front,Las Ramblas and Placa Catalunya,.After visiting the Cathedral,took one of the narrow streets and found the shops,bars and the cafe in the narrow streets and alleys to be different and interesting.
Ineresting historical area. This historical part of Barcelona is very interesting and needs a good visit if you are here. Here you will feel as well as see the old history of Barcelona.

Nice little streets with great bars, food, history and sights. You can spend a lot of time and just follow the little streets in all directions. Great place to find good food, artwork, a drink and photo spots.

An Ancient Maze. Get lost in the alleyways...stop for some churro a & chocolate, see a very old church or two and grab a Vermut...it's a fun barrio to explore, shop and eat. There is a seedy element at night as you get a little closer to the Ramblas so use your judgement...but very fun

Lovely area!. We stayed close to the Gothic Quarter when we were in Barcelona. It was very walk-able and easy to get around. I'd definitely recommend at least walking through, if not actually staying there.
Feels like you're in Gotham. Walking through here...It felt a bit creepy, there is no sunshine penetrating through, ancient architecture, dark, but you learn some history about the medieval times.

A step back in time. Our hotel was in the Gothic Quarter. What a great location. The streets are lively with all kinds of wonderful shops and restaurants. They're narrow and there's something interesting around every corner. The architecture and old buildings are beautiful and have so much character. It's fun to walk around and see what you can find. This is the old heart of Barcelona and shouldn't be missed.
Great little alleys. I loved the surprise at every little turn. Great shopping and little restaurants. The alleys and buildings were amazing to see...I could wander around there for hours.
lovely place!. love the vibe on this place very chilled will definitely visit again! would recommend to anyone to visit this place when visiting Barcelona!
Fun way to spend a day. Wonderful historic district in Barcelona - nice to take a tour to get all the background on this amazing area. Fun restaurants, shops too.

Intriguing . This is one of the best districts of Barcelona city .. You can visit this place several times while you are there and still find something new to stop and admire.. Narrow lanes opening into squares .. Wonderful architecture everywhere and small boutiques scattered Around with several places for tapas and drinks.. I roamed by myself all day and still never felt alone .. While walking around I happened to witness the human pyramids by castellers dressed in unique colors with much fan fare.. Memorable sight, lovely place to hang out if regular touristy stuff is not for you.

A place to live. From cold Russia to sunny Barcelona - what else could one wish? Cosy narrow streets of Gothic are one of our favourite places in Spain. Nice restaurants and shops too. You can find anything you want here!
Old part of town. Nice to walk around in and get lost. Love the old buildings that exude tons of character. stop in one of the old cafe's and soak it all in

A must see in Barcelona. We stayed in the Gothic Quarter and I'm so glad we did. The Cathedral Placa was amazing! There were hundreds of people at all times of day and night, outdoor cafes line the sidewalks and there is always musical entertainment going on. We walked the alley's and small streets even late at night. Around each little corner of every alley there are shops, cafes and street artists. One evening we heard the most beautiful voices and followed the crowd to find two older gentlemen singing opera behind the cathedral. There is a surprise around every corner of this old area of the city.
A favorite. Wandering through this old neighborhood is always a delight. The cobblestone streets, the quaint restaurants, and the Cathedral makes this a mandatory Stop when in Barcelona.

Favourite area of Barcelona. Must visit. Do not leave Barcelona without wandering these little winding streets. We took a walking tour, with Runnerbean tours, then popped back several times afterwards. Lots of small shops, ice creams, bars and restaurants, all hidden between roman ruins, medieval streets, Jewish relics and the sites of ancient legends. Move round the small squares and watch the world go by. We went to the Cathedral and visted the Porta de Santa Eulalia where 13 white geese live, all part of the Eulalia story, very pretty and such a surprise to find. Walk through from the Ramblas down to the beach, spend the whole afternoon and stay for food. We had a delicious meal in Gravin, left another review for that. You won't regret spending several hours here. We will stay in this area next time as a great base to walk to the Ramblas, Placa de Catalunya, La Boqueria, the beach and well served by the metro for getting to everywhere else.
nice. Scenic buildings lots of walking, very typical of many places. Gets overwhelming at times. Hot and muggy when we went on tour

Great history, lovely cafes. Every district in Barcelona has its own feel to it. The Gothic quarter contains lots of narrow streets and is mainly a residential area. every so often you come across a square, usually with a church and some cafes. Lovely for wandering around, although be careful not to get lost as we did one night.
Lovely afternoon. Have fun wandering the narrow streets. Do a little shopping. Stop for tapas and drinks. Check out a museum. Definitely a must see!

Small streets, lots of people, the heart of Barcelona. This is the center core of Barcelona so it is imposible to miss it if you are in town. Almost everything is nice there except for the smell (In spain we do not have the habitude of public toilets, so...)Late night can be a litle bit disgusting if you cross with drunk tourists (not a problem if you are one of them). Most of restaurants are acceptable and with reasonable prices. Be very carefull with the pickpockets they are like ninjas. "do not leave your baggage unattended" should be clealry posted there. A good place for cheap shopping, drinking and eating tapas and this kind of stuff. Flats are very small and with small or inexistant windows. Weekend noise can make people living there crazy. I dont recommend the flats there if your are concerned about noise and drunk people. Check water pressure, kitchen appliances, and electriciy before renting there, remember that most of the buildings have more than 200 years.

Must visit!. We had a tour of this quarter and wow... All these tiny streets and what's so awesome to see too is these old shops who have been operating for more than 100 years and have been recognized by the State of Catalunya! Some have been lost unfortunately as rent from places like Starbucks is more lucrative but it's these old shops that add so much character to the area! Thankfully they are getting some protections from the government.We had a walking tour of this area and so got a great insight and the history which just adds to the surreal experience! So highly recommend take a walk in this area! Even better with a guide!

Takes you back in time!. I love the narrow streets, the lamps and everything about the Gothic Quarter. All I did was walked along the narrow streets and admired it's construction. This area is well worth a visit.

Gorgeous.. Walk around this neighborhood, marvel at the architecture, and check out some of the shops. We loved exploring. No need to make plans or book a tour - it is fun to just wander and get lost on your own!

Old city of Barcelona. Scattered throughout the area some very interesting antique shops and unusual boutiques. Many piazzas,restaurants,tapas and wine bars. Excellent Cathedral to visit although admission payment is required.

You will get lost and love it.. This area of the city is steeped in history. As you wonder the narrow winding streets you will discover something interesting around almost every corner. It is easy to spend an entire day here and there are many charming little restaurants and patios when your feet need a rest.

Mystical, Historical & Charming. I lived here for a year and I was sad to leave this wonderful barrio. It's historical mixed with new, full of bars, cafes, restaurants, shops, boutiques, ice cream shops, strange sights, beautiful buildings. Get lost and enjoy the surroundings.
Worth a visit. Great place to visit whilst in Barcelona, recommended! Lots of food and drinks on the beach; can be a little pricey.

Our hotel is in the middle of this. Really neat small alleys where you can get lost easily. Just a fantastic maze of alleys some with businesses along & some not. Main streets are touristic yet that's a big source of income for Barcelona & it's residents.
Interesting. There is so much to see and admire, beautiful shops , little streets to wander down, bars and restaurants with decent prices. Beautiful architecture and the Harlem Jazz Club.

Pleasant discoveries!. Walking through the Gothic Quarter afforded us the luxury of discovering plazas full of people and chocolate cafes. As we wandered the alleys, we happened upon a plaza full of people in colored tops, dancing to a marching band celebrating the election, a plaza full of artists selling their wares surrounded by outdoor cafes and finally a plaza full of dancing, giant puppets. What a wonderful experience!
Amazing. The old town Barri gotic is full of nice small tapas restaurants! Really enjoyed it! If you are visiting Barcelona I would 100% recommend to pay a visit to this Gothic Quarter!

Historical walk. Great place to walk around and admire the ancient roman architecture. If you visit the Barcelona catherdral from La rambala the walk takes you to the Gothic quater .Lots of eating place and small shops offering souvenirs.Worth mentioning a very funky shop 2 floors high near the cathedral which had some amazing stuff, do visit this if you have time ( wont be disappointed )
Beautiful. Wonderful narrow streets, astonishing buildings, architectural surprises at every corner. A bit too busy but lovely nonetheless.
Out-of-the-way gem. This area of town is made of backsteets and interspersed roads and squares, filled with artisan shops, cafes and restaurants. Nice place for a wander around.

Great place to wander!. You'll find Barcelona's cathedral and Casa Batllo in the Gothic Quarter, as well as lots of amazing architecture. If you're planning to go in the cathedral, I'd suggest looking up the dress code (the day we went people were being sent away or asked to cover up). My friends and I had a wonderful time just roaming this area and discovering all the beautiful architecture.

Overnight stay. Lots of twists and turns. Interesting change from day to night. The day time each area street was bustling with shops and things to see. When the sun goes down, the garage style doors were closed and each one was artfully designed with different styles.

Beautiful area. Walked through here as part of a tour, and later again to see more detail. There was so much to see and admire, shops to enter, little side streets to wander down, bars and restaurants with relatively decent prices. Highly recommend.
Gothic Quarter. Beautiful architecture, cute shops, and good restaurants. I wish we had had more time to explore the area.

A maze of discovery. Every time I think of Barcelona it is the Gothic Quarter that comes to mind. A maze of little streets with so much to discover. If you can find accommodation here you may never leave for your entire stay.
Amazing . Lots of great things to see including amazing art and architecture. There was also loads of small boutique shops and bars and restaurants

Fun, exciting and historic. We spent most of our time in Barcelona at various tapas bars, restaurants, shopping and the Harlem Jazz Club in the Gothic Quarter. It's especially exciting at night, but a treasure of history during the day.

Gothic Quarter. Old part of Barcelona city. Made up of tiny rambling passageways and squares.Several cafes/bars/restaurants are dotted around as well as old buildings. Great for a morning wandering around , drinking coffee and exploreing.
Great Area!. loved it, much cheaper than the Rambla area and much more choice in restaurants and bars! Make sure you have comfy shoes, lots of walking required!

Great way to spend an afternoon. Such a beautiful neighborhood to get lost in. Go without an agenda and just wander around. Really great restaurants and gelato shops. Also there is a church (can't remember the name) that we stopped in - no admission fees - and it was breathtaking.

Historic and vibrant at the same time. Our flat was located in one of the historic buildings. There were restaurants, bakeries and shops all around. We spent some time just wandering around the narrow corridors. One of those walking tours with a guide would be nice to fully understand the history.Also walking distance to Barceloneta for the beach.

Great buildings and architecture. There is lots to take in , in this area the architecture is astonishing as it is in most places in Barcelona is it is a wonderful city. There are lots of shops and restaurants to chose from also lots of street entertainment which is actually very good. !
We found our feet taking us there. It's casual, comforting, different, full of great shops and eateries and great landmarks to see. We pretty much spent our vacation there.
gothic greats. fantastic architecture we really enjoyed a ramble around this gorgeous area followed by some amazing tapas

Take a free tour or have a good guide book for the best experience. There is no defined Gothic Quarter at street-level, it is more a defined area on the map, so unless you go on a tour or have a good guide book it is easy to wander off piste and end up in some seedier streets between Las Ramblas and Parallel. Not that they are particularly threatening - I think the risk of pick-pockets in the city has probably been over stated - it is just that they are not that interesting, one street seems to be one mobile phone shop after another. But around the Cathedral there is a warren of narrow medieval streets and squares with nice, interesting shops, restaurants and cafes. Keep looking up - a lot of the best architecture is above the shop-front level - but this can be difficult with the crush of tourists oblivious to everything but what is in the lens of their camera. To do real justice to this area - including plenty of sampling of the cafe culture and people watching - allow a full day at the minimum.
Excellent Walking Neighborhood. Great neighborhood to wander in with everything from old Gothic architecture, to Roman ruins and lots of interesting churches, shops and museums.
Have fun getting lost. Lots of small shops in winding and narrow alley ways, just make sure you bring an umbrella if its calling for rain.

Very Historical!. There are lovey plazas in this area and nice little niches to have a small bite to eat, or even a coffee...El CALL, the Jewish Quarter is also lovely. I recommend seeing La Plaza de Felip Neri, and La Plaza del Rei.

A wanderer's paradise. This is the place to just walk around to experience. There are small squares, shops, interesting restaurants and every day life going on around you. The architecture is varied - sometimes quirky (think palm tree on the third floor of an old building), quaint, stunning with a little modern thrown in. Do not miss it.
Great fun. Loads of different architecture, restaurants, bars. Spent hours wandering around and could have spent more!

Silent side of Barcelona. We explored this twice, in different cycling tours and found it very interesting, helping us understand the history and phases of the city. The sign languages, little pieces of design in buildings and facades tell a lot- of course our guide was very knowledgeable. I recommend using a bicycle (used a child seat for my 5 yr old)
very interesting area. got a little lost - make sure you have a detailed map fascinating area lots to see - cathedral worth a visit
Great architecture. A nice gem out of history. Really beautiful architecture and nice small Cathedral in the center to get out of the busy streets.

Cute and very surprising!. Just beautiful buildings here the architecture is simply wonderful. Turn another corner and find another courtyard or square. Lots of little side streets to explore and lots of little magic treasures to smile at. Busy but worth sightseeing.
beautiful. everything....the entire experience was amazing! It's a complete must see when in Barcelona with it's winding streets. So much charm
Great for walks. Great place to just walk and see the old city. Architecture most likely different than your home town. Several free tours available also. Great way to walk off a large paella.
Visit while departing for a cruise.. Seeing the old town Barcelona was good. It is near the beach, city centre and port. Barcelona is a clean big city and I was delightfully surprised.

go early in the a.m.. Arrived in Barcelona on a redeye flight. Hotel room not ready so we struck out to sightseeing. My wife and I wandered through early in the morning. The best time!! No tour groups. No clusters of kids with selfie sticks. great to do a self guided tour a la Rick Steves. The narrow streets and old architecture seeps in and you really feel the atmosphere of the place. We came back another day when it was busy and it wasn't the same. Do yourself a favor and come here EARLY!!

Architectural beauty!. Takes you back in history.,...gorgeous! Be ready to walk. There are several walking tours around. Best in the day before sunset. Getting a guide is a good idea else you will never understand the context.

Take the guided walking tour. If you can, take the guided walking tour of this area. It's very informative, cheap, and it makes any subsequent trip back for restaurants or activities even better. Our guide spoke very good English and was very knowledgeable in the area as well as Barcelona in general

Stroll on.....!. The gothic quarter is wonderful to just walk around. As with most Spanis cities, come tapas time, 4pm ish..... All the action begins. We walked down an alley by old church and a who.e group sang an impromptu opera.. CarmenBeautiful architecture evrywhere. Best food, l'academie
Wow, great experience. Very eclectic, safe and easy to get around, wander about down side streets and you will find such quirky treasures

Walk this!. Oh yes you have to walk this neighborhood! It is vibrant and full of life and spirit! There are many little shops for clothes, jewelry, purses, cafes and bars, music in the plazas, food places, like bakeries, or take away sandwiches and paninis, or restaurants. Everywhere someone is playing and instrument violin music or saxophone or accordion or guitar entertaining the public. Parades just happen in the square with the Giants! The old buildings are everywhere and the gothic surrounds you. You can walk upon an art exhibit or a little plaza with an interesting vibe. Take in the Barri Gotic.

Beautiful. Beautiful architecture and wonderful to wander around. Wandered over to the city park and enjoyed the peace and quiet, went.over to the arc de triomphe and walked up the 'mall' where a guy was 'blowing' massive bubbles over everyone which my girls loved.

Loved this area - Really felt like we were enjoying the "real" Barcelona. We stayed at a hotel right in the heart of this area and just spent days wandering around all the little alley ways and discovered something new every day. Cute little shops, restaurants and cafes, and you could admire all the architecture all around you. We spent almost two full days wandering around and trying new foods. Didn't worry about where the streets lead because there was always something new to see and just experience. Loved the area and so glad we stayed here. There was always something going on but not like the hustle and bustle of a city. We didn't even realize how close the actual "modern" city was until the third day which only reinforced our choice to stay in this area. Had a great time.

Lots of small streets. Yes - a lots of streets and you won't see them all in a couple of hours. Search in advance the places you must visit. Enjoy the atmosphere. Remember to sit down, eat ice cream and watch people. Lots of old buildings. For example walk towards the Duomo.

So many shops, bars, restaurants, easy to get lost.. Loved the Gothic Quarter, lots of lovely side streets, full of shops, bars and restaurants. It was so easy though to wander around and get lost, and then trying to find a bar that you thought looked nice seemed impossible. So much to do here and a real sense of history.

Wonderful to wander. We were with four friends who we Cruise with and the stop in Barcelona was amazing one of my favourite cities and just walking through the streets god smacked because of the quality of the buildings. What great history and at its finest.

Spent several days wondering the narrow streets of the Gothic Quarter. Many opportunities here to stimulate your senses! Great shopping, good eats and treats, centuries old churches, great architecture. You must try the hot chocolate and churros before leaving Barcelona. Musicians and performers will be around a few corners to delight you. Don't rush, and savor the life in Barcelona!
Gorhtic enjoyment. A night walk with Bean Runners city tours was very good. You experience the culture and history of a very old country

Amazing to find this so close to chaos of Las Ramblas.. Head a block or two from Las Ramblas and be amazed at the stunning buildings and narrow little alley ways, hot if they're in the sun a welcome break if you're in the shade.

Walking & Dining.. Beautiful area to walk around and get lost in the tangle of small streets. We spent many days making our way through different alley ways and coming across beautiful little squares. It was wonderful both during the day and at night. We found many stunning little restaurants with fantastic food- we could never find the same place twice but that added to the charm.Definitely recommend it if you like to walk and eat!

Gotta Love Barrio Gothic!. What I love about cities like Barcelona are the contrasts available. You can step from the bustle of the wide city streets and La Rambla into the narrow cosy back lanes of the Gothic old town. Great little laneways and shops where you can find some great shoes and nick nacks. We spent a great afternoon wandering around the squares and historic churches, discovering Roman walls after a pretty hectic morning. Must do in Barcelona.

"A Very Lively Neighborhood in Barcelona". One of the more fun things to do in Barcelona is to walk around the old Gothic Quarter. We began atthe Placa de Catalunya & walked a few blocks downthe Ramblas lined with shops & kiosks selling allkinds of things. Tucked into the buildings is theErotic Museum. Across the street from the museum is the massive Mercado Boqueria where you can find almost any kind of food, flowers & such.We headed over to the main Cathedral, then to theold Jewish section, had some tapas along the waythen over to the Picasso Museum for a visit. Along our path were several sites of Roman Ruins, churches,small Placas and a few small museums. A spontaneoussong & dance group started performing in a pedestrianstreet while playing guitars! Near the Picasso Museum is the awesome Palace of Catalan Music-a must see. We ended up back at the Placa de Catalunya where we picked up some wine, meats, cheeses, and bread for our room at the wonderful deli in the basement of El Corte Ingles department store.The main tourist office is under street level of the Placa de Catalunya . Here you can find tours, Barcelona Cards, Metro passes & such.During the evening hours the Ramblas is very popularfor walking & several clubs for music & dancing arescattered throughout the area.

Totally interesting area!. Part of a tour we were on was going through the Gotsis quarter. It was very cool and wished we would have spent more time there. It was recommended to NOT go there at night and I would agree.
Excellent walk. We found a great place for mojitos. Great way to cool down on a hot summer day in Barcelona. Try it and you will li,e it. Free wifi too.
Must see. Must see area! Stayed here for a week and it was an amazing area to see. I would highly recommend it even if you are not an architecture fan.
goths rule. In the Gothic area you have splendid cathedrals BUT you can not enter the cathedral wearing vests and shorts etc must have knees and arms covered Le rambles is a lovely vbabrant town

Step back in time. I love to wander around the Gothic Quarter. Just step down one of the alley-ways off of Las Ramblas and you find yourself in a different century. I recommend doing a bike or walking tour of the city to get to know your way around and how to stumble upon gems like the Gothic Quarter.

Dignified Kitsch. It's not really, as billed, that these buildings go back to ancient times - if there is anything ancient here, rebuilding and ahem restoration has removed anything of historical value. The commercial enterprises here, both shops and sidewalk vendors tend to be a bit weak on the value-price ratio. That said, this area does have its charm; one cannot help but remember favorite scenes in Barcelona's favorite novelist, Carlos Ruíz Zafón.
Great lanes to discover. There are so many great little shops that cater for the locals and tourist. There is always something new in each new passage

Lovely place to stroll. An escape from the Rambla into the Barri Gotic, where you can wander in the shady lanes and enjoy the little squares and medieval churches. It's probably my favourite thing about central Barcelona - a reminder of its long and complicated history.

A wonderful part of town. We walked around this area on the way back from the port and La Rambla. Some parts are wonderfully quiet and shaded, then there are lively squares where you can enjoy coffee in the sunshine. The beautiful cathedral is here too, and although I'm not a religious person, I did make me feel a little spiritual. There is a lovely bridge in the style of the Venetian Bridge of Sighs, I never found out what it was for but certainly worth looking out for.

Don't go on Sunday. Everything was closed but it was fun to walk around! The architecture is unlike anything i've ever seen and it was probably better the shops were closed or I would have spent a lot more money!
Fun to just walk aroung. Narrow street, lots of people and some cool shops. We just wandered around for a couple of hours enjoying the building and the scenery.

Lovely part of town. We stayed in the Gothica area, beautiful old part of the city, narrow streets and tall buildings and some great bars and resteraunts to visit.Could be dodgy late at night as few unscrupulous characters hanging around, particularly drug dealer pretending to be selling loose cans of beer as a front. In saying that we didn't feel threatened, and there are police touring on scooters.
Charming. Can spend hours simply wandering all the little alleyways.Take a map! Take the opportunity to act like a local, and savour some of the local tapas and cafe bars.
A great area.. Our hotel was in this area... lots of little streets and squares. Loads of restaurants and interesting shops. Don't forget to visit the market.

A must see. A sprawling, winding maze of closes and streets, packed to the brim with shops, cafe's and bars. Delicious Tapas, fine wine, local beer, and stunning architecture.......the list just goes on and on! If you're in Barcelona you just have to spend an Afternoon wandering around the Gothic Quarter, you will not be disappointed. P.S Due to the buildings being so high it can come as welcome shade of the sun is blistering.

Great area right in the heart of Barcelona. I stayed here for a week in an air BnB apartment right near Jaume metro station. it was fantastic! There's some hidden gems in the little streets of this area that doesn't have so many tourists - eg the Jewish quarter. there's fantastic little bars, artisans, galleries, etc. also right in front of the stairs down to the station is THE best chocolate & patisserie shop La Colmena .Pastisseria La ColmenaLives in Plaça de l'Àngel, 12, Barcelona, Espanya mmmmmm
Gothic Quarter. Mostly interesting but completely ill-advised to male tour group stand in the full sun when there was plenty of shade

wonderful. The ancient history of Barcelona come to life and a charming part of the city. Walkable, centrally located and full of wonderful shops, places to eat and sights. A mix of tourist traps and venues loved by locals.
Spend the day there. This was a charming part of Barcelona. Loved all the shops and restaurants - the little narrow streets and cobblestones.....gorgeous!!!
The old city in Barcelona. There is a lot of history here to enjoy including the oldest Jewish synagogue. I would recommend a local guide to take you and explain the history in this area.

Amazing discoveries at every turn!. Beautiful area of Barcelona and must be discovered at a leisurely pace in order to fully appreciate just how amazing this area is. Theres also an amazing restaurant hidden in here the Cafe Restaurant Estruch. Its located at Av. de la Catedral and this provides a beautiful setting whilst enjoying great food!
The Architecture of light and shadow. Perfect dark places. Narrow streets of old town. Tourists are everywhere. So much history in architecture. Modernity with small cafes, entertainers and music.
Gothic Area. This is a very interesting area, with very old buildings and incredible architecture. Many narrow streets with shops of all kinds.

Wow! Fantastic...don't miss this experience!. Great area to visit when in Barcelona. Great restaurants and bars (La Pla restaurant is fabulous...make reservations...reasonably priced and good wine selection). Very quaint shops. Very authentic area. We also visited Le Salon restaurant and enjoyed it.

Great place to stroll.. Forget all the dire warnings about safety. Of course, this is a big city and you have to be aware of the people around you, but as New Yorkers, we found it safer than Times Square. There are terrific places to eat, so explore away!

OLD SCHOOL BARCELONA. The gothic quarter of Barcelona is an area in old Barcelona featuring alot of old buildings featuring a stunning cathedral of Barcelona and a beautiful museum along with a number of other buildings which names i cant remember. You can see remains of a huge walled area with a honeycomb of little alleyways surrounding a large square.. Not sure if the antique stalls are always there but lots to look at. Beware this is PICKPOCKET heaven.....Just take all the necessary precautions and you will be fine.

Much to see in the Gothic and Jewish Quarter. There is so much to see in Barcelona's Jewish and Gothic Quarter that we were very glad we had hired a private guide through Emily Mathews, owner and manager of South O'le Spain Tours who also provided private guides for Segovia, Toledo, Seville, Cordoba, Granada, Ubeda and Baeza and three days in Barcelona. In addition to seeing the 15th c Palau de la Generalita and 14th c Town Hall, the 12c Roman Baths and 1st c B.C. Temple d Augustus, we spent most of our time in the El Call (Jewish Quarter) comprised of very narrow streets. At it's height, there were about 3500 Jews and 5 synagogues in this section prior to the Jews expulsion. The Call de Barcelona was founded in 1997 to educate about the Jewish history of Barcelona. It manages the 1267 medieval Mayor Synagogue (the oldest in Spain) which has two small rooms, one of which can be used for services. When we were visiting, there were numerous tour groups so there is limited space or time to look around. Nearby is the MUHB El Call (Museum of History) which opened in March 2015 in the former home of a Jewish weaver. The museum has two floors of excellent displays of Jewish life in el Call and a glass floor over roman ruins. There was good signage in English. This is one of the best Jewish museums we saw in Spain.

Another lovely Antique area in Spain. This area is filled with Cafes and shops and tourists. It is a lovely antique area with maze like streets and at least one beautiful plaza. Definitely add this to your trip to Spain.

Don't miss it!. I loved just walking around and getting lost in the intertwined streets there. Take a map and discover everything this area has to offer. Plenty of tourist info stands. Pay them a visit and you will get lots of coupons for museums, etc

Winding alley's with intriguing shops. I thoroughly enjoyed the Barri Gotic, for the architecture, the old fashioned streets, the winding alleys that are almost like a maze as well as the shops within the area. Tonnes of bars, restaurants and authentic Catalan shops to enjoy your time in.
Felt like I was living in Game of Thrones time. This area is one of the neatest areas i have ever walked around in .. it is full of little alley ways that you can take and find other neat areas ..

Wonderful. Great part of the city - lots of history, atmosphere, tucked away corners, bars and shopping. Beautiful squares and buildings and feels very relaxed. Yes, there is a bit of an issue with petty crime here and in Los Ramblos - pickpockets in particular - but no more than you would expect in any city of this popularity. Use basic common sense to avoid any problems.

Get Off Las Ramblas!!!. If you want to experiance BCN like the people who live here head off the main streets into the old town and enjoy the beautiful winding streets, hidden restaurants and bars and the sun kissed plazas. (Mind yourself at night, don't be too drunk and alone, pick pockets everywhere)

Loved this!. You will like you've stepped back in time wandering through the streets of the Gothic Quarter. Little shops and quaint sidewalk cafes abound. We were there on a Saturday and there was a flea market going with unique one-of-a-kind iitems from the very talented artisans displaying their wares.
a breathtaking area. a breathtaking atmosphere in this area. the buildings are astonishing. also the jewish area inside. recomended!!

Adventure for All. Don't miss the Gothic Quarter while in Barcelona. The quant streets, shopping and restaurants are fun to explore. You may even see groups of people dancing in the streets as we did.

Historic Barcelona. The Barri Gotic area of Barcelona is magical. The historic atmosphere and medieval architecture is almost overwhelming. You could stroll endlessly for days and still not cover every street and alley. For history buffs, a wonderful experience.
I LOVE IT. I have travelled around europe but when i went to barcelona i feel like this part of the city is just special!
Check out the cathedral. Please do not go to Barcelona and not go to the Gothic Cathedral. It is truly amazing, make sure you go ont he roof. The biews are breathtaking.
Old Town. Very once and authentic place in this great city,lots to see and shopping to if you are looking for that special gift.
Busy Barri. Fabulous architecture, full of history and places aplenty to refgresh yourself at - be it coffee or something stronger. If you visit the cathedral, ladies need to cover their shoulders.

Walking through history. We took a walking tour through the Bari Gotic and then went back a couple of times to spend more time in the places we wanted to view in more depth. The museums, the churches, the restaurants, the plazas, the street entertainers, the narrow winding streets, the entire atmosphere was wonderful.

Walking tour of Barri Gotic. We saw Barri Gotic on a self-guide tour from a Rick Steves travel book on Barcelona. It allowed us time to enjoy the tour at our own pace with wonderful explanations of what we were seeing and...the price is right.

Walk Around During the Day to get your Bearings Then Again at Night. This is the hoppin, hipster place in Barcelona. Filled with cafes, shops, tourists and locals, it is more personal than Las Ramblas and it gives you good vibe of the city. Walk through the mazelike lanes that open up to apiazza, where you can have a coffee or beer. But...good luck finding that piazza again!
Tremendous time warp!. Absolutely magical, cobblestones winding laneways filled with interest. Eclectic range of shops, lovely little bars and restaurants, this area is the stuff of dreams.
A good area to say in. We stayed in a small hotel here in 2014, it is extremely central, full of history and was, whilst alive, not too noisy at night.
Gorgeous architecture!. America is such a young country so it's nice to see so much history and aesthetics. The people are friendly. The food is appetizing, aromatic, and colorful.

Definitely take a stroll through the Gothic Quarter. So much to take in in the Gothic Quarter! I really enjoyed this quarter of Barcelona. I took a stroll and stopped for a cafe con leche. The people were so kind.

The old and the new.. We walked down Las Ramblas to the Gothic Quarter and with our free map were able to find the old Roman Walls. Strolled through the narrow streets until we found one of the old city gates. Nearby was a very old chapel and glassed in building ruins.Needless to say there are shops and shops flanking these ancient thoroughfares.Barcelona does food very very well, much better than the italian tourist cities and it is a delight to sample the local delicacies as you stroll.The locals seem to love tourists and are warm and helpful.Barcelona is an enjoyable city for tourists, but remember to take security with your belongings. Ladies must never hang their bags over the back of chairs in public areas. This is asking to be pickpocketed! This happened to a few of our friends in the city.

Fascinating. What the gothic quarter has to offer is what other European cities are now trying to develop.It's a hip area with lots of streets and corners filled with cool little shops, bars and restaurants.It's fun to walk around the streets, both during the day and at night. The streets seem safe, more than La Rambla by any means.I think younger children will get bored quickly (mine did) but teenagers will like it.
Lovely Neighbourhood. Lovely narrow streets filled with delightful shops. Full of character and not to be missed! Bring comfortable shoes.

Worth a walk. You need to see the old Roman walks and take in the underground part of the city to really explore. They have a very good museum of the preserved parts which you walk over and with explanations in several languages.

A lovely historic area of Barcelona. Fantastic narrow, winding roads to amble down taking in Roman ruins and the feel of the oldest part of Barcelona. And there are plenty of places to stop off for refreshment, too.
Something new each visit. Explore the narrow streets and buildings in this area which is a little more tranquil than the nearby Las Ramblas. Each time i visit i spot new buildings of interest.
great experience. it is a place highly recommended , with interesting shops and picturesque cafes. the people are friendly and welcoming .

A wonderful walk through time. Gothic quarter is stunning and brimming with life.
Great shops, loads of character and heaps of cafes, eateries etc.
Streets are easy to navigate and away from the Ramblas, crowds are not so bad.
While cleaned regularly there is still a nasty smell.
If you have a sensitive nose many of the streets are pungent with urine which is unpleasant.
Great walk alng this neighborhood. Many little shops. Tall buildings. Many vintage stores along the way. Lots of fun window shopping. Not to miss.

Narrow streets with loads of shops.. These streets were a delight to walk around every single day because it was easy to walk down a different street and find small squares and quirky shops.We also experienced wonderful buskers every evening and on Sunday we saw a parade of giant figures - just added to our Barcelona experience.

The Best of Barcelona if you don't like the commercial nonsense. Great for you inner Bohemian!. The best part of Barca. Most of the attractions are very commercial, theme park like with no character. This is the best Barcelona offers. Fabulous shops that you get to bargain in, not too crowded as you HAVE to discover this place on foot. Steps are uneven if you're on a wheelchair but it's not too bad that you have no access, just less comfortable. Same for those with pushchairs and baby buggies. Ideal for friends and couples. Children will get bored. Lots of local crafts to buy from handmade candles, pottery to Venetian masks.
Historic and worthwhile to visit. We walked through this area as part of our APT tour and were very impressed with the way they have maintained the buildings and structures. A must see

Interesting. All of Barcelona is interesting but this area is especially so. Barcelona was not that interested in its history and built over the Roman infrastructure. It is now exposing that period of its history and the Barri Gothic is a great place to see that era as well as the city of the Middle Ages. It is all so clean and, with a map, easy to get around. Everywhere in Barcelona seems to teem with places to eat and this area is no exception.

One of the pearls of Barcelona. Very crowded for the local people, if you want to have a contact with local people, this is not the best place... But architecture enviroment and narrow streets brings to you a whole experience, cool bars, clubs and surprisings restaurants, try to find your spot, there's a lot of magical nooks, it will amaze you, you can spend hours and hours floating in the streets.

Real Middle Age. Most part of the Gothis quarter is from the Middle Age. But you can find Roman remains as well. Here is the Cathedral, and some other smaller churches as well. In the small streets bars, restaurants, cafés. You can get lost in the narrow streets.

One of the oldest synagogues in Europe is here!. In the charming old neighborhood of Barcelona, they have found and restored an old synagogue. There are tours daily but they might not be open on a Saturday or holiday. Call first. The street that the synagogue is on is not on any map. Tell the cab driver to drop you in the square where the city hall is. Walk to the far side and go to the street on the right. Take the first right and go 1 block and make a left and it is right there. It is charming and has an interesting history and your contribution helps continue the restoration.
