Plan to amble, explore, and soak in the history and present of this classic European neighborhood.

This is good overview of the area. This will give you the history of the area and a must go to back to see overview. I am very glad glad that we were on this tour we had already seen many of the things but did not know the history.

Great atmosphere. Older part of town full of small independent traders of all descriptions, even saw a shop devoted to all sorts of tripe (food).Great restaurants all over but particularly in the larger squares. Great area to simply amble along and go with the flow.

Try the Shadow of the Wind walking tour. If you're a fan of Carlos Ruiz Zafon's most outstanding story set after the Spanish Civil War -and if you love Barcelona or are planning on going there, you should be - then after reading the book, download the map from his website and spend a few days visiting the story's locations! It is a wonderful way to explore the Gothic Quarter. There's lots to stop and enjoy so make sure you allow plenty of time.

Hours of atmospheric wandering. I could've wandered around this neighbourhood for hours. It's charming, intriguing, and saturated with historical buildings. If you want to dig a little deeper, visit the Museu D'historic de Barcelona, and - among other things - you'll be able to go underground to walk along Roman, and Medieval walls.

Great place to walk around and hang out. Safe, walking streets, beautiful scenery, shopping, cafes, what's not to like?? We spent a lot of time here as there were so many good restaurants and it was near our hotel. Some of the shops are a bit touristy, but there are plenty of good ones, too. We loved it.
History and interesting. If you get a tour to learn about all the different parts of old city, you will learn centuries worth of information. Enjoy!

Historic Centre. A must visit part of Barcelona. Good walking shoes are a must when visiting this area ;-) Lots to see do and explore in this old part of the City. Tall buildings, narrow streets and lots of shops to explore. There are also plenty of eating places to stop and rest and replenish your batteries! There are lots of people about so be prepared for crowds of other people moving about within this area as well as yourself. The old cathedral is well worth a visit and to see the cathedral's guard geese and their pond! Be prepared to encounter public demonstrations in the main square of the Gothic Quarter. These are peaceful and well policed. People appear frequently to demonstrate in this area but these gatherings do not last long. The people gather, make their protest in front of the main public building and then quite quickly disperse while life goes on in the Gothic quarter. It is just part of the local tradition within this area of Barcelona. The Gothic Quarter is easy to navigate around with the aid of a basic tourist map. As previously highlighted this is a must see area if you visit Barcelona.

Pretty to walk through, but not our idea of an "attraction". The beauty of the Gothic Quarter easily warrants five stars, but I wouldn't consider it a destination were in searching for something to do. We enjoyed the view as we were urban hiking through to our next stop.

A District Worthy of Exploration. If you want to explore Barcelona on foot this is the district where you should start, especially as due to its antiquity it is more rewarding to explore as a pedestrian than as a motorist.If you are a keen tourist you can do lots of research and plan your itinerary. However I think this barri deserves a more unstructured approach of wandering and soaking in the history from the varied buildings. Thus you will appreciate more the unexpected delights it offers!

trips around the old quarter. gothic quarter is really a must if you are in barcelona. just loose yourself in this quarter and visit small streets where you have the impression there could be something, you will love it
Beautiful architecture. The Gothic Quarter is lovely place to stay, with museums, historic churches and all the bars and restaurants you could want, all in walking distance.
A nice walkable town with unique character. People watching ... how the locals go about their daily lives ... including watching football at the local restaurants

No visit to Barcelona is complete w/o a trip to Gothic Quarter.. This area is full of shops, bars, restaurants and historical buildings, bike rental places and hostels. Good for families with kids and couples in love alike. If you are on low budget book an airbnb flat.
Loved it.

So much history and quaint Cafe'. Love love love. So much to see and explore. Nice to see so many owner operated businesses. Out of the rut. Mostly unique and oh so pretty. Cathedrals and buildings made me just awestruck.

Great area with fun interesting shops.. Enjoyed this area of the city very much. This was part of our bike tour, which I highly recommend people do. Wonderful shops and excellent places to eat and enjoy Tappas.

Architecturally interesting historically important cathedral.. This place is worth a visit, after you've been to Gaudi's masterpiece. It epitomises everything I hate about R/C cathedrals. The architecture is fantastic.
Wonderful place to explore!. Must see the Santa Caterina Market and the Mercat al Born. Explore the "Call" (old jewish area) but avoid Las Ramblas.
Original Barcelona. Make sure you take a walking tour of this area as this helps to understand this area. Easy to walk, take in during the day and also in the evening.

History, art and fun. I liked the many narrow streets and pretty squares where you find artists exhibiting their works, tiny shops selling nothing but wicker products or masks, historical buildings like churches and tapas bars galore.
Must in Barcelona. Special atmosphere, tiny streets, good restaurants. Take a walk there. Don't miss it, it's the heart of Barcelona in the old city.

Incredible!. This must be the most incredible medieval quarter in Europe.
This has always been my favorite part of the city apart from
the architecture the atmosphere is fantastic. There is everything
here. If you can only visit one place in Barcelona it has to be
this.

one of the great attractions of Barcelona. you could loose yourself for days here and feel that you have had a great trip - its another fabulous world - we are so lucky that the Barri Gothic and Born areas of Barcelona are preserved. its fantastic just being there

Magic. Perfect to get lost
It's fantastic
Full of people, full of life. Lots of things to buy, even if you don't buy it's amazing
Architecture, mysticism
Around every corner. Through the maze of streets and alleyways, there's a shop, a vendor, a restaurant, a view, a building, a courtyard.....find yourself a treasure there.

Get lost.... ... this is the only way of experiencing it.
The intricate network of narrow streets and passageways always deliver you to an interesting place or, better still, a hidden 'bodega' that serves the best olives you've ever tasted.
Great area to wander. Very busy with all sorts of interesting shops, restaurants etc...Unbelievably clean, like most of the city.

Fab!. Loads of different things to see here. Best facilitated by a sunny day and a beer or two (or ice creams) on the way round. Make sure you can look up (unlike our aged Parents with neck problems) so you get to appreciate the architectural beauty of the taller buildings in this area. Barcelona is remarkable and this area is a real jewel in its crown! Don't miss it.
Wonderful. What a fascinating place to explore with its narrow streets and unique shops,cafés and restaurants. Don't miss out on Las Ramblas which is the main shopping street in this area.

A time machine!. We spent a whole day just meandering around the Gothic quarter. The most stunning architecture I have ever seen. Knocks spots off Paris! Lots of individual boutiques, art galleries and eateries. Absolutely loved it. A must if you visit this amazing city.
Old world at your fingertips !. I stayed in the Gotic quarter,great walking around the old lanes, all the buildings, churches, great vibe about the place !

Busy interesting area. The atmosphere seems less intimidating than it did 20 years ago. There are lots more shops, but more tourists, in droves. We loved the Musica building which has a good cafe. The area is still grubby but has character.
Barri Gotic. Nice old building, very narrow streets, a lot of young peaples walking through streets during night and day-makes good atmosphere of this area

Lost in a maze of streets. In the Barri Gothic you will see all the main important cathedrals, buildings and squares from medieval times. It's a tangle of streets which are really fun to explore. Be prepare to get a little lost, that's the whole fun of it, and poke around the numerous shops, art galleries, cafes and restaurants located there. The Picasso Museum is in the Barri Gothic located in 3 old buildings. They have an impressive and comprehensive collection of his work donated by his wife Jacqueline and his best friend and private secretary Jaume. You should try to take a walking tour around the Gothic quarter just to orient yourself otherwise it's a tad confusing. I love the atmosphere which is bohemian and arty at the same time historic and cultural. You can see lots of beautifully executed graffiti on the walls, a testament to the artistic inclinations of the Catalans.
Lovely stroll. This neighbourhood is the perfect palce to get lost in, amongst lovely buildings, quicky stores, cute cafes and restaurants...Lovely way to spend an afternoon!

Great place to explore and walk around. The Gothic quarter is a must see place in Barcelona. There are narrow alleys shooting off the main roads full of boutique shops and restaurants. Please be super super careful about your wallet and expensive items when travelling by Metro or in crowded areas. Pick-pockets in Barcelona must be one of the most advanced in the world! I would suggest carrying just 1 credit card and some cash. Leave the rest in your hotel room safe.
Nice. it easy to see that there are a long history in the old street and buildings with very new commercial activity
Walk around old rome. A must see place. As the weather was bad, I did not see as much as I wanted to. Next visit will re visit. So much to se and do

Every turn there is a surprise. This place is awesome and you can do it all, beautiful architecture, incredible stores hiding like little gems on every single street and a beautiful surprise in every corner.You can really take hours to go here, the place is awesome, just let yourself get lost on the little streets

don't just vist- stay there. The Barri Gotic is, for me, the heart and soul of Barcelona. Not to just visited, but stay there (if even for a few days) Enjoy walking the tiny streets and alleys and soak it all in. Churches big and small, markets, shops, restaurants, bars...nice to get away from the traffic, too!

Beautiful Old City. There are lots of shops and restaurants hidden in a warren of narrow streets. As you explore the areas, you will come across small squares and terraces, and ,if you are lucky, talented musicians performing in the open.
Cool and cute. Very cute district, cool and authentic. It is very touristic, but what is very interesting is not "Las Ramblas", but all the little streets all around !

Coolest area of the City. Don't need to say much, the Gothic district is just spectacular. Really transport you back in time getting a walk along Roman walls and streets and watching the layers of the city go up into a medevil powerhouse City that survived one of the darkest times in recent history it really let you appreciate the awesomeness of the Roman Empire and the subsequent rebuilding that was necessary during the dark ages. It really is a very interesting and unique experience really no other city provides quite on the same level. A must see for anyone visiting Barcelona

Wandered the Streets. My brother and his girlfriend and I decided to just wander the back streets and alleys in the area. We saw some really neat architecture, and just happened on cool sights. No plan necessary!
Get lost. Just get lost and enjoy every second of it. The little alleys are very safe and just when you least expect it there is a castle/museum to explore.

Barcelona, out of season. Spent a few days before Christmas shopping in Barcelona, out of the tourist high season but still with plenty of hussel and bussel and loads of thinks to do as well as shopping. As you would expect, all the large department stores plus hundreds more small ones for something different at excellent prices in the gothic area. Loads of narrow alleyways to explore as you soak up the history of the area. Stayed at the Petit Palace Garden Hotel excelent rates for a couple and friendly accomodating staff. Special diet breakfasts served with no fuss, with a good selection. Being placed just a few metres from the spectacular Les Ramblas you have easy access to bars and restaurants galore. Here are just a few places we tried and very much liked :- Workers Restaurant on wherelse than Workers Street, find it by walking up the Ramblas on the left, look out for a narrow street running diagonally of the Ramblas almost at the top, the restaurant is on the right approx 30 metres along the street. Amazing value - menu del dia, 4 courses, choice of 3 selections per course incl. wine or beer or soft drinks, water for a grand total of 11.50 euros, this is where the ordinary people of Barcelona eat. Get there when they open, 1 o clock in the afternoon, it fills up fast! Next try the tapas bar opposite the Theater Oprea House on the Ramblas. Look carefully for this one, you can easily walk past, its just a single glass door with a window on both sides, old in appearence. Step inside and go back to the early 1900s, excellent selection of food and beers at reasonable prices. And finally, KINO a small bar run by 2 of the most soft spoken Irish lads from Cork serving wholesome food and beers at good prices. Find KINO at Carrer Feslandia 23 up near the Unniversity. Visit their web site www.kinobcn.com Have a good time, we did!!

Great area!. We stayed in this area during our trip in March and it was so perfect! Lots of eateries and shops to explore! Plus it's very central so you are never a few minutes from any key attraction. Definitely recommend staying in this area.
Wander Those Streets !!. Spent the entire day just wandering in the Barri Gotic. So much to see and do !! You will love the shops, the cathedral, and restaurants.
Beautiful. Got to be seen first hand to appreciate and worth getting the bus tour to get a flavour and then hopping off when you want and this is prime spot.
Medieval streets. Loved just exploring the medieval streets. Found remains of a Roman temple and walls. A great selection of small shops and bars.
The nicest place of city. This place is really the most cozy in Barcelona. Small alleys with shops and restaurants. Buildings are old and impressive. It is nice to walk here without map

Loved it!. The Gothic Quarter is beautiful! It's well worth a walk through, plus a lot of the little bars/restaurants are much better than those offered on Las Ramblas (price and quality). Look into a free walking tour to really absorb some of the history.

A walk down medieval streets.. Narrow streets, lovely placas, coffee houses and old style Catalan tapas bars all winding around ancient buildings- very evocative.You can wander for hours through this ancient part of Barcelona. From Roman wall to medieval buildings you can almost hear the long gone voices of the previous inhabitants.
get a pic of the archway. Nice area that is near the cathedral. the architecture is very distinct for the area. Great walk around the outside of the church to see the cool architecture.
Excellent views. A must see for the traveller. Old and new mixed here, also some very interesting shops and little bars and resturants here. The place to go in the summer to cool off!"
Beautiful architecture.. Just a pleasurable walk around the Gothic area. Not far from the fruit market and just off the tourist La Rambla.

Great Place to visit for sights, shopping and eating. Loved this area, pedestrian streets, full of character. It has everything you could wish for, shops, restaurants and sights.
Get a good map, as it can be a little confusing.
It has the best Hat shop ever, Sombrereria, OBACH, Carrer del Call, quality all the way, no tourist junk.
Cool buildings. We visited this whilst we were visiting museums. really unusual and lots of little squares. Great if you want to get away from the mad crowds and try some great cafes.

Gothic Quarter. Did a free tour in this area. Small and confusing streets unless you have a good map or a local to show you around. All the architectural elements are so interesting and give a different perspective to the city beyond the Sagrada familia and Casa Batilo.
Nice place but. Full of pick pockets.. otwerwise worth of seeing.. somehow bit scary place because of narrow streets.
Historic. This is the best area of Barcelona. You get yourself in the real historic town, also nice little local restaurants tapas around
Must see in Barcelona. Barri Gothic and Sagrada Familia are 2 must see attractions in Barcelona. Stroll in narrow streets and enjoy the architecture.

Loose yourself. This is a great area to wander around. Crammed with bars and restaurants : be warned however you might not be able to find the same bar two nights running. Great to just explore the narrow streets or choose a bar and people watch.
Fantastic. A brilliant area to stroll around and see the fantastic old buildings and architecture. One of the better areas to visit.

Cool Places for Dinner. The Gothic Quarter is like Paris' Latin Quarter but, in my opinion, even hipper. There is an artsy vibe that still feels fresh. Even the graffitti is artisitic. Plan to eat on the later side. A lot of the local restaurants don't open until 7:30pm.

Barri Gotic. It's just a great area to explore and get lost in. With it's many narrow alleys, it's easy to spend a great deal of time there. There are some beautiful cathedrals with amazing architecture that you should go into, to appreciate the grandness of them. It has fun eclectic shops, great eateries of all kinds and you are likely to find street artists performing, that are really good. If you go to Barcelona, this is a must see.

Another world. Spend a day just wondering around and it's like you are transported back in time. Every street and alley more charming than the next. Plenty to do here, too: the cathedral, the Picasso museum, the Plaza Real are just a few. Have lunch at La Fonda.

Best Night in Barcelona. We very much enjoyed strolling the streets, alleys, and courtyards of the Gothic Quarter. There are a ton of restaurants and bars, indoor and/or outdoor places to eat, as well as street artists and entertainers, beautiful buildings and architecture, and an overall lively atmosphere. A great place for people watching.
Nice for a wander. Great place for exploring - tiny streets with yummy cafes, interesting buildings and great little artisan shops.

Easily the best part of Barcelona. Barcelona is a fantastic city offering the best of both city life and beach life...and the Barri Gotic is easily the best part.Street after street of stunning old architecture, boutique shops, patisseries and quirky tapas bars...it has the lot, and a surprising new square to discover is never far away! We'd absolutely love to own a flat in this area!Quick tip: See if you can hunt down Bubo, they do amazing cakes!
Just walk!. Enjoy your walking? Well this is the place! What a neat area to loose one self... Neat shops and wonderful tapa bars. Don't forget to look up at the buildings, they are amazing!

Lovely!. The Gothic Quarter (Barri Gotic) is a remarkably lovely old area in the heart of Barcelona. Fill of museums, churches, restaurants, bars, cafes, clubs, eateries, etc, it is the heart & soul of Barcelona. Always lively, this is the colourful, energetic, young & vivacious center of the city. For amazing architecture, wonderful nights out, interesting museums and for lots of incredible walks to discover this exceptional city - Barri Gothic is definitely a first choice. Most highly recommended!
Beautiful. The gothic quarter is jam packed with little tapas bars & narrow streets. We loved just getting lost amongst them
Great to wander and lose yourself. Mostly pedestrian, here you will find all sorts of shops and restaurants. Great place to lose one's self for a day.

Enjoyable for Walking Tour. We spend about 3 hours just walking this area where there are tourist sights as well as many small boutiques for shopping. There are also all types of eateries of all price ranges.
One of the nicest parts of Barcelona. The Gothic quarter is exquisite....historic, great shopping, wandering, eating and drinking. Don't miss it!
History. the barri gotic area is a must when visiting Barcelona - so much history, many cosy restaurants and small side streets to explore

This is what Barcelona is about. The history of the Gothic Quarter is amazing. It is truly unique in ambiance. Safe, clean, historic, and lovely. It is both a photographers and shoppers dream simultaneously. This is why you come to Barcelona. Throw out the map and wander for a while - enjoy the details here.
Recommend the walking tour. I recommend the walking tour of this area, very enlightening and makes you appreciate the city and it's history.

Plenty to see. Be prepared with a comfortable pair of shoes. You'll be walking a lot through this area. Plenty of sights to see in the Gothic area, especially if you are interested in architecture. Lots of nooks and crannies to explore too. A nice combination of old and new. You'll learn a lot about the history of the area, if you sign up for a walking tour.

what else to do??. here is old town, if you don't go there then why have you came to Barcelona??I liked waling there but I expected more. as a hint there is a cathedral in this area which is free and it worth the visit. in front of it also there is a food open air bazar which you can buy local foods and drink . it was best during my visit of this area. you may access it from end of the street which is in parallel with La Rambla

Truly lovely...profoundly historic in feel.. It's almost sinister, especially at night. You can practically hear the footsteps from a thousand years past on the narrow, winding streets. Just off the Cathedral you'll find the remnants of a Roman wall, and the entire area is dotted with interesting art and antique shops, as well as great little spots to stop for a drink and a bite to eat. We went to this area almost every day and never tired of it. One evening we found a hidden courtyard with a fountain and it was absolutely magical. Enjoy! Let the streets take to where they might - you never know what you'll discover.
Great fun. Enjoyed getting lost in the beautiful streets and stores. Easy to find things to see or buy or eat. Authentic place with nice people.

Small stores and a lot of ambiance. The Gothic Quarter of Barcelona is one of those neighborhoods with small alleys to get lost in. There are many touristy shops here, but also some cool boutiques and crafts stores.

Endulge in old times. It is worth while being in Barcelona to stroll around the Gotic quarter.
Bring along more time to really enjoy the sights. Unfortunately i did not have enough time, will come back again.

Best part of the city. Wow, what an amazing part of the city, all the small streets, with very modern stores and full of people. My favourite part, it never seems to end, amazing open areas with restaurants, amazing!

Walk & Wander. One of the great joys of visiting an old European city is to walk and enjoy the architecture, small shops and old buildings. This area exceeds expectations with it's charming streets. Take your time and make sure you visit during the day to be able to see all of the details.

Get Ready to Walk!. Every single street in itself is an experience. Walk it off! Sit down have a café, get up, keep walking, sit down have a glass of Verdejo, get up, keep walking, take pictures, buy something, sit down have a glass of Rueda and a tapa, get up......repeat. Enjoy!!!

Little and very small streets to get lost for some hours. You can stroll through the history in this part of the town. Some streets are very narrow that daylight can't come through. Many little shops with interestings things to buy.

A great place to stay for its trip to Barcelona. This is the absolute best location for visiting Barcelona for the first time . . . or the second . . . or the third. Charming old quarter. Everything you would want to see here is within walking distance.
Wonderful street walking. The streets are a fantastic way to take in the beauty of the city. There is so much to see that you should allow several hours to take it all in.

explore it by night, especially full moon nights. by far one of my favourite places in barcelona; i am a huge horror film, mid evil fantasy monster fan and this part of town. Barri Gotico is like a trip to disneyland for people like me.During the day, you see many tourist's, locals wandering the streets - taking picture of the architecture or the beauty of the streets, the life that is around during the day time. At night its a whole another crowed, such a cool place to be when it's for example full moon... many alley's and streets in area are great spots for full moon picture,the gothic atmosphere gives it such interesting character. There's many cool book shops and little stores that u'll find there too, take a few hours of the day or night and explore the streets, have coffee - chat with locals about history of the Barri Gotic. Its a must see of Barcelona....
Lovely walk. Would recommend to have a little walk around and enjoy the unique architecture. It was also interesting to see the distinct personality of this quarter of Barcelona.
Going back in time. It's like going back in time. The place is just amazing and really interesting. lovely walk around and just taking time to feel the place.
Great to just wander in the streets.. Great surprises as you walk around - interesting small shops, sights, food halls/markets, street life. Loved it!

A step back in time!. What an amazing section of the city and a must to see. A walk through the narrow streets felt like I was transported back in time. The Gargoyles that graced the buildings were haunting to see. The architecture was priceless, to actually stand and touch the stone walls and to see the size of the doors, wow. Take the time to tour the Church and pay the fee, you will not see anything like it. I read about the Gothic Quarter but until you walk it and feel the history of this wonderful city you will come to understand history at its finest.

Excellent place to wander. No destination required - just wander the alleys, streets, and plazas taking in the variety of shops & little restaurants. Take a tour during the day & one at night to experience the differences - good for family, too.

Simply a must. To walk through the Gothic Quarter is to walk through time and history. Well done Barcelona for holding on to your history and making it available to all your people and visitors.Note however you have to pay to go into the church. I know it must cost a lot to keep up but even if you want to pray it still costs.

A must visit. Fabulous in all senses. Nice streets, stores, tapas bars, Picasso Museum, Santa Maria del Mar cathedral,..., perfect place to enjoy by getting lost in its streets. Also, didn't feel any safety issues.
Fun place to know. It's easy to get the from Pl. Cataluña, and you have to see the ambience as it's a different Barcelona in Barcelona
Only if you like architecture.... It wasn't really my thing. I didn't eat here. The Ajuntament is beautiful on the inside as is La Cathedral. These are the only two things I liked about this area.

beautiful but a bit unsettling at night. the buildings, alleyways and squares are stunning but at night it is very busy and there are loads of beggars and prostitutes towards Las Ramblas in the alleyways, try El Born instead, just feet apart and same style but much more relaxed atmosphere, it's where all the locals go.

One of a kind. If you like browsing, shopping, food, or just random strolling around, this is a nice area. Lots of narrow streets between centuries-old buildings, one-of-a-kind shops, and inexpensive restaurants. There are also some very nice hotels converted from some old buildings as well.

Narrow ways feed the imagination. While modern and funky in feel this area feeds the imagination and my thoughts easily turned back to medieval times when the layout was first established. Many small shops and cafes.

Classic. Loved the lovely old streets, all the architecture of the lovely old buildings. Went into lovely churches where the history was visible everywhere, lovely area for a visit and a stroll around. Lovely just to sit in the sun and daydream.
Very interesting. With the Cathedral in the centre and with plenty of good restaurants a short walk from La Rambla would be a shame not to visit.
Great Location. Wonderful architecture, lots of history & a bohemian atmosphere. Don't miss it if you like taking photos & try visiting both day & night to capture all it has to offer.

A great place to stroll for an hour or two. Barcelona's Gothic quarter is a step back in time. Narrow streets,plenty of interesting shopping, some gelato here and there. Worth a visit, not to be missed.
Wonderful. Just Wonderful, amazing architecture in all the area,lovely cafes, great tipical food and friendly people!

Loved this area!. Take time and walk around all the quaint little streets, pop in for a tapas here and there trying all different types of foods, be sure to visit the Museum of History with the under ground Roman city they discovered. Walk through the old Cathedral and up and down all the little old streets. Take your time and enjoy the beauty of the old buildings. Enjoy!
Lovely area. Nice little roads with old gothic buildings, little restaurants, bakeries and shops. Nice place to take a stroll before or after la rambla.
Unique. An area so different, so unexpected close to Las Ramblas. A place full of history, unique atmosphere with perfect alleys and narrow streets.

Fascinating. Great day spent exploring, lots of great little shops, something new to see round every corner. Lovely little cafes and restaurants to sit and relax in, and my favourite, the market, perhaps the best market I've ever been in, but beware the prices - not cheap, but fantastic quality food stuffs.

Be safe. This was my second trip to Barca and each time we have stayed in the Barri Gotic area. The city has a reputation for pickpockets and crime so i thought i would share my thoughts. If you are victim of crime it will most likely be non violent, ie it will be some while before you realise that your pocket has been picked. Whilst walking back to the flat at 1am a man walked towards me asked me the time, i told him and then he raised his had towards mine to shake my hand and as i went to respond i realised that the situation was going to develop into something i couldn't control so i simply ignored the handshake and walked the opposite way. I had gone a few feet and there was a second man waiting in the shadow of some bushes. I carried on walking and looked back and waited for them both to move on. Before i had gone out for the night i made sure all my cards and most cash were not on me. I was going to the Harlem Jazz Club and there had been some thefts there so i just had cash for the night. Sometimes i would stow certain things in the hood of my coat, thieves will normally go for back pockets of trousers and inside jacket pockets.So travel light, leave bling at home, head down and keep walking, stop for no one and avoid distractions. Have a great time, we did.

Something you´ve never seen before. Ok now i´m going to try to explain my experience in gothic quarter. First, people are sorrounded by a peaceful atmosphere, where you can be what ever you wanted to be. I mean, is like everything is available.And this is not about a place in particular, is EVERYTHING. The food, the clothes, persons, dogs, streets, hair style hahaha, bar, gelato stores, etcPlease, dont use my opinion like a bible, Im sure you´ve a lot of details to notice when you get here! So dont missed for nothing!!!

Our Barcelona favourite. We loved the Gothic quarter. The character and history of the place with it's narrow streets and alleyways harks back to medieval times. Fabulous and lots of choice with Bodegas and restaurants aplenty,
architectural must. Visited museums around gothic quarter loads to see with spectacular history. Well set up for visitors

Lovely to wander around and soak in the atmosphere.. A really interesting historical area, little shops, coffee bars, historical buildings. Great to just potter around and soak in the atmosphere.You could spend hours here. On a hot day, it will be really cool too since the streets are narrow and dark, you really feel that you have stepped back in time.

HISTORICAL QUARTER!. Walking through the narrow streets of this historical gothic quarter is a fabulous experience. Most of the Barcelona attractions influenced by the great architect Antoni Gaudi's works, but this area is post Gaudi period Barcelona! Ancient walls, churches, etc fascinating everyone. Worth a visit.

Lots of history and lovely shops. This is such a fascinating place to go and be. There are so many traditional restaurants, shops, markets, and bakeries that are not in the travel guides. I found a wonderful place to buy some earrings for my sisters and I. A must see and discover.
Nice district for a stroll. Don't miss Placa Reial and Placa Del Rei. Just stroll and allow yourself to get lost. There are lots of surprises.
Lovely. Wonderful to stroll around and enjoy the architecture. One of my preferred Quarters. It feels less touristy as the streets a tiny. It's close to the sea. Very safe.

LOVE the Barri Gotic!!!!. We just loved the Barri Gotic! Every time you take a turn, there's something new and cool to see! Everything is very close and easy to walk to, and so charming! There are tons of historical sites - from Roman all the way up through time. Great shopping and restaurants, too. Tons of atmosphere - just wander and explore!

Really liked this little maze of streets. Recently spent a few days in Barcelona and have to say the Gothic Quarter was great.Reminded me a little of York with its maze of small streets with little hidden cafes and restaurants.Just a little less busy than the main drag of Las Ramblas and a nice change.Have a wander and get lost in the streets here, you never know what you will find!

Great area to visit. Lots of quaint and delicious tapas bars and restaurants. Great shopping and a great environment. The cathedral close by is unbelivable and the ambience around it is great. Try all the little streets that run through it as you'll be delighted to find delicious churros, great bookstores. There is definitely something for everyone. Great overall ambience

Strange and stinky . Well,it's a must to visit wile you're in Barcelona to feel the atmosphere of this district .. There are different narrow streets,some of them have shops , cafés, hotels,with people walking , but some of them has only closed doors with graffiti , nearly empty,and really stinky as it seams that these streets are used as toilets all the time..

A wonderful area to visit. The gothic quarter is fascinating and there are many bars and restaurants in the narrow streets offering good food at sensible prices. After touring Barcelona by hop on tour buses we would suggest it is one area not to miss.

Don't be afraid to get lost in the narrow streets. The place is very different from the rest of the city. Very tranquill, full of ancient architecture, churches and bassilicas. Also, on a hot day, it is the place to enjoy the shadow.Do not be afraid to get lost. This way, you will find hidden treasures of the quarter.

Close to La Ramblas. If you are walking around La Ramblas make sure you veer off and check out the Gotic section. While La Ramblas is full of action and loads of more modern-day buildings, Gotic section has way more character! Narrow streets that give you that old European feel. Plenty of restaurants and shops.
Beauty and entertainment. Be mindful of pick pockets but it's stunning and historicalYou should add this to your Barcelona to-do list.

Fantastic walking tour! The highlight of our trip.. Stories and Legends of the Gothic Quarter Walking Tour was a definite highlight of our trip. This was a 2.5+ hour walking tour through the medieval neighborhood, including El Call, which was home to one of Spain’s largest Jewish communities until the 15th century. The legends our phenomenal guide Ana told us as we walked the cobbled streets were enchanting! http://www.viator.com/tours/Barcelona/Stories-and-Legends-of-the-Gothic-Quarter-Walking-Tour/d562-5574GOTHIC

Medieval spirit of contemporary city. Gothic Quarter (Barri Gotic) is the part of Barcelona to see as must. Quarter will charm you from the first step and no matter will enter it from Las Ramlas or from Via Laietana, from Placa de Catalunya or Passeig de Colom. You will walk it though and come back again. Every time you will discover something new. Walking sightseeing tour with professional guide can give the historic information and common overview. Just come back again and you will find the magic of this place.
Half open half closed.. Nice winding streets but many shops closed and the ones open were mostly filled with tourist tack.Some very nice squares with cafes and restaurants around the peripheries.

A treasure around every corner. This area is fabulous, it's a complete maze and easy to get lost in but it's small so you're never too far from the main streets. It is full of amazing little shops that you don't find in other cities with really gorgeous tapas bars and historical sites that don't get a mention in a guide book but shouldn't be missed.

Very old, beautiful, and unique part of Barcelona!. We spent a week at a small apartment in this area. We loved it so much we are going back again this spring. We spent many hours walking around the area, down narrow alleys, into small shops, dining at small restaurants tucked into old, old buildings. We never knew what we would come across when we went down another street or alley. Early mornings and evenings were very special with the lighting and fewer people on the streets. The architecture is spectacular whether you wanted to just observe or take hundreds of photos. I think I took about 300 photos!! The larger squares by churches were full of people (spring time brings many high school spanish class tour groups!!!!!) sitting, wandering, eating. We felt safe wandering up and down streets. We were warned about pick pockets so we took note and wandered around with money zipped into pockets or in safe places.
Great stroll back in time. There are cute stores, great architecture. My only regret is walking around late so some of the stores were closed. I would visit during the day.

Perfect atmosphere. This barrio is beautiful, there are free opera and classical music performances in the streets, amazing food, perfect Gothic architecture. Without doubt, this quartier contributed to my opinion Barcelona as the best city. It is also a very romantic place.

secrets around every quarter. some incredible restaurants are hidden in this maze of alleys just explore and let your senses guide you. If you like Jazz look out for the Harlem Jazz Club will worth a visit

walk around and look up. good area to walk around and sample some of the architecture then try one of the small bars that are dotted in the tiny streets.round each corner there is another intresting view and aspects of city life.. amble around and enjoy

just wander. wandered around for hours upon hours from tapas bar to tapas bar!! great area to sit back and take in the spanish love of food and wine..eveyone chatting and joking and busy with their lives. beautiful cobbled alleyways hung with washing and busy with locals doing their everyday business

Stepping back in time. The Gothic Quarter is like stepping back in time to the 16th-17th century. The architecture is classic and the buildings are well maintained. There are ample sidewalk cafes and small stores to buy everything from jewelry to hats. If people watching are your game, then this is the place. We were looking for the Picasso museum and wandered through these streets with awe. We stopped at a small cafe for some mid day tapas. They were delicious and the wines and beers superb. I would highly recommend this area of Barcelona.

Smell of urine and gypsies. I will remember this area as habitat of dodgy people and smell of urine. Maybe it used to be a nice historic place but now it looks and smells more like slums. I was in summer though, maybe in other seasons it stinks less. I would not go there after dark as I didn't feel safe during daytime (I generally felt very safe in Spain just not in that one spot).

Loved this place!. Such an interesting place to visit! From the Cathedral to the little tapas bars to the wonderful shops it's an absolute must for visitors to Barcelona. And it's so much bigger than it sounds or certainly than I expected. Lots of little alleys and side streets amongst the historical buildings and squares. Don't miss it!

The best area in Barcelona for socialising. Gorgeous restaurants, bars, shops, bakeries around every corner. So steeped in history with impressive churches and architecture. Can be a it noisy at night so wouldn't stay in this area.

Amazing Buildings. Everywhere you looked had something to see it was fantastic. Lots of photo opportunities, great getting lost in back alleys and discovering some antiquity. dont do it at night time.

Stepping back in time. You can walk for hours on end across the many intertwining narrow paved paths of the Gothic Quarter. There are lots of shops, restaurants and our favourite haunts- ice cream parlours. Many of the buildings have beautiful facades. Important to amble leisurely and savour the scenery
Valentines weekend. A very interesting area to wander round to see the architecture with lots of streets going off each other.
A treat awaits you at every corner. Don't miss a visit to Placa del Rei to learn about roman Barcino. Some terrific tapas restaurants/ bars.

Simply Amazing.. This is a place you can not miss when you go to Barcelona. It encompasses a great deal of buildings from the Roman times through the Medieval, Renaissance and Baroque era in the city. It is an area full of history and very well preserved.
Amazing. I spent a sunny afternoon walking around here, great shops, cafe's and obviously, the buildings are amazing.

Give yourself time, and don´t hesitate to get lost!. The Gothic Quarter is a charming, interesting part of Barcelona, which over the last few years has turned into a cultural melting pot. Give yourself plenty of time, don´t set a specific route, and don´t hesitate to get lost. Find a nice café terrace, soak up the sun, and watch the world go by. You will be suprised!

A medieval city with authentic life.. There are many medieval cities in Europe, and many of these sadly exist now only as tourist destinations, with nearly all of their stores dedicated to the medievalness of the town. They are filled with souvenir shops peddling little swords and shields, or post cards, or other things dedicated to the past. The Barrio Gotico is different. It is a legitimate city, alive and vibrant, with markets that sell real produce to real residents who do normal things, like go to school, work as plumbers or taxi drivers... All in buildings that date back centuries. As you walk through the crowded streets, you get a sense of the thousands of residents who have passed before, and unlike Rome, or Rothenburg om de Tauber, or Carcasonne, or other cities with a cumbersome presence of history, the Bario Gotico has a sense of future as well, fueled with Catalán pride and demonstrated in the myriad hip and fresh little shops, bars, cafés, and restaurants.
Barri Gotic.... Fascinating area of Barcelona with many narrow streets and lanes to explore. Interesting small shops and restaurants. A visit to the cathedral cannot be missed.
Fantastic Building great shopping good food. Fantastic Building great shopping good food if you go to Barcelona you will spend most of your time here

Great location.. Stayed in the Gothic Quarter during a stay in Barcelona. Found it really convenient when needing to get to other parts of the city, quite central and easy to walk to many places. On a second trip, I stayed somewhere else; bitterly regretted that! If I were to go again, I'd definitely stay in the Gothic Quarter. It would be my first choice.

A little maze. Have a wander through the little narrow streets and you'll find some unusual little shops, bars, tapas, as well as other random places to eat. Most of it has such a nice relaxing atmosphere with lots of people taking in the lovely architecture. It does feel like a maze but all the little streets eventually lead to a main route, with many little surprises on the way.There are, however a few quieter streets which make you feel a little uneasy, probably more to do with hearing about pick pockets in Barcelona but overall it's a pleasant walk and a bit of an insight into how and where the locals live.

Stunning area with great architecture and quaint buildings. Walking around the narrow streets of the Gothic Quarter is certainly a visual extravaganza. There are so many little narrow streets with every building having its' own individual style. Interspersed in these are a plethora of bars, cafes, and churches. Every step you take requires a swivel head to try and capture the ever changing vista before, around, and even behind you. Some places have a different perspective depending on the angle you view them from. Visually stimulating, and also good for the soul as you wander and meander through the labyrinth of streets. Was one of the highlights of my short trip to Barcelona, and I will return to do it justice next time, by devoting a lot more time to seeing it properly.

Wonderful place. Great area just to wander around and discover new things. Interesting shops, small cafes, and fascinating architecture. You never know what's around the corner in this area. Contrary to some reviews, never felt like it was scary, even at night. There are numerous poorly lit back alleyways, though, so at night a little caution would be warranted.

Be sure to check out the Gothic Quarter. North of Las Rambas you can find the oldest part of Barcelona. Dating back to Roman times , the original settlement of Barcelona was situated here. Most of the buildings date back to the late Middle Ages and later centuries. The area is full of restaurants, bistros and shops as well as homes.  The streets are narrow and winding so it's easy to get lost. Bus tours can not negotiate these small streets so you have to do it on foot. I would suggest that you start at La Ramblas and head north or start in the north at Plaça Sant Jaume Metro stop and head south. There is a midieval church and a few museums to see near Placa Sant Juame as well as a wax museum just off of La Ramba.  The shops are small and interesting. There are some cars and motorcycles so you do have to be aware of what's going on around you . The food offered here is different from what you find in tourist areas like La Rambla. There is more choice and often the prices are better.  I picked up a pastry and a banana for my breakfast one evening here. . It's cheaper than a hotel breakfast and just as nice.  There are bars and nightclubs but we did not go into any of them so I can't say what they are like. I would suggest spending 2 or 3 hours wandering around in the late afternoon and having supper there before it gets dark. After dark it's harder to figure your way out of the area.  I would say that the Gothic Quarter is well worth the visit.
Marvellous hidden gem. The little alleyways opened up and here was a wounderful square filled with sunshine and sculptures. Lots of little shops gaudi shop and cathedral well worth a visit

Going back in time. Coming up from the metro and was taken back by all the history and beautiful architecture. The first time we went there were some local people in what I'm guessing was the center of the Gothic Quarter and they were holding some kind of rally against child abuse. It was the day of the Barca vs Villarreal game so we saw many people everywhere sporting some sort of FC Barcelona apparel. I tried to close my eyes and imagine how it was back in the day. There are many shops and restaurants with great food to offer. I recommend that you make some time to visit this area.

Barcelona back in time some centuries. Spend one morning or afternoon visiting its small streets, bars, churches, old shops and enjoy understanding how Barcelona was back in time and why it grew to what it is today.

Very cool. If your into ancient buildings and enjoy getting wisked back in time this is for you. We walked the old streets for a couple of hours and popped into some of the old shops. Well worth the time.

Love to get lost into the narrow streets. Always be aware of peak poquets !
Nice to walk arraund and stop and drink a glass looking people routin...

Go, but hold tight to your belongings!. You'd really have to wander these narrow streets and walkways 100s of times to ever be able to really see every eye-catching, beautiful window, door, archway, building facade, sculpure, etc. Walking through the Barri Gótic, as the locals call it, and the Born, is the best way to capture the essence of old Barcelona. Not to mention the most economical. That is unless you stop in a few of the endless bar/restaurants, eclectic giftshops, unique clothing or shoe boutiques or delectable bakeries/pastry shops/chocolatiers. Which you should. Have a beer and a couple of tapas in between each of those new shoes, hat, jacket or dress...
Stunning!. Lovely area. I especially loved the cathedral. I highly recommend doing the Rick Steves Barri Gotic Walk. It covers all the important sites and gives nice overview of the history.

Beautiful stone carvings in Gothic Quarter. Pedestrianised area makes it very easy area to wander round and marvel at the old buildings, stone gargoyles and carvings. Amazing that it has stood the test of time. A must see in the city centre.
A favourite. Went back and forth in the center of Barcelona, but Gothic quarter is definitely one of the favors. Great architecture and amazing buildings,

Just walking around. Nerrow streets some crowded some quite. Boutique stores and eat places. Atmosphere of an old European city. Beautiful place. Go by day and by night - it looks like a different place.
a surprise around each corner. Very interesting lots of alley ways and shops. Seems to be a safe area during the day. Great architecture, surprises around each corner. Worth a few hours wandering.

One of my favourite parts of Barcelona. This is where you can get lost all through the meandering streets and Tapas Bars of Barcelona. Work your self away from the tourist trap of La Rambla, through the Gothic Quarter, and toward the more discerning area of Borne where you will find the best restaurants and bars.
So much to see. Just wander around and discover beautiful buildings, gorgeous shops, food and more. Wonderful narrow alley ways full of history.

Amazing place!. Such a great place to walk around and take in the city. Ate at a place called Caputxes which was very good. Took the Sandemann's New Europe tour around which was cool. Loved the area. So much design in the old city part of town. The small narrow streets and the Gothic building were a sight to see.

Stunning and scary at times. The amount of graffiti is always a shock
Pimps intimidating, great to see but not so happy at night
Bars better elswhere

Picturesque and pleasing. Nice historic neighborhood, picturesque during the day and festive at night. Don't miss the impressive cathedral (you can go inside for free) and the palaces around it. It's also nice to just stroll around and admire the street artists' performances.
Takes you back in time!. Its a very beautiful neighboorhood, very particular edifications, very clean place and lots of pubs and restaurants to visit, very close to la rambla!
Lovely small streets. We had great time exploring this part of city with our rented bikes. It is winter season, so some shops and bars were closed.
2scdrifters. Beautiful buildings, great little alleys to explore, small family restaurants. Kept very clean by the municipality. we always felt safe even late at night returning from a flamenco show.

Must see. This is probably one of the greatest places on earth to feel like you have stepped back in time. At night the area just glows as if there were magical waves of fairy dust floating over centuries old buildings and winding alley ways. Have a few drinks and some fabulous tapas and get lost finding your way from pub to pub.

The heart of Barcelona. Barcelona would not be itself without the Barri Gotic. Easily accessible through La Rambla, the medieval streets and small squares can take you back in time. These old streets remind me a bit of the "calle" of Venice, they just pull you in deeper and deeper and invite you to wander aimlessly in them. From Placa Sant Josep Oriol to the streets surrounding the Cathedral, you can continue on to Santa Maria del Mar and Passeig del Born, which belongs to another quarter (Born). The point is to lose yourself in these charming streets, there will be many interesting shops, cafes, and sights for you to explore along the way. It will also be a nice surprise to see some local and "avant-garde" designs shops against a backdrop of Roman and medieval Barcelona.

A lot to see and do. The gothic quarter is a fascinating area of tiny streets, workshops, really nice local shops and architectural / historical houses and sites. To get the best from it, you have to do a walking tour with an expert. You will love getting lost, finding a bar, having a meal, buyimg some locally made stuff.

Wonderful experience. Loved every minute of our day trips through Barcelona. We walked, took taxis and used the tour buses. Went all the way to the beach and walked through a major shopping precinct. Barcelona is cool, sophisticated and trendy. Have to look around for bargains though cause some stores can be pretty pricey even for small items such as a pair of flip flops.

Very crowded and more commercialized. The streets are old but the shops are new. You can find every name brand in the world you can recall here. It is sad that commercialism has transform this old neighborhood into a walking mall district just like any other big shopping malls. There are many tourists, even in the cold season. I am not sure if I would come back again.

A must see location in Barcelona. This is an old part of Barcelona with narrow streets and Roman history. Great atmosphere for wandering round, with a number of tourist sights to see, including the Cathedral, and Roman ruins.

A fascinating day exploring. It didn't feel like a tourist attraction,the narrow cobbled streets were lined with shops stalls and restaurants.the buildings themselves were fascinating a living museum.

History, narrow streets.... Wonderful area in Barcelona where you can find wonderful buildings and hide corners. Plaza Real is a must! Full of shops, restaurants, bars...The Barri Gothic its a fun and very lively area. I would not recommend it to sleep there because this area can be noisy at night. You can stay better in el Eixample or in el Born. Barcelona is an amazing city!

Get thee to the Gothic Quarter. The Gothic Quarter is the old, gorgeous part of the city of Barcelona. It's great to wander in and out of the alleys and curving streets to see the fabulous old architecture. We have heard incredible Spanish music being played out on the streets of this ancient section of Barcelona. There are plenty of people, restaurants, and cafes to relax in.

Loved the architecture and history here.. Our family enjoyed a quick tour of the gothic quarter. The history and architecture are amazing. Don't miss the Ancient Synagogue and its wonderful collection inside.
Always worth a visit. I love this part of Barcelona. So much history and some very quaint shops with food to die for. Another great visit.

a suprise at every street corner. give yourself about 1 1/2hrs to follow street guides. Don't forget to look up occassionally from your map as you will miss the beautiful details that these streeets bring.
nice lifestyle and culture. Enjoy the "old" Buildings at Barcelona and the special flair arround it. Take some nice pictures and see the lifestyle mix in it of modern and gothic.

A walk through history..with lots of restaurants !. A great part of town ! Lots to interest most people. Full of a tapas bars and restaurants . A good place to visit and an even better part of town to stay .

Walking tours a must. This whole area is beautiful, and contains everything you need from cafes and shops to history and architecture. I took a free tour with Runner Bean tours, which was a fantastic way to get to know the area - they mapped out our route so that I could find my way around later. It's also really close to Parc de la Ciutadella, so pick up lunch in the Gothic Quarter then sit by the lake for a really peaceful afternoon among the locals!
Gothic Quarter. Lots of narrow lanes opening out on to plazas with bars and cafes.Loads of nice building to see and shops to browse through
Augut restaurant. A hidden gem in the Gothic quarter. Superb food, very Spanish with good value prices. Would recommend.

Unique and breathtaking . This place is just like stepping into the medieval times, everywhere you look there is some stunning marvel of architecture or picturesque narrow cobbled street. Worth a stroll, and there are plenty of places to pick up a Spanish pastry or three. Don't leave Barcelona without strolling through the area.
Stunning architecture!. Wow, what beautiful buildings! Gargoyles everyone, so intact and beautiful! One of the best bits of Barcelona so far! Outstanding.
feel free to go lost. put the map aside and wander through the small streets , lovely shops and cafe's . the heart of the city
Like walking back in time. A wonderful place to take a stroll. Wonderful architecture,great restaurants and interesting side streets to explore.

Suggestive. This district of Barcelona is very suggestive: I've been there for one week and I wanted to stay.
It's full of history and ancient buildings.
A must to do when in Barcelona. Small street in the center of the city with the feeling of being in the "old Barcelona". Many small shops and bars and a nice walking experience very near Ramblas.

Just waunder, get lost, stop and live it!. From Roman walls (even a possible temple to Augustus) and still discernable ruins to more evident medieval buildings and 18th century palaces, you can spend days in the "Gótico". This really still is a neighborhood in many ways, with bars, restaurants, wonderful boutiques of all sorts, antiquarians museums, street life with an incredible mixture of cultures and languages, jazz clubs, magnificent churches (Santa María del Mar is an absolute gothic jewel). Just walking around provides constant discovery and delight. Do yourself a favor and take your time to savor.
My favourite bit of Barcelona. Stayed very near. Wondered the streets for days. Excellent bars, restaurants and shops. Full of atmosphere and things to discover. A must visit when in Barcelona.
Beautiful. The cathedral was free to enter and is breathtaking inside, well worth a visit! The narrow streets surrounding are very interesting and pretty too.

Old, interesting and eccentric. Spent a few hours wandering around, found good bars and restaurants as well as some very interesting and unusual shops. Stay away from the La Rambla as that is crowded and not interesting comparatively
Interesting. Quaint old streets. Excellent to visit during the winter months, perhaps very hot to visit during the summer.

Gothic Area Barcelona. We wandered into this area and although it clearly has it's tourist attractions and beautiful buildings it is lovely to pick your way through some of the smaller streets and uncovering a little gem or two. Lots of little Nic nak shops mixed with the odd museum. Definitely worth a visit and only two minutes walk from Las Ramblas.

Just one of those places you have to visit in Barcelona. Nice to walk through, like stepping into the past.
The church is nice. The market is nice too.
Just one of those places you have to visit in Barcelona
Must see. A beautiful area to walk around...we've left Barcelona with stunning photos of the Gothic Quarter. Can't wait to go back!

Definitely should walk down this place. We were staying in the vicinity and I think the walk around the place is really nice. Small quaint lanes and small eating joints and bars and pubs. I think you should go there and see the place.
Wonderful for wandering around. I had a wonderful time wandering around and shopping here. The architecture is very beautiful. Make sure to buy ice cream.

Great place to see and wander round.. Well worth walking round. Not much more I can say that hasn't already been said. Great for families, friends and teenagers - and solo if you're backpacking alone (plenty of dorms nearby).
Ancient!. Its right in the heart of the city and such a beautiful place to just stroll down and enjoy your time in the narrow alleyways!
Nice. Cathedral is the much see things one should plan... You will find Roman architecture preserved ... very close to sea and shopping area.
Impressive atmosphere. Unforgettable experience of the walking in the narrow streets of the Old Barcelona! Especially early in the morning or in the late afternoon.
Walking Shoes. You can loose a whole day just walking around, lots and lots of Tappers from expensive to cheap so wear a good pair of shoes as you can walk for MILES.
a great area to wander and explore. Rainy day so we wandered the Barri for a few hours. You never know what each corner brings. Just a great spot to be a tourist and explore.

Wandering around in the Gothic Quarter. Must do while in Barcelona! Spend at least 1 day walking around in the old town. Look up, look around, you will see amazing structures, paintings on doors, people standing on their balconies. You will hear music, you may see movie in the making. Sit for awhile when you're tired, but absorbed as much as possible. I think this place makes Barcelona.
we should literally GET LOST INTO it. The Barri Gòtic retains a labyrinthine street plan, with many small streets opening out into squares. Go with patience and enjoy as much as possible ;)

Fantastic. Take the time to lose yourself in the middle of the Gotic quarter. Colorful and various shops, small typical streets, restaurants and bars, piece of art everywhere, beautiful monuments, it was my favourite area in Barcelona, do not miss it and if you can , find an accommodation / hotel in this area
Free walking tour. you can walk around the area yourself but for great in depth information do take one of the free walking tours

Love this area. I could not go to Barcelona without visiting this area -- have stayed here twice and will again -- so much to offer with shopping and tapas bars there is almost no need to go anywhere else!

Charming old world quarter. We stayed in a gorgeous little apartment in Plaza Sant Josep right in the heart of the Barri Gotic. Far enough off La Rambla to avoid the crowds and hassle and bustle but plenty of shopping and attractions within walking distance or via the metro. A vibrant area full of gorgeous little designer boutiques and eateries. Walked around the area at night without any sense of unease.

So Intresting. This is a fascinating district with so many different styles of architecture to see from the original roman walls, to mediveal b uidlings along widning streets with so many quaint shops to discover

BreathTaking. Regardless of the season this is not to be missed.
On a January afternoon the waterfront was in the fifties.
The hopnstop bus costs under 20 euros per person and can be used all day/ eve.
Picture taking is a must
Beware tourists and their annoying selfie sticks!!!

charming. perfect for a stroll any time of the day. Lovely narrow streets that take you a few centuries back in time, plenty of small shops with just about everything, tapas bars, cafes, pubs... I loved just walking around and getting lost in the old labirynths, especially at night when it came to live with all the pubs and bars open.

Quaint. Loved walking around the Gothic quarter. The streets are quaint and you have a feel of history. There are a lot of nice shops for shoes and handbags and you do not feel as harassed as when walking on Las Ramblas.

Watch Out. Beautiful area to walk, and feels very safe even at night. We found a great restaurant there. I started to let my guard down, after a few days. Then, upon exiting the Metro train at Catalunya station, I was surrounded by a team of pickpockets and held in place for a few seconds until they went through my pockets. Please make sure that your valuables are buried deeply inside your clothes.

Eclectic Neighbourhood. Lots of museums, shops, tapas bars at night, chocolate and pastry shops, art galleries, churches, the university and narrow alleys and streets make for an entertaining time strolling through this very old neighbourhood. Take a cue form the locals and step into a pastry shop for sweet pastries/chocolate and coffee about 5 PM. You won't feel the need to rush out for dinner much before 9 PM when the tapas bars start to get going.
Barri Gotic. a-ma-zing! Just sad because I didnt want to pay to enter the Cathedral! If you go, please do it for me :)

Typical Mediterranean atmosphere.. Like other people are saying, just go here and get lost among the narrow charming streets. Wonder in and out of shops and do try a tapa or pincho in the area. When you finally want to emerge from this beautiful ancient area, there will be a metro station not too far away.

Go Before It's All Boutique Hotels. This fast changing historic center of Barcelona still offers glimpses into the past. Many small unique shops with handcrafted merchandise you won't find back home. Unfortunately the Quarter is undergoing rapid change with souvenir stands replacing one of a kind shops and family apartments being converted into chic flats.
Great neighborhood to explore. Had fun wandering, popping into shops. Interesting churches. Great food! Visited early December - no crowds, lovely for wandering.

pretty awesome, should go with a guide. Gothic Quarters is an area where the buildings from centuries ago were preserved. I felt like I traveled back in time walking through the narrow streets. The pictures doesn't do justice to how beautiful this place is.There were many attractions within Gothic Quarter, museums, churches, plazas and the city hall.We went to Museu Frederic Mares, where it housed hundreds of sculptures and collections. I was truly impressed. Admission was free when we went on Sunday.http://w110.bcn.cat/portal/site/MuseuFredericMares?lang=en_GBhttp://teenalareina.blogspot.ca/2015/01/must-see-places-in-barcelona.html

Hide your map and get lost in this charming quarter!. Amazing, charming area! Don't be afraid to be lost, this place is really worth to explore!!! Visit it in daylight, than in late evening - you'll get two different experiences. Book a tour if you want to know more about this quarter. I suggest a free "Runner bean" walking tour "old city". We really liked it, and it is free of charge! Of course you can leave any amount of tips at the end of it if you liked. Highly recommended tour!
Beautiful. It's worth getting lost walking around the gothic quarter. The shops, the food and the architecture will keep you occupied for an entire day!!

Wander at leisure, be prepared for surprises. Wandering around here you can have nice surprises, and disappointing ones, too. A wonderful find was Restaurante Grill Room at Calle dels Escudellers, 8. We had a quiet lunch here with friends. The food and wine was great, not too expensive and the decor is authentic - lots of art nouveau style wood, mirrors and an upstairs area for quieter eating.

Great place for a stroll. Loved wandering around these little narrow streets, filled with interesting and unusual little shops and bars, definitely a must see whilst in barcelona. Did not feel uneasy or unsafe at all, there was a great atmosphere, found the best time was after 6 pm when a lot of the locals are there shopping and eating and soaking up the sights and tastes.
charming!. Very charming district - deffinitely worth a day of wandering! Breathtaking architecture! Well restored for tourists.Don`t forget to look up to admire the details!

Best place to get lost in Barcelona. It was a great area, especially during the night and especially when you walk without a map. Plenty of tapas, restaurants, shops, small walkways. It feels tourist-y but hey this is one tourist-y spot I don't mind hanging out in! We came here 3 days in a row (after heaps of other sightseeing elsewhere of course) :)
Nice Walking Around. Stay in the Gothic Quarters the area is really beautiful, lots of alley ways small restaurants and bars. Plenty to see
Walk around the Gothic Quarter. What a walk. Great bars and local places to stop for a drink and snack. The atmosphere in the evening is amazing.
Stunning. This area is beautiful, lots of alley ways, something new to see around every corner. Wear comfortable shoes as there is plenty to see, lots of small bars and restaurants.

Just blow your mind. Having our hotel on the Ronda was just great as we had a front seat to all which was happening.Best time was at night ,Lots of exciting places to enjoy good food and wine just sit back relax .Then just join in with the fun of being away for a few moments.People told us it was expensive BUT we never found it expensive all we had for us was First Class don't be put off get out there and go with the flow and believe me you will enjoy.We will be returning.
Great little spot!. Fantastic quarter filled with shops, galleries, and historic spots! I recommend a walking tour to describe the area and all that happened there.
Get lost and find yourself!. An amazing place to explore. Photographer and history buff alike - this is must visit when in Barcelona!

Lots to see and do. Stayed in the Rialto Hotel here and was quite amazed. Close to Las Ramblas and the Cathedral. Go and see the Cathedral, quite amazing. Lots of little alleys and squares. restaurants are excellent and are thick on the ground. Beggars are a nuisance, they all had mobile phones...

real spain. I loved it - narrow streets , great musicians displaying their talents. I came across a magnificent violinist who was selling CDs, he stopped a tourist recording him by shouting stop at him, it showed me that I need to consider the work that these musicians do
Good walking tours. Great walking tours thru this area. Worth getting a good guide that can direct you (Spanish Trails) and give you some of the great history along the way.

Grat area to strol around. I've stayed in this area a few times and like it a lot. There are plenty of small hotels and lots of bars and restaurants. The area is full of narrow alleys to get lost in, but you always come out. the cathedral is the centrepiece and is always worth a visit. I like the area best at night when the bulk of the day trippers have gone.

Gothic Mixed with 19th and 20th Century. The Gothic Quarter of Barcelona was a wonderful combination of Gothic with the more 19th and 20th century providing contrast while maintaining the precious past. The streets [almost without vehicles] so narrow and lined with beautiful buildings must be seen.
Lovely area. Nice, touristy area - very atmospheric if not all that authentic in modern times. Good to just wander and see what you find, plenty of smaller tourist shops, jamon, tapas etc.

must see!. This is such an interesting area to see. Very old, winding, narrow streets with shops and homes above. Loved seeing the old buildings and learned a bit of the history from our tour guide which made it all the more interesting.

Marketing, marketing.... This Gothic quarter is a perfect example of touristic marketing in action. It is nice, of course, but when you read about it and her some reviews you wait more... In reality in is not that special! The place is too touristic and the general atmosphere here is rather bustling. I am sure that this review is just one of hundreds reviews about Barri Gotic but I there is just one thing I want to tell all of you - do not wait too much and you will enjoy this place in Barcelona!
beautiful city quarter. Steeped in history and beautiful buildings, lovely to walk around and soak up the atmosphere! Plenty of cafes and bars to rest and grab a refreshing drink.

A maze of small streets. This area feels like one big maze of small streets. Very nice to wander around, specially at night. Just watch out for the ripp-offs at some restaurants. They shameless double prices right in front of you...

Wonderful Walk. Despite being in BCN during winter, a walk through the Gothic Quarter was a wonderful experience. It probably would have been nicer with a docent guide, but nonetheless an enjoyable experience to walk on your own.TIP: Be sure to check the Dali and Picasso museum nearby.
favorite section of town. My favorite section of Barcelona. Very nice to stroll down the narrow roads, especially in the evening. Love Sensi Bistro Tapas and Zim in the Gothic Quarter.

Real Barcelona !. Staying in the Gothic area of Barcelona is a delight with its little alleyways, quaint corners and little local shops and tapas bars. Far from the maddening crowds. Wonderful people. Apart from the Picasso museum, there are few attractions but the atmosphere is warm and splendid even in January.
Worth a visit. Worth visiting. Barcelona cathedral is beautiful even just to walk past to see! It says online it's free but when I went, 4 days ago, it said €6 entry.

Great attractions and lots of nice restaurants. This is my most favorite part in Barcelona. You can be here hours and hours wandering around. There are many ancient attractions and great restaurants and bars around.
very enjoyable. My wife and I spent it walking around Barri Gotic, it was very nice, romantic, tried out different tapas, and site seeing.Must see

Love the Gothic Quarter. Every time I go I see something new. It was sad this time to see shops that have been in business for generations closing because of the change in laws regarding rent control. Many of them can't afford the new skyrocketed rates and are forced to close. We wandered down the Jewish section and found some amazing bead shops that I bought some treasures in. There are tons of cute little shops and restaurants to see. Worth a visit any time. I love all the narrow little streets that you can wander down to hidden little gems.
Old world charm. Great bars restaurants and landmarks many hidden gems.great area to walk your day away.just of la ramblas

Atmospheric. I personally love all old towns in cities all over the world. Much more than museums or churches, they give you a unique perspective on a place's culture and history. And Barcelona's old town is a good one. Take a stroll and have a bite to eat in one of the numerous restaurants in the area and just soak the atmosphere of centuries of architecture and change.

a bit dirty but nice. beautiful churches, nice little streets, overall impression of the area is that is very very touristy and not very clean , also for the amount of people heading to ramblas and living there. Iglesia de merce is a must to see and maybe also have a coffee in the little square
Paced around. Basically found ourselves roaming into the area. It's nice to see the local neighbourhood, but there was not particularly anything interesting apart from the narrow alleyways.

Include El Cal, the Jewish quarter, in your wanderings. Barri Gotic is all that other traveller say. Be sure to find the Jewish district too. Fascinating history, very small synagogue discovered and open to the public (small charge). Also, be sure to eat at Cal Pep, which is amazing for Tapas and real Catalan food.
Amazing. It is simply amazing i was walking though I a hurry, ended up being 30mins late, i slowed right down just to take in all the history that is here

Sightseeing paradise.. Our hotel was right on the edge of this region of this magnificent city. The Cathedral was just across the road. Every corner you turn, every square you enter is adorned with remarkable architecture a lot of which is unique! Have your camera ready.

Medieval with a modern twist.. Do get lost in this Barcelona maze of a neighborhood with interesting neo classical buildings, narrow cobblestoned streets and quaint shops and interesting Catalan restaurants that serve fish head. I enjoyed the daily walks here from my hotel than the rest of Barcelona. It is however crowded during the day especially around Carrer del Bisbe. Although a bit risky, it is more enjoyable to stroll at night.

Interesting. So much history here. We visited the area at night, which takes on a totally different look.There is one of the oldest walls there. The church is interesting and has many interesting stories associated with it. Explore and get lost in this area.

Fantastic!. Every time I left the Barri Gotic I found myself wanting to go back. The unique shops and romantic restaurants made it very easy to stay. The food was delicious and more affordable than other parts of the city. The streets and tight and have a sense of mystery to them. Take a stroll through Barri Gotic, you won't be disappointed.
Interesting. Interesting little side streets. Lots of people walking around. Well lit streets. Felt safe.. but beware pickpockets!

Walk-Shop-Eat-Walk..... The Gothic Quarter is always worth the visit. My suggestion is to just enter and lose yourself for a few hours. There is everything to offer from boutiques, museums, tapas, coffee shops etc.... On a note there is a nice Flamenco Bar within the Barri, which offers shows on a daily basis, if your on the main routes of the tourists, you will surely pass by it, very rustic, some decent photo moments and maybe even book a show. Overall the location is worth the visit.
Great atmospheric area. Loved being in that area. So much to see and do and all at a leisurely pace. Good eateries. Interesting architecture. Lot of independent shops.

Great to walk around, shop. We walked around with a guide book the first time, then I went back with a wonderful tour guide, and found shops and learned things I couldn't have found on my own. Take the tour first, then go back to shop! It's one of the reasons you go to Barcelona.

An interesting walkaround. This is a nice area to stroll whether or not you are familiar with Barcelona. Take a couple of hours just to enjoy the atmosphere. There is also shopping conveniently nearby.
Must visit!. A million cute little shops, restaurants and bakeries. Helpful street signs point you in the direction of the major tourist spots.
