Do a walk-about; Really Fun; Really Cool!. We had a super fun day wandering from our Hotel, Le Meridien, through Barri Gotic to the Barcelona Cathedral and then on and into Born-Ribera to Museu Picasso. Narrow, winding streets filled with shops, restaurants, and bars. Really fun! Really cool!

A Good Place to Explore. Just off Las Ramblas there are lots of narrow winding passage ways, almost no cars, some bikes, and lots to explore. There is lots to look at and lots of places to shop and when you need a break stop for a coffee and a delicious pastry. You can easily spend a morning/afternoon/evening exploring and shopping.
It is a must. I really liked the Barrio gotico. It is very very nice, a lot of history is shown there. I would advise it to those who love architecture and old buildings. I found it really relaxing

Winding streets and shops. Interesting architecture and quaint shops. We picked up several nice scarves andvery nice leather goods at reasonable prices. Be prepared to walk and the streets are uneven so wear comfortable shoes with firm soles.

Most charming section of Barcelona. Loved this area if Barcelona the most. Might be because it reminds me of Venice (without canals). Santa Maris Del Mar is a very beautiful church. It was built by the people for the people. Charming squares, Picasso Museum. Quaint shops and Tapas restaurants. Enjoyed walking here very much.

Nice but expensive. Barcelona is a great a great city with many interesting neighborhoods. The Gothic Quarter is one of the top with unique interesting architecture, shops and restaurants. A great way to spend an afternoon. We did find that food / coffee was a lot more expensive here than some of the other areas, I think the fact that it is so popular with tourists means you pay more.

Marvellous and picturesque. The small streets and squares are beautiful. Behind every corner there's a new surprise, beautiful buildings and churches, impressive cathedral, nice little restaurants, shops, ...

A bustling area laced with a hint of the ominous - Brilliant!!. I loved the Gothic Quarter in Barcelona. The streets are narrow and winding and really contribute to a sense of the unknown. I visited this area at night and I'm so glad I did. Walking off down a side street, the overpowering bustle of Las Ramblas disappeared behind buildings and I felt really immersed in history and mystery. We walked around the Gothic style La Catedral de Barcelona and it was wonderful, especially in the darkness. We walked down a narrow alley lit by lanterns and shadowed by gargoyles and creepy statues, all to the background of an opera singer on the street corner. I highly recommend it.
Pure beauty. We were accommodated in the Gothic quarter, beautiful historical part of Barcelona. So easy to get anywhere from here.
Easy to get around. Barcelona is a great city for walking around. This was a lovely area to wander through. Throughly enjoyed the area.

Beautiful!. Great area of Barcelona to explore. Just go here, and get lost. There are bars, restaurants, and all sorts to do around there. There was fascinating architecture. It was just the perfect place to get lost for hours, doing absolutely noting.
Best district of the city!. We lived in the district. It's worth to visit it: a lot of old Gothic buildings, churches, narrow streets. Great atmosphere which you feel with all your senses ;)

Gothic Quarter. Barcelona is a great pedestrian city with many interesting neighborhoods (barrios). The Gothic Quarter is unique with interesting architecture, shops and restaurants. A great way to spend an afternoon.
Great location. We loved staying in this area, 5 mins from La Rambla and the port, with a lot of attractions, shops, bars, restaurants within walking distance.

Kind of back in time atmosphere. Beautiful historical area of Barcelona...loved it. Take the time to walk around all the little streets and you will be amazed. Close by there are a some high end stores for those who like to shop. It is so very different from the hussel and bussel of La Rambla. Jaumi 1 Metro station L4 Yellow brings you right in the middle of this historical area. Barcelona Gothic Cathedral is in this area quite close to Jaumi 1 station. This Cathedral should be a must see. This area is also quite close to La Rambla. Yes, you can walk to La Rambla from here.

Get lost. A must in Barcelona. Try to get lost in the middle of this neighborhood. Try to get away from busy areas like Ferran, Escudellers, Pl. Reial or Pl. del Pi. Try to find Plaça dels Traginers, el Pati Llimona, Pasaje de La Paz...
Great place to wander aimlessly. Fascinating area to explore. We spent several hours wandering fairly aimlessly just enjoying the character and ambience of the area.

Nice place, but a tourist set. Gothic sounds nice in arquitectural terms, and Gothic Quarter really seems, but most of the buildings gothic style in the site are not. They're, simply, modern recreations, built in the 30's and 50's, past century. The cathedral was finished at the end of IXX century. But walking by the streets is relaxing, beside tourist purposes. It looks like. There's a thesis by a Dr. in Arts which explains this.
Fantastic!. My favorite area of Barcelona. A must see and visit! Loads of bars and restaurants located in narrow, dark (Gothic in deed!) streets, lovely architecture and atmosphere.

Walk around and take it in. This is a very cool area. I took a tour and got lots of history. Even if you don't do a tour, just walk around the area and every corner is something to see. Strongly suggest you go.

Best place to stay. Loved staying in this area. Old with loads of places to eat and shop.Best leather bags are in "Calpa" Carrer de Ferran, 53. Beautiful soft quality leather and very affordable. I purchased two! Avoid eating on the main cross streets. The food is not traditional.

History, culture, atmosphere. The Gothic Quarter was a little bit of old Rome, a feel of the streets of Italy, the culture of Catalunya, and a walk back in time. Get back into the back streets - some of it is a little touristy if you don't. Walk around and explore the hidden gems - the Call, the old walls - it's where we spent most of our time.

Travel back in time. I felt like I was time warped back in time. The streets and buildings have been maintained for many to see. It was really lovely to walk through the narrow streets and get completely caught up in the moment. Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves!
Travel in History. We liked most the ancient city with it magnificent Cathedral.On the other hand to many tourist at the Plaza Catalunya

Great afternoon walk. I visited in July 2012. Very different after the modernista gaudi sights. Dont miss the sardana dance outside the cathedral and the Picasso museum.This old charming area is great to walk and explore.

Gothic Quarter. It is located in the heart of the Old Town in Barcelona. Quarter consists of narrow crooked streets, many of which are closed to travel. Cathedral of St. Eulalia is the central point of the Gothic Quarter. Quarter starts from Plaza Catalunya and stretches from Avenue to Via Laetana.
Romantic HISTORICAL. The possibilities are endless walks, enjoying the views of ancient streets and churches. Many cafes and shops, the Picasso Museum, Barcelona Cathedral central

Overwhelming... Tiny streets, quaint shops, bars and restaurant....and all those churches and historic monuments that just line the entire place. One can spend a whole day roaming in the streets and still not have enough. We were lucky as our hotel was right there. All one had to do was take a right and enter into any lane and start experiencing the Barri Gotic. One word of caution. Wear comfortable shoes and ensure you don't let anyone near you and engage in a conversation. This place also happens to be filled with pickpockets. I know, as one flicked my mobile from the top pocket.So, wear your walking shoes, tuck away your valuables in the front trouser pockets and you are off to a historic and free to tour of the gothic quarter. This is the best way to experience Europe. On foot.
Quaint old streets with shops galore. A great place to walk around. So much to see, so easy to get lost. Some lovely restaurants and bars to go to as well.
Old!!!. Wander the back streets off La Rambla & stumble upon the Cathedral, Palau de la Generalitat (for a free tour) market stalls and yes more Tapas bars. Make sure that you wear comfortable shoes.
Just go get lost. Just walking in and out of all the tiny streets - the restaurants, shops, scenery, people - all a wonderful experience! Just head out and see what is around the next corner!

awe inspiring. Loved the atmosphere particularly at night around the Barcelona cathedral where each evening we had magnificent free entertainment at the side entrance- fantastic acoustics and performances- Wonderful buildings squares alleyways and tapas bars to lose yourself in.

We couldn't stay away. Our visit to Barcelona included four separate trips back to Barri Gotic. We loved the Cathedral and the Jewish section, where we visited one of the world's oldest synagogues (not a lot of the building still standing but worth a visit). This section of Barcelona brings you back in time and its worth wondering through the narrow streets and old buildings. There are also lots of very talented street musicians.

Getting Lost. Get lost in the windy narrow streets in the Gothic Quarter is a must in Barcelona. The many shops, churches and not to be missed are the many unique tappa bars. Oh don't forget the wine. Don't forget to look up at the many old buildings. Not to be forgotten is the markets. To see the Gothic Quarter during the day is one thing but to see it at night is another. Take you time don't be on a schedule, enjoy the ambiance.

Gothic. We took one of the free walking tours at night, well worth it, our guide Miguel had many stories to tell, it ended up being one of our fav things we did in Barcelona. Totally not his fault we got lost going back to our hotel after, that was an adventure, but no regrets
Wear comfortable shoes. Nice area but don't bother if you are tired. . .so many narrow beautiful streets and you'll want to walk down everyone! Tapas bars, shops, old buildings. . .not to be missed.

Much to explore. The many streets, shops, churches and attractions of the Barri Gotic will keep you busy for days. And did I mention two big markets and plenty of restaurants? Put on your walking shoes and go!

Awe&some. Really just wandered through the narrow streets is a special experience at night, full of life and entertainment. Quaint shops galore of local produce. If all you do in Barcelona is take a walk through this area at night you wont regret it.

Amazing shopping and bars. Just like no where else...a real maze of little streets and alleys with amazing architecture, street art and every kind of shop, bar and cafe. A great place to spend a few hours.

Wonderful, can't wait to go back without the kids. After a little driving around got free parking fairly close. We set off without map to explore and unexpectedly found medieval streets, independent shops and restaurants. Architecturally and culturally interesting for all ages and interests. The eldest (14) has a collection of amusing shop and road signs photies, hubby wonderful pictures of the architecture, the girls (7 and 10) and I have taken hundreds of pics, including beautiful shops, giant doors with huge knockers, rows of mopeds, rows of Boris style bikes, men with wheelbarrows, grafitti and general street scenes – we are going to make a huge collage of our visit – so much to see, so atmospheric.We can’t wait to go back (without the kids!!)

Fun neighborhood to walk in. This is a great neighborhood to walk in. Just do yourself one favor: bring a detailed map. You can't really get lost, but you can get turned around. When it is time to leave, you will appreciate the map.
Great place. Took a lovely stroll through the gothic quarter I would recommend to this to any would be visitor. We did it without a guide or street map.
Walk eat drink have fun. Precruise a couple of days in Barcelona this is just a fun place to walk around great sights good tapas and lots to see

Wander & enjoy. There is so much to see from the architecture, the museums, the individual hope, the bars, cafes, restaurants, something for everyone who likes to stroll & to soak up the atmosphere. There are so many narrow streets leading one to another interspersed with squares both little & large with numerous opportunities to sit and watch the world go by. Musicians, dancers will entertain but expect the hat to be passed around.Where ever it is busy/crowded beware of pickpockets.
Historic place for a wander. Fascinating Area, lots of bars and places to eat and a great sense of history. Cool in the heat of the day.

Interesting walk. We love getting lost in an interesting part of a city, and this qualifies as interesting enough. Drop by the Basilica de Santa Maria del Pi and the Barcelona Cathedral of Santa Eulalia.
Wander around and get lost. Gothic quarter has a wonderful vibe and is a great way to pass away many hours. Visiting all the little shops and admiring the architecture.

Love to walk around and soak in the culture. This area of Barcelona is so much fun to walk and wonder the side streets. There are quaint shops everywhere and it is great to just close an ally and go down it and see what you discover. With a map you can't get lost and we found the locals very helpful when we were unsure of where we were. This is a place of history and contemporary nightlife. It is fun and worth the time just to get lost and found here.

Best Neighborhood in Barcelona. Although there are no world-famous Gaudi houses in Barri Gotic, this neighborhood is fascinating, beautiful, and unique. The stone buildings, which date back centuries, combined with the narrow streets, small shops, and incredible buildings make it an absolute MUST to experience in Barcelona! Don't miss it!

Just go and forget the map!. Just take a deep breath and go! Walk around and explore, put the map in your pocket and forget about it, - go to narrow passages - don't go just where the tourist groups go! I went there in day time and in night time - both ways are amazing (by night time I found what seemed like a red district!!), feel the life of a big city compresed into small streets. In day time you can find a lot of small wonders - dancers, musicians etc.
a must explore. medevil alley ways, discount shops, and good place for tapas and a drink. not an area to get a hotel, just to explore
Beautiful little alley streets!. What a treasure to find all the little streets in and around the Gothic Quarter. Many beautiful little café's and bric and brac shops to explore. Like a maze!
must visit. A necessary visit is needed if you come to town , is the old part of the city with museums and lots of history.

Culture and Art together!. Sunday on the steps of the Cathedral was a full orchestra playing to a local crowd in the square below waiting to gather and join in one of the Catalunya folk dances. What an experience to watch young and old dance together to live music embracing historical culture. Expanding out from the square was a flea market filled with Spanish treasures!

Beautiful architecture. Great little enclave in Barcelona. Plenty to see, eat, photograph and do here just by wandering through the alleys. Be sure to look up! You will find something beautiful at every turn.
So Much to See, Eat and Drink. You'll love just wondering around, make sure you take a side alley you never know what you'll find to yes, see, eat, drink or buy!
Beautiful Barcelona. Great for a chilled out walk. Interesting antique market on the Tuesday. Worth a visit. Lots of lovely places to eat and drink.
Very nice part of town. Labyrinth of old streets, churches, houses, statues and cafes is just lovely to stroll around and take a break while listening to some street musicians.

Magic, a real gem. These streets are best explored without a map, a real old world feel and you stumble on local shop restaurants bars and hidden squares. Was great to have our appartment also in this area.

Interesting, but better medieval quarters in other Spanish cities. The quarter had some interesting aspects, particularly the Cathedral. It's a good easy walk, but even better if you wander farther east into the neighborhood of Born. Less touristy and more real life in Born.

History abounds~Get lost in the streets!. Just wander and enjoy all the small passageways in the Gothic Quarter. There are several "free" walking tours with donation after as you wish, so check out what works into your timeframe. The guides are well informed and a couple to look into are the Orange Donut and Runner Bean Tours.

Got totally lost here and loved it!. My wife and I wandered aimlessly through the narrow streets going to shops and places to eat. We made out own private chocolate tour by stopping at any place that offered chocolate. It was a truly amazing place, and very romantic.

Fantastic for a walk. With its winding streets and numerous shops, Barri Gotic is a fantastic place to lose yourself in Barcelona. There are so many picturesque streets and small plazas to come upon, that I seem to find something new every time I walk around here (and I lived in BCN for 3 years). One of my favourite places is the Plaza Reial, but do be careful around this area at night. Lots of pick-pockets!
Great place to lose yourself. I loved walking the narrow passage ways and discovering small boutique shops and restaurants along the way. A great place to walk and get to know Barcelona.
You just have to do it as a tourist!. But it is still possible to find quiet, out of the way places for a bit of peace if you look hard enough!

A Maze. I loved walking through here. The buildings are stunning and I could have spent two or three days just wandering around looking at the sights and stopping for coffee or drinks at the wide variety of bars and cafes.

Fascinating. You feel like in 1200 bc.. Every corner, every building has life. Your eyes will get crossed by looking every stone. What a place!. You can eat tapas, get a beer, enjoy the culture and spend lot of hours walking in the Quarter. Amazing!
Interesting places and diferent neighborhood.. Really interesting neiborhood, with small streets and cute stores. Nice restaurants and good food. Very pleasent for a Sunday afternoon walk.

Great shopping & restaurants. We didn't have anything planned for the day so we went walking.and found the Gothic Quarter. We ate at a sidewalk cafe but don't remember the name of it. The food was delicious and the service was fast. My favorite part was finding the best button shop ever.

Open your eyes! You're in an old town now. It'll be kind of difficult to follow a map in these tight streets, but, if you don't carry one, don't bother, let yourself be at the mood of your own walk. The Gothic Quartier is not so big after all, and sure you won't get lost forever! There are lots of tourists too, unless you walk early in the morning. The architecture is beautiful in this place. Pay attention, the shops aren't open before 10am and almost all of them are closed from 2pm to 4pm or 4.30pm. At night, most of the shops are closed between 8pm and 8.30pm, just a few may close a bit later. But, of course, restaurants are open at night. If you don't want to walk in a "ghost town", try to be there when shops are open. Have a coffee/cappuccino and a homemade cake at Caelum, they have conventual recipes!!! It's in Carrer de la Palla, 8 and they have also packaged pastry to take away. If you're looking for trendy shops, look for these streets: Carrer d'Avinyó and Carrer dels Banys Nous. The most cosy place in Gothic Quartier, for me, is this square: Plaça de Sant Felip Neri. It's not so easy to find, but ask someone, you won't regret. You'll see the vestiges of the Civil War in the exterior walls of the church. This amazing little square served also as a setting for videoclips and movies.

Charming old quarter.. Loved the buildings, squares, churches and history. Safe to wander around alone and all the tourist sites are well signed. Not so keen on all the graffiti. We were told to be careful of pick-pockets so keep all valuables secure.
Mindblowing. Little narrow winding streets packed with cafes, restaurants, galleries, shops and loaded with gorgeous architectural detail. What's not to love?

free walking tour. recommend the free walking tour of this area . Feel free to leave the group if it drags on, though. We stuck it out and it was worth it but could have been better if the guide stayed on topic. Best if small group shows up. We have 8 people. 2.5 hours.

LOVE IT!!!. This is the place to wonder around aimlessly, every turn you will find something new to see. Tons of bars, restaurants, architecture, shops, and a great all around atmosphere. My favorite place for sure.

Wonderful narrow streets dotted with attractions. LOved the Cathedral, with the geese, the busking and other entertainment in the square outside, liked the chocolate museum, the market, disliked the queues to get into some attractions so did not go in. The frozen yoghurt and tea shops in Carrer dels Boters are worth a visit (if you like thats sort of thing)

Cool neighborhood. Very hip, a lot of very good restaurants and places of cocktails. You can get lost wandering around in all of the alleyways. A lot of people but nothing like Las Ramblas which, to me, is overflowing with too many tourists. We stayed in this neighborhood for 4 nights and really enjoyed it. We walk a lot and didn't mind walking to other neighborhoods or taking the transit system to go someplace further out.
Atmospheric old town. great for exploring back streets, tapas bars, picture perfect plazas and old churches. Plaza Real and Le Seu cathedral a must see..

A walking experience of surprises. This historic area has many interesting squares where you will find cafes tucked in each corner. Small winding streets open up to interesting places with small shops of local crafts etc. Forget a map and take the opportunity to walk and explore and you will be rewarded.

Nice to wander but find time to get a tour around. Great to wander and get lost in such narrow streets that formed the roman inner sanctum years ago and to see the original roman pillars hidden away and different quarters.However, find the money to get a guide or tour around this area, runnerbean are donation only along with other groups and you will learn so much more and see so much more of what is an incredibly historical area
Historic. Yes, it's historic, but it's also quite scruffy and mobbed with tourists. The more modern parts of Barcelona and its great architecture are more interesting.

An easy stroll. This was our first glimpse of the city. We followed a set walk around the Gothic quarter to get the flavour of Barcelona. It took us through streets we might otherwise have missed with glimpses of the Roman and medieval history of Barcelona.

The best of BCN. At night, on daylight, this amazing quarter is the thing in a beautiful city as Barcelona. The cathedral, iglesia del mar, bars, food, live music on the street... makes this neighborhood something to remember... You'll feel like in another age, surrounded by walls, alleys, for me, it’s a must.

Very Pretty. It really nice to just wander the streets and soak in the atmosphere. Nice to put away the map and just get lost for a little time. Eating in this area is more expensive and you can get bothered by people trying to sell things.

Fascinating old town of Barcelona. We took a guided tour of the Barri Gothic and were shown a lot of fascinating features that we might have missed if we had gone alone. The architecture is great and the area has a good atmosphere - there are a lot of tourists and you will queue to see some things such as the Roman column remains where the access is a bit restricted, but if you enjoy this sort of sightseeing you will not be disappointed

Great area to explore!. We loved all the narrow streets with great restaurants and shops, I highly recommend the free walking tour of the area since they bring you to some spots we would never have known about!

Take a Tour to Really Appreciate It. There is so much to see and learn about in this area that we would have missed so many of the important and interesting things without a guide. This area is alive with people, businesses, markets, and restaurants as well as historic and religious landmarks. Don't miss it if you are in Barcelona.
breath taking. we liked this alot. just be careful of bags we took very little.It is just good to take it all in. do not engage anyone in conversation usually a scam

Walk the streets, feel the city, the history. We walked the narrow streets of Barcelona's Gotic, felt the history, got lost, found ourselves, stopped for hot chocolate and coffee. Part of any trip is feeling where you are, doing what the people are doing, and this is one of the ways of doing it.The Old Catedral is here, so are some of the city's craft markets on Saturday and Sunday, and some of the great bars and restaurants.
Very cool. I loved walking the cobbled and tiny streets.....the architecture is amazing. And it's full of little shops and places for tapas and sangria. The gothic cathedral is very beautiful.
Atmospheric. Classic little atmospheric streets, full of quaint little shops and businesses, clearly packed with tourists as its such a lovely little arae.
Nice atmosphere. Nice Walking and strolling around in this quarter, finding new small streets every day, nice Location for Tapas and Dinner. Born quarter is Special, do not miss.
Don't Like It!. Really do not like this area. Too crowded and touristy. Would rather see other areas of Barcelona. We just go in for a sight or museum and leave.
Great atmosphere. Every European city has an old town. Barcelona's is packed with shops, people and seemingly endless tapas joints. In a week-long stay, we wound up here three times for dinner.

Bustling.... Yes it is full of tourists…but that is what we are ! But many locals appear to frequent the area as well which enhances the vibe.Took an apartment in the area which was fantastic.Full of eating places, bars and an array of shops not to mention the market stalls that appear.Wonderful old shops that seem to have been there for time immemorial~let's hope they stay and are not pushed out by the chains that are more than happy to pay MORE rent.Close enough to walk Barcelona which is THE way to explore the city which has an underlying buzz like no other in Spain.

I like this area. It's quieter than Las Ramblas for staying over night. Lots of side streets so small that they have mostly pedestrian traffic. But it's still close enough to restaurants and Las Ramblas and shopping.

Wonderful place to wander & enjoy. We stayed close to the Barri Gotic & wandered through these twisting little streets, museums, churches, restaurants....right off La Rambla but a completely different experience. To really experience daily life in Barcelona this area is way to breathe in the local atmosphere. Crowded with locals as well as tourists, be prepared to feel a connection to the city that you will miss if you stay on the main La Rambla. Take the time to enjoy and plan on spending lots of time savoring the experience of the plazas, the crowd, the energy here.
Very atmospheric area.. Great for browsing and soaking up the atmosphere - every kind of shop you can imagine, impressive buildings, wide choice of bars and tapas restaurants.
Well worth the visit. Narrow streets, numerous squares all with numerous bars/cafes lovely churches and so many hidden gems around every corner.
Small narrow streets, great shops.. There is lots of character here, nice cafe's and restaurants. Small shops selling interesting items not tourist 'tat.'
Beautiful old quarter. The gothic quarter with its narrow winding streets is just wonderful. Lots of restaurants and shopping. A visit to the cathedral is a must.
atmospheric. We loved wandering these gorgeous atmospheric streets, shopping, eating dinner or stopping for a lunchtime snack to watch the world go by. One of my fave places in Barcelona.
Lose yourself in history. A great place to put the map away and just absorb the history and individuality of the place. I loved the way the place came alive in the evening; lots of places to eat.
A must see. Take your camera and enjoy the walks through the old city, great shops and dinning make this place a visit that will easily eat up half a day exploring.
Beautiful place. Amazing atmosphere, great restaurants and wine bars in these beautiful narrow streets and secluded courtyards:)

You can feel the history . This beautiful area of Barcelona travels your senses to the old times.
The best location to stay.
Amazing buildings, shopping and many nice places to eat.
Loved it.
Lovely. Strolling through the Gothic quarter was a very relaxing experience. Restaurants, shopping, street performers, and architecture combined made for a delight to the senses.

Immerse yourself. Our rented apartment was in the middle of the Gothic Quarter and we loved every minute of walking through the narrow streets.
Great shops, bars, and restaurants around every corner. I would suggest doing one of the many walking tours available because there is so much history hidden behind doors and alleys

Don't miss this. If you can't enjoy your time here you shouldn't be in Barcelona. The cafes and architecture are beautiful. It feels really safe. My son and I really enjoyed wandering and finding a table.

Leave the main drag. Don't waste your time on the crowded main drag of La Ramble full of McDonalds, KFC, Starbucks and the like. Go into the back streets of the Gothic Quarter and enjoy the street life with far fewer tourists and some authentic coffee houses, chocolate and churro cafes, and boutiques.
Wonderful Architectures. Explore and discover the neighborhood streets, shops, restaurants and bakery cafes. Excellent shopping.

I love it. One of my favourite places in the world.
Just wander around & soak up the atmosphere.
Stroll, stop into bars, nibble tapas
Loose yourself. Great just to wander round the streets, admire the buildings, window shop, find an interesting place to eat.
a must see. lots of old buildings and nice shops. Very old and beautiful. You must see this area. Coffee shops are nice as well.
Very interesting!. There's a lot of history in this quarter, but unfortunately a ton of tourists! If you can manage to ignore all the people,and get a good guide, it's well worth visiting.

Narrow Streets and Gothic Architecture. This is what a European city should be like; cobblestone streets, narrow alleyways and old buildings mixed with slightly newer ones. You could easily get lost here and you wouldn't mind as you would discover something new. There are churches and museums missed in and you could easily spend a day just taking it all in...

Still Magical. The crowds seem larger and the number of tiny neighborhood shops seems to be diminishing; nevertheless, this is one of the great neighborhoods on the planet. The Barri is not a collection of several quaint streets, rather it is an entire community of homes, shops and local families. You can feel the history here as you wander the narrow streets and get lost in the past. You've not seen Barcelona until you've been lost in the Barri Gothic.

Labyrinthine alleys.. Its my second time walking around this district and i've got to say i love it more. I was lucky to chance upon a parade of the giants (gegantes) which was a highlight of the walk. Otherwise, this place makes a nice quiet walk that is bound to throw up some local shops that will surprise you.There are however one too many Desigual boutiques around and one cannot help but notice the lack of business in the local shops like ice cream parlours and cafes, seemingly a sign of the decline of the spanish economy.
a must. lots happening, lots of history and culture, coffee areas. quaint shops, cobbled streets. a delight to visit
LOUD. i liked that it is authentic, and there are still family run cafes like Los Amigos. The loud young crowd at Bullocks kept me up every night.

Take your walkin' shoes.. We stayed in a suite on Las Ramblas and walked out the back - to get delightfully lost. You can walk around for hours day or night and see some things over and over again...then go round a corner and get completely disoriented and come out on the seafront, or Las Ramblas, or somewhere else entirely. Don't worry, relax, there's always a cab or a bus (14 or 59 go onto Las Ramblas from the front). Besides you can just stop to drink and eat at one of the hundreds of bars, cafes. restaurants. It's crowded at times, but the atmosphere is relaxed and friendly, as we found it to be everywhere in Barcelona. Loved it. Even the graffiti is great!

You can go on for ever. So much to see and do here. Alleyways and narrow streets. So interesting, lots of shops that you may never find again, suddenly finding squares, churches, restaurants and bars. Galleries, ice cream and pizza.

Wow, so awsome. Spent some time here November 2013, I went out that time because it was cheap and I like to see stuff out of season get a feel for the real people. Was fantastic walking tours were happening if you wanted them. If you can fond Q bar I highly recommend a visit!
Stunning. A beautiful area to walk round, eat and soak up the local atmosphere. The architecture is amazing with a mix of new and old buildings
Plan before your visit. Varied and stimulating history and architecture. Join a guided tour for a really detailed and informative experience.
A real rabbit warren of shops and eateries. Lovely bars, Tapas, arty shops and galleries. Can be difficult to find your way around without a smartphone
A walk through history. A really beautiful area of the city! We started at the cathedral and explored the tiny side streets and loved this area. Well worth a visit!

Love it. I prefer this part as apposed to the ramblas. You just stumble upon something new every time you go. Just don't worry and get yourselves lost in the narrow streets! Love the little shops here. We even found a half pint for 1euro. Love it!

wonderful area. we loved this area of Barcelona, very atmospheric( even if we kept getting lost after being out late drinking) the shops cafes and streets are wonderful, so much to see and sit and relax. There is so much to look round that you need a few days just in this area, the weather was also grest sunny and you could walk round in a sleeveless top  we will be back

Wonderful place. The Chatedral is magnificent, huge, full of history, well kept. The whole area is well maintained and is surraunded for bars, stores and coze tapas restaurants. It is worth at least a day there.

A brilliant place to visit.. We stayed just off of Las Ramblas so found ourselves right in the middle of the gothic quarter. We found it so interesting with plenty of shops and cafes to visit. We felt a bit uncomfortable walking down some of the narrow streets after dark as there were a few street sellers out and about. A great atmosphere through the historical streets with the cathedral situated in the middle like a hidden gem.

Great place to hang out in the afternoon. If you like walking through small streets, stopping at tapas bars, doing a little shopping and picture taking then this is definitely worth it. I don't recall anything particularly amazing about the Gothic Quarter but it's a small little area in Barcelona that's worth checking out, especially since the Bus Turistica stops there so its' easy to get there and leave when you're done.
No maps ?. Take your time when walking around Barri Gotic and don't be to worried about directions as eventually you will come out at somewhere you recognise

best part of the city, get lost in the many narrow side streets. We stayed in the heart of the gothic area and it was brilliant, we spent several hours just wandering in and about the narrow streets and squares finding little bars and restaurants to eat and drink in. Food and drink was good and reasonably priced although most restaurants in the small squares charged typically 10% extra to sit outside but in most cases it was worth it to soak up the atmosphere and enjoy the autumn sunshine

I loved Barcelona, Gothic Quarter is a happening place. This is the area to stay in Barcelona. Close to everything you will love. Good food, drinks, music on every corner of the narrow streets. Best guitarists/musicians I've heard. All the squares/plazas have interesting things to see & do...La Ramblas is never a dull moment. We wore money belts, and felt at ease throughout the crowds. Don't carry too many valuables. La Boqueria Market, is a must see. Go there to have breakfast, lunch or dinner. Great prices, and everything is so fresh. Great shops, leather shoes and handbags are good buys, great selection of shoes.

Very old Gothic Quarter of Barcelona. We stayed in this area and I really enjoyed the feel and sights of the quarter. It has the narrow streets and old Roman style buildings. Worth walking through for sure.
Chill out wander. A great area of Barcelona to wander around and relax, there was a market on while we were there which was a food and drink expo, not bad value and a great range of things to try
Wow. This is a must for anybody travelling to Barcelona. The history and architecture is just amazing. When you go make sure you get the audio it gives you the full history of this amazing cathedral.
Essential part of Barcelona. Very interesting place in all with small shops and bars and restaurants. Loved the narrow streets and sense of history. Could wonder around hours over here.

Get a good guidebook and enjoy!. This area lived upto the hype! Our B&B was in the district, so made wandering and photography easy. Barcelona's architecture is one of the primary reasons to visit, even if many never venture past Las Ramblas!
go get lost down the beautiful streets- its amazing. amazing buildings, great and friendly coffee shops. Just walk down the streets and let your mind go wild

Just Roaming. We just roamed around, looking at the architecture and the people. Didn't go into the Cathedral, but did try some stuff at the food festival of some sort that was on the square when we were there.

Interesting area of Barcelona. This old part of Barcelona has a stunning cathedral and other gothic buildings worth seeing on a visit to the city. Be careful of pickpockets in this area as streets are small and crowded.
Nice place to walk.. A very nice place to wander around and to get lost in the small streets. To see the small stores and have churros with hot chocolate in the afternoon.

OH MY Gaudie, Gaudi. We were confused all day long, so much going on, maybe the hop on hop off was not the best choice, SUPER crowded - drivers not thrilled to continue to answer questions. Took to Gaudi Sagrada Familia Cathedral which was our only desired place with such short time in Barcelona, we go there, got off and the line was painful - hundreds, hundreds wrapped around the corner - it was hot and did not feel like wasting our time standing 3 hours so we got back on bus (KEEP EYES OPEN FOR WHICH HOP ON HOP OFF COMPANY YOU HAVE TIX FOR) do not wait in wrong line as we did ! ALSO, BUY TIX ONLINE PRIOR - it will give you a specific time to be there and NO waiting in line - WE DID NOT KNOW THIS!

Explore Walking. An excellent place brewing with small shops and markets..Tapas is aplenty and so is the high energy of the place. Walk and explore.Amazed to see the age old architecture enmeshed in modern times and activities. Highly recommended..

Get lost in the side streets. You'll be happy you did - restaurants, bars, shops. Lived in West Village of NYC for 8 yrs, and working on my 2nd in Nolita - this was one of my favorite neighborhoods in BCN.
Well worth a visit. Gothic quarter is well worth a visit. Traditional and interesting. Very busy but packed with unusual shops and places to eat, catering for all tastes and budget.

Great just to wander. This is a great place to wonder about and do some shopping with a good mixture of main stream shops, market stalls and bohemia. The streets and buildings are awesome, it is far more traditional than nearby Las Ramblas. The kids may find it a bit boring and need a rest so plan a visit to the cathedral where they can enter for free and sit in the cool. There are some good traditional ice cream and sweet shops in this area.

Feel like middle century. I am totally in love with this neighbourhood. There are just so many small lanes and street that full of surprises. You will lost in between the store and direction. But it's alright because you will always find something special about it. Maybe a nice boutique shop or local bar. Sure a definitely thing to see in Barcelona

Nice walk !. It was a nice and romantic walking around the streets, also in the evenings ! Nice restaurants around, narrow balkonies, nice colors, a great atmosphere ! Placa Reial is the jwell of this area! Don't miss it, day and night !

Nice bike taxi tour. We had a great tour guide, Pablo, who showed us places we never discovered ourselves. Visiting the little square full of children that was bombed in the Civil War, was very impressive.
Great Place to Wander. The amazing thing about this was revealed during the Merce Festival. Just wander around the very narrow streets and enjoy the experience.

Wander the small streets of Bari Gotic. You must take a few hours to just get lost among the small streets of the Bari Gotic. Late afternoon is a good time, shops and eateries are everywhere and if you are up to it you can wander of to Las Ramblas for a dose of people watching.

Mixed feelings. We enjoyed walking here, but somehow it felt very touristy. It attracts tourists like us because of its age and quaintness but it also felt commercialized. There were tour groups and crowds in many places, and we were there in mid-October.

Barri Gotic is a Photographer's delight. If you like history, architecture, food, people watching, picturesque cobble stoned streets, medieval villages, Roman remnants of walls, aqueducts and towers, photography, music, shopping, soaking in the atmosphere during the daytime and then coming back at night (the place changes at night), make a point of exploring the barri Gotic.
Atmosphere. Strolling the narrow alleyways, visiting the amazing churches and enjoying all the tapas bars was one of the ways that we immersed ourselves in the Barcelona experience.

Nice walk. Our guide walked us through the Gothic Quarter on a nice Sunny day. Could not remember much of the stories he told us. Everyone was busy snapping photos. Streets were crowded with tourists.

So much to see - easily spend a couple of days. Lovely old quarter of Barcelona with lots of little side streets and a new experience around the next corner. Eat in the tranquility that is the Pl Reial - try les quiz nits (see separate review)
There are lots of churches, little courtyards, interesting streets....

Something for Everyone. Whether you love the historic buildings, the teeming street scene, the touristy shops, the culinary pleasures -- you will enjoy Barcelona's famous Gothic Quarter. It bustles from late morning until late night, and is a walker's delight. The street beggars can be a problem when they disturb a meal or persist in their approach, but most are passive or polite. Simply people-watching is the best entertainment.
One of the best sections in Barcelona. Walking through this area is another "must do". The buildings are amazing, the shopping in this area is wonderful. A little bit of everything for everyone.
Quaint section of Barcelona. If you want to experience Barcelona of old, walking around this neighborhood is the place to be. Do take the time to visit.

Spend morte than a day here. If you want to really sense the history in Barcelona then go to the steps of the church where Columbus set off for America! The range of tapas bars & restaurants is awesome
Perfect food, nice shopping. Go beyond the Rambla, and visit the Gothic Quarter. Perfect food an nice small restaurants. Nice shopping, leather items, shoes, and many more things to find.

Avoid the crowd; take an evening stroll. There's an incredible amount of history and old-world charm in the Barri Gotic. This is the area that was originally called Baroni by the Roman's. One can stand on and touch Roman history that is still a part of Barcelona's day-to-day life. At my wife's suggestion, we decided to walk the area at night and I'm glad we did. Using one of Rick Steve's excellent guidebooks, my wife narrated our self-guided tour. The evening hours added a dimension to the walk that one would not get during the day. Besides, the narrow streets were easy to stroll down after dark. We walked through the area on our way to another part of the city during one morning and could barely move at times.There are small restaurants and food vendors throughout the quarter, as well as shopping (but many stores were closed at the time we were there...but then again, that wasn't our reason for strolling the Barri Gotic). This is walk to be savored. Soak up the history and take in the atmosphere. We stopped periodically to listen to street musicians and even came across a concert in an old church courtyard about 10pm...taking time to sit on the church steps and listen to the music with the locals. We never felt that our safety was an issue. Then again, we're from a big city. While walking the Barri Gotic be sure to see: Cathedral of Barcelona, Martyrs Statute, Church of Sant Felip Neri (in a small courtyard that's used as a playground for school kids during the day) where Gaudi worshipped and which is still pockmarked by shrapnel from the revolution, El Call (Jewish Quarter) & the entrance to Barcelona's oldest synagogue dating to the Middle Ages (marked by a very small door on Carrer de Marlet), the Roman Temple of Augustus...where you can stand on a millstone outside the door at #10 Carrer del Paradis).
Best location. We stayed at a hotel in the gothic quarter and that's a great location for staying, because you have everything in walking distance, including restaurants, pubs, attractions and shops.

Loved roaming around!. Really interesting place. Make sure to go to the Cathedral, which is a great gothic style. The small coble stone streets are great to wonder around. Best not to have a destination...just get lost!
A walk in the past. The cradle of Barcelona, the Roman center of the mtime in this area can still be seen, touched, and lived in the Barri Gotico

LIVELY AND HISTORIC. Loved the lovely high gothic buildings with their lovely history and a visit to the lovely church is not to be missed.A visit to the towers is breathtaking with wonderful views over the city.There are many other attractions nearby and the food stalls are mouth watering
The old city. This part of the city is nice. Wander in the small streets and visit the Cathedral. Don't miss it but dont waste all your time there too.
Gothic Quarter. Very easy to get into. Be sure and walk around outside as there are many treasured areas outside of the church.
Must see. Very quaint to walk through. Easy to find from Las Ramblas. Be sure to take in all the side streets. Interesting shops and restaurants. Great chocolatiers along the way! Yummy.
Charm and shops. Very clean and restored gothic . Great for people watching and shops. Restaurants abound . Shops are cheap to expensive.all is good in this fantastic city
A touch of Gothic. There are beautiful narrow streets and a great atmosphere. There is a variety of Interesting shops although it can be crowded. Well worth a visit to appreciate old Barcelona.

Amazing!. The Gothic Cathedral is amazing. There is a cloistered garden with geese (representing purity!) and the architecture is just beautiful. We had breakfast one morning is a little café that had English Breakfast tea - not something you usually find abroad! We walked through the Gothic Quarter to the seafront which was worth seeing.
Short Vacation. The Gothic Quarter was very interesting with its history, small shops and many back street restaurants

A terrific place to walk around and experience. This neighborhood is close to the Rambla, but very different. Narrow street, beautiful buildings and a very nice atmosphere makes walking around an experience to recommend.

Fabulous place to aimlessly wander. My boyfriend and I walked miles and miles by meandering the narrow streets here. We stumbled across some fantastic cafes/bars/restaurants which we would never had found otherwise. It was a romantic way to see the beautiful architecture there is on offer and really get a cultural experience.

Old style streets. It was our first trip so everything was new.It was what I had expected from Europe very narrow streets with commercial at street level and prople living above.Its nice to just wander thre and soak up the charm

A fun afternoon of strolling through ancient streets. Definitely touristy, but you can't fake the amazing architecture. Look down every little alley way, because there's something interesting everywhere.

the best part of Barcelona. I loved the Gothic quarter and spent a lot of my trip here roaming the streets, trying different kinds of traditional Catalan food. One day we also hired a bike and cycled through the streets all the way to Barceloneta beach. I would recommend setting aside at least 3 hours to fully explore the Gothic quarter and highlights are the Barcelona cathedral and the very peaceful placa de sant felip neri. Just be careful as it can be very crowded and is the optimum place for pickpocketers!

Great walk around. A great way to see history in today's world... The two come together beautifully here. Well worth it. The day we went, we combined with going to La Boqueria... Very chill & wonderful.
Great. This is an amazing area which is great to travel via foot. You get everything from roman ruins to the Jewish quarter as well as everything else. Explore and be amazed
Beautiful. I couldn't stop taking pictures- beautiful small streets, tiny tapas restaurants and random shops selling everything you need. Lovely area.

Atmospheric and intriguing. Don't miss this part of Barcelona, many narrow and winding streets which are full of un-usual shops and little bistros. It shows you the old Barcelona before all the streets were built on a grid system.
The Old Section. A series of small, narrow and winding streets. The architecture is old and a mixture of Spanish, Roman and Moorish. A sight to see.
Interesting. It was interesting to tour this area, both to learn the history and to browse the shops and enjoy the tapas!
Fascinating street. Take time to wander the streets in this area. There is plenty to see and some wonderful tucked away restaurants serving great tapas.

Such character. Love this place, so interesting. The tapas bars are brilliant and lots of quirky shops. Keep your wits about you as a lot of pick pockets but I felt safe. Just keep to where there are lots of people and enjoy it.

Great vibe!. We stayed in the Gothic Quarter - small enough to walk around and enjoy. Tons of boutiques and souvenir shopping. Lots of food choices.
Right next to Las Ramblas if you want to do that stroll.

a must see. Great little shops selling all sorts of amazing goods, food, clothes, shoes, chocolates, etc. Do visit the grocer who specialises in freshly roasted nuts, particularly almonds - brilliant!

The best area to wander. Many closes, interesting shops, small unique artists working, mixing with cafés shops, nice gelaterias
Let yourself get lost there so you feel the place. I think it is the best area in Barcelona

Wonderful, and not for quiet seekers. We rented an apartment in the Gothic Quarter in the peak of August when it was totally over-run with young groups of sometimes noisy groups of 20-somethings (bless 'em) and we still had a ball. It's incredibly safe (neither of us ever felt concerned at any time of the day or night), full of history, excellent food and bars, exquisite architecture and a short walk to basically everything. Don't have a bland Barcelona experience staying in a hotel. Book an apartment in the Gothic Quarter from a local and have some fun. You can sleep when you get home :)

Best place in Bareclona. The main touristy part of this barri is buzzing with shops, restaurants, cafes and people! In a nice way. It's also worth getting lost in the charming (sometimes) dingy alleys and discovering beautiful churches, restaurants and graffiti!
Wandering and exploring. Small individual shops, bars, restaurants. Museums and attractions also here . Liked just to explore here.

A real highlight. We went around this area with Runnerbean tours (who were excellent). It is a warren of old buildings that have been layered on one another over the centuries. There are some interesting shops to keep you amused. As ever, keep your valuables secure, however we witnessed no trouble. Don't miss a wander around Barri Gotic!

Get lost in this experience. We did get a local walking tour the first day just to, we hoped, get oriented. Tour was nice BUT there is no way to get your head around this area. Get lost, have fun and explore. We used Trip Adviser City app and that was a life saver twice when we got "lost" Great food-restaurants/drinks, shops and stores. Great sites...No difficulty with pickpockets for us BUT be careful and aware!!

Interest round every corner. You never know what you'll see next in the Gothic Quarter, good restaurants, bars, tourist shops, upmarket shops, small alleyways, the Cathedral, interesting buildings, graffiti art and huge numbers of people out enjoying themselves. The area never seems to sleep. Great fun and a good vibe

Does anyone sleep at all in Barcelona?. We stayed in our AIRBNB just off Las Ramblas and down one of the little alleyways. Always rocking night and day but once inside it was quiet as. What ever time we ventured outside there were always people out and about having fun. Late at night there they were, early morning when we got up about 6am one day to go off there were people still about. The alleyways, the shops, the buildings - all so amazing. Just a fantastic area to get lost in and have fun. Definitely a MUST to walk around.

it is nice to walk around!!!. I liked very much to walk around and see all that gothic architeture. It is not really my favorite art but it was nice to go there. You can not miss if you like art the Macba museum of contemporary art that it is on the neigbourhood.
Nice place. We walked through it, and had a very nice lunch. In general Spain has a very good kitchen, and a wide variety of seafood

Little, teeny streets packed with fun restaurants.. Loved the area for restaurants and architecture, but be extremely careful about pickpockets. I carried an impenetrable travel wallet, but we could see all the subtle distractions being used to take your focus off your possessions, for just the few seconds it takes. Don't watch the flying lights that are shot in the air, for instance, or if you do, cling tightly to your valuables.

Amazing. Could spend all day wandering around the gothic quarter, every turn of the narrow alleys brought more surprises. The cathedral is lovely and the view from the roof worth the queue for the lift
Leisurely walk. There are great shops and restaurants in this area. The architecture is amazing. Take a day and look around.
Beautiful area. This area of the city is the real Barcelona. Lovely little cafes and shops. I found some great clothes in the little boutiques, made in Spain or Italy at reasonable prices.

Back in the Medieval times!. What a wonderful place this is! Walking the magical story - telling alleys you can shop, enjoy a gelatto, coffee ...or just walk and enjoy the fascinating gothic architecture. Barrio Gotico was my favorite place in Barcelona. It is located of La Rambla no way to miss it! Enjoy!
Beautiful. The architecture and the steel like light glinting from the high sided building takes the breath away. The place is full of tourist influenced shops but not in a bad way. Recommend

I love walking through this part of Barcelona.. It is like the most wonderful maze of shops, sights, smells, colors, and plazas opening up from dim passages between wonderful old buildings. Just wondering around in this part of the city is worth a day of your time. You will find wonderful things to see, do and eat. It is just magical and it is safe. I could spend a week just enjoying this part of the city.
Great for a sunday and not only walk. Had a great walk through the small street of Barrio Gotic. Small shops, restaurants. You can visit also the Cathedral and go to the top!

Great area to meander and explore. We truly enjoyed taking our time to wander through this area. All sorts of twisty turny little alleyways filled with neat old buildings, a wide variety of shops, and tons of little bars. I really enjoyed one street in particular, Calle Petritxol...shoes, chocolate, jewelry all along one street. Wonderfully lethal combination.
Interesting. Nice place to walk around and appreciate the architechture and winding streets. Quite a few touristy shops and restaurants. Very busy, some street entertainers to enjoy.

Well worth a guided visit. This was my second guided visit and I appreciated learning more about this quarter. The ruins and old buildings are marvelous and give you an appreciation of the Barcelona of yore.
Fantastic Cathederal. Lovely area, lots of quaint old streets with lots of tapas bars. Very high old buildings and shady courtyards, a must when you visit Barcelona.
Great walk. This is a great area to walk around. Don't rush, take your time and enjoy all the quirky alley ways that make up the place!

Great area to lose yourself in. Lots of little shops and restaurants, terraces to sit out on that emerge out of little alleyways that snake around cathedrals. Best bet to escape some of the load busy areas like Las Ramblas, would've easily been able to spend more time there had it not been for our other attraction tickets.
full of charm. this was more than we had expected so many great shops bars and restuarants a bit of a warren so take a map

Exploring the Gothic Quarter. Walking down the streets of the Gothic Quarter is one of the best things to do in order to get away from the agitation on Las Ramblas:). You can find a lot of great little shops and coffee shops to relax .
Nice variety. Nice shops to find hand made items ( a littele expensive), and to find vegetarian restaurants. Visited day and night and was pretty nice each time

Lovely area. This is a fab area of the city, we got there using the city tour bus. it is full of old style architecture, beautiful restuarants and cafes. There are street performers around which were very entertaining.

Wonderfull area, but very many people. The Gothic area contains a lot of interesting stuff for any person interested in archeology. Remains of medieval and even Roman buildings can be seen, and it is very easy to see where parts of buildings have been reused.But there are a LOT of tourists, and therefore the area isn't calm and relaxing, which is a bit sad. Though if you do leave the main streets, there are fewer people. So go. Roam the streets and find a hidden gem.There are and abundance of quaint shops selling everything.
very accessible. Easy to get around and great to look at. We stayed in this area and would do so again if possible. You can also get reasonably priced tours with well informed guides.
Interesting. Loved the little alleyways, quaint shops and bars, had a great time exploring the area and sampling the bars

A step back in time!. To wonder around the narrow streets, with the tall buildings was to escape the hussle and bussle of the modern Barcelona, lots of unusual shops and little bars and cafes. Very beautiful squares.
Gothic quarter. We stayed in the Gothic quarter at an Air BnB. The quaint streets, the food, the history and on and on. Just roam around get a churro and chocolate and cafe and people watch.

Quaint, quaint and quaint. Spent 5 days in Barcelona and managed to spend a part of everyday walking the winding streets of the Barri Gotic. Took a tour of the big points like the Town Hall and Cathedral. You have to go and just follow the streets and you will find the most wonderful and quaint stores…perfumeries, leather stores, jewelry stores from local artists, etc. Restaurants everywhere and plazas both big and small everywhere. A definitely must do!!
Skinny Streets. The Gothic Q has lot's of cool shops, great architecture, old narrow streets and is definitely worth the trip.

Tour around the Gothic Quarter. We enjoyed the walk and architecture in the Gothic Quarter.Well worth the visit but doesn't quite qualify as excellent.We felt that the area could do with some nicer coffee shops - probably went down the wrong street!

Gothic Quarter...... A place to get lost and enjoy !. Lose yourself in the Gothic Quarter of Barcelona, that's what we did and discovered sights of historic beauty at every turn, found very special shops and delicious restaurants. We dedicated a full day to this unique area and were even blessed with glorious sunshine to do so. A must.

Just SO interesting. The tiny streets leading you to several squares are fantastic, the buildings are fascinating, the little stores are cute but like in any touristic area make sure you're buying something at a fair price. The little restaurants throughout the area are all so delicious! You can't go wrong with Basque food.

Loved wandering around. This is exactly where you want to be in Barcelona. Right in the center of town with hundreds of tapas bars of excellent quality. The cobblestone streets, lit by beautifully crafted lights make for an old world field and excellent photographs. We were there for the fiesta of St. Michael and the town was just crazy good fun.

Lovely atmosphere. Visit the laneways in this old Roman quarter of the city to get the atmosphere of Barcelona. Lots of museums to be visited, the cathedral to see, and the extensive Roman remains. Good tapas bars too.
Submerse yourself in the small streets of the Gothic quarter. Submerse yourself in the small streets of the Gothic quarter. Great architecture and a great array of shops and tapas bars.

Nice. A nice place to wonder around. Beautiful buildings. Actually some of the must see buildings in Barcelona are located in this quarter. The Cathedral is spectacular, it reminded me of Notre Dame from Paris, but smaller... Palace of Catalan Music is also located in this quarter...
Lovely place. They have nice markets at the weekend but don't bother eating -food poor. Have a drink and people watch.
Unfinish Cathedral. it's an amazing building ,a lot of shops and restaurants along the street I like the gift shops around the there...
Free walk tours. Google the free walking tours, they are a great way to see the city and learn history without getting lost!!! I went on two, Gothic & Gaudi.

Walk and enjoy!. We liked friendly atmosphere of pleasure. It was nice to see the local families with children and dogs enjoy their weekend at food markets, cafes and restaurants with outdoor seating.

Fun. This area is a blend of history and modernity. Strolling around alleys, there were Roman remains, medieval buildings as well as chic bars, shops. No maps required. It's certainly worth to spend an afternoon to visit, aside from the Gaudi's architectural buildings.

Well preserved.. See examples of Gothic architecture in a complimentary setting. Whole neighbourhoods from this period. See Gothic alongside neighbourhoods from other periods. It's a bit wired, but it works. Worth the time and effort.
pleasant wander. just off La Rambla and hidden away but worth finding and strolling through the area, narrow streets, pleasant square and shops.

Get Lost!. Barcelona's pedestrian zone is fantastic! The narrow streets are not too congested and are clean and well lit in the evening hours. There is something new to discover around each corner, a cozy bar, an antique bookshop, a shop for knives or ladies fans...get lost and find something amazing!
Very atmospheric!. Really liked this area and though the Cathedral here was beautiful both inside and out. This is a particularly nice area for restaurants and little craft shops etc

Quaint and Beautiful Area. We ventured into the Gothic Quarter on our way to Barcelona Cathedral (not to be confused with Sagrada Familia) and the streets and walls and area are really beautiful. It was raining that morning that we went and that gave it even a more gothic feel. Has some shops along the side streets.

Lots of side streets. The Gothic Quarter is a great place to meander through. It's many side streets have restaurants, bars, shopping, museums. Much better than walking along Las Ramblas which can be very busy with hordes of people.

The best place to get lost. It's quite a maze, and that's part of what's fun about it - you never know when you'll find another cluster of great shops or cute building or interesting museum. Worth setting aside an afternoon just to wander aimlessly through.
Just go and immerse yourself. Wonderful to just walk around and get 'lost' in the utter beauty of the area. Lots of restaurants and bars as well as shops make this an enjoyable excursion.

old Barcelona with quaint roads. This is the old quarter with narrow streets, numerous eating places , Roman ruins, Government buildings & plazas. Placa Reial has neo classical lamps designed by Gaudi.
The synagogue is also in this area & so is Cats4 restaurant whose first cover was also done by Gaudi

My favorite!. This, to me, is the most exciting, entertaining, historic and beautiful section of Barcelona. The pedestrian only streets, the winding, seemingly endlessly meandering alleys filled with shops, plazas, old cathedrals and delightful tapas restaurants make this a must do. Let yourself be swept along with the crowds or set off down some alley on your own, you're sure to find entertainment. Love it. Sure, La Ramblas is interesting, but to get the real experience, head off on one of the alleys. You'll be glad you did!

Back to the Middle Ages, with lots of tapas and wine!. The Barri Gotic, with his structural foundations and many buildings firmly from the middle ages, is everything anyone interested in urban planning could wish for - lots of old buildings and high density living and extremely walkable - I loved this area and generally got off on the Jaume I (go to the Barcelona history museum near the marina to find out more about this person) - there is a lovely little candy and pastry shop right off the exit - go inside and buy some of the taffys (hard candies, not soft chewy ones) - as gifts for the folks back home - they are wonderful. If there is any specific area of Barcelona you want to go to on a visit, this is it - go to the Cathedral of Santa Maria and do the roof tour to get a birds eye view of much of this area.

Perfect area to stay in the city. Close enough to most of the action without being in the center of tourists. Beautiful restaurants everywhere and bars of all types and expense. Loved this areas. Would stay here again

Wow!. Narrow streets, colorful buildings, the cathedrals and squares, local life, street art, and shopping combine to make this a great place to visit. A Must See - but mind your wallets and purses from the thieves. They are very talented here,
Awesome. The oldest neighborhood in barcelona and it is amazing. And it´s free to see, for backpack person is perfect.

Heart of the City for visitors!. First visit to this great and delightful city and stayed within easy walking distance of Placa de Catalunya. Easy walking and central to transportation within the area and to the airport. Lots to see and do and a safe area. Las Ramblas is a fun place to people watch and the Cathedrals, old buildings, Gaudi attractions, markets, eating and shopping areas, and even the Picasso museum are within reasonable distances. Transportation to all other areas is readily accessible. Glad we selected this area as our primary location to operate from.
Great Location. Great place, very historic, and so much to see. The back street area very picturesque and at night all lit up and street entertainers in quiet areas.

The true spirit of BCN. Authentic!!!! Narrow streets, a plaza at every corner, best cafes and pubs in BCN and definitely the place to shop for original stuff in BCN away from the usual international brand chains.

Look up! Look down! Don't miss anything!. From the Hebrew tiles on the sidewalks to the wonderful and surprising narrow alleys crammed with bright windowboxes, this is a city with a living history whose residents seem to be fully engaged in living and doing. WOW.

Interesting history... Booked a walking tour out of an English/Irish pub near Las Ramblas. Really enjoyed the walk and the tour, especially hearing all of the medieval and modern history that relates to these lanes and buildings. Lots of good photo opps and stops on the way. It's an area where I'd take a walking tour or a very good guide book as there's so much interesting history in a very small area.
Get lost.... This is a fun neighborhood to spend some time in and get lost down the narrow stone streets. There's a good mix of "chain" stores, as well as local shops and restaurants.

quaint old city. roman ruins, cathedrals, restaurants, cobblestone streets.A wonderful place for a stroll through an old european city - the typical, you might say. :) I love just walking through these areas - wandering about to see what you can see and enjoy the lovely old buildings, and people-watch. Sit at a cafe and have a glass of wine and relax.It's touristy, but I still love this stuff. :)

good shopping. Old quarters are always more interesting than the main roads (in my opinion). Here there were some nice restaurants, not so crowded as those on La Rambla. The shops were a little more up market as well; no tacky mass produced souvenirs.

Interesting history. It would be easy to overlook this area (a block or so off Las Ramblas)--don't. There are interesting buildings, museums (including Museu Picasso), Roman ruins...you get the picture. It is an easy walk from Placa de Catalunya but also close to the Metro.

Well worth stepping off La Rambla. Well worth stepping away from La Rambla to explore the Gothic quarter. Narrow streets open up into courtyards which are lovely to sit down in for a beer (much cheaper than on La Rambla). Also some very nice shops dotted around. The cathedral is beautiful but we didn't go in on this occasion.

Walking Tour Barri Gottic. This tour was conducted out of the Tourism office in Barri Gottic and was good value for 15 Euro. The guide was knowledgeable and was able to give us good insight into the history of the area.
Interesting. There is a combination of interesting history and lots of shopping that ranges from tacky to great. The cathedral and Jewish quarter are interesting. The people watching is fun.

Fun to Wander. It's fun to wander the narrow streets but we found some dark alleyways which can be a little frightening around sunset. There are some interesting boutiques and cafes. You can access some of the popular sites and cafes such as Els 4 Gats Cafe, placa sant Jaume, the Barcelona cathedral, and turron shops. It's so easy to get lost but try to stick with the streets that have the most tourists. Definitely worth touring around!

Lots of walking but interesting. Picturesque narrow streets, a lot of unique shops and restaurants to explore. Lots of walking if you want to see most of it. Bordered by Las Ramblas street which we found to be very crowded and expensive compared to shops and restaurants inside Barri Gotic.
Great area to get lost without minding it. Good place, nice streets, good food and shopping in every corner. It can be very crowded, like when we were there during the celebrations of the Mercia.
Authentic. Old town is always interesting to visit. I enjoy sightseeing ancient buildings, narrow streets with full of history.
very romantic. My friend said that she knows why there are not many signs with directions there - to get lost in these narrow streets and wander there all day...

Excellent walking experience.. Its kind of history meets the reality. The roman remains are preserved well same goes to the medival time works.We took the advantage of the Barcelona card (the walking tour is included), the guide was very knowledgeable and friendly. Few tips for the future travellers: 1. keep your belongings always attended. 2. check the quality of the headphone (if you do the tour via Barcelona tourism). 3. careful about the traffic passing by. 4. try to get some sapnish fast food- else you will feel too tired after the walk. :)

Interesting quirky. Very touristy but wander down the small back streets especially in the Jewish area and it is so pretty and so interesting. The buildings around La Catedral are beautiful. Remember to look upwards.
Afternoon stroll. Great to amble around this part of Barcelona, stumbling across pretty squares & some lovely boutique shops
Afternoon stroll. Great to amble around this part of Barcelona, stumbling across pretty squares & some lovely boutique shops

A wonderful area to explore. This area of Barcelona is wonderful to walk around and to explore. There are many shops to browse in and great restaurants and bars to choose from. There are lots of historic buildings to pay a visit to as well.

Unique experience. If you go to Barcelona, this is a must do walk. The neighborhood and it's atmosphere is unique.
Still some people may find it ... Differently.
But if you are a person who likes to blend and feel the atmosphere of the city or country that you are visiting, then you cannot miss it.

Gothic Quarter. So much to see and a very nice blend of old and modern environments.
Bring a camera...especially for the cathedrals/churches and wear comfortable shoes. You can walk around for hours and not see everything.
Quaint streets. Lots of little streets and passageways to explore with different shops, bars and cafes to enjoy. A great place to sit with a drink and admire the architecture.
Amazing. Cant miss out gothic quarter when on a visit to Barcelona. Amazing ambience but visit during the tourist season. Very vibrant and interesting happenings. Can spend an evening.

Wonderland!. I stayed in a 900+ year old building in the Barri Gotic and loved it all except lugging my suitcase up the stairs. Every trip outside was an adventure. I never knew what I would find around the next corner. What really makes utterly great, however, is that people live and work in this area. It's not just some tourist dive.
Charming. We took a City Walk of the Barri Gotic. So many shops, restaurants, and history in this very charming area.

Favourite area of Barcelona. In my opinion the most interesting area of Barcelona to just walk around and soak up the atmosphere, get some food and drinks and while away an evening. Although the restaurant owners know it too and set the prices accordingly.

A great area to just wander around and lose yourself. This is my favourite part of Barcelona - I love walking around all of the old lanes, taking in the architecture and stumbling across great little shops and bars.

My favorite. I love the Barri Gotic! Take a god day or even two and walk around. I sugest you get of at metro station Urquinanona and go down via Leitana. Once you visit the ''main'' part of the barrio, do not forget the Santa Maria Del Mar Cathedral a little down via Leitana and opposite side of the street. While you are there, why not visit the Bubò boutique if you have a sweet tooth!
Narrow streets with beautiful Plazas. Although it can get crowded, we walked in the early morning hours to enjoy coffee and pastries. So many charming shops and little streets with markets!
Do it!. It'd be hard to miss the Gothic Quarter- I recommend getting a walking tour to show you all the sights and hear the stories you will miss otherwise

My favourite part of Barcelona. I lived in Barcelona for a year and the Gothic Quarter was always my favourable place to go. There is everything - shops, history, nice places to dine and some souvenir shops, if you are a tourist.
Great to walk around. This is a must see in Barcelona...many landmarks in this part of town. Recommend doing a walking tour as the guides can give you the much history of this area

Great to walk around. Super nice to walk around, well Barcelona center is not that big and it really makes it so easy when you are a tourist because you only need a map and go walk!! lots of bars, restaurants, stores, museums, the beach...everything!
beautiful part of Barcelona with wonderful bars and restaurants. You are spoilt for choice for restaurants and bars. Varying prices and quality but something for everyone. Not to be missed.
Feel the History. you can feel the history of the Gothic Quarter, awesome medieval and roman architecture very well preserved.So worth the visit.

Loved the VBRO and location. Loved the location!!! Walked thru old european streets to get to almost ALL of the sites we wanted to see!! it really felt like living in old europe!!!!Sant Pere Mes Baix. It had 2 bedrooms, 2 baths, just a fabulous location and the interior was excellent!! We'd stay there again in a heart beat!! Also, the owner of the creamery 2 doors down was a delight to get to know!!!!!!!

Unique place for a small items of jewellery. My wife found a unique Spanish Jeweller who does some work for Swartzski and she made up two sets of Crsytal drops/ear rings for my wife for around 40 Euros!There are also many other small personal small shpos in this quarter

Gothic exploration. The Gothic Cente stretches from La Rambla to Via Laietana, and from the Mediterranean seafront to Ronda de Sant Pere. We put on our walking shoes, stepped out of our hotel and kept walking for five hours without even having lunch, because there was so much to see - ancient architecture, including the Carrer del Bisbe, the Roman wall and aquaduct, murals down one whole side street, markets selling antique jewelry and other effects and the cathedral which was beautifully decorated. Just walking down La Rambla during the day or at night is an experience. It seems to always be packed with people. There are lots of placas, restaurants and shops in all the little side steets. Barcelona is really alive!

Great to wander around. Narrow streets with varied small shops lead on to large squares with historic buildings or a peaceful Moorish courtyard/ the old Cathedral cloisters. Acrobats perform just off the Cathedral Square and a lady sings nearby accompanied by a solo guitar. Just a great atmosphere.

have fun getting lost and explore. We were lucky enough to have our rented flat in this area and wondered the back streets every evening I used a small clutch purse ( that had a strap to fit my hand in and then hold the purse) this worked well just be aware of the people around you The streets are narrow twisty and beautiful you always end up in square with bars to enjoy a coffee and watch the world go by Yes there are people trying to sell you cans of beer at night and brollys if raining but don't let that spoil your vist some of shops are for tourist souvenirs but so many more are independent we both loved wandering around
