Check out restaurant reviews before you head out - we had many very disappointing meals. Had fun buying inexpensive jewellery, locally made shoes and Spanish wine.

Very good option for walking, shopping, restaurants. Very nice and well preserved Gothic Quarter. Good for walking, food and shopping!!! Ramblas, old buildings and churches are very interesting and old constructions
Just let yourself wander.... The Barri Gotic is a fascinating way to discover how wonderful it is to simply get lost. And don't mind choosing not to follow the crowd.

excellent. The Gothic Quarter is amazing.
Be sure to wear some comfortable shoes , wonder the streets and explore.
Amazing architecture, quaint little streets, shops, tapas bars.
You can spend hours and hours wondering around

Ditch the crowds and explore the side streets and alleys. Spend a couple of hours or more exploring old Barcelona. Historic architecture, quaint eateries and specialty shops with friendly vendors reward wanderers who move beyond the beaten paths onto side streets and alleys. A welcome respite from the crowds. A few minutes of prior online research or a quick glance through your tour book will enhance the experience.

The best of BCN. I lived in Barcelona for a few months years ago and fondly recall my best memories being in the gothic quarter. It is the oldest part of the city, with many winding pedestrian ways, hidden treasures in the boutiques, cafes, restaurants and squares. You could spend your entire trip to Barcelona in the Barri Gotic and never get bored. A lot of history and beauty, a rich area of the city, culturally. And my personal favorite neighborhood.

Free entertainment. This is a must, you can just walk the streets and be entertained. There are museums and great bars and restaurants along the way but it's so worth it just to walk these old streets and take it all in. The Barcelona museum is one of my favorites, it gives you the history of what you are seeing in the Bari Gotic and tells you the history of the city.

Worth a visit once and that's it. The buildings are pretty but the vibe is a bit odd, it seems the weirdos of Barcelona congregate in this area. I liked it because it's so different to the rest of Barcelona as the streets are alleyways and more alleyways which you should just wonder through (don't bother with a map) which made a nice change to the grid like set up up of the rest of the city.There's also a beautiful cathedral and good places to eat but it wasn't the highlight of our visit

Essential viewing. There is no point in visiting Barcelona and not spending considerable time exploring its oldest neighbourhood. Despite the tourist crowds flocking to the Picasso Museum and the Cathedral, the area offers many out-of-the way streets, shops, restaurants and sights that reward those willing to wander and get lost. One night, after an excellent dinner in a small restaurant recommended by my hotel, the location of which they drew on a map, I got lost trying to retrace my steps to a hotel. Wandering far afield (or so I thought) through dark, deserted streets, I remained calm and collected for the city seems very safe. When I eventually hailed a cab that took me back to my hotel, I found that I was, in fact, only six blocks from home. The Barrie Gotic is smaller than it looks, and more interesting than you might initially think.

Great Area, Lots of people. I loved this area! There are lots of people, but if you keep walking further in away from the ramblas there are less. I wish I would have explored more of this area. Another plus is that there is some shade down the narrow streets.

Great area to stay in. We rented an apartment for 3 days here & found it to be a great area to stay. We were able to walk to most places we wanted to see & combined that with the Hop On Hop Bus to get around Barcelona. Found many great restaurants & shops here. We loved walking down the small crooked streets just to see where they would take us.
Gothic Quarter. Lovely to stroll round - lots of little alleyways with shops and bars - a good feel for the history of the Gothic area.

Too Crowded. This area has some nice medieval streets, but much of it is over-crowded with tourists, kitschy souvenir shops, and chain stores. El Born section is much nicer for strolling and finding unique stores.
Walking is nice in this area. you will enjoy walking in that area sooo much either during daytime or at night. Loved it soo much. many shops and cafes

Atmospheric area. Cool, narrow streets leading through ancient architecture. Interesting little shops, wine bars and restaurants. This is a real area where people live and work so it has heart and vibrancy. Well worth a visit.
must see BUT. very special but very commercial shops, many doors closed and seem to be just for storage, but of course you must see it if you visit barcelona
Very Interesting. Again a trip worth going on ,very good guide not too much walking but lots of fascinating information recommended

Lose yourself in the Latin Quarter. The Barcelona Latin Quarter is a great place to wander. You could spend days walking through here and never walk the same street twice. The whole area is pedestrian friendly and chock full of surprises in shopping and eating. It's a maze of alleys and squares packed full of plazas, restaurants, bars and shops. Based on my experience I'd recommend a slightly structured approach to exploration. Depending on how much time you have, on a tourist map, divide the are into cells and explore one or more cells in a session, punctuated by frequent drinks and snacks in the bars you'll discover. We didn't take this approach and now struggle to find (and recommend) some of the great discoveries we made.Within 100 metres of La Rambla the attractions become far more touristy but there's plenty to keep you satisfied.

Cool area to lose yourself in. And it will be easy to do-- just start walking around and before you know it, you will be off the beaten trail. There are lots of interesting buildings, churches, and even Roman ruins to discover along the way. The overall feel is laid-back and not as crowded as walking around Las Ramblas.
Great. beautiful old quarter with tons of shopping, nice bars and restaurants, great architecture, loved it.

Over rated. I really was expecting more. Barcelona has done a great job of promoting Barri Gotic. If you can brave crowds of tourists morning, noon and night it is a beautiful place but I think its overdone. There are too many crowds to be able to enjoy this place.

Excellent location to wander and get lost. You'll discover new and interesting sites each time you do. A good map and a sense of direction are helpful, but you can't go to far wrong to just walk in a particular direction. We felt very safe doing so.

Gorgeous. Atmospheric. Lovely well maintained historical buildings. The old cathedral is stunning too. Summer time is mad because of the crowds! But even they can't kill the splendour of the sites. My suggestion: walk down from Placa Catalunya and head down into the alleys with a camera. Get lost basically :)

A Historian's Dream Spot. If you love history and legends, this is your paradise. Loved the Gothic Quarter. Make sure to take a walking tour. The stories and events that happened here are fascinating. Beyond any guide book. My husband and I found a great group here on Trip Advisor. It started and finished at Travel Bar. It was free, but you are highly encouraged to pay in the form of a tip. I am not complaining, just informing, It was worth every penny. The guide was a college professor, and a great storyteller. In the Barri Gotic you will find museums, cathedrals, Roman ruins, shopping, bars, and restaurants. If you can stay anywhere n Barcelona, stay here. Hotels are reasonably priced. It's the heart and soul of Barcelona. I wish I could live here. How long until I retire?

Lots of alleys, nooks & crannies to explore. We always stay near this area. It's a great walking area with lots of local as well as brand stores. Plenty of places to eat offering everything you can imagine. Anyone who has been to Barcelona knows this area. One of the highlights of any trip to the city.

Lovely at night time. Great place for some boutique shops and little tappers bars. we wondered around the area and found some nice desert place as well as a delightful tapers restaurant. Not to many people in the area at the time so made it pleasant to view the area.

NOT FRIGHTENING AT ALL!. We had read that we were being daring to visit this area - not at all - it was fabulous, original, unique and very interesting - lots to see and do with a superb little antique market. Very busy in August but I like it that way.
Lovely place. Great place. Lots of nice bars and cafes. Lots to explore and the architecture is amazing. By night is also good

A Must Destination when in Barcelona. Walk, see, learn about this amazing quarter. There are stories from past to present and the views are remarkable - a photographer's paradsie.If you like charming ochre walls, tiled roofs, and archeological remnants from the Roman and early Catalan periods, it is the place to be.Walking tours are a great way to see, walk and learn.

Great architecture. Lovely walk around the gothic quarter. Fabulous architecture and nice shops to browse in. If you're i the area, be sure to pay a visit to the cathedral, it's free to visit and lovely and cool.
A must see.. You have to visit the Gothic Quarter when in Barcelona. It is really charming and has many restaurants and small shops.

Delightful maze of old streets. Wander around the old quarter without any agenda. You will get a sense of old Barcelona. It's beautiful, although if you want a quiet night's sleep, stay elsewhere: this quarter never stops.

Found a great bar. Enjoyed walking around the Gothic Quarter, visiting the Cathedral, and the quaint shops. We found our favorite bar in Barcelona: L'Antiquari that advertised the best mojitos and they were!!

Magic. Very hot ...
The best was the tour ...
With the photograph who took pictures of us....
Thank you for the best picture ever..
atmospheric. very nice area to stroll and take in the architecture and bars and restaraunts. alley ways and passages dont seem to end

Getting lost never felt so good.... It feels truly like a maze, and it's easy to lose your sense of direction. Not that you'll be complaining... the old, many Roman, building and narrow alleyways with scores of interesting shops, restaurants, tapas bars, etc will make you not want to find yourself again! You can while away the hours just walking around. Beware for those coming from the new world - it's old-looking, sometimes a bit dirty or smelly or run-down, but full of character and life. Unfortunately, like all major attractions, it's full of tourists (then again, I'm one too, so who am I to complain...) and consequently you'll pay more here for food that in other neighborhoods in Barcelona. Just take your time, and don't forget to look left, right, up and down - there are pleasant surprises everywhere.
Favorite part of Barcelona!. This part of Barcelona is the oldest part. Lots of small cobbled stoned streets. Just walk and get lost! lots of great restaurants around and a gelato at every corner!

Great place day and night. Lovely enchanting area of Barcelona, you feel safe and there are great restaurants and spontaneous outdoor entertainment which spring up around La Catedral to include Opera and fire eaters. trying to dine to dine alfresco is tricky though.
go at evenings. great wondering in the small streets and piatsas. in sunday's morning a spiritual atmosphere surrounds the quarter/

Walk around and enjoy. We basically keep getting lost and finding new plazas, bars and restaurants every day. A great place to see in Barcelona, not sure where the Gothic quarter starts/ends and the Old city the same.

Gothic Quarter. The whole of Barcelona is one architectural palace every building is interesting .There hundreds of interesting buildings in Barcelona. The gothic quarter is very interesting place and is located at the hearth of the city. the building are just marvelous and the level of detail in them is just magical.
could get lost in here for days, in the good way. There are so many amazing nooks and crannies in here, lots of great food options and shopping. Really unique atmosphere and architecture.
lovely little streets. full of history, but also full of surprises - there are some lovely querky shops selling jewellery and clothes - just walk through the streets, they are enchanting

Too good to miss. Make sure you look upwards to see the windows and architectural features. Even the public lighting fixtures can be a joy. There are posh and quirky shops as well as the tourist shops so every row of shops is worth a look. Take a map with you to ensure you see everything otherwise you are bound to regret missing something or other.
Great place to explore. Fascinating part of old Barcelona, with history, interesting shops, and lots of places to eat and rink.

Beautiful area.... We walked around the area and also toured it on the Hop-on Hop-off bus....architecture is stunning! Every neighborhood in Barcelona has its own identity and Barri Gotic is no exception.

Great for strolling and sightseeing. We took an afternoon in Barca and strolled around the Gothic Quarter. Visited the cathedral (take the elevator to the top - the view is worth it), and generally strolled around doing some people-watching and admiring the history and architecture. I think we had a Fodors book that listed sights in the Barri Gotic, so that gave us a few highlights to look for and having an agenda contributed to the fun. Felt a bit like a scavenger hunt.
get lost wandering around this area. Many shops, churches, small passageways,,restaurants. just wander and see what you see,,, some art galleries. A nice change from the larger busier streets

Interesting. A fascinating maze of of old & narrow cobbled lanes. Fantastic Gothic architecture and lots of tucked away bars and restaurants, although choose carefully to ensure you eat somewhere authentic and at least Spanish! We made a few mistakes as it can be hard to tell at the door.

Nice place to walk, eat and absorb history. This place has interesting shops and cafés spread out within the quarter. You can take your time to stop and read about the history and take a break if you get tired and they carry on where you left off. So you can take your time to soak in the sights. Do wear comfortable shoes for sure.

Quaniter than Florence, more chic than Paris. Barcelona has got it going on!! Trendy stores selling beautiful clothes, shoes, jewelry, novelties. Many Eco-themed.Cute sidewalk cafes, tapas bars, churches, historic sites, oldest temple in Spain, cobblestone streets, open squares, trendy hotels! Street musicians playing at dusk! Best hot chocolate in the world! Guitar concerts in churches at night! Just wander around. It is safe and magical!
Interesting. Well worth a look. Nice restaurants in the area. Outdoor antiques bazaar. Cathedral worth a look inside.
Nice area. We lived in the middle of the quarter and it is really the place no 1 to visit if you´re in Barcelona. Pittoresque streets, nice cafes and a good atmosphere all day long.

I LOVE the Barri Gotic!!!. Stunning old buildings, winding narrow streets, cute and unusual boutique shops, bars and restaurants. It is especially atmospheric at night. Just be aware of the men standing on street corners trying to sell 'hash' and cans of Estrella. Bizarre, but kind of adds to the charm! The Barri Gotic is not to be missed if you're visiting Barcelona and is easily accessible off Las Ramblas.

Respite from the heat. In the intense heat and humidity of Barcelona this is an area to explore.The narrow alleys are cool, meandering tunnels of interesting medieval buildings where you'll find museums, offices, shops and workshops - also something to eat or drink!
Lost in history. Liked the non conforming layout - lost for hours in the gothic quarter. If you couldn't cope with hours take a decent map! It was amazing just soaking up the atmosphere
Step back in time. It was literally like going back in time. Definitely very different then anything you'll see in the United States. The winding roads were fun to explore and get lost in!

A maze within the old city. The Gothic Quarter is a wonderful way to weave your way the history of Barcelona. There are many small plazas, "streets", and alleyways that are so fun to go into, even if you feel lost at first. It seems as if there is always something off the beaten path to find, and it is a welcome relief from some of the crowds of the more familiar areas. So much history and beauty to experience in a relatively small space: make time to get out of the more "touristy" areas.

Amazing!. There is so much history in these buildings. To see walls and structures that pre-date the birth of Christ is astonishing. To stand in what was the palace of Ferdinand and Isabella where they received Christopher Columbus after he had discovered the new world is amazing.All of the architecture is beautiful. It is all so grand. It's hard to imagine this was all built without any of the tools we might use today.
Amazing Buildings. Brilliant for taking amazing photographs if interested in photography and a great tourist attraction if visiting barcelona
Fantastic streets. Fantastic streets to wander in, varied shops, nice restaurants with good food, nice people and nice and clean.

Great place to loose yourself...and your family. So many alley ways and shops. There was such a variety of things to see that each day was different. Definitely barter with the shop owners, especially for souvenirs!
Excellent. Lovely location, the Eulalia Cathederal a high point of the tour ( cathederal with its own geese !) we went back a couple of times to get the ambience

Great Place to soak up Barcelona's History. Fabulous buildings, great restaurants and a lifestyle that oozes with fashion and the finer things life has to offer. Immerse yourself in this amazing area of Barcelona.

Basic. Liked the change of street patterns as rest of city was in boring blocks. However it was still a bit tatty and no effort to present it. Lots of shops selling usual rubbish but also some with individual style selling arty or weird things.
Fascinating and absorbing. You need more than one day and plenty of time to stop and stare. So much to see round every corner. Lots of walking so comfortable shoes
Worth a visit.. Just off of la Rambla so worth going to. Lots going on and good sights to see. Street dancers are common. They are very entertaining. One of many places to visit in barcelona

Timeless. Just a fabulous part of an amazing City. You can really feel the true heart of Barcelona wandering through this area. Do not miss out on the Museum of Barcelona where you can go underground and check out the roman ruins of Barcio - up to two thousand years of history which no one was exploring the day we visited. Real highlight for us.
Our favorite area. This is the old section of Barcelona and so pretty with small alleyways, nice shops and great places to eat. Such a pretty area to walk through again and again.
A great place to spend a day. A very pleasent area with lots of sites to see.Many shops and beautiful buildings - you can spend half a day easily just walking around.

I have never been somewhere so alive. The gothic quarter is the most spectacular part of Barcelona. I have never been somewhere so alive, so bustling. Day or night the streets are full and there is such an exciting, busy atmosphere. So much to do and see, no matter how many days you are there for. The vegetarian restaurants are excellent, the ice cream stands plentiful and, at night, the best spot for interesting cocktail bars. If you're a pale guy though expect to be offered to go to Irish Bars about 6 times a night, literally chased down.As long as you are sensible with your belongings you will most likely be fine.I recommend going without a plan and just getting lost wandering around. Plenty of supermercats to keep buying water from. Not to be missed.
Really interesting and beautiful. Loved the Gothic area. just wander around beautiful little streets and see some amazing architecture.

Whole country in a one place. Pueblo Espanol is a very nice idea, you can see all parts of Spain in a one place.But on the other hand - you pay only for the opportunity of going to cafes, restaurants or shops and paying there again ;)
The Very Best of Barcelona. Walking thru these narrow streets one re lives the past and marvels at the architecture and can only wonder what these shops once were

Tourists and terraces ruin the neighbourhood. This was an exciting neighbourhood thirty years ago, when you could go and find unexpected discoveries. Now the antique shops and other family-owned businesses have disappeared; instead, Pakistani-owned supermarkets, noisy terraces full of beer-drinking tourists of the worst kind, and shops with soccer outfits hide the rich past of this barrio. A real shame. I protest together with the residents, the veïns.
A vibe of trend and culture. Such a great vibe as you walk through the oldest districts of Barcelona. A great mix of trend and culture .
Great. Walking tour worth doing we did the Picasso one, very interestingTourist office tricky to find underground Catalunya Plaza on the eastern side

Felt like Venice without the water. I liked this old area. We went thru quickly because we had limited time, however, this area reminded me of Venice without the canals. The streets were narrow, but well traveled. Fun area to explore!

Great place!. Love this place, I think the architecture is so beautiful, and has great restaurants and great shops (Bit overpriced, but in Barcelona everything is). I think it has a lot of magic in it. You can go just for the afternoon to grab an ice-cream or at night and find great restaurants and cool bars. The only reason my review is not excellent, is for the amount of people, bikes and rolling skater that make the place really crowded sometimes. But I think the charm of the place its hard to beat.

simply wonderful. a lovely area of the city... you keep turning a corner and another stunning sight confronts you! such a contrast to other parts of the city... we ended up in the Placa Real: beautiful too and we had a glimpse of some of Gaudi's first town decorations: the street lamps!
Barrier Gothic. Get yourself lost in this wonderful section of Barcelona. Each twist and turn of the jumble street will lead you to a gem of history and architecture.

Fantastic shops. We loved the narrow streets full of shops, bars and boutiques every corner there was another delight. The city hall was one of our favourites and the great square teaming with families. We walked for miles going round and round each time finding more to buy
Gothic Quarter. Visited on a walking tour, very friendly area with lots of restaurants, bars and culture. Very safe location with a lot of character.

Nice but not safe. This district is very colorful. You need to go for a wolk here, visit small shops. But be very careful, there are a lot of theives. One of them opened my bag and tryed to steal the pocket

The Heart of the City. Situated just off La Rambla is the wonderful gothic quarter. As you stroll through the streets you can feel the history of the place, and get an understanding of why the Catalans are so serious about where they fit ( or indeed don't) into the fabric of Spain. The buildings are stunning and you can see where Isabella seduced Christopher Columbus, where the Saints were buried in the cathedral and enjoy people watching in the various courtyard cafés and bars. Don't be in a hurry to leave here for Bourne or other suburbs - it doesn't get better in Barcelona.

Get lost in Barcelona!. An amazing adventure navigating the narrow and winding streets. You could easily spend days exploring the part of the city. Each street offers a variety of shops, tapas bars and gelato! Hidden in the streets are lovely squares with cafes to enjoy. I strongly recommend you spend a couple of hours or day exploring this part of the city by foot.

A must visit !. This is a place fulll of life, the beach at walking distance, many bars and restaurant with their own artistic touch of decoration and price are resonable. At any time you look out by your window you see people walk, eat, drink peacefully around.What a lovely place !If one decides to come to Bacelona, I strongly recommend to stay around this area, your stay will be worth paying !!!Sur I'll come back!Sur I' ll

Take a map. We did a few different tours, and even when walking on our own found great little shops that were impossible to find our way back to. Could've spent a few more days there easily...lots of cool stuff!

A must see in Barcelona. We strolled through the Gothic Quarter (Barri Gotic) of Barcelona on our first visit to this wonderful city. An older part of the city with narrow cobbled streets filled with museums, churches, cafes and shopping, it was a fun and interesting part of the city.
A walk back in Spanish history. The markets, historic buildings and easy acess in getting around the area. One feels as though they have walked back in time.
Great to walk around and enjoy the history. It is great to explore this part of Barcelona and wished we had more time. It is so beautiful and easy to navigate and when we went was not crowded.
Wonderful. Yes Barcelona is wonderfulVisited the gothic quarter as part of a walking tour, we'll worth the time and it enhances the experience with the background.Loved this area, go and enjoy.
Walk on the Gothic side. Go and walk without the map for a while and then when you have had enough get it out and see where the heck you have ended up. A lovely journey thru the ages
Great walk. Great area to walk around with loads of places to have a drink or get some food. Beware of the prices on the main drag. La Boquaria Market is amazing - pick up same great snacks in there!
The real old Barcelona. All corners of the quarter have something to offer. The Barcelona Cathedral is absolutely stunning. Picasso's museum is around the corner.
nice area. Interesting and very nice area with a lot of small shops. Close to la Rambla. A lot of nice small restaurants and bars.
Beautiful. Definitely worth a visit! Plenty of beautiful and interesting buildings to look at. We stayed here for a while walking down all the interesting streets away from the roads.
Great to wander. Beautiful and you can feel history. Lovely place to wander at night buzzing bars and restaurants, very romantic.
Gotic. We went in the evening and it was very nice with the lights. There was a lot of shops too. There were a lot of little street ! We have walked a lot but we liked it !

Great night life, special neighborhood. This quarter is a charming maze to get lost in and explore! Great nightlife, small and iconic restaurants on the narrow streets of El Gotic. Very close to La Rambla.
Gothic Quarter. Make sure you take the time to get lost in the neighborhood and shop and eat at local restaurants. It is very interesting with the narrow streets.
Old town, small street and wings of histroy. Its nice to stroll around in the gothic quarter. There is lots to see for history buff. Make sure to visit MUHBA.
nice to explore. nice to explore the small streets and its history, total time spent about 40 minutes, walking and taking photos.
Fantastic. There is one word for this place. Fantastic. Really enjoyed it as I'm huge fan of gothic architecture. Must see place for visitors

Great Place to Wander and Enjoy. So many cute streets with little shops and restaurants tucked in to them. Wandering through this district and enjoying the sights, sounds, cocktails and tapas is a great way to spend an evening.

Lovely neighbourhood. We enjoyed walking and cycling around this charming part of Barcelona. As it was very warm, the shaded streets meant we were able to keep cool whilst enjoying some of the area's lovely squares. Lots of lovely shops and galleries.

Neat, but confusing. We enjoyed wondering around, but could never get a feel of where we were in the maze of the Barri Gotic. Our map didn't outline the nooks and crannies of the passageways well and it was a blind effort on our part. I think if you knew what you were doing, it could be worthwhile. Alas, we didn't and just left feeling "eh".
Great walk, shop and eat !. Don't miss out on the paella ( mixed or black rice) from the Santa Maria del mar restaurant on the plaça. :)
Go back in time. Just walk around the Barrio Gotico, stop at small galleries, visit the Picasso Museum, eat at a taberna, bar, or restaurant, and relax. Feels very safe. Take lots of pictures.

Perfect!. Wonder around and enter into all streets and historical buildings and squares, that was great if you are into history especially. Touristic friendly structure and clean quarter is a must see. There are even very nice and creative places to eat or dring, do not miss.
Very Lively. We enjoyed walking around this area quite a bit. While this is still a touristy area, it is not as bad as las ramblas and with quite a bit more charm. Definitely recommend.

very atmospheric place. If happen to be in Barcelona you must wander through Gothic quarter, it will be like travelling through times: you will start your journey in 1st century AD when barcelona was a Roman colony and then go to Middle Ages with its bewitching cathedrals and then to neogothic period.

Wander until you get happily lost then taxi out. Definitely one of our best moments in our trip as you wander through and find some yummy goodness of tapas or gelato. Definitely a great place to get dropped off on one end by a taxi and then wander through and go with the flow of human folks and find some hidden gems and then taxi out. :)

Great walking tour. Learned so much during the wonderful walking tour that left from the tourist information center at 9:30 . We used the discount voucher from the Bus Touristic booklet that we got at the hotel. Very interesting to learn about the Jewish Quarter and how the Jews were blamed for the Bubonic Plague and massacred 100 years before the inquisition, and later we went back to see the old synagogue.

Overcrowded smelling disaster.. Mostly El Barrio Gotico is associated with the Rambla - the crowdiest and the most smelly place in Barcelona. Lots of tourists, artists, police and pickpockets. Didn't stay long.
Maze of streets and plazas. I did not have much time to explore in depth all but loved little streets and plazas with shops and restaurants...

Interesting. The Gothic Quarter is nice part of the city to wonder around and see what you can discover. We did not take any kind of tour just a map of the city. Lots of small shops and historical sights to see.
Great walks everyday!. Beautiful architecture, wonderful shops, restaurants and street musicians...loved this area...spent many a day just wandering...lovely Barcelona!
A must to visit!. Well worth a visit. plenty of shops and restaurants. just off la rambla there is the market full of meat, fruit, veg etc. A must visit...especially for the fresh juices!!

Nice to wander through!. Nice to walk through safe at night too. Lots of cafés hostels bars and different shops churches and squares to visit! Well worth a look or do a walking tour! Interesting place
Yea!!!!. This is without a doubt the best area to stay in Barcelona.This is the central area where it all happens.Best of all close to the Bouqueria!
Lovely. Wish we had more time to walk all the streets. Beautiful old and narrow streets. Take the Sandemann's walking tour to learn all the history behind it.

Less then I expected. Well, definetlly is nice to see, unusual at least. Other thing is that you just pass along those streets, but nothing special is there to see actually. Of course, every building there is a monument, but if you are tired there is no descent caffe or restourant to sit and rekax.

The Old City. The old part of Barcelona was part of the Roman empire and you can see some the walls still there. If you are a history buff its the place for you to spend time at. There are old churches, museums, etc. to visit. The large city market is here too.

Nice area to get lost in for the day!. The Goth area of Barcelona is one not to miss. It is an area great to get lost in and find those little unique shops and places to have tapas and some wine or just to look over. Great architecture in this area. The prices tend to be lower then other areas of Barcelona for eating and shopping. Don't let all the hostels scare you away, just a lot of college age kids discovering Barcelona too around this area. They all pretty much kept to them selves even though this was height of summer travel. We enjoyed this gem within the lager gem of Barcelona!

Worth a visit. It felt like going back in time being in this area. The old world charm of this area makes a definite impression on you. You cant help but find parts of this area fascinating. It feels a bit like a warren of small, narrow lanes that occasionally open up on to a larger square or gathering place.Each lane has a variety of interesting, quirky small shops. Some of which are a bit touristy, but others are much more attractive and feel more authentic. Some of the larger historic buildings you can go in to for free, including their inner courtyard areas. Others you have to pay to enter, but you may find worthwhile if its your thing e.g. art museums, etc.One small square near the beautiful old church had puppet shows in the middle with puppets playing the pipe and dancing. This was great and free, but people were throwing coins in to a hat. In another much larger central market square type of area in front of the church, there were lots of activities going on. Art displays, folk dancing, including some unexplained ritual of old folk dancing around their "handbags and hats". Each to their own!! But it was all fun and entertaining and free.There are lots of cafes in and around these squares and market areas, but we found them to be touristy, expensive and staff not to attentive. A short walk away from these communal open areas we found better, more cosy and cheaper small cafes in the small lanes.It was worth the time and some of the more memorable architecture and scenery that we experienced in Barcelona.

Favourite neighbourhood of Barcelona. My boyfriend and I love this neighbourhood so much, it is easily our favourite in Barcelona. You can get lost (and you will) exploring the tiny alleys. There are so many wonderful little shops, restaurants, bars and beautful buildings. The area basically encompasses everything between Via Laietana and Las Ramblas, or anything between Jaume and Liceu. Some of the main streets are fairly busy but it's much easier to lose the bulk of the tourists compared to Las Ramblas.Just take random streets, wander and enjoy :)
Beautiful old neighborhood!. Don't miss this beautiful neighborhood! Ideally, take a walking tour to really appreciate it. We took a "Runner Bean Tour" which was excellent.
Shopping. All though this area is hard to navigate getting lost in here is half the fun. I found some amazing shops with great statement pieces. Although a bit expensive its worth the look!

Holiday. This place is buzzing so many restaurants to choose from and character , you could walk around this place for hours admiring the buildings and you will get lost. Don't use a shop as a place mark as all shops close their roller door and they all look alike
Gothic quarter. Nice area to walk in. The architecture is beautiful to look at. This area has a spooky feel to it, was lots of fun.
Fun to wander the streets. Tapa bars, and small shops abound as you get lost while admiring the gothic architecture at every turn.
Cool architecture. The buildings are beautiful. It's amazing how you'll walk through what seems like alleys that open up to shopping districts, then open again to La Rambla.

Just roam around, you are sure to find something interesting. Narrow streets, interesting buildings, and unusual shops (such as one that sells masks exclusively). This is an interesting area to walk through ( a good map helps keep you oriented). The buildings are high enough and streets are narrow enough so that it is easy to stay in the shade (a real help in summer). There are also interesting museums worth visiting in this area including Museu Europeu d'Art Modern and the Picasso Museum.
Charming old section with tiny streets.. There are some shops and restaurants and the cathedral, which is amazing. Worth a few hours strolling--make sure you see the old Roman walls
Wander round and enjoy the old streets. Wander round and get lost amongst the old narrow streets with shops and bars a plenty. The old cathedral (free) is well worth a visit too.
atmospheric. a fascinating area to walk through, lively in some places and very quiet in others, the architecture and shops are really something to see for yourself

Good experience. When u have time, take a stroll along the gotic quarter.. its old, but at least its different from those modernized buildings u see in barcelona. There are lots of shops and bars over there. Good way to destress yourself.

This is walking back in time!!!!. Love this place,you need a whole vacation to walk the entire Gothic Quater,it is like walking back in time,the very feel of old european city with an architecture that goes from the roman times, medieval to the renasscentism, you find museums,shops,restaurants of all kinds,artists,churches,one of the most impressives things is the way that they have the buildings preserve. The Barcelona Cathedral is there and is masterpiece you can miss with an exibition of old religious artifacts,pieces that are beautifull and unique that they last for us to admire.

The beautiful history. When you go there you feel history. You feel your childhood. You feel comfort because new civilization is no more there. Every stone there gives you relaxation somehow. Old streets, stores, lamps, terraces, ......even roses in windows....really great feeling.
So much fun getting lost. Loved the winding, old stone roads, and the constant night life buzz. Great energy and vibe all through this area
Love this area. Quaint little part of Barcelona where you can explore the streets and find some delicious restaurants and bars.

Great part of the city - very authentic. Loved the nightlife. The small bars and tavernas, and off course the lack of main stream tourism. Good variety in restaurants, and good vegetarian alternatives. Probably good shopping as well, but I leave that to my girlfriend.
Gaudi work again. Another amazing site from Gaudi work. Plenty of little sights to see and around the place. I would recommend to walk around the little side street. you might find a hidden gem

Take the time to get lost in the gothic quarter. I lOVED the gothic quarter. This is where I found local artists and their work. If you are looking for authentic winding streets with character and a great photo - I highly recommend this.
Shopping and eating. Great place to spend time and explore all the great offerings! Small area which is easily covered by foot, nice small shops and places to eat.
love the Barri Gotic. Meandering through the narrow streets and alleys feels like what a walk through an old European City should.

Very enjoyable!. We walked around Barri Gotic on our first day in Barcelona. Lot's of restaurants and shops and if you are visiting La Rambla and La boqueria it's all within walking distance of each other as well as many other sights in that area. It's nice to just pick an outdoor spot for lunch and people watch.
just like the Ramblas. Mucho foot traffic and the lifestyle alone is enough to keep you people watching, so many places to watch street performers
love this area full of history shops and great restaurants.. the cathedral is a must see both day and night inside and out also a good landmark when getting around this area.

Immerse yourself in medieval times. My favorite neighborhood in Barcelona, and in fact one of my favs in Europe. Authentically ancient, you feel like you have travelled back in time to the medieval ages. Take you time and enjoy being immersed in the past!

Keep your eyes wide open. Great place to take a stroll and enjoy some tapas, mojitos, little shops and people watching. Make sure you look up as you're walking through the narrow paths/streets as there are several small statues looking down on you. The gothic architecture is amazing.
amazing architecture. Amazing architecture. Great shops to explore. Great people watching. A great way to spend a few hours or more exploring during your trip

Too bad. I had 15 years without visiting Barcelona. One of my best memories was the gothic quarter and I really wanted to take my sons to this magic place in this city. The place is in horrible shape, very dirty, and full of cheap stores one after another. It was really disappointing especially after we visited Girona in the same trip, which has an immaculate historical center. Barcelona deserves better.

Fun!. The architecture around the area is absolutely amazing. Walk around and go in to the Cathedral. There are several coffee shop and restaurants round the area if you get tired grab some cafe con leche..

Beautiful quarter, a bit touristy at times. The Gothic Quarter is the the part of Barcelona where we stayed. It's beautiful. There are lots of good restaurants and shops, most of them in the smaller side streets. Although Jaume 1 is also a pretty street, it's very touristy. I'd recommend walking criss-cross through all of the smaller streets. Especially nice is the square where Cafe Babel is at.
Wander. Great place to wander around and stop for a drink and some tapas in one of the bars some fantastic buildings to see

A great area to meander freely. This is an area to leisurely meander and stumble onto interesting shops and tapas bars. There's so much to admire in awe with some beautiful gothic architecture. And interesting lane ways.
Loose yourself. In its windly streets until the perfect tapas, mohito or shop find you. Watch landmarks as you wander and you'll quickly learn to find your way.

Feel the atmosphere. The Gothic Quarter is the centre of the old city of Barcelona. It stretches from La Rambla to Via Laietana, and from the Mediterranean seafront to Ronda de Sant Pere. It is a part of Ciutat Vella district.

nooks and crannies..... We stayed near this area and every time we walked through the back streets and alleys it was a new adventure, from another public square bordered by places to stop and eat / drink, to shop, to another church or historic building, it was a never-ending labyrinth that offered so much at every turn. We were told to be a bit careful if venturing too far into this area but at no time did we feel unsafe, however I can see just the nature of the area could create some opportunities for problems to occur. During our time there were always plenty of people around, all enjoying themselves, having traveled a lot I'm usually quite aware if there are some shady characters around but certainly didn’t feel that here.
Unmissable. If you visit Barcelona for more than two days and don't spend the a big chunk of your time here you've missed out
Always worth a visit. Nice, trendy neighborhood. Shopping, food, sights to see in close vicinity. Nice to just sit in a cafe, have drink and enjoy.
Do a tour and learn about the history. There are lots of free and paid tours of this area, and they are super informative / definitely worth it.

Fun neighborhood to walk through. This is a very historic area in Barcelona to wander through. There's not a whole lot to say about it other than the architecture is exceptional and a little bit different than the rest of the city. Definitely add it to your list and simply just walk through there. There are lots of fun restaurants and the proximity of el Barri Gotic is very close to La Rambla and Placa Real.

Do not miss the Gothic quarter. I love this part of the city, it is so typical, so full of life.. Nice!Plenty of little stores, some fairly cheap, and tapas restaurants, teh Cathedral, booth to have a cold orxata.. hmmmm

Definitely worth a visit!. We thought this area was great, full of character and little tapas bars and restaurants. The Mercer hotel, which we passed, is located here and looks wonderful, think we will stay there next time and the area is so nice.

A delightful area to explore. There is something fascinating around every corner. We felt completely safe, even in the evenings. The locals we met, in all the fascinating little shops, were so warm and helpful. Our hotel was close by, so we wandered the narrow cobblestone streets for several days and discovered so many unique spots off the beaten path.

Very nice touristic neighborhood. This neighborhood is very touristic, so you have always street performances and small restaurants all over, it's near the port and if you like to walk for a while you can go to the beach.
Beautiful Place. Loved the place and street artists' performance. Place has a lot of history. It would be better if you have a guided tour for this. There are few free walking tour for this place.

A walk through history. I spent two full days wandering through the Gothic Quarter. A lot of these building are over a thousand years old. The cathedral Santa Cruz is 1,200 years old. If you like history and architecture this is the place to be
Avoid the crowds. It's worth getting up early in high season to see this as the locals do, and then to relax in the heat of the day and return in the evening to witness the hustle of the tapas scene.
One of the best things in Barcelona. The Barri Gotic is an absolutely wonderful place to discover in Barcelona. Walk around and then sit at a street café and enjoy the atmosphere :)
Great for a stroll. My partner and I found ourselves often wandering around here, popping into curious shops and eating ice-cream. Definitely worth a look.

Regret not spending more time here. Our trip to Barcelona was semi rushed for time, we walked through the Gothic Quarter leaving the beach and immediately regretted not going sooner. Lot's of cool shops, restaurants, bars, etc. I would highly recommend going for a few hours and eating there.

The place to stroll. If you want to wander in Barcelona and avoid the crowded Rambla do it in the Barri Ghotic. It is the place to get lost in Barcelona. See the artisans shops and have a tapa in some of the bars.

Definitely worth a visit. I enjoy the historic parts of cities and I especially like to wander the narrow streets in the old town. It's fun to go inside the cathedrals and be surprised by what's around the next corner.

Cosmopolitan and worthy to visit. Barrio Gotico where the cathedral is. There are shops and cafes and many places to spend time there. For me personally barrio gotico was an opportunity to capture the little roads of Barcelona I used to see in books and so I did. Totally Recommended
Cute vintage shops. Use your gps and hunt for those vintage shops. Thers a small street with a hand full of shops. Worth a visit
long lazy walks. Great neighborhood, connected with Born district, ideal for walks in the afternoon, discovering tapas bars and secret gems in every corner!
Really cool. We wandered this way on our last day in Barcelona and we weren't disappointed. Cool alleys, shops, and street performers.

A must for visiting Barcelona. An old neighborhood with narrow streets - amazing.
Lots of small shops, a church famous Cathedral and atmosphere of history. Worth a visit!

My favorite part of the city. Fabulous area of Barca, enjoyed wandering around the area, delving into the protracted history of many of the buildings.
Only problem was the odd weirdo wanting money... at this point we simply wandered faster - because normally the hindrance of the fake disability hindered their progress!!

Interesting. Cathedral square presented and unexpected surprise and the Catalan tradition of the human pyramid (think is called casteller) and the people were lovely. Good food here and little shops in the winding streets. Worth a visit.

Wonderful experience. Gothic quarters is a must see attraction in Barcelona. It is full of culture and history. Architecture is unbelievable. If you visit gothic quarters on Sunday, you will have a chance to go to the cathedral and attend a mass. Please make sure you have your shoulders and knees covered. If you are lucky you can even see weddings taking place in the narrow alleys.

Beautiful place to walk about! . We came here early afternoon and enjoyed the atmosphere here. The architecture is simply beautiful. We took lots of lovely pictures here. It shows us the cultural background of this city. Thoroughly enjoyed this place and would highly recommend every visitor to come here. From buildings to quaint little shops and some street performers all add to the charm of this place! Must-see place in Barcelona
Pretty and quaint. Ambling around individual shops, antiques, café bars. Relaxing. Cooler and cheaper on the narrow streets, the squares a bit hot and pricey.
Interesting but be selective. We spent a couple of afternoons here. Really fun to just wander. There were some really interesting shops, but a lot is pre-made and touristy. Just be selective

Great for mooching.. This has been our first, and hopefully not last, visit to Barcelona. We never really thought we would get a feel of the city in only 2 days, but this gave us not only a taste, it threw in dessert as well!Yes there are great places to see but it's the ambiance that gets to you.Mooch and absorb!

steeped in history and culture, shops and restaurants. buzzing.. certainly worth visiting to enjoy the atmosphere and the culture of barcalona. some of the streets are so narrow and the buildings so tall that only some sunlight gets in, and it really feels like a different city, a true barcalona. lots of lovely old buildings, and some fantastic quirky shops, old booksellers, generally a great place to come and explore and get a bit lost!

Fun place to eat and walk around. It is beautiful to walk around here. I wish we had more time to explore the area. Lots to look at, lots of restaurants, TONS of crowds. Early evening is a really nice time.
lovely place to wonder. Its very touristy but still has a lovely charm about it. Just be careful there are loads of pick pocketers!
Fantastic buildings. Was just wonderful to walk around the streets and admire the architecture and history of the Gothic quarter

Cultural, historical and beautiful. If you're looking for narrow cobble-stone streets and authentic Barcelona shops and sweets, this is the place to be. In the gothic quarter you'll find all sorts of jewels, including a candle shop (est. 1761), delicious gelato and a real Gothic-style cathedral.

Stroll at your own pace. There's so much to see in this area that I can only recommend putting on a comfy pair of shoes and strolling to your heart's content. Beautiful area of the city. There's plenty of astounding buildings to see and where you need a break there's a number of gelateria, bars and restaurants to allow you to take a seat and take the area in.

the Highlight of our trip. Give yourself plenty of time to explore this area. We took a free guided tour with Runnerbean and then returned 2 more times. There is so much to see - El Call, the Cloisters, Placa Felipe Neri.So much history and beauty in a small area..
Lovely. Beautiful neighborhood. Well worth visiting! Allot of gothic style buildings. Carrer del bisbe next to the cathedral is very beautiful.

Fun to explore. We had the benefit our first day in the city to have a guide show us some of the most unique finds in the quarter. ( the oldest synagogue in the city, ancient ruins where columns were preserved , could never find on my own) Most of the fun was just getting lost in the area and just looking at all the beauty and history . Then when you get hungry, you find a plaza, a table, and order tapas, sangria! Enjoy it, I took hundreds of pictures

Must see for shopping. In my opinion, there is better shopping here, to find that little perfect gift or souvenir, or clothes or T shirt than the much marketed shopping areas of Barcelona. Plus the charm at every step and corner, every where you look literally!

Not to be missed... Gothic look with modern amenities. The gothic square was well maintained and gathering spot for tourists and locals. The modern amenities including many shops, dining options and small hotels. Some very cute shops with unique clothing. Also some wine stores with great local cheese and olives. Not to be missed.
Highly recommended.. If you go to Barcelona, you must visit this place. The cathedral is awesome! Also, there are plenty of restaurants and shops around!

Living History. This is a wonderful area in a wonderful city. The old narrow streets are full of boutique shops along with bars and restaurants. You could (should) get lost in all the maze of streets which take you all the way to the water side with its wonderful architecture and great attractions, trust me, visit the Barri Gotic.

Gothic Center. This is a wonderful place to be when visiting Barcelona. We stayed at Hotel Neri, I would suggest it for all going. The Cathedral was a stone's throw from our hotel and so beautiful. There are churches all around.

Gothic Center. This is a wonderful place to be when visiting Barcelona. We stayed at Hotel Neri, I would suggest it for all going. The Cathedral was a stone's throw from our hotel and so beautiful. There are churches all around.

Shop in the Gothic Quarter. The best shopping is in the Gothic Quarter, along with great little cafes and restaurants. Skip La Rambla, except for the market. It is full of stupid tourist trinkets made in China. The Gothic Quarter has great stuff actually made in Spain.

Take the time to explore. We love walking the streets of the towns we visit. One has the opportunity to immerse oneself in a little bit of local life by taking less busy alleys, exploring the local shops and sometimes simply sitting in a square to smell, see and take in all that is local. We found a quaint little square for a spot to sit down at lunch time and were surprised by an extremely talented flamenco dance pair doing a street performance. A truly memorable experience.

Away from the hustle and bustle. Wonderfully quiet and peaceful area - the architecture is staggering with so much verity. You leave the main road and within minutes you are walking around the cobbled streets, browsing the shops, taking in the sights or sat in a street cafe with a cool beer and people watching.
Great place to walk, eat and go out!. The best of Barcelona for me, I loved this gothic streets full of young people, bars, restaurants and charm!
Beautiful churches, buildings, squares. A very cozy part of the town, with the church Santa Maria del Mar (beautiful), the Cathedral, museums, nice small alleys. Definitely recommended.

Nice, but little to see. All very nice and you get a feel of what it felt like to be in a Gothic area with the narrow streets, but apart from a few churches and some walls the Gothic area was demolished to build bigger apartment blocks about 150 years ago.
Great walking around area. Interesting place to walk around…good shops, restaurants and terrific architect. The place you'll want to be!

Gothic Quarter. Another must see. Everywhere you look there is something different to see. Each house is unique and most are beautiful. Take the time to wander the less crowded allies as these hold some real surprises. The area is not large so with a basic map of main streets you cannot get lost. Most little allies end in very popular open areas. At no time, night or day, did my wife and I feel threatened or feel we were at risk of becoming victims of pick pockets. We were there in July, during their holidays, so I would have thought this would be the worst time for pick pockets, but we saw no evidence of them.Take one of the free tours on offer.

My favorite area of Barcelona. These narrow, windy streets have so much personality and charm. Wonder around, you can't get lost just go wherever you feel like and you'll find plenty to see and plenty of history and beauty. Make sure to go down even the quietest of allies as you will find a treasure along the way.

It was Awesome!!!!!!. I really love this sight of Barcelona, is very interesting,you have there the stores to buy anything you feel like, scarfs, souvenirs, hats, clothes, jewerly and you could also found.restaurants or coffe-shops.places where you could taste the famous"Paella" the favorite dish in Spain. I really enjoy it there..I hope you found mi comment helpfull.
Aimless wander!. You can find a few things if your into that sort of thing. Getting lost is all part of the experience as the area is pretty big. Gives you a feel for barcelona though!

Fun to get lost in.. It's a country where time does not matter. Loads of little squares where a drinks and tapas are on offer. Choose ones the locals use. Some are better than others. Architecture is fantastic. Too many people but then its a tourist attraction and I was one of them. Cyclists, skate boarders etc abound so be aware.

great exploration of every alley and corner. during our week stay in Barcelona we must have returned to the same area for food and shopping for more than thrice. we especially love the varieties of boutiques, little cafe, restaurants and bars. Be sure to drop by Sagardi for tapas!
Lovely architecture. This is a quaint part of Barcelona, with fantastic little streets full of shops and lovely buildings. The architecture is really beautiful and the Cathedral is truly fantastic
Wander. Love all the old streets with new sights on each corner. There isn't anything I did not like. Great place to really see the culture and history.
great!. Great area to walk around, beautiful buildings and great shopping in the area. Could easily spend hours getting lost in the small streets

Great neighborhood. We walked from the Plaza de Catalunya to the Barri Gotic. Nice stroll. The streets are narrow with many extremely old buildings with very interesting architecture. The cathedral is in the center of the Barri Gotic. There are many shops and restaurants everywhere and the area can get crowded. For a nice litte adventure try and find the ancient Roman columns that are hidden in a back alley with a "modern" building built around them. Barri Gotic is well worth a few hours visit while in Barcelona.
Fun to walk around (read Rick Steves tour). We found some bullet holes from the Civil War and learned a good bit of Catalan history from the Rick Steves' tour in his book.

Beautiful old city center. Beautiful old city center, walking streets with restaurants, cafes, shops, locals, residential buildings, historic buildings, etc. Pedestrian streets have been taken care and are very well maintained to walk around and get lost. Any tour book, such as Eyewitness Travek Guide, will have walking tours recomendations, do take them!

narrow streets and fascinating buildings and bustling people. loved this area as so interesting...lots of walking so wear sensible shoes...best way to see the gothic area too !...lovely squares with cafes and varying street acts and monuments floating or positioned to add to the ambience...and nice way to cool down !

Very interesting, not too crowded. Visit gothic quarter on our runner bean tour. Got a lot of history from there that we would have missed otherwise. Definitely go there to get a feel for Barcelona's history.

Love the quarter! Couldn't get enough time there must go back.. ove the quarter! Couldn't get enough time there must go back.
Loved it all can't think of one negative aspect.

Enchanting. Spent a lovely couple of hours wandering around the little streets. It feels like you have stepped back in time. The Cathedral is beautiful. Stopped at a café to have a coffee and take in the sights. Don't miss it if you are in Barcelona...

Gothic Quarter. Just incredible, a must see. All sorts of cool shops and restaurants. Music in the corridors by licensed musicians is an acoustic marvel. Catalan dance, human pyramids, plays, all sorts of entertainment.

Beautiful and Unique. For us, Barri Gotic was a must see while in Barcelona. All the beautiful architecture and cool little shops and restaurants makes it a fabulous way to spend an afternoon. Don't bring a map; just wander and enjoy everything this unique area has to offer.

Crowded but beautiful. Like: beautiful, you should have a map with you don't want to loose the best places
Disliked: crowded
Quaint and old. Liked the quaint little shops and the feeling of stepping back in time. Do not like commercial chain stores or restaurants at all, I feel it takes the identity out of an area
Fun!. Lots of neat shops and small streets to get lost in. Seem to have a plazas at every 2 intersections.

Gothic Walk. 15th Century Barcelona. Gothic is a unique place in Barcelona. Between it narrow alleys, houses, small palaces and magnificent cathedrals is the world famous Picasso Museum, the Mercat del Born and the majestic Cathedral of the SeaMany buildings, including the Cathedral are from14th century and that produces you the feeling like walking in the European Middle Ages.Among stone streets you discover antique shops, wineries, local restaurants and shops "Made in Barcelona" where the designers sell their creations directly.. Unique Fashion Shopping!We love the store "Arlequí Màscares" a lovely shop with lovely magical masks where workers are as kind as artists.The Cathedral of the Sea, The Picasso Museum, Mercat del Born with the ruins of the Barcelona in the 14th century and the modernist Palau de la Música sites are an obliged visit..If you also want to eat something, there are many tapas bars and excellent restaurants out there on the streets like "Sky Bar" or into Sta Caterina Market.Super recommended!

Beautiful architecture. A beautiful place to just wander around and take in the surroundings. It is particularly nice to take a seat outside and enjoy a pint of San Miguel, a bite to eat and watch the world go by.I particularly enjoyed the unlicensed street performers who would just stop mid-routine and hide from the police!My tip would be, avoid the bars and restaurants on La Rambla, take to the side streets. I got 1 sangria, 1 fanta and 4 tapas on La Rambla for 45 euros. I took to a side street and found a lovely bar where I got 3 sangrias, 1 fanta and 4 tapas for 25 euros!
Amazing part of town. Just wander around and discover the many architectural and cultural treasures that line these streets!

Gorgeous and clean but mind your belongings. The quarter lives up to all descriptions. A wonderful place to spend time and so much history to discover. But mind your belongings. We had no problem but others in our party were pick-pocketed. We were lucky to be there on a Saturday evening and saw the circle dancers. No wonder Picasso painted this tradition. So very charming.

Enjoyable walking trip. We very much enjoyed walking around the narrow streets of the Gothic area and seeing the architecture of the era. The merchants in the shops were very pleasant and accommodating.
History abounds. Great area to wonder around and take in the historical aspect of Barcelona. Great cafes and shops to see along the way.
Great to wander. Just lots of great hidden streets and alley ways to explore. Spend all day wandering around and found best gelato outside Italy sorry can't remember name of place

Lovely Barri Gotic. I really like this part of the city- narrow streets, beautiful Gotic style, a lot of good restaurants and bars, amazing churches (Santa Maria del Mar and Sant Maria del Pi), fountains, Roman remaining,... It has great history and the atmosphere is different from other parts of Barcelona.

A walk into the past. Since I was born there, it was a walk into my own past. But my history is not nearly as old as the old quarter's. So much to see and enjoy, so many nooks and crannies! Take your time and wear comfortable shoes!
Bustling Lanes. A very enjoyable half day spent wandering through the sights. get a guide book beforehand to find out where the hidden gems are. It's not easy to just stumble upon them.
Nice neighbourhood. A nice neighbourhood to wonder around, finding hidden places, having coffee, looking at people, having a bite.
Excellent streets to just wander around. Lovely to walk around the Barri Gotic, so much interesting architecture, loads of shops and tapas bars to sit and unwind and watch people going by

Enjoy walking the area. Liked: roof top restaurant at the Dali museum, the Picasso Museum (arrive early and be prepared for a long line)
Disliked: taxi drivers
Nice for a walk. Lots of tourists and street vendors. But it was a nice detour on the way to the beach (Barceloneta). Small streets with a bunch of restaurants and coffee shops.

Feels like you are in a movie from middle ages. Feels like you are in a movie from middle ages, at each corner there is a gothic view. Recommended to visit twice, one in the morning and one in the afternoon.
A must in Barcelona. You can walk around the Gothic quarters for hours. You'll find cute little shops and wonderful restaurants and bars.
My Favourite Place!. Gothic Quarter was my favorite place when visited Barcelona! Cute little streets, interesting shops, lots of people, amazing churches and piazzas.
Pleasant to stroll around. Mostly average stuff. Cathedral and Palau v good. Beware lots of tourist trap tapas bars and knickknack shops.

Definitely my favourite part of Barcelona- 3rd visit and not our last!. We have been to Barcelona 3 times now. We initially went 3 years ago, fell in love with the place and it has become our annual city break.
Our first trip we stayed in the El Pobolnou area (at H10 Marina hotel). It was a bit far out from the main areas but it did mean we got to walk...


More
Loved it. It's what I think Catalonia is all about, narrow streets, like a magical maze, lots of interesting little shops, eating places and a hub of people not to mention fascinating buildings.

If you like Architecture, this is for You.. Barcelona has a great variety of architecture; old and new. This area of the city has some of the most interesting buildings we have ever seen. Don't miss it!

Absolutely amazing. We spent a great time there, strolling thru the little streets, relaxing in the shade and listening to street musicians, like Barnakustica, who are often playing there: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qaFndAzpu6s

Vibrant community. Tremendous variety of quaint, ethnic shops. This appears to be where all of the new immigrants from dozens of countries land when they arrive in Barcelona. The Gothic Quarter buzzes with life. Aromatic bakeries and spice shops are plentiful. Children riding their scooters, elders talking in doorways, hardware store proprietors digging through musty drawers and shelves. Laundry hanging from every available window. It is a pulsing, vibrant area of Barcelona. Great place to walk through.
Back in time. Must have been here I if you visit Barcelona. Wander around the narrow streets, little, nice shops and have a drink on a terrace

very convenient, fun neighborhood. My wife and I stayed in an apartment here and found the area very well located and fun to wander around. It's midway between Plaza Cataluyna and the waterfront and has lots of narrow streets filled with restaurants, bars and shops. Photo opportunity. This area was excellent place to practice taking snapshots. Sure taking photos of so beautiful old buildings, squares, shops, churches.... My kids were impressed by the atmosphere in area.

Beautiful. Nice little streets with some nice restaurants, bars, buildings, shops.Beware of pickpockets, and don't get lost. The cathedral is beautiful andthere are some hidden treasures. Adventure around!

Impressive Cathedral and nice area to wander. This is a lovely part of Barcelona and well worth a visit. When we went in to Catherdal there was a service taking place, so it seemed very peaceful and a reverent silence hung in the air. No charge to get in, and some nice stain glass windows etc. to look at.
Goth just got better. Amazing building, narrow street with loads of character. Early morning is the best time to go. There is a few little shops and cafes.

Must visit. Great place to chill and see the old Barcelona. Best place to hide from the summer sun. I just love the old small streets and the balconies! No need for public transport - you can just wall a whole day.

A place to get lost and find yourself. We walked down to the Gothic Quarter and loved it. Just going around and getting lost in the small alleys was wonderful. You really get the flavor of Barcelona and what it must have been in the middle ages when the Cathedral of the Sea was built. A must when in Barcelona
Hidden Treasure. Full of little hidden gems of shops, galleries, restaurants and cafes. Be careful not to get lost as many of theses streets look very alike
Saw something new every time. We wandered in an out of the Gothic Quarter over the course of 5 days and kept finding new buildings and streets to love.

Like a portal to the past. Wander through this area. There are so many interesting architectural details. There is a feeling of timelessness here.
We walked through this area for a few hours and happened upon several small shops, and a church that seemed older than religion itself.
This is a great place to see the old and new, the sun and the shadows.

Forget Las Ramblas. Leave behind the seething masses and walk into the side streets and alleys away from Las Ramblas and it's a different world.Here you will find an array of shops of all kinds selling everything but the tourist rubbish. lots of sites. Walked all over the quarter. Followed Las Ramblas down to the sea. Felt safe and no problems with pick pockets. Probably need a good map to see all that can be visited. Great experience.
Excellent for urban exploration. Lots of side streets to explore. Interesting shops of the beaten path. You can easily loose an afternoon exploring it.
Wonderful location. The area is full of wonderful architecture and great small tapas places. We went into a side street and found the nicest little place with great food. La tete Bistro/1
Fun area to stay. Amazing area to visit. Had so much fun winding around the streets. I felt like I was on a movie set! There were plazas throughout. The gothic buildings where amazing.
Great Gothic Experience in Barcelona. My wife, grand daughter, and I enjoyed our stroll throughout this area especially the food and cathedral.
Take a nice leisurely walk. Wonderful narrow streets with quaint shops and houses, a must see. Located next to the Ramblas street it takes you back in time to an earlier Barcelona..

touristy. We didn't travel this area extensively but from what we saw just be aware this is a very touristy area. Some of the street areas smelled of urine, I suppose from impatient partiers. There are nice areas, interesting restaurants, etc; but it wasn't one of the Barcelona highlights for us.

Enchanting!. Strolled through on Sunday late morning, early afternoon finding interesting little shops and entertaining street musicians. A fascinating part of the city with quaint passages and beautiful squares, including the Cathedral square. You cannit visit Barcelona and miss this area.

go through the maze of side streets, there's lots to find. wear comfy shoes and go through all the little streets, there is lots to see. there are all these little places and restaurants that you could find by chance. I liked this more than busy crowded La Rambla.
Need good shoes. U'll get lost. But it's nice! I got amaized with the streets, old monuments. Atleast you can get a restaurant or bars any corner to get some rest or drinks!

Busy but worth it. Obviously going here in June, it was bound to be busy, but if you get up early, you can wonder the streets, take in all the outside sites, grab an ice cream and lounge in the morning sun before the main crowd appears.We actually didn't go into any of the main paid attractions, but the area itself was lovely enough we didn't mind!

Gothic Quarter. The Gothic Quarter was one if our favourite parts of Barcelona. It has a life and vibrancy of its own and we spent hours exploring the small roads and alleys that make up the Quarter. The market shouldn't be missed. It it the most amazing place filled with the most wonderful food, every type of fresh juice imaginable and a great place to have a good but inexpensive meal.

Very interesting area to wander around and discover.. There are many shops, restaurants and boutiques. You can wander for hours here and see something new at every turn. Wear comfortable walking shoes. Ladies leave the heels at the hotel.
You will get lost. I became miserably lost in the inexplicably winding streets and loved it. A lovely place to wander and imagine the Barcelona of hundreds of years ago. Nice shops too.

Start walking. This old historic area of Barcelona is easy to get around, or get lost in and just start walking.The cathedral, old fortifications, town hall, too many places of history and interest to list.Plus there are loads of little squares and bars to sit, relax and watch the world go past.Also of interest was the street art on shop roller shutters, had to be up early/late to see it as it disappears once the shutters are up.
Barcelona highlight. We wandered around this area and ate here. Interesting history & fun atmosphere away from La Rambla crazy

My favorite part of Barcelona!. Forget the map and get lost in Barri Gotics small streets! There are so many things to discover, fun little shops, organic bakeries, great cheap local restaurants, etc. During the hot summer months it is nice to seek shadow in the narrow streets, and the atmosphere at night is great as well. A journey back in time.. This is a lovely place to wander and get lost in, amazing architecture spanning from Roman times onwards. Narrow little twisting streets and labyrinthine in nature, but something of interest at every turn. Suddenly you turn a corner and your are in a beautiful open plaza full of light. The cathedral of Barcelona is delightful and it's history interesting, the internal buttresses are a particular and interesting feature. The can also be seen at the Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar. Loved this part of Barcelona!. This might very well be my favorite part of this beautiful city! It is romantic, mysterious and full of amazing places to eat and shop!!! I cannot wait to go back. It is also a photographers dream, with the tall narrow streets and just so many interesting things to see. We might even stay in a hotel in this area next time :)
Wonderful. What a wonderful area to visit and eat. Had a beautiful seafood meal in the square off Las Ramblas and saw a troupe performing.
Old Town. I call it old town because gothic seems old to me. Great to stroll through and see how the locals live ...... sample their food ....... visit churches, etc.
A lot of photo ops. I was here alone for an afternoon and took a lot of photos roaming around. Maybe it was not actually this quarter, but all places were close.

Would stay again. We spent 10 days at the corner of Carrer de Portaferrissa and Carrer de Petritxol in an awesome apartment we rented through Friendly rentals. We loved the apartment. This area works for so many reasons. It is alive with people and is a great home base. You can walk up and down Las Ramblas, shop at La Boqueria fresh market and also the grocery called Carrafour, head to the artisan market at the foot of Las Ramblas and enjoy the waterfront. It is also a quick walk up to Placa de Catalunya where you can catch any firm of transportation, and a meeting place for many tours and excursions. Great spot!!

Best of Barcelona. Loved the consistent beauty and constant mood of these medieval streets, winding everywhere. Loved the many restaurants, courtyards, churches, plazas. Loved the market stalls that popped up on various days selling everything from coins and stamps to jewellery, books and novelties. Loved trying to sus out the best restaurant deals (thanks, Tripadvisor, for your tips). Wished our elderly legs had given us greater mileage on the charming, no-vehicle streets!
Gorgeous neighbourhood. Great shopping and lovely to just walk around and get lost on all the side streets. The buildings are beautiful!

Up close and personal.. We did a 3 hr walking tour with an English speaking guide who was thorough and quite knowledgeable. The cost of the tour is the gratuity for the guide. Shame about the graffiti. There are some wonderful buildings, such as the cathedral, in this area, and some great restaurants and tapas bars - even some Roman walls - the main tourist areas are great. But my over riding feeling about the area, and especially the little back streets, is that it is covered in graffiti. Perhaps it was worse than usual because the shops were mainly shut for 2 of the days we were staying, and the majority of the graffiti was on the steel shop roller blinds. Also the hotel we were staying in was in amongst the back streets so we had to walk past it all the time. It is also a shame that there is so much bag/phone/wallet snatching going on.

Take the time to explore. Barcelona’s oldest neighbourhood, the Barri Gotic a fascinating maze of narrow cobbled streets and squares that lie between La Rambla and Via Laietana and from the sea (Ronda del Littoral) and Carrer Fontanella.It’s a perfect place to wander and find old sites such as the Temple of Augustus in Carrer del Paradís and the neogothic-style bridge over Carrer del Bisbe Street. Take the time to listen to buskers outside the Catedral de la Seu and enjoy the offerings of restaurants and cafés. Or you could try to avoid the temptations of the fabulous pastry shops/bakeries and the helado shops – a next to impossible task.
awesome place to hang around and get lost. Dont plan it .. just get inside and get lost and then find you're way back. Lot of fun discovering old interesting architecture, food, and sights.

A different perspective of Barcelona :). My friends and I joined a free walking tour of the Gothic Quarter and loved every minute of it.
