This is one area I did not mind getting lost in…it is, in fact, the perfect place to wander around without an agenda, and if you do indeed get lost, fret not - there is enough and more to see, do and experience here to ensure you're having a good time. The little, cobbled stoned alleys lined by beautiful old buildings, decorated with brightly painted windows and doors, and sometimes elaborate patterns on the exterior facades; ornate balconies gushing with the fresh bloom of spring flowers; narrow passageways that surprisingly open into charming little squares populated with tiny outdoor bars & cafes and terraces…the Gothic Quarter is literally a world of its own. It is true what they say about Barcelona - the sunlight makes everything look so much happier and alive…. all the oranges, yellows, corals, pinks and turquoises blend harmoniously to create a multi-coloured visual treat that is every photographer's paradise! Don't miss the little chapels and churches that dot this area. if you can manage a walking tour guide, it's recommended so that you can learn about the history of this place. In the night, the Gothic Quarter takes on an eery, mysterious aura - nothing to be afraid of as such. If you're lucky, you might even have a Spanish Guitar encounter! If you're on your own, I would say ditch the map you're carrying around, and just wander around. There is much to see, do, shop, eat and drink along the way - or sometimes, to just sit and watch the world pass by.

Little bars, outside eating and people watching. The old part of town, little passages opening into squares with bars and eating places. Look for the smaller places for more authentic food. Great place to sit with a beer, tapas and people watch.
no map required. loved just walking around the streets finding little gems and the general mood of the place was great

Just delightful!. Treat yourself to meandering through the wonderful streets and alleys of the Gothic quarter but make sure you have a map! There is so much to see. We had a guided tour of some of the Tapas bars as well as the sights and we highly recommend it.

It was ok. I really didn't dislike this area but I didn't much like it either. I've visited here before but this time I came with friends and felt that they should visit it too. They didn't particularly dislike like it but didn't much bother about either

Like stepping back in time. An amazing area to get lost in the narrow streets. Our favourite part of the trip was to explorer the Gothic Quarter. We stumbled upon some decent bars and eateries. Well worth spending an afternoon here.
A great place to visit!. We truly enjoyed this part of Barcelona. It is well worth the time to wonder through this part of the town and enjoy the sights and sounds.
Interesting medevil. Lovely place for a romantic stroll around Barecelona. Went with my boyfriend to see a few museums and squares. Fantastic fountains and architecture.

A Must-Do. El Barrio Gothic is awesome - tons of little stone alley ways that suddenly open up into an old plaza with important stunning old buildings like a cathedral or town square. Tons of restaurants and bars as well!

I didn't get what the hype was about. After visit a lot of old city centers in Europe (Florence, Nice, Stavanger, Bergen, Rome, etc.) I can definitely say that I didn't get what the hype was about this Barri Gotic neighborhood. We did the Gotic walk that's described in most tourist guides and even if we saw three or four interesting landmarks, 75% of the walk took place in shabby alleys smelling of urine and flanked by boarded up shop fronts and graffiti. There is indeed a few beautiful little squares in the mix, but that's not really worth the entire visit, especially when half these squares are overrun by shady looking homeless people.

Immersed in old city with lots of people. This is part of why we travel; to see the old quarters and up close with locals. Great place to wander or stay on main tract to look around. La Rambla is cool to be a part of the crowds, see the shops and places to eat.Caution: Many stories of pick pockets & thieves. Locals wear cross the body straps, while holding bag in front. Friend, female, had shoulder purse, gripping tightly and was accosted by team of thieves. One hit her in back, then the other grabbed her bag and ran off in crowd. Another lady we met was almost robbed coming out of phamacia. Evidently thieves looking for meds to steal. We both had backpacks fully strapped on, watched each other's back, and had no issues.

A must. One of the best preserved old towns in the country - this is a must for any visit. I stayed in the Gothis quarter to make sure I could soak it up but at least put aside 2 hours to wonder through and admire the small streets, 500-1000+ year old environment! shopping! eating! drinking! Ole'It's great for taking pictures so charge the battery - there is a fresh food market there worth a look and lots of significant places to visit I their own right.It's the place for churros, plaza dining and getting lost.

Medieval area with a wonderful Cathedral. We stayed here for five days. I chose to stay in this area because I love history and old buildings.However, don't think of 'York', which is a wonderfully preserved and quaint town- this is dirty and cramped.The streets are so, so narrow that they act like echo chambers and it is very noisy. Despite the streets being narrow, cars run up and down them, meaning your diving into doorways to avoid being hit.The tall buildings on these streets are shops at ground floor, with mostly apartments above.The rubbish generated in these buildings is simply put outside the door at ground level, i.e. on the street. So, during the day the rubbish builds as well as the dog dirt from the myriad of people walking their pets.While there are trucks that clean this rubbish up every morning, the fact is, that as each day drags on, so the rubbish builds.There are simply tonnes and tonnes of restaurants however, most of them sell paella and/or tapas, which is a bit tiresome. It would be like visiting England and only being able to eat fish and chips in every restaurant!However, while this place clearly hasn't gone down very well with me, I can see it is a place full of amazing history with a lot to offer tourists. The cathedral was really lovely (however, go dressed appropriately or they won't let you in because, though God created us naked, He gets offended by bare shoulders).

Experience medieval Barcelona. A quiet walk in Barcelona is a difficult task but Bari Gotic is a bit of an exception. Even though there were many tourists, this area was much, much quieter and less commercial than Las Ramblas. The prices and quality of food was also better. At the same time a stroll through this area was very educational.
wonderful evening. What a fabulous area to wander round in the evening with great shops open spaces with great art work.And also good bars.
great walks, clean, beautiful. I love history and old buildings, this city is great for both. Clean, friendly, and easy to walk. Lots of great places to eat and get drinks.

Nice to walk through. If you have the time, take a walk through, but if you are limited on time, you can skip it. It is close to other areas as well, so if you are done looking at Gaudi stuff, it is a bit of a change in scenery
very busy. Full of atmosphere and very busy.the queue to get in the gothic cathedral was massive, however we got up early and went straight in. plenty of restaurants and shops close by

Like walking around in Assassins Creed. Such a beautiful part of the city, each street looks different from the one before and little shops and bars can be found. Just make sure you have your bearings ;)

Shabby. You should probably see this on one of your walks along the Ramblas. It's easy enough to find. Tourist shops, a few bars and lots of graffiti and boarded up store fronts. After visiting the old sections of other European cities (Florence, Sorrento, the Amalfi Coast, etc) we were disappointed by the old quarter here. You can find a place to sit in the old square and watch people smoking, they love to smoke here. You get to it by turning left as you walk down the Ramblas. For a better experience turn right off the Ramblas and find one of the best outdoor markets in the city.

Explore the little streets. We loved walking around this area. Lose yourself in the gothic architecture and visit the little shops you find. The deeper you head, the more traditional restaurants you will find. We did a walking tour to give us a feel for the history and so we knew where we visiting
Fabulous Buildings. Very pretty area, like a large court yard buzzing with restaurants and a few bars and shops. lovely area to have dinner and ppl watch. Also the free walking tours go from here :)
Should walk arround. You should definetely walk arround here different times of different days you will find another shop or place open and will feel suprised to it there
I like it. Really beautiful part of Barcelona. I really like this nice architecture and tight lanes where the ghost of old city visit your mind.

Wonderful architecture - cool vibe. You must see this part of Barcelona to really "get" Barcelona. It is a vibrant area of the City with really wonderful buildings and a mass of people, especially on Sunday afternoons.

Sore feet and good eats. Tapas bars abound. Tables on the plaza's to enjoy sangria, food, and people watching in good weather. Be sure to try the white sangria made with Cava. Take a good map as the street maze is 2nd only to Venice. Micro-mini cars with GPS and narration allow you to drive yourself around to see the sights; not actually to my taste though some May find doing battle with a double decker bus to be exhilarating.

Keep an eye on things. Well worth a look, and while your there walk 10 minutes east to the arch. As you may have been told pick pockets are everywhere. We had no problems but only take with you what you need and be careful at pinch points and crowded areas even in shops and coffee shops.

Fantastic old city. We didn't get nearly enough time.. We loved this section of Barcelona. To see architecture going back to the Roman Empire was amazing. We only wish we had more time to walk the streets and alleyways.
Simply fab. A must visit. Full of character and characters. Could walk around for days and not see it all. Full of adventure. A surprise around every corner !

the real Barcelona. Great to walk around - and get lost - in all the narrow streets. Lovely quiet atmosphere away from the hustle and bustle of las ramblas. Plenty of tapas bars and cafes to choose from - the best choices were full of locals
Walking tour is recommended!. I got the Sandeman's walking tour, and it's recommended. The architecture is amazing, and a walking tour is necessary to really understand the history behind it.

The Heart of Barcelona. This is a neighborhood, not really an attraction, but it's the area that is the most fun to explore. You might consider a walking tour with one of the local tour companies, or find your way around with a map or your cell's GPS. You'll get lost, but that's part of the fun. There are lot's of individual attractions within the neighborhood - churches, squares, museums, restaurants, etc., read about it and go find them, that's the fun part.
Great Old Part of City. We loved the gothic quarter and small passage ways. We found ourselves lost in the area. Such a great day and great for pictures
Interesting. Great way to wander through the past. Incredible architecture. Twists and turns and narrow streets with many places to stop for tapas or a drink.
Lovely. Just a really nice place to wonder around. On a Sunday it's really quiet and atmospheric and well worth a visit.

Gothic surprise!. We had the privilege of staying in an apartment in Barri Gothic recently. It so reminded us of a water -free Venice- so many narrow streets surrounded by very interesting buildings. There were surprises every corner you turned. On our final evening we found the Arc de Triumph and much to the disappointment of my husband a huge street market. My female cousin and I were delighted ! All in all, we have had an amazing first visit to this beautiful city and would def. recommend staying in this area .

Perfect for a stroll!. Loved this part of Barcelona and spent hours of my visit walking through the area taking in the buildings and shops. Lots of unique items available and many designers have their studios right in the shops which was fun to see.

very nice neighbourhood. In the heart of the city, very nice area, traditional, with bars and restaurants and good nightlife too. it was very close to where i was staying so was going through this area every day
Barri Gotic. Liked very much just to walk through the small streets. We also visited the quarter with "Runner Bean Tours".
Wander, eat, drink and shop. Great atmosphere with lots to see. A great mix of local commerce old buildings, bars and restaurants. A real old feel to the place with style.
Great for an easy stroll. Take a casual stroll here in between the million things you've got planned in Barcelona! Just amazing little shops, restaurants and alleys.

Gives a sense of travelling back in time. I read that you should get lost in the Gothic Quarter of Barcelona and that we definitely did do when we were out there, mainly when trying to find some restaurants. Just take a stroll through the area as it is full of old buildings, narrow streets and truly gives the sense you are walking somewhere back in time. Take time to appreciate the culture and beauty this city has to offer.

Beats La Rambla all times. Fantastic! Barri Gothic, the beach and the marina are the best areas in Barcelona. Barri Gothic has everything you'll need in my opinion. Small, cosy alleys where you can find fantastic food and many small shops. We spent several days here and also found some of our favorite restaurants in this area.
Nice for a walk. You can just stroll in narrow streets and enjoy the athmosphere or visit the cathedral and museums in this charming quarter.

Unique and interesting. Lots of narrow dark alleys... actually they are roads. Probably not somewhere to be lost at night, but lots of interesting shops, stalls and sites to discover as you wander around.

Amazing!. When visiting Barcelona we often found ourselves walking through the street of the Gothic quarter. You feel like you are stepping back into history. Every time you discover something new, see something different etc. Well worth visiting!
Mystical. Worth a visit just to wander around the narrow little streets, something new and beautiful around every corner!

Beautiful - do not miss!. It was a pleasure to walk admiring those old and beautiful gothic-style churches, buildings and tight streets. I love this place and next time hope to have more time to spend around.
nice place to visit. entry fee to the church was not good. but yes the beauty of the monument is itself an eye candy. for photo enthusiast its really a place to visit.
great. one of Barcelona must see. never miss it , you can spend Hours here and get lost in the narrow streets. enjoy a glass of wine in the evening
Barri Gotic. Wander through this neighborhood to enjoy ancient and achingly beautiful gothic churches and meandering, cobbled-brick streets. Plenty of places to stop for tapas or for shopping.

Wonderful way to pass away the time in Barcelona!. I loved just walking around the Gothic Quarter - finding little bars and cafe with excellent and reasonably priced food and drink. The area retains a great atmosphere and lots of interesting alleys and buildings to look at.

Great place to just get lost. My wife and I have been traveling different European countries over the last 4 years and this type of area is why we love Europe. You can just wonder around and see all the shops without the concern of getting struck by a car, bus or motorcycle. These neighborhoods offer a good place to shop, wander aimlessly or sit in a cafe and get a coffee or cocktail and people watch. You really can't get lost in here because it is surrounded by main streets on 2 side, La Rambla on another side and the port on another side.

Getting lost in Barri Gotic. Zig when you should have zagged, zag when you should have zigged - what does it matter? Just get lost and enjoy it. There is a great little Indonesian restaurant but that is as much as I can tell you except it is opposite La Quattro Gats or similar which in itself is a must see. Actually the street is Montsio (restaurant is Betawi or similar). Barri Gothic is one of the highlights of Barcelona. Try and stay there if you can.

The most amazing place. It was just beautiful old world charm. I have never seen such beautiful buildings, churches and other structures. I wish I had more time to spend and I hate that a lot of the people working in various places were not bilingual but I managed.
Relaxing walk.. The Cathedral of Barcelona is a beautiful building and a visit here is a must. No fees whatsoever but go in with respect and humility.
Not like Roman churches but you should pass through. It's an interesting area. You're literally walking through a castle. If you have time, I would pass through.
Amazing place for wandering off. Boutiques, Restaurants, cafes, Galleries, Gift shops, cobblestoned streets, no cars, GREAT AMBIANCE........................

Loved it . We took a stroll off the main streets and stumbled across the gothic quarter by accident. It was wonderful. Get good walking shoes and just wonder around the small narrow streets of the gothic quarter. Very entertaining. The cathedral del mar (I think that's what it was called) was mind blowing, fabulous building!
Fascinating Architecture. An assault on the senses, everywhere you looked fantastic buildings. Long queues to get into the Gaudi designed houses, Quieter in the evenings

beautiful. take a few hours or days to amble around the little back streets,stopping every few hours for tapas ,we spent 2 days just walking and eating,life doesn't get any better,a really chilled area with little surprises round every corner,amazing hidden squares,lovely buildings and fantastic food.

traditional spain. beautiful architecture, a cris cross of lots of lovely narrow streets, great tapas, lovely catherdral, locals of all ages singing,music dancing in the square simply lovely to sit have a glass of sangria and watch the world go by!!
Mysterious. Get lost in the medieval passages. A wonderful way to explore this area and discover its many secrets. Some research ahead of time will ensure you find the hidden treasures.

Wonderful narrow streets. It was wonderful strolling around in Barri Gotic and i couldn't enjoy it more during our trip. Get a good pair of shoes and walk the tiny streets of Barcelona trust me it's worth it and certainly the best way to learn the city.

Chill ax bar. El mercadillo bar jardi is a secret roof top bar in the gothic quarter. Offering fabulous drinks.. I recommend the mojitos the people are chilled and the atmosphere awesome. Highly recommend .
Lovely place. I would definitely recommend staying in the Gothic quarter. Lots of narrow streets, souvenir shops and great tapas bars.
Beautiful. Like stepping into another era. Beautiful buildings and streets full of character. We thankfully did not have any bad experiences to report.

Very good free tour. We took a free tour that was very good, with useful information about this part of the city. Barri Gotic is not beautiful other places in Barcelona but the history and architecture are worth.

Open Top Buses. The best way to view this area and other areas of Barcelona is on the open top buses. They have different coloured routes and go clockwise or anti clockwise. You can always get off to visit a particular interest of for a few beers and lunch. Then re-join your tour on another bus.
heart of barcelona. beautiful preserved streets mostly from the middle age some truly amazing old palaces , my favorites being in the ribera area the sea merchants street where the picasso museum is
A beautiful part of Barcelona. Worth spending time walking round. We visited several times during our visit and always found different things to look at.
Take time to walk through. I allowed myself about an hour to ramble the alleyways of the Gothic quarter. There is something interesting on every corner, be it a shop or a medieval building.

Great place to wander away a day. I loved just wandering through the tiny streets and peering into unusual shops we happened upon. The higher you get I think the higher the €€ and public toilets are not available! the tourist info opposite the catherdral wanted 1€ each for the bog key! Far cheaper to buy a coffee.....
Favorite part of Barcelona. The Gothic part of Barcelona is nice, has lots of local shops, bars and restaurants. A must place to visit, take 1/2 a day and stroll around and drink in the atmosphere.

It's fun to get lost here.. We enjoyed roaming around. When we got hungry we dropped into whatever courtyard looked inviting, and there are many. We also took a free walking tour to get our bearings, which was very helpful later in the week when we were looking for specific places.

Superb area to get lost. First Tip...do not follow the person in front. Second tip...do not follow a map. Walk and get lost down the range of tiny streets. Some locals had warned us about pick pockets in thus area although did not see any. Just use few basic measures.Some of the weird mix of shops down side streets and back streets. Beautiful.Finish up in a square with a cervecas.

Interesting Area with Character. Great chance to see what Barcelona was like "in the old days" with narrow cobblestone streets. We explored on our own and took a walking tour, which is highly suggested so you don't miss some of the important points of historical significance.
nice walk. You will definetely walk there is very central . Make no specific programm. Just wander in the alleys and travel back in time!!!

Best area in Barcelona. I booked to stay in the Barri Gotic after many suggestion here and i didnt regret it!!! The best place not only to stay in Barcelona but the main ared for bars and restaurants. Also you can spend all day walking and enjoying the alleys and old buildings of Barri Gotic!!!

A lovely wander round. We spent a lovely couple of hours wandering around this warren of streets - were met with a parade of nuns singing down one at one point which was a surprise - goosebumps on arms moment!

Enchanting. While this was certainly interesting enough just for its near-ancient architecture, but when I was there a young woman was singing for spare change, and her voice reverberated between the plain walls of the old quarter like she was in a high-tech echo chamber. Pure touristic gold,

Could've spent our entire trip just wandering around here. There are a lot of great photo ops in the Barri Gotic, but it is much more than that! I don't see how you could wander around these little alleys and not be enthralled by all of the history surrounding you. What happened in the oldest parts of Barcelona changed the globe forever. In addition to the historical treasures, it is filled with great little shops and tapas bars everywhere.
Amazing. Everybody should visit this beautiful quarter. The narrow streets take you to past times and the atmosphere is magical.Definetely visit Placa Real

the ancient borough of Barcelona. this district is probably my favorite for its magic and history. its small streets form a web between the ramblas and the cathedral. It is easy to get lost, but I always found my way. It is plenty of traditional restaurants and stores, it is full of activity day and night. it is a must to get here and have along walk through this web. it is a perfect place to buy cheap and curious gifts for friends and taste traditional tapas.
Nice area for pictures but nothing more. Very nice buildings and few nice Tapas bars but I was unhappy as cars keep passing by along with bike riders so I didn't felt that safe.
Lovely and romantic. Lovely place to go for an evening walk. Lots to do and romantic too. Lots to do in this exciting City

Incredible. The most beautiful, magical place! Get lost down all the little side streets, there are so many fantastic things to see which you may not stumble across if you stick to the map! The atmosphere, smells, colours, architecture is so fantastic.

can't get enough. i so love this area. found a great tapas bar in the heart of Barri, right in front of the cathedral. and I'm sure so many other tapas choices in other places around the quarter. and take a glass of vino caliente to go, to enjoy your evening stroll even more!!

Just enjoy getting lost in it. Also known as El Born, is a safe (mostly), rowdy, eclectic, busy and fun area at the very heart of Barcelona. Just walk without a map and you'll find yourself surrounded by urban art ancient and new, all kinds of people and good food and drink. Eventually you'll hit a main street and find your way again. Not to miss even if you're in town for one day.
Labyrinth. You must go and wander the labyrinth of streets and alleys in Gothic, loads of shops ( some good some not so !), loads of architecture and normally loads of people.
Easy walking in tight quarters. Holy week so many people in the streets. Gives you good idea of how close people lived in past times. Lots of people to see and sights as well.

Be careful at night. The Barri Gotic is a wonderful place to stroll round during the day. The maze of tight little streets is full of surprises, little shops and bars tucked away round every corner. At night however it can be a little intimidating, like everywhere in Barcelona you should watch your wallet and a few times we felt less than safe.

On a warm spring evening - it was deliciously cool to stroll around the old town. The streets were busy enough to add to the feeling of safety. Plenty of bars and cafes open so that we were well refreshed. Just lovely to drink in the lovely atmosphere.

Fascinating. This is a great area to explore. Be in no hurray and just let your legs take you in any direction to explore! Remember to look up as they are many fascinating structures and architecture on the sides of buildings and on top. Many little tapas bars and other restaurants, some more 'touristy' than others.

The place to be when visiting the city. stayed and ate in this area, best part of the city! every little turn and corner seemed to have a lovely little cafe or restaurant and felt very safe throughout! stay here and eat here!!
The nicest area of Barcelona. A lovely area to meander around, with lots of nice little independent shops and cafes. I much preferred this area to La Ramblas.

fun. If you have the time to roam around and get a little lost, forget the map and just enter the narrow streets. The cathedral is the focal point, Ferran street is crowded and there are little cafes spread everywhere. They say the chocolate is great but i didn't try it.

Old Buildings and Dark Alleys.... .... just the way i like it.
We stayed in an apartment in a converted town house in the Gothic Quarter. Amazing view of the action from our roof terrace overlooking a small alleyway.
Plaza'a, Alleyways. Old churches and theaters. Nice bit of culture love it dont we.
Old Barcelona!. Walk through all the narrow lane ways to see how they lived in old Barcelona. the buildings are old and full of character. the markets are fun to go to.

perfect area to stay and hang out. great area to stay and walk around. very safe and friendly. would definitely recommend staying at a hotel near here so you can walk around easy. you don't need taxis a lot if you stay here
Nice walk. A nice walk in Barcelona , good atmosphere , have a few drinks on the street watching the people , definitely a "TO DO" in Barcelona

Travel back in time. This is one of the best parts of the city. When walking around here, you really feel like you're travelling a couple hundred years back in time. I don't know how it is during high season, but in April the narrow, labyrinthine streets aren't very busy and you can really soak in the authentic atmosphere. It's simply wonderful to just wander around here and check out all of the authentic shops, beautiful art galleries and cool bars.
Lovely place. Lots of small narrow streets just of La Rambla with plenty of nice Tapas restaurants to eat & drink in.
Nice stroll. It's always beautiful to walk through an old city centre but the the Gothic Quarter with its little "calle" and shops does certainly stand out. Watch you handbags

mythical. Gothic Quarter is just fabulous! You hve to visit the cathedral, sity wall and mandatory be lost in small street where you can feel soul of Barcelona! If you woul like to rest i recomend a dunnes irish bar where you can drink some beer and eat nachos!
Cool area to get lost. If you don't mind walking and getting lost this place is the spot. If you want a tour there is a free walking tour also recommended here which we did and learned a lot.

Interesting architecture. The Gothic Quarter is full of old architecture and is very nice to take a walk in. Tours are available of the area but I prefer to walk around on my own. Pick-pocketing is very common in Barcelona so keep an eye on your stuff.

Original Barcelona. Visit the cathedral and wander around the side streets. There are lots of things to see around every corner. Nice cafes, bars and restaurants that are less expensive than Las Ramblas.

AWESOME - our favorite quarter. This area was our favorite quarter in the city and we ended up here most days! Look up Orange Donut Tours - she's amazing and will give you a TON of great information about things you would have just walked by! Awesome area with a lot of history, beautiful cathedral and plenty of food/pastries/drinks to be had.
The place to be in this city. I love this area of the city lots to do, see, watch and enjoy. The funky little shops are a delight. Bars and restaurants abound.

A very interesting walk. In the streets of Barrio Gottico you travel back in time with many beautiful buildings, interesting sightseeing andcozy cafe and tapas bars. A not to miss walk around the cathedral and picasso museum. When the night falls, marijuana dealers are everywhere.
Love it!. You can't see Barcelona without an afternoon stroll through the streets of the Gotic. Simply fun and wonderful architecture!
Beautiful Area. This is a beautiful area great for pictures but easy to get turned around in so bring a good map, and your appetite lots of cute little places to drop in for candy, pastries or food!
Holidays . Really nice area, just enjoyed the view an shops around it. Plenty museum and Barcelona Cathedral. Excellent..
Much fun in the shoulder season. Great walks anywhere in any direction from our hotel (Raco del Pi). Variety of sights and lots of bars and restaurants.

Old Barcelona. We picked up a tourist walk around the Gothic quarter, which took about an hour. It was a Monday so most shops were closed but we were able to meander and spot the features described. We went again a couple of days later and loved looking around the many and varied shops. A must visit.

Wander around the little streets. The cathedral is definitely worth a visit, and there are many quirky little streets and shops to explore. Many cafes and restaurants in the area and is also close to the beach for relaxing.
Simply Beautiful. Charming quarter with many shops, bars and cafes tucked away in little streets, as well as monuments and churches. We came back here every day of out visit.

Small streets full of history. You can loose yourself here: the cathedral, Place del Rei, the roman temple, Placa sant'Jaume and more. Reserve the morning to visit everything here, really worth it (better is it's sunny!)
Great place to walk around. Really lovely area of Barcelona. Great bars to watch the world go by. It has a great deal more character than many of the other districts.

watch the world go by. beautiful place to sit and watch the world go by.
Go to the local market if you can. Chocolates are to die for... Restaurants offer a variety and are inexpensive.
Shops are fab
Gothic. Very impress with the gothic style buildings made me feel like I was traveling back in time. The street performers was a plus they made the square come alive. The cathedral was stunning .
go for a wander. each turn from each little street has something different to offer! great place, great history - love it!
Not as crowded as the Rambla . Nice shopping area. Not even nearly as crowded as the close by Rambla. Wonderful. You might also find some markets there.
THE area to visit in Barcelona. We much preferred this area to La Ramblas- more authentic and interesting. Wandering through, you always find new sights, squares and places to stop and eat or drink.

Fascinating area!. Walking around this old area with it's narrow cobbled street is almost like stepping back in time but hidden in these streets are a myriad of shops that sell interesting & modern merchandise and terrific cafes & restaurants. Don't leave Barcelona without checking out the Gothic quarter

Get lost!. You'll be so glad you did. I could have wandered through the Barri Gotic for a couple of weeks. Every street offered something interesting. Restaurants, shops, people watching and more, the opportunities for exploring seemed endless. And the old cathedral was interesting as well. It's not difficult to see the old Roman city you're standing in.

My favourite thing in barcelona!. What a fantastic area of the city - a stark contrast to the continuous blocks elsewhere!
There's some lovely little cafes, along with squares that include churches, palaces, monuments and you can even find the Cathedral!
Cosy. Here you can go on forever and look into the different shops, cafes and bars. The atmosphere is wonderful and pleasant.
Nice Place, ancient.. Nice place for a walk. The ancient architecture was quite a change. I really enjoyed the narrow, cobble stone type walkways. This is definitely worth a visit.
Close to Hotel Realto. Loved the ambiance of the district, the narrow streets, outside cafes and quaint boutiques. It is so romantique and reminded me of Paris

Great!. I stayed right down in the center of the Gothic Quarter for a week last month and it was great! The streets are narrow, and down every alley is dozens of shops and restaurants. My apartment was only 3 blocks from Las Rambalas, and when visiting Barri Gotic Las Rambalas is a must! There are many local cafes in this area that are great, to get a real feel for the area.
Perfect for wandering. I loved this area; was traveling with my son and we ended up here every evening wandering the streets, shopping, visiting galleries & churches, having tapas. Wonderful fun.

Historical Walking. so many tasty places and small shops you can fşnd around. Also very nice to have a walk in these little tiny streets. Typical catalan soul is living there and visiting gotic area is a must in Bcn.Especially dont forget to try ''Leche de Pantera'' in typical bars . My favourite one was the pink one ( ıts a milk w liquor). Enjoy it...

A trip back in time. this is the most charming quarter of barcelona. just walk through all the small streets, stop at a bar and have a coffee of a drink. look in the small boutiques. you will get a feeling of the old barcelona and never is really old, it is grand.
Excellent Architecture. We stayed in a hotel in the Gothic Quarter, the cathedral and the architecture surrounding it it wonderful. A stroll early in the morning is a must.

Hussle, Bussle and Beauty of Barcelona. Busy it can be but worth it. So many delights to see in the gothic quarter, lots of really good value restuarants and fantastic shopping! Bohemian cocktail bars are dotted around and icecream paralours are readily available. Really adds to the whole expereince of Barcelona, its one of the safer and more up market locations in the city and really worth a visit. Stay within the Riberia its alot nicer than many of the other locations in Barcelona.
Wonderful for a long stroll!. Loved the Cathedral, the Squares, the cafes and the street entertainment.All in all a very enjoyable Sunday stroll just before we had to leave Barcelona.

old is wonderful. the gothic quarters is well worth the time to visit. many wonderful sights, and much history. it is like stepping back in another century. also, the tapas bars are great for drinks and snacks. while we were there, we lucked up on a festival parade , and an event at the church which was very interesting.

Wonderful exciting area. Get lost in the Gothic Quarter. Wander through the alleyways where cathedrals just pop up out of the blue. Some of the fantastic restaurants are in the Gothic Quarter. It feels magical here.
Lots of bars and restaruants. lots to see and do, plenty of bars and restaurants - we ate and drank in a few of them and didn't have any bad experiences.
Magical!. I love the Gothic Quarter! It's got lovely narrow streets full of interesting boutiques and cafes. You can walk around for ages and just soak up the old world charm!

So many beautiful buildings!. My friends and I stopped to take so many pictures of the architecture in the Gothic Quarter. Undoubtedly some of the buildings now housed small shops and businesses but they were still truly astounding. The Barcelona Cathedral is breathtaking, and the Old Jewish quarter and the Picasso museum are both nearby. Remember: always look up!

A must see for Barcelona. A beautiful and historical area of the city, well worth spending some time soaking in the architecture and atmosphere here. The people love of the arts and beauty can be seen through out, lots of areas to stop for refreshment and areas of special historic importance.
Interesting tour. We took a walking tour, via Runner Bean Tours, through the Gothic Quarter -- very interesting. Good tour group for relaxed time.

Explore. This is a fab area to explore
We stumbled accross this by pure mistake but be careful as can get lost very easily

A lovely part of Barcelona to exlore. Far, far nicer than Las Ramblas this is a fascinating part of Barcelona for a stroll. Plenty to see and lots of cafes and shops and far more Spanish in feel than Las Ramblas. We wandered around on the way from our hotel on the edge of the Gothic Quarter to Barcelona Cathedral which is well worth a visit. All in all we had a really lovely 3 hours in this area.

Get lost in time. Get lost in time through the narrow alleyways of the old Gothic Quarter. Take a look at the display windows of the quaint little shops walking from the Citadel Park until you reach the Rambla Promenade. Shops are overly expensive and pickpockets are abundant, so don't buy without comparing and bargaining, and don't forget to keep your bags close and your pockets closer. :)

Nice stroll!. A nice walk for people visiting Barcelona. The shops along this walk are interesting to look, you will defiantly admire the original products on sale in the windows.Leads nicely to Barcelona Cathedral.

Truly amazing area, very easy to get lost in space and time.. We have spent more than one afternoon touring, taking pictures and reading the history of this fascinating area that some of it predates Roman times.Very interesting.Do visit and allow as much time as possible. Wear sensible walking shoes.

Full of hidden treasures. This beautiful area is full of culture, narrow little streets with olde-world Siderias, a Cathedral, a few dodgy looking areas (that turned out ok) Carrer de la Merce/Escudellers, etc.
History on every corner, and free !!. A great place to just stroll around and soak up the atmosphere. Superb buildings, lovely coffee shops, and not too much tat in your face from the souvenir shops.

Authentic Gothic scenery for day walkers. Could spend days and days just to roam the streets there! Be aware, it's very easy to get lost in the narrow, twisting alleys - but on the other hand it is also very pleasant place to get lost. And naturally there are plenty of restaurants and tavernas to choose from.

Nice. Nice area and a lot of antiques and shops
The cathedral is a piece of art but be aware of pickpockets
Fantastic. The Cathedral is amazing......well worth a visit. Beautiful chapels and the view from the roof is stunning.

A must!. Simply beautiful, and fascinating to walk through. Be prepared to get a little lost, but that's OK. Every street eventually leads to a square, so you will be able to find your location and navigate. But that's the least of your worries when in the Gothic Quarter. It is so beautiful, with such history. Go during the day and wander...visit the magnificent cathedral. There are shops, bars and restaurants to enjoy.Go in the evening and wander (preferably with a friend, it's narrow and dark, so I would have been hesitant on my own, although we never saw any problems.) In the evening, we happened upon a young man who must be an opera student, standing in a small archway, singing his heart out for tips. He even had a sound system set up--I get chills just remembering it. We sat there and listened, it was absolutely magical.
just visit. Endless hours can be spent exploring the back streets their shops, historic buildings and museums. You will never get bored.

just a great place to walk!. So much to see here! Just strolling the old alley ways-exploring shops and cafes-people watching-we spent many afternoons and evenings around here-it gives you a sense of what the old Catalonian Culture is like! We had no trouble but I can see how pickpocketing could be an issue so be careful! there are lots of cons who want to suck you into coming to their restaurants and buying their wares-a lot of cheap stuff to be sure-just take your time and do what you enjoy and do not listen to them!
Favorite area of Barcelona.. Stayed in the gothic area and enjoyed walking all of the streets. Be sure to go to The Caterina market down from the Cathedral. Much cleaner than Boqueria.
tourist shopping and restaurant area. I saw only a fraction of the area but found little that was extraordinary. If you like narrow streets and interesting shops, this is your place.

Back to Beginnings. This is one part of Barcelona that captivates me - everything from old Roman walls, incorporated in Medieval Cathedral and a three dimensional honeycomb of humanity with shops, bars and cafes.And it is safe!Just spend the hours wandering, looking, watching. Try a coffee - remember an Americano coffee in some of the coffee shops is the equivalent of an espresso in some parts of the world.heaven.
Awesome!. Awesome walking through back in time. It was a really good still through this old area. Felt completely safe with no issues. Great little shops as well!!
Gives you the right vibe.... El Barrio Gotico, is probably one of the most chaotic, places in Barcelona. still to get a vibe of the city, you must get there ...
Amazing architecture. The Gothic quarter is one you must see. Don't miss the amazing Gothic cathedral and the beautiful town hall, located there.

Lovely. The buildings in the Gothic Quarter are amazing. Would recommend for anyone who is visiting Barcelona to take a little time out and see these, via the walking tours or by yourself. some breath taking sites!
Ideal place to walk around. Small shops, many bars and restaurant, tiny streets and nice architecture...the real taste of Barcelona !

Good walk. We were looking for a recommended tapas restaurant in EL BORN area and we found plenty of options to dine. Origens was our choice (a typical catalan cuisine restaurant), not a bad deal for 20 € per person (wine not included)!
Wander Around!. We spent hours wandering around the Gothic Quarter... beautiful area, sights, shops, and lots of yummy ice cream! Our son enjoyed choosing which streets to go down!

not to be missed. This is not to be missed if you enjoy medieval cities. Narrow streets and alleyways, unexpected squares and it's cool in the heat of the day! There's a tiny ancient synagogue over Roman remains, and a history of the community in Catalonia, as well as an entrance to the magnificent cathedral. A variety of restaurants on the periphery. Take bottled water, you can get lost!

I love it!. The quater is so nice (mostly). Some spots here and there are obviously being used as a toilette, and has a strong smell of urine, but you forget it as soon as you passed one because this is such a charming part of the city. I could walk int he quarter for hours just looking at the buildings, the narrow streets between them, and the street life.

Good location. We stayed at the Catalonia Catedral in the Gothic quarter and can recommend it as a central location. The Cathedral is very interesting and there are good places to eat and drink on your doorstep. It is also within walking distance Las Ramblas.
The old city. Restaurants, shops, people, and beautiful churches and architecture sprinkled throughout. What's not to like?
Our favorite area!. Loved all the history and great little corner restaurants and coffee shops. This was a very fun area to roam around. We enjoyed a walking tour from travel bound.

Going back in time. Despite Barcelona being very modern it still holds the interest of time travelers and a walk through the Barri Gotic does this for everyone, lots of narrow streets with special shops, bars and cafe's a great way to spend an afternoon.
good to wander around. It is lovely to just wander through the many little side streets, exploring the shops and bars. Plenty of atmosphere to soak up here

Great to visit, better to stay here. We rented an apartment in this area and loved it. It was not a perfectly beautiful apartment, but the convenience of staying right in this neighbourhood far outweighed the slightly lesser apartment (not 100 % clean, not as nicely fixed up/decorated as others we have rented). La Rambla was about 30 feet from our door with all it's amenities including the Boqueria Market, a grocery store and a Metro station (Liceu). We could easily to go to the Market for fresh fruit, candy, juice and hot breakfast and coffee. We shopped in the endless maze of narrow streets full of shops, restaurants and bars. We walked and took photos of the numerous churches, plazas and entertainers we found all around this area. We took good advantage of the restaurants on the side streets for tapas, beer, wine and the atmosphere of this vibrant city.
Old City. Wonderful old city to tour. Easy to walk. Lots of great restaurants and Tapas bars. Quaint streets with shops.

Delightful area to explore. A lovely maze of narrow streets with many interesting historical buildings, museums, shops & restaurants. A great place to spend time with a less busy feel than the nearby Las Ramblas.

i like this place but.......!. is dirty shame that the place is very nice .very tipical spanish ""barrio"".anyway it is nice to walk around look for ancient building and shop.Full of tipical spanish restaurant where you can eat very good paella and a fantastic sangria
GothiC quarter. It is wondeful to walk in the old town visiting the cathedral, jewish quarter, the magnificent narrow medieval streets.. a must in Barcelona

a must!!. I think this was my favourite part of the city. You'll get to stroll around the narrow streets and discover so many things. The district is full of life.  Cathedral de Santa Eulalia, Placa Sant Jaume, Temple D'august, Placa Nova, Palau de Generalitat, Barcino letters - to name just a few - are the sights/landmarks you'll come across in this area. Don't miss it!!

Love it. What a beautiful area, a surprise round every corner.
Lovely little bars and shops to visit - could walk round here all day.

Nice Walk. I ended up visiting the Barrio Gotico because the Picasso Museum is in that neighborhood. There are beautiful old buildings and had a nice stroll around. Don't miss Picasso's Museum it is one of three in the world were you can see a vast majority of his works from beginning to end. I waited in line for about 30 minutes. So if you know a date for sure you are going to go. I would buy online ticket if you can. It closes on Mondays. I was there in March at about 1:00pm.
labyrinth. Little streets of hidden beautiful sights. One recommendation? Dont use the map and just get lost...

Great stroll. The Gotic is really what Barcelona is all about random streets studded with great little shops offering an andy dote to industrial Zara type shopping - you don't really need a guide - the enjoyment is in following your nose - forget the schedule, although the Rough guide's gastro tour is a delight - look for hoffman's pattisierre - hmmmmmmmmmmm! and off course there is a surfeit of interesting bars to re fresh the tired tourist.
Shopping and nice walk. In this Quarter you can stroll along the whole day for sightseeing and shopping and during the eve and nights for the bars and restaurants.
Free Walking Tour. You can meet at Hard Rock Cafe by 11am for a personal guided walk and then just tip the guide. Jord was excellent.

Incredible vibe. I loved the architecture and history of this area! It was a buzz with tourists and locals, and there is so much to see and do in such a small area. Check out the 2,000 year old Roman temple, and settle down with an espresso while you´re exploring.
Could wander round here all day.. Beautiful architecture, interesting shops, lovely restaurants and doesn't have a 'touristy' feel about it.
tiny streets, squares, shops..... by far the nicest quarter in Barcelona. It is nice to walk through the streets, to have shops and bars and restaurants all located in the same area.

excellent. My wife and I stayed at an apartment in the gothic quarter and it is a wonderful location.The mix of new and old makes this an interesting and exciting area. Exciting walking through all the alleyways and finding new shops and places to eatBy far my favourite area in barcelona.

Days of wandering. You don't really get tired of wandering the narrow alleys of the Gothic Quarter. So many fine restaurants and cafes and interesting shops. And so much to take in--go during the day and then at night.

Great food, great shopping, great exploring. This is a fun area to spend the afternoon and evening. My son found a sneaker boutique, I found a designer consignment sale, we snacked on crepes as we explored the narrow streets and we had the best dinner of our trip at Tapeo- the most incredible tapas ever!

Center of festive activities. Besides the shops and the architecture, this quarter is also the place where the city holds festive activities like Correfoc, Sardana dancing, etc. The more you stay at Barcelona, the more you will love this place

Awesome way to see Barca. Walking through the Gothic Quarter is a must do for anyone wanting to experience the cultural beauty of Barcelona.
I would recommend a good 4 hours here just taking in the majestic architecture. There are plenty of cafe's and other shops as well here.
A definite absolute must do!
Fun Area. Medieval buildings with modern shops and restaurants/bars. Picasso Museum is in this area in a 12th century building. Beautiful, classy juxtaposition! Must see
A great place to wander around. The Barri Gotic was full of history, it was great to wander around the streets looking at the buildings. Lovely architecture.

Love it. Cool, mysterious, interesting, old and dirty all at once.. The Gothic Quarter is one of those neighborhoods where you can just get lost walking for hours in the labyrinth it is, and you will never get bored. It is full of historic landmarks that are often overlooked by tourist and many, many secret jewels you just happen to run into when you are walking around. Little impressive discoveries. The Catedral de Santa Eulalia is stunning and the Plaza del Rey just takes you back hundreds of years. You will also find tens of little interesting shoppes, art galleries, nicely decorated restaurants, beautiful architecture all around and little bits of history.

Fun stroll but beware of the tourist traps. Cute little shops along beautiful old alleys, perfect photographic opportunities if you have some patience... the area is constantly flooded with tourists and some locals have learned to take advantage of it, so keep that in mind before you sit down to eat anywhere and check the menu prices first, there is no reason to pay 7 euros for a glass of Sangria :)

Loved it !. Close by to our hotel so we walked the Barri Gotic area thoroughly and most days. We loved the surprises round most corners and down the small narrow streets.Lots of independent shops made for an interesting morning.We also visit the Cathedral and took the lift upto the rooftop which affords excellent views over the city.

Roman Ruins and Classic European architecture. Nice place to walk around and Roman ruins and narrow passage ways through the city. Lots of souvenir shops; they negotiate prices. 40% discount pretty easy. Be prepared to walk, same stuff is next door. Beautiful churches, go in any that are open. If you don't believe, it's not too late to start. Even so the art and architecture is amazing.

Amazing buildings. This is where the cathedral is (not to be confused with La Sagrada Familia). Cathedral has the bones of Saint Eulalia in the crypt which is accessed by steps which are in the middle of the cathedral. Amazing architecture
unique. Fantastic buildings in great condition. A lot of small lanes which may put people off from entering, but they also contain lovely shops which are modern and clean.

Enchanting. One of the most enchanting parts of Barcelona. I have currently been living there now for 3 months and am amazed by the movement and charm that it has. It is one of the most beautiful parts of Barcelona, with all the small and windy little alleyways, each turn you take you will find yourself in front of yet another amazing little square, or buidling, church, cathedral, monument. Every corner of Gothic has something hidden for you to discover, an afternoon just wondering these hustling and bustling streets it's highly recomended. It's the best way to see the true city of Barcelona with a constant stream of street performers and buskers, it's impossible to get bored and you will constantly be seeing new amazing and enchanting things.

Must visit. During a 4 day city trip to Barcelona, we scouted the different areas of this huge city, and the Gothic quarter is one you must see. If you take a tourist hop-on & hop-off bus, you get a very nice guided tour through this part of the city with interesting historical background.

Stunning.. The Barri Gòtic is probably the living heart of Barcelona, being the oldest part of the city.Don't miss the amazing Gothic cathedral and the beautiful town hall, located in the middle of the quarter.
A new discovery everyday!. the most lovely area to walk around. Walking tour strongly recommended to give you some history to things you just walk past. Even my 11 year old loved it

Explore and enjoy the discovery. If you enjoy walking around and exploring the place that you are visiting and absorbing the surrounding atmosphere, the Gothic Quarter is the perfect place to do so. Take your time to walk the small and quaint streets and explore the architecture and the stores. This is definitely the place to come to have lunch or dinner (this is a favorite even among locals). And as all around the city, mind your valuables.
Stepping into a different world. Lovely tiny streets and buildings. You could wonder around here for hours. A feast for the eyes. All the little quaint stress are so different.

The best part of the City. The area is mainly pedestrianised so the problem of dodging mopeds and cars that happens in many cities is avoided which makes the experience much more relaxed. There is something to see round every corner and when your feet get tired there is no shortage of bars and cafes to while away the time until you can face some more exploring. Don't miss the Eglesia De Santa Maria del Mar.

Awareness makes Barcelona and Spain a great trip. Our concierge would not let us take passport from hotel but made a copy. While using a public phone unknown to me one man came up behind me to cut off fanny pack. He was going to hand it to a third who would have been long gone. My son yelled at me to look out and all was ok. I lived Barcelona so much my husband and I are returning this fall

The Gothic Quarter is amazing, but we were glad we read warnings about pickpockets first. We loved wandering through the streets of Barri Gotic--amazing place. Just before leaving our hotel, we read in one person's tripadvisor account about the pickpocket ploy of having someone spray paint the back of your jacket, then another "helpful" person calling the event to your attention. As we walked into a beautiful little square a man asked "Do you speak English?" and then said "Look at your jacket." We looked about and realized there were at least a couple of other men watching closely, perhaps ready to close in on us, so we hurried away and then waited in a pharmacy until they moved on. Thankfully, the spray paint or whatever it was came off of my wife's favorite sweater with cold water. This happened on our last day in Barcelona and could have put a sour note on our impression of this beautiful city, but we had 2 p.m. reservations to visit Sagrada Familia and that place is so incredible that we went away with glowing opinions of Barcelona. But if a stranger comes up to you saying "Do you speak English?" or "Look at your jacket," it's best not to respond and to leave quickly. We consider ourselves pretty streetwise and were being vigilant and still could have fallen for this if we hadn't read the warnings that morning.We never felt unsafe while in Barcelona, but pickpockets are always a concern in places where there are lots of tourists.
Loved it!. Came back a couple of times, just to walk around the picturesque streets and enjoy the laid back atmosphere.

Get a hotel here!. I would definitely recommend staying in the Gothic quarter if you come. There are affordable hotels or hostels here and the atmosphere is very nice. It's also close to the waterfront, La Rambla and the Barcelona Cathedral. The streets themselves are amazing to walk through in the evenings. The only downside is the amount of drunk people in the evenings, and also I saw a couple of guys urinating against shop windows. A bit of a downer.
Awesome. You cannot go to Barcelona and not take a walk through the Gothic Quarter. Be sure to check it out at night as well... fantastic atmosphere!

Cathedral is beautiful. Very pretty part of town, and a nice thing to see amidst all the modern architecture, etc. The Cathedral was beautiful, its a shame that so many beggars were out front. The quarter itself was a nice tour with some great souvenir shops as well.
Great tour of this area. We had a great guide named carmen, and she was wonderful and new everything about this area.we wondered around this area and found many shops with great things to buy.

Great architecture and shopping. This area has some wonderful and interesting architecture of the period. It also boasts many very quirky and unusual shops where you will find lots of Spanish craft items and unique pieces of art and curios. If you're a serious shopper then you must spend an afternoon here.
little streets. Super attractive old town! Lots of little streets and great tapas bars! A must and in December really great.

Beautiful part of the city. Spent a couple of days wandering the streets of the Quarter. The Picasso museum is impressive, as is the building which houses it. You can find very good food at many of the small restaurants in this area. Beautiful views wherever you look!
Amazing. We were so glad we booked a hotel here - so many great bars and restaurants to explore. We never had a bad meal during our holiday and we basically only ate in this area.
Great place to walk around. Atmosphere is great, a number of shops and restaurants you can visit, local people are really friendly
Great Memeories. I love that area it remind me with all the best times i had in barcelona, great for going out, food and close to all the shopping outlets... My favourite area in Barcelona
Old town Barcelona. if you like narrow streets with unique shops and architecture then this place is for you. There is a lot to see and do in the area and plenty of nice places to eat.
Not that exciting. It's a pretty small area really. Get your tickets to the cathedral online. They have cute, little gift shops in the area. But honestly there isn't much to see.

Cutest area!. My favourite part of Barcelona, by far! It's cozy and gives you a real feel of the city. If you walk in the small streets you'll find little boutiques to explore and great restaurants which sell the best churros. I 100% recommend visiting this area.

Interesting old buildings and history. Cool winding streets and very interesting old buildings. Take a bike tour or walking tour to learn more. We used goodbarcelona for a couple hour tour and liked it. Would have liked to get to the history museum but didn't have the time.

Energy at it's best!. A must on your sightseeing list, so many people from so many different parts of the world in this area and the houses are beautiful, lots of restaurants trying to outdo the other,prices are good and the food great!
Easy to get lost. Great to just wander and look at the many and various shops. Many cafes, not overpriced. You could get lost, but if you keep going, you'll return to civilisation eventually.

A place to remember. The barrio gotic is very special. When in BCN you will for sure bump unto it. Get lost in its narrow streets and let the gotic vibes kick in. Be wary of pick pocketers and other possible scams.

worth a visit!. I stayed in a hotel right in the heart of the Gothic Quarter.
The restaurants and the shops with hand made products add spice to the old city :) the vintage buildings and the small streets guarantee a good walk down the quarter!

Take a guided tour to fully appreciate. With Roman foundations and buildings from the middle ages this is a place to explore old Barcelona. However to fully appreciate what you are seeing I recommend taking a guided tour.

The old city. We visited this part of the city on our most recent visit to Barcelona. This is a good chance to see a part of history. The streets are narrow and winding. There are shops for everybody. Plan on spending at least a full afternoon.

Time travel. You actually feel as if you have traveled thru a time machine and have reached several years back. Really inspiring architectures and really talented street artists with loads of fun all around the corner. heaven for street photographers
Fun and Pretty. Such a fun area! Give yourself time to walk the streets and enjoy random shops and cafes. Definitely my fav part of the city.
Gothic quarter. We stayed here & it was the perfect location. Walking distance of most attractions & a very nice old & interesting part of the city.
Wonderful. We took a long walk in the Gothic Quarter and everything we saw , the historical buildings, little shops or bars was filled with greatness or just love for life and impressed us!
Great place to walk around Barcelona. Take in the sights, enjoy some food and wine, relax with Barcelonians. It's just fun and the architecture is amazing.

Best Adventure. Explore every day because you will see something different every time. Restaurants are plentiful and courtyards are often magical. We got very lost one night but never worried. The people are so kind!

please be careful. Gothic Quarter is great but I want to mention increasing theft in Barcelona. While walking around yesterday, my brother was warned by some people who told a bird has pooped on him. The same three people with napkins on their hand asked him to take of his jacket and offered help to clean it. (Actually they had sprayed paint on him) As he had recently read an article just exactly on this in Tripadvisor, he understood that they are thieves. There were also two other victoms just next to him (two senior ladies). My brother warned the ladies and tried to get away. There were some other people from the gang chatting around. One of them got very angry and pushed my brother. Please be very careful and have a look at this tripadvisor article for safety in Barcelona. http://www.tripadvisor.com/Travel-g187497-s206/Barcelona:Spain:Health.And.Safety.html
Amazing. I could spend a month here. This place is fantastic, so much to see, eat, buy & learn. Make sure you do a walking tour if you get a chance.Also walk down all the little side streets.

It's very GOTHIC and has many stores to SHOP!. Imagine a shopping mall right in the midst of a Gothic Quarter. The passageways were very narrow at some point but it was fun navigating thru there. You can get a little lost but it was fun exploring the little passage ways. I wouldn't wonder on my own especially at night. Great place to do some shopping, take pictures, and sight seeing.

Great place to just shop, eat and explore!!. Visited the Gothic Quarter (Barri Gotic) with several friends, it is a quick metro trip from anywhere within Barcelona. Found this great Tapas Bar in the quarter that is to die for called Bar del Pla. There is also the Chocolate Museum which if you like chocolate you have to go to it as well. The shops are amazing and you can find almost anything you could ever think or want to buy. Must stop here!!

GRAND OLD GOTHIC QUARTER. Loved this part of Barcelona. Lovely shops mixing old and new, modern and antiques, commercial and artisanal. Great jazz pubs and tapas bars. Some of the best places to eat are also found here.Great to start exploration later in the afternoon and you may find yourself staying until the wee hours of the morning.

Beautiful and so old!. This is a really old laberynth of narrow streets and alleys. It has a dark quality, I suppose that´s why they call it Gothic Quarter, and yet all the small squares full of bars and restaurants give a lively atmosphere to it. Taking a walk through its treets is a MUST while in Barcelona. You will find the Cathedral in this area, which is also very beautiful.

Truly must be visited. This olde world part of Barcelona is a contrast to the traffic, noise and modernity of other parts of the city. Stroll around and take in the atmosphere, cool bars and eateries and enjoy it.
Great Character!. This was our favorite part of Barcelona. We suggest going later afternoon to enjoy sunset and early nightlife.
Beautiful!. Absolute must if you go to Barcelona. Beautiful little side roads with nice little shops. Just start wandering around, and you'll be amazed!
Labyrinth. Labyrinth of streets with quirky bars shops & restaurants. Looks totally different day & night. Down side graffiti
Charming. Small streets, narrow alleys and very charming. Plenty of small cafes, tapas restaurants, small squares and shops. Take a step from the main streets to avoid the most touristy stuff.

Oldest part of the city!. I love history so this part of the city was the best for me. Look for the hidden church and the head sticking out from the building. The only one in Barcelona! Can you guess what it represented?

Speechless. You can get lost here. And that's a good thing, as long as you have some sort of an idea as to how you can get out. You can never get bored of walking the narrow alleys, stopping at little cafes and maybe even watching a street performer. The architecture is one of a kind and it is an amazing place.

Good for a stroll. There are a couple of interesting things to see through the Barrio Gótico. You find a few local artists on the streets, there is a lot of window shopping to do, a few good places to stop and eat, and you'll find that a lot of house numbers have the name "Jehovah" on them. We walked all the way to the pier and it was a nice stroll.
Still medieval. A great place to wonder around this part of the city: I mam sure it is neither as crowded or smelly as it was in Medieval times but certainly conveys a sense of what it was like.

A real joy to explore.. Ever wanted to get lost down ancient narrow streets? "No"; then don't go here. If you are looking to be taken away to a wondrous, historic adventure then an exploration is a must. They have started to also preserve the ancient Roman Walls which are equally magnificent. The cathedral is great as well, nothing like anything I have seen before with an open courtyard full of geese. Crazy.
Great for Tapas. Pop to the market on the rambla & then go for a wander through the Gothic Quarter, find a nice Placa & enjoy.
Lived here!. Amazing place to be! Be sure to stop by the cathedral and all the shops, restaurants, and cafes in the gothic quarter. One of the most beautiful areas of Barcelona!
Nice place. This place was close to where we stayed (Hostal Fernando); nice place to walk, sample churros and chocolate, small lanes and squares and old roman structures

Favorite area in BCN. This was our favorite area when visiting Barcelona. The historical buildings are beautiful and feel never-ending as you wind through the small walkways and archways. Lots of great shops and restaurants in this area. We stayed nearby at the Mercer Hotel, and spent the majority of our weekend stay in the Gothic Quarter.

Beautiful lanes and feast for tastebuds. Barri Gothic is adjacent to Rambla street and one can easily spend 2-3 hours walking in the narrow lanes, if lucky you will come across many street performers during the evening. The beautiful architecture especially of Cathedral added special effects of twilight and lamps, takes you back to olden days. Lots of eateries and cafes. You can also opt for walk tours which are operated from Rambla to explore the area with guide. (However we choose to explore it ourselves.) Would advice to be with a company post 9ish as we came across a few shady characters in the dark alleys. Also please do not take cab from the close Square as we heard of few cheating instances.

Gothic Serenity Hostel in the Gothic Quarter.... We actually stayed in the Gothic quarter, which was great, so easy to walk down to the Ramblas or across the wooden bridge to the new Shopping mall....lots of really great tapas bars and it certainly came alive at night.....defifitly a city for the young, although we still enjoyed it. The Hostel supplied us with ear plugs just in case we could not sleep at night, because the bars stay open very late. So great for shopping, bars and tapas bars and restaurants...
Vibrant walking neighborhood. Beautiful narrow streets, plenty shops, pastries and restaurants with lots of history. I loved walking in this neighborhood.

interesting tiny passageways with shops. This is centrally located area with narrow passageways that lead to old shops. I saved it for the last day because I wanted to do some shopping there. for instance, there are the jamon shops and you have a choice of the ones that are specially hand-cut or the ones that are machine cut .
Great Barcelona Neighborhood. I enjoyed walking around this part of the city. There are some great examples of gothic architecture, and a lot of cool little shops and cafes to keep you occupied.
Interesting. Some really interesting roads and lanes with nice unusual shops a lot of graffiti though which makes it look bad at night

Surrounded by History. A pleasure to stroll around an area surrounded by so much history Beautiful Buildings Secluded squares Quaint Shopping great value restaurants Tiny winding streets and alleyways an intriguing place not to be missed

love it. worth going through the streets as each street is different esp the buildings - none are the same - lose yourselves as if in a maze and have fun looking at building an high up of the characistics of theses buildings
lovely streets at night. Great for a walk at night, very enchanting. Old cobbled streets, Fantastic cathedral you can walk round.

A Labyrinth of art!. Gothic quarter is a beautiful part stretching from La Rambla to the Via Latinae and has remnants of its glorious Roman past. The narrow ,winding streets open up into placas or squares creating an interesting labyrinth full of pieces of architecture! While we were walking through a narrow street we started to anticipate a piece of art at every corner and you bet we were not disappointed at all.I would advise you to look up and around or you may miss some nice bits!Right in the heart of the quarter is a huge Cathedral which is equally superb form the inside. Placa Reial is good to relax and to be spoilt for eating choices from Tapas to Paellas. Placa St. Jaum is famous for its government buildings which are open for public on Sunday mornings. There are some good shops too which are an exception from the regular souvenir shops. Beware of the pick pockets and try not to roam about late at night though.To get to Barri Gotic or gothic quarter there are three metro stops on La Rambla , Liceu is one of the stations and Jaum 1 is on the side of Via Latinae.A perfect place for an afternoon stroll!

Great atmosphere. This is a great place to get lost in, there are so many amazing buildings, lovely little cafes & restaurants, shops, market stalls, street entertainers & there was even an impromptu local gathering of dancers on the main square when we were there.

Take your googlemaps GPS and set for walking.... I loved walking around and just experiencing... and with googlemaps set for my destination or my hotel I knew I could travel the alleyways and not get too lost!
Well worth 2.5 hours!. Juan C. was seriously amazing! I had a blast learning about this beautiful and historic part of Barcelona. Juan knows his stuff!!

Barcelona in March. Loved being here. The weather is a little nippy with wind most days but we still see the sun. Love the Gothic section of town...lots to see. We are here during Carnival so there seems to be a parade going on somewhere all day long. It is nice to sit at a little outdoor cafe along the parade route, drink a hot chocolate, eat Tapas and peppers and watch it go by. Charming.
The best part of the city.. A lovely area to wonder around. Beautiful architecture and wonderful narrow lanes. Peaceful in February.

Must see for the History Buff. Barcelona is a great place for strolling, people watching, and experiencing Spain. When we were there late last year we spent an enchanting day wandering around the Barri Gotic (The Gothic Quarter) of old Barcelona. After a quick breakfast on La Rambla, head down towards the harbor and dive into the Middle Ages. Stop at the Cathedral and take in the exterior and the performers in the square. Make sure you visit the Museum of the History of the City. You can walk into and over excavated Roman ruins to really get a feel for the foundation of Barcelona. There are plenty of little streets and alleys to explore within the old Jewish Section. Signage is good, and we found the shop owners to be very helpful and friendly. Plan on going into the Picasso Museum to see how Barcelona influenced his art and his life. Well worth the entrance fee.

Spend lots of time here.. We spent most of our time in Barcelona here. There is so much to see and do. Great restaurants, little shops, street life, architecture, plazas and little squares, narrow winding streets. It has an air of mystery in a way that's hard to explain. A great place to walk around and just soak it all in.
COOL. i loved the architechture, the bars at night and the pizza place late night after the drinks. it feels like you are in a batman movie. loved it.

Classic architecture. It is a nice compact area to walk around. Many small shops, restaurants, bars, etc. As you walk around, don't just look at eye level but up at the amazing architecture and details.

A great historic walk around Barcelona. The Barri Gotic is the historic architectural centre of Barcelona. Small narrow streets and great independent shops and cafés are the norm here. It's a wonderful area to aimlessly wander around taking in the many sights of historic Barcelona. Stop for some tapas outside in a quaint square or take in some art at the Picasso museum. Get closer to your spiritual self at the gothic cathedral. There's something for everyone to see in Barri Gotic.

Beautiful, old world charm. This was my favorite place to wander every day. The old churches are magnificent, and the narrow winding streets are perfect "old-world" Europe. While roaming the streets one day I stumbled on to El Quatra Gats (4 cats) restaurant that my wife and I returned to for dinner and had a really great time with people from all over the world, Be careful of the young girls and their "babies" and other scam artists in these areas. They are good at their trade and are plentiful.
Market is a must. Nice walking road, extraordinary market, pleasant small roads in the old city. Some parts do not seem safe: dark, isolated, suspicious men drinking.

Great area to walk around explore. Barri Gotic was one my favorite places in Barcelona. It's a great area with a lot of amazing sights. Take a guide book or go on a tour so you can understand the area better.

My favorite place to stroll. So much amazing architexture to take in we went back so many times, we always ended up here! Food can be a bit over priced and not that good, so i dont recommed eating her. I'm sure there are some good places, we Really like the Taller Tapas. However, from the other three places we ate at we were never impressed and once didn't even finish our meal left and ate somewhere else. Shopping is great. Just walk! take in the people, the buildings. Ahhh makes me wish i was back

Walk at night. Its safe and full of small alleyways and shops, great stops in tavernas and restaurants and very clean. Never had a problem with pickpocketing at all but we were careful and it was winter

Fantastic Area to browse ...... This area is great. It has a lot of charm, wonderful shops and some AMAZING restaurants (some really bad ones too, golden rule fellow travelers.. if there is nobody sitting at tables at 9pm.. there is a good reason for this). Its definitely an area you should visit.

Brought back to the past. The area has so many old buildings and very narrow street.It seems we were brought back to the past.We spent around 1-2 hrs in this area strolling around to admire the beauty of the past.Even my 7 yrs old daughter loves this area.

A MUST for any trip to Barcelona!. The architecture is amazing! Each place you look this is something interesting to see. Be sure to take an empty memory card with your camera. Plenty of other sites to visit if you get tired of just strolling around on want to grab a bite to eat.

Walk around it is worth it. If like us you did a bus hop-off and hop- on as our guide book recommended then make sure you leave time to walk around the Gothic quarter. Lots of quiet streets to explore too.

Beautiful architecure. Loved he gothic quarter full o people and life... has a life is own.. it carries you through its alleys and shows you so much... You will come across some of he best little pubs and restaurants. It was amazing and shopping sales are a dime a dozen... Loved It!
Gothic Quarter Tour. It is well worth taking a walking tour around the Gothic quarter as there is so much history surrounding it. Gives you a real insight into the history of Barcelona.
Very quaint. A guided tour is a must do - there are so many interesting facts and places to see plus lots of nice small cafes/tapas bars etc.
