There are many Pakishops, a bit more expensive than a normal supermarket but still enough supplied to find what you need.***You can take with you everything that you want and dress as you like, the beautiful thing about this city is that people don't judge you.You can happen to be there in the morning with normal dress, in the afternoon with your swimming suite and in the evening with your nice party dress and it is always very nice to be walking in this very attractive quarter.You can plan to walk there just for an hour or so, otherwise you can spend there the all day just visiting this quarter, its streets, museums, churches and Cathedral.Enjoy it!!

Nice 3 hour stroll. Saw the local Catelian folks dance in front of Church; was very nice. Saw signage for a Clasical Guitarist that same night. We can back and it was a highlight. Lots of little cafes where you can try and find where you are on a map. My 3 maps were failures but so were to MANY other folks who were looking a their's - no risk of being really lost. There is a 9:30am English tour - we missed it - no harm done.

Perfect for wandering around. After we ate our way through the market, we ambled back through the narrow alleys leading into the Gothic Quarter, one of the most ancient parts of the city. Stop and gawk at the rose window of Santa Maria del Pi (St. Mary of the Pine Tree), the neighborhood Gothic church built between 1319 and 1391. There is an artist's market here every week and we wandered through the exhibits, admiring the variety. Then we followed the meandering alleyways back farther off the main road, and found small restaurants and tiny shops and hostels, mixed in with apartments and train stations and miniature grocery stores.
Quaint.. Got the real feel of the Old Barcelona here. Lots of interesting bars, shops and buildings. Loved the atmosphere walking around, and the architecture.
Nice for a walk. You can spend a couple of hours walking through these narrow streets which are filled with shops. Along the way you'll see some interesting squares, cathedrales and museums.
Get lost!. Just get lost and you will find very nice shops and cafes.The Cathedral, the narrow streets, lot's of turists, nice buildings, and great pictures - visit Gothic Quarter!Enjoy!!
Brilliant!. To be honest there is so much to see and do in this wonderful city that you literally could spend a week in it exploring, but the Barri Gotic is a must see

Great area. The Gothic quarter is a lovely area, slightly less busy but still very interesting. The little side streets are in abundance and there are some lovely restaurants tucked away down them. Very traditional.

Great place to amble around. We walked around this charming part of town when we were fighting jet lag and we wanted to stay awake. It was not too taxing, just a nice place to stroll along, look at shops, and grab a coffee. The alleys are narrow, but every now and then will enter into a larger square. We stumbled upon the cathedral and found it beautiful.

Spend at least an afternoon. The area is full of interesting architecture, museums and great restaurants. This old part of the city is well preserved and an interesting contrast to the Modernist area.

perfect afternoon stroll. wondering in the alleys full of sights, shops, people, burs and restaurants. It is best in the afternoon when shops are still open and streets are full of people and tourist attractions are open

Roam and enjoy. The many hidden alleys that rambled throughout the Quarter was what caught my attention as I was enthralled by the age of this section of the city and the amazing architecture around every corner.

Safe walk through history. We felt safe walking through this beautiful part of the city. It never goes to sleep day or night so be careful booking a hotel room if your a light sleeper. There were so many interesting spots, from cathedrals to tapas to the little boutique.
Probably our favorite day in Barcelona. Take the time to discover the Gothic quarter...little alleys with wonderful shops and restaurants. Get lost in the Gothic district--you won't regret it.

Take a Guide. Lots of little alleys and out of the way places. Loads of shops to browse. To know what you are looking and to understand the area, take a guide.We recommend the Travelbound FREE daily walking tours, found by accident and super.

A must to visit. The heart of any visit to Barcelona. Find a local Granja cafe and enjoy the churros and chocolate. Then walk until you drop! Just wandering was the best thing we did, no itinerary no pressure.

Prepare your comfortable shoes. Very nice old area with many interesting shops, bars and restaurants. You can spend a whole day strolling around it without a fell of time waste. I was pleasantly surprised at each corner with something to see or photograph. Each street is worth visiting and it is very difficult to say which one is the "main" one or where the actual "center" is (if there is such thing in Barcelona at all).
Love!. We loved walking the streets of the Gothic quarter. There are great tapas spots, small plazas, boutiques, etc. very close to Las Ramblas and the port area.

Stroll for hours. Relaxing but so much to see, do, eat and drink. Can be a very cheap afternoon if need be too! Great architechture and so much in a small space. Quiet corners and bustling squares. Much more "Spanish" than the rest of Barcelona
Great area to stroll and explore. Wander around the stores, try the various restaurants and look for the choloate coated churros. Area is always busy with people and many restaurants to choose from.

Very gorgeous architecture. We wondered through the Gothic quarters almost every day! We love the small streets, the most gorgeous architecture, the character o the area. There is so much history and it appears mysterious. A must place for the history and architecture lovers
Beautiful and interesting. A great place to wander around. Interesting shops, lots of bars and restaurants and lovely squares. Great atmosphere.
Wow. Beautiful buildings.The cathedral is breathtaking.Wonderful tapas bars and restaurants. Great atmosphere.
Gothic splendor. The whole ambience of the buildings, some steeped in history and others of course so different with their Gaudi influence. Great just walking around

Well worth a visit. Lots to see and do around here , put it on your list.
Watch out for pickpockets they are everywhere!

Better than Las Ramblas. I liked this area much more than Las Ramblas. It was less crowded and the shoppes and stores were more unique. However if you going there to see Gothic building there is not much, only the church.

Beautiful place to stroll morning or night. It's best without the large,noisy tour groups so try to go earlier in the day. The roman wall that runs the length of the Gotic Quarter is very impressive. Look for shops and restaurants off the main streets. The ones in the smaller walkways are usually higher equality and less busy.
Historic Barcelona. Very interesting part of town that includes the Roman walls and the Jewish Quarter. The atmosphere is special.
Walking Tour. Do the walking tour and hear and see about the history. 2-3 hours should do it, then you have time to wander back to revisit favourites, listen to buskers or admire the squares.

Get lost in the quarter. I can only say that I didnt use a map and enjoyed getting lost in the Gothic Quarter. I dont think I passed anything twice. Shops, restaurants, galleries, bars galore. I literally spent the majority of my time here.
Great area, loads of character and lots of restaurants. A touch of the old spain in a big city, loads of character and atmosphere , well worth a visit when staying in Barcelona

Very interesting. A fun place to walk for several hours, have lunch or dinner, or shop. We were warned about pickpockets (like many places in Europe) but had no trouble nor saw anyone we would be concerned about. We were there more than once, and would go back.
Not bad. Pretty cool to walk around in, not cheap though. If you're not there to shop then it's still cool to see but not for more than a couple of hours.
Barri Gothic. Excellent I loved this area I felt very comfortable and relaxed. It was safe and enjoyable to look at the different type of buildings.

Wandering the streets has never been so much fun. Great to get lost in, and superb to explore. The Gothic quarter (Barri Gotic) is a 15th century treasure of alleys, shops, tapas bars, churches and restaurants.
wandering around on the streets. was nice to stroll around. I liked the Gothic structures and lot of little restaurants all over. Area is right next to la rambla
Narrow Streets. Wander down the gothic quarter and get lost, it is so fun! Stumble across quirky vintage shops and magnificent eateries!

Great Durring the Day, Feels Eerie At Night . The Gothic Quarter feels like a vast network of tiny streets that are used by pedestrians. Lots of tiny shops and cafes everywhere.
At night it feels like a dark maze and you can easily feel like Jack the Ripper can roam the night here looking for victims.
It is very safe though.
beautiful. great little cafes and "milk houses" where you can buy pastries and goodies to eat while you stroll - winding streets full of history and it's virtually impossible to get lost! A must do.

Great quarter. Great quarter with perfect and unique athmosphere. In gotic quarter you can feel like in a different city. The only disadvantage is that there is lot of people and also pickpockets. Really this is nice place recomended for you visit
History just looks at you. I have been to Barcelona 10 times. I have to see this quarter again and again and see anything I missed. It is just awe inspiring

Atmospheric - loved the cathedral. The main attraction here is the cathedral - yet another fabulous building in ths wonderful city. The shops and cafes here are varied and it is good to just wander around enjoying the sights and soaking up the atmosphere. I might have enjoyed it more but had left it untill the end of the day and did not have much time for a leisurely stroll.
Beautifully preserved.. Great to stroll around and see the wonderful gothic architecture. Can be done in an afternoon if you're in a hurry.

Kind of mysterious. This was a wonderful place to walk around and get a taste of what Barcelona must have been like through the ages. Lots of windy streets and cute shops (great shopping!) not to mention chocolate places too. History really comes alive here.

Plus and minus. While overall the Gothic Quarter was not what I expected, the cathedral is magnificent. Also, be sure to visit the Roman excavations at the Museum, which are outstanding. My reservation here was expecting to see more Gothic architecture.

Time to Wander. We spent a wonderful afternoon meandering (and getting a little lost!) in these narrow winding streets. Many beautiful buildings tucked away off the beaten track as well as a a variety of shops.
Great to potter around. Lovely to potter around any time of day. Interesting architecture, sculpture, restaurants, bars, shops... Love it!
Charming Area. I walked all around. Seemed quite unreal - as if I had been transported to some other age. Loved it.

A Must While in Barcelona. Very picturesque, romantic and fun. Great architecture and fun to walk around and get a little lost. There are many shops and people about. Very close to all other attractions in town. Great way to end the night.

A marvelous area to wander at night.. Just wander round and absorb the atmosphere, in the day have a Chocolate with churos and at night have tapas.
It easy to get lost though!

In love with architecture. I loved getting lost in this area of town. No matter where your are, you've got a lovely view. The buildings have such character and each one has its own distinct beauty. I love just staring at a building and wondering who spent their time working and building the beautiful places.
Nice place to get lost. I literally got lost in the Gothic Quarter, but I didn't mind. It just felt so ancient and all I had to do was find the church tower. By then I was well on my way.

Like 20 years before. We've been to Bracelona more than 20 years ago, and returning know I was pleased to find the place exactly like i remembered. We spent an afternoon walking around there, and it was lovely.
Super Walking Tour. Get the free walking tour, but please tip them well. They are so good! Funny, deep, rich in information, passionate

A great place to spend the evening at. We have been there for two nights out of four, and the place is really amazing and very special. Don't miss the vendors who sell sweets on the corner of the streets, we personally liked the sweet apples and also the take-away Sushi, it's also very close the the main street of la Rambles where there are shows and things do to all along the day
nice place. nice and quaint coffee shops small church 3 euros to go in then another church free was great . not alot for goths though if they want gothic gallore
Historic Walking Areas.... Really nice Neighbourhoods, Historic Walking Areas to see...it was really pleasure to feel this streets....
Vibrant and bustling area. Narrow streets, cathedrals, squares, fast food, tapas, bars, clothing outlets...this area had it all and it partied until the wee small hours. Well worth a wander.

Must visit. The old part of BCN contains many in steering historical buildings as well as some really interesting shops. There are many small cafes throughout this area, and enjoy a quick vino in a small Placa. One can wander all the streets in this area for a whole day!

Art and craft. So much to see, buildings, craft shops.
Narrow passageways open into square's with fountains or
civic buildings. Lots of shops to spend time in. Resturants
with great lunchtime menus.

A must in Barclona. Just loose yourself around the small street and discover shops, galleries, restaurants, should not try to plan your way, just walk around on every corner you will find nice places.

Better than Las Ramblas!. The architecture and variety here is very fun to explore. There are many stores, beautiful architecture, delicious restaurants, and of course many museums to keep you occupied :) You can easily spend a day here exploring and eating.

This is what Barcelona is all about!. Turn off of tourist ridden La Rambla and explore the Barrio Gothic. There is a great Gothic catheral we stumbled upon, great places to each and plenty of ´hidden´ plaça to chill in.

just wander all day here. Great shopping, restaurants, sights (cathedral, Roman wall, etc). Found some live music on the "street corner" next to the cathedral. It's close to La Rambla and Born. Loved it.
A must see in Barca.. Old Barcelona with its small streets and lane ways gives you an idea of how people lived within the old city walls.

Beautiful!. We spent half a day walking around in the Gothic Quarters. Small stores, narrow streets, fantastic arcitecture, lovely cafés with tapas everywhere... I can definitely recommend the Gothic Quarters if you have a few hours to kill!
(We were there on a friday. The whole area seemed to close down on Sunday though so try to visit during the weekdays!)

Magic, lost in time and place. I loved exploring the streets of the Gothic Quarter. Easy to be lost but there is so much to see and do - it's look and feel is quintessentially European. Loved every moment. Shop, drink, eat your way through Gothic Quarter for a day. You won't be disappointed,

Lives up to expectations. Barri Gotic is very close to the La Rambla and Plaça de Catalunya and easy to get to.It is in the centre of the old city of Barcelona and stretches from La Rambla to Via Laietana, and from the Mediterranean seafront to Ronda de Sant Pere.It's ones the places to stroll through at your leisure but with the usual warnings from local Catalans which is to keep you handbag/wallet safe!!The streets/alleyways vary considerably in style but the old quarter is generally characterised by narrow cobbled streets with tall old buildings.The cobbled streets might impact on families with more than one Buggy and anyone in a Wheelchair (could be a bit tiring after a while).Picasso apparently lived and worked in Barri Gotic as did Joan Miró.We stopped for leisurely Coffee breaks and just soaked in the atmosphere.There are also a diverse range of eateries there to cater for most palates but seafood is always high on most Menus in Barca.It's steeped in history and my only regret (after the event) is that I didn't read more about it before visiting it!

Eat here, stay here, play here. Absolutely fabulous! Gothic Quarters in Barcelona are the heart of this city. Although not far from the very touristy La Ramblas, not many visitors to this city venture out much here. Do yourself a favour and get lost into the maze of streets. You will find amazing photo opportunities, brilliant shops, great food. 10/10.

Explore. Make sure you explore the streets and alleys of the Gothic Quarter for a taste of old Barcelona. Wondering around this quarter you'll feel like you've just gone back in time. Be sure to go early in the morning before it gets too crowded.
alleyways to lose yourselves in. Lots of intertwined alleyways that eventually link to a square. Lots of traditional cafes and lots of chic boutiques too. Can spend half a day exploring.

Very cool, hip area but be careful!. This is the most touristy area of the town, it´s a great place but like any tourist traps, watch your wallet. Things can be expensive even before you get pick pocketted!

Fantastic old city. We took a day to go in the Gohic Quarter. The place is fantastic. You can see a lot of old beautiful buildings, many nice shops and coffie shops as well. We had a great walk with our camera, enjoyed the life in the old city. We really recomend a walk int the old city. Very nice

Great to wander around. The Gothic Quarter was my favourite area in Barcelona city. Containing plenty of tourist sites (a cathedral, the Barcelona city museum and others), it can be crowded, but the great value is in ducking down a side-street or two and leaving the crowds completely. Take the opportunity to just wander around with no direction in mind: it's gorgeous, safe and well-stocked with near-hidden cafes and bars. A fantastic way to soak up Barcelona culture and atmosphere.
so much to see and do. my feet ached from trying to fit everything in. had a wonderful time seeing all the beautiful places and trying new foods

Yeah!. Since I really enjoyed Barcelona and this is the plced we lived, it had a great ambience and loads of small stores and details and streetlife and was great to be in, but be aware of pickpockets!
Authentic. ...Barcelona is design, a free city, and to discover the old town was an amazing experience, old buildings, churches, its streets in the middle of the modern city

Gothic Quarter. Do not miss because of all its fascinating small streets. We wandered there for hours looking into the shops and cafes. The Picasso Museum and another around the corner were interesting, however, be aware the museum does not have Picasso's best works because they are in major museums around the world
Must see in Barcelona. A great place to walk through to see historic Barcelona. Many of the churches and sites are along the way.

Concentrated charm. So many small restaurants, shops and things to see in all the small, narrow streets. Details on buildings that make you stop to further inspect. Laundry hanging here and there.. You must see for yourself!

Dog pee. Most streets in Barcelona are worth visiting, and many are kind of cramped and cozy, but what you always get is a whiff of dog pee (poop). Making dogs illegal within a certain area of Barcelona would certainly make the whole experience better. The Gothic Quarter has some of the best food (Tapeo, anem de tapes) and nightlife (Rubi bar) in town. Highly recommended

Must do in Barcelona. We skirted the area on our first trip and immersed ourselves in the area this time. It's a remarkable slice of history. Walk it day and night -- go to the Cathedral and immerse yourself in Sardana dancing on Saturday night. A real highlight....
Great sights to see. This is one of the great place to stroll through. Not only for the sights but for the shopping. Store owners are very friendly and helpful, the bars are great.
Awesome. A must do!. This is close to the Hesperia Presedente Hotel. Safe and beatiful. Great shopping and restaurants. The markets were fun but alot of tourist traps.

Fantastic architecture and a place to see in the day and night!. I love the Gothic quarter, especially at night and have so many beautiful photographs...In the day there are small independent boutiques to peruse and at night small bars and tea houses open which are just charming. My friends and I wandered around at night and often did so without bumping into other people since there are so many little alleyways and streets to explore. It's one of my favourite parts of Barcelona!

The Best Part of Barcelona. This was for me the best part of Barcelona (which is itself an amazing city). My best advice is take at least a whole afternoon, ditch the map and just get lost in the medieval neighborhood of narrow streets, shops and cafes. You'll be glad you did.

Wow what architecture!. Great place to go, maze of streets opening out onto different squares. Wonderful during day however I was a little nervous at night as not so many people around and lots of dark corners. During day it's vibrant, loads of people and great little shops and restaurants. Worth a visit to see the architecture.

Winding streets and alleyways. We did a private tour of the Barri Gotic during our recent trip to Barcelona. Our guide Cesar was amazing. He brought the history of Barcelona alive for us. The narrow streets with great shops and restaurants. What a day.
Well worth the trip. This is real Barcelona, all the very quiet back streets and unique shops. Well worth getting lost for an our or two

A wonderful place to wander and get just a little bit lost. This area of Barcelona is filled with so many different visual delights. We spent hours circling the small streets, vandering into various historical sites and enjoying various shops, cafes, bars and restaurants.

Awesome in the classic sence. Absolutely the most amazing and romantic place on earth. Takes you back thousands of years. Get lost here especially late at night. One night there were college students playing flamenco next night around another corner a group of 30 adults singing ave maria to a conductor. Just amazing. And enough tapas bars and restaurants around each corner especially closer to ramblas and sea

Just make me a map!. This area was very exciting to wander thru. We did it with the help of the Free walking tour which leaves from the Travel Bar off of the Ramblas. The guide told us so much and answered questions thoroughly. It was something to be in streets like El Call ( the old Jewish section) and think back to when it was fullof daily activity before the Inquisition. I'll never forget it!
Don't miss the gothic area. I liked to stroll in the narrow streets in the Gothic area. Many art shops and special stores. I liked the atmosphere...

Loved this area!. The Gothic quarter is very interesting and nicely contained so you can walk it and not feel too tired. The Roman remains of Barcino under the modern city were very impressive. The Barcelona Cathedral is beautiful and the Roman temple near modern dwellings just fascinated me. We stayed in this area as it was easy to walk to restaurants, shops and of course the historic area. The Barcelona Marathon came right through on one of our days here.

quaint streets. We visited this part of the city late evening and found many little streets and alleyways to explore to many for the short time we had.. well worth giving yourself a good amount of time as from what we saw would be well worth it.
Cute Alleyways, old buildings. Liked- Narrow alleyways with cute, unique shops- Meat / Wine Shops- Charming architecture - Picasso Museum: Collection and building

Wander and wonder. Lots of little side streets, wonderful gothic architecture, street musicians & performers, simply an enjoyable way to spend the afternoon. A photographer's dream, so many pictures waiting to be taken! Around each corner was something new to see...a flamenco guitarist, a 3 piece jazz group, performers dressed in outlandish costumes. And the Barcelona Cathedral is not to be missed...simply stunning. I was amused that instead of lighting candles though, they had modernized it with electric candles...there is a slot to drop in your coins and any number of candles light up depending on how much money you deposited!
Good places to eat. Narrow streets, lots of shops and odd restaurants. Great old buildings to look at. Full of life in the evening.
Great place for wandering about... Lovely streets, picturesque squares, a cathedral, buskers bands and wine.. A great place for watching the world go by.
Beautiful!. our favorite quarter in Barcelona! Very beautiful, gorgeous! Little Tavernas where you eat very good! Take a walk through, just to look around.

Real fun. We spent a whole day in the Gothic Quarter - and could have spent more :) We took a tour with Runner Bean Tours to the quarter, and afterwards just kept wandering and shopping around. Many nice and old buildings and churches, and many great shops (not just souvenirs!) . Also, the quarter is full of nice places for coffee or tapas :)
the whole world is here. just off the Ramblas and miles of narrow streets with everyting from indy design jewelry shops to irish bars to chic clothes shops to hundreds of restaurants and cafes

Beautiful. I love waking round this area. With the magnificent cathedral and it's beautiful little squares I think it's a great way to spend a couple of hours or so. There are some great little tapas bars, as well, for you to re-fuel along the way - Bar del Pi is one of my favourites.

Lovely place to walk, etc.. We keep going back to the Gothic Quarter. We should have stayed there! We love wandering through the tiny alleys, discovering new things around each corner. A friend who traveled with us shopped 'til her wallet dropped, but it's not my style. Many fabulous restaurants and cafes. Many overly touristy areas are only so much hype, but I've thoroughly enjoyed our time there. We'll be headed back tomorrow.
Charming. This is the place to go when your in Barcelona. Always something to see or taste or experience. Go there, eat there, live there
Get lost in the Labyrinth. A great place to wander for hours. Shopping, eating, sightseeing all in one place! A visual treat for the senses.

Lovely. We took a walk around here quiet a few times on our stay. It has a lovely atmosphere. The shops are very interesting, they sell some really odd stuff but they are very interesting. The market is also very busy and quirky.

Lovely. We took a walk around here quiet a few times on our stay. It has a lovely atmosphere. The shops are very interesting, they sell some really odd stuff but they are very interesting. The market is also very busy and quirky.
winding allies and nice shops. Strolling in the Barri Gotic is shear pleasure, with lots of shops for any taste, mostly the low (touristic) to medium levels of design in clothes, jewelery
The heart of the city. Recommendation: do a tour, than come back twice on your own: once during day time and once during night time.
Enchanting. small narrow streets . architecture, history arts and culture spread all way in this maze of narrow streets between monumental buildings. worth the walk ! needs a couple of hours
Pleasant place for shopping and site seing. The Gothic quarter of Barcelona is a very old part of the city, with small middle ages streets,lots of historical places, shops and places to eat or drink.
the best part of the City. Thsi is my favourate part of the city with its winding paths through beautiful architecture. Look out for hidden bars on the roof tops.

Wonderful atmosphere and full of life. The gothic area is a must for all visitors to Barcelona. Very vibrant with lots of character and charm.plenty to see historical buildings, museums, tapas bars, restaurants etc.

Wanderers delight. Loved the Gothic Quarter it was one of my highlights of Barcelona ....to wander through here at different points of the day. It was always different, some busy streets some very quiet alleys it is a great place. I love walking around and coming across churches, museums etc that I am not looking for...it makes it a bit more original and allows you to absorb the atmosphere in this area of Barcelona rather than have your nose in a map trying to find things of interest. Lovely place of Barcelona with plenty of attractions, cafes and people watching to be had! :)

Atmospheric cultural and historical centre. The Gothic Quarter gives the visitor the opportunity to see Barcelona at its best. The narrow streets house all sorts of quaint and wonderful shops and museums. You are never far away from somewhere to have food and drink, especialy tapas. The best time to visit this area is dusk, you can wander around the streets and get the eerie atmosphere of a medieval centre.There are amazing religious buildings in this area also.

Drama & Romance! (...and lovely wine bars). My favourite experience of Barca by far. I could be lost in the Gothic Quarter for the reat of my born days and die happy. Dramatic architecture turn after turn, a maze of winding alley-ways, churches, museums, indie shops and many many old authentic tapas bars and little old wine bars. Blissful by day with an exciting touch of edginess in some parts by night. Wow.
you can spend some hours here. Go and spend some hours. Have a book to understand about it, or find a guide - too many interesting stories to know and see.

Narrow streets and a sense of history. Our hotel was on the edge of this part of the city - so we could walk outside and we were almost immediately there. Narrow streets that felt cramped and full of history - the cathedral is beautiful but keep walking and you are soon off the beaten track in a maze of old stone architecture that is awe inspiring! Loved it.

Stay at Gothic Quarter. If you can, get a hotel within the Gothic Quarter. It's an amazing place to walk around, get breakfast, coffee, snacks, lunch, etc. and you will get to know this wonderful area of Barcelona.

Quiet. Grab a coffee and sit in the square and people watch. You can also watch the pickpockets at work, they are all over the place and you can see how they target stupid tourists with open bags and wallets in back pockets (usually American!)
really nice part of town. not much to say enjoyed trying to not get lost in the small streets around the catherdal, how can you lose a cathedral i did on numerous occasions
A fun and unusual area. Lots to see and do here: quaint little shops (one is a marvelous miniature store - leaves most people in awe), great bars and amazing architecture.

Take a walking tour. If you go take a walking tour. The historical facts and stories behind the stone walls are much more interesting than just the views. I was fascinated to know about the buried cemeteries and the roman walls.
CHARMING ATMOSPHERE. Not far from the placa catalunya.THE cathedral -the narrow streets- the street artists- the atmosphere- don-t miss it.

Just wander around. and enjoy the unexpected squares, fountains, churches, gargoyles, Roman walls, not to mention shops with surprisingly good value..... and watch out for the children playing football in the side streets - they take their game very seriously and do NOT stop for tourists!

Cool place to get lost.. I took a (lonely Planet travel guide) walking tour through the Gothic Quarter and it was very interesting. Found several Tapas bars and Irish Pubs I liked. On the route was two Cathederals and Several unique Plazas. Its a maze of tight streets and ancient buildings, easy to get lost and I did, but you are not too far from the waterfront or La Ramblas, so you can wander around and will eventually come to the Docks or main walking zone. I especially liked La Cathederal, and Plaza De Phillip Neri.

Beautiful area. If you love historic buildings this is a must see in Barcelona. We loved exploring on our own but also did a short walking tour with a guide who pointed out so much that we might otherwise have missed.

An enchanting area of Barcelona.. A wonderfully entertaining time can be simply spent wandering the charming Barri Gotic. It's a interestingly beautiful hive of narrow friendly streets that are brim full of excellent little shops, cafes, restaurants & attractions.Especially just ever so slightly across Via Laiteana towards the Church of Saint Maria del Mar. There's much more to it than just strolling Las Ramblas (which we honestly didn't find particularly warming!) A visit you will be richly rewarded in making. Enjoy!

Get Lost. The Barri Gotic is a maze of enchantment! Seriously, put on your walking shoes and wander around aimlessly. There are so many side streets, shops and restaurants to explore.You can also get a lot of your souvenirs from this area rather than Las Ramblas.
You must do this!. It will feel strange and bizarre but I have walked through this twice and loved the weirdness every time. Enjoy the quiet cafes, hidden treasures and narrow narrow lanes.
Great area. Enjoyed the area for photography.Nothing to dislike, except that some homeless people pan handle you while you are in a restaurant.
Gothic Quarter. One of my favorite areas to walk around in Barcelona. It's a pretty small city so you will find yourself here at some point.

Gothic tour of Barcelona. Last thursday we enjoyed a guided tour of the Gothic region of Barcelona. Our tour guide Tanya was excellent. She was very knowledable and friendly, The company, Castle Experience, she told me was quite a new company, so feedback is very useful for them. I would thoroughly recommend them, Also \I hope you get Tanya she made the tour smashing.Chris and Sue

Wonderful little area. Take all day to wander through this area, you will discover amazing little alleyways with bridges from one side to the other, lovely plaza's with bars and restaurants and great shops

A good contrast. You won't be missing this area as it is along the la rumblas, it is an area you can find so many by wondering around only, the bacelona cathedral is one of the surprises.the music the bars and the relaxing atmosphere were also fantastic.

traveller. The area is very atmospheric, the architecture and layout of the streets make it a fascinating place to visit. Then there is the lovely music of the lone guitar player to be followed by a violinist.We unexpectedly came upon Barcelona Cathedral which is worth a visit by itself.You walk into a courtyard which has a pond in the centre, home to several geese.The cathedral itself is a marvel of architecture and you could easily spend hours trying to take it all in.I couldn't find anything in the area to dislike.
Beautiful. Nothing more to say. On of the most amazing places I've ever been to. Stunning architecture, great cafes and bars and most very well priced.
History in the modern world. Just to walk around this area makes you think that today's planning departments especially in the UK have lost their way.
Wandering the Streets. Enjoyed visiting this part of the city which was the main part of it originally - all narrow streets and interesting buidings.

Feels like you are in an different era. Literally walk into this place, after visiting passeig de gracia and then palau de lamusica catalana- wow, what a different place. Felt like I was in an different time zone- so romantic! Lovely places to visit like the cathedral, museums are great and the streets are full of amazing things here and there. Can imagine this place gets pretty busy in summer as some streets are pretty small.

Talent around every corner. This is a wonderful part of the city, with all the narrow streets to explore. Around every corner there is a musician playing. We came across a cello player, violinist, guitarist who were all wonderful, but our favourite were the two tenors who sang in the evening at the back of the cathedral- just amazing to stand and listen to such singing. Plenty of places to eat and relax.
You could spend forever looking about. You could easily spend all day looking around the shops, church's etc, The atmosphere is just lovely.
The walk about. We love walking around in the Gothic Quarter. There s. an unique site around each bend in the Sally and winding roads.
Just wander and find......... Full of side streets and wonderful finds in amazing churches, theatres, ice cream parlours and bars.

Short stay. If you like shopping, this is the place to go. Miles of tiny little streets, selling just about anything. Take care at night though, as we wondered down some very narrow streets, with no lights, only to come to a dead end. Stick to the main streets

A maze of streets and squares. Loads of little streets and squares to visit and walk around. Can be quite creepy at night when the little shops are closed, but great during the day. Lots of cafes, bars and restaurants.

Both Historic and Modern. We really enjoy walking around the Gothic Quarter and having wine or beer and tapas, then checking out some of the history...then moving on again to another drink and food. It's a really enjoyable experience and we've done it nearly every night of our vacation. Make sure you pay attention to the non-nationals when they come around you - they're known for their pick-pocketing skills. We've been lucky so far, but keeping our fingers crossed that we don't let our guard down. It's just like any other big city, though. We have thoroughly enjoyed the Barri Gothic!
A walk through history. We spent an afternoon walking through the Quarter and found it to be a pleasant way to spend the day. If you enjoy old buildings and museums then you will enjoy this area.

Wonderful. Be sure to step off la rambla and get lost in the narrow streets that make up this area of town. The cafe's and bars are lovely and very reasonable in price compared to some on las rambla! Here you'll also find the cathedral and a few other beautiful architectural works. Lovely, one of my favourite parts of the city
lovely to wander..... there are some amazing tapas bars here....lovely bars where you can sit, sip cocktails and watch the world go by

The very heart of the city. The historical and religious centre of the city. The Roman Barcino remains lay under the currently visible gothic and younger constructions, Narrow streest, sometimes seem a little neglected, but if you look closer there are many interesting details to be seen. The major attractions are the Cathedral, Palau Reial, some old houses and palaces,museums, other churches (e.g. S. Maria del Pi) and squares (some of them require ticets/ are upon fee). A must see when in Barcelona.There are also lots of shops, bars, cake shops, even a demonstration at Placa S. Jaume in front of Palau Generalitat if you are lucky ;-)

Interesting streets.. Stayed in this area for 5 days. Full of atmosphere with interesting streets with great restaurants and individual shops. Very central to everything so Las Ramblas, El Born district, and Barcelonetta are all within walking distance.

Very Good. We stayed at Hotel Gotico, which was perfect for exploring this part of the city. We could see the spires of the First Cathedral from our room - magical. Plenty of good places to eat and many attractions to visit - recommended.
Hidden secret shops. Go off the small side streets in the Barri Gotic. There are so many small jewellery shops and shops selling quirky small things for very cheap.
Afternoon wandering..... You just have to go and wander..... so fun! Wander and stop-- see a church... have a drink... wander some more and around each corner it is charming!
Great area!. Lovely area full of charming streets, shops, interesting architecture and nice people. A must see when sightseeing in Barcelona.

Good place to wander. .... but listen up ladies.... If you’d also like to browse some of the ‘interesting little shops’ (as mentioned in another review) stay clear of Sunday and Monday. Although some shops are open, most of them are the tourist ones selling the same things. Also remember that shops are closed between 2-4/5pm (good time for Sangria.) So I guess for the lads – best time to visit this area is either on a Sunday or Monday! Worth a wander taking in the Cathedral, but don’t make it a priority if you’ve done ‘back streets’ before and/or you’re short on time. Make sure you do the ‘Sagrada Familia, Casa Batllo, Casa Milà (La Pedrera) and Palau Guell first…..
Must see. A Barcelona gem, the architecture is amazing and shops unique. Well worth a visit as just off of the ramblas

Favorite neighborhood in Barcelona. Very old neighborhoods, lots of character, lots of history. I really enjoyed walking around the Barri Gotic, would probably stay in that area if I returned to Barcelona.

Lovely shows and charming ambiente. I liked this quarter. It is cozy, has nice, special shops, really special and just by the Rambla. I was with a friend from the US and she was fascinated, as there are no quarters like this in her country. For europeans, it is usual to visit "old" cities and quarters. But for people from América, this is absolutely original. Worth to visit it.

Ancient Barcelona - gothic quarter. Barri gotic aka gothic quarter of Barcelona is a must see area. The main attraction in this amazing quarter is the Barcelona Cathedral. There are great alleys here with architecture dating back to 14th to 17th centuries. There were some nice tapa bars around- we had some great tapas at a nice restaurant nearby, don't recall the name now.. Also a short walk from Gothic quarter is the Arc de Triomf, which is also worth visiting.
Atmospheric. Lots of winding streets and has a definite "Roman" feel to it! Lots of small shops and restaurants / coffee shops. Would not like walking around some of the side streets after dark...

Shopping Mecca. My wife's dream vacation. Wandering the narrow streets and hundreds of interesting shops and she was in paradise. I just hung on and hoped that I could tear her away for a couple of days to see the Gaudi attractions, et al.

Took a Walking tour with RunnerBean, Catherine. The walk around the old town is certainly a great way to understand how Barcelona come about. I would recommend you to do it or better still get a guide walk tour, so that you could be better informed.
Wonderful architecture. The Gothic Quarter house many many magnificent old stone buildings threaded by narrow walkways. Amongst them is the beautiful Cathedral.

History, beauty, quaint shops and cafes. Our hotel was directly across from the Cathedral, so we had lots of time to explore this area. The closer you are to the Ramblas, the more touristy it is - try to just wander down little alleys and enjoy the squares and plazas. There is a great mix of artisan shops in among the funky restaurants and more trendy or touristy spots. World-class buskers just add to the fun.

Charming place. Liked the small streets, surprising corners with small restaurants, churches. We biked around and it felt like a dream.
The main street is too crowded and full of "tourists traps".
The market was GREAT! full of life colors and food.

Gothic Quarter. Stroll along Las Ramblas and take in the local flavor. Be careful about being in this area late at night. At that time, it's full of prostitutes and others who are up to no good. I speak from experience.

Great place to explore. El Gotic begs for hours of wandering exploration and discovery of its narrow, alley-like, winding streets, tiny eclectic shops, and hidden historical treasures. Beginning at the edge of the busy, modern area around Plaza Catalunya, the barrio stretches for many blocks toward the harbor and includes the Barcelona Cathedral and a great city historical museum, among many other attractions. The cathedral, huge and impressive, is typical of European, medieval cathedrals and is open to the public most times. Nearby are 4th century remains of the Roman city, Barcino, that preceded Barcelona. And if Roman archeology interests you, don't miss the City History Museum which includes extensive Roman ruins that have been excavated beneath the present street level. This museum also includes gothic remains and exhibits on Barcelona in the early Industrial Age, giving a very complete history of this old and interesting city.There is much more to this area of the city that I didn't have time to see--don't miss it!
Nice church. Then architecture is stunning. The Gothic area is a must see when visiting Barcelona and this church in particular is a beautiful sight
Splendid quarter. Old Barcelona at it's best - lots of restaurants and bars, cafes etc. Keep your eyes on the second floor of the buildings and above.
Classic quarter. More and more modern boutiques dot the old Gothic landscape but one still gets the feeling of times gone by
nice to walk around. It is a typical European historical center, pleasant to walk through the narrow streets on a sunny day.
Great shopping. If you are looking for something a bit different - great area for small boutiques. - the side streets can be a bit dismal so stay on the more travelled areas.
Spend some time here.. My favorite area with the narrow streets and many treasures in the way of restaurants, shops and architecture around every corner.

A pleasant walk, unhurried. One can find many "old towns" in many of Europe's older cities and Barca's "gothic quarter" is similar to many, with its winding streets, unique shops, and architectural wonders. If you hav never tried to lose yourself in a place like this, you'll have a wonderful (safe) time, especially during the mid morning when crowds are down and shops are jist opening.
Cozy. This neighborhood is very cozy and very intriguing due it's streets and ghettos. Old buildings and colors make this point a very good point of visit.

Interesting Place to Wander for a Few Hours. Great place to just wander around, do a little shopping, find a small restaurants for some snacks and Spanish wine. Easy to get in and out (downhill takes you to the water) and the area is tucked between 4 main streets so, eventually, you'll run into one of them. Definitely worth exploring.

Wonderful. Must-see..
It is not really a gothic quarter, but it is a lovely place in the old city.
My advice:
- walk there
- eat there
- relax there
- but dont shop there

LET YOU GET LOST IN THIS STREETS. Lovely and interesting. This old streets, completely irregular but without climbings, are made to walk at ease. Lots of shops of everything, from famous brands to cheap things and souvenirs. Nice places to have a cup of coffee (or, better, of chocolate) with good catalonian pastry, or an ice cream, or even a meal. Prices vary thoroughly from place to place, better consult the menu before entering. Try to start your visit in the afternoon, and stay when the sun sets and the lamps go on, because it's a completely different picture.
Lovely. Lovely area with amazing architecture, beautiful squares and fountains and lots of lovely tapas restaurants

Wonderful area to explore. We stayed in a hotel in this barri and spent some part of every day exploring it. If you feel brave, dive down any little alleyway and you are bound to come across a gem of a bar or cafe. The whole area has such character and although I mentioned bravery, we always felt safe. A piece of utterly unspoilt old Barcelona.
Amazing. Shops, a cathedral, churches, museums, cafes and restaurants. The gothic quarter is my favourite part of the city and never disappoints

Good for an afternoon or evening stroll. This is a perfectly preserved Gothic quarter. The streets are small and quaint, just like you might imagine. There are many shops and restaurants to choose from as well. be careful with your belongings as pick pockets are think here. It is not to be missed.

A gem of a place. It was like stepping back in time - the wonderful alleyways and eclectic mix of shops and bars. The cathedral was a brilliant revelation. The area is stunning by day and even more so by night when. It takes on a completely different character.

"Must see" when you visit Barcelona. We stumbled upon the Gothic quarter by accident and truly enjoyed the magnificent architecture, old narrow streets full of history, churches and lovely restaurants.
great walk!!. Great walk,beautiful building close la familia Cathedral beautiful to see the different, gothic homes, stores and shop around the house.
A must see. Although it is nice to wander around by yourself, we went on a walking tour which really helped us appreciate and understand everything. Fascinating!

Wander the streets with the masses. What a fun, energized area...wonderful shopping and food as you wander the maze that is the Gothic Quarter...don't forget your map. A lazy day of Tapas and shopping….a wonderful outdoor antique market set up in front of the Cathedral Barcelona and Bruce and I had a wonderful time wondering…plus shopping…medals, trinkets…great antique prints and vintage phones.
Restaurant. Look our for a restaurant called 'Arcano' - well worth a visit. The food is excellent and not overpriced and the staff are very helpful but not intrusive

Amazing Area. Did not know what to expect. Once I got there I felt like I could be on the set of a James Bond movie. The extremenly narrow streets and quaint details like huge wooden doors that look like 500 years old just delighted me.

Barri gotic. Been here totally different to the rest of the city full of interesting places to discover and explore the only down side is it gets very busy in the summer especially if your looking for somewhere to eat
Take a walk. Intricate street layout - get lost in these streets in daylight hours and enjoy the experience...lots of Gothic architecture to photograph !
Entertaining 2 hours. Very atmospheric, nice little shops, bearing in mind it was a cold grey February day, it was a pleasant couple of hours.
Narrow streets. Old town narrow streets with paella restaurants, shops, bakeries, Jamón ibérico shops. Streets seemed to be safe even in late nights. People ate dinner really late around 10-11PM.
Must visit. This place was awesome, the environment was the best. To me this is the heart of Barcelona for travelers and everything is wonderful.

Old Town. This is the historic Jewish quarter that has more character than any other area I visited in Barcelona. The style and attitude of the old stone streets and buildings is something that you can't recreate. There are historic delis, restaurants, shops, etc. I purchased my dad a hat from a local sombreria which was packed full of customers during Three Kings. I would definitely recommend this area to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Best bit of Barcelona!. Do yourself a favour and dive off the Ramblas into this network of backstreets. Don't worry about being lost - just wander and enjoy. If the fancy takes you, stop for an ice-cream or a coffee. The Plaza de Pi is a tiny square with bars, cafes and a church. if you're lucky enough to see a market, go and spend some money there. When you reach the Via Laetana, turn round and take a different route back. Check out nougat shops, and St Jaume Church and eat a menu del dia almost anywhere.

Deffinetely worth doing in the evening!. We went there in the evening and were surprised how many people were there. A lot of restaurants, shops are there. We finished our walking with a nice dinner and then went to TORES show Flamenco.
Barri Gotic in Barcelona. Very romantic. Narrow, winding alleys with neighborhood restaurants/bars all along. Very medieval vibe with churches and squares all over.

good tapas. There is a great tapas bar in the corner of the square near the old cathederal oppostie the tourist info place. Large coffee only 1.40 euros and great choice of tapas with a good people watching view.

Wander to heart's delight!. Loved wandering around the Gothic Quarter. Every winding street had it's own interesting quirks. Lots of wee places to stop off for a coffee or cerveza. Monumental palaces, cathedrals, squares and museums a plenty! Thoroughly enjoyed exploring!

Great tapas bars. This is the area to find great tapas--look around plaza in front of the Cathedral in particular. Picasso Museum is there. But be careful in areas as you go toward the water become shady.

LIVELY HISTORY. To be honest, I expected less of the "Barri Gotic", after visiting hundreds of Gothic spots around Europe (especially in Germany). But this astonishing little district of Barcelona goes beyond: extremely beautiful and romantic , with nice stores, bars and restaurants... and most importantly, full of life!

The Real Barcelona!!. So much to see, would recommend Caleum (tea/coffee/cakes/liquer shop) and also Placa Reial, a place to stop and ponder life. There is also a lovely organic crepe and ice cream shop just as you are entering the Placa.
Barrio Gotico. Worth to see when visiting Barcelona. Easy access. The cathedral and surrounding buildings are very interesting. I would go again in future visits..

I just love this place. One of my favourite parts of the city. It's old but preserved and clean, multicultural and lively, big enough to "get lost" and explore. I like the shops, bars, entertainment, just about everything in the Barri Gótic (the Gothic Quarter).
Narrow streets, quirky shops and good bars. Just wander, find a good chocolate shop, or a bar, or an old market. An easy but fun place to get lost, with some fabulous buildings to delight the eye.

A Gothic wonder in the middle of Barcelona. The Barcelona Cathedral is a prime example of a Gothic Cathedral and the area around is full of examples of this style of archtecture, together with the bars and street entertainers it is a must and walking distance from La Rambla.

Excellent contrast to the rest of Barcelona. The Barri Gotic is unique to the rest of Barcelona. It is a maze of winding streets going up and down little hills, with buildings that span centuries towering on either side. There are so many different architectural styles and points of interest to see around every corner that you can entertain yourself for ages just walking around without ever going in anywhere. To be sure, there are plenty of tourist trap-type places, but that shouldn't detract from the overall feel of the place. We thought the Museum of the History of Barcelona (MUHBA) is a must-see, as is the cathedral, and just a general stroll around.

Loved this part of town. The Gothic quarter has so many elements to it. There are tons of boutique shops, restaurants, and random things to see. Just like most of Barcelona, but particularly here, you need to be careful of your belongings. You don't have to be afraid but you need to be mindful at night!
cozy. we were only there to visit picasso museum. but the area were beautiful, cozy and old :) we liked it. very historical.

Just walk around :). Walk around this beautiful neighbourhood and let the great architecture, small streets and smells from caffees win you over. If you somehow get bored from that there are plenty of shops with a variety of goods for your entertainment. A bit shady during the night though but nothing bad happened to us :)
Lovely little wander around this part of town.. Lovely architecture, beautiful buildings, great little shops, cafes, bars and restaurants. Great for a relaxing, sightseeing stroll.
Old and interesting. We had a tour with a architecture student, so he showed us lots of nice places, details and stories behing the buildings. The quarter makes an impression.

Get lost in beautiful area of Barcelona. We walked for hours in this area. It was a feast for the eyes and stomach. The shops were delightful. We bought some very unique items here. You can step into a tiny beautiful shop that sells only masks, or scarves. So many fun shops. The buildings are so old and beautiful. Be sure to look up as you stroll through the area. We had the best gelato here. There are little places you can sit outside and dine. Musicians and entertainers are also walking through. Slow down and spend some time letting it all soak in while you are here. It seemed to be safe and clean.
Don't forget. In my first trip we don't go to this place and when in my 2nd trip I go there I regret that why don't go there with my family . Don't forget this amazing site
Just wander around. and feast your eyes on Gothic architecture so stunning it could be a movie set. Pretty crowded with tourists at all times.

could walk for days. lots of bars restaurants, architecture, artists, shops. beautiful location and you never know what you will stumble across down every lane or round every corner from boutiques to beautiful buildings and grand courtyards buzzing with activity!

Gothic Area. Stayed in this area at Hotel Colon.Lovely area and lots of tiny alley ways and a fab shopping experience. There are small streets leading to La Rambla, with shops on them such as Zara,H and M,and many more.Good eating places too.Felt quite safe too.
Stroll-worthy. All you need to do is take a stroll through this area. It is very expensive if you are looking for a bite to eat, but very nice to take in a bit of the city´s cultural feel.

Charming Cobbled stone streets in Barri Gotic. Our very first trip to Barcelona made it very interesting because of the old charm of Barri Gotic. Our hotel was located within this area, and this historical quarter in Barcelona made our stay memorable. There were charming cobbled stone streets that lead us to old churches, restaurants, museums, and unique shops in Barri Gotic. Free day walking tours abound. Street musicians and dancers entices tourists to relax and join the merry-making. On certains days, flea markets are put out in the plaza right across Barcelona Cathedral. I will always treasure my brief stay in beautiful Barcelona because of this place called Barri Gotic.
Barcelona at it's finest. I spent days just wandering through the Gothic Quarter - best place to see sites at every corner and the place to stay when visiting the city!
A lovely Sunday afternoon of exploring. The heart of a city, dancing between old and new. Some great unexpected spots... But smaller an you think

great place. this place is a mix of both ancient architectures and modern arts, where locate the picasso musee and the gaudi musee, some roman walls and blue ocean as well if keep walking. i can't find and places more attractive to me than the gothic quarter that i went there twice in my three-day visit in barcelona. i love it~
very special. compact, amazing, this is the place where it is so nice to loose your way, just to find out a next jerm.
Worth a wander. Amazing architecture, rambling alleyways, interestig shops. Must visit the Cathedral gardens, light a candle and see the geese!

quaint stores and beautiful structures. little remains of the true history such as artefacts and statues, however the quarter is quaint and has a good vibe all around. id return for the great array of ice cream stores and restuarants withing the cobbled alleys. the structures, churches and buildings leave traces of the eras gone by, with intricate details and stories of love and passion for art. this was also home to the jews which is interesting to see the difference that was made by a different religion/culture

Enchanting old world flavor. We loved wandering through the Gothic quarter while in search of cathedrals and the Christmas market. There are many restaurants along the side streets and quite honestly, you get the feeling no matter which one you stop at you'll have a good meal. I don't think we had a bad meal the entire stay in Barcelona.

Going back in time. Walking around the narrow streets is like traveling back in time. The streets are so charming. Placa de Sant Felip Neri is absolutely gorgeous. El Call is also a must. I had a great time walking around and getting lost in the maze.

Pablo's old stomping grounds. I would recommend taking a guided tour of the Gothic Quarter. Lots of history in the area. Knowing the secrets of the street makes strolling them a bit more meaningful. Several unique restaurants, including Vegan cafes. Music and shops galore. Don't keep any valuables in your pockets though!
Gothic Fairytale. Touristic yet original, full of surprices in every turn. Perfect architecture, interesting museums (picasso), nice shops by Catalan designers, nice bars and restaurants :)

My favorite quarter of Bcn. Amazing atmosphere despite the whole tourist mob. You can feel and see the history of the old town. Beautiful squares cosy cafes and fantastic shops! I just love it and miss it every day..

people-watch, eat, and wander here. This lively neighborhood hits the mark on many levels. There are good restaurants and bars, people living and socializing, and it's architectural eye-candy. We even saw a protest underway. If you're headed here for specific activities, take the time to get lost in the quarter.

DALI is there - for Dali lovers. of course the Gotic quarter is lovely and so romantic...but for Dali lovers - the very hard to find Dali collection is right there in front of the cathedral. For Dali freaks, DO IT. You will be glad. It's not as small you think - via the almost non-existent web page and even local city patrol guards who don't know where it is. If you like your Gaudi sprinkled with Dali, or even if your trip to Dali-land just north is sprinkled with a day en Barca - Do IT!!!

Wonderful place, night or day. We spent a long weekend strolling around the cobbled streets of Barri Gotic, both evening and daytime and in the evening, and thoroughly enjoyed all the lovely buildings, cool restaurants, fun bars and quirky stores. Especially enjoyed the Cathedral and the lovely Church of Santa Maria. A must see!

Look up. This is a wonderful quarter to visit in Barcelona. The narrow streets of high buildings are intriguing, from the shops below to the living quarters on the upper stories. The area is full of good restaurants (and some doubtful ones), artisan shops and museums. Watch for pick-pockets.

So interesting. We were based here for our long weekend and thought the place was enchanting and so interesting. Getting away from Las Ramblas is a must and the side streets in Barri Gotic drew us in time after time. Great authentic food, wonderful bars and the culture was immense.
This is such a great area to be located and visit. Fantastic.

Historic Barcelona Worth Exploring. Initially planned to visit Museu Picasso after visiting the Sagrada Familia in the Eixample district the previous day, we ended up accidentally in the Gothic area the oldest part of the city and discovered the 4th Century Roman Wall and the amazing Barcelona Cathedral which was constructed some 600 years ago. Given that it was Christmas Day we decided to spend some time inside the Cathedral which was a great spiritual experience. We then explored the area strolling along those little streets and alleyways until we reach Arc de Triomf , an access gate to a wide promenade connecting with the Park of the Ciutadella. Certainly recommend a visit to the Gothic Quarter if you are in Barcelona and even if you are lost, the whole area is worth exploring.
Loved the Gothic Quarter. We pre-printed a Frommers guided walk and followed it through this fantastic area. The guide ensured that we did not miss some of the less obvious buildings and Squares.

Wow.... So many people, bars, coffeshops, restaurants, shops.. and of course the big Cathedral.. I felt likeI was walking between the pages of "Cathedral of the sea" book... Amazing athmosphere during the day and night
explore. roman ruins, including standing columns from the temple, the aqueduct, gothic buildings, narrow streets. you never know what you will find around the corner.
The best of Barcelona. The very old part of Barcelona, loaded with Tapas places in historic streets and ruins. A lot to see in this place, worth a full day to walk it through.

Shopping Shopping and tapas!!. When in Barcelona don't miss walking down these wonderful little strees lined with fantastic boutiques and fun tapas bars. A MUST is "Xarcuteria La Pineda" - tapas at their BEST!!

A Lovely Place to Stroll. The Gothic Quarter is full if tiny streets, bars, little shops and plenty of history. It is really atmospheric. We decided to take a guided tour which took 90 minutes, which helped us understand a great deal more about the area.

Brilliant experience.. Really fun exploring the small streets. You could spend hours wandering around and never see the same thing twice. Also there are great bars here by night. My favourite part of Barcelona

Historical Area With Inspirational Buildings & Atmosphere. The Gothic Quarter has so much to see and do, well worth getting on a free guided tour by WTF Tours, lots of quirky shops, different churches and buildings, many places to eat and in George Orwell's square it is cheap and lively.

A funky home in the heart of Barcelona. The Barri Gotic was easily walkable, beautiful, studded with great places to eat, our home away from home. Winding, narrow streets; the smell of delicious food; great people watching and a cozy hotel about a block from Plaza Cataluña made Barcelona our favorite part of Spain.

When in Barcelona,.... No trip to this beautiful would be complete without ambling through the Ramblas and surrounding streets. Especially interesting place since not just tourists are hanging out here. Great sights, smells, architecture, people watching to be found.

Historic area. Liked the labyrinthine alleyways. Cathedral excellent.
Barcelona does tourism very well, everything signposted.
Lovely area to wander around.. Great selection of shops of all types. Nice to wander around and take in the athmosphere. Easy to find in the centre of Barcelona.

Romantic stroll. For a romantic stroll in what I see as the true Barcelona, then please check out the Gothic Quarter. It is like an open air museum with picture perfect streets (most of them car-free) with cute little stores and wonderful tapas bars and restaurants. Make sure to pay close attention to all the architecture of different eras.

Gothic Quarter. If you are in search of "La Vida Bohemia" you willenjoy going to this sector of town. I personally preferdoing so during the day-time, but as a non-drinker, italso makes sense. The streets are narrow, lots of small shops and restaurants.....not the place I"d like to walk around at night, unless you stick to the places where there is a lot going on. I would avoid romantic side-streets at night, to avoid any danger of getting mugged.

just wander around this vibrant place and soak up the atmosphere.. what a fabulous place...............so much to see. some beautiul buildings and churches. lots of back street tapa's bars a market and some lovely independant shops. we went during the day but would have loved to go at night time as the streets i would imagine would be buzzing. would love to go back!!

Lovely area. We stayed at the Hotel Ciutat de Barcelona its very central to all of the bars in the Barri Gotic. We were warned about some of the darker areas and told to avoid them at night but we felt no threat really. The whole place was very freindly and warming.
Charming. A walk throw narrow streets... take your time and don't hurry up.A must is going to Santa Maria del Mar, a gothic church. The best feeling I've ever had in a temple.

Probably the best location of Barcelona. Quaint, vibrant, hustle bustle, scenic and intense
Always take time to explore this area of winding backstreets and tapas bars or you will miss the real Barca
getting lost. Great area to wander the streets, check out the stores, restaurants, and find a museum or two. Impossible to stay lost as Las Ramblas is just a street or two over.
Old World charm. Worth wandering with no place to go. Get lost, stop into great little eateries, enjoy a glass of wine, and get lost again.
Full of character. Brilliant. You must walk through the Gothic Quarter when visiting Barcelona. Full of character and charm and wonderful shops and bars.

Great for wandering.. There are so many surprises in the Barri Gotic. Lots of old shops as well new. Be sure to catch the street musicians who play both on a small street on the side of the Cathedral and in front of the Cathedral. We really enjoyed the Spanish guitar.

Get lost. In the best sense! Just go wonder and loose yourself in the tiny winding streets you will come across roman walls ancient ruins, century old churches traditional bars and independent quality shops.
Beautiful architecture and great mood. Walking between the gothic streets and looking at the churches and other building in a sunny day in Barcelona is possibly one of the best thing ever

Like the middle ages. The Gothic Quarter is like a maze, located in the old city center. Be sure to get a detailed map. Some of the nicest little squares or buildings are hidden in small streets. Also checkout the time tables. Some of the buildings will be closed during the afternoon.Do not forget the Santa Maria del Mar. It´s located on the other side of the Via Laietana, but belongs also to the Gothic Quarter.If you visit the quarter in the evening it´s like you are walking in the middle ages, especially because of the Spanish music, played by street musicians.

The heartbeat of Barcelona.. Stayed in this area of Barcelona, the use of a little bit of common sense regarding money/valuables will disappoint the pick pockets.There is a great atmosphere about this part of the City.

Blast from the past. Brilliant trip back in time, got lost in the back streets but loved the boutique shops.The market is a must see - to quote Pulp Fiction " its the little things that are different"
Barcelona of yesteryear.. A labyrinth of narrow streets lined with old buildings, some of particular historic interest, as well as some ancient churches.
Fabulous area. easy to walk around and look at the lovely buildings. Lots of nice little cafes around as well! Visit the Cathedral in the mornings when entrance is free.

Not at night. Lots of very narrow streets littered with shops from tacky souvenir to decent restaurants. Not an area I would visit alone at night as the lighting is poor and there are muggings in the area. There is a very nice cathedral which is well worth visiting during the day and a good sized square in front of it.

Fun for wandering. With twisty side streets and varied and interesting architecture at every turn, it is impossible to take an orderly walk through this neighborhood - so let yourself wander and get a little lost. A photographer's dream.

Gorgeous, and love the cafés. Very beautiful area of the city, it is a must see part of the city of Barcelona. However, women must remember to be dressed appropriately to see the gothic cathedral, they are very strict on dress code

fantastic area. The arcitecture and atmosphere around this area was fascinating. We could have walked around this area all day and not got bored. theres lots of lovely little tapas bars dotted about and little shops as well as churches and great buidings.

Get a feel for the real Barcelona. The Gothic Quarter to my mind was the most beautiful and exciting part of the city. The walls enfold you and around every corner is history and incredible little shops with fascinating and interesting products and curios. The real history of Barcelona is in these walls and this area of the city and on a hot, sultry, day it is so cool and inviting. You can see the locals living their lives as they always have done in the tiny squares and narrow streets. The buildings tell you their own story and the atmosphere seems unchanged for hundreds of years. We spent several afternoons wandering around and had the best food and lunchtime tapas on our entire trip inside these walls.

Worth strolling around the streets of Barri Gotic. Barri Gotic was very picturesque, the Catedral presented amazing architecture which takes your breath away. We sat in the square outside the Catedral in the sun people watching. Woudl recommend spending some times here.

Worth spending a few days exploring shops and restaurants. Great alleyways and old buildings, but filled with interesting stores, some designers and art, and lots of restaurants. So it appeals both to modern and historic aspects. Make sure you look at the areas on both sides or the ramblas.
Wonderful. I can thoroughly recommend you lose yourself for a couple of hours walking along the narrow streets and wide squares. A lovely way to spend an afternoon in Barcelona
charming. You need to see this area very charming. these are some of the areas not to be missed. do take the hop on hop off all over the city its the best way to get an over view

out side of italy!. This is one of those very unique settings where one can walk the streets of an ancient roman settlement. really neat well done underground: can get a little warm but a must see. Other aspect of the Gothic Wuarter are also worth visiting but the roman settlement was pretty kool.
Breathtaking!. Explore this area as often as you like at all hours. Fantastic buildings, great bars,good snacks and fine resteraunts.Huge amount of photo ops and plenty to see.
A hidden gem in Barcelona. The Gothic quarter is an explorers delight - easy to get around on foot, beautiful architecture, and many small, excellent restaurants and shops.

Part of the city you must explore. The Bari Gotic, or old city, is one of the original parts of Barcelona. There are some large avenues, typical of the city, and then a maze of smaller side-streets, and alleys that make up the area. There are numerous great bars and restaurants throughout the area, so you should search by the area, and then the type of cuisine you are looking for.
a place of many squares. you can get proper lost in Gotic, very hard to go back to something you avoided previously half the fun tho

Love the charming winding streets. Walking the Barri Gotic is of course a must-do when in Barcelona. The streets will charm you with the intimacy and glimpse of a long time past. BUT, take a map, and stay on streets that have retail/restaurants. Some of the streets have no store fronts and are poorly lit, which can make for a harrowing experience late at night. Best would be to go during the day time.

Nice and interesting area near La Ramblas. Walk to small streets in nice weather... Can find interesting places in there. Drink coffee and eat croissant in that area...Walk to small streets in nice weather... Can find interesting places in this area.

Unique area. The Barri Gothic quarter is unique with its narrow walks and a host of wonderful places to eat. You could walk around all day viewing the architecture and passing the time with a coffee or something stronger in the squares!

Narrow streets and beautiful churches! . It was like walking into a movie set; except that this was very real history right in front of us. The extremely narrow streets and beautiful churches remind us of a time gone by...& how our world has evolved! A good route is to visit la ramblas first since most streets from there connect to the gothic area. Great place to hang out and soak in the atmosphere while the kids run around.

Loved the gothic quarter!. I loved this area, I bought lots of art and crafts from local artists. I stayed on the main roads, advised by locals to not be there late a night like 3am. Otherwise, very nice area of Barcelona
Barri Gotic. Architechturally fantastic. You feel that you have stepped back in time. Although a bit touristic. A great place to find vintage gifts.
Authentic. Loved the area and the complexity of the small streets. You can easily get lost - a good kind of lost!
Best place to find vintage clothes. Beautiful place, the Gothic area I would say is the best of Barcelona its what Europe is truly about. Travelers: try Pim Pam Burgers!! Delicious.
Nice streets. My hostel was in the barri gotic, so I often dinner and walked arround here. The streets are nice with a lot of shops and restaurants.
Interesting to visit. The Barri Gotic is an interesting place to visit and stroll around. Great history and shops, interesting little hidden places.

The heart. So, there's two Barcelonas: the shiny and awe-inducing one, with all the modern stuff, the ramblas and the Gaudì buildings, and the Old one. I love them both, but I have to say I prefer this one. Get lost in the small (and tourist packed, but I was a tourist too, so who am I to complain?) streets for a long time, walk around, eat something, have fun!

Do It - Will Not Disappoint. You will not be disappointed. So much history in this area and so much to see. The market has some really yummy tapas restaurants and the churches are beautiful. Lots of pedestrian streets to get lost and to find new treasures.

Best of Barcelona. We stayed at Hotel Colon opposite the Cathedral of Barcelona, a must see. There are many, many great sites to visit in easy walking distance. Walking the Gothic Quarter at night was also a blast and we never once felt threatened or concerned for our safety. La Ramblas is on the west side of the district and El Born is on the east, both highly recommended and all within easy walking distance.

Green Bean Walking tour. This free walking tour of the old city of barcelona was 2 1/2 hours of interesting knowledge and views. Katherine our guide was friendly and very informative. I learned so much of the history of Barcelona and Catalonia. We saw streets and squares we wouls certainly have missed. Because it is free and you give what you think appropriate at the end , the guide really wants you to enjoy the experience and <i certainly did and would recommend to anyone wanting to see and learn more about the old city of barcelona
Very interesting place. This is were Barcelona started. There are still parts of Romans walls. There are a lot of small streets like a maze. You feel safe walking around. Very interesting
stroll stroll stroll and lose yourself. A beautiful old quartier when you can stroll in a leisury pace to discover little shops and boutiques, tapas bars and restaurants. Get lost! :-)
Being taken over by commercial chains, but.... you can still find quiet corners and great Tapas bars. The Cathedral is still worth the visit alone. We liked the Born neighborhood better

Great place to get lost in time and space.. Perhaps one of the loveliest gothic quarters in Europe, the Barri Gotic has its own personality. (Think of Barcelona's separate cultural heritage within Spain as Venice's in Italy) one of the best places in the word to "get lost" and roam around during a lazy afternoon, while watching a great human spectacle as well as a huge diversity of specialty shops.
Many boutiques with good prices. Worth a visit. You can buy interesting things at good prices. You can stop in one of the several good little bars and restaurants to take a break.

Worth a visit. Architechturally fantastic. You feel that you have stepped back in time. Leave the busy road, packed with tourists and step through an alleyway into a peaceful haven of retreat. Visit the adjacent Church and feel tranquillity. step out into the heat of the day with a clear blue sky and you are back in the heart of the City.
Excellent Place. This area is combination of different streets just few mins walk from Ra rambla. Worth seeing it. These are old typical streets that make you feel the past culture and tradition.
