Fabulous and quaint. winding streets with lots of history, good to have a stroll through, lots of little shops, bars and restaurants

Great architectural examples. The older structures, particularly the churches are worth examining. Particularly pay attention to differences in the construction of the arches, ceilings, and columns. The rich colors and designs of the windows are fantastic when the sun is shining (and it often shines in Barcelona). Also, there are great small cafes and pastry shops here with excellent light breakfast and lunch choices.
Touristic but lovely. The oldest part of the city and quite touristic, but still a must-visit for everyone going to Barcelona.
a walking tour watching above. among the millions of shops and tapas...do not forget to look around and above you! a place to eat: Menage a trois: cheap but tasty and not for tourists
Atmospheric... A wonderful and atmospheric part of the city. Deserves many hours of walking and stopping the the many bars and restaurants there. Essential to any Barcelona visit.
Great place to walk around. A lovely place to walk through at night or day, do enjoy the bars and restaurants but do avoid some of the loiters peddling drugs, unless that is your thing.
excellent place in barcelona. One of nicest areas, close to transport, small shops, lanes easy access to las ramblas and not that far to walk to beach!

If you like wondering narrow streets then you'll love the Gothic Quarter. With many narrow streets with small shops, tapas bars and squares this is a great place to walk around and get lost in the maze of little streets. Pick a tapas bar to stop off and people watch and the hours will fly past without you noticing.
a place of peace. walking through the Barri Gotic is so nice; you will find many excellent musicians giving to the place a very peaceful and nice atmosphere
fabulous place to explore. sandy coloured stone architecture, small pedestrian streets, quaint cafes and shops. squares that appear unexpectedly. loved it.

Just go, get lost in the small alleys and enjoy it. Probably one of the nicest parts of town for strolling, getting lost in small alleys and streets, accidentally running into some great tapas-bars. This part of town is crowded with both locals and tourists. Try to visit it in the morning when locals wake up and do their errands, it's more fun without too many tourists around. There are so many small public squares that it's always a good idea to sit down, get a coffee and just watch people. There are many galleries, bars museums and if you can find stay there then stay in this part of town. It's the best.

Medieval streets. A labirynth of small straats with reataurants and shops. At night a delight to wander, admire and gaze. You can easily get lost but after a few streets you get back onto an avenue and find your way back.

The historical part of Barcelona. Before I visited Barcelona, little did I know the rich history of the city. Barcelona is famed for being one of the most liveable cities and up and coming cities of the world. The Gothic Quarter is where you will find its history and some ruins from the Roman era. There are eateries and shops (very touristy though) which one can enjoy as one wanders around and take in the old areas of Barcelona. The Barcelona Cathedral is among the historic buildings that can be found here.
Gothic. Walking round this part is amazing, fantastic architecture, well worth a visit. Also at christmas the market sits just outside the cathedral.
A must do!. Loved walking through the small streets and seeeing the plazas and buildings. We did it with a guide, otherwise it's a bit vague to know what you're looking at. It was a great experience!

Nice corners but the shop quality is average. There are plenty little shops. You can find some interesting ones. But I think you need to be a local to find the real nice ones. However I did not quite enjoyed walking in the little streets. It's winter, days get dark pretty soon.

Amazing, but careful with thieves!. The Gothic area of Barcelona is absolutely amazing! A rich history, incredible architecture, and delicious bars and restaurants, the Gothic area has it all! It is the most touristy area in the city though so do be careful with your belongings... the pickpockets in Barcelona are professionals and if you're not careful you might wake up minus a few items!
Fantastic. Great area for just meandering around and discovering quirky shops and great architecture. Some very good restaurants if you go off the beaten tourist track
Good during the day, better at night. Fantastic area to walk and get lost in time. Try to excuse the commercialization. Walking through during siesta time is a good option too.
Step back in time. What a neat place to just roam around. If you have the time it is definitely worth a visit. There are a few interesting shops but also a lot of the tourist traps.

Must see if you like history. The Barcelona Cathedral is awesome and I loved the ruins of the old Roman wall and the columns of the Temple of Augustus. There are a number of picturesque old buildings and the typical narrow streets of an old Spanish city. Despite being October, it was still very crowded around mid-day. It seemed to get less crowded in the late afternoon.
My favorite part of Barcelona. narrow passages that lead to large plazas. Funky shops, stunning architecture. One could spend the day getting lost in this gem!

Great old atmosphere. So much to see in the Gothic Quarter and if you like beer, there are plenty of places. If you're lucky you'll stumble upon some small neighborhood play happening in one of the corners on a small street. They had a Christmas play happening in the middle of a small street that didn't have a lot of tourist traffic....it was in Spanish but not a ton of people watching which gave us the impression that it was more for the locals.

Stunning old buildings. Best to allow one full day to discover this quarter of Barcelona, mostly on foot. Can start from Plaza del Angel with the Cathedral and enjoy lots of little streets with ancient buildings churches and stone carvings.

Disappointing. Whilst Barcelona's Gothic Quarter has some charming elements, I was disappointed on the whole and it seemed to be very run-down in places. Thinking that the "old town" would be the place to stay, we had deliberately booked a hotel in this area but felt quite uneasy wandering some of the streets after dark.There are certainly some good places to visit in the Gothic quarter, but it's worth taking advice from someone who knows the area well.

Going back in time. Well worth a stroll through these old streets which get cleaned up every night - much needed. Lots of cheap and slightly quirky places to eat and drink too. Gives one an idea of earlier times in history as the streets are narrow and buildings nice and old fashioned.
great sight seeing and restaurants. great for sightseeing and great choices of restaurants, we ate here and couldnt resist the many ice cream shops

Easy to navigate - Clean. We were there for the Christmas week, there were still plenty of shops and restaurants open. Dropped into church of St Jaume for vespers with beautiful voices singing chant. Easy to self-navigate with guide books. Enjoyed browsing streets and shops. Cleaner than I expected it would be!

The is the charming part of Barcelona. What's not to like about the Gothic Quarter? It is as quaint as can be with its narrow irregular streets. It hosts some of the best restaurants in this chic city. There are little speciality shops all about and something different around every corner. It is flanked by the amazing Ramblas. There are hotels aplenty. You can listen to some of the finest guitar music in the world at the cost of small change. Just watch out for your wallet!!

Come with a tour guide. While you can stroll around here and still have a good time, there's a lot of interesting history on every street and a tour guide would help you get the best of it. It's incredible how much history is crammed into this quarter, from ancient Rome through the Middle Ages up to the modern times. Good place to get lost in.

Lets go back N tyme.... I love the narrow streets. You seem to go back into another era... Thank you Barcelona for preserving these beautiful buildings. My friend and I found some quaint shops and food here. We found an awesome bakery and enjoyed exploring the narrow streets. Oh and everyone says to watch out for the Gypsies Tramps and Thieves. I was in Barcelona for 4 days and saw no crime but im not saying it doesnt exist. Just stay on your guard, walk with a friend but most of all...... Have fun!!!!!

An essential part of Barcelona. There are so many treasures tucked into a comparatively small area that of all the areas of the city this one is an absolute must. While of course it can be enjoyed by just wandering, we followed a suggested walking tour in our guide book which proved excellent and quite comrehensive.

Old Barcelona. We like the old part of Barcelona. Every time we are in Barcelona we spend a lot of time in this area - and we discover new sites almost every time. This time we spent a lot of time on small squares, small cerveserias and did a lot of walking. My favorite part is Eglesia de Sant Filip Neri, a tranquil place with a sad story.
Beautiful!. Seem to be anotehr world...Gothic Quartier its a must see .The cathedral of st Lucia its very nice to be visited.
Walk and get lost in these streets. Just walking along the narrow streets give you a feeling of being in another time. We spend many hours just exploring the Barri Gotic.

barcelona charm. A vibrant area that attracts alot of visitors but worth the visit if you love great architecture. There are restaurants dotted around the area. I would suggest order a drink and just take in the scene.
Wow!. Best views in Barcelona!Small allies with boutique shops and cafes leading to unexpected Plazas.Roads are well marked

Always something interesting. I frequently try to get lost in Barri Gotic, just to see what's new. The are changes so quickly, that you'll always find something new, as well as the old favourites. Good to spend an afternoon wandering aimlessly...
Everything!. I loved this place. Friendly people (watch out for pickpockets and bagsnatches, everyone warned me), street music, art, those wonderful cafes and bars. .
Loved it. The buildings were old but beautiful, the small streets were awesome, I could understand why it is called Gothic and loved the shops there!

If you miss this - you've missed Barcelona. The Gothic Quarter really does give you an idea as to the sense of history of Barcelona. It is a wonderful rabbit warren of streets that to an Aussie like me gives you a sense of awe as to history.
Loose yourself here!. This is a place to do some serendipity. Just walk without any planning, enjoy the shops and choose a place to eat alonfg the way.

Distinctive old town quarter. This is an area of Barcelona well worth a walk around and visit to the museum if you have time. Best to go early morning if possible during busy seasons. It helps to know a bit about the area before visiting.

well worth a walking tour. check in with the Barcelona tourist office in this district and join a walking tour, you will not be disappointed... more to see than can write about and highly recommend you take the walking tours
Lose yourself. You could get lost around here in all the back streets so take a map. You can walk around the roman wall of the old city and stop in many of the bars.

Wonderful Experience Walking the Streets. Walk the streets of the Barri Gotci area and truely soak up the history.
Wonderful shops and tapas bars are hidden on the side streets so wonder around at ease and you will be pleased by your discoveries. A must vist area.

A very cool part of town. Runs the gamut from ticky tacky souvenir shops to excellent coffee places and even the first synagogue (all 900 square feet of it) in Barcelona. Tiny streets you can get lost in, amazing architecture (very different from Gaudi's Sagrada Familia) that sends you back in time. A beautiful and unique part of town.

Definitely worth a wander. You have to walk around this area and have a look at the old buildings and churches and get a feel for Barcelona of old. Keep going down Las rambles and find the waterfront, it is a really neat place to stop after a day of walking.

Completely different to the normal streets. You feel like you are in a completely different place! Very beautiful and interesting! Easy to get lost but everyone is so friendly you'll find your way back!

The Ancient Gothic Life. This is the old Gothic town in Barcelona. It has wonderful old churches and even a palce. Both can be visited at anytime. The church has a fee during the day but is free after 6 pm. Their is a rich history with the Gothic old town and it is a visit that cannot be missed. Be sure to ask to see the old Roman Bridge, and the Roman Columns as well as the ancient synagogue
Medieval streets. Old tiny medieval streets and tiny shops. Some good food - especially for lunch. Place changes at night when the bars open

walking through history. I am always amazed by the history you can find in foreign countries. Being from a newer country like the US makes me very aware of the difference in history of the centuries, and seeing the medieval architecture -- and older! -- in Barcelona and in this Quarter was really special.

such an iconic part of Barcelona. This is my favorite part of Barcelona, winding alleys, fabulous architecture and a vehicle to ancient history. Don't even try driving, but stroll and soak up the ambiance. Also, so important to remember the pain of its recent history under Franco (as well as its old painful history during the medieval times), and to celebrate the changes that have occurred

Medieval and 21st century!. The Gothic Quarter succeeds in being both medieval and solidly 21st century! Why? The labyrinthine alleys and stone walls, churches and chapels are from the middle ages but the fine shops and eating places are globalised and multi-cultural. Wander around, get lost and then emerge into the Ramblas or the coastal road with the Roy Lichtenstein installation, quintessentially Barcelonian!
Did I miss something?. If there wasn't a Christmas market here I would have seen not much more than the cathedral. Don't get me wrong, a beautiful place but I expected more in the area.

Exploring the narraw alleys. You will always find some interesting shops, museums or other things.
We let ourselves just wander into the Gothic Quarter "uncharted" and just enjoy whatever we came across.
There is this very very narrow alley - which, we understand, is called the "Mosquito alley".
We enjoyed just exploring like this !
great place for travellers. You could drink a cup of cofee here without hurry. Its lot of small buildings and cafe! You will find lots of amazing shops with souvenirs and foods.

Absolutely beautiful!. Barri Gotic was my favourite area of Barcelona. The architecture, complex maze type alley-ways, quaint little shops/cafe's hidden around every corner. First i walked around for a couple of hours taking it in, getting lost (dont worry you cant get completely lost). The next day hired a bike to do the rest of Barcelona and re-visited Barri Gotic to find things i may have missed

Intrincated streets typical Europe. Lovely walk which can end up in the Picasso museum!I love the little streets. One can do La Rambla, La boqueria marked and the Gothic quarter at once. be careful at night.
Fun to get lost in the streets of this great neighborhood. Watch yourself, but generally this is a safe area to walk around and enjoy the great architecture and little shops.

Worth the visit. Not only is e quarter interesting but the cathedral is worth the detour. It is extraordinary.The cobble stone streets are charming and the quarter is charming in the middle of a big city like Barcelona.

During the day. May be a little shady at night. if you are a female I would reccomend avoiding visiting here at night. It is a wonderful area to visit during the day, The shops sell original things that you probably won't see anywhere else so be sure to buy it when you see it :)
Unique ambiente. Wonderful architectural detail on practically every building a great place to stroll, shop and sit with coffee and cake people watching.

Live these quaint old sections.... Yes, you will probably get lost in this maze of streets with great little shops and original shops. These kind of neighborhoods are exactly what I like and I was not disappointed by this quarter of the city. Bars get busy VERY late!

Great place to just hang out. Greta shopping, great food, great street entertainment, I loved every bit of Barcelona and it's because of places like this. I had red a lot about pickpockets here but we didn't see nor have any dramas what so ever

Prepare to get lost in time!. The twisty, windey streets will get you turned around once or twice, and will definitely lead to places you hadn't started out looking for, but it is worth the adventure. Do not miss the Picasso museum, and search out Pappabubble candy store to see incredible candies made before your eyes. Keep your hand on your purse/wallet, however, and stay on your toes - the area can get a bit dicey, pickpockets are known to prey on tourists here and the streets can be a touch rougher at night.

Excellent place to explore. A criss-cross of lanes with Gothic architecture on both sides. The best time to visit is in the afternoon with spillover into the night. During the afternoon / evening the setting sun lights up the area and the shadow-light created is amazing. During this time details are also visible. After dark, the lighting changes dramatically and the semi-dark alleyways generates the true gothic feel. In addition there are various shops and eateries.A wonderful place to walk around which is close to the Catalunya

A Fun WAlk. It is a lot of fun to walk through this area. We found many different delightful surprises during our walk. We never knew what we would find; an art show and sale, a puppet show, a group of people dancing, little boutique shops, a co-op for artists, etc. The streets are narrow and the buildings lean in to block out the heat of the sun. Be sure to look at the doors and door knockers, balconies, and watch for little decorations in unexpected places. In the sixteenth century, everything was reused, so you will see stones with Hebrew writing in some of the buildings (One is upside down!), and signs from those days. Look at the street signs, too. There's so much to see during a walk in the Barri Gotic.
Great walking area. We walked all over this place - stayed in a hotel in the Barri - and ate all of our meals there. Fantastic!

a district to explore. Gothic Quarter is filled with little corners to explore. Try to get an appointment for a free guided tour in the building of Generalitat to discover the history of the district and the original location of several sightseeing places.

Touristy in parts but get off the beaten track if you can. Parts of the Gothic Quarter are so full of tourists, but if you head down the alleyways, you will discover little tapas bars and eateries frequented by the locals and there are interesting little shops to explore too.

Just lose yourself in the little side streets. Great architecture, great cafes, tapas bars and shopping but still the highlight of the district are the narrow side streets and alleys. A magical feeling and when it's not crowded a true pleasure. was there on both types of days - crowded and slow, the slow was far superior an experience. Not to be missed with all the musicians waiting around corners creating an enchanted experience

Cafe's, shops and a certain vibe. We liked this part of town, it's lively and it smells right. Little boutiques shops and fantastic wine bars and little squares here there and everywhere. Great to get lost in.

Plenty of building to see and photograph. We visited the Gothic Quarter over a series of hours. There are plenty of buildings and photos to take. All very unique to Barcelona and Spain, some winding old streets, some modernised streets with remaining old buildings or restored old buildings. In addition we went here in December so there were plenty of Christmas Market stalls to look around below the Cathedral. You can see from this district that Spain is a very religious country both in the past and still at present.
Beautiful old buildings. Loved walking round the gothic area steeped in history. There was a Christmas Market during our visit and is was really pretty.
Loved It. Great place to wander around and lose yourself in gothic Barcelona. Lots of little passages that open to sunny squares, bistros and shops. Loved it.

lovely area to wander around. there are lots of churches to be discovered, lovely little wine bars, very good restaurant called milk. the area is sheltered from the winds with the narrow streets so fine to wander around in december.

Past and present. It's not a single building that calls your attention in the Gothic Quarter, but rather the general environment created by its narrow, laberynthical streets. And if the stone buildings commemorate the past, the vibrant life you will find: clubs, shops and restaurants a-many, speak of a very contemporary spanish culture. Dinner or drinks at the Plaza Real are not to be missed!

Interesting district. This was a wonderful place to just wander round and enjoy. We lost a good few hours here just strolling down the narrow streets, looking in the little shops and generally soaking up the atmosphere. There are plenty of interesting shops and tapas bars to explore. It's well worth a visit, was possibly the highlight of our trip to Barcelona.

One of the most iconic and historic neighborhoods in Barcelona. This is a must see on anybody's trip to Barcelona. Much of the architecture here has been undisturbed since the Middle Ages You could spend an entire day exploring this many streets and alleyways in this area of the city. During the daytime it's relatively safe. There are also many cafés and places to shop in this area.
Lose yourself. Lose yourself in the narrow alleys, eat tapas and drink wine whilst searching for bargains... This is th old Barcelona, once a walled city... look up and down...
So cool. This area is a must! Great shopping, great food, so much fun! Wish we had a place like this where I lived
A journey back in time!. One can walk for hours along the narrow cobbled streets, from one little Placa to the next. Little shops, bars and restaurants all over the place!
Weekend trip. Loved walking through the streets, was good would recommend, loved the market and the shops off the main ramble , far more interesting and different.

Getting confused is part of the fun. The narrow, twisting passageways of the Gothic Quarter means your internal compass can get quite confused, but there are helpful signs here and there to get you back on track. Just pop into any of the little bars you'll find, or tiny eateries or shops. So much more interesting than the main thoroughfares. I guess you need to be a bit careful at night, but having said that we (as a couple) never felt threatened.
Don't miss it!. I returned to the Gothic Quarter several times during my week in Barcelona. It oozes charm with a maze of narrow streets, quaint shops, local markets and restaurants.......loved it!!

Walking Tour. Two hour walking tour (only 4 of us), excellent guide and great overview. Reasonably priced. We had the ability to ask our guide many questions and she was able to refer us to "other things to do" which was invaluable information.
Gorgeous architecture. Stayed at the Grand Central Hotel...great location in a beautiful city. You must stay in this neighbourhood

Beatiful and historic area. Lovely to wander up and down the ancient streets during the daylight hours. Just keep your wits about you when nearing or approached by a group...pickpockets are out and about.

The life, the history, the restaurants...... Remember we are in a quarter with multiple restaurants,plazas,historic sites, bars, a very busy place, just go and blend with the people around( only care is with thieves like any other big city anywhere).it is a lot of fun you can walk it completely

Walking back in time and more. We found this Quarter very interesting. Bars, restaurants, souvenirs shoppings and more.Small streets plenty of stores, big ones, small ones, old buildings, everything is interesting and funny. Take your time and walk....and enjoy it!
Fascinating. Wonderful part of Barcelona which is an absolute must see. Delightful little shops and squares everywhere

So picturesque. The Gothic Quarter is so picturesque and cozy. I am not sure how much of area it covers, but it consists of many little streets buzzing with history, life. Some excellent tapas bars are in the Gothic Quarter. Strolling down the streets, you never know what or who you are going to meet. There are stores, shops, restaurants, museums, it just feels so great to be there.

Historical Catalunya. A must visit for those who love architecture, history & culture. Best visited as part of a walking tour where the guide will provide you with more details about this place which is rich in history.

lose yourself in the old city. The tiny streets are just like many other European cities but the expansive city on one side and ocean-front on the other make it more interesting, as you could find it hard to get lost for very long in the gothic quarter. Visit the tourism shop to book walking tours. the gothic tour was a highlight and the guide had a great sense of humour and was an expert on the history and story of each place we walked through.

Gothic Architecture !!. Barcelona has a strong presence of Gothic architecture and every nook and corner of the city amplifies this fact. This area is full of activities and there are sometimes roadshows and stalls. An evening in this area with your love , sharing a glass of wine along with some tapas would definitely be memorable. Though August is a hot season , but definitely I didnt get disappointed with the weather , rather enjoyed the dry heat. The Gothic Church is a must see and there is no entry fee.

Great for a wander. The Gothic area is a pretty awesome place and feels typically Spanish. It's great for just wandering about so don't do this if youre in a hurry. Take time to look up and down whilst youre there and youre likely to spot beautiful little statues, shrines and mosaics hidden amongst the copious balconies and buildings. With many charming shops, it's a great place to find unusual jewellery and there are many bead shops if you fancy making your own!
Nice for a day walk. Feels like walking in the middle ages, except for the shops (which are really modern). The way they have preserved this area is fabulous. A must when visiting Barcelona.

Great Insights. Did a walking tour of the Gothic Quarter with Urban Adventures, and the guide showed us so many small things that you would never see if you walked by yourself, plus so many stories about the history. We even stopped for Tapas in a nice little square.Really got the "feel" for Barcelona from the tour.

Don't Miss. A wonderful whimsical place - walking all through this area takes your breath away! A must see! We enjoyed the cleanliness and pride shown in the maintenance of the buildings and area. It is a charming district.
Barri Gotic. We just loved everything about the Barri Gotic area.shopping was of a high standard. and there were plenty of cafes and eating places.

My favorite!. This area is packed with a lot of history, a lot of shopping and restaurants. We decided to just walk it all from beginning to end and look at all the churches. Our feet were killing us at the end, but we got lost in all the history and its beautiful neighborhoods. We especially loved the vintage stores tucked away. And the cathedrals were just beautiful.

you'll go back day after day. it is so amazingly fun to walk around this section of the city, the architecture alone is inspiring: the narrow streets, the cobble stones, you can smell the history seeping from every building. and it's very close to shops and eateries and an open square with vendors and places to simply hang out.

Best district in Barcelona. I absolutely loved wandering thorough Barri Gotic and looking at the old architecture. I could have easily spent a whole day just in this one area! You can wander around, pop into cafes or wine bars, or go into any restaurant and feel like you found a jewel!
Excellent time. Spent so many hours exploring this area. Great food, excellent photo locations and plenty of shops. If you have only 1 day give this area at least 2 hours.

informative walking tour. a young and knowledgable tour guide with excellent English took us on a 2 hour walking tour through the Gothic quarter. A wonderful experience and not at all strenuous or stressful. we passed the major sites and this gave us a good bearing of this area, allowing us to come backlater and browse the . during the tour, we passed a lonely guitar player playing the most wonderful flamenco guitar music ( sells CD at 10 EU and wonderful memory of this time- his name is Ayman Bitar). If we had not gone on this tour, there are a numer of gems I would have missed out on just walking through, so well recommended. Great photo ops!

A nice walk to make... After sagrada & casa batllo, this area is nice to see and wander in the streets!.. Do not forget of course to stop and shop in all those stores as you can find something that will fit you. As you wander about, be free to go also to el born to eat some tapas!..
Great find!. Love the area - the cafes, botique shops, just walking along the meandering little streets finding pastry shops, restaurants, and El Born - and El Xyampanyet - the best tapas in town!
Gothic City. A must visit when in Barcelona. You walk thru numerous alleyways and soak in the history of the place. You will find buskers, cafes, tapas outlets, fashion, bars etc.

Wind your ways through the Alleys. Get off of La Rambla and head into the Barri Gotic for quaint boutiques, tapas places and bakeries. You can skip the junk stores that look like they import their wares from China. We found a great lunch spot Merce Vins which we recommend.

A walk through the old ages. I love old classical buildings and this area is really swamped with them. Anywhere you see, you will find old buildings still standing proud. You also can find a big church in this area. But beware, pickpockets are really heavy in here. We even have a chance to look them in action in front of a church.Just hold tight to your belonging and enjoy the scenery.At night, you can find a market there that contains a lot of small kioks, selling everything from souvenir to handbag.Must visit when you come to Barcelona, cause it is one of the thing that make the visit to Barcelona special.

Barri Gotic. Such an interesting place, with an intense history. We went to the city without much knowledge of it so the walking tour we went on was definitely necessary. The information we found out and all the things we saw were saddening at times but there was a real sense of the spirit of the place and the people there which was wonderful.

So much to see!. Alot of the hostels have walking tours for backpackers for free.definitely take advantage of that. We went to visit Barcelona on a budget and we saw a lot! The buildings and alleys and cobblestone walkways are the coolest things around.

Go back,go way back. A treat to see a mideival city in current use, wonderful architecture and narrow alleyways that are called carrers(street).
Bars restaurants, cafes and hotels in ahistorical setting.

Temptations, Tapas, and Getting Lost. The gothic quarter is unmissable. It's magic in the evenings - full of life. Lots of small restaurants. Lots of great food nibble by nibble and tapas galore. Easy to get lost, find yourself, and get lost again. Lots of street theatre, music, and improv. I would return in a minute if I weren't on the other side of the world.

Atmospheric!. When you walk through the Gothic Quarter, its like stepping back in time. As you walk through, look up at the old buildings. You unexpectedly come across beautiful squares. Just a word of advice. Take care and be aware of what and who is around you. My daughter was almost pick pocketted!
Took the free walking tour. Amazing history and architecture here. Don't miss. Wear comfortable shoes. Just wish the weather would have been better that day!

Fun and interesting. There's lots to see and do around the Gothic Quarter of Barcelona. The historical aspects are not as well-preserved as some of the very old villages we've visited in smaller cities (much has been modernised) but for a section of a major metropolis is has quite a lot of charm. Many of Barcelona's best restaurants are here. Easy to get to on foot or by Metro.

Pedestrian perfection & Historic highlights!. I stayed at Hotel Denit (see review) during my trip to Barcelona which is located on the edge of the Barri Gotic. It was a great choice. It is an action packed area with great architectural history, wonderful restaurants, plethora of shopping opportunities, and pedestrian only thoroughfares. Great neighborhood to stay in and walk around. There are walking tours of the Barri but I decided to go solo by foot and by bike. A must see part of Barcelona for locals and visitors alike!
Went saw. Prefer the antiq market and el bornArea better more rafts people there Cleaner etc. can't say any more

Enjoying walk. The Gothic Quarter is a must see in Barcelona. It's a nice place to walk around with plenty of things to see. Do not miss the Cathedral and surrounding area. Walk along the narrow streets and visit old churches.

Worth a visit. The Gothic area of Barcelona is amazing. Don't forget to visit Picasso's collection - world class. The narrow streets with gothic balconies & cute buildings are a treat. You will also discover some wonderful little restaurants & bars. It is definitely the place to visit for wonderful tapas washed down with a great glass of wine
you feel the history. just wonderful. it is the centre of the old city of Barcelona. It stretches from La Rambla to Via Laietana, and from the Mediterranean seafront to Ronda de Sant Pere.t

you feel the history. just wonderful. it is the centre of the old city of Barcelona. It stretches from La Rambla to Via Laietana, and from the Mediterranean seafront to Ronda de Sant Pere.
t
Great walking area. Enjoyable area to walk around and soak up atmosphere. Recommended by several locals for the spot they go for tapas. Take a GPS or phone or you'll get lost!

A fun place to wander around.. It's easy to lose all sense of direction in the Barri Gotic and it's an experience that I recommend. Narrow, winding streets with exotic and interesting shops to see and smell. You never know what you're going to see next.

Medieval Barcelona. Don't skip wondering around medieval Barcelona and see the city's Roman beginnings. This quarter is very crowded. Architecture is typical European and very romantic. You will be amazed by the squares and the former Jewish quarter is here too. Plenty of opportunities for food and drink on the way. Enjoy!
Very Gotic. Well worth a visit to this area, there are several museums and the catherdral. Lots of cafes and shops to take a rest.

Relics of a darker time. Everything Goth should be. Dark and with a lot violent death reminders. If you want to have an extreme church comparison go the the Gothic church then go to Sagrada Famillia. The contrast wil enlighten and inspire you.
Great. Amazing place just to walk, theres cool stores, streets and place to eat, have a drink and just relax.
Nice, very nice. Go for seeing the Gotic Church: is makes a strange effect considering that you are in Barcelona! The square in front of the Church is always full of people.
Perfect!. The old streets are so much fun to walk in and discover all kinds of fun stuff and stores. We had a really great time there. A lots of tapas bar and icecream places. We loved it!
tapas bars and old streets. liked the tapas bars, didnt like being rushed with a bill before we finished our drink, in the bars in the square. liked the cathedral.

Beautiful architecture. We went on a walking tour of this area which was helpful as we found lots of little nooks and crannies that opened up into beautiful squares with shops and bars, lovely old buildings and great history.
Great streets. This was a great day just relaxing & strolling around the streets. There's also a great little accessories shop called Six so do visit.

Wonderful Meander. Notwithstanding the tourist infestation this is a wonderful area in which to spend an afternoon wandering about. If you're feeling the contagion of the throng take a restful break in the Frederic Marès Museum - an island of religious iconography in the sea of commerce outside. There are plenty of small contemporary galleries also and some very nice craft work to be had. Try to find a restaurant away from the bustle of the cathedral area. You will happen upon one in a little square at some stage.
Back in time. Brilliant atmosphere - incredible stone streets lined with small boutique shops. A brilliant walk (during the day though, it's a bit scary at night!) from Barcelona down to the seaside.

Great fun for tourists!. Put on your walking sneakers, hide your wallet, and go for a pleasant stroll. It wasn't crowded in November. We went to a Flamenco place on Palace Reial and then to a surprisingly great restaurant across the square.
Interesting street views and shops-. Found the nicest little tapas bar and friendly waitress- best hand mixed sangria too! Truly feels like a medieval neighborhood.
lots to see. this is a great place to find a cafe to eat and small shops to just window shop. take a map althought the streets are a still hard to find!!
Charming section of the city. All sorts of lanes and alleys with fabulous shops. A pleasant way to spend a morning. There are wonderful cafes, restaurants, and sacred spots to see.
Wonderful Old Buildings. Lovely atmospheric area to wander round or sit and enjoy a coffee. Lots of little shops to mooch round. Mostly pedestrianised, but cobbles hard on the feet.
Fantastic. Very nice trip in the gothic quartier. You can see nuce streets, bwautiful buildings and you can feel a magic amosphere.

Wonderful place!. Love love love this place, everything you love about little towns & villages in a massive city! The restaurants are fab, the little shops are amazing, just overall a great place to visit!

History comes to life. Roman City and Cathedral take you back to years past. Take a walking tour of this area if you can. Stop to eat at a restaurant on a side street that locals frequent to get the full flavor of the Gothic Quarter.

Interesting walking in the daytime.. Can be slightly dangerous at night.
Stick to the streets with people on them, stay with people.
When in doubt stay in the middle of the street, best seen during the day.
great place!. beutifull arround MUSEO PICASSO , but dont forget to visit the RAVAL quarter on the other side of LA RAMBLA
Old and New side by side. We loved the Gotic area. The shops are so inviting and great for gifts but some are very upmarket. The old buildings are beautiful and the Cathedral is a place to visit

Great way to see Barcelona. Make sure you pay attention or else it is easy to get lost in the maze of the Barri Gotic. But, then again, isn't that what traveling is all about! Our most difficult thing was to decide where to eat/drink/be merry. We were surprised by the stores- some very high end; others selling junk. I went into one store to buy scarves for friends only to find out they came from India!
Get lost in the quarter. This is such a nice place to get away from the busy streets & take a tour of the Picasso Museum & visit the Santa Maria del Mar

Must stroll the Barrio Gotico, treasures arund every corner!. There is NO fee despite another review I just read, these are open streets, a maze of little corners and streets, full of people, From the ancient times, Roman ruins undergound, Arab baths remains hidden in basements of some of the shops. Even a museum you can pay to visit the Roamn foundations undergrund that they are continually excavation. Old Jewish Synagogue remains found in these streets as well, Fabulous area.
Amazing place to walk around. The atmosphere is great. shops for shopping or just Sit in a cafe to relax !!!!Alleys has many attractions to go into such museums, churches.

Wander at will.. The Cathedral in the Quarter is fantastic. Wandering the streets during the day and early evening is a fun thing to do. Wouldn't want to be there too late, though, as it seems you could easily become disoriented and not be able to emerge exactly where you might want to be.
A great stoll!. Loved the walking, cafes, facades, tour bus ride through as well. Charming and fascinating. Tourisme bus is best deal all round.
Fabulous Part of the City. We could wander around this part of Barcelona for hours. The fabulous squares, crowded narrow streets, the churches and of course the architecture - to die for.
Shopping. Great shopping for something a bit different. Fantastic buildings and of course the food here is as good as everywhere else
Must see. Great picture opportunity and surrounded by so many other great sites. Entrance is 6euro but if you walk around the entire cathedral you can perk inside at certain points

Amazing!. The Gothic Quartier is the best place to visit in Barcelona. It offers good restaurants, charming little shops and great bars! For thosr who appeciate historic places, it is just wonderful to walk around its narrow streets observing the stylish buildings. You shouldn't miss it!
The best. The best for bars and food we think in barcelona we loved it . There is plenty to see and do . It's good just to walk round taking it all in .

Great place to visit. Unusual surrounding & buildings. we were in awe of some of these. lots of restaurants to eat at. We ate at one restaurant and they had live bands going around to individual tables to play music. great atmosphere. Nice place to wonder around.

Stroll through the streets of Barri Gotic. Beautiful area of Barcelona - not overly touristy, but plenty of restaurants, cares, and shops. Don't miss the Cathedral (hard not to!) - it's become one of my favorites in Europe.
Lovely streets. It was lovely getting lost around the streets of Barri Gotic, it has hundreds of little shops, restaurants and the occasional church to see.

Best part of Barcelona !! and its free.... I was lucky that my wife and girls wanted to shop the moment we arrived so I went for an evening stroll with my camera through the gotic quarter.. as the sun set it left all the old buildings with an orange glow that was a joy to capture but even the photographs cannot take in the sounds of music and smell of cooking.... oh what a joy to walk and soak it all in..... shopping I ask you !!!
Bari Goti district. Historic interesting and friendly and accesible from the Ramblas. Best seen on foot. Cathederal and Piccaso museum here and then you can walk to the marina.

Our favorite part of Barcelona. Be sure to save time here to explore this old part of the city, and it's cathedral. The old narrow winding pathways are a joy to explore. We did the Rick Steve's walk here and enjoyed it very much. And after dark, the setting is very romantic.....perfect for a leisurely stroll.
Walk around. Great place to walk around. Lots of places to eat, drink, relax, shop. It can get busy. We had a great time crushing around taking it all in.
Keep your eyes open. You can have a car or people on most of these roads at any one time, not both so walk carefully. Really interesting look at how differently cities were laid out before cars.
My Favourite part of Barcelona!. I loved wndering the winding streets of Barri Gotic. So many neat building and shops to discover. Very beautiful and picturesque.
Great to walk around here.. Quaint shops and cafes. Totally safe and a great place to walk around! We were forewarned of pickpockets and were on the lookout but didn't have any issues.
Beautiful area well kept with interesting restaurants and bars. You can easily lose hour after hour just wandering round the streets exploring or stopping off for a drink or a bite to eat
Get lost here!. An amazing area of Barcelona to explore and discover. Great little shops and place to eat are everywhere and you will undoubtedly stumble upon some amazing sights.
Interesting neighborhood. Nice location with old houses, close to Old Church. Walking distance to Place Catalonya and nice, genuine dinner places in the Gothic Quarter.

romantic. Romantic and extremely well keept.
The old city is a visit must. Just to walk about.
You see new things all the time, and find interesting things, bars, cafes and so on in the smallest streets

Great architecture, love the market. Great way to spend time just walking around this area and admiring the buildings. The market is fantastic and you can spend an age walking around without buying a thing!
Some great small bars and shops.
Gothis Quarter. Very interesting to tour on foot noting the old architecture. Many small pubs and cafes. A wide variety off small shops.

Get lost in the history. Being able to wonder around the whole Gothis Quarter pretty much day or night and feeling safe while being able to experience a whole other way of life was wonderful. Add to that the shops, restaurants and it's worth the time again and again.

My favorite area of Barcelona!. I couldn't get enough of this area of Barcelona, you truly feel as you are walking around this old city that you are back in the Midieval times! I love the cathedral and the old roads and buildings. There was a beautiful opera singer there when we went who seemed to be there often and she used the echoes of the old stone passageways to enhance her voice, magic :)

Character and Charm. Easily accessible on foot from the centre of Barcelona this historic area provides plenty to see and do. Gaudi's Cathedral, Picasso's Museum and the marina and waterfront area are all easily accessable. The narrow streets of Barri Gotic are fun to explore and despite the tourist pressure there remain many shops including small markets, butchers, etc still catering to the local population. This adds a local feel and flavour to the area that many places taken over by generic tourism no longer have.
A labyrinth. Winding streets with a myriad of stores - very quaint and many Kodak moment. Bring your Visa! Ate at a little restaurant called Venus - great home cooking.

Take your time there. Well, it is a place to people ( like me ) who really like the medieval streets with its closed quarters, smals streets, hidden gems... Take your time there and just wander around...
Wander and soak it in. What a wondrous place to walk around. The cathedral and the museums near by are excellent. Make sure to grab a coffee and people watch.
a myriad of tiny streets. a tourist ideal,loads of tiny streets crammed with artisan shops tapas bars and interesting places to photograph.Great place to find peace away from the hub of the Ramblas

What a history that is!. Walking through the Barri Gotic was absolutely fantastic. The Cathedral is really something one could rarely see elsewhere. Narrow streets full of restaurants and shops. This time, we took more time to browse around , from north to south, from east to west. Don't miss the opportunity while in Barcelona.
Must see. Get lost among the narrow, meandering street of the Gothic quarter. Eat at gelato stands. Find a tapas restaurant.

Get lost and love it. The old city is a warren of tiny streets filled with shops and restaurants. You can spend a few days wandering. Come upon squares with live performance art, ice cream shops with rose shaped gelato, tapas bars, and an array of fun stores. Be aware that Barcelona is well priced for Europe but not cheap by US standards.

Best area to stay in Barcelona. The Gothic Quarter is central to everything and there is a subway that you take to other areas of Barcelona. We had a great time there, but be aware of the pick pockets, we saw them in action at a plaza near us and they even were selling their stolen goods, that was until the police arrived and they all dissapeared.
Great part of Barcelona. I enjoyed seeing the ancient part of Barcelona and the small streets. Even though it was rainy, there were places to duck into.
Old City area. An interesting area worth seeing if you have some extra time to spend in the Barcelona and near La Rambla.
Pretty touristy. So you should walk through to see the cathedrals and on Saturdays there are art shows that are lovely to walk through, but the shops are very touristy and no really worth it.
fun to wander. My husband and I loved just walking and looking at the various architecture of this beautiful area. At night, things were really hopping!
Took a free walking tour. Old city is full of history. I recommend a free walking tour with runner bean. Their tour starts from Placa real.

Interesting and Intriguing. The Gothic Quarter was among our favorite things in Barcelona, particularly the archeological museum - this is absolutely not to be missed. The Cathedral was stunning and the Call was very interesting. The one thing I would say is be prepared to get lost in the small, winding streets - it's part of the fun. The shops are a nice diversion from the museums. And, some of the restaurants in the area are really good as well.
Feels like you're in a movie. The area has amazing medieval character. Walking through the small streets feels like you're on a movie set. Worth a visit.

Make sure this is included in any day tour your on. The Gothic Quarter should be included in any city tour of Barcelona.There is so much to see here from the Cathedral and sculptures in the street.Keep an eye on your valuables, we didnt have an issue but met people who had had things stolen. In my experience is if your remain aware of your surroundings and dont drink too much alcohol you are left alone by potential theivesThis area is easy to walk around and we spent some tiem here as it was close to our hotel. We also took a city bike tour that included Barri Gotic also and learned more about the culture.1 -2 hours in this area should have you covered, and upto 4 hours for a more in depth expeerince

Interesting Barri Gotic. Barri Gotic is a really cool neighborhood to simply just walk and enjoy. There are shops and eateries and historic sights. I thought the Barcelona Cathedral was just beautiful.

Loved it!. If you like to walk through history; wrap you map, put it in your bag and walk through the streets listening to your senses. Almost every street leads to a different historical scene. The quarter is photogenic and inspiring. If you are lucky to be near the Cathedral of Barcelona in a Saturday afternoon, you can wath the Sardina dance of Catalans :))But beware of tiny streets by night. Does not seem secure.
Just wander. Put the map away and just wander these streets, great Roman walls and sights. Good selection of shops and places to eat

Watch your pocketbook. As others have described, La Ramblas is a thoroughly ¨Barcelona¨ experience. Best at night, there is food, shopping and entertainment. Tourist police are in evidence. We had no problems, but good advice is wear a money belt, care for your treasures, and enjoy the atmosphere.

Must see.. This is one of those areas of old Europe that every corner and turn has a photo shot that could be a post card. We walked this area several times, great tapas restaurants & shopping & scenery.
Difficult not to get lost!. Such a Spanish feel and a nice way to spend an afternoon, watching the world go by from a bar or two

A maze of interesting streets, shops, bars and restaurants.. The Gothic area of Barcelona is a maze of old streets with interesting history and architecture. You need at least a whole day to explore the area so we did not see all that it has to offer. I can imagine that some parts of this area are very 'seedy' especially at night. Some cleaning of certain buildings would certainly enhance the areas appearance which overall is charming. However, the City Authorities really need to clean up the graffiti which is a real eyesore and spoils the façades of many buildings. Well worth a visit though. The restaurants and bars on the Carrer Ferran are numerous and inviting.

Gothic Quarter. So much to see. Small alley like streets, mysterious. Streets full of hidden treasures. Beautiful church with large courtyard also located in the Gothic Quarter. Small outdoor markets with all kinds of appetizing treats.

Fun way to get lost in Barcelona. Not only do they have so many nice, boutique shops, but there are also many places to eat at. We went here in the morning when it was pretty crowded with tourists, but found that its really at best around early evening, when there is less of a crowd. It does represent the best of what Europe is... walking around through the main streets and alleyways, stopping at every store to browse (or shop) and soaking in the fact that you are in Spain!

Barri Gothic. This very old part of the town is fascinating as you explore its quirky narrow streets. We were warned about pick-pockets but we were never troubled. It's beautifully haunting to hear classical guitarists playing in the streets at twilight. WOW!
Loved this area. We found so much in this area! A fantastic cafe Origens. Went to a tiny theatre La Seca in another winding alleyway and just so many interesting shops and buildings! Love it!

Good spot to explore narrow side streets. We spent a lot of time walking in Barcelona and this is one area that is really fun to see what might be around the next corner. Cathedral is a must. Give up on trying to use a map and just wander. You will eventually come out on a main street and get your bearings.

dont get lost. the gothic quarter where we stayed at our hote reminded us of the backstreets of venice,the building are high and the tiny roads are very narrow,you can easily lose yourselves but most roads lead to a main road in the end,there are lots and lots of little shops,bars,cafes,and some classy restaurants in the narrow streets,the pavements are very narrow and if you walk in the road watch out for the cyclists.

Take your time and see a lot. The Gothic Quarter is a nice part of Barcelona. Take your time, look around, take pictures. Also choose for the narrow little streets and you'll be surprised. Black and white photo's will give a very special atmosphere. Sit on a terrace and order a cava or sangria and just look!
a relaxing walk. Enjoyed the sights and sounds of this unique Quarter. The small streets and cosy shops crown the experience.
Cool. Amazing hip and cool area, although seems to be favoured by American tourists mostly. Great nightlife vibe, but just steer totally clear of Hostal Romay- bloody terrible place!

Old world. Some great old buildings, winding narrow streets, lots of little shops, bars and cafes. Not sure what it is like at night but I feel you may need to take care as some of the streets are very secluded.
Immerse yourself.... Narrow, winding streets take you back in time. Truly worth getting lost and exploring. The Plaça Reina is lively at night and full of good food.
Underrated. This quarter is the heartbeat of the city, but doesn't have the noise of La Rambla. Our hotel was here next to the Cathedral and we always felt safe and comfortable. Good restaurants too!
Got lost :-). Just soaked it all in... Lots to see, lots to miss. Worth going back a couple of times to see it all.

Great to wander around. Immerse yourself in history and wander around this area taking in all the architecture, wonderful squares, restaurants and churches. Picasso Museum is worth a visit and Barcelona Cathedral is amazing. Enjoyed relaxing in the Place Reial with some sangria and watching the street performers. Just wander around and take it all in.
a beautiful area. Just wander around and get lost in the charming narrow streets and stop for a sangria and tapas when you can

Interesting place to get lost in. Plenty of interesting little streets to amble thru and every now and then you turn up a nice plaza. The Cathedral at 6€ entry is well worth the visit , despite what others may say and the view from the top is also good. No climbing either, there's a lift!

Great bars and restaurants. Great place to hang out and eat and drink. Personally would recommend Taller de tapas just down from Jaume 1 metro in Argenteria. And bar la luna very close by. great mojitos

Priceless. The old city is a wonderful site to see with its medieval churches, buildings and cobbledstoned streets and in the heart of it all.. the Picasso museum and the remains of a Roman Wall. Yes, it IS Barcelona!
Nice Place. I like this place, it was very amsusing. The places to eat were very nice and different. I like the people there.

What they said. Yes, great shops, food and architecture. We were following the Rick Steves "Ramble" and when we came to the back of the church we heard this music. We had stumbled upon a violinist playing and he stopped us dead in our tracks. His playing was beautiful, and the accustics sublime! If you see him, buy his CD for 10 euro...you will not be disappointed.

Very cool. We ended our day here, after a lot of sightseeing it was nice to just walk around a bit. Very visually appealing, lots of little shops and restaurants. I enjoyed even though it was raining the whole time!
Nice to wander through.. Not the most sensational Old City in Europe, mostly stores, stores and more stores. You can find concerts in churches, which have great acoustics. Picasso Museum, of course.

Very historic and cool to see!. This was my favorite area of Barcelona. We found this on our last day, so we didnt have time to go back. I wish we did because there was so much more to see. Im not an architecture fan, but this area was amazing!
great architecture. so much to see and do here, wander around the streets, you'll be amazed what curiosities you will find. Be prepared for a crick in your neck as you're looking up so often!
Great place to get lost. A surprise around every corner, look for old Roman ruins, gothic churches, shady courtyards and shuttered businesses that open on no predictable schedule.

Pleasant Surprises Around Every Corner. Walking the streets of Barri Gotic is very adventurous. My wife and I stayed in the Hotel Ciutat de Barcelona on 33 Prencessa. There are many, many restaurants and tapas bars to quell your hunger. It was very safe for the two and a half days we stayed in this area but we didn't venture down unlit alleys. We'd stay here again.
Nice place. The Gothic Quater is one the most pleasenat places in one of the most beautiful cities in the world. Completely enjoyed our visit. Use the on/off buses.

Good to Wander. You cant go to Barca without spending time in the Gothic quarter - full of quaint little streets and alleys and atmospheric architecture. Interesting during the day but absolutely vibrant at night, when all the tapas bars and restaurants fill to overflowing with locals enjoying their great city

The most beautiful church I have ever seen!. The church of course! And walking around the Gothic section was pretty interesting. You can take the bus or the taxis are pretty cheap in Barcelona. I have been to Rome and none of the churches on the outside come close this church. It's amazing.

Medieval Charm. Just of the Ramblas, the narrow winding streets of the Gothic Quarter lead you past small shops and into hidden squares with cafes and bars as well as small churches and of course the Cathedral.

You can spend hours exploring the old town!. We laced walking down all the different alleyways expiring the old town, once you are away from La Ramblas it feels like a proper old town! There are loads of different squares, bars, shops and tapas restaurants to see!

Great place to stay!. Our hotel was here and we found it a perfect area for touring Barcelona. FABULOUS food at marvelous little restaurants tucked into the alleyways and GREAT people watching at the many outdoor cafes.

Loved this area - must visit. We were lucky in that we were staying so close by to the Gothic Quarter so we got to walk around it several times. We discovered something different every time, just keep wandering and you'll happen upon some wonderful authentic bars and cafes down little narrow lanes and alleys. Try to visit in the day and at night, because it changes as different shops, bars and restaurants open.

wow wow wow. wear your runners, and empty out the camera. we spent hours here then went back the next day, so much to see, shopping, architecture, churches - the museaum is amaing and well worth the entrance fee - warning though, it will take a few hours to do the whole lot - the underground city was the best bit. we ate well and found ots of wifi along the way.
Definite Must. We took a free walking tour through this neighborhood which really helped with the history and architecture. Went back the next day to see the ancient synagogue.
Beautiful. Beautiful inside and out, a truly must see. The location is perfect, just inside the Plaza next to La Rambla

Divine! visit on late Sunday morning. it's an amazing area. All those old buildings filled with graphite paintings, the narrow streets. The tiny charming shops. I deduct that it must not be a very safe area to visit at night, so visit it during the day. Even more safe if you do it on a Sunday morning, but the shops are closed...
Walk and walk. I could have walked all day through here and El Born, I couldn't get enough, particularly now that they clean up after their dogs, you can actually look around!
Brilliant area... This was our favourite part of Barcelona, the food, the amazing buildings and the little lanes - this is where we are heading next time.

A pleasant stroll through an old European neighborhood. The Barri Gotic is similar to the "old towns" in European cities. Some areas are very crowded with tourists, others are simply local neighborhoods. It's a pleasant area to stroll through - you could spend 2-3 hours. Lots of small places to get a pastry, beer or sandwich to keep you going. Hard to get really lost, so just walk without looking at your map - you never know what you might come across!
Great any time of day!. I would recommend staying here if you can. It has excellent restaurants and bars. Is lovely for walking around and shopping if you feel like. My favourite part of Barcelona!

Barri Gotic. To properly see the Gotic area I went on a free walk tour by a guide from Travel Bar. He was amazing. I recommend it. The tour takes 3 hours and it takes you on every important landmark in the are from Las Ramblas, Carer D'Avignon and the Barcelona Head at Port Vell explaining the history behind each landmark.
Get lost in time!. We loved strolling the narrow streets and getting lost and then finding great little cafes to have a glass of wine or tapa (or both!)
Beautiful. Very nice area. On Sundays around 11:00 you can admire locals dancing Sardana (traditional catalan dance) in front of the Cathedral (La Seu).
Must do!. A good way to spend an easy day. You can grab coffee, a glass of wine and a few tapas here and there... Lot's of outdoor sitting, good for people watching.
shopping. Greatest place to shop in Barcelona. The variety and quality of the shops was outstanding. The only confusing part was the streets that go in all different directions

Gothic Quarter (Barri Gotic). Quirky, great bars , restaurants and individual off shops. We went to a local Food and Wine show Mercat de Mercats (19-21 Oct.) which was AMAZING! I'm visiting with an empty suitcase next time.

Return at begining. With few step you are again in last ceturies, can see, the buildings, roads, facilitties form ancient time, can eat a food same time, and cane enjoy to buy gifts with ancient amprents .
Quaint, Charming, Lively, Colorful. Narrow streets, interesting shops and places to eat, antiquity with a modern attitude. Stroll for hours and look in the windows and doors, have lunch, it's great!

Lots of culture. The Barri Gotic had lots of interesting restaurants, an open market and a fine cathedral. On Sunday at 12, there is a semi-spontaneous community dance featuring a small orchestra and about 150 people dancing in a circle.
Nice area to walk around. The Gothic Quarter is a nice area with all the side streets and Cathedrals to see you could spend hours in this area

A must. Great art deco city but watch out for pickpockets, everywhere!
Walk everywhere and look up! houses are all wonderful even if not Gaudi

interesting part of the city. very glad we were able to visit the gothic quarter. the architecture and narrow alley ways really bring you back in time. so many interesting bars and restaurants tucked away in little nooks and crannies. ate at a small restaurant and enjoyed a lunch of paella, chicken, sausages and local beer. really delicious and at 25euro was actually a pretty good deal for 3 people.

lovely for wandering. This area is jam packed with unusual independent clothing ,jewellery and ceramic shops away from chain stores.There are also lots of great wee restaurants just off the beaten track. Round quiet corners you get away from the tourist bustle but are never far from the bizz.

Two thumbs up!. Makes an awesome walk down the narrow cobblestones alleys of Barcelona. The main attractions I'll say are the Gothic Cathedral and the area behind the Cathedral. The walk down Carrer del Bisbe is nice too. You can spend an easy 2 to 3 hours here and not be bored. You can then head to La Rambla and the Port which is a short walk away.

lost in time!. A real medieval experience! Looks like 7 or 8 hundred years ago, literally the buildings are falling down! There is no any straight street, it is easy to get lost! :) I loved this special feeling, but the drug addicts and prostitutes, also the pickpocketers are really harmful for the turism....anyway, I'll come back, just watch out! Cheers!

Charming and picturesque. This area is full of narrow, winding streets with old world architecture that makes you feel like you are going back in time. Very charming and beautiful architecture. Just walk around and experience it.

fun to walk around. its a fun place to walk around, grab a coffee outside and browse the array of shops, markets and general sites. yes, its a bit touristy but there are so many small alleys etc to wander down and many little squares to see. there's also the Rambla, a big section of stalls, restaurants etc to visit. The only thing I would say is that the small alleys can actually be quite dangerous at night with junkies and be careful to keep your wallets/purses safe as there are lots of pick-pockets - common problem in many big cities and just requires a little street smarts. I wouldnt go solo into these areas at night, but if you do, stick to the main streets.
Gothic Quarter. beutifull, romantic, great.great small restaurants and shops' wherever you go, you can't go wrong, the small street are great to roam in - loved it!
You can't leave Barcelona without walking the streets of the Gothic Quarter!. Perfect for getting lost on a lazy day. Truly memorable. We were able to find some great deals and gelato along the way!

Barri Gothic. Try a 'Free Walking Tour' through the Barri Gothic area with Travel Bound. THe history is enthralling, the streets quaint and sooo old. One of the most gorgeous, interesting areas in Barcelona.
Amazing to just wander round. The Gothic quarter is probably my most favourite area of the city. Amazing architecture and we found a brilliant violinist busking on the steps to the cathedral

Incredible site!. Historically amazing as it was a combination of two styles from two time periods. Just walking the several blocks around the area and down the smaller surrounding streets that opened up to art displays, specialty shops and incredible eateries
Take a map. You'll get lost if you don't have a map. Maybe you won't mind, though, because it's so interesting. And a bit spooky late at night

Such a cool place to see!. We loved the architecture of these buildings, we went through the Gothic Quarter a few times and had lunch there a few days we liked it so much. The buildings are awesome, I highly recommend it!

Full of atmosphere. Just off The Ramblas an interesting area with some interesting old buildings. The cathedral is spectacular and the antique market outside worth a look. Plenty of shops to browse and good restaurants too! Recommended!

Fun by day, avoid by night. The Gothic Quarter was great fun by day. We had tapas, shopped and strolled. We went back after dark and were greated by a group of homeless men were begging, borrowing and doing whatever else they could do to keep refilling their beer bottles.
Great neighborhood. Walk every where, we felt completely safe day and night. Wonderful resturants, Barcelona loves the tourists and are very helpful and friendly.

Get lost. The fun part of this area is to get totally lost. You cannot err in any substantial way (easy hint, Barcelona is going up from the sea so you will always know where the sea is) as there are big streets all around and the fun in here is all the small and narrow streets.Take your time, there is a lot to see and discover, be it street artisans and musicians, be it the architecture or the nice little shops and restaurants. Stop for a wine or a beer, enjoy some bakery and simply forget your time for a while. Of course it is touristy but there are also places where the Catalans go which offer a good value for money. This place (like so many in the world) is bty best enjoyed before are after the big masses form the cruise ships are in. If you are on a cruise... go there yourself, doing it in a large group and with a guide might give you some more insight but will destroy the romance and the charm of the place.It can give you a nice feeling like being an adventurer going there on your own.
Must see in Barcelona. If you are a history buff this is a must see while in Barcelona. Off Las Ramblas and easy to find. You will feel transported back in time.

Take a Stroll. This network of alleyways, lanes and Gothic buildings is perfect for a stroll with a camera. Lots of museums, churches and an antique synagogue. The antique/fleamarket outside the Cathedral is great for bargain hunters.
Delightful little streets. Felt safe here. Lots of shops and restaurants and the was no traffic in many of the streets. Much nicer than 'Rambles'

Interesting old buildings merge with lively entertainment. The cathedral is located here and is good value for a visit. When we were there, we saw a troupe of acrobats performing in the street outside and also an antiques market
You will get lost. Awesome part of barcelona where u will get lost and establishments tend to.go.walkies but its all part of the fun and who.knows....u may stumble upon something expected! Ace!

Just Wander About & Get Lost. Lovely narrow, high building streets to wander thru & discover hidden squares & plazas, small shops, restaurants & bars.
We came across some South American dancers adorned with beautiful head-dresses & costumes.
Recommended
Wow, what history!. This area is really cool. The old buildings, architecture and food located here make it worth the trip.
Great strolling, shopping, dining, and drinking. Cool area with great walk-ways, alleys, shops, bars, restaurants, and people-watching. What else do you need?

AMAZING!!!. The Gothic Quarter was amazing!! Our hotel wasn't far away and the views were absolutely beautiful. So much to see and hear with the musicians on site playing their instruments or singing their hearts out.

A Charming Medieval Area. I'm so glad we were able to walk around the Gothic Quarter with it's magnificent Cathedral. We had originally wanted to find a hotel here but as it turned out we were happy to stay elsewhere since there were demonstrations going on (peaceful) regarding Catalonia's quest for independence. The streets are really beautiful and definitely give you an idea of life in a former era. Don't miss it.
Must visit!. Just stoll around on the many narrow streets. Most of them only for pedestrians. Try the bars, restaurants and cafés (the wine and coffee is till quite affordable).

My favorite in Barcelona. Definitely for me the best place to feel Barcelona as you should. It's an old part of town. You can walk around exploring many of Medieval buildings, you can just sit on a bench and enjoy the people's everyday living or you can find your little shelter in one of the many cute bars and restaurants in this Quarter. Take a time, relax and ''get lost'' in some of the many little narrow streets because you can find something interesting on every corner. In the square of their art school you will find lot of interesting young people who are wiling to talk to you and explain you a bit more about Barcelona, things that you won't find in your guide books.
rain. Nice walking area. But couldn´t enjoy everything due to down - pour of heavy rain! Had a lovely breakfast at a small very old place. It´sworth going back to on a lovely sunny day!
awesome. Loved just wandering round this area and finding something wonderful round every corner. Ancient buildings and alcoves, Narrow streets, truly atmospheric of ancient Barcelona

Make sure you do this. This is probably one area where you can just walk around, leave your map behind, roam around, take it easy, admire the ghotic architecture, and really, just get lost! You'll probably pop out on Ramblas anyway at some point! Of course, if you want to make sure you don't leave anything out - then yes - map required LOL
A must see. I really loved the theme of the place, it really stood out. It's totally different than the romantic themes of Italy and France.
Lovely. Just a maze of little streets with plenty of shops and restaurants. Great atmosphere and very enjoyable.
Excellent area to hang out. Gothic quarter is full of nice little places to eat & drink. Walking around is a pleasant experience. Not really touristic and boring as places around la Rambla are!
Quaint. It was nice wandering along the little cobbled pathways of the gothic quarter.Quite quaint it had lots of little interesting shops.

Good find. Worth while wandering through the Gothic Quarter as you never know what you'll find. It has narrow streets and as the name suggests is the older part of Barcelona. The houses and shops are small and like family enterprises as opposed to the large stores on Las Ramblas. we found a quaint old shop that sold hams and bottles and jars containing all sorts of vegitables and preserves. They have a couple of tables at the back where you can sample some of the hams and have a drink of local wine. What a great way. The till, meal slicer and oven are out of the arc but he still uses the till.

Had a great tour!. You want to check out the free walking tour at 11am at the Coloumbus statue for an excellent history lesson on the Gothic quarter and the Catylunians! Every square had something fun and entertaining happening!
Lovely to walk through. Interesting and historic. WATCH your belongings though. It's not a dangerous area but annoying pickpockets.
Just wander. I think we had the most fun just wandering around getting lost in the alleys and passages of Gotic. Lots of interesting shops, bars and historic places to visit.

A walk into history. The Barri Gothic area of Barcelona makes for some wonderful walks and sights. The architecture, narrows lanes which look almost mysterious sometimes and surprises like a farmer's market or a group of street musicians, all make it a must see in Barcelona.

but beware thieves!. Wonderful architecture to absorb but beware thieves trying to get you to take out your wallet with a request for a penny for a flower. Their sleight of hand is very good (for them, not you!)
Wondering the Barri Gotic.. Lovely little streets and alleys full of interesting shops and eating places. Wonderful to ramble through.
A must-see. The best thing was wandering around the Gothic area and finding a nice place to sit and have a glass of Sangria or some tapas. Truely spanish

Get a Tapas Tour. We loved the Barri Gotic, and we loved the Tapas Tour from Tapas Tours Barcelona.
As new guests to the City, we appreciated the walking tour, the history provided by an EXCELLENT guide, Katrina, and we loved seeing four very different places!

A must!. You cannot visit Barcelona and miss out on the Gothic Quarter. There is so much to see day and night. The cathedral is quite magnificent (although on our last trip everyone had to leave - perhaps because of a very noisy, and at times a little unsettling, protest march which passed the cathedral on the way to Palau de la Generalitat. Still in the current economic climate in Spain, protests and demonstrations appear to be relatively common). As well as wonderful architecture, There are several Playas which provide peaceful places to sit during the day and are lively meeting places in the evening. There are plenty of places to have a meal or a drink or just sit and people-watch. There is generally something going on to entertain you when you have had enough of wandering through the many narrow streets and alleys.The Flamenco at Tarantos in Placa Reial is a low cost opportuntiy to see traditional, intimate Flamenco shows at a fraction of the cost of some of some of the bigger venues (book online and you can buy tickets at 8 euros instead of 10 on the door). As in most other cities it is important to keep your wits about you. While the area is full of honest, friendly and charming people there are a few less savoury characters to be found so keep an eye on your possessions and be aware of what is going on around you.
Beautiful buildings. Nice architecture, many shops and squares, great for wandering and strolling. Some hidden beauties that are worth discovering.
A charming area of Barcelona. Lovely small streets and beautiful architecture. A nice place to take a drink and relax whilst keeping away from all the crowds
Atmospheric. Lovely to wander around and find little shops, bakeries, small chapels. Barcelona has different districts and you need to experience the variety

Roam Free. The Gothic Quarter is an area for discovery. Yes it has the shopping and eating that is expected in a grand city, such as Barcelona, but it is so much more. Keep your eyes and your soul searching and you will find something amazing in every corner. Stroll the alley ways, relax in a plaza, and take in the incredible Gothic architecture.
lovely squares. Best part by far. Alleys, squares, shops, bars and cafes at every turn. beautiful architecture,churches and lovely tapas

One of our favorite areas. I was so glad we followed the advice of Rick Steeves and our tour guide in San Sebastian who both said to visit this area. We had a great time...fun shopping, gelato, bakeries and of course architecture...a beautiful "bridge of sighs" was an added bonus!
Great fun. Be sure that you have the name and address of your hotel because your going to get lost its great fun
Great for wandering. You could wander the streets for ages, day or night - shops, cafes, wonderful buildings and street lamps, cathedral and church buildings with wonderful carvings. I loved it.
