Beautiful. Lovely to walk in the small and narrow streets! Beautiful arcitechture and lots to see. We just walked randomly through the streets and were really impressed.

Good are to just walk around and get lost.. This is just an old gothic are which has many tiny streets interconnecting with each other at some stage. It is very easy to get lost here. There are alot of boutique shops here , and there are also alot of restaurants and cafes and tapas bars where you can enjoy a nice meal. Be vary wary of pickpocketers and thiefs who will attempt to snatch your camera or handbag and run.

Explore at night or be prepared to wilt. This little section of small alleys and shops was quite interesting, but in the July afternoon it was unbearably hot and we could not last for long exploring it on foot. This was true of almost everywhere we went in Spain. I don't know if it is always this hot in July and August or if we caught a heat wave, but it was ungodly hot. I am definitely a believer in global warming now. I was in Spain 30 years ago and cannot remember it being as hot and uncomfortable as it was on this visit. There is simply no way anyone of any age can go outside during the afternoon without dire health consequences. It is as though you are stepping into a sauna and it just drains all of the energy from your body. I am a regular at the gym, doing an hour of cardio each day, and I was exhausted after five minutes in the heat of the afternoon. We tried exploring this area again in the evening and it was a totally different experience. It is a quaint and fun to explore section of Barcelona, but it too is filled with tourist trap restaurants and souvenir shops. I could not find many sights or shops worth spending money in. I found this true of much of Barcelona. The town seems to be a hangout for young people and not much else. It reminds me of the Jersey Shore here at home. Snooki would fit right in.
Fabulous architecture. Lovely cobbled streets to wander round with some fabulous buildings and shops! Day and night a must to do.

Get lost in the small streets. Wander around the Barri Gotic admiring the beautiful architecture, visit the cathedral, the Barcelona History Museum (Plaza del Rey) and stop for a cup of coffee in one of the many cafes. There are some gems hidden here and if you want to visit the off beaten routes, you should try the Plaza Sant Felip Neri (behind the cathedral) and Iglesia de Santa Maria del Pi.

Go to see Santa Maria del Mar. A wonderful area of Barcelona, the highlight was the Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar, a truly holy place with slender columns and brilliant stained glass. Everyone was so courteous, helpful and friendly. I cannot wait until my next visit. As you leave the Basilica cross the road to a lovely restaurant and bar. Good food at very reasonable prices with delightful staff.

Cool place to be. I liked this unique little neighborhood. It was a blend of Roman, Gothic and modern architecture. It reminded me a bit of Venice without the water canals. Shops and restaurants galore. In Barcelona, this is the place to be!

Beautiful part of the city. It's such a stunning area, especially the gargoyles peering out at you from the rooftops. The courtyard of the cathedral was beautiful and we just noticed it when we were walking past. A great place for an afternoon stroll, and there's a market in the main square.

You Didn't Visit Barcelona Unless You Where Here. Great bit of Europe. Most of our dinners and cocktail hours were in this charming part of town. When there it is easy to imagine what life was like hundreds of years ago in Barcelona.

You simply have to go and see it for yourself!. Words cannot describe hundreds of years of history, just go spend a few hours walking around, looking up at all the beautiful historic buildings in this area....there are many cafes and places to go into and take a breather if you are with younger kids or elders.

charming. it is a must when in barcelona. local charm, great restaurants - from cheapest to somewhat pricey, and super cool boutiques. like in almost any area in barcelona, be very careful with your personal belongings, and other than that, enjoy and take in the atmosphere.
Nice and medieval but too many junk shops. It is charming and a joy to explore but unfortunately, as other places like it, filled with tourist traps and shops selling cheap junk.
Loved walking this area. Great little shops and restaurants. Shade from the summers sun. We found a few little plazas to sit around.

a complex experience.... Picturesque place, clean enough but the plumbings network was terrible, all the place share a distinct and unpleasant odor in the middle of August, if you'll survive, the simple walking will be a nice experience, a lot of police, be aware of pickpockets.
Wonderful hidden streets. The old quarter is amazing with surprises around every corner. Great shops, little cafes, bakeries and bars. Love discovering.
Interesting. Looking at the old building and how they have evolved was great - also some great shops and little restaurants

Don't worry about getting lost. One of the few cities to keep their old city intact. The streets are small and winding, but they all lead to a coupe of major streets so you can always figure out where you are. Enjoy.

Lovely and unique. Old, old buildings full of boutiques, souvenir shops, restaurants, cafes, clubs with residents on top. Take a walking tour to learn about the fascinating history of the Barri Gotic!

True "European" Experience. I've been living in Europe for almost 2 years, and out of all the places I've visited, walking through Barri Gotic finally made me feel like I'm now in "Europe." It's hard to explain. I've been to Venice, Paris, Amsterdam, London, all over Germany, Austria, Switzerland, etc. I think it's the ambiance, architecture, and the fact that locals take residence in all the apartments and hang their laundry. Even with a bunch of tourists walking around, the corridors just didn't have that "touristy" feel to it at all. The place was not commercialized, and the restaurants and stores were authentic. If you come to Barcelona and miss walking through this place, you'll definitely miss out on what Barcelona is all about. The best way to experience this is to start walking from Ramblas street (The Touristy Street) and start walking along the Carrer de la Princessa (with a few detours here and there) towards the Citadel Park, where you can enjoy the beautiful fountains.

The best location in Barcelona. For me it is the best location in Barcelona, I visited Barcelona two times, and the first time when I saw Barri Gotic I wanted to stay there so I made my wish come true. :)Beautiful streets where you can wonder and wonder for days and always discover something new. Everything is close to reach by foot, Las Ramblas, Barceloneta, La RIbera, Gracia...

Want to get back to gloomy European history?. A maze of narrow streets with quite a high buildings (given the time they were built) which would lead you to different sights (like cathedral or some other churches, or Picasso museum). At certain point you will get out to waterfront and can continue to La Barcelonetta. Many restaurants are located in these streets, some of them having many dried hams hanging from the ceiling, and in hot days "gloomy" appearance of the streets - as in some not much of the light comes from the skies - will provide you a good shelter from a strong sun. I suggest you start your exploring mission from La Rambla

Amazing Time. With our tour guide Charles from Spanish Trails, we enjoyed our walk through the Gothic Quarter with a wheel chair. It was quite the adventure, amazing churches and sights and history. We were greatful to have a local on hand to help us and give us great information!

Fascinating maze of streets, shops, and restaurants. The Gothic Quarter is a great place to spend the day (or multiple days). The streets and paths are narrow and shady so they are a great way to escape the heat. They wind along in every direction and are lined with shops and restaurants.

Atmospheric area.. Ahhhh, it was so good to stumble across this area of Barcelona after the madness and chaos of La Ramblas. It was dusk and the light was beautiful. I love all the little alleyways and boutique shops. What an amazing area to get lost in!
Great!. Another great area that I wished to of spent more time in. If you go, there is a great restaurant called 'Pla'....it's a bit off the path of things but the food was amazing. Well worth going.
nice place. Waliking around looking at the shop and cafe, admiring the architecture ,simply magic. Around the Rambla from place Catalunya down to the port
filled with character. stacked with history and atmospere. Churches, bars, tapas bars. the place to go to eat, drink, see and be seen.
Atmospheric. Loved the narrow streets,buildings and character of the area as well as the funky independent shops,disliked the masses of tourists on bike tours on pavements.

Spend an afternoon here. Historic, unique and worth the time to explore. We spent two hours wandering around looking up and down the buildings and the alleys. Around each corner is something to photograph.
Very atmospheric. Interesting narrow streets. Particularly interesting around the Cathederal. Some people might find it a bit intimidating at night after the shops are shut.

Great nighttime walk. It was great to walk around the Barri Gotic at night. A lot of the shops were closed, but the restaurants were open and the place was bustling. We had some delicious squid ink paella (at a restaurant whose name I can't remember) at about 11pm and the place was packed.
Walking tour with materiabcn.com. Great tour. Savvy guide. Excellent maps and preparatory explanations. No repetition of a script. I recommend it. You buy it online.

Great to visit, but do not stay here. The medieval alleyways are fascinating, a fun to wonder during the day. Can be very noisy at night, with night clubs and bars opened almost all night. If you want to sleep find a place to stay in another part of town.

Unique atmosphere!. Unique combination of history, trendy shops, antiques, bars, restaurants, gotic atmosphere and a Roman wall over 20 centuries old, the Barri Gotic is a must. Close to Plaza Catalunya and Las Ramblas the quarter is located in the very central area of the city. Allways crowdy, tourists and locals visit it day and night. The Gotic Cathedral, a building made during centuries XIV and XV, is one of the icons of the district and also the city.

Vibrant Touring. The city is espexcially alive in this section of the city with museums, Gothic churchs, very interesting architecture, shops tapas bars and outdoor dining spaces. Oh yes the best galatto!

Just a few steps off La Rambla, and much more interesting!. The Barri Gotic is just east of the popular tourist destination La Rambla. My husband and I downloaded Rick Steve's travel guide and gave ourselves a guided tour. It was great! It took about half of the day and we got some great pictures, too!
Gothic Quarter. Beautiful streets with so many surprises, and beautiful art work. Some brilliant resturants and some fantastic street performers.

Lots of fun!. The Bari Gotic is lots of fun to explore, with all sorts of nice passageways and bars and restaurants. A great way to spend a day or an evening wnadering around, getting lost in the maze!
Beautiful buildings. We stayed near this area and walked through it several times. Each little street you see new things and the feel is so old world it's very fun. The cathedral Gothic is beautiful!

Very interesting to walk around. Lots of interesting shoppes and you are guaranteed to get disoriented because the streets wind in and around in all directions. The architecture is stunning, and you can just imagine what it was like hundreds of years ago -- when people were wandering the same streets are you are now.
Have to go. Well worth spending a few hours wandering around and getting a little lost in the narrow alleys. They are full of shops and bars with a real feelgood factor.
Barcelona at its most historic and trendy. Spend time aimlessly wondering the streets and you'll find trendy stores, can't miss dining spots and centuries of Barcelona history all together.

A most beautiful area.. Loved the architecture and feel of the area. Very beautiful. Great wrought iron works, hidden churches and squares with cafes, bakeries and little surprises around every corner.
Worth a visit. Definitely worth a visit if you are staying nearby. Paradoxically beautiful, a site of fascinating architecture and intrigue.
Really cool place. Getting lost in here is like getting lost in a different era... Wander the streets and enjoy. Find random shops
Bustling. Great combo of gothic architecture and interesting restaurants. This area has a great indoor market with all kinds of fish, fruits, meats and cheeses. Fun!
Must see. A must see whilst in Barcelona! Full of beautiful, quirky cobbled little streets, a very pleasant walk in the sun.

Go down that side street!. Las Ramblas is very boring but to either side there are endless canyons of interesting streets and squares. Again, off the main Gothic streets, there are side streets. Wander around at night. As the street gets smaller, the prices drop.

This area is beautifully historic. The architecture and atmosphere is out of this world. Bustling and busy with plenty of little nooks and crannies to explore. Lots of quaint shops and pretty streets. It was a hot day when we went there and was crowded, which was a little overwhelming.
Great place to wander & get lost. The buildings look amazing. Seems a waste we ate in an American diner just on the edge opposite the tube station, but the burgers were amazing!
A place not to be missed. Beautiful buildings narrow streets, lots of little shops, you could wander all day there and not have seen it all. Take a camera for sure as there is so much to see.

A charming quarter. I recommend taking a guided tour around this beautiful quarter. The tours are offered at various times and the tickets can be bought online. The tour will take you to the best parts of the quarter and then you are free to wonder off on your own. This quarter is full of small boutiques, local restaurants and cafés.
Picturesque.... Small streets with an air of old times. Go see it once, because there are nice corners to stop for a while.

my hotel was in the gothic quarter. The quarter was good but i've seen a lot of bad "faces", i mean.. a lot of strange people, clochards and people who tried to sell us drugs like marijuana and cocain, heroin ecc! they youst came there and ask us.. that wasn't good.. there might be more controll over this people i think!

Nice arquitecture. Nice, but always crowded. Museums are NOT free and it can get very hot and sticky in summer so be prepared. Take plenty of liquids to drink, sun protection and hats are indispensible.

nice to wander around. was good and its nice when its hot, there is a lot of shade in the small streets. the shops and food is a bit more expensive. I loved the Middle Ages Atmosphere. Especially the streets with the passeig are nice.
Great attraction to be in. Must go attraction, all the "atmosphere" and the streets there are lovely, don't miss it. Good for all ages.

So cool place. Loved the area! All little shops and bars. We tried to walk through small alleys which didn´t have that many people and also prices were therefor lower. Go and explore! Tarantino bar is the best!

A great place to explore. Just of Las Ramblas, the Barri Gotic is easily accessible, and worth an afternoon walk around, just be careful of your possessions as apparently there are a lot of thieves, although thankfully we were ok.

Relax in the Squares with a beer and watch the world go by-bliss bliss. Chill out in one of the many squares that you come on as you turn a corner. Have a beer a coffee or just sit on a stone and watch the world go by fabulous

Takes you back. Takes you back to a time...well a time I didn't even exist in. The little shops and tapas bars are great and walking through the gothic quarter is entrancing. This area was my favorite part in Baecelona. You can hear music in the air and walking around at night has a magical feeling to it.
what a maze. best to go late afternoon,and take note where you are as it is easy to keep going in circles.Can be a bit smelly,and cars do use the alley ways.

Really nice to walk around. We took the Runner Bean Tours free walk of the old city which was excellent. Highly recommended.
Nice atmosphere, a lot of history.

Get lost. No really. Get lost in the Barri Gotic for a few hours. You will discover the most enchanting part of the city. Gorgeous boutiques, cafes, restaurants, gift stores...you name it. One street more quaint than the next. THIS is what Spain is all about.

The best to visit in Barcelona. Narrow streets, small shops, amazing gothic arquitecture and one of the most multicultural environments in Barcelona. Enjoy it !!
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
For further information please visit http://myspanishtrip.com

splendid atmosphere. let your self loosen up and get lost in the non paralel streets. this place is very unique with all the little bars and shops. go to Plaza de rial and sit at one of the great resturants there.
Picturesque and interesting. Everyone says to be careful of pickpockets - we were and so had no problem at all. Lots of quaint buildings - and also great shops!

Cool eclectic quarter. Our hotel was located in the Gothic Quarter, around the cornier from the beautiful Cathedral. I loved walking through all the small pedestrian streets and running into little cafes, street musicians, fountains, and courtyards. It really is a great place to walk. It is also right next to a busy shopping area and not too far distant from Las Ramblas. It's a little difficult if you have a car because a lot of the streets close off on the weekends and you might be stuck trying to get in, but that's the charm of this old quarter.

What a great place for a wander. I loved the Gothic quarter, full of character and hidden buildings. If you walk to the right of the cathedral and enter you can look around the impressive gardens before entering the main heart of the building. Loads of nice places to stop and have a drink.
Quaint and special. We spent so much time here, drank in the squares, ate tapas, and soaked in Barcelona. It was our favourite area in Barcelona- away from the chaos of la Rambla.
Cosmopolitan and interesting. Full of historical buildings, shops restaurants and cafe bars.Extremely cultural soak up the atmosphere

We loved Barri Gotic!. We loved this area and our hotel was right in the heart of it. Lots of great little shops (ham, ice cream, tapas bars, clothing stores, local crafts, souvenirs). Great cafes and plazas, sometimes with art sales, entertainers or farmers markets. Our favorite area of Barcelona!

Fun area to walk and eat. Super fun area to walk around in. There are lots of really cute shops. There must be a few dozen ice cream places as well. If you look around you can find some really excellent tapas places.

Fascinating to walk through. The narrow streets and vibrant markets and shops in this area allowed us to get lost in this historic area. Architecture and narrow streets and small churches give n idea of what life would have been like centuries ago before modern transport and architecture.

Wonderful Shops in The Old Part of Town.. ... and so many shops too. A great place to buy presents to take home, and clothes to wear too :)... and so many shops too. A great place to buy presents to take home, and clothes to wear too :)

Perfect combination of history and shopping. So glad I chose to stay right in the middle of this picturesque area of Barcelona with its maze of little lanes, some so narrow you can almost touch the walls on both sides with outstretched arms. Away from the corporate chain stores and eateries, the Barri Gotic brims with colourful, individual little shops and restaurants and is steepd in fascinating history. Take a free walking tour with "Runnerbean" and find out even more about the area!

A Moorish Experience. Living in Marrakech, Morocco, I was not quite expecting such a Moorish influence this far north in Spain, indeed in Catalonia. But I was pleasantly surprised by the medina like influence of this ancient part of Barcelona. No need for a guide at all as the people were so friendly. I think that some of the other reviewers did not know where they had visited when there are comments such as “Like a big dirty old shopping mall"! (The Barri Gotic is simply not like this.) But then again I overheard an American couple saying "Gee, Mildred, just look at that wall with the tree growing out of it!" - don't these folks know how to build a decent wall?) This was of course a reference to a two thousand plus year old Roman ruins of the city ramparts of the Barri in the wonderful city of Barcelona. (The same couple were later to be heard to criticise the fabulous patisseries in the shops - have these people never heard of Krispy Kremes?, the obese guy said.)

An ideal area for strolling. Like the old quarter of any city, the Barri Gotic rewards strolling, especially if you remember to look above street level too. It's corny, but true when people say - "I bet these streets could tell some stories if they could talk". There is a lot of history and atmosphere in places like this, as well as interesting shops and other businesses.

Walking tour Gothic Qu. A very enjoyable way to visit this part of Barcelona. Our guide was friendly and knowledgeable. We saw lots of interesting parts we wouldn't have known to look for. Some parts closed on a Monday as museums closed then - so either a good time to go as you can go to museums another day, but there were some parts of the walk we didn't have access to because of this. Be careful of pickpockets - our guide helped us be alert for this.
love it. Take some time to just wonder through the streets. It really is beautiful! There are so many people and not the best food though.

Like a big dirty old shopping mall. Fun for an hour, then get out.. Crowded, smelly, over priced, but a fun place to find lunch or poke around in shops. You can find some good tapas and beer if that is your thing, a couple of museums, but stay in a hotel in another part of town. And watch your things, your wallet and bags and your senses. If the hotel itself posts signs that warn against scammers who need help with directions, cars, etc. if the lobby of the hotel has multiple signs posted warning you to watch your stuff, it is wise to stay elsewhere if you are looking to relax on vacation.

Horse and Buggy. We got on the horse and buggy at the end of the Ramble and the driver took us through the Gothic Quarter pointing out places of interest, it was worth the fare. Then we came back the next day (on foot) and we knew where we wanted to spend additional time exploring. Great experience ! Lots of history to explore.
everything you need for fun. The place is alive a lot of people all the time. Drinks, food, shopping, fun. The place never go to sleep and entertaiment all over.

Excellent shopping. This historic area has many small boutiques that offer unique products. If you are a non EU visitor take your passport and obtain a tax refund voucher. There is a refund office next to the tourist information at Placa de Catalunya, situated at the city end of la Rambla. It is not necessary to take the items to the refund office just passport and travel details. Beware that they charge a hefty fee for the service - about 25% of the refund, but the bright side is you get 75% in cash. They take you credit card as security so that you complete the airport inspection.You have to complete the paperwork at the airport police office far left back of the main terminal at the airport and take the items for inspection. You have to take a number and wait outside the police area until called - this can take 20 to 30 minutes, so leave extra time! At least they open 24 hours a day!El Corte Ingles is large enough to have their own refund system on the basement level of the main store and they process the transaction as a credit to credit card or cash with much lower percentage fees. Again you will have the card charged for the refund if you do not complete the airport documentation. This feature makes shopping for common items much more attractive at El Corte Ingles.

Exciting Place!. You cannot miss this area if of Barcelona. The Barcelona Cathedral in the Gothic town is absolutely beautiful. The streets and the intricate detail on the old buildings are worth seeing. Take notice of the beautiful doors and iron works in this area. There are also plenty of shops and restaurants to visit.
Tapas, restaurant, night fever!. really nice part of the town to visit at the end of the day!enjoy tapas and Mojitos!!!We enjoyed walking on the streets of gothic Quarter during the night!
Walking the Streets of History. We really enjoyed just walking around the Gothic Quarter. It has a very ancient feeling to it and there are lots of interesting shops and cafes throughout.
Guide book? No thanks!. An ideal area to get lost in the streets and alleys and find yourself seeing different places and sights maybe only locals would know of.

Good, but losing its charm slightly... I'm getting the feeling that Barri Gotic is now almost entirely taken over by over zealous tourist and backpackers with cheap goods sold by street vendors and a general 'tourist central' feel. It is still beautiful though. Head to Barceloneta (away from the beach areas though) for a more local feel.

So close to Las Ramblas and so different!. The atmosphere feels so much more authentic in this part of the city. Shopping is great, you find any kind of bars or restaurants. If you want to eat xurros, go to Starbucks on Carrer de Ferran. Right beside Starbucks there is a narrow street, walked that street about 5 minutes, passing a hat store and you will arrive to the xurro shop.The owner is of the head of xurro association. They also make the best crisps.

Gothic. The Gothic lack of organization, as intended by Modernists, is a great feature for life in the city. You have all you may need in a walk distance, no need to get two types of transportation system and no tiring trips. Bread, drinks, coffee, lunch, supermarket, just at the corner near where you live. Barcelona Gothic Quarter is like that, just what the planners of modern Urbamism say is a good neighbourhood organization. And they did not manage to build in no modern city.
interesting area. An area certainly worth exploring, there a lots of narrow twisting streets with plenty of places to explore & little squares where you can enjoy a snack & watch the world go by!.
A nice "free" walk through and tour. Just strolling through the quarter is lovely and free! The atmosphere and environment is beautiful! Alot of history to be seen!
definitely worth it. We only walked around for a couple of hours but it's a cool atmosphere with lots of history. Much more authentic than Las Ramblas

Fantastic. The Gothic Quarter deserves a whole day of sightseeing. We visited it on bikes and on foot with the "Hi, This is Barcelona" tour Company. Angel, our guide was well versed in the history and was an outstanding giude. We enjoyed learning of the history of the city and its place in the Roman empire, and its place in Spanish history.

Whatever you need, you'll find it here. Entertainment, art, history, culture, this is the place!La Rambla is one thing, but here is the place for the best (and not expensive) resturants, shops, bars, etc. And no pickpocketers, I felt really safe late at night.

Crazy place!. Everything is big and busy. Lots to see, we walked for miles! Shopping and food everywhere. East Gothic has higher end shops. West cheaper but with hidden gems. There are things to eat see and do at every step. Bring a map. People everywhere. Stayed at OHLA hotel which was placed well between Gothic quarter, shopping and close to Las Ramblas action. I would say to be leary at night. Be around people in the eve when walking. Walked to most heritage sites from the Gothic quarter even to the beach. The buildings are stunning, streets clean in the day, food great, beer cheaper than soda. Go to all the churches and bring lots of MB for the camera and a zoom lens. Bathrooms at Micky dees, burger king starbucks.
Great for wandering around after dark. Beautifully lit, romantic, small alley ways and streets. Me and my girlfriend got coffees and wandered around in the summer evenings, perfect!

Deserves a whole day. A maze of streets and squares around the Cathedral. On Sunday morning the Placa de la Seu thronged with Catalans dancing the Sardana as a band played on the Cathedral steps. We didn't actually stop for lunch, but "grazed" around the shops, cafes and bars with a marvellous selection of food on offer.
Must see. We toured this area on the 'Fat Tire bicycle tour'. Great area to walk around and look at the various architecture

Spend time at the Catedral de la Santa Creu, soaking up the atmosphere!. We came across the Catedral de la Santa Creu whilst wandering through the Gothic Quarter, and spent time there everyday. It is a fantastic spot for people watching, drinking sangria at one of the restaurants, or just sitting for 10 minutes on the steps before moving on, and winding your way through the streets of the Barri Gotic.There was always something on in the square, whether it was the sounds of singers or accordian playes drawing us into the narrow streets, or street dancers and performers! Better still was a festival on the Saturday evening (a Catalan event throughout July I believe) and we were lucky enough to witness endless dancing by groups of older people, and the amazing Castells (people towers) right by the Catedral steps, which was truly amazing!

Back in time.... This medieval quarter of Barcelona was great to explore on foot. In every little street there was something new like a great big door that actually led to an oasis with palmtrees and a waterfountain which turned out to be the courtyard of a church. Or a quick stop at the Picasso museum which you can't miss as it has some typical Picasso drawings on its facade. This area is also great for cafes and quality souvenir shops. Be prepared to "bring" a lot of time with you.

It all goes down here. All the nice places to eat, bars, shops, are here. Have to check out the small crooked streets, squares, and stores. Best to spend some time walking the streets, to see what you come across. So many places to eat and drink, will stumble onto things.
Take a walking tour. You'll never be able to find all of the little roads and crevices on your own. Walking tours are well worth it. Such a lovely area.
So Romantic. lovely! All the small streets, colorful, nice shops, cafes and Restaurants. To visit La Ferreria Café
Pure Barcelona. Just wander around and be surprised at every turn full atmosphere restaurants music of every description something for everyone

Brilliant atmosphere, bars and shops.. Take the time to wander around the Barri Gothic, it is definitely one of the most interesting places in Barcelona. Great if you find a table and just people watch. It's got the pick of the Bars and Restaurants and beautiful architecture, buildings and squares.

Beautiful and atmospheric. I am a bit of a sucker when it comes to just wandering around old streets and Barcelona's Gothic Quarter provides a perfect location. It is full of narrow streets which open out into pleasant little Placa's and reveal beautiful architecture and delightful cafes. The area around the Cathedral and Generalitat is particularly pleasant and the Placa Reial is a must.

Beautiful and Quiet Walking Tour.. My brother and sister and I stumbled upon this area totally on accident, and I'm glad we did. We wandered through this Gothic Quarter of Barcelona for about 2 hours. There are many cute stores, nice eateries, and lots to see. Often, I felt like we were the only ones in Barcelona! It was so quiet and peaceful at times. A great mix of busy old town streets and quiet alley ways. Perfection! I highly recommend wandering through this part of Barcelona.
Cool.. really stunning history with the gotic scene, every wall you touch has seen it all before !
Fun to walk around and see all the little places here. and it's near the Picasso museum, which is well worth a visit, and doesn't take too long to see.

Great area to wander around, plenty of little Bars. Has a great feel to it, narrow , cool streets and lots of little cafe's and bars BUT be on your guard for those looking to relieve you of your camera , wallet or handbag. Do not let this put you off becasue this is a great part of Barcelona...but be aware.

Nice to walk, average to take photos. Typical old town of medieval city, a lot of old houses, a lot of souvenir shops, music near cathedral, but streets aren't very good for taking photos, they are too narrow. Anyway, it's good place to walk between avenues of Barcelona.
Could walk around for hours!. DEFINITELY visit the gothic quarter if you are in Barcelona! It was really cool walking through the different alleys
Time travel. The alley ways wind around and give you a taste of long ago Barcelona. Narrow and intimate, these streets have character.
Worth a visit. Nice area for a city walk. Small shops and cafes, can be very hot in mid day. Did not get the impression of medieval.
Expectacular!!!!. you will not want to miss this area of BCN!!! don't miss the alleys!!!

Windings Roads. Get lost in the ancient back alleys of Barcelona! You can walk around for days on these winding roads, visiting all the bar-bars, tapas-bars, restaurants you'll ever need. Even if you're not religious, be sure to visit the churches, some date back many hundreds of years and are full of history, very cool.

Great area to walk in. We ended up in the Barri Gotic, because we wandered off Las Ramblas. The Barri Gotic was so beautiful. We were there on a Saturday night and a lot of the shops were closed. What a surprising contrast to some of the Gaudi architecture which is only a few blocks away. I wish I had spent more time here.
Gorgeous Buildings. It is a great place to walk around and explore. All the Gothic buildings are beautiful and are in great condition.
Nice to see. This is one of the most beatiful part of Barcelona. There are a lot of restaurants and bars there. Price can double in one day. So, pay attention to special offers.

Despite its age, constantly changing!. Something for everyone; history from the Cathedral and la iglesia del Pi to Roman baths and history museum to a maze of little artesan shops, restaurants and bars both very old to the very avant garde.

Great location to stay in!. Lovely neighbourhood to wander in, so many shops, bars, restaurants, winding alleys. The Gothic Quarter is a great location to stay in...it's close to everything and so alive.

Fantastic atmosphere, lovely restaurants.. The fun, lively atmosphere in the Gothic Quarter is perfect, and there are some wonderful restaurants and bars there. I'd recommend avoiding the restaurants on the main streets and instead delving further into the back streets of the place, where less touristy, more authentic and more affordable fare can be found. Even just walking around the Gothic Quarter is a treat, taking in the street artists, sporadic dancers and musicians.
beautiful. The most beautiful area to walk, eat and shop. Loved seeing all the different cultures that live and visit this area.

A step bak in time. Amazing narrow streets will give you a neck ache, from looking up at all the architecture (well all Barcelona is like that.) The Gothic cathedral is stunning and shopping and flea markets too, what more could you ask for?
Beautiful Architecture. As you wander around the Gothic Quarter you get a real sense of the culture and heritage of the city. This area has many great restaurants and small boutiques. Recommended.
Interesting,. This was just a self-walking tour, It was interesting but could have used a guide to really get eveything out of it.
Great area to walk and people watch. Very crowded on weekends, but nice early in the morning.
Beautiful. The oldest section of Barcelona - beautiful bulidings and some great places to see and stop.
Very nice area. If you just want to seek a little shade from the hot Spanish sun, watch people, eat good food such as tapas, do some shopping or view the architecture - don't miss these quarters.

Lose yourself in facinating backstreets!. Loved finding tiny bars for a glass of champagne, great tapas were everywhere, fun shops with unusual wares, art, fountains, churches around every corner. I felt safe and loved every minute!

Gothic Quarter's hidden gems. fascinating area, dont miss the underground Roman city of Barcino, an extensive excavation of streets below the Gothic Quarter, 'housed' in the Museu d'Historia de la Ciutat and the Roman columns incorporated into the wall of a 'modern' apartment block at the Temple Roma d'Augusti
Great place to wander!. We loved this area of Barcelona and found a great restaurant here too! We especially enjoyed these streets at night and always enjoying walking any time we're someplace new.

Explore the magical alleys. Choose a good weather day, wear comfi shoes and take a magical tour in this quarter's alleys. Don’t miss the La Catedral's inner garden, the great rosata round window of the Esglesia de Santa Maria del Pi and the nice vintage and new shops.

Scenic and unique. As an American it is so amazing to walk down streets with such beauty and history. Great shops, great little alleyways, took a million door photos, just can't get over the doors! Took so many photos here. Fantastic atmosphere. As you walk, your view of a street would be the same as some living centuries ago. Just loved it here.

Great for daytime entertainment and food. Don't be on the street "La Rambla" after 10:00 PM or before 8:00 AM. Almost got carjacked at 11:15 PM and prostitutes are everwhere but seem to be heading hom by 7:30 AM.

Beautiful place. We stopped there with our hop on and hop off bus with the orange route. we had a nice breakfast in the plaza and walked the narrow little streets. We could and should have spend more time there.

Highly recommend. Definitely put this area on your agenda when visiting Barcelona, the buildings are amazing and the streets and laneways are hidden gems. Also recommend Tapas bar overlooking the Bascilica
Architecture from another time. I could spend all day in the gothic quarter. Loved all of the architecture and ran out of battery taking photos. It was amazing.

Great Shops, Great Eats!. This is a wonderful area filled with twists and turns and cobble stoned streets. A beautiful place to get lost (safely) for hours and just enjoy! We ate several times in Placa Real within the Bario!

Lovely area to walk through - lots to see. There are lots of old gothic buildings that you can view (from both outside and with a fee from the inside). Beautiful church in the center of the quarter. Easy walking distance from Las Rablas - certainly worth the walk.

Take a long walk, prepare to get lost. Barri Gotic, unfortunately, was lined with stores and restaurants and cafes. In the midst of all that, there were so many little nooks and crannies that you're almost guaranteed to get lost. The structures and buildings are cute and is definitely worth taking a stroll around. It's also a nice respite from the condensation found in La Rambla.

Unmissable. What a lot of culture, history and art all in the same place. visit the city museum and get the ticket that is included for other attractions. visit the Cathedral and ladies have a scarf in your bag for your shoulders and gents no shorts so you can get in.Barcelona just flips you over, brimming with history, culture and art and the SHOPPING.
Facinating Barcelona. This part of Barcelona has an amazing history, from the Romans to the Franco era, lots to see. I suggest a walking tour of this area.
Great place. Great shops and restaurants, romantic small streets, museums, cathedrals an more...
Impressive Old Town. My favorite neighborhood in Barcelona was the Gothic Quarter. Walking around the neighborhood one feels as if he or she is taken back in time!
Nice gothic tour. Great architecthure. Alot to see. Better to do it on foot.

Fun to explore. Stayed here for 3 nights and loved being right in the heart of this maze of narrow cobblestone streets. We would go out walking, get lost, find new places, and always find our way back to the hotel. such great little bars, cafes, a homemade churro shop (yum), and shops, shops, and more shops, not to mention the architecture, old Roman graves . Loved exploring and being so close to La Rambla.
Take some time to explore this area. Beautifulo buildings, people and food in this section of town!!

Best area. We spent most of our time wandering the area, eating and enjoying the nightlife.Saturday night the whole area is full of people, very lively! There are many young people (students) hanging out on the steps drinking beer. I found a very cool little bar (funky) and had a blast. I did make the mistake of passing a bar or restaurant and trying to find it again....very tricky at night. Some of the museums and historial building s are open until 1am.Both men and women dress casually during the evenings and good walking shoes are a must. I feel that the gothic area truely comes to life at night and getting lost is simply amazing!
Pretty cool looking architecture. Didn't see a whole lot there but the stuff that I did see was pretty cool.

Wonderful medieval buildings and great shopping. You can wander for hours here and never tire of it. There are outstanding little shops everywhere. Definitely see the Picasso Museum, great for his early years in the Catalan region.

Average. Wasn't my favorite experience in Barcelona. Tourist trappy feel. Walk through this on your way to La Barceloneta or the Park (can't remember the name but the one with the zoo) --- but don't make it your destination. And really don't go out of your way cuz it feels like there's one of "these" in every large metropolitan city.
Great place!. Love this area of Barcelona. After the cathedral, walking around the Gothic quarter stop by the Barcelona City museum. Will get an overview of the birth of this great city.
Walking tour. As in most cities the old town is great and fun to walk... much to see and enjoy....small streets provide shade from the hot sun...
This is where to stay.. It was our first visit to Barcelona and we researched where was the most effective area to base our stay. Everything is within a reasonable walking distance.
Spent most of our time here. Such a nice place to wander around. The architecture is amazing and loads of tapas bars to stop and rest. Close to La Rambla and easy to get around. Lots to see.
Go after 16.00 hours. Nothing realy happening in the morning here, good if you want to enjoy the small streets without the thousands of toerists that come out at night.
Quaint part of barcelona. Small streets, alleys restaurants and shops. A great walking area with lots of history and old architecture.
Awesome. I considered this the best part of Barcelona. Very quaint streets to meander thorugh. Easy to stop at one of the many bars or resturants ofr a beer or coffee.

Crowded yet interesting. The crowds were really overwhelming in the afternoon/evening. First thing in the morning was a much nicer time to go as fewer people were out & about. In the early morning I was able to get several photos of "points of interest" without people or with very few & the light was fabulous on the old architecture. The little alleyways were much more navigable at that hour also, though the hustle and bustle of the afternoon/evening has a draw all it's own. The roman walls & aqueducts are amazing given the age, highly recommend seeing.Shops in the area present standard kitschy souvenirs, many made in China etc. The market off Ramblas is pretty awesome & a good spot to grab some food.
Gothic Barca. We loved the architecture and the way stores and residences were all integrated. So beautiful.
Just okay. The old streets are okay. Extemely touristy and no so different from other old towns in Europe.

It's a MAZE!!!!. You must visit this area of town and get lost in the maze like alleys filled with shops and restaurants. We got lost several times revisiting the area, but gladly stumbled upon something new places we had not yet discovered.

Non Stop Surprises. Have a walk around the gothic quarter and literally get lost. Yes, the alleys and lanes are a labyrinth of fun. Art galleries, quaint fashion boutiques and one off eating places to die for.
Brilliant streets and squares to walk around. On every turn there is something new. Missed the Picasso museum as ran out of time. Love the buildings, streets, restaurants and shops.

Car driver. We drove to Barcelona from the UK and used the car to get about in the city, there are plenty of car parks and it is easy to drive around, We parked right next to the barri gotic area for 2.70 euro per hour.The Barri Gotic is the best part of Barcelona and is a must if you are in Barcelona, remember you need your shoulders covered to get in to the cathedral, Lots of restaurants but don't get ripped off going to the fancy looking ones, we had seafood paella with drinks for two for 27 euro and it was excellent.
Cosy and busy. the busiest area of Barcelona by far. Very characteristic with good shopping and plenty of bars and restaurants.

needed a guide. It was okay. I think to fully appreciate it, we needed a guide to tell us more about the history of the area. I had read a little about the places we visited but after a while it got a little boring.
Favorite part of Barcelona!. Beautiful architecture. Fun little shops. Just get lost there. Ah! Best ice cream I ever had: Gorgonzola gelato.
old world charm. waik around and enjoy a feast for your eyes and apprecian how well things stand the test of time

Be ready to Walk. You must walk and wonder all the little streets. Take a coupld of days to do this because you need time in between to stop at one of the restaurants to eat.Great stores all around. Dont shop to much around, prices don't change dramatically, if you like soemthing make sure to buy it and ask for discounts, they will give them to you, specially at night time when stores are about to close
Amazing arquitecture. It was fascinating to see a historical and well conserve monument like the gothic quarter.we love ot
have fun and get lost. the alleyways and streets are charming by day and even better in the evenings- wonderful cafes, restaurants and bars line the way
Classic spanish architecture. Beautiful streets, lots of interesting places and loads of restaurants. We stayed in the heart of the gothic quarter and wouldnt want to stay anywhere else.

Wander (put take a map with you). We had fun wandering the Gothic Quarter - the first night we got a bit lost (hence the recommendation of the map) and weren't quite sure where we were headed (but that can be some of the fun). The second day, map in hand, we were more deliberate in our wanderings. Both days we really enjoyed this picturesque area of the city. We found a great cafe, too, in Placa Reial, and quenched our thirst with a great pitcher of sangria....
Old time walking. Such a lovely area. Eating lunch in one of the squares is a must. Local acts perform in front of you and the food is not overpriced as in London to get good locations.
Beautiful place to visit.. The scenery, surroundings and stunning architecture is something that can easily make you lose track of time and wander admiringly through the alleys.

Photo OPs. We went through this area with a guide and then went back later. There are a lot of great photo ops in this area. I went early in the morning and saw a lot of cool places without a lot of tourists.

Great Walking Tour. Give yourself a half a day to wonder through the Barri Gotic and make sure you have a map with you because it is very easy to get turned around. The Quarter is filled with many surpise shops and restaurants as well as historical churches and museums.
Narrow streets of shops and restaurants. You can find here interesting shops and have a nice walk when you are tired from the crouds.

Worth exploring. Nice to wander around the narrow streets in the oldest part of the city. Many interesting attractions such as the town hall, Palau de la Generalitat, a Roman foum dated from 27BC etc..
Don't miss it. Just wandering through the streets and alleys you can lose hours and hours. Beautiful.

famous. famous old quarter of Barcelona ... ancient streets full breath of the old days ... magical hidden corners of restaurants, clubs, various shops .... cathedral, street fountains, cafes and especially wonderful atmosphere that's Barri Gotic

Beautiful. this was my favourite area of barcelona for architecture,style and good food,cafes,wine bars its so funky its just got a great exciting buzz about it and there is a photo on every corner its lovely
Old charm. A good mixture of very old buildings and boutique shops
Gotic Mood. Barrio Gotico is one of the best places in Barcelona with churches, street musicians and a lot of fun without having to pay a penny. Enjoy the sites and street fun!

Great area to wander around. We loved walking through the winding narrow streets. Found many charming shops and cute restaurants. Nice quiet area compared to Las Ramblas...it was nice to get away from the crowds and wander about. We did not feel that it was a dangerous area but we kept our purses held tightly as we did throughout Barcelona.

touristy, but still fun to walk around. Like all tourist centers, every building is a store selling something, Still there is enough to see such as the old buildings themselves, a picturesque well and the Cathedral.
nice area. lovely area to walk around. will chance upon some lovely souvenier shops as well.
Loved it. Fun to wonder around and discover all that the Barri Gotic has from restaurants to stores to bars. Good place to meet the locals..

Get lost in the small streets of the Barrio. It is nice to walk around and get almost lost in the small streets of the barrio gotico in Barcelona. Keep your nose up, and look at the beautifull architectures of the building.

Lively colourful neighbourhood. Loved this place. Just walking about through the narrow street and alleyways. Lots of interesting art galleries, lot's of little colourful shops, and the Jewish Quarter was very interesting
A great walk around. Visit the Gothic Quarter and prepared and happy to get a little lost. It is a nice walk, one you want to take when you have time.

one of my favorites. I enjoyed the quaintness of the Barri Gotic neighborhood. The cafes and shops were nice and small. It really feels "0ld world". There are so many gelato and ice cream shops here that it was hard to choose! Just wandering around looking at the buildings was amazing in itself.
Side Streets Side Streets. Get off the main drag - which is like a suburban shopping mall with better architecture, and head to the side streets. Tons of great boutiques and little hidden gems.

old town / beware of pickpockets. it's a tourist area with many hostals and restaurants.
but beware of pickpockets, it's a slum!!!
Atmospheric. The narrow streets around La Seu haven't changed for centuries. Lots of small cafes, shops and artists studios. Antiques shops, studios and artisan boutiques.

Misrepresented and dangerous. While the shops and restaurants are charming, this quarter is actually mostly 19th century neo-Gothic (including the cathedral). You can still have a pleasant enough afternoon wandering around it. BUT, short of padlocking your belongings to your torso, there's no way of keeping your bags safe here! Don't listen to guidebooks that say the Ramblas is the most dangerous area for pickpockets and bag-snatchers - it's also this area, and pretty much everywhere else in Barcelona too! I've traveled and lived in major cities for over a decade and have excellent street smarts. This is the only place I've EVER had anything stolen. My purse was literally snatched right out from under my feet at a quiet indoor restaurant with CCTV surveillance - even if you take all reasonable precautions, the professional bag-snatchers here can still get your things! Police were sympathetic but essentially have no hope of catching the person or retrieving any of my belongings at all. If you're even thinking of coming to Barcelona, don't bring anything you value at all, and make sure your insurance is up to date and covers theft while traveling (travel insurance won't do this, make sure your home or renters' insurace does)
Walking tour. Inside the itinerary of our private tour we were able to do a walking tour at the Gothic Quarter. This district is so charming and you can feel the atmosphere of Medieval times

Scenic Medieval Quarter. This is my favorite area of Barcelona. Lots of narrow medieval streets, interesting shops, historic buildings, wonderful architecture. There are also many nice restaurants. What a fascinating place.
Take a guided tour. I used HI THIS IS BARCELONA and got so much more out of their walking tour than if I had gone on my own. So much to see.
Fun stroll. Take a nice leisurely stroll through the barrio. Meet the people. Fun!
Fascinating area to explore. Great area to walk around, eat and shop. Many little alleys and squares to explore.

Narrow streets and history. There is not really a lot to say! It's the medieval part of Barcelona with parts of it going back to the Romans. You HAVE to see the Gothic Cathedral, but after then it is just about wandering down the tiny little streets - looking upwards to see things. Probably the best way is to take one of the walking tours. I just like to go in the old cafes and bars and to see the old walls and wonder "what did they use this for?" It's quite good as occassionally they have plaques on the wall telling you about the history of what you have visited. The best way to visit the Gothic Quarter is simply to keep wandering down all the tiniest and narrowest streets. Don't worry - you cannot get lost. SImply ask for "Las Ramblas" and you will be there in 100 yards. We called in a 'locals cafe' three times eating the roast chicken, sausages and tapas. It was briliiant.

Wonderful place. Well worth a visit - the architecture is outstanding and the Gothic Catherdral is truely stunning - well worth a visit. Small queues to get in and no entrance fees for the Gothic Cathedral.
Not to be missed. An excellent place to visit whilst in Barcelona. It has it all. Amazing architecture, excellent atmosphere and good Tapas places.

Well worth a wander through.. Not sure why this area gets quite so much hype, it was okay and well worth a wander. The best thing is that it's pedestrianised and you can get away from all the traffic.

Endless narrow streets to explore. I thoroughly enjoyed visiting the Gothic Quarter and found myself returning a number of times in both the daytime and evenings. There are endless narrow and winding streets to explore, full of boutique shops, quaint bars and restaurants. If you are a keen photographer you will find a number of brilliant opportunities for snapping the beautiful architecture that surrounds the area.

Wonderful place to get lost in. Spent many hours walking around, as well as getting a walking tour from the information office. Splendid part of Barcelona for its architecture and many small streets to lose one self in

Go for a wander in the evening.... The Gothic Quarter is well worth a visit when in Barcelona - the maze of little lanes and streets is filled with interesting architecture, tapas bars and people out enjoying themselves, with the locals out on their balconies watching the world go by down below
dont miss. narrow streets off the Ramla . Lots of tourist and artish shops . Very intersting.
Perfect for shopping and cava crawls. Lots of shoe stores and little boutiques. Loved wandering around and getting lost in this beautiful neighborhood.
Stay here for the best night life. We stayed here in an Air B & B apartment and it was just magic. Best area to stay for restaurants, bars and the beach and perfectly safe!
City's melting pot. Nice old part of the city. Easy to get around, with lots of hidden treasures. Cafes and restaurants, nice little hotels and some of the cities most ancient monuments.
Nice. Must visit for tourists..The architecture is amazing
An area which calls you back time after time. On our first visit many years ago this was the first area we called at. We always re-visit because it is so atmospheric
everybody goes Gothic. Perfect place with its tapas bars, restaurants, squares. Always full of life.

Worth the Paseo and Some Tasty Tapas. Barri Gotic offers a walk back into the Barcelona of the Golden Age--set aside a couple of hours to let yourself get lost in the narrow streets. There is plenty of kitsch tourist shopping along the way, but also plenty of Spanish history and cafes with delicious jamon and cafe con leche. Barri Gotic is a great way to get acquainted with the city--consider starting your visit here. See where the cobblestones take you, and take in centuries of Barcelona's history.

Barcelona Tourist Destination. The Gothic quarter is the old town area which ia mixture of everyday stores, quaint little shops and flat out tourist traps.It i worth a visit though. We could not drag our teenagers out of all the specialty shops. There also a fair amount of great antique stores.
Best location for your hotel. This is the best place to pick your hotel. Nice central location, full of restaurant and nice atmosphere.

Lots of alleyways. This is one part of Barcelona which you should see. Lots of good restaurants and alleyways to explore and it is easily accessible to most parts of Barcelona - we stayed in the Port area and was an easy walk from our hotel.
Charming. Charming place to visit. Lots of little details around, and if you're lucky, you'll encounter live street performers.

Just like you imagined it.... This is that centuries-old neighborhood of narrow, winding streets that just oozes history. Read over my shoulder as I walk it...http://antoniorambles.com/2012/06/24/barcelona-beckons/
One of the gems of Barcelona. One of the most picturesque places in Barcelona filled with unique shops and restaurants. Definitely one of my favorite things in Barcelona.
Good. Its a nice feel with lots of interesting architecture around every corner and a great place to wander & explore.
very impressive. convenient for walks, medieval spirit, impressive architecture
don't miss this. so fascinating. many little alleys and passageways to explore.

Good to see. As some have said mainly architecturally great but equally after a while it does become just another combination of narrow graffiti strewn streets with a range of shops, bars restaurants and characters.

Lovely area. A wander through the Barri Gotic on a hot afternoon in June was wonderful, surprising little squares, unexpected shops, beautiful balconies and a little respite from the bright sunshine. Even if you've only an hour to spare it's a lot more interesting than simply wandering along Las Ramblas. Don't miss it!
Amazing. The best place to book a hotel in Barcelona. Every corner some amazingly beautifil building
Walking around the Barri Gottic. Kudos to the Barcelona municipality for the excellent blue signs that are up and down Rambla Boulevard was very easy to access the Barri Gottic and other quarters.
Loved it. I could walk through those streets endlessly; it's a must if you go to Barcelona
Gothic area. tons of tourists...lots of young people...narrow streets

Dress conservatively. If you want to visit the cathedral you must be wearing over the knee clothing or they'll not allow you in. I was actually expecting more buildings around the cathedral than i found.
intriguing medieval neighborhood. Fun to walk around despite crowds of tourists. Many types of attractions: churches, houses, museums, restaurants.
Great place to get lost. Wander the alleys and find the tapas bars. A wide variety of food and drink in small bars.

Beautifully Quaint!. Lovely area. Fantastic architecture - we spent as much time looking up at the rooftops as down! Very historic buildings, shady courtyards with fountains, labyrinthine narrow streets, interesting shops. Would love to return sometime.
going back in time. well worth the time. Very interesting. lot's of small winding streets between 500 to 800 year old buildings. even some from Roman times

hours of wandering. Lots of unique and lovely shops and restaurants in this area - so refreshing compared to most European cities. Not a H&M or Spar in sight! I happened upon a fabulous shop selling giant heads and clown gear. Some beautiful buildings and historic sights in the area. Definitely worth finding a free walking tour for to get a bit of info about the history.
Picasso Museum. Approx £10 each to go in. Ok if you like art. Gothic Quarter is great - very dark and little shops.
Another side of Barcelona. A great contrast to La Rambla, quirky streets and shops
A trip to history. A constrast to the temporary and fast moving city, Gotic area has a retro atmosphere
Fav part of Barcelona. Loved the cobble streets and lilttle shops around it.

One of Barcelona's best sights. Love wandering around here. Get lost and find yourself in a sudden jewel of a plaza. Try to visit early in the week, before the weekend crowds. Also, June is better than July/August in terms of crowds

History unfolding in front of you. Cannot in any way convey the wonderful experience that is to roam freely the streets of the Barri Gotic. Go to tourist office at Plaça Jaume I and register for one of the tours of this medieval hood and then feel free to just wander on your own. We had a young catalan as a guide that plugged anti-clerical and anti-fascist opinions at every turn (very welcomed by me.) A young catalan that was very informative though had a very poor sense of humor (though he thought he had a good one) and was very ignorant of English culture and had some curious social opinions that seemed like Tea Party sound bites. A very curious mixture of old fashioned Spanish Civil War leftist and rightist, but with good, useful knowledge of the Barri Gotic.

Fun spot. This is a fun spot to visit, very old buildings, and a beautiful old town square. Beautiful cathedrall in the middle of the square--ladies, you cannot wear short skirts or have uncovered shoulders in the cathedral, they will not let you in. Fun spot, right near the Rambla. Takes 45 minutes to see everything in the Quarter, then on to the Rambla.

Good but overrated. From travel books and research I expected the Gothic quarter to be more Quaint and have more unusual boutique stores and offerings. However it consisted mainly of high street stores and some "boutique" stores which mainly sold whatever they wanted. All the restaurants were rather expensive and didnt look very inviting. However It was good to see the old buildings and to get lost wondering around the streets.
Very nice. Very lovely area with lots to do and see. Highly recommended.
Very nice. we were on the gothic quater and we liked the buildings, whom were very pretty, and we visited in the resturants. we wished that they had more unique places, not just Tapas and such.
Best place in Barcellona to stay. Beautiful, small streets and gorgeous churches. Sit in a cafe's window seat, have a pitcher of sangria and watch the nightlife after a soccer game.

A feast architecturally and a lively, inspiring atmosphere. We came upon Castellers building their human towers in the Place Jaume. It was amazing. We also watched the dancers of the Sardana in front of the Gothic Cathedral. So much fun.
Fun area. I found a great Jazz club called Harlem Jazz Club. Saw an excellent group playing cuban music called Habana Con Kola
A real maze. A maze of old alley ways and older buildings. Interesting feel of a time gone by.

The streets of Barcelona. The Gothic Quarter of Barcelona, like the old sections of Rome, London, Paris and New York is a tangle of tight little streets that lead to beautiful old buildings, churches, museums and tee-shirt stores. It is a must to walk here and admire the stones themselves with gargoyles and many architectural touches. During the warm weather there is a particular odor that reminds you of centuries of human habitation.Basically, you should spend an afternoon here to get a feel for the city before you move on to the more uptown venues and, of course the Gaudi buildings.
So much fun! Go again and again. Everything...the small gift shops, cycling, flowers in the balconies and total ambiance

wonderful old buildings. What a different kind of art you can find here, all buidlings are so nicely decorated, special windows. The streets are really small, lovely to walk there. You can find small shops, restaurants, bars ..

the past. wonderful buildings ..great atmosphere ..loved the glimpses of
days gone by..every turning was different
Our hotel was located in this quarter. Near to beach, port vell, ramblas, plaza catalunya
Worth the visit. a complete different view of barcelona the old part of city is very nice little streets shops worth the visit
a little disappointed. From previous photos i have seen of the gargoyles on the buildingings, so i thought the architecture would be amazing and i was left a little disappointed.
Lots of history.... Cobblestones, architecture and sunny days...who could ask for a better walking tour!

Amazing walk through the historic lanes. Gothic Quarter of Barri Gothic is a locality in Barcelona that contains buildings and houses which were built many centuries ago. This place is really good. The lanes are narrow and worth a walk. Its easy to enter this area after visiting the Gothic church or you can easily access from any lanes connecting La Ramblas street. This place has many shops and restaurants and tapas bars too. You will find tourists everywhere. Come here in the early evenings and leave this place after its dark. Its really nice.
Stroll around at day and night and see what you find. Must see. Just walk around and see what you find. Amazing atmosphere and remember to stop and look up every now and then.

Beautiful, old, a bit smelly!. Wow, you can really get lost for hours in the Gothic Quarter! Picture perfect cobblestone alleyways, corner shops selling all sorts of nic nacs, and encounters with beautiful churches. The only downside is it can be very busy (so hold onto your stuff) and, like some other parts of Barcelona, it doesn't smell the best at times!
Food, drinks, nightlife. Adagio Hotel is situated in this area, so we couldn't be more pleased! Nice cosy restaurants and bars, splendid nightlife.... perfect hide-out!

stunning buildings. watch your belongings ,pick pockets rife ..A must is the tour as Barcelona huge to walk in 30 degree heat .. Eat away from Rambla's as expensive ..The la Fonda restaurant on Barri Gothic is lovely and reasonable lunch time head for San Joseph market off Rambla's ,they sell bowls of fruit for 2 euros ,delicious
Really cool neighbourhood. Beautiful streets, cool shops and restaurants make this area a no-brainer to visit when in Barcelona. The nightlife around is really fun and the buildings are charming.
Quaint. Lots of nice little restaurants. Felt very safe even late at night. Guard your valuable though at all times.
Barri Gotic Back-Streets. Brilliant maze of shops, bars, cafes, markets, restaurants, cultural centres, museums, churches. Do not go on a Sunday as most are closed.
Picasso Museum. Lovely to walk around and visit Picasso museum. Make sure you allow an hour or more to visit the museum.
Great neighborhood. Get lost in the windy narrow streets, find a tapas bar, soak up Barcelona
A must see. If you go with the sightseeing busses, don't miss this stop. The whole area is beautiful and somehow feels mysterious. nice place to walk around have an ice cream or coffee.

go to the Born Quarter instead. Sure it's nice to walk around the old streets of Barcelona. But you're doing this with many many many other tourists all trying to take a picture of the same thing. I much prefered the Born Quater: more alive, same narrow old streets and gorgeous Santa Maria del Mar church.
Excellent walking section. Lots of fun to wonder and explore, plenty of shops and restaurants, beautiful old buildings.
Fun Place to Get Lost. My husband and I enjoyed just wandering the streets and getting lost. It is so beautiful.
restaurants. many fine restaurants beneath the arches to sample
Just wander. Wonderful little streets/lanes that just meander. Walk around and get lost and find some wonderful cafes and little squares in which to sit and watch the world go by.
TRANSPORT YOURSELF!!. beautiful .... surrounded by bars, stores, plazas, and full of life .. little streets to get yourself lost in enchanting mood!!

Wander at your leisure. Get a map and have a look before you start walking, fab wee shops and different districts i.e. chinese shops/turkish sweet shops! Have a wander and you will have a great time oh and stop for lots of little breaks for drinks etc!
To Barcelona from Shanghai. nice walk tour in the small streets, to discover nice corners to rest and continue the adventure....
Wonderful culture. A maze of windy little streets with a stunning sight just around each corner. Well worth an afternoon of wandering

Amazing. Everything you go to Barcelona for is right here in the Gothic Quarter. Excellent food, excellent eye candy. Great xocolate. Alleys, walking, music echoes throughout. Beautiful. Great shopping. I was completely ok with staying there and venturing out to Las Ramblas.

Lot's of fun. Pleasant getting "lost" in the maze of streets. Placa Real is a good location to eat. A handy tip: Put the leg of your chair in the strap of any handbag or camera bag under your chair. Scooter grab and snatches are not unusaual.
Lovely place. Great for a wander about. Lots of little streets and squares can be found in this area. Highly recommended
Interesting area - a must. narrow streets filled with buzzing life, small shops, restaurants and cafe's. the architecture is so impressive.

Don't miss this!. Actually there are parts of the city as you get lost which seem like they are all influenced by Gaudi. But this little stretch houses some of his best works. Definitely touristy and might include waiting at times, so maybe think of including it in a day tour of the city or something like that or maybe hire a guide, which helps skip the lines.
meandering in the shambles. great mix of old architecture, shops, restaurants and bars and very atmospheric

Did a free walking tour of this beautiful area. To say Barcelona is beautiful is an understatement, I did a free walking tour one morning with http://www.barcelonafreetours.com/gothic.html and our guide walked us through the entire quarter sharing history on most of the builidings and answering any questions we had. A really nice way to spend the morning and gain some general knowledge
Nice area, not that special though. I guess that i must be spoilt but i have seen many more areas like this, just like most of the old towns in southern europe, nice but nothing more than that.
Cute place to walk around. Very cute to walk around to do some shopping and/or get a quick drink or have tapas.

Fascinating-one could get lost. I didn't get pickpocket or hassled but I did get lost! Smells of urine all the time, especially in the narrower passages, but it was still totally worth it. We went 3 times to various sections in our 7 day trip and am sure we only saw a fraction of it.
Beautiful Streets. Such beautiful streets! Every corner was another ally-way you just had to walk down!!! Take your comfy shoes!!!

Charming walking tour of Gothic Quarter. We took a walking tour of the Gothic Quarter with Barcelona Day tours and had a fabulous time. When in Europe we like looking at the oldest areas and our guide was very knowledgable as well as being very nice.
beautiful architecture. beautiful architecture. you have to be there to see it.

mysterious streets open to heavenly plazas. walking every street is amazing, you can easily find a beautiful plaza end of a narrow street, good tapas restaurants and cafes on 'carrer de ferran', many shopping places on 'portal del Angel' and some more cheaper shops through 'carrer de la portaferrissa', street musicians is a plus to this beautiful neighbourhood

Impressive Old World Charm. Barcelona's Gothic Quarter is full of surprises... many little hidden alleyways, beautiful old world architecture etc. A terrific walkabout and a great way to spend a sunny afternoon. Highly recommended.
Gótic. an old Roman city with narrow roads and gothic archetecture. Awesome!

OK. OK. Worth a quick visit if you are in that area, but was not the highlight of my trip to Barcelona. There are some interesting shops . Most of the old town was demolished. A friend stayed in the gothic quarter and was disappointed in the older style hotels and noise. Parking is a big problem in his area too.
Free tour from Hotel Barcelona Catedral. Great Wednesday night tour of the quarter with legends and inside information about the history.

Wonderful People Watching. So many shops and wonderful places to watch people - strolling here was amazing - many hidden alcoves and courtyards. We felt completely safe at all times.
Many people stated problems with pickpockets, we took precautions and didn't have a single problem - Great place!!!

great neighborhood. our favorite neighborhood in barcelona. stayed at the W but spend most of our time here. great to walk during the day and take in the architecture, shop, eat, drink and people watch
Lovely. Very interesting and lovely area. I liked the arcticture of the buildings.

Great architecture. This is a fun area to wander the small streets after visiting the Picasso Museum or the Chocolate Museum. There are many tiny restaurants and shops that will distract and enchant you. Nice vibe.

Medieval Barcelona. Barcelona is a city of many faces. I loved the broad, tree-lined avenues in the Eixample. The Barri Gotic is medieval Barcelona and interesting in it's own right. Take some time after visiting the Picasso Museum to wander the winding cobblestone streets.
quaint streets for cafes and shopping. get to the roof top for a wonderful view of the city
Gothic quarter. A real find tucked away, wandering round the narrow streets, stopping at authentic bar for tapas - feels like the real Barcelona
Great place to wonder around. you can't miss this area on the one side of the Rambles.

I like old!!!!!. this was my 4th time to Barcelona and I always hop in the bus to see it all over again,
that is how much I like it.....
Be sure to see. Loved the church and the atmosphere. Many shops, some high end, but all in all a nice place to visit.
you do not need a tour for going through this area...it was great to walk around the gothic quarter.. Barcelona is expensive, but what a wonderful city.
A great maze of adventure. A wonderful place to stumble around and find interesting places and sites. Well worth a visit.
Give you self a little bit of religion!!!!. Visit the churchs and the litlle stores...no maps just follow you guts...and look up..LOLOLOL

Don't miss the Barri Gotic!. One of the most fascinating sections of the city ... you can walk the narrow streets and alleyways for hours and discover delights around every corner. Don't miss the Museu Picasso ... spectacular facility and great collection. The Barri can get a little dicey after dark, so pay attention to your surroundings, don't wander alone, and don't engage with the "friendly" street vendors who will approach you.
Gothic Laneways. Old laneways where people still live, shop, eat and get around. The pulse of Barcelona.
Must visit. Lovely location to stoll around, some quaint shop but also well known chains and of course good Tapa's bars.

Fascinating. Fun to wander around in and get lost in. This once was considered a somewhat dangerous area with muggers and low life, but it is not that way now -- although I would be careful against pickpockets.

The Real Barcelona. Easy to get lost, and difficult to see further than the street that you're on. But you wouldn't mind, because the sights that surround you are magnificent!
The architecture is fantastic, and you're surrounded as soon as you set foot in The Gothic Quarter, it's worth getting lost just to find those treasures hidden between the winding streets.
Worth the time to wander round. Quaint narrow streets with lots of interesting shops, squares and buildings.

A walk back in time.. If you visit Barcelona then this is a must. It is truly amazing! The maze of lanes and alleys seems almost endless and it feels like each step takes you further back in time. It is also so large that it is easy to find quiet areas where you can just let your imagination go. Cities and large areas like this are always very hard to review and describe simply because there is so much and each persons perception is different but I would heartily recommend going for a leisurely walk around here just exploring. It's hard to take it all in, there is so much going on above as well as below and at eye level. Just remember to look down now and then or you'll be tripping over the cobbles!
Great to wander around. This was one of our favorite areas to just wander around. A little less crowded, and almost everywhere you turn is a great old cathedral or interesting building.
Hotel was located there.. The Hotel was located close to this area and it was great strolling and exploring

Some Place to See. Amazing architecture , history. Simple great just walking the area ,always something interesting . We happened upon The Folklorica Catalonian dance mid day at the plaza at Barcelona Cathedral .Every street of this place is special . I was here 1961 ,age 18 on leave from Stuttgart Germany, found the street (Avinyo) where we stayed , good to see it again

Great 2 hour walking Tour. We had a great English-speaking guide, Danny. Kept our tour lively and light. Very interesting and simple facts about the places in the Gothic Quarter. A good, 2 hour, walking tour- worth the money and the time spent.
Can't get enough. We love this area of Barcelona and would not stay anywhere else. It can be loud and sleep will be compromised, but worth it!

what spain should be. when you think of spain, small alleys and spanish architecture comes to mind. That is the Gothic Quarter, small churches, squares, boutiques and flower shops. Lots of Gaudi buildings and sculptures.

History all around.. Walking the old streets and alleys which will suddenly open out into a large square containing a church can't be beaten.
Spoilt by the fact that you have to be constantly aware of the thieves and pickpockets which are all over Barcelona.
Beautiful. every lane way and every building tells a story. you can lost in this maze of history. some good shopping - great little stores that carry unique items and clothing.
so much history. brilliant area to stay and visit...lots of little alley way and eating places..easy to get around not to hilly...loved it
Lovely restaurants. Good location for shops and restaurants that are reasonably priced.
