Different. Very nice quarter I enjoyed very much. A place to go and have a nice dinner in one of the many little restaurants.

History and charm. Be sure to take a tour!
I have never before stood in one spot and been able to see two centuries of architecture in a 360 degree view like you can in Barcelona. Well preserved, easy access and helpful staff.
great place to walk around. easy to get lost in this area without a map, but worth a visit, many things to see, the cathedral a must see, go up on the roof for some spectacular sights.
Very picturesque. It is great to wander around this district. Each corner will suprise you with a new look.
Good. We were lucky to have nice weather to appreciate the gothic architecture

Just keep wandering. Fantastic bars and restaurants down all these little alleyways my advice would be if you think its the wrong way go down it as there are some amazing places of the main routes. Like all of Barcelona graffiti spoils parts.
Great to Wander Around. Stay in the Barri Gotic. Large range of eateries of very good quality. Easy to visit major and minor sites.
Old city rocks!. A fantastic cataclysm of old buildings, narrow cobblestone streets, tiny shops, great eating caves. A must do walking adventure!
Beautiful place. Love it....Love shops and people are very friendely.

Nice place to just wonder around.. A lovely section of Barcelona with plenty of shops, tapas, bars placa's etc. Great spot for photograpy and a look around at the spanish style streets/buildings in the area. I can imagine if you get a walking tour or something you will get a intresting insight to the history/religion of the area - which would only enhance the experience.
lovely relaxing. Take time here browsing little shops stop have coffee enjoy

Interesting and atmospheric. The ancient parts of Barcelona are not what most people come here for but it should certainly not be ignored. There are some wonderful streets to explore with great cafes, bars and shops and if your in the mood for some learning there's some fascinating history too!
Visit Before Sunrise. To enjoy the beauty of the streets visit just befire sunrise.
Interesting narrow streets. Lots of restaurants mixed in with the older buildings. Too many shops selling strange stuff for FCB.
Best part of Barcelona. Beautiful spiralling streets, bustling and vibrant but not noisy, restaurants were always safe bets, lots of Tibtan and Indonesian wares being sold which were all gorgeous

Wonder little streets with nice cafes & shops!. The Gothic Quarter is the real Barcelona. Narrow little streets, great wee cafes where you can stop of for a nice coffee. Lovely shops with quirky stuff. Certainly this is the old world side of the city. I dont think anyone would not enjoy walking around it

Stumbled upon this treasure!. i somehome managed to stuble upon the Gothic Quarter without realising, it's very easy to get happily lost in the maze of wonderful streets in the city!
Definately worth wandering around the cathedral, it's magical
Great buildings.. I love walking through the streets and just looking up at all the different buildings, such great architechture.
Don't miss!. Lovely area to visit - quaint sidestreets and lovely little shops, bars and restaurants. Worth going on a guided walk to learn of the history of this area.

Best place to shop and for atmosphere!. The Gothic Quarter is my favourite part of Barcelona to shop, eat and people watch. There is always something happening here. Concerts, street artists, antique markets and outdoor activities. You will find all manner of boutiques and food stores here. Cosy little tapas bars, cute and unique souvenir shops, gourmet chocolate stores and even stores that sell all types of sausages, venison and cured meats from local areas. If local produce is what you are searching for you can´t beat the mysterious alleyways of the Gothic Quarter. And after you have shopped til you drop, sink yourself into a seat, grab yourself a glass of Cava, Sangria or San Miguel at one of the many cool little bars, and watch the world go by.

Stunning. I was not one for histroy but after my visit to this area, I have been converted. The alleys and passages are a treasure trove of all kinds of things to discover. Shops, galleries, bars, lounges, shops, churches, little squares, shops and more churches are just some of the delights. I loved it!!

Ola Barcelona. This is an amazing place, its alive, its buzzing with activity the streets and laneways are just wonderful old and gothic sometimes scary and sometimes wonderous but always warm and inviting, wonderful cafes and bars atmosphere all around.
The heart of the city. Very good atmosphere plenty going on with all the history and a surprise round every corner
spend some time browsing round. lots to take in - the cathedral, interesting shops, good tapas bars and restaurants

The place to eat and relax. Lots of narrow streets with so much to see - dont forget to look up! There is so much to see. A great place to wander, take Arty Photos and enjoy tapas and people watch. Very Safe feel to the place.
stunning arcitecture. so much to see lots of interesting nooks and crannys intresting buildings lots of little museums & interesting shops
It is a must see. It is touristy but beautiful. It is neighborhood to sit down and enjoy a full day. Look for a nice cozy restaurant and have some wine.

EXCELLENT AND MORE. By far one of the most incredible areas in Europe ,almost completely closed to traffic ,one hundred small pedestrian passages,lined with historic buildings, shops,and lovely places to shop.Centered by the great CATEDRAL, palaces and museums, with interesting and beautiful squares .A small jewish Sinagogue ,one of the oldest in Europe hidden in a narrow street in the call (old jewish section )of ancient Barcelona.A great place to ease your mind while you walk through this interesting historic area. ROMANTIC EXPERIENCE .
Fabulous area of Barcelona.. Great little streets made for walking and shopping. Safe and incredibly charming!

Picturesque. Beautiful part of Barcelona. The buildings are gorgeous with lovely winding streets and lots of picturesque squares, cathedrals and churches. Shops are fab, restaurants are atmospheric and delightful and there's also a great market. We were even lucky enough to stumble across a band in the middle of Placa de Sant Jaume on the way back from dinner. Part of Primavera Sound, the music festival, playing salsa music and getting the crowd dancing. An authentic Spanish experience, we felt so delighted to have come across it. Make sure your camera is fully charged as you'll stop every 5 minutes for pictures. Well worth walking down all the little side alleys, even if they look questionable. Make sure you are covered if visiting churches as you won't be allowed in wearing anything sleeveless.
Get Lost in the Maze. Loved just walking in the narrow alleys, and discovering all sorts of interesting shops. A must do in Barcelona!
Great Place to while away the day. Lots of lovely little squares, coffee shops and much more. Easy to spend a day here doing nothing!
A beautiful work. We had a walking tour with a guide who was both interesting and very motivated who knew a lot about the area. It was a memorable event.
Great atmosphere. Loads of buskers adding a fab sound track and entertainment
Surprises around every corner. Get a good map or a tour guide to explore this historic, lively slice of Barcelona. Abounds with great restaurants, shops and entertainment--even in unexpected places.
comfy. lots of nice tapas restaurants just a few min off the ramble. See the cathedral and the maria church
Windy, charming streets...don't miss it!. Great little squares and shops hidden among the ancient windy streets...do not leave Barcelona without spending at least a morning or afternoon here.
Cosy quarters. Dont miss this area, with tons of pittoresque squares and small alleys, cathedrals and lots of nice shops. Just off La Rambla.
the old town. for a good walk around the old streets for culture, this is the area to go

nice just for a strawl. not bad for morning walk but a lot of souvenir shops as usual and beware of pickpockets. Also if you go walking later in the afternoon you tend to feel less at ease in the small streets.
Historic yet captivating. Walk through these streets and get lost in the narrow roads and paths while enjoying something to eat or drink and shopping at the local shops.

Lost and Found. Barri Gotic turned out to be exactly how it was not described in the travel books...the travel books dont do justice to the amount of life this zone has, the pulsating energy and the calming antiquity - a paradox- that reveals as much as it hides...a beautiful sector, worth exploring every inch...
You need to see. Different but beautiful ,we loved it ,can't miss that one when in Barcelona
THE PLACE to hang out at night. El Polaroid, El Mariachi, Petra...Lots of great little spots to have a drink with the locals and live the true Barcelona night life

Beautiful, safe, lively. Fantastic churches, remnants of the city wall, narrow streets and loads of fine buildings, this is an architectural gem. Add the great number of bars and cafés, and you can lose yourself in here for the day. Of course, it gets a little bit touristy at times, but what do you expect?
Forget the map - just wander around. So much to see all packed into a small space. The architecture is terrific, with plenty of small cafes and bars to slake your thirst or grab a bite to eat

Step Back In Time In The Gothic Quarter. Travelling with teenagers, seeing the architecture of Barcelona and had to include a walking English tour of the Barri Gotic. You can get a tour by walking La Rambla street, we turned off right by the Macdonalds sign and within minutes were by the Tourist Info Office were we bought tickets for the tour that morning. Tour guide gave us headsets so we could always hear her explanations etc. It's a good way to see a part of Barcelona and learn a little about the history that you might otherwise miss on your own. You can even do the Cathedral after the tour as it is located in the area and it will be easy enough to find on your own. Lots of little shops to poke into and plenty of eating places, including a delicious Gellato ice cream after a hot day. If you have 3 or more days in Barcelona this is worth doing and let's you step back in time.

Great walk . If u feel the need to see and feel the history you should walk through the Gothic streets! Apart from the beautiful buildings you can stumble on great small boutiques that sell hand made stuff from magnets to chlotes and shoes! Unic stuff that you won't find on the famos "la Ramblas"
beautiful. I loved the little winding streets and the feeling of being completely immersed in wonderful, gothic buildings.It is easy to get lost here, but you know what, it's all part of the fun!
Great place to roam. Great place to roam and wander into the medieval narrow lanes
Just beautiful!. Don't miss it while being in barna! Totally worth it!

Lots of atmosphere. Despite all the tacky souvenir shops there is a surprising amount of atmosphere and history here. It really is a nice place to stroll and pass the time. I like this part of BCN enormously. I don't know what people expect of it but if you wish to see an old historic neighborhood with plenty of surprising court yards with restaurants and shops this is a great place to hang out.

Good for a short ramble. Although the Gothic Quarter is considered a 'must-see' site in all of the guidebooks, there really isn't much to see after you've wandered down one street after another. A few shops crop up here and there, along with the ubiquitous coffee/pastry shops (the staff were always very friendly at these shops, so feel free to drop in anywhere for a break). For a better idea of how the average Barcelonians live, head to the neighborhoods north of the Avenue Diaganol or closer to the university & museums.
a must!. we made sure this was one of our first visits.Beautiful area and we found a lovely lil eatery with the best pealla (excuse the spelling) we've ever had.

Nice walk. The area dates back to medieval times, although the fundation is Roman, beside the cathedral and Museo Mares, there are streets and secret corners, one street is mainly antique shops, others have boutiques or cafes and souvenir shops, others are just residential, a pleasant walk and potentially good shopping
Lots to See & Do. Many things in this city to catch your eye. Everything from the ugly architecture to the mimes, markets and even the attractive modern buildings and bridges.
Get Lost. A great place to get lost in for a couple of hours and find little gems of shops, cafes, great architecture and resaurants.
loved this area. great little streets, shopping and wonderful little tapas restaurants. get lost in the area!

Great architecture and crowds. The historical architecture in Barri Gotic is a must see. It provides a glimpse of life in days gone bye. The summer crowds on the narrow streets are challenging and detract from the experience. And there are way too many shops selling the same things for the same price.
Very intersting.. If you like the Latin Quarter in Paris, you will love Barri Gothic. I can wander thru here for hours. And did.
An excellent walk!. Full of charming stores, it's beautiful and very interesting!
Just wandering around. This is the 2nd time I have been to the Gothic Quarter and still love it. At every corner there is something different to experience.

history and bohemia. I would suggest anybody to start getting to know the city by wandering around the Gothic Quarter. You`ll also find some rests of the Roman city and two or three streets were the old Jewish neighborhood used to be. Get lost and walk, but try not to lose wonderful squares such as Plaça Sant Felip Neri, Plaça del Rei, Plaça Sant Jaume, Plaça Sant Miquel, Plaça Reial, Plaça George Orwell...Just one concrete suggestion/petition: watch after your belongings... there are many pick-pockets around... Never leave your purse or backpack on your chair or on the floor if you're sitting in a restaurant or a cafe and try not to be too distracted when walking around (just let people know that you're aware of what's around you...)
Great part of Barcelona. just love it ,the shops,the bars,everything .It great day our night .Love the sightseeing and the history and just stopping off in one of the little bars for vino.
Get lost. Great to wander around down the narrow streets and be surprised by what's around the corner.

Most interesting District. Real, oldschool barcelona can be found here in the gothic district, well located, do not fear getting too lost because its actually quite small and you will end up on one of the main roads of barcelona (Rambla/via Laietana/ Ferran/ plaza catalunya.
Quaint. Easy to get lost here which is kind of fun. Wander until you find the Picasso museum. Some good cafes but also some sketchy areas.
stroll in the past.. Loved every minute of my four day trip and highly recommend the bus trips very informative. people very friendly. wonderful city.
Great architecture. Good area to walk in and also a lot of places to eat that were good.
Beautiful. The small narrow streets and laneways do not disappoint -- the architecture is stunning.
Cool. I loved this area, very interesting a cool. Don't miss spending time here, it's worth it.

A place to be visited and revisited. The area is composed of many small pedestrian streets with all kinds of shops and activities and in the middle of it lies the fantastic Barcelona Cathedral. It goes parralel to the famous Rambla, but actually i loved this area, and for me it is much attractive than the Rambla. Whenever you revisit the area you will find yourself in a different street with different taste. Dont miss having ice cream in this area, you will enjoy it in a different way.
NIce place. The atmosphere and restaurants. Of the beaten path but with nice restaurants and bars
Fun. Cool streets easy to get lost in those narrow ally's to street signs only go during the day, not safe at night.

Unforgetable walk in "Old Barcelona". We used an iPhone audio guide map to the Gothic Quarter, and loved every minute. You will love the small narrow streeets, especially in a warm day, as the buildings provide nice cool shade. You can't get lost there... eventually you'll end up at the Rambla or some other familiar place.
Not to be missed. This is such an interesting place to roam through....right behind the Ramblas. Lots of vendors with interesting wares.
Fantastic. You need to look up all the time or you will miss the beautiful buildings.Wonderful place with lots of shops and bars.
great architecture. Church undergoing renovations - lines too long to go inside

city center. this is the city center. staying on the main roads, you'll be fine. sometimes, we would walk down a small side street and smell foul things in the air or see homeless people. Also, haggle with the tourist shops. we bought a t-shirt for 5 euros, down from an original price of 17 euros.
Amazing architecture. As a photographer, I enjoy the different styles encountered throughout my travels. The Gothic Quarter offers some exceptional photo opportunities and should not be missed.
Must visit. great area with bars and restaurants, even if a little noisy and crouded
Enchanting alleys. Recommended to take a guided tour and walk in the enchanting alleys during the day.
Wander and take it in. This is the place to find hidden gems and atmospheric traditional; fare and bars. Don't be scared to wander in, but try have a little spanish at hand as it does help.
Best bit. I loved this area you can get lost in the winding streets, Loads of good food and plenty of shops, Don't be afraid to haggle
Amazing - loved it!. Sooo cool to walk around this area. Great restaurants and shops and amazing architecture.

good. it was all good you visit these places cos you are interested in seeing the history of the area so you have to make up your owm mind if it is what you expected or not cos sometimes things are not you expect them to be especially in europe but we found that cos it was our first trip to europe everything was new and exciting for us to see

Roman aqueduct right next to a Gothic cathedral. Wander around the old section of Barcelona for a nice contrast to all the Modernist architecture everywhere else. You will see narrow, winding streets, pedestrian plazas, and lots of charm. Don't miss Placa Reial.
Great cathedral and gigantes in march for school... Great photo ops. SomeRoman remains. Scool kids in procession for patron Saint.

A must during your visit to Barcelona. Some of the old businesses are "listed" so they can't be changed and have real charm and character. If you go on the Evening Tapas or Gourmet Tour run by Viator you will be taken around the best.

Great and not just for tourists. The network of narrow roads and alleyways is well preserved and many of the buildings, both old and more recent, very attractive. But I liked the fact that it is still a living area with convenience stores next to smart clothes shops, a utilitarian laundrette beside a smart restaurant and masses of parents taking their young children to school just before 9am..
historic place. I like all the little streets leading off to the main Cathedral.I dislike that there are pickpockets lurking around.

Magical medieval walk. A must do on foot, lots of magnificant architecture & winding cobblestone alleys, hidden churches in small squares (often with a small local market happening). Easy walk from La Rambla, get away from the tourist restaurants into the back streets.

Beautiful. Great area to spend an evening walking around and seeing the sights. There are also quite a few restaurants and shops in this area worth stopping at. Definitely worth checking out just to see the architecture.
Fun place to wonder through the narrow streets. There were a number on great streets to wonder down and take photos

Here you can forget about La Rambla. The narrow streets, the impressive historic sites, the music on the streets, the cafés and restaurants, the shops.... The area gets everything to make your trip memorable!
Fun walk. It's fun to walk around the beautiful small streets. If you keep a sharp eye for pickpockets you wont have any problems.

A MUST See. If you like huge castles and cathedrals, then you'l like Barri Gotic. Our tour was short so we didn't see much of the inside of the buildings and the museums, but one can only imagine the treasures inside. The area is a bit crowded (as one would expect) but well worth the effort.

Gothic Barcelona...... The gothic quarter is really special. The older architecture is beautiful and the area is loaded with shops, cafes and restaurants.
The gothic buildings and narrow passage ways offer a real European ambiance.
Gothic Quarter cool area to stay. we stayed rigth in the gothic quarter and it was so cool... we were minutes to Passeig teh Born..and we ahd a aweseme time
interesting and fun.. had some nice shops to see the local fare but very busy and lots of people.

Just wander aimlessly. Let the winding side streets take you where they will. Visit this are of the city and take your time. Every other street is a little surprise. Don't forget to look up. The architecture here is worth looking up to see the cornices and even the windows. Do not worry, eventually you will end up back in the Ramblas or on Laetana. Stop at a little cafe and enjoy an "entre pan" (sandwich) with some wonderful jamon iberico (iberic ham). There are nice local shops to look at too. I wandered into a typical spanish ceramics shop and got some local made things to bring back, but don't ask me where it is and I probably will not be able to find it again. The little streets just take you there.
Interesting. We had a private guide for this and found it very enjoyable.

history. Found it fascinating. Signed up for walking tour with Barcelona Information Centre. Comprehensive history. Meant you understood what you were looking at and saw things you would ahve missed otherwise

Spent most of our time here!. It was great to wander all the little streets and learn our way around this area, packed full of bars, restaurants and shops. Much nicer than Las Ramblas. But beware, it is full of pickpockets, beggars, buskers, alcoholics etc. We were in Barcelona one hour before we saw a bag snatch, and had pickpocket attempt on our first night. We also felt that a lot of the restaurants were ripping off tourists with high prices and poor quality, but with some recommendations from the Rough Guide we found some really lovely places and had some great meals. Just pick carefully. The shopping was a bit hit and miss. The fabulous old bars are the highlight here I think.

Loved it!!. Loved every minute! Did the Old city tour with Runner Beam and then wandered on ourselves. The buildings are preserved wonderfully! It's really a very charming part of the city. Would definitely spend a couple of hours strolling there again!!
Explore the side streets. To get away from tourist priced bars/restaurants, go down the many side streets - you'll find some great places to eat and drink at more reasonable prices.
Interesting & fun.. Loved the Barri Goti with all its twisting streets, and detailed iron scrollwork. The Flamenico guitar players on the streets made you so happy to be in Spain!
Love the atmosphere. I definitely did not spend enough time here! Lots of unique shops and winding streets to explore. Can't wait to come back!

We never get tired of the Gotic Quarter. This was our third time in Barcelona and the third time that we went to visit the Gothic quarter . This time though , we took a guided walking tour with Travel bar and we saw the Quarter with a different perspective .  Barri Gotic has so much history , so much architecture that it is impossible to fully see it on a single visit . There are many excellent bars and cafés to take a break during day time and plentiful of restaurants to have dinner later on . We will surely go again on our next trip to Barcelona

explore the lanes of barcelona. i stayed at placa real, the heart of the gothic quarter. took a free walking tour. really impressed by the history of the city. great places to eat and shortcuts to reach the beach
Cool...Electric...crowded. Umber touristy...overpriced food....great sights and lots to take in. Very much worth the vist. Would definitely go back.

Very atmospheric. This is a very bustling and fascinating area, full of tourists and things for them to see. I loved the street performers... particularly the acrobatic group which is always there, often near the Roman wall or cathedral in an open area. They are chased off by the police but oh my goodness, they always put on a wonderful show. They simply pick up and move to another location. Shopping is good, eating is easy. Don't take photos of the people who are dressed up unless you're prepared to pay... that's a common mistake Americans make. Barri Gotic is a don't miss if you're in Barcelona.

Get off the Beaten Track. Found this area of Barcelona fascinating, as long as you got off the main routes and explored some of the smaller alleyways and lanes. There were some great little restaurants and shops that were more local rather than the tourist tat places on the main drags.

Get away from La Rambla into the old City. Narrow streets and ancient buildings will remind you of parts of Rome and Florence. The streets are lined with small cafes, restaurants and shops (including a condem shop advertising bright-glo product!)

Good for a drink, not a place to eat.. The very narrow streets of "Barrio Gotico" are amazing. The little coffee shops with 3 or 4 tables (sometimes 2) are a delight to relax, watch people and breath the atmosphere. Coffee and drinks are OK. Food is not good compared to other areas of Barcelona. If you haven't read "The shadow of the wind" by Carlos Ruiz Zafón, read it before you go and you will enjoy this area better (Like the da Vinci code and Le Louvre)
Forget the Map and have fun. A great place to walk around and have fun... lots to see
Interesting. Great atmosphere with lots of interesting lanes to explore. Restaurants are cheaper than on the main roads! Easy to get lost so keep your bearings.

You must go here!. Take a tour or just walk through the old section of Barcelona. Amazing churches, museums, public buildings, and just small, narrow, quaint, picturesque, streets. You could easily spend a day or more in this area.
beautiful aritecture. truely amazing to see such ancient strucktures and there beauty.

take a stroll!!. this was definitely one of my favorite places to visit in Barcelona. I absolutely love el Barri Gotic! Great place to take a walk, shop and eat. There are a lot of little restaurants tucked away in between the alleys. I love all the little alleys!! you'd think it would be dirty and not safe walking through an alley, but not here!! it is sooo clean and neat. You'll find shops, barbershops, restaurants and more walking through these alleys. And the buildings are just amazing, really old with so much history. I probably visited the barri gothic like 3 times while i was in Barcelona. The only thing i regret is not experiencing the night life and bar scene around here. I only visited during the morning and day.
Dark, but authentic.. Think old narrow streets. It appeared to be dark even in early afternoon. But it's thriving and always something happening.
Take a bus trip and take a look. We have really enjoyed Barcelona but the tours - with Julia Travel are the best

An Old Lively Quarter of Barcelona. We really enjoyed the lively ambiance of the Sunday morning when we were there. We witnessed a processional of some sort and then saw the Sardana dancing in front of the Caterdral at noon. The night before, all the museums in the area were free until 1:00 am and we were able to visit quite a few in the neighborhood.
cool area. Defo worth walking around for the shops, bars and tapas places... loads of cool graffiti too!!!
It has a unique flair. I like walking on the streets of Barri Gotic watching small shops, visiting restaurants...
A very interesting area.. This area of Barcelona is a must see but we recommend a guided tour. Also alot of walking.
beautiful area. tall European buildings, fantastic shopping available here, this is a really nice area to walk around and get lost in. not as busy as Passaig de Gracia, i love it here!
Tour. We had a guide and the area was interesting with his information.

Beautiful place. As if you were on a Middle ages story!!! The streets are narrow and you can imagine people with horses and long dresses up and down these streeets. But modern, full of stores, cafes, and good restaurants.
Nice stay!!!

Nice to loose yourself. We stayed in this area and loved walking around the cool streets getting lost on purpose. The shopping is fanastic, I found some amazing vintage shops and bought a Dior scarf for less than £40.00, a bargain. The small bars are very friendly and much cheaper than the Ramblas area.

Wander and Explore. Coming from Australia we have nothing like this: little laneways and streets that nonetheless house chic shops, cafes and restaurants, churches, monuments and amazing culture and history. Take the Travel Bound Free Walking Tour to really appreciate, then just wander.
Great spot for hanging out. Lots of tapas bars, restaurants and little cafés. Quite different during the day and the night, yet you can always find a nice place to eat, drink and have a good time.

Cobble stones. Escape the heat of the city streets and spend some time in the cool Gothic Quarter street. The sun is kept at bay by the high walls that are filled with interesting shops, restaurants and entertainment.

Great place to stay. We stayed at Hotel Colon And had a view of the Cathedral. You van walk just about anywhere to site see and the neighborhood is fun to explore. We ate breakfast at La Boqueria the big market every morning.

A don't miss! Fantastic ages!. A great peek into the history of the city. Spent several hours on a few diff days wandering, eating, shopping & exploring museums. Picasso is a must after a stroll through these streets.
just enjoy it. A lot of small coffes and pubs. Sit down and watch the rush.
Architecture wow. The different style buildings are gorgeous, excellent place to sit and watch the world go by, some excellent bars and restaurants. Do not miss!!!

Shopper's Paradise in little world of winding streets!!. Loved this area. Little streets that brought you out to massive squares or more little streets but full of the best shops selling souvenirs, clothes boutiques and lots of shoe shops!!!! This is like another world from La Rambla just a few streets over. Brilliant - we walked around here and then on to the Waterfront area and had the loveliest day.
Wonderful Gothic. Wandering through the Gothic Quarter was such fun. Beautiful architecture and a wonderful maze of interesting streets.
Cool alleys. Sheltering from the heat down the byways in Barri Gotic, lots to see and shops aplenty
Must go. The best thing is to walk through de little streets and find hostory in every corner you turn.
Authentic & Alive. Beautiful wrought iron mixed with modern touches, eclectic architectue and vivid colors and textures

A photographers dream. We walked through the area and I couldnt put my camera down. Beautiful buildings, too many to list. Thank goodness for digital camera's, as I took dozens in a short space of time.

Veer off La Rambla & take a walk into winding alleys. The centre of the old town - this magnificent warren maze of ancient medieval narrow alleyways crammed with shops, bars & cafes has been the throbbing heart of Barcelona for the past 2,000 years, Creepy and dark winding streets. It was easy to get lost in and avoid Barrio Chino, the grotty lower end below the cathedral: pickpockets, sex shops & hookers galore - not that great a neighbourhood.
As if you are in a time tunnel. Narrow streets, gothic motives everywhere, just behind the La Rambla, you will be drawn into a tale where you will be the king and queen.
Touristy but still a great walk. Lots of shops with a little of everything. Wonderful walking experience if only for the architecture - which is worth every step.
great central location with lots going on. most attractions within easy walking distance with something for everybody
A true view of Barcelona of old. The magnificent structures, narrow tree-lined streets, and quaint homes made this area fantastic.

The historic buildings and alleys in Barri Gotic are mesmerizing. My wife and I walked through the Barri Gotic each day of our trip to Barcelona. The narrow winding alleys of the Gothic Quarter are mesmerizing. The shops and restaurants are plentiful, especially bakeries. It seems like there is a bakery on every block. This is another of the can't miss things to experience in Barcelona.

Quaint streets with lots of charm. Very nice area of Barcelona. Would recommend a guided tour if possible. We used Rick Steves' guidebook with its recommended walking tour...but still got lost. Do go inside the Cathedral - it's spectacular. ALso visit the small Roman ruins.
A great place to wander. My favorite place in Barcelona with great tapas bars.

The Barcelona you imagined. There are many different parts, or barrios, in Barcelona and the Gothic is one of the best.
Take yourself down the side streets and find shops that you will never find again, every route comes with its own mini adventure.
the side streets can be very quiet, a welcome relief from the busy shopping streets.
Loved it. Really enjoyed experiencing this area of the city. Would have loved to spend more time there.
wonderful buildings. It seems like you are in another century, the buildings are great, very well preserved. Loved it!
Cool. Cool and interesting walking. Unexpected gems of buildings.
just wander. worth taking your time to just wander and immerse yourself in the architecture, the history and atmosphere
Nice!. Nicely preserved medieval quarters, many shops, museums and little alleys to explore. The negative was the smell of the sewers, in some locations it was revolting.

Interesting walks inside a walled city. We stumbled onto this area by chance after visiting the Cathedral, without a map in hand, and just wandered around aimlessly. The alleys have shops selling everything from T shirts to hams, pattiseries to gelato shops, candy stores and tons of cafes. While inside the area, it reminded me of Venice, on a smaller scale. Our walk, eventually, led us to Las Ramblas. How we got there? I don't know.

Worth walking through. The Gothic Quarters were very different than the rest of Barcelona. Truly where the old meets new. It doesn't take long to walk through this area. Well worth a half hour of your time to walk around. Lots of people out begging so be careful.

Take A Tour!. The Gothic Quarter is the oldest part of the city and something that should be on your list to check out. I would highly recommend seeing it as part of a bus tour or walking tour, because you can't get the history without a guide. Also, you will get lost - even if you have a map. The tiny little alleys are confusing and eventually buildings will start to look the same. Really, take a tour.

Best area of the city to visit. This area of the city is a great cental location to Las Ramblas, many historical stops, restaurants and shops of the city. Many hotels are available in this area that is geared for tourists, easy to get around, and very pleasant to visit.

Take the time to walk around. We spent hours 'getting lost' in the narrow streets of this quarter and enjoy the scene as well as the many small shpos and restaurants. In the evening, you will probably find a nice local tapas bar to enjoy a quick snack
Magical. You could wander these streets and see something different as you turned every corner. Wonderful

Lovely part of town!. Barri Gotic is a lovely part of Barcelona!It's full of little shops and bars. The area is very charming, it's a lovely part of town to get lost in.Our hostel was situated in barri Gotic, and we loved it! We felt right at home among the narrow little streets.

Get lost in the maze. You have to let yourself go and get lost in the maze of little streets and corridors, to really appreciate this part of town. You may discover a little gem of a store, or a minuscule place to eat, or an interesting angle for a photo. Take it all in and imagine you could live there. A piece of history that is still alive and thriving.

Best part of Barcelona. We really enjoyed walking here in the narrow streets with interesting cafes, restaurants, tapas bars etc. Get rid of your map and just follow your instincts. Very nice cafes and restaurants too. I think this is real Barcelona and not Las Ramblas which has become very touristy !

A great place to wander. The Barri Gotic was my favorite part of Barcelona. The narrow, winding streets and tiny boutique restaurants and shops were absolutely enchanting. No chains here; everything a different local business selling unique goods.

I loved it very much. It was so fun to walk in those streets. My best part of Barcelona!
And I bought very nice and not expensive jewellery at Mel Jili's boutique in the Bari Gotic. Very charming streets.
Nice place to walk. Nice place to walk, small shops and every day you found something new.

Just keep walking!!. You can walk for hours exploring this area and eat or drink many different things. Amazing architecture and history if that is what you are looking for or shopping for something different.

Medieval Barcelona. I really loved this area of Old Barcelona. The narrow streets have no vehicular traffic as many of the buildings that had been there since Roman times are so close to each other. I enjoyed walking through those alleyways that are full of pretty shops & tapas bars. The labyrinth of these narrow streets take you to the old Jewish quarter and the majextic buildings fram medieval times. The streets end in squares or plazas that introduce you to more streets that tell stories of ancient Barcelona. I soaked all the beauty of the old buildings and walked in the Barri Gotic several times during my one week holiday in Barcelona.
A medieval maze. Chocker block of interesting shops, cafes and small bars. You can wander around and amuse yourself for hours coming across little squares that you didn't know were there.
Cool area with shops and surprises galore. The Barri Gotic is definitely worth checking out, just make sure you have a map or else you'll wander around in circles trying to find your way back out!

beautiful buildings great architecture. There is nothing I disliked in Barcelona. We did not go on a tour. You can do it all on your own. I did get tickets to the Museums on line. If you are a senior you get that for 1/2 price. and you do not have to stand on line.Go to Quell Park, amazing. Fantacy in amazing condition.
really a nice place to explore. take ur bike and ride around , you will enjoy it no doubt!
Loved watching the crowds!. Beautiful tree lined street with outdoor cafes and restaurants.
Great shopping. The Gothic Quarter is the place to stay. There are lots of amazing shops and unbelievable side street.
Local Help. This was great to see and we were fortunate that we had local in laws that came to show us!

My best day in Barcelone.... I can get lost in these small streets for days...., wondering at the nice gothic architecture, picking into many small little shops, standing by and listening to the street artists playing Spanish guitar and then sitting in one cozy restaurant, having delicious Tapas and sipping Sangria...And one word about Tapas...they have been understated under internationalized....why so much fuss with pizza (and Italian food in general) when tapas ( and Spanish gourmet in general) could be soooo much more variable, tantalizing and diverse both for sophisticated and non sophisticated palates????
Gothic Quarter. This was a wonderful area to stay. Close to metro/buses, beach, open air markets.
Nice quarter to walk. A lot of small allys with tapas restaurants, nice shops and cafés.Old roman remains, churces and the Barcelona Catedral is located here. Very nice walking area.

A lot of walking, but well worth the time. You can easily spend a few hours walking this area. Do one of the walking tours from the tour books so you know what you're looking at. We had an incredible time navigating the narrow streets and seeing the gothic architecture. There are a bunch of shops that make it quite commercial, but you won't have trouble finding a lane with nobody in it for some great pictures.
The "old city" atmosphere its gone.... Everything is shopping now, a huge "mall" in open air. It becomes harder and harder to notice the architecture and style.
Take a ramble walk. Old part of fascinating city. Narrow streets with small shops. Go outside Rambla and you will see real town, without crowd. Take a walk - simply wander around
Unbelivable. Liked: EverythingDisliked: .... nope, cant think of anything.Brilliant little restaurants here and there. A great Barcelona experience

this the place to eat ,,,drink and see. the are a lot of locals live here ,, so dont be of put by 3 or 4 men standing at corners. Just keep in a street with other people and you be ok
again DONT FLASH MONEY
Loved it!. Absolutely loved this area, bags of character! We would stay here if in Barcelona again.

fun but confusing. make sure you bring a map and then be prepared to get totally lost anyway. There are so many tiny alleyways that it's hard to figure out where you are but such a charming area, I could get lost in it any day!

beautiful district in a beautiful city. Its amazing to see so many period buildings not only well preserved but also the fact that this district has too few modern "concrete" buildings. What ever modern buildings are there are non intrusive.
Excellent. Very exciting buildings and a great experience. quaint little shops and restaurants, food in the area is lovely.
endless wandering. Loved this part of the city, with every turn and at every corner another lovely church, or square
Beautiful. Perfect place to just stroll around and look/take pictures, when you get tired feet just sit down in many of the coffe places or bars for a cold cervesa :-)
May have lost its charm.. It was too commercially exploited with restaurants and bars to be appreciated in all its former glory.

Rent an apartment. If there is one thing on your bucket list of things to do in Spain, rent an apartment in the Barri Gotic and explore the winding streets, bars, restaurants, and shops. You are five blocks to the beach, four blocks to the Rambla, four blocks to the Hop-on-Hop-Off bus(you can now pay on board and don't have to go up to the main square) Great sunset bars we are going to tell about about later. The location is great for all you sightseeing trips there is a metro station each side to the district so not too long to walk either side you rent on. Hey part of the charm is wandering along the streets and finding another great tapa bar or shoe, jewelry, or head shop to stop into any time of the day.
An interesting area beware of pick pockets. An interesting area of narrow lanes and squares but one of our party had his money stolen in front of the cathedral

Was Gaudi on drugs?. When you see all the buildings he designed and their unique features, you wonder how he got so very imaginative!!
Everything he deisgned was based in nature, and he was very inspired by the conch shell, but these buildings are really like nothing else you will see!

Wonderful wandering. It was wonderful to wander the narrow streets of the Barrio Gotico to marvel at the span of history, culture and architecture ranging from Roman to modern times. Stop at Caelum for tea and postres made by nuns in the cafe built on the site of the Jewish women's bath house. Pause to be reminded of the Civil War when you see the bullet holes in the church wall in the same square where parents gather their children after school. Sip cava and munch on Piminetos padrone in Placa Santa Ana.
So Medieval and quant. Loved just walking around the old tight streets and alleys. Lots of little cafes to go into and stores to shop in.
History. Beautiful old building, a must for travellers to see

Gothic Quarter. Be prepared to walk about, you'd appreciate the architecture and some interesting shops around the area. Barri Gotic is very Romanesque, with lovely restaurants to sit and have something to eat, either indoors or al-fresco. Very nice visit!
nice walk. it is nice to stroll among the narrow streets where pieces of history are stored... Just imagine how life was at old times...

Nice experience. Small irregular streets, feels safe, people are friendly. A little bit dirty, but people are trying to do their best to clean up after tourists. Some good restaurants, some not so good, but still expensive...Did not like siffleurs, who are likely trying to sell something.

You MUST walk and shop in the gothic quarter. The gothic quarter is just next to La Ramblas and is the old city. The premises are excellent, with many shops to shop from, restaurants and cafes. Maybe a little bit unsafe during the nights, especially if you are alone.
Gothic Maze. Part of the Barcelona experience is wandering around this maze of small streets and beautiful buildings. Lots of restaurants and interesting shopping.
Gothic Quarters. All close at hand; charming labyrinth streets with endless amount of great hidden corners and squares.
Our location. Old and interesting with narrow streets opening into open plazas. We didnt have time to explore sufficiently - next time!
Strolling through Old Barcelona. It was raining but still a wonderful place to walk the streets and alleys. It was quite crowded yet there were still musicians playing in front of the Cathedral.
WOW. Just walk around this area its brilliant, the buildings are superb the detail is unreal.
Gothic Quarter. It is one of the most interesting places I have Visited something different around the every corner

Old Spain. A trip to the Gothic Quarter is necessary to put things into perspective. Here in the USA, we're 2+ centuried old, but when you see buildings dating back 7+ centuries, it is positively fantastic to experience them.

Classic old Spain and Europe. The Gothic Quarter of Barcelona, called the Barri Gotic is exactly what I thought old Spain and old Europe would look like - tiny streets and alleys going in all directions. It is interesting to see all the new stores and shops blended in with the old and ancient architecture. It was a pleasure to walk here and get lost in history. There were many interesting places to shop and snack and eat. When in Barcelona, plan on walking the Gothic Quarter for at least a few hours.

Pretty architecture, lovely squares. Loved the street architecture, stunning streetlamps and general friendly buzzing atmosphere. Was nervous about pickpockets but had no problems (mind you, we were mindful and careful!).
Worth Staying Near. The heart of the city always worth going to and staying near and far enough away from the dreaded Ramblas!

Not as unique as I'd hoped.. Yes, you can wander around the streets and you'll see a ton of shops, but I couldn't have been more disappointed to see that many were major chain franchises that I can find in the USA! Shoestores like Nine West and clothing stores like the Gap were hardly what I hoped to browse through in a European city's medieval heart. On the plus side, there are lots of street performers, but again, it was like being in the USA. We saw (amazing) break dancers who worked the crowd in English, an opera singer who was quite off-key, etc. Every musician performs next to a display of their CDs for you to buy. We nearly missed a pair of towers that were built by Romans, according to their sign (which happily included English). The sewer odor is noticeable, as others have said. The crowd is 100% tourist, not local at all, but everyone looked to be enjoying themselves. My husband liked the area because it reminded him of Sixth Street in Austin, Texas. That was exactly why I didn't care for it. Why cross the Atlantic Ocean to see what you can find in many cities in my own country?

Nice display of old Roman architecture. Nice place to hang around with fantastic back alleys that lead you to some magnificent architecture. We came across a nice Catedral de la Santa Creu by mistake having explored these little alleys.
Dreamlike. A little bit fearfully, you feel like Alice in Wonderland

Great place to wander around. Second time in Barcelona and the Barri Gotic is always full of hidden suprises. Wonderful Gothic churches, beautiful little squares, narrow streets full of interesting little shops, great places for tapas, excellent restaurants, etc. etc. There's always something new in Barcelona, the city of forward thinking ....also in the historical center.

All that is Barcelona. Do not come to Barcelona without spending most of your time in the Bareo Gotico. History, atmosphere, fabulous tappas, happy people and atmospheric old cafes. It has it all.Unfortunately (but hey!) what it also has is terrible sewers, pickpockets and bag snatchers. Every evening you will see some poor tourist walking along the Ramblas crying - you'll know why if you're not careful. Try not to put down your bag. Better still, use a small rucksack or bum-bag. These guys are very skilful and often work in pairs. One taps your shoulder whilst the other takes your purse as you turn around etc.Don't get paranoid - I've lived there and never been robbed. You just need to be careful and not draw attention to your valuables.I can offer no solution to the smell of sewage in certain streets. You get used to it and it's well worth the trouble.Try Horchata - a delicious cold drink made of almond milk.Good seafood restaurants by the port in Barcelonetta.Take minimal luggage. You won't need all that stuff.
Just walk through it.... Loads of places to stop and eat and drink very relaxing !!

Interesting combination. Wandering this narrow maze really took me back in time but at the same time there are interesting modern boutiques and fun graffiti. The main area of historic attractions is beautiful but very crowded with tour groups.
Great old place. Very old buildings in great shape. Cathedral is a must. Area full of narrow winding streets all with names. Taximan nightmare

This is ther area we chose to stay in. We have decided that Barcelona is now our favourite European city! The Barri Gotic quarter is cool and contemporary yet so mysterious and dark. I am so glad we stayed in this area and I would recommend to all!
Noisy and confusing. In my opinion there's too much confusion in the streets and there's nothing quite interesting too see... It's a quite ancient quarter, but in my point of view that's all...

Nice casual walk. If you like old architecture, this is a nice area to walk around randomly. It is also quite nice in the evening. The souvenir shops are nothing special but there are some nice shops for clothing.
Wonderful. quaint historic great to just walk thru and site see. historic museums and buildings. guided tour helped first time there. this last time we did it ourselves
Great shops, great atmosphere. Lots of cool, reasonably priced shops, restaurants, beautiful streets for strolling
A journey into time. You'll find cobblestone alleys full of art, history, architecture, shopping, and food. You'll be delighted.
Super atmosphere. We loved the architecture, the variety of buildings, the squares, the wonderful atmosphere of the pedestrian areas and the outside cafes/bars and the extensive food market.

Vibrations from the past. A cozy and mysterious part of town with small lanes and street musicians making the visit unforgettable. Nice small shops and restaurants. There was some good ice cream bars too with lots of different flavors that I'd never tasted before.

Excellent streetscene. The buildings were very interesting but the people were really fascinating. We enjoyed seeing expert dancers tango, heard opera and show tunes, watched agile young men do incredible gymnastics and generally enjoyed people watching. It was interesting to see street performers and vendors quickly stow their stuff - and then police would cruise by. There must have been lookouts. We were very impressed with the effort to preserve the wonderful architecture which gave us a sense of what it would have been like to walk the narrow streets in earlier times. We watched a group rally for a political demonstration in an area used for the same purpose centuries ago.

Stroll. Get lost in there!. Barri Gotic is made for strolling and getting lost in. Luckily almost every little alleyway leads back into Carrer Ferran (one of the main streets in Barri Gotic) so it was fairly easy to re-orientate myself. Bring a camera - preferably a good camera!! To re-energise, stop at a good tapas place - this is not meant to be discriminatory, but I found that restaurants ran by Spanish (rather than those of Indians or Middle Eastern origin) are more refined though more pricy, but I dined at a fine restaurant with 5 excellent tapas dishes, basket of bread, glass of Catalan wine, a creme catalan, coffee and a bottled mineral water for 33 Euro, as opposed to paying up to 20 Euro for the 2 tapas and a paella deals plus a drink which fills you up but doesn't really satisfy the inner gourmet ... :p

Travel to a time before Christ. We loved the Barrio Gotico because of the cobblestone floors and narrow streets that were made only for foot traffic. It's a beautiful labyrinth of cafes, restaurants, shops, etc. and we had so much fun walking through this epic place. A must see if you come to Barcelona.
filled with character. the maze of streets where fun to explore, plenty tapas bars and coffee shops. the hot chocolate drink are a must try
Great night out. If you want lively but safe, head to the Gothic area. The square just off the Ramblas is buzzing with some great places to eat.

Great Walking tour. I'd highly recommend the walking tour provided by the TI in St. James Square. It's reasonably priced and covers a good amount of sights and history in two hours - using the individual headsets you see on many more expensive guided tours.
Vibrant. Love the architecture, the many hidden plazas, the small corridors, the huge variety of stores.

Tight and twisty.... The narrow lanes of the Barri Gotic are more like architectural canyons, cool and shady, bustling with activity. A great place to wander, just keep your wits about you and your wallet secure!
Love it!!. The stores, food and facades of the buildings are unique and without a doubt my favorites.
Good historic sights. Exactly what Europe is all about. Great historical sights and magnificent architecture
Exciting. At every turn, there are beautiful buildings and passageways. I recommend visiting with a guide.

A whole other world. This is where Barcelona really comes alive. Little boutiques and designers, GREAT local pizzerias and eateries, and if you love vintage clothing as I do you are spoilt for choice. Go along in the afternoon after siesta, wander the shops, marvel at the amazing old buildings and finish up with the locals in one of the 'hole-in-the-wall' restaurants for dinner.

Traditional Cantaluna. My favourite memory of Barcelona is the fresh markets filled with cured ham, fresh fruit and vegetables, but most especially for the small and the experience of their fresh fish trade.
Alleyways and squares. Fascinating maze of alleyways and small squares. Lots of places to eat and drink. Cathedral interesting.

So awesome!. I loved walking around the Gothic Quarter, it felt like being part of a different time. There are many streets and getting lost is fun because you always end up somewhere you recognize anyway! There are cute stores and cafes tucked into random side streets and grafitti/art on the walls. It's a nice place to stroll. There may be some pickpockets around, just stay away from streets that have a bad vibe and you will have a great time!
This is Barcelona at its best.. The Gothic Quarter is another world with narrow streets, extraordinary architecture, interesting shops and lots of good restaurants that are hard to find.
Beautiful!. Beautiful area to walk around. If you want to go into the churches make sure you are dressed properly. We had to go back! Since it was hot and we were in tank tops and shorts.

Well worth a wander through.... We enjoyed meandering through the Gothic Quarter... the tightly packed streets mean you are constantly surprised by what is just up ahead or around the corner. Lots of places to eat, and snack at. Lots of interesting building features. Barcelona Catherdral is a beautiful building - unfortunatly there was a service on while we were there and we decided not to wait around until it had finished to go inside.Not so sure I'd want to be wandering around this area at night!
Gothis Quarter. We booked a walking tour through the Tourist Office in Jaume Plaza - excellent value, very informative and with the radio contact with the guide you could hear everything.

A nice afternoon walk. We strolled through the Barri Gotic three times while in Barcelona. We first went through as part of Rick Steves' "Short Sweet Tour" described in his book which has stops at a torrone shop on Portaferrissa, a chocolate and churros cafe on Carre de Petrixtol, and a chocolate shop (that we didn't make it to as we were full). YUM! Our second time through, we went back for churros and chocolate and shopping. We also stopped at a farmer's market outside a church in the Barri Gotic at Placa del Pi and purchased delicious cheese. The third time through, we walked through on our way to the Picasso museum, which I highly recommend.

Great stroll through this area. I really enjoyed walking through the Gothic Quarter. It was a definite change of scenery from the busy and bustling street of Barcelona to this quiet, lonely section of town. It is definitely worth a trip down to the area it will take you about an hour to walk through and most streets will lead you right back to Las Ramblas. It’s has very narrow streets that open up to large squares where even art shows happen and pop up randomly. We also went here at night and found some great pubs and bars where locals hang out. I would highly recommend even staying in this section of town.
You can almost feel the history. Barri Gotic is a very good example of historic buildings and streets. But it's not like a museum - people live and work here, like it's always been.
Beautiful. Church was beautiful loved the whole surrounding area.
EXCELLENT. Central to everything perfect location, entertaining
Old Part of Town. A maize of narrow streets with lovely buildings, shops and eating places.
Great walking tour. The Gothic Quarter has lots of buildings of great historical and architectural value.

Beautiful. This is my favorite area in Barcelona. My friend and I stayed at a hotel here and were able to walk the beautiful winding, narrow streets back to our hotel every night. The shops and restaurants were great as well.

Good to Visit but Beware. The Gothic Quarter is incredibly interesting including the dancing of the Catalan dance La Saldana at the Cathedral on Sundays. There are interesting narrow winding streets with quaint shops and eateries. However, after dusk, the area is inundated with police because of the pick pocketing and a very obvious prostitution problem.
not that far away. just off la rambla. we stayed near placa de catalunya, and walked the whole of la rambla a few times. getting off to the side streets is where the really good tapas bars are.
Gothic Quarter. Our favorite part of Barcelona and where we walked the narrow streets to see the sights and find a tapas bar:)
Best area. The Barri Gotic was the best area that we went to as far as we saw in all of Barcelona

Worth the time walking around. Get a street map and spend a few hours exploring the area walking around. It is the only way to take in the many beautiful buildings and the streets of the Gothic area. Many local shops and restuarants as well.
Superbly atmospheric. Great area to wander around full of curio shops and great restaurants.
Great history. My favorite part of Spain was the Gothic Quarter. The narrow streets, the architecture and the street performers were all absolutely amazing. A must when visiting Barcelona

Amazing energy. Barcelona is one of my favorite cities in the world and the Gothic Barrio is a great place to witness first hand the high energy and diversity of this town. A great place to hang out and watch the street entertainers and other people but take care of your wallet and purses as pick pockets are everywhere.

So much to choose from. This area has an abundance of cafes, restaurants, bars, culture and shopping to suit all tastes. You could happily spend hours wandering around the little streets or having a drink in one of the many beautiful squares. There are lots of interesting buildings and the Gothic Cathedral - La Seu - is worth a visit. I would rate this area well ahead of Las Rambles, as it has more culture, atmosphere and isn't as commercial.
labyrith of quaint streets. Great to browse, so many little nooks and crannies and lovely shops
Great just to wander around - good atmosphere. Lots of litter but good for an evening stroll. Felt very safe at all times.
Beautiful. Recommend spending time here instead of on Las Ramblas.

Real Gemms in the city centre. Takes you back in century's of good life.Suprises you in every corner with a litle market, or a caffes ,or a quater with. litle taverns, of Cathedral,or lots of shop( big lables too )Evenigs are magic and very romantic there.
Atmosphere. Full of atmosphere but keep safe by not venturing into too quiet streets. Lots of smaller ones have loads of flies and smells.
Barri Gotic. The Old Barcelona with the old Cathedral of Barcelona.At the central Place the queen Issabella had met Colombo after his voyage to the Americas.
gothic quarter. loved the gothic quater because you didnt know what was around the corner.

My favorite part of Barcelona. I loved exploring all the little streets and Placas of the Barri Gotic. It's very helpful to take a guided tour, as the knowledge of the guide adds to the context of the experience.
dont miss. fab and intersting area - the Gothic Barcelona Cathdral is beautiful and it's free

Medieval +Roman +nice placas. The Barri Gotic is still very vibrant with people leading everyday lives. In addition, the Cathedral and Museum of the City as great. You can walk extensive, excavated Roman ruins under the palace and see where Queen Isabella received Columbus on his return from the 'Indies'. The maze of streets is fun to wander and felt fairly safe because of all the people around during the day. The quarter is manageable in size and not far from the Ramblas. Also, nearby is a permanent Dali exhibit at one of the museums.
Great Shops & Restaurants. Lovely old part of the city with interesting quirky architecture and real character. Full of great shops and restaurants.

fascinating place. The narrow lanes and all the old buildings are a sight worth spending time just wandering and marvelling at the sights. Th Roman remains are so impressive---camera working overtime!
This area has to be seen to be believed.

Important part of seeing Barcelona. The Gothic Quarter was one of the highlights of my trip to Barcelona. Charming streets, squares, cathedral, and especially the marketplace were wonderful. We used a private guide from "Hi This is Barcelona" who took us through small streets and courtyards that we may have otherwise missed. Loved the way the town has found reuse for many of the old buildings - hospitals are now college buildings etc. You could really feel the history of the city as you walk through the Barri Gotic ! Do not miss this area

A must do in Barcelona and visit at night for the best effect. You should stroll through the streets and alleyways at night (and bring your camera with a tripod) for the best experience. The architecture is great, very detailed and beautiful. It's exactly what pops into my head when I hear the word "gothic" particularly the churches, the Carrer del Bisbe Irurita, and Els Quatre Gats being very memorably sights for me and you ought to seek them out.I'd read stories and concerns about petty theft in this area- and I can certainly see the potential for it, but I walked through this area at all hours with a huge dslr and an iphone and didn't feel threatened or experienced any problems. Just use your common sense and try to stay in well lit places or areas where other folks are strolling through as well.
Hopping old-world feel. Loved the artistic, old-world feel of the Barri Gotic. Small shops, eateries, monuments at every turn, and the ever present music. Awesome!

Historical heart of the city. The old town is full of historical buildings mixed with little shops. The narrow streets give the unique Medieval atmosphere. This area is always very crowded and the prices are high. Be careful with pickpockets.
Catedral quarter. Interesting little side streets you can get lost in beautifully!

Wonderful Architecture Everywhere. Just walk the streets. Lots to see; lots of buildings to admire. The Gothic Church was not overly impressive, especially after the Sagrada Familia. The church was standard European in nature, which is neat, but the Sagrada Familia spoiled us.

quirky, smelly. Funky little allyways to ramble about. Unfortunately Barcelona does not provide many (any?) public toilets in the town centre so the streets are the worse for this with some unpleasant smells.
Fun to walk there. The narrow streets were fun to get lost in. Wonderful food and shopping.
Gothic splendour. A journey back in time and a vivid contrast to the Gaudi Cathedral. Fascinating never the less

Walking tour is the way to go. In 2008 friends and I took the Barre Gotic walking tour and I thought it was so enjoyable that I took my mum on the same tour on my next trip.Recommend doing this on your first day in Barcelona as it helps you get an idea what is where and shows you several sights along the way (the Catedral, etc).

intriguing. we used Rick Steves' guidebook walking tour of the Barri Gotic. Quaint buildings, lovely courtyard of a former home. Watched the dozens of dancers on Saturday night, in front of the cathedral, stepping to live music. Delightful and charming!
A trip to another time. This is like walking through a time machine! Beautiful architecture. We were there Good Friday and Easter Sunday and the processions etc were really amazing
Great Place for a Walk. It was a great neighborhood for a walk about. Visiting the Picasso Museum was the top stop, but the Museum of Chocolate and all the great restaurants were fun too.
Great to Wlak arround and get lost. You are in Medieval Barcelona, excelenttly well kept, visit the Cathedral and the Palza de San Jordi
Take the time to walk this historic area. Loved the street-side restaurant areas and shops. Beautiful....loved our visit!
ancient barrio . jewish old block. wonderfull arquitecture gothis style, beautifull pictures for photograph lovers...
Barri Gotic. see the sinagoga (the oldest in Europe) and, eat at Bar Lobo and El Torrero.

Hidden bit of history. Hard to believe this section of gothic architecture exists in the modern city of Barcelona. We enjoyed reading about all the history this area represents. It was especially cool to stand in the room where the King and Queen welcomed Christopher Colombus back from his "discovery of America."

Pleasant historical center. Maze of small streets and old/medieval houses, where you'd stumble on historical places at almost every corner, even some dating back from the Roman Empire. The area is also very lively with a lot of interesting shops, cafés where to enjoy tapas, or lively bars, etc.
Throw away the map. Wander and delight. Winding streets, beautiful architecture, hidden restaurants and shops.
Gothic Center--trip to the past. Interesting and a place to experience not just see.

Barcelona's heart. Barri Gotic manages to feel simultaneously very 'touristy' and very authentic. The architecture, with its ancient houses and building and narrow streets, lets you feel the weight of European history, but its shops are your standard fare (Starbucks, Desigual, and souvenir shops).The place is full of life and just nice to walk around. Just pay attention to your surroundings, as we saw quite a few pickpockets around. Don't be afraid, as long as you stay aware of your surroundings, and don't act foolish, they will not get near you.
discount shopping. THe good section to get reasonably priced gifts to take home

Fun for all. If you have time to explore only one area of Barcelona, make it the Barri Gotic. Markets, museums, galleries, churches, shops, restaurants, tapas, people watching. Have a good map in hand, as it's easy to become disoriented without one, but easy to walk around.

nice place. Beautiful and peaceful neighborhood, especially during the dayA little scary to walk around alone at nightBeautiful buildings that give the feeling of another timeDefinitely recommend taking an hour or two to walk in the alleys, admire the different stores and not hold back and buy some delicious baked goods! (for example XUXO!!)enjoy yourself! you're in barcelona!!!
shopping. if you are a shopper this is the place for you...there are alot of shops in the gothic quarter from chain stores to small artsy boutiques.
A must do - to explore the narrow streets of the Gothic Quarter. So much to find in this area from Tapas, to bakeries and shops. Have fun!

Back to Middle Ages in Gothic Quarter. We love to take walks in this neighborhood because we always find something different every time. It's tiny alleys one after another and one leads to another, it is like magic walking and looking at the remnants of history and culture while imagining the people who used to live within these walls and walked though these streets. We found some churches with interesting cloisters that open to the public. Also, this is where you could find the still standing Roman gate to the city, it is right next to the Cathedral of Barcelona.Again, lots of little shops, restaurants, bakeries, and little coffee shops and similar to Born quarter, it is lively and alive even at night.

a place to wander around. To my opinion the Gothic Quarter is the best place to stay when you visit Barcelona, but even if you don't stay there it is certainly worth a visit. You can wander around a maze of picturesque narrow streets. To our amazement the place is very clean and it seems pretty safe during the night. The area is full of cafes, restaurants, tapas bars etc and it keeps on being very lively till late night.

Quirky and bohemian.. The tall narrow alleyways of the Gothic quarter are unique and interesting. Each alleyway leads on to another equally interesting and within them are lots of interesting piazzas where you can sit and enjoy a coffee and a pastry or authentic tapas. At night I could imagine why pickpockets would be a problem but if you are worried about that simply go in the daytime...it's still well worth the visit.
Historic. Easy to find your way around and easy access. Felt safe the entire time.

Heart of Born and a must for medieval architecture. Explore the gothic cathedral and cloisters and see the geese. Explore the surrounding alleyways and see the square of the spanish revolution with bullet holes in the walls
Wander till your hearts content. A great place to wander around, relatively simple to navigate (despite the windy old streets) and full of little curios.
Great!!. Walking around this part of the city makes you feel in the middle ages. It's so very well taken care of... Plenty of places to visit that makes you fell that your visit was not long enough!
beautiful surroundings. Beautifully buildings and a fantastic walk. And very coos small restaurants around the quarter.
mandatory. You can´t come to Barcelona and don´t spend an afternoon here. Come and feel.
gothic quarter. very beautiful and interesting - gaudi was the man!
fascinating. We took a free walking tour with a knowledgeable and enthusiastic guide. I loved the history, architecture, and interesting shops and cafes.
Barri Gotic. Everything the adventurous kid in you wanted to see in a historic city, along with everything the adult in you appreciates: good food and drink, shopping, sights.

One of my favorite spots in all of Spain. What a great place to just walk around to surrounded by the history, music, museums, and shopping stalls. If you get lost... No problem! There is always a new and interesting sight around the corner. I just loved it there.
Perfect wandering time. When the main hustle of Las Ramblas gets too much and you want some peace and quiet and feel like you're exploring on your own head for their area.
atmospheric. some good restaurants hidden away behaind the cathedral nice to wander round

An incredibly fun adventure. This part of town is a mix of old Europe with some modern tourist traps. The cathedral is incredible and worht a visit, and the flea market in front of it has some interesting (yet overpriced) items. Tons of shops line the streets, and the Picasso museum is a must see.
pleasant. A delightful area to wander and pass the time Las Ramblas was a delight and the market at Liceu was a gourmet's delight! The Cathedral was a place of wonderful peace.

Gorgeously Gothic. Wow. I arrived at night on on a walk about stumbled on this most awsome site. The area was well lit and a welcoming electrifying atmosphere & frivolity against a backdrop of such old spleandour. Classical music drifted towards us which we followed up narrow cobbled stones and found the orchestra on the piazza in a public and free concert. In the morning it proved to be all and more than what it seemed the night before. An arcitechtural work of art.
FUN area!. Forget eating on La Rambla. Explore the alleys/streets of Barri Gotic! Enjoy the street performers and the small restaurants you can find in this neighborhood!
Experience. Very good experience, don't go with any expectations & just enjoy it for the moment.

My favourite district in Barcelona. Don't know people bother with the adjacent and touristy la rambla when the gothic area has so much going on - interesting streets, nice shops, great bars & eateries and antiquities like La Catedral. Our favourite places Robert are I'm Placa Real - but it can get busy!
old town. nice walk in the city streets, lovely buildings. the gothic quarter is really enjoyable
Fabulous area to stay. We enjoyed staying in this part of Barcelona - soo much to see and do with hidden masterpieces wherever you went!

Quirky and charming. We loved wandering the narrow alleys but, best of all, was the area in front of the cathedral where musicians and dancers would gather. Also fun was browsing through the stalls selling antiques.

Atmospheric and Historic. We stayed near the Barri Gotic and wandered around here most days during our holiday in Barcelona.The streets are narrow, winding and really interesting. There seemed to be music playing on all of the corners, and in the main square there were elderly people dancing.It is a place to just wander, lose yourself and not plan where you are going.There are lots of interesting, though touristy shops and restaurants. Do not miss the Placa Reial and the Gaudi lamposts - his first job in Barcelona.
Allow extra time here. A maze of alley ways and passages. Plan on getting lost even with a map! But worth seeing.

Nice walking tour. Good place for sight seeing. Not the best for shopping or bar hopping but not bad. The city history museum is a must see as is the Cathedral. Avoid the Cathedral on a Sunday, way too crowed then.
very nice. Well worth a look but stay clear of this area at night

Fun area - great buildings and history. We decided to stay in the Grand Central Hotel right in the centre of this area.The buildings, streets, structures, and restaurants and bars in this area are great.You can wander safely and have a great time.It is central to most other attractions in Barcelona - so a good place to base yourself.It is easily serviced by the Jaume 1 metro.On the weekend there are some buskers, dancing, musicians and flea markets located in the square adjacent to the Cathedral - join in the dancing and explore the square for some great fun.

Take a guided tour, if possible.. We were on a private tour with Miriam from Forever Barcelona. Her explanations made the tour memorabe; otherwise we would have walked around looking at who knows what. Loved her explanations of the cathedral...the geese, especially.

Be careful at night. The cathedral is pretty nice, as is the City History Museum located in Placa Real. However, the bar scene at night can be kind of sketchy, and anybody who eventually found out that I was a tourist promptly went out of their way to tell me about horror stories regarding how many times they were mugged, how their friends were mugged, and how their poor uncle Pablo was preyed upon by miscreants.I only had one strange encounter that didn't end up being a bad for me, but it is definitely something that people should be prepared for; but this isn't anything that common sense can't effectively combat.Otherwise, it's nice for a stroll, but it isn't too different from any other old European city.
Must see. It gives you a flavor of Barcelona... Very narrow streets, fashion, food, people...

wander until your feet fall off. Tall buildings all a kind of sandy colour, lots of people speaking spanish, down and outs, drunks, little shops, bars, small markets, a truer representation of Barca than the tourist trail, you got to try it, it's beautiful, narrow alleys, lead to small placas, hives of activity everywhere, but interesting, not too many tourists shoving around, you know what i mean.
Lots to see. Easily walkable. Many sites to visit. Don't miss the museums with the history of Barcelona and the early Roman beginnings of the city. The Cathedral of Barcelona sparkles on the inside.
Gothic. We had great time strolling around this place, it is also cool to sit around and watch the passerbys.

A walk through the ages. It is easy to walk and find and view all the buildings - not easy to photograph because of some of their locations in amongst the more modern. Inside the Barcelona Cathedral is worthwhile too
Beautiful. I LOVED this area of Barcelona, the windy streets & little doorways. I came to this area every day just to soak up the atmosphere. The little shops are quirky and interesting.

the most interesting area. Barri Gotic is the historic heart of Barcelona. It's the most interestingdistrict in Barcelona with pedestrian streets, nice squares and manyinteresting palaces from the middle ages. The cathedral of Saint Eulalia (worth a visit) andsome museums are also located in this pleasant area. It's a nice place tostroll around, away from all the traffic.
Great place to stroll. Does get very busy but dont be afraid to wader down side streets for some hidden gems
